review.title: Nice hotel close to fisherman so wharf
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff and good breakfast menu. Quite central for all fisherman  wharf and cable cars.
review.negativeRemarks: Lounge area

review.title: Nice hotel near the centre of town
review.reviewText:
Easy check in, great friendly staff
Great location
review.negativeRemarks: Hotels noisy aircon- can turn the room one off but hotels hums all the time
review.locationRemarks: Very near to all attractions

review.title: Great location walking distance to Pier 39.
review.reviewText: Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful would definitely love to go back and stay longer in the future.

review.title: Nice hotel at the North edge of Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
My son and I went to see the Cal - Texas football game and stayed at the Argonaut Hotel.  It was great.  A rather quick ride from SFO on the BART to Embarcadero station and then a long, very nice walk along the Wharf or an "E" or "F" bus to within  a hundred yards or so from the hotel.  Great location.  Check-in was efficient and when I asked about directions to the football game, the front desk attendee had us get going way sooner than I thought I needed to in order to get to the game with time to spare.  We were grateful as our plans would of had us missing pregame fun stuff and part of the game.  Our room was perfect-small and efficient and very comfortable beds.
The next morning we ate breakfast at the Blue Mermaid restaurant that connects to the hotel.  Wonderful breakfast.  I saw an award for "best chowder on wharf" and although a long shot, I asked if I could get some.  Our waiter checked with the cook and he was able to get us some crab-corn chowder at about 8:30 in the morning.  Great chowder.
I will stay there on our next trip to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks:
The staff in the hotel and restaurant were excellent.
Location, if you like the Wharf is unbeatable.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe have 2 concierge desks instead of one as the concierge stayed busy all of the time.
review.locationRemarks: Location, Location, Location as the realtors say.  This hotel is at the edge of the Wharf.  There are great seafood restaurants on the Wharf.

review.title: Great hotel in historical building
review.reviewText: We were very happy with the argonaut!   The location was great...near cable cars and on the bus lines.  Walking distance to many sites.  The hotel concierge was amazing!  Our room was clean and comfy and quiet.    We loved the national parks visitor center inside this building!  If you're a history fan, stay here!
review.negativeRemarks: We couldn't figure out the room coffee maker...a small issue.  Maybe the lobby could have hot coffee with real milk/ cream available?
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars, ghiardelli square, fisher mans wharf, ships to explore, buena vista bar for Irish coffee...sea lions...

review.reviewText: The room was beautiful and the hotel was in the middle of all of the activities on San  Francisco .

review.title: Good location but that's about it
review.reviewText:
Just spent a few days at the Argonaut Hotel with my husband last week.  The location is great if you want to be in walking distance to cable cars, and the pier.  The staff was very friendly (especially Donovan).  Here are my issues:
Parking was an additional $57 per night.  That is ridiculous!!! When we needed our car it took a half hour for them to bring it around.  It made us late for our dinner reservation.  
Rooms were a little small for a hotel.  The walls are so thin you can hear everything!  Water pressure in the shower was so low.  
We received a card with our welcome package (Which was just handed to us and not explained at all) that said they have a wine tasting everyday at 5:00 as a meet and greet but when we went down to ask about it we were told that they don't do that anymore because it was too expensive.
Refrigerator in the room is for purchase use only.  (Soda, water etc) No microwave in room but they do have a coffee pot and coffee.  Beds were very comfortable!
Overall, it wasn't terrible, just not as nice as I had hoped.
review.negativeRemarks: Do the wine tasting again. Lower price of parking and additional taxes

review.title: Perfect place to stay - right on the Wharf!
review.reviewText: We were there for a week and have nothing but great things to say about our stay!! Highly recommend this hotel!!

review.title: close to everything on Fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a fabulous location. Very clean, great staff, helpful doormen. The one and only downside was that our room was directly above the street at Fishermans Wharf, so it was loud at random times, next time I would just request a room off the street side.

review.title: NICE ,,ACCROSS FROM HYDE ST PIER
review.reviewText: HOTEL WAS GREAT!!! RESTAURANT WAS AWFULL FOOD !!!!!!!!!!! SCOMAS RESTAURANT WAS BEST ALONG WHARF AND WORTH THE MONEY

review.title: Top notch place!
review.reviewText: Amazing place - great location (Fisherman's Wharf), excellent rooms, very fresh and new. We really loved it!
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant in the hotel (Blue Mermaid) is merely OK (and definitely overpriced). I recommend skipping it and trying places nearby.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: This was a perfect stay if you're visiting the wharf area! Beds are super comfy as well, which is the most important feature to me besides location!

review.title: Great hotel experiebce
review.reviewText: We stayed the weekend before, took a motorcycle trip and returned for our last night of vacation. Room was spacious, clean, quiet. Staff was awesome! Location is great for trolley access and a few steps from Pier 39 and all of the waterfront activities.

review.title: Very nice hotel on Fishermans Wharf.
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the hotel was. Right near everything for a nice vacation. Walking distance to Ghiridelli Square, the Cable Cars, Alcatraz terminal.

review.title: Great hotel right near the water.
review.reviewText: Definitely would come back and stay at the Argonaut! Very nice hotel. We were walking distance from everything we did.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to all the restaurants and to the Alcatraz tour.

review.title: Great location and wonderful experience!
review.reviewText: Upscale hotel with European feel. Rooms are spacious. Staff is excellent. Restaurant and bar are cozy and good.

review.title: Location could not have been more perfect!!!!
review.reviewText:
Located in the Fisherman's Warf District and close to nice restaurants. 
Right beside cable cars. 
View of the Golden Gate Bridge.
Close to Alcatraz attraction and bus tour stops. 
Friendly and helpful staff in seemingly safe area. 
Interesting building structure. (Loved looking at old beams and decor.)
Room had fridge that was stocked, but you can put your own stuff in there, if desired. 
City is cold (Even in the summer.)

review.title: Excellent location. Irregular service
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with where the hotel is situated and some of the staff were very attentive but we did have issues with housekeeping (non responsive) and the valet system is not very good.

review.title: Argonaut is a great place to stay,
review.reviewText: Very nice friendly staff. Close to everything on the ward.

review.title: Perfect location - great rooms and good value
review.reviewText: Probably the best location to see the city. Near the harbour, great views of the bridge and close to cable car station. Lovely atmosphere - and great fire in reception.

review.title: Clean and beautiful hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText:
I would give it a five except the walls seemed thin. We had a fighting couple who started arguing around 3:00 am and we could hear every word of their conversation. 
Other than that everything was perfect
review.negativeRemarks: Thicker walls!!
review.locationRemarks: The pier, restaurants, activities were all a short walk away

review.reviewText: Great hotel clean great staff. Steps away from cable cars and fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Fantastic Stay cant wait to stay again
review.reviewText: This is a lovely hotel in a very central position, close to all the amenities, cable cars, fishers wharf and walking distance to lots of restaurants and sight seeing excursions at Pier 33, staff very helpful polite and made my visit special as it was my birthday nice gesture. Blue Mermaid restaurant very nice food and great ambiance, the hotel lobby is decorative for location and made it a fantastic stay for my partner and me.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything about the hotel was lovely staff, room, views, location.
review.negativeRemarks: We found the bed to be very high from the floor, husband is short so was a little high but we managed.
review.locationRemarks: The location is close to the Cable Car turnaround, bus stops are close, Fisherman Wharf is outside the door lots of restaurants and places to see.

review.title: Good location but reception could be friendlier
review.reviewText: Room was small and check out time was rigid . I asked for late check out at 12.30 pm but was rejected . Really unusual
Great location, excellent staff, concierge was amazing and beds and bedding were super comfortable.

review.title: Fun decor on the wharf
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the nautical theme of this converted warehouse and its proximity to the sights and sounds of Fisherman's Wharf.  A relaxing place after all the local walks.  Decent food offered as well.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: Chose this hotel to spend our 40th wedding anniversary while in San Francisco. I can't say enough good things about the staff, room and overall experience during my stay. The building was an old Del Monte factory warehouse. There are the original huge columns and beams still incorporated into the hotel. The staff from the front doorman on, made sure we felt special and tended to all our needs. Location was perfect as it was right on Fisherman's Wharf and a block from the cable cars.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the hotel building.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a thing.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Fisherman's Wharf with restaurants and tours all right there.

review.title: RIght on the Wharf.  Very good location.
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the staff and the level of professionalism.
review.negativeRemarks: Kind of expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Bay tours, shopping, sightseeing

review.reviewText: Some people say Hotel is loud.  We had room on second floor and felt there was no more noise then any other Hotel. Occasionally you heard people in hall that was the only noise. Great place. Great location.
Enjoyed our stay. Liked being close to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, and cable cars.

managementResponses.response:

Thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback regarding your stay at the Argonaut. review.title: Expensive but centrally located
review.reviewText: I've stayed at some really nice hotels, in some very touristy places and always felt like I got my money's worth.  Although the central location of the Argonaut is appealing, I feel like the $400+ price tag I paid for this room is high considering my amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff wasn't overly helpful (including concierge).  Hotel wasn't breathtaking (for the room price) and the attached restaurant served the basics.
review.locationRemarks: Ghirardelli Square, Wharf, Naval boat tours, bike tours of GGB and blocks away from ferry pickup/drop off.

review.reviewText:
good location, nice service.
room was very small' a bit old.

review.title: Friendly Stay at Argonaut
review.reviewText: Wonderful stay at the Argonaut Hotel in San Francisco. Staff was helpful and courteous. Great location. Would definitely stay again in the future.
review.locationRemarks: Good location for Fisherman's Wharf. Plenty of eating places of varying types. Walking distance to some historical locations.

review.title: Great location - poor wifi
review.reviewText: Overall very pleasant stay.  However as we were very reliant upon wifi to make ongoing bookings and reservations to avoid large UK telecom charges - we found the available bandwidth wholly inadequate.
It was a very nice, comfortable stay with a staff that was helpful and courteous.  I would recommend the hotel to family and friends.

review.title: Location is great.
review.reviewText: This was our second stsy, because we like it so much.

review.title: Nice hotel in a very touristic area.
review.reviewText: We had to book it in a rush time. We were really well received. The receptionist helped us and made us feel so comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The restaurant is a good choice.

photos.caption: Navy ships right across from the hotel

review.title: Take a right, next stop Pier 39
review.reviewText: Hotel Argonaut sits right on the the Pier (about Pier 41), it's right in the middle of the action.  There are shops right outside the door, there are restaurants, there are performers, there are ships.  The Sees Candy factory is behind the hotel.  The location is fabulous.  Take a right and go Pier 39, take a left and head to the walking trail that goes along the beach, keep going and you will hit the Presidio and eventually the Golden Gate bridge (about 4 miles).  Sharing the wall with the hotel is a beautiful National Parks Historic Museum that has a real light to a lighthouse and a history of San Francisco.  Very worth your time.  Yet, sleeping at night was not hard, the noise was not a factor at all.  This hotel was very well run from the moment we showed up, the valet, -friendly, efficient, kept everything moving at a good clip without making you feel like you at too rushed to not matter.  The check-in was a well oiled machine.  We happened to mentioned we were celebrating our 25th, and they sent up a complimentary bottle of wine (That's class!)  The room was amazing and had touches all throughout the hotel of a ship.  I really enjoyed these touches.  Checkout was just as easy and treated us just as kindly on our way out.  Thank you Argonaut and we would stay here again if ever in your fair city again!
review.positiveRemarks: The fire in the lobby was a nice touch, San Francisco is not always warm!

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText: Nice location close to everything ,highly recommend

review.title: Nice, clean hotel, right on the wharf
review.reviewText: We booked this room at the last minute having forfeited a reservation at another location that turned out to be disgusting. Staff was very gracious, rooms were very clean,  room service was on time if not early, the valets went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of.  I would book this again if I come back to San Francisco

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Ideal location, just past the crowds of Fisherman's Wharf. Walking distance to restaurants, shopping, etc...

review.title: There is no better place to stay.
review.reviewText:
Staying in Fisherman's Wharf is the ideal place when visiting San Francisco for pleasure. The Argonaut is close to everything. For the serious shoppers the hotel is adjacent to the beginning of the Trolley line, take it to the end of the Trolley line and you are in the shopping district. 
We would surely stay there again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Spent a long weekend. Location right on the wharf was excellent. Cool building. Staff was excellent and very friendly. Bed was harder than I prefer but that is a personal choice. In room coffee was not refilled for second morning. A small thing but small things make a difference at this price per night. It was overall a great stay.

review.title: Ideal location and good quality hotel
review.reviewText:
We stayed in SF for 10 days, and decided to use the Argonaut as our base which proved to be a great decision.  We wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel to anyone.

Not only is the hotel of a good standard, its location is ideal - access to downtown is easy, a very nice area next to the hotel to chill out overlooking the Bay and, whilst on Fisherman's Wharf, the Argonaut is at the "quiet" end away from the frenetic Pier 39.

Some great independent cafes and a good Starbucks behind the hotel for breakfast; plenty of fair, if not great, restaurants along the wharf. The hotel's own restaurant is good but suffers from a limited menu.

The only downside was that on a couple of occasions we noticed noise from the next room, when children were having a tantrum. But this was intermittent and generally not a problem.
review.positiveRemarks: The housekeeping and staff on the front door & lobby were all very courteous and helpful.  Rooms were kept very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: One or two receptionists were much less friendly than the rest of the staff. Access to PCs for free would be a good addition (currently $7 /15 min).
review.locationRemarks: Almost everything a tourist might want to do in SF is readily accessible; the business district is only 15 min cab journey.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This was our 1st trip to SFO.  We had a great experience with everyone at the hotel, they were very informative, kind, and enjoyable.  The location was great, with easy access to Fisherman's Wharf.  We would definitely stay here again, as well as recommend to our friends.

review.title: Great Hotel: Great Location for Tourists
review.reviewText: This is an excellent hotel - well presented and maintained. Rooms are spacious, comfortable, quiet and well appointed.  The staff were consistently friendly and helpful.  The hotel is easily accessible.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great, and the hotel presentation and service is exceptional.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect for tourists - restaurants, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, cable cars and Ghirardelli Square are all easily accessible.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location and very friendly staff with good room service, only thing missing was a bar area to retire to without having to go next door, but all in all enough out if the way of the hussle and bustle but near enough to join in !

managementResponses.response:

Thank you for taking the time to review us on Expedia. We truly apologize for the delays with our valet team. We have shared your comments with our management team to ensure your experience is not duplicated. Thank you again for your feedback.

review.title: Touristy location, hotel not worth the money
review.reviewText:
Staff is not helpful, waited 30min for valet
Wouldn't recommend

review.title: Great staff, close to everything!
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay, great staff, good restaurant, refreshing. Next door to cable cars, down the street from Alcatraz, Sourdough bakery close. Get Clam chowder bowl ! ! Got rental car drove west coast. Nice getaway ! !

review.title: Great location,
review.reviewText: Can see a bit of Golden Gate Bridge if not foggy, watch July 4th fireworks on the lawn right next to it, very convenient yet quiet at night, highly recommended

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Had a very nice time upgraded  to a suite was Excellent  ..The only complaint  I had that maybe  not fixable  is the bar right next door to our corner suite when it closed  there was fighting ,cussing  so loud I thought  there in our room and did not stop for at least 30 minutes..I informed  staff To perhaps sound proof ..Location  is awesome  you can walk to Buena Vista to have an Irish  coffee, and walk to wharf..
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proof  rooms ...
review.locationRemarks: Endless, Wharf,restaurants,  Alcatraz,  Boudins, live ,music.

review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, courteous & attentive staff and located near all Fisherman's Wharf sights. Convenient location to all San Francisco sights.

review.title: Best place to stay to enjoy SF's maritime history
review.reviewText: Perfect location right at the foot of the SF maritime museum scene. Easy walk to Pier 45 area and Ghirardelli Square. The Hyde Street cable car turntable is right across the street. Quiet and comfortable room. Very good restaurant with award-winning chowders. THE best place to stay if you are in town on July 4th to catch the famous San Francisco fireworks extravaganza. Extremely friendly and helpful staff in all departments. Try and get a view room, otherwise you will have a "courtyard view" room that will likely be a disappointment to some. I upgraded to a 4th-floor room that overlooked Hyde Street which had a terrific view of Ghirardelli Square, the cable car terminus and the park. Very enjoyable stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Room furniture is a little dated
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location in Fishermans' Wharf for those interested in sampling San Francisco's maritime heritage.

managementResponses.response:
Hello DT, 

Thank you so much for taking the time to leave your comments on Expedia. Your feedback is truly appreciated. Moreover, I appreciate your suggestion, and will be sure to share it with our respective team for review. Thank you again, and I look forward to welcoming you back to continue indulging at our outstanding accommodations.

Warmest regards, 
Steven Marais
Front Office Manager

review.title: Attractive position and decor but pricey
review.reviewText:
On the plus side, nicely positioned on Fisherman's Wharf. Everything restful, inside and outside the hotel. Staff very professional, attentive, and helpful.

Downside, it is pricey. Our rate was room only and charging breakfast quickly mounted to uneconomic levels. Better value hotels available, or eat out - plenty of good value spots away from the Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Inclusive buffet breakfast. Europe and New York can do it, why not Fog City?
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is a pleasant tourist spot, for the first night. We really enjoyed the surrounding areas though, Pacific Heights & Haight.

review.reviewText: We stayed 4 nights and had a great time. Hotel is in fantastic location and staff friendly and helpful.
Front office staff and parking staff were exceptional! A wonderful experience.

review.title: Great location: Good stay
review.reviewText: It was convenient to stay here with family. Just walking distance to guiradelli square and many great restaurants. Will stay here again

review.title: Super small rooms and hard to bed
review.reviewText: The rooms are so small I can't even describe it other then a dollhouse   The rooms were clean and the Decor was cute but the beds were super hard

review.title: Great location with a helpful staff.
review.reviewText: The location was excellent for our needs as first time visitors to San Francisco.   The Staff was very knowledgeable and took extra steps to assist us.   We mentioned that it was our 25th anniversary and they had a bottle of champagne sent to our room.
review.negativeRemarks: Need a new showerhead.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Fisherman's Wharf and next door to a Cablecar turnaround.   Everything was nearby as well a some great restaurants.

review.title: Love the location to everything in SF
review.reviewText: The room was quiet and very clean. The restaurant we ate at every morning was delicious and the staff was very polite and professional. Loved it

review.title: Great place to stay in a fabulous location!
review.reviewText: Amazing door and front of house staff. The restaurant was fabulous and the wine was superb!

review.title: Great hotel within walking distance to everything.
review.reviewText: Great place to visit can wait to return. Loved the Decore and ambiance. Very pet friendly.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, rude porters
review.reviewText:
The welcome was warm and efficient. The room and communal areas were gorgeous. Great location! Check out was swift. They even stored our bags and car till 1pm. I would highly recommend this hotel. The only thing that brought the whole experience down were the comments from the porters regarding tips as we were leaving.

Throughout our stay we tipped 20%, we tipped to bring the bags to the room and for the valet in addition to the $50 valet charge. As we were trying to organise ourselves and sort change the porter made a remark that spoilt the experience for our group.

photos.caption: an easy walk to best wharf offers
Extraordinary complex with much to explore
Soak up the atmosphere with cocktail in the lobby

review.title: Beautifully appointed facility on the waterfront
review.reviewText: Wonderfully restored historical building with loads of character. Our deluxe double Queen room was immaculate and was everything we expected - earning the 4.5 rating we read about before booking. Dog friendly, too. Highly recommend!

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Excellent location, friendly helpful staff.  Rooms are spacious and clean, great views.  Very quiet at night, close to all Fishermans wharf attractions.

review.title: Great staff and convenient location
review.reviewText:
Experience of great staffs begins at the drop off area. 
Door man, Joan was super caretaker and front desk ladies were very informative about the area.
Fantastically restored historic bldg, one down side was water pressure at shower head is a bit weak...

managementResponses.response:
Ahoy! 

I am sorry that your recent stay was poor and that you were unable to find the good points. We typically do better, but there is no doubt that the plumbing caused a disruption during your stay. That said, I am sorry our staff failed as they have been known and reviewed to do better. Every effort is being made to provide and acceptable guest experience and it is clear that in your opinion we missed the mark. I am sorry and hope to have the opportunity to show you that we can do better on a future visit.

Best regards, 
Steven Marais
Front Office Manager

review.title: Expect Better From Almost 5star Hotel.
review.reviewText: Paid Over $400 Dollars A Night For A Bay View. My Stay Was For The Weekend I Expected More. Hotel Is Gorgeous, However I Was In A Room That The Was Problem With The Plumbing In The Shower. I Was Taking A Shower In Ankle High Water Because The Water Was Not Draining. I Complained To Front Desk The First Night And They Sent The Maintance Guy To My Room And He Said There Nothing He Can Do Until The Morning. Well Needless To Say After Talking To Manager In The Morning and 4 Showers/Baths Later My Room Was Changed. Just Expected More From This Hotel At These Prices.

review.title: Center of fishermans warf
review.reviewText: It was very nice. Definitely within walking distance of multiple sight seeing tours & restaurants. The front desk staff could have been more friendly...bellhop & front door man were very kind.

review.title: Nice clean well staffed hotel
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel right in the midst of Fisherman's Wharf    Staff was excellent, concierge most helpful and room was kept clean and comfortable at all times.

review.title: EXCEPTIONAL HOTEL with friendly, funny staff
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, comfortable, clean, and a fantastic restaurant downstairs. In the tourist area, so be aware of that. The best part of the hotel is the wonderful staff - super friendly and quite funny.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel is very well located. The restaurant is very good. My only criticism is the charge for parking. Very steep.
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel is very clean and the staff are very nice.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is right beside the cable car station is  centrally located near fisherman's wharf and the waterfront

review.title: Nice hotel, close to everything
review.reviewText: Great hotel, amazing staff. Close to most "tourist" things to do in San Francisco.

review.title: Elegance and character
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location at Fishermans warf. Our room overlooked alcatraz and the bay. Excellent staff and services.  The rooms were large and we'll appointed.

review.title: Good  location for Fishermans wharf.
review.reviewText: A nice period building near to Fishermans Wharf but not too close so that it was disturbed by the busy hustle on the streets. Everything in the wharfe easily walkable. Sizeable room well equipped. Friendly and helpful staff. Enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Staff are friendly and helpful good location.
review.reviewText: Very enjoyable refuge to crash in when your tired from a day out.

review.title: Beautiful
review.reviewText: Will stay there again. Perfect location on Fishermans Wharf. Great staff
Museum right at hotel site.  Cable car entrance a few steps away.  Nice view of the bay.

review.title: Great location to explore SF from on our honeymoon
review.reviewText: We looked around for a good location to catch the sites of SF and this did the trick.  Very attentive and clean hotel located right on Fisherman's Wharf just near the cable cars too.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, bike hire to do the Golden Gate bridge, cable cars to great restaurants

review.title: Excellent location and phenomenal staff!
review.reviewText: This was such a nice surprise from the time we pulled up to drop our stuff. We needed to drop our items quickly to get our rental car back before it closed in Union Square. The men were so nice and allowed us to park there and told us to take our time checking in and getting our things. Check out was a breeze and we were gifted a room upgrade from a standard king to a king suite because "it was our first time there! So nice! For San Fran the room was HUGE! VERY comfy linens, robes, towels, and bed. Less than 5 stars for condition as the pillows were all super squishy and there was a high pitched humming noise that slightly bothered my husband. I am sure had we cared so much to ask they would have accommodated with other pillows or changing our room, but we were in there so little didn't matter. Free wifi was very strong signal - nice! The concierge was awesome - great recommendations for transportation to airport, set up a car for us quickly and was so kind and polite. The lobby area to relax was so fun - all nautical themed and really quite comfortable. The door men were so polite and remembered us for the few nights we were there. Everyone was pleasant, smiled, and SUPER helpful and accommodating! Will definitely go back. No complaints at all.
review.positiveRemarks:
- room size
- amenities
- look of hotel
- LOCATION!
review.negativeRemarks:
- offering more firm pillows in closet perhaps
- pool may be nice
review.locationRemarks:
- fisherman's wharf 
- Irish coffee at Buena vista Cafe is delicious!
- Segway tours
- Bikes for use in hotel (or we used Blazing Saddles)

review.reviewText: Staff was very nice & helpful.  Loved the decor of the hotel.  It was very clean!  Rooms & beds were comfortable.

review.title: San Francisco trip
review.reviewText: My husband had a wonderful time I San Francisco. The Argonaut was a great choice & we would recommend it to anyone & would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great. The hotel staff & conceirge were wonderful .
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: We stayed at Fishers Wharf & it was near shops, great food, Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge & much more.

review.title: Great location no need to rent a car.
review.reviewText: We had a great stay in this hotel and would stay again.  Everyone was very nice and helpful at any time creating a stress free vacation.  The room was clean and the beds comfortable the maid service was prompt and very good.  It was quiet and we enjoyed the stay.
review.positiveRemarks: It was right on fishermans wharf and stress free, the staff was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Piers, ferries, busses, trolley, bike rentals, city tours, swim beach, museums and plenty of restaurants and the swim beach.

review.title: Hotel of choice
review.reviewText:
This was our first trip to San Fransisco and it was great. The hotel was very clean. Hotel staff were extremely friendly and greeted us on every occasion including cleaning staff, front desk, and Bellman. The hotel is located right next to Fisherman s Wharf and was close to shops, restaurants, and transportation. 

Hotel room was very clean and overall had a great experience. We will definitely stay here again if we come to San Fran.
review.negativeRemarks: Had to pay for internet usage in business room. We could check into our flight but wasn't able to look other information up about area
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf within walking distance. Trolley right around corner. Overall great location.

review.title: Nra till det mesta
review.reviewText: Trevligt hotell precis nra till det mesta son turisten behver se. Vldigt trevligt stlle.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The room was clean, comfortable with all the amenities!! It is close to everything and I would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

review.title: San Fran 4/18th
review.reviewText: Stay at the Argonaut April 14th thru the 18th.  The hotel was a PERFECTLY located on the wharf.  Staff very friendly.  Would not stay anywhere else but here.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower soap
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, walking distance to starbucks, restaurants.

review.title: Hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel conveniently located walking distance from Fisherman's Warf, Ghiradelli Square, and the cable car.  Flying in from SFO, no car was needed as we were able to get to this hotel via Bart and F-Line.  The hotel staff was friendly and accommodations were nice.  I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Second visit and still pleased
review.reviewText: Great central location and very pleasant and helpful staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Love the theme of the hotel.  Great shower. Comfortable bed. Very friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: We miss the wine tasting in the lobby! Also second floor room was street level which was pretty noisy early in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: Nice to be on the quiet end of Fisherman's Wharf.  Easy to get to from the Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Great Hotel near Pier
review.reviewText: terrific location directly across the street from the pier and close to all the shops and restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: across from the pier, conveniently located to shops and restaurants

review.reviewText: Great hotel, excellent staff and Great location! Close to fisherman's Wharf, cable car, Buena Vista, Ghirradelles and more!

photos.caption: View back to Wharf from Black Point
Hyde St Pier across from hotel

review.title: Nice friendly staff. Next to the park
review.reviewText: Really great! We also had beautiful weather, 80 degrees in April! Doorman was very friendly and helpful upon arrival and the front desk person was all smiles and helpful. The location was excellent for a quick visit to Fisherman's Wharf. Turn left and you were in the SF Maritime Park and Ghiradelli Sq. Turn right and all of the sights and attractions of Fisherman's Wharf were laid out before you.
review.positiveRemarks: The nautical theme, location and the really nice staff and they allowed pets
review.negativeRemarks: The walls between rooms seemed a little thin so we heard the joyous sounds of the kids next door when they arrived
review.locationRemarks: All of Fisherman's Wharf and the Maritime Park

review.title: Nice Hotel next to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Convenient location next to the Wharf
Walking distance to many restaurants and attractions

review.title: It was great
review.reviewText: The room, staff, experience. Everything was completely top notch

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText: Large comfortable, clean room.  Nicely decorated and added touch (welcome basket) was appreciated.  Staff was friendly, attentive and helpful at every turn.  I won't even bother to look for accommodations anywhere else the next time we visit.
review.locationRemarks: The location near Fisherman's Warf and a stone's throw away from the Golden Gatewas about as accessible and convenient as it gets.

review.reviewText: Great stay with the family. Clean , quiet and spacious .

review.title: Best door man in the hotel business.
review.reviewText: The hospitality from hotel staff was exceptional. Especially the door man out front, his hospitality, friendliness and willingness to help was amazing. We had a huge rental car, I asked if I could park in front for a few extra moments while the family made their down w bags, his response: "of course MR ....., we want you to stay with us as long as possible". Threw me back on my heels, amazingly customer driven, front desk was very similar.

review.title: excellent place to stay
review.reviewText: The staff was wonderful. The suite was beautiful.  Great location.  Anything we needed was provided to us in a timely manner.  Thank you for a wonderful and carefree stay.

review.title: Great location--cute and comfortable!
review.reviewText: Great location!!!  Cute and comfortable! Friendly staff that was apologetic and willing to fix problems quickly!  The staff was very warm and friendly from the front door all the way to the room.  Upon entering the room, it was noted that the bathroom was left dirty!  The Bellhop was still in the room when it was discovered and quickly notified the desk.  The Desk staff promptly worked to get the room clean. However after thinking about it, we did not want to stay in the same room.  In speaking with the desk again, they switched our room.  It took a bit of convincing, but we also got them to upgrade us for the trouble.  Upon entering our upgrade, we also discovered a bottle of wine, chocolates and a note from the staff.  Great job fixing the problem!
review.negativeRemarks: Double check cleanliness of rooms before let someone check in!
review.locationRemarks: The Warf--Buena Vista Cafe--Giradelli--Cable Car--Golden Gate Bridge!!!

review.title: Great location and atmosphere
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel had easy access to transportation or close proximity to everything we wanted to see and do around the city. The staff was great, and it was always pleasant to return after a day of touring. We loved the decor and everything was fresh and comfortable for our family of 4!

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText:
We booked a King studio which was spacious. We had a view of the Golden gate bridge and the Powell-Hyde cable car stop that my 2.5 yr old son enjoyed very much. Majority of the tourist attractions were walking distance and the street car stop was just a couple of blocks away. 
We did need access to a microwave to sterilize my son's bottles but were told that none were available. So if a microwave is an absolute must this may not be the place for you. 
I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to all the main tourist attractions like Pier 39, Cable car stop and Ghiradelli square. Lots of restaurants near by.
review.negativeRemarks: Tea in the room. Access to a microwave.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, Ghirardelli square, Bay cruises, Street car, cable car, beach

review.reviewText: This was our second time staying at the Argonaut.  The staff is impeccable! Extremely friendly and helpful to answer any question you may have.  The hotel is clean, rooms are quiet and the beds so comfortable.  Great location to walking to restaurants and sight-seeing!

review.title: Nice hotel. Close to fishermans wharf.
review.reviewText: Loved the atmosphere and location of the hotel. Did not like our room location, as our window had a street view and felt loke we lacked privacy.

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText: The location is excellent. Excellent staff. Delicious Restaurant. Very unique look! Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Great hotel convenient to everything on the Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice, the room was perfect and clean. Very comfortable. I wish we'd had an unobstructed view of the water (tree partially in the way), but it still very nice. Hotel staff were the best I've ever encountered. The concierge staff were top notch and hooked us up with a lot of great activities and made all of the arrangements. Thanks!
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff. Very clean. Very convenient to all things to do on the Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Really nothing in my opinion. We loved it.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, great food and shops and sea lions. Wine country tours, Muir Woods, boat trips around the golden gate and Alcatraz, Maritime park.

review.title: My City as a Tourist
review.reviewText: We like to stay in hotels around San Francisco (where we live) and play tourist. The Argonaut is a fantastic hotel on Fisherman's Wharf and makes the adventure special. I would recommend it to anyone, local or not.
Great location, beautiful hotel, very helpful staff, rooms are comfortable would stay there again in a heartbeat!

review.title: Good location, easy for tram, good restaurants.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable, a little disappointed we had an internal room (looking into others) so blinds were constantly closed. You could hear the neighbours in next door rooms talking and the air conditioning was very noisy. Location was great for the team and Fishermans Wharf restaurants

review.title: Gorgeous boutique hotel which a beautifully-styled
review.reviewText: Welcomed by amazing staff, room was beautiful and comfortable. Beds amazing! Bath robes.....oh the bath robes.....

review.title: Great place for families, couples and fur babies.
review.reviewText: This was our second stay here and we enjoyed it.  It's across fisherman a wharf and shops. Next to Ghiradelli, restaurants and wine tasting. Definitely a tourist spot, but fun and easy.  We always park at the structure behind the hotel. Cost is $40 bucks all night, if you do not want to deal with valet $50 plus parking a day.

review.title: Good hotel near the wharf
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay very much, should have stayed at this hotel longer rather than trying out another one.
review.positiveRemarks: Accessible room for wheel chair traveler.  Room service and mini bar.  Assistance checking and out, and with luggage.  Lovely building and interior.
review.negativeRemarks: Add an actual day spa.  The massage service isn't quite enough.
review.locationRemarks: Location is amazing, nearby pier 39 so lots of shops and food options, also great for walks and tours etc.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, close to restaurants, shops, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Ghiardelli Square. Friendly service from the  front desk staff (Lavon) and the bellmen. Clean and nicely decorated rooms. My daughter got to get a toy from the treasure box.  Pillows and mattress could be more comfortable though. And concierge should be more knowledgeable about when restaurants open so we are not waiting around for 2 hours for it to be open. We would stay here again.

review.title: Relax in style on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Chose the hotel from Trip Advisors recommendations, it was great! On Jefferson St right in the middle of where we wanted to be. Room was much more than I expected for the price and very roomy. I took my two daughters, 21/18 and it was more than enough room. Most def would stay again!!

review.title: Good hotel near fishermans wharf
review.reviewText:
This hotel is convenient to cable cars, bike hire, Segway tours, shopping, Alcatraz tours, bay cruises and everything else at fishermans wharf. Our room with a bay view looked out towards Golden Gate Bridge. It was a great location and the nautical theme was quirky and suited to the area. 
On the next corner is the Bueno Vista Cafe with the best traditional breakfast and Irish Coffee as well as numerous crab shacks and seafood restaurants to choose from.

review.title: Hotel is in a great location on waterfront
review.reviewText:
Nice place, a little spendy but it's because of the location. Room was plush and comfortable except first floor room windows can be seen in from outside to easily. 
Staff was nice but not overly welcoming. 

Restaurant connected to hotel was crud. Poor service, happy hour was meh, and dinner was way overpriced for "Skippers" style seafood.

review.title: Omg! Loved it
review.reviewText: As soon as I walked in, I knew I would love it. It's right on the pier and walking distance to everything. It has a restaurant/bar attached to the hotel, a museum, a wine tasting room, and the hotel is super cute. The room was clean and comfy and the staff is superb. We're already planning to come right back.

review.title: Nice hotel right on the ocean
review.reviewText: Very nice amenities, friendly staff and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: restaurants and shops

review.title: Relaxing Stay
review.reviewText: Very helpful baggage support in lobby. Valet quick and efficient. Great appetizers at happy hour in Blue Mermaid restaurant.
Good location. Super friendly and helpful valet staff and bellboy.

review.title: Best place in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We've stayed here twice for family trips. The hotel is the perfect location for Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, cable cars...and also access to Golden Gate National Recreation Area, Crissy Field, and the Bridge.  If you're a walker, runner, or cyclist, this is also a great place because you can just hop on the trails.  Aside from that, the hotel itself is really unique as its built onto an old warehouse, the rooms are beautiful, and the staff is great.
wonderful stay in this unique hotel. loved the nautical theme.

review.title: Great location on Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: The location is perfect, and the hotel itself is beautiful. We were just far enough from the action on Pier 39 to make it a quiet and family-friendly place, but a short walk put us right in the action. Overall a great time!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Look Elsewhere, 

We deeply apologize for your experience at our centrally located property. I assure, this is not of the norm as you may have seen in most of our reviews. I have made sure that your feedback was communicated to both our Executive Housekeeper and Chief Engineer in hopes to fine tune our operation so this never happens again. I hope that you may give us another chance to regain your trust. Thank you again for your valued feedback. Safe Travels!

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: Had to change rooms 3 times. First room had screaming people next door, second stank like wet socks third was ok but sink girgled all night. shower never got more than warm.

review.title: Close to all the action and on the cable car syste
review.reviewText: Great place to stay, definitely stay again! Parking is a bit difficult but the location makes up for it.

review.title: Near the pier
review.reviewText: The food was delicious. The bed was comfy but the view was terrible.

review.title: Boutique hotel, close to Ghirardelli square
review.reviewText:
The best things about this hotel are:
-It's a boutique hotel with a shipboat theme. It's clean and the staff are super accommodating.
-It's close to Ghirardelli Square, Aquatic Park, Fisherman's Wharf and Lombard Street. Lots of fun and historical things to see within walking distance.
-They take pets. Dogs and cats of any size. No questions asked. And they even offer you dog beds and leashes upon arrival. They are very accommodating to furry children as well.
review.locationRemarks: Ghirardelli Square, Aquatic Park, Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street, Hyde Street Trolley Center, Buena Vista Cafe, Maritime Museum, etc.

review.title: Last night in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My wife and I had spent the previous month working on an event in San Francisco and decided that for our last night we wanted to play tourist.  I picked the Argonaut from a list of hotels that Expedia had in the area we wanted to stay, and we couldn't be happier with our choice.  The staff at the Argonaut were friendly, and helpful with every request.  Even our getting to the hotel earlier than usual for check-in didn't phase them.  We got into our room, had a great meal at the Blue Mermaid and then hit the area up playing tourist.  If you are in San Francisco and need a place to stay for something romantic, or just need to get away from it all, the Argonaut Hotel should be the first place you look to stay.

review.title: Unique hotel in a fun place
review.reviewText: This hotel is a former cannery at fisherman's wharf.  They did an excellent job on this property highlighting the original building features.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location and friendly staff.  The concierge and doormen were a great help with directions and activity suggestions.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning staff did not replace coffee.  Room service did not answer phone.  Parking limited and valet expensive.
review.locationRemarks: At fisherman's wharf.  Cable car depot next door.  Short hop to farmers market, Embarcadero. Baseball stadium via trolley or bike taxi.

review.title: A sanctuary of class, style and personal service
review.reviewText:
Great place, lovely decor, very welcoming.  Fisherman's Wharf is a bit touristy, but if you stay here you will get great enjoyment out of your visit.  Combines the best of both worlds.

Two minor criticisms:

- The concierge had little local knowledge - asked him for a dinner recommendation and he just went straight to TripAdvisor on the PC in front of him and started reading the same thing I had just looked up in the bar.

- If you have a room at the front you might want to open the windows to experience the bustle and atmosphere of the Wharf.  Disappointing that smokers are allowed to puff away just outside the front door, so their fumes drift into your room.

But very highly recommended.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: In the heart of everything. Quiet and peaceful hotel

review.title: Helpful staff and convenient location
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and pleasant. The location was perfect for site seeing and getting around, most things are walkable or public transportation is right outside. Parking was expensive, but they were good about getting and taking the car. We'll stay here again when we return.

review.title: I love this hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed here several times.   This was our first time we were not in a king suite.  The king standard room is very large and nice.  The only issues I have with our stay were minor ....the lil pumps with body wash, shampoo,,etc do not work well.   And in the exercise room, there were NEVER head phones, and on several of the pieces of equipment the tv didn't work.  Otherwise, this hotel is marvelous!!
review.negativeRemarks: See abobe
review.locationRemarks: This is right by ghiradelli square!   The location cannot be better

review.title: Quality hotel near the waterfront.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a very old converted use building on the waterfront. It is exceptionally well designed and maintained and overall perhaps the best staff I have encountered in at least 10 years. My compliments to the Managment as they clearly train staff extensively on how to interact with guests.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very comfortable, clean, and well maintained. A little busy, but highly skilled at handling many guests.
review.negativeRemarks: It could be more quiet, though they obviously try to keep all non common areas quiet.
review.locationRemarks: Premiere location for tourists wanting a trendy spot on the waterfront close to downtown, financial district, North Beach, and bay activities.

review.title: Fun location and good hotel.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay.  Check in and check out was quick.  Concierge had recommendations that we enjoyed.  We liked the location though we didn't do much in that neighborhood we could walk to the areas we wanted to see.  Good for the price!

managementResponses.response:
Ahoy!

Thank you so much for taking the time to rate us on Expedia. I am so happy to hear that our A+ team was able to accommodate you with your needs and make your experience incredible. We hope that you may take advantage of our prime location on a future visit. Thank you,
Steven Marais
Front Office Manager

review.reviewText: It was on the wharf and close to everything. The staff was nice and went out of their way
the staff was very friendly....would recommend this hotel to my friends. except for parking the hotel was in a great location.

Very comfortable beds! Super convenient location. Guest 
Robes some of the best I have had.
review.positiveRemarks: Gets my vote for the best bed!
review.negativeRemarks: Really great hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, on the Bay.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to write about your experience, I am sorry to hear that you were not more pleased with your first night. I can assure you that we did not place you in a small room as all of our standard accommodations are the same size. I am so happy that we were able to fix the difficulties you had during your stay. We hope that you will come visit us again when your travels take you to our beautiful city by the bay. Thank you again for your valued feedback. 

Warmest Regards, 
Steven Marais
Front Office Manager

review.title: Fantastic location
review.reviewText: The room was super small. Too small for 2 people. Based on the price I expected more. Only the suites have windows that open. I had difficulty breathing in our room and woke up the next morning with a terrible sinus headache. When I complained to the front desk they immediately sent someone up to change our AC filter. The problem was solved and my second night I slept fine. The staff was great!
review.positiveRemarks: The location was fantastic. The staff was exceptional.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was too small and the beds were very high. There was only one chair in the room and we had to take turns using it to put our shoes on.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Well located hotel, with easy walk to Pier 39, cable car to union square. Good restaurant in the hotel as well as across the road, with great French bakery around the corner which is perfect for breakfast. Easy access to do the bike tour over the Golden Gate Bridge. After a long day or after being caught in the rain the open fire in the hotel is lovely to sit around. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Good location on Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Rooms were lovely nautical theme, beds very comfortable, however shower head was very loose, so had to stand very close to wall to get adequate spray.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower, lighting in room, also free water would be good when paying these rates

review.title: A Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Close to everything: restaurants, park, cable car line, plenty of shops, walkable to center of town. Rooms are great: so clean, nice beds and bathroom, service great, and their restaurant is very good. Food and parking are a little pricey, but so convenient and people so kind. treat yourself and go there.

review.title: Hotel chosen for location
review.reviewText: My spouse and I attended an art show nearby, and we chose the Argonaut for its location. The cost of staying there and parking a car ($50+ per night) did not match the value we received; no quid pro quo. Yes, the staff is very good, courteous and efficient, but our room telephone was broken and three of the lamps didn't work. There we were near the Bay, and we couldn't open the window for fresh air! Despite the quaint brick walls, the rooms were noisy for the clamber and footfalls from other rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the lamps and the phone in the room. Maybe replace the mattress...?
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in the heart of the Fisherman's Wharf, the famous SF tourist attraction. Be prepared for ticky-tacky and mobs of day trippers.

review.title: Great funky hotel in a great part of town.
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel. Very comfortable with great nautical theme to the decor. Nice lobby area and integrated restaurant and bars.

review.title: Excellent location, close to a lot of ammenities
review.reviewText: Very good, other than the weather was very cold.  Room was cleaned and quite, close to a lot a amenities and attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Warf, Ghirardelli Square, Hyde Park Troley, Hop-On Hop-Off bus terminals, shops, bicicles rentals, etc.

review.title: Nice location near the shore and cable car station
review.reviewText: It was very nice location to start your Fisherman's wharf tour. It is pretty close to the F-line station so you can easily reach out to the central commercial area, too. The hotel people are nice and friendly, room was clean but I could sometimes hear what people next door is talking if they are talking loud enough. Overall, I am satisfied and recommend this place to other visitors!
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great. People there were also excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: I would appreciate if the price was lower.
review.locationRemarks: Famous cable car turnaround was close. Peers are right in front of you. You can view the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz after a few steps walking.

review.title: Nice hotel in Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Argonaut. The hotel has a good location, is maintained well and is kept clean. The hotel bar is really just a restaurant with a few stools at the bar.

While this isn't really the hotels fault, one of their staff members cloned my credit card upon check-in. In fairness, the manager did check their systems to see if they could find anything, but I suspect the person who cloned the card used their own skimming device which is why the hotel systems were clean. This was the only location that I used my card in, so it was clear where the cloning occurred.

review.title: Perfect location, close to everything worth seeing
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located on Jefferson St within short walking distance to the ferries for the Alcatraz tours and on the same street as the old fashioned trolley car,   Ghiradelli Square is a block away and there is a Sees chocolate shop on the corner.  The Hyde street pier is just across the road if you want to tour the old ships, there is a hop on hop off your bus stop one block away and a free nautical museum inside of the hotel.   

The hotel itself is charming and has a really nice restaurant called The Blue Mermaid .   It is a real value on Monday nights as they do quality appetizers, beer and wine at bargain prices.  Appetizers are five dollars , beer four and wine five.  

The Buena Vista which is famous for its Irish coffee is just up the road and serves a fantastic breakfast. 

The only negative about the hotel is the concigere.   My husband called several weeks before our trip for a restaurant recommendation .   He wanted a quality Italian restaurant with a romantic setting.   Upon their recommendation we went to Sociale and I must say it was neither good food  or Classic Italian.  We both left 3/4 of our meal as it lacked any flavor .   My eggplant Parmesan was so thick and hard to cut, and my husbands beef dish lacked any flavor at all.  It truly tasted like beef boiled in water and then dressed up to deceive until you take a bite of nothing .  So upsetting!!! As far as romantic setting goes , the garden is lovely.  The inside crowded and noisy.  

Great hotel overall

review.title: Great location in SF
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Argonaut many times and will continue to do so. The location is perfect. It's on the water with views of Golden Gate and Alcatraz. The cable car turn around is across the street and so is the Meritime Park. They allow pets and we love bringing our dog. The staff is great. The doorman are very friendly and helpful. I recommend getting a room with an outside view. I can't wait to return.

review.title: Pre-Christmas Getaway
review.reviewText: We had a great experience. The room was spacious and cute. Our son got sick so we had to stay in the room the whole time. Luckily the room was very comfortable and the restraint downstairs had great take-our. We will be back soon.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice staff and awesome location. Very convenient for food and sights.

review.title: close to beach
review.reviewText: it was fantastic. ok it was great. fine fine day. i love to walk around the Pier 39 so location location and location. the hotel was in a prefect location.......
review.negativeRemarks: no
review.locationRemarks: food and more food

review.title: 50th Anniversary/ Family Reunion Vacation
review.reviewText:
We couldn't have chosen a better location or a better ambiance to celebrate our 50th Anniversary (plus additional November family anniversaries and birthdays) than the Argonaut.  We were thrilled with the pleasant and helpful staff and the comfortable, spacious, and quiet rooms.  We took Amtrak from the Central Valley of California to Emeryville and then the Amtrak bus to Pier 39, so we didn't need to contend with driving, parking, etc. in San Francisco.  It was an easy walk to the hotel.  One reason we chose the Argonaut was that it was fairly close to Pier 39 but away from the major tourist congestion and noise.  Being next to the park and beach and just down the hill from Ghirardelli Square added to the fun.  We chose to take advantage of the convenience and celebrated our 
anniversary dinner at the Blue Mermaid.  That too could not have been a better choice.  Everyone (12 of us) all chose from the variety of meals listed on the menu and no one was disappointed in his/her choice.  Our attentive and friendly server, Brian, made the evening even more enjoyable.  The concierge was helpful in giving us suggestions on how best to get our granddaughter to SFO so she could fly back to Syracuse University.  The nautical theme of the hotel was carried throughout the decor and we were constantly noticing special touches that made the experience of staying there so special.  We truly felt like royalty.

review.title: Great Location, Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. If you are on the side of the Cable Car, it can be a tad noisy. Great location, and I hope to return!

review.title: Nice, friendly n helpful Hotel on warf
review.reviewText: Lived in Northern Ca for 30 years.  1st tourist visit to San Francisco.  Can't wait to return to this beautiful city!!

managementResponses.response:
Hello Hannah,

I'm sorry to see that your experience at the Argonaut was disappointing.  I assure you the situation's you encountered were pretty rare, but that doesn't make it any more right.  We strive to offer genuine, friendly service to all our guests, I am truly disappointed to read we missed the mark during your stay.  I know we can do better.  I also wanted to let you know that I have been in contact with your friend about the car incident, the paperwork was completed the day it occurred and it was filed appropriately the next day.  I am sorry I wasn't available to speak to you directly but again, I have been in contact on a few occasions with your friend.  Again, thank you for providing us feedback, it's hard to hear the not-so good stuff, but it helps us learn and improve.

Sincerely,
Christine
Assistant General Manager

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText:
Parking is $50 per day at the hotel, so outrageous. They also charge $100 per night deposit on top of your room rate, for incidentals.

When pulling our luggage out of my friend's car, the bellhop's cart toppled over onto his car, causing a huge dent. Supposedly they'll cover it, but the fact that it happened at all is ridiculous. The manager said they would cover it, but she was nowhere to be found when it came time to file all the paperwork. The assistant manager kept saying she was "off site." Your hotel dents a customer's car and you can't bother to be onsite? For real? 

Front desk is RUDE RUDE RUDE. Called front desk because the room service people forgot to give me silverware (you have to call the front desk when room service doesn't answer), she had an attitude when I asked for it. Was I supposed to eat with my hands?

Called back to ask for a bellhop upon checkout. She almost hung up on me. What the heck?

Water is $4 in the rooms.

Bathrooms are small. 

Overall, really pricey and not much bang for buck. Probably won't stay here the next time we come--it just doesn't seem worth it. 

Being from Texas, I was very friendly and polite and this was our first time visiting SF. I guess Californians aren't the same. It's good to know that SF isn't very friendly to tourists when it's a tourist city. 

Won't be staying here again next time I visit.

review.title: Great hotel @ Fishermans Wharf & Ghiradelli Square
review.reviewText: My mom and I really enjoyed our stay here. The staff is excellent and very accommodating. The location is fantastic, at the quiet end of Fisherman's Wharf and just a couple of blocks away from Ghiradelli Square and easy access to the trolley. We really appreciated having a restaurant on site to provide room service on a couple of early mornings. I would absolutely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent staff, room service, accommodations, location.
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the stuff in the room, e.g., the decorative bed pillow and the tissue box cover, could have been cleaner.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to the Sausalito ferry, Ghiradelli Square, Fisherman's Wharf (including two great boat museums), and lots of restaurants and shops.

review.title: Excellent hotel, well located.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the Argonaut.  It was handy for Fisherman's Wharf and is right next to the Cable Car terminus. The hotel has nice rooms and the breakfast is good in the American style.  Great base for a visit to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were great, it was clean and spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much.
review.locationRemarks: I have already highlighted the good location handy for the waterfront and to catch the cable car to Union Square.

review.title: Nice Hotel on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel right on the wharf. Staff is friendly and eager to please. Spent one night there in November. Room was clean and quiet. No view at all.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great if you want to be near the wharf
review.negativeRemarks: hotel is dark, rooms are dark.
review.locationRemarks: All of Fisherman' s Wharf and close to public transportation

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: My business partner confessed when we arrived that he was nervous about not staying in a big brand hotel.  He then went on to tell me how pleasantly surprised he was with this hotel.  The hotel has an excellent location and the top notch service that you would expect with a 4 or 5 star hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: not sure
review.locationRemarks: There is an awesome Ben & Jerry's scoop shop two doors down.

review.title: Over priced for what you get, to many extra fees.
review.reviewText: The location is great, but not at this price point once you add up all the fees.

review.title: Wonderful hotel love the staff
review.reviewText: You and your dogs are welcome here and the staff is extremely helpful and happy to be there. Parking is over priced but they may not have control over thst

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was above and beyond in every aspect from location to service. The hotel itself is beautiful from the outside and inside. The service is amazing they cater to your every need. The room was clean organize and spacious. The price was a good deal for a deluxe king room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It's close to every thing you want to do in San Francisco everything it's walking distances. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I came to San Francisco to celebrate his birthday. Right when we pulled up to the Argonaut Hotel we were greeted by Donovan - he was so friendly and personable! We were able to check in early and our room was very nice and clean. When we came back from walking fishermans wharf there was a bottle of champagne and a note that said happy birthday! So pleased with our stay and the staff. We will definitely be coming back.

review.title: Close to beach,
review.reviewText:
Clean room, helpful staff. 
Joshua went extra mile helping me get my transportation to the airport. Thanks.

review.title: Great location in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Everything excellent at this facility
A must stay if requiring hotel while in San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: Bring back wine tasting experience
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants and Boardwalk

review.title: Excellent choice
review.reviewText: This hotel was an excellent choice for our short stay in San Fransisco to experience all there was to see. A short walk to dining, bus trips, cable car, and wharf. Excellent views of Alcatrez and Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Awesome hotel!! Amazing stay!!
review.reviewText: The argonaut was amazing my fianc and I stayed there three nights on our trip to San Fransisco. The Argonaut is in the old Del Monte cannery building so it's absolutely beautiful inside and out there are restaurants right out the door as well as the piers on fishermans wharf are right outside the front door. The location couldn't have been more perfect the trolleys are right across the street and you are seconds away from anything on the wharf. It was the only hotel along Jefferson that was actually on the street amongst all of the shops and piers. Staff were amazing and helpful and the concierge helped us with booking our airport shuttle and tours. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Booked the Argonaut Hotel after reading reviews of a hotel that I had reserved previous. Glad that I made the switch. The Argonaut Hotel is a great hotel in a beautiful hotel with extremely friendly and helpful staff. I would highly recommend the hotel for anyone visiting San Francisco. I hope to stay there again in the future.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: We arrived and were welcomed by hotel staff . Our room had a great view of Alcatraz and was spotless. It had everything we needed. Cable cars were just a short walk away and the hotel was surrounded by great restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were friendly and helpful and the room had a great view and was comfortable and spotless.
review.negativeRemarks: We enjoying our experience and didn't encounter any problems.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location for our first time in San Francisco. Plenty to do and see, cable cars were just a short walk & good restaurants near by.

review.title: great atmosphere and location
review.reviewText: The hotel is right where you want to be for walks to wharf area . It is in a wonderfully restored historic building with warmth and charm . Room was great,  modern updates but the old charms are maintained . bed pillows , linens and mattress were less than what I would have expected. Dresser space was limited . coffee and tea in lobby would be nice ... these were minor matters as the hotel was more than we hoped for. I would hope to revisit the Argonaunt soon and would highly recommend others to stay there
review.positiveRemarks: old world charm and location , concierge Brooke and doorman John were exceptional
review.negativeRemarks: bed  and bedding was the biggest issue
review.locationRemarks: you are steps from piers , cable car, restaurants galore . perfect location

review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful... The restaurant food was not very good. We ate there 2 times during our stay.. The pancakes were burnt and had a burnt taste .. The crab dip was terrible...

We were very disappointed that we were not informed that this property is no longer owned by Kimpton. They cancelled the wine reception, this is one of the reasons we booked. When we complained we were given 2 free wine and promised a bottle of wine. They never delivered. I would not book this hotel again.

review.title: Excellent stay with my family
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Just would ask for a microwave in the room. Staff is very friendly.

review.title: Close to all the attractions and very comfortable!
review.reviewText: Historical building transformed into a beautiful traditional hotel representing San Francisco Habor! Love this place!

review.title: Centrally located, close by major attractions
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, inside an old renovated cannery building. Snazzy decor, tasty restaurant next-door and quality treatment from the staff who go out of their way to take care of their guests. Close enough to walk to all the major SF attractions, including Park museums, shops at Pier 39 & Ghirardelli's, aquariums, cruises, etc. The National Park museum right next door is a 'must-see' with wonderful exhibits about the history of SF. And the SF MTA kiosk for trolley's, buses, cable cars and other transportation is just around the corner! Comfy and convenient sums up the Argonaut Hotel perfectly - we would definitely go back again!
review.negativeRemarks: List of hotel amenities, in each room.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located on the waterfront - near most major SF attractions, too much to list.

review.reviewText: Lovely hotel - great location in Fisherman's Wharf - however not a Kimpton Hotel anymore so wouldn't have stayed there as we are Kimpton Karma Reward members

review.title: Great location, excellent staff.
review.reviewText: Had a great time. Great location at Fisherman's Wharf. Walked almost everywhere. Staff was excellent. Bed was a little rough on my back, and the walls were a little thin (could hear full conversations and kids horseplaying). Overall, had a great time.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during Fleet week. The hotel is comfortable, clean and the staff are efficient and friendly. The location is great - it's close to public transport or if you want to explore the city it's great to walk into the city, Chinatown, little Italy, Union Square areas.

review.title: Great vibe
review.reviewText: Just on edge of real touristy area, clise to everything. Stayed in 4 star parc 55 in union square, argonaut light years better.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel is in an excellent location. The hotel is a beautiful rehab old building and the room decoration is neat and clean. Very good staff that is helpful and polite. Front Desk excellent attention.

review.title: Great location. Clean, secure, friendly.
review.reviewText:
The Argonaut is located in a prime area of Fisherman's Wharf--in the center of activity. The room was small, expensive, but clean and artistically finished. The service, bed, and ambiance were great.

The hotel couldn't have been more convenient for our needs.
review.locationRemarks: Located on Fisherman's Wharf. It's a prime location. You can walk to every attraction in the Wharf area--which is great.

photos.caption: View from hotel room looking to the Golden Gate Bridge

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Hotel doesn't look much from the outside but really modern inside 
The hotel bar and restaurant are good but quite expensive but location is excellent for piers,boat trips,tour buses and cable cars 
I would recommend this hotel very highly

review.title: Great location on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Room was smaller than we anticipated but nice and quiet, bed very comfortable.  Restaurant was good but expensive.  Staff very friendly and accommodating.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is ok but very expensive.  Unfortunately this seems to be par for the area as anything we looked into booking was pricey.
review.negativeRemarks: More electrical outlets that are easily accessible as most were covered by furnishings.

review.title: Fun hotel in the middle of everything Fisherman's
review.reviewText: My family and I stayed a night at Argonaut Hotel during Fleet Week in SF. Super fun area. Wine tasting right downstairs, great restaurants and bars eveyrwhere. Couldn't have been better!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, nice decor, friendly staff, centrally located.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I found.
review.locationRemarks: Right at Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Square. Great bars, restaurants and the water right there at your doorstep.

review.reviewText: In town for the Packer-49ers game. Great location in the Fisherman wharf area. Enjoyed the atmosphere.

review.title: First Class experience - Amazing city will be back
review.reviewText: This was my first time to visit San Francisco although my partner had been before, but just like the Tony Bennett song 'I left my heart to San Francisco'! This city is amazing and we will definitely be returning. The Hotel was First Class and perfect in every way for what we wanted. Great location, room was brilliant and always cleaned every day - Thank you so much to Housekeeping, you were excellent. The staff in the Hotel were fantastic, so polite and very helpful. I would definitely recommend this Hotel was an excellent all round outstanding experience and service - well Done :)
review.positiveRemarks: Everything - great Location, warm and polite service from the staff, exceptional throughout
review.negativeRemarks: The Footmen/Bell Boy service - sometimes this was not always as friendly compared to the rest of the staff in the Hotel
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant base for everything - Alcatraz, restaurants, cable car/tram connections. Recommend Irish Coffee's at Beuna Vista, staggering distance 2 hote

review.title: Nice Hotel near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Great hotel and staff. We paid extra for a bay view room, which was worth it in my opinion. Situated nicely so close enough to catch the cable cars around the corner and walk to Ghirardelli Square/Fisherman's Wharf/Pier 39 just a couple of blocks down the street. Very busy outside the hotel during the day but quiets down after sunset so leaving the room window open was a nice option at night.
Loved the nautical theme and rooms were clean and neat. Staff was friendly and attentive when we needed assistance. Comfortable lobby to relax and meet people.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, neatness of hotel. Quiet rooms - couldn't hear other guests. Staff was attentive and helpful.

review.title: Excellent hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Right at the end of fisherman's wharf and a 5 minute walk to a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge, this hotel is in a really great location. The rooms are decorated to a high standard and kept very clean. My only criticism is that at times you can hear the voices of people in other rooms, not great when the neighbors have a screaming baby!

review.title: Amazing in every way!
review.reviewText: So happy with our choice to stay here!  Perfect location and great staff.
