We were pleasantly surprised to find out that we got free bike rentals from the shop next door courtesy of the Argonaut so we chose to bike over the Golden Gate Bridge...a must do.  The room was up to date and super comfortable.  Couldn't have asked for anything more.  5 star!!

review.title: Comfortable hotel in great location
review.reviewText: The Argonaut hotel is across the street from the famous San Francisco cable car.  Two great seafood Italian restuarants across the street.  Rooms very clean and comfortable.  Staff helpful.  Restaurant attached to the hotel, the Blue Mermaid, although serves good food, the service was slow.  The restaurant wasn't as warm and comfortable in atmosphere as other restuarants in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Furniture, had one desk chair and one chase lounge.  For two people watching Tv, I would add another chair in the room.  Restaurant service.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car across the street. Next to the hotel Is the National Park Servive museum.  Also has the Nps sailing ships 100 feet away on Pier.

review.title: Close to tourist attractions, tour buses, trolleys
review.reviewText: My daughter and I stay for four nights.  We had a queen size bed.  The room was not big but we were only there to sleep and shower.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  We got a three day pass on the muni and then did hop on hop off tours so we were able to see and do many things.  There were close places to eat and the hotel had room service which we did not use.
review.negativeRemarks: There were loud motors running.  It did not keep me awake only because I was so tired from my day when I went to bed.  My daughter felt like the floor
review.locationRemarks: Close to restaurants and tour buses, trolleys and cable cars.  Next to Ghirardeli Square.

review.reviewText: Excellent location & great hotel staff. Would stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel, but not worth the value
review.reviewText: Hotel has a great location and is clean, but not worth the value.

Argonaut Hotel is the perfect location for the tourist.  It is across from the bay, next to the cable car turn around, one walkable mile from Pier 39, close to tour bus pick up, & great restaurants.  All staff was very helpful & great concierge who will make reservations for you.  Upscale hotel.  I would stay here next time.

review.title: Great hotel great location
review.reviewText: Everybody was very friendly and pleasant. Within walking distance of pier 39

review.title: great boutique hotel on the wharf
review.reviewText: Great stay. Wonderful bed and linens Loved the nautical decor. Exceptional staff
review.positiveRemarks: Amazing reception for our dog.  They put out treats and doggie poop bags for the dog guests.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Beautifully decorated
review.negativeRemarks: Although nicely appointed and decorated the rooms were small.
review.locationRemarks:
right on the wharf 
many restaurants and shops full of souvenirs and collectibles
concierage full of knowledge for fun activities

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is so close to everything on Fisherman's Wharf.  Walking distance to almost everything.  Enjoyed the staff, they were very pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and close to many restaurants
review.locationRemarks: Mnay restaraunts and plenty of things to do

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very happy with the location. Cable car right next door and  Fishermen Wharf

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf Location
review.reviewText:
We have stayed numerous times at the Argonaut and enjoy it's location on Fisherman's Wharf. 
This past stay was out first without our family dog, Reno, it was bittersweet but brought back fond memories of our past visits. The nautical ambience, large rooms, pet friendly, and courteous staff make this hotel everything you could ask for in beautiful San Francisco!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, pet friendliness, rooms, and Mermaid restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is really expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Walk the wharf and enjoy the food and music.

review.title: Do not valet at this hotel.
review.reviewText:
Don't get me wrong - the hotel itself is pretty nice. The low rating is because of the valet and checkout process. 

I had an early morning flight so I went to check out at 4 AM and there was no one at the front desk, no sign indicating how to check out at odd hours and no buzzer/bell to reach a front desk employee. Another guest and I stood around for 10 min until someone rang the front doorbell to be let in and an employee popped out of the back. 

After that, the checkout process was simple. 

Then the valet nightmare began. 

To begin with, the valet is horribly disorganized. When we arrived the day before, there were no spaces for us to pull into the valet area so we ended up blocking traffic until we were attended to. Nobody offered us a baggage cart even though we were the furthest car from the door. 

The valet ticket instructed us to text a code to a number and we'd receive a text back from the number in 10-15 min when the car was ready. We texted around 3:45 so our car would be ready once we checked out. 4:05, no car and no text response from the valet. At that point we were locked out at the curb so I had to use the intercom box to talk to the front desk. He promised to call the valet and inquire. 5 minutes, no response from front desk or valet text. We finally get a text that all valets are busy- try again in 10 min. Finally, around 4:15, the car appears. The valet wouldn't give my boyfriend the key until he tipped him, even though the service took 3x longer than

review.title: The Argonaut Hotel San francisco
review.reviewText: We had a lovely stay at The Argonaut Hotel in San Francisco it was the second time we stayed there and we weren't disappointed.

review.title: Good hotel and a good location.
review.reviewText: Stayed for Dreamforce. Pleasant surprise. Would recommend this hotel for a stay.

review.title: Rated outside expectations..
review.reviewText:
With only a couple of days to enjoy San Francisco the agenda was busy. We chose the Argonaut based on reviews and location which came with high expectations.. While the staff were super friendly, helpful and professional the Hotel had a tired and well used feel within the public areas but we weren't there to stay inside and the room was clean and comfortable..

Two issues.. 1) Unfortunately the hotel has a noise that runs throughout the accommodation and noticeable on each level I was informed informed by the staff and forms part of the old air conditioning system. Perhaps they didn't wish to move us to a quiter room... Even switching off the HVAC in the room made no difference as it flows through the ducting everywhere and becomes an irritation where we resorted  to ear plugs..

2) Not a big issue but If you want "fine dining" or a dining experience of intimacy or an abiance of subtle cuisine or quality its better to eat out as the hotel fare is very basic and has that bustling cafeteria atmosphere.

On a final note is that we truly loved San Francisco, the private tours and the fabulous quirkiness of its districts, the laid back people and the Argonaut Hotel being unquestionably a great location but from experience (considerable) the Hotel is no more than a 3 star and a little expensive for the return... The happy hour venue ea day was great and bustles with people of which I'm sure most non resident but a fine welcome nip before going out for the evening..

review.title: Great location, nice place but missing a trick
review.reviewText:
Fisherman's Wharf is a great location for tourists and the building of the argonaut is iconic in the area.
The hotel is nice.  It looks better on the website than in real life as it is even by their own admission a little bit tired and dated.  However it is clean and the people are friendly.
There is no bar.  I have never been to a hotel without a  bar before.  There is no lobby bar porter service either.  So when you come back at night there is no opportunity for a night cap before bed - which was definitley missed by us and many others - this is something that would really improve the service.  There is a wine tasting / wine bar thats part of the hotel but it closes quite early - it ouwd be great if that could used to service the lobby after it closes.  There is a mini bar in the room and its not too expensive.  The rooms are fine, the bathrooms are a bit dated but they are clean and there is a fitness room which is sufficient.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel bar service could be introduced.
review.locationRemarks: Trolley car terminus.  Hire bikes in the building to go the bridge etc.  Fisherman's Wharf.  Good restuarants.

review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in a fantastic location which met all of our needs during our stay
Loved the area and our stay at ate Argonaut. Would stay there again!

review.title: Great hotel at great location
review.reviewText: Perfect place for a get away. Lots of attractions just a walk away. Muni is easily accessible.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators are SO SLOW!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Ferry Building, Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge, shopping, eating.

review.title: Thoroughly liked being close to Trollys, ferries
review.reviewText:
Totally enjoyed Argonaut
Staff greeted every time we crossed paths . Room made up nicely. Easy check in, grab key and go. If needed help looked like it was readily available

review.title: Nice hotel good position on fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Really lovely hotel nicely situated on the wharf. Had a view of the Golden Gate Bridge from our room in the 3rd floor. Rooms were nice size and clean. Hotel staff were friendly and welcoming

review.title: Edge of Fisherman's Wharf without the noise
review.reviewText: On the edge of Fisherman's Wharf, close to everything but without the crowds.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, helpful staff, Del Monte converted historic cannery, clean rooms, comfortable beds especially the pillows. Great food., crab corn chowder
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything, all the piers for access to fishing boats, seafood, cable cars, ferry to Oakland

review.title: amazing location beautiful hotel.
review.reviewText: amazing location!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! beautiful hotel. nice staff. great food.
review.locationRemarks: the best location ever!

review.title: Hotel good location for Fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean, staff helpful, and great location.

review.title: Fantastic room great view perfect location in the
review.reviewText: Upgraded room was palatial champagne on ice in the room on arrival
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant breakfast could be improved no gluten free options
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz pier 33 easy walk pier 39 sea lions bars restaurants lots of choice open top bus tour over the Golden Gate Bridge

review.title: Excellent location close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Great location close to the buzz of Fisherman's Wharf and the Embarcadero.  Interesting museum on the ground floor and Maritime Park across the street.  Cable Car station also nearby.

review.title: Best hotel ever!
review.reviewText: Located in the fisherman's wharf area of San Francisco, great location.  We were upgraded to a view of Ghiradelli Square, the trolley car and The Golden Gate Bridge.  It was a great location with an even better view.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff went above and beyond for us to enjoy our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: None.
review.locationRemarks: Ghiradelli Square, the trolley car and The Golden Gate Bridge

review.title: Hotel on the warf
review.reviewText: Hotel was excellent. Only complaint is the air conditioner went out for about 12 hrs and the hotel room was hot and muggy.

review.title: Nice hotel and close to all major attractions.
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean, comfortable, and friendly staff. They did not have laundry so we had to go to another hotel to do our laundry. The restaurant in the hotel closes between 9pm and 10pm. But A great Italian restaurant across the street was open until late. This hotel is a great location and loved the lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and comfortable. The water pressure in the washroom was good so easy and fast to get ready in morning. Washroom was clean and well maintain
review.negativeRemarks: Need laundry. It's the first hotel we have stayed in that does not have laundry.
review.locationRemarks: Beach close by, breakfast, lunch, and dinner restaurants close by. Walgreens 1 block away. Lots of activities close by.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Rooms were very nice with a nautical theme carried out throughout the hotel. Beds were very comfortable. Staff friendly. Party atmosphere in lobby during free wine. Restaurant and bar were both very good.
Wonderful experience, close to all the sights, friendly, helpful staff
Great room, great location, great staff!!  Loved this hotel.  Would definitely stay here again.  My 12 year old son loved it as well!

Very clean room with a very comfortable bed.  Steps to the beach and a short walk to Pier 39.  Concierge and doormen very helpful and incredibly friendly.  Whether it was booking a tour or giving directions, they were there to assist with any need.  Wine tour is a must as is Muir Woods.  Book Alcatraz asap or you will only see it from a distance or on the bay cruise.

review.title: Close to Wharf and transportation.
review.reviewText: Small room. Nice marine theme. Liked wine/beer reception.

review.title: Close & convenient to most attractions!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay there, liked the location, would recommend this property. Convenient  to Fisherman's Wharf and most attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, nautical theme, friendly staff, complimentary happy hour, kid friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The outer glass of the windows in our room were dirty, facing the bay.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, right on the bay, facing Alcatraz, right near Fisherman's Wharf. Access to city transit nearby.

review.reviewText: A perfect location to enjoy the wharf area of San Franscico!   Rooms are well decorated and comfortable and the staff is very professional.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to all of the popular wharf's and tourist attractions.   Only 1 block away from the longest cable car route.

review.title: Fantastic location, not so helpful front desk
review.reviewText: Fantastic location, very nice hotel. Very nice baggage services and bell services, so helpful and nice. Front desk and concierge not so good, quite inexperienced to deal with people, I saw a few conversations with other guests that were not appropriate. This could be a great hotel.
Very cool hotel. Location is perfect. Welcoming staff.

review.title: nice hotel if you get the right room!
review.reviewText:
1st room was an interior room - no view except other interior rooms. my husband called front desk and was told - all booked - no other rooms available. Felt like being in a closet.
I called later and was told they did have outside rooms available - for an upgrade charge of $30 per nite. Much better - view of street and park. For an interior room you may as well book a hotel off fisherman's wharf for a lot cheaper. I thought all rooms had some kind of view - the street,the bay, the park or something!  On nite before we left,our key card did not work. After a long day of walking and getting up to room very tired,very inconvenient.They never even apoligized. This must be a common problem - the same exact thing happened when we stayed here a few years ago.
review.negativeRemarks: key card issue and make sure people are told when booking an "interior" room and exactly what that means.
review.locationRemarks: ghiradelli park, aquatic park very close. golden gate park about 7 miles.must see sea lions at pier 39

review.title: This hotel has wonderful location with easy access
review.reviewText: This was my first time to San Francisco, the hotel stay made the vacation so easy and fun.
First trip to San Francisco was made even more amazing by staying at this INCREDIBLE hotel! The staff is extremely responsive and friendly, from the front desk staff to housekeeping. Always a smile!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel had so many amenities and the location couldn't have been better!
review.locationRemarks: You are on the wharf! Need I say more! :)

review.reviewText: Great hotel, will definitely stay there again and would highly recommend!

review.title: Gorgeous hotel in ideal location
review.reviewText: I loved everything about this hotel.  I highly recommend it for their attention to detail, friendly and courteous staff, room amenities, and location.
review.negativeRemarks: Perfect just the way it is.

review.title: Clean bed easy check in .nice location.
review.reviewText: Nice view,good location, walking distance to China town,pire,and most the sightseeing in town.

review.title: Great hotel. Close to lots of SF activities !
review.reviewText: Loved the nautical decor! Good workout facility! Close to ferries  to Alcatraz and Sausalito and Tiberon

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Argonaut was a wonderful hotel, close to all sorts of restaurants and other attractions.  The  hotel provided much to offer for the wife and I and our every need was taken care of in a wonderful time frame.  Thank you for your courtesy in assisting us by ALL your staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!  Our every need was met quickly.
review.locationRemarks: Too many things to mention here.

review.title: Location is perfect!
review.reviewText:
In general, hotel was fine. However, since they were JUST transitioning from a Kimpton to some unknown brand, they all seemed a little awkward and had some computer glitches -- like our room keys suddenly didn't work -- as we were schlepping food, etc. back to the room.

Bathroom could have been Cleaner! The coffee pot looked dusty and unappealing, as if they never pick it up and clean it or the counter underneath. Didn't drink!!  Didn't trust the drinking glasses either!!  

"View" of the Golden Gate Bridge was only possible if you could crane your neck a lot--except there were BIRD DROPPINGS on the window!
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, more food/ drink choices on propert.
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly on Fisherman's Wharf!  Trolley turn around right at corner. Near great seafood restaurants. Walking distance to Alcatraz ferry pier. Fun!

review.title: Great facility, location and parking staff.
review.reviewText:
My wife and I were guests for the last evening of our summer getaway after touring wine country for the previous part of our trip.  The hotel was a mixed bag.  The location is great for tourists, as it is fairly central to ALL of the tourist attractions of San Francisco.  The facilities are well kept, the decorations are wonderful, and the architecture of the room very attractive.  Our room was enormous (We had reserved a king suite), with an ample living and dining area complemented by a spacious bedroom.  The furniture was comfy, the bed was extremely restful, and everything was clean.
The poor part was the front desk staff.  They were terrible.  Our reservation was lost, and they treated us as though this was our fault.  Even after showing them proof of payment and booking, we were told that we would be responsible for payment again while they were straightening out the issue.  They did finally and magically "find" our reservation.  
Upon check out the next morning, the nice woman at the front desk asked how our stay was, and I was about to mention the only was that no one came to replace a light bulb as requested and the noise, but, before I could even get those words out of my mouth, she interrupted with the details of the parking charges.  Conclusion, we're told to ask, but we don't really care.
If you have to have the best location, stay here.  However, if you are able and willing to walk just a few blocks, there are better choices.

review.title: Perfect Hotel. Great location
review.reviewText: Great! Wonderful vacation! Great location! Professional staff! Free managers reception everyday.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: A perfect starting spot to explore San Francisco

review.title: recent stay at Argonaut
review.reviewText: former Del Monte cannery with retro red brick feel- right on top of Fisherman's Wharf. super close to action. Suggest take bikes over Golden Gate bridge to Sausilito and then back by the ferry.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice happy hour with FREE wine and beer. Smaller 4 story hotel. Former Del Monte Cannery with retro red brick feel- has a nautical design flair.
review.negativeRemarks: entrance to hotel is really quite tight and high valet cost
review.locationRemarks: right on top of Fisherman's wharf. My wife and enjoyed renting bikes to travel aca corss the Golden gate bridge and took the ferry back from Suasilto.

review.title: Excellent hotel across from Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly, rooms were extremely quiet and clean. There was no view, except of the rooms next to us. The space was small but very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was amazing and entities were all inclusive.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect. Cable cars, shopping, the wharf, amazing dining and history was everywhere including the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz.

review.title: Great hotel and excellent location
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed the hour wine and beer reception. 
Didn't realize they charge more to park our truck. Their website said $50 for parking.We had to pay $61
Overall great place

review.title: Very nice, great location at Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Great location at Fisherman's Wharf, Very friendly staff and free happy hour from 5 to 6pm every day!

review.title: Great location Easy access to sites and activities
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice.  Staff was excellent.  The $50 per day valet was troubling.

review.title: Excellent location. Close to almost everything
review.reviewText: We had a great time. Took all the tours, road the cable car. Great city to visit. Lots of interesting things to see.

review.title: Roomy, comfortable, quiet
review.reviewText: Close to Fishermans' Wharf.  Helpful, friendly staff.

review.title: Great hotel in good location on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location on the bustling Fisherman's Wharf area. Staff were very helpful. The room was spacious, clean and quiet with good decor including exposed brickwork. The hotel served free wine and beer between 5-6pm each night which was a nice touch. We could also hire bikes which was complementary on a first come first served basis. Overall very pleased.

review.title: Nice Hotel and Excellent Staff, all very friendly
review.reviewText: Loved Hotel and Location, would definitely recommend

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was a very nice hotel.  Withing walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, trolley and San Fransisco Sightseeing bus tours.  The hotel restaurant was excellent.  The clam chowder was the best we've ever had!  The Staff at the hotel and restaurant were very nice and accommodating.  Would love to stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable beds.  The restaurant was excellent and the staff was very nice.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf was a 2 minutes walk. The trolley was a block away. Pier 39 was about a 10 minutes walk.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText:
Excellent staff always helpful
Rooms were great
Great location to restaurants, attractions
review.locationRemarks: Fisher mans Wharf

review.title: Just like Main Street USA in Disney World.
review.reviewText: I can't stop raving about the staff and the accommodations. From the doorman to the front desk to the porter and the concierge(s). We loved the Argonaut. We will return on our next round the world go-round. Cheers!

review.title: Celebrate 40th anniversary
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent..they helped us find things to do ...recommending restaurants or places to see...very friendly... The hotel was clean...and so close to everything
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect...to riding bikes, taking buss trips, riding a Segway , to walking on the Pier

review.title: You pay for location.
review.reviewText: Poor tv and water pressure. Walls were thin.  If this hotel were anywhere else it would be about $150.  Nice bed.

review.title: Love!!
review.reviewText: Love!!! Took my little dog and it was amazing! The park next door couldn't have been better!! Great location!!

review.title: Close to Ghiradelli Square
review.reviewText:
Nice bed
Walking distance from many attractions 
Restaurant had down hours during the afternoon.  Not able to eat there.  
Had to walk to the warf for chowder

review.title: Close to all tourist attractions
review.reviewText: Wonderful complimentary happy hour and bikes. Have to get up early for those, however. Very happy with our stay there.

review.title: July 4th on SF's famed Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We loved our 4th of July stay at the Argonaut.  The staff was friendly, professional, and very helpful.  The afternoon Wine Reception was a big plus each day.  The room was clean, comfortable, and met all our needs.  We ate at the Blue Mermaid two of three nights and it was great.  The location is perfect for seeing Fisherman's Wharf and it is very easy to get around town using public transportation from here.

review.title: Great hotel in a prime location.
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Argonaut for 5 nights at the beginning of July. It is a superb hotel. Very comfortable rooms, nice and quiet, friendly staff and in an excellent location in the heart of the tourist hotspot. Highly recommend this hotel!

review.title: Very well positioned for Fisherman's Wharf area
review.reviewText: Excellent museum explaining the area in the past adjoins the hotel. In the same building but easy to miss.  Well worth a visit.  The Fisherman's Wharf area itself is tacky and touristy.  Not a place I would want to go to again but I don't regret going once.  The guy at the door is super friendly but lacks sincerity and is clearly just fishing for tips.  Same patter with everyone. This is the American way but it irritates me massively.  I have dragged my bags around the world but then I need to pay him to take them 10 yards from the door to the lobby!  I need to pay someone else to take them to the room - he made this quite clear.  Couldn't wait to be out of his reach.  But apart from this the hotel was nice.
Very wonderful hotel and more than expected. Thumbs up

review.title: Great location. Pay the extra $$ for the view.
review.reviewText:
Got a room for a discounted fare on Expedia a few days before travel date. Hotel is in a great location and front staff are great. I would suggest paying the higher rate for a room with a view of the bay. Otherwise you might get a view of the street (pic attached). 
Also thought I would attach a few general room photos that the hotel management may have left out. Just keeping it real!
The breakfast menu in restaurant was expensive and the menu choice was disappointing.
review.negativeRemarks: A wider choice for the breakfast menu and more reasonable prices
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect for the piers and beaches. Easy to catch the cable cars a good place for a relaxing break.

review.title: This is it!
review.reviewText: I spent way too much time looking for a hotel for my first visit to SF and Im so glad I decided to stay at the Argonaut. Every single aspect of this place is carefully designed to satisfy guests (both human and canine!). The hotel just has a lot of personality and hipness to it, without leaving great service and hotel basics behind. The rooms are super clean and comfortable, the location is unbeatable (for a tourist, a first timer in particular), the food at the Blue Mermaid is spectacular and the staff is knowledgeable and friendly. We didnt get a room with a bay view since we werent planning to be looking out the window too much but outside experiencing the city and it turned out to be a good idea as our room was quiet, away from the elevator and very spacious.  Treat yourself to a stay at the Argonaut, this place is amazing!
review.negativeRemarks: If I had to point out something to improve, perhaps the exhaust fan in the bathroom could work a bit better but thats it.
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars, Ghirardelli Square, Pier 39, F line... all just a few minutes from the hotel.

review.title: Wonderful at the Wharf
review.reviewText: Typically there is at least 1 amenity at any hotel stay that does not meet most peoples satisfaction. I can honestly say that this hotel meets every expectation that I anticipate when away from home. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to anyone thinking of staying in the Fisherman's Wharf area. The staff is excellent and very accommodating. It is also close to all the activities and sites we wanted to see.
Great near main locations near the warf, good gor nearby cable car

review.title: Great location. Loved the bed sheets.
review.reviewText: We would definitely stay again. My family enjoined the location because we were able to get to the local attractions easily.

It was wonderful went over Fourth of July in the center of everything will come back for sure!
Doormen very helpful at getting around town, security very good at this place...
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, friendly staff, clean rooms, great location!

review.title: Great hotel in the middle of all the action.
review.reviewText: You pay a little more for this hotel but it is worth it if you like to be within walking distance of all the San Francisco sights and activities.  We walked to the Cable car, Buena Vista Caf, Ghirardelli  square, Pier 39, Water taxi to Alcatraz, etc.  Can't beat this hotel for comfort and convenience.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking expense!
review.locationRemarks: Cable car, Buena Vista Caf, Ghirardelli  square, Pier 39, Water taxi to Alcatraz.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Nice place with perfect location ,... Loved the staff.  Andreas was great
review.negativeRemarks: Larger rooms
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf

review.title: Wonderful hotel close to Fishermen's Wharf
review.reviewText: From the decor in keeping with the area, the superb and friendly staff, and the close proximity to the  action, this hotel has it all.   We would definitely recommend the hotel to a friend or stay again if we are in the SF area.

review.title: Great location, Clean, Nice Staff
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 2 nights and it was a very nice trip. Hotel was clean. Staff were very courteous. Valet in the early morning was a bit of a problem. Took them 30 minutes to get the rental car. But other than that, it was an excellent stay. Would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a nice upscale hotel right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Wonderful location - but don't do full price
review.reviewText:
We had a pleasant stay. Excellent location - not only for walking, but the cable car is right around the corner (do not wait in the hour-long line if you want to hop on going to the city... walk up a few blocks and you will be able to get on right away.) 

The decor is cute, but some rooms are a little too narrow and feel like an upgraded Motel 6. You may encounter noise issues. If your window is facing the Beach Street, you will not enjoy having it open unless you like the sound of traffic. However, some  rooms above the quiet court yard offered a constant hum reminiscent of running water next door that did not go away the entire night. Potentially, you could find that sound soothing rather than irritating - but I prefer quiet.

Despite all my complaints, I would stay there again if I find a good discount. The vibe of the place is very pleasant, the staff is professional and the complimentary drinks at 5 pm in the lobby are a lovely touch. Do try the elderflower lemonade. Better yet - ask the server to mix it with the house-made watermelon sangria. Perfect start of an evening!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, location and the free drinks. And the decor is sweet. And the street windows can open - which is pretty great.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the vent system - or whatever it is that produces the annoying humming noise.
review.locationRemarks: Park the car and forget about it. Buy the public transportation  pass and hop on the cable car. And walk. As much as you can. Explore.

review.reviewText: It was our first time in San Fransisco. You really can't beat the location. We were close to everything and all kinds of mass transit. We had a problem with our toilet but it was fixed immediately. The concierge was very helpful. We had a wonderful vacation.

review.title: Fabulous experience
review.reviewText: The only way to describe this hotel is fabulous. We were made welcome from the moment we arrived. The rooms are spacious and the decor excellent. Location could not be better, worth every penny.
review.negativeRemarks: The piped music in the communal areas, please try some light classical or lounge orchestral music.
review.locationRemarks: Location excellent, everything close by.

review.title: Lovely hotel, the rooms are perfect.
review.reviewText: Room is very clean, beds are perfect, staff friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, staff was friendly and very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of hallways.  There were room service trays in the hallway overnight, carpeting did not appear to be clean and random trash on the floors.

review.title: Great location, fantastic service from all staff!
review.reviewText: This was probably one of the best hotels I've stayed at so far- great location, fantastic service from everyone and Brooke the concierge was unbelievably knowledgable and helpful with all our enquiries! The only downfall is that the walls are not soundproofed well so there were times that could be a little bit noisy.However, that did not negatively impact on how we felt about the hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, friendly and helpful staff, beds were super comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Better sound proofing
review.locationRemarks: Location was right at the pier where all the shops and restaurants are. You can rent bikes to ride to and cross the Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Nice location to the piers
review.reviewText: Good stay, however valet is loot and takes awhile. The complimentary drinks are great and restaurant is in the hotel. We got a great deal on Expedia. They are dog friendly which was cool too.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Excellent service provided by all from the beginning to the end

review.title: Location, service, friendly
review.reviewText:
Concierge was wonderful with bike passes and food recommendations.  Front desk was very helpful getting things resolved whenever I had an issue - unlike the Hyatts I've stayed at before.

Loved the history of the hotel and the ease of getting to everything  you'd want to see in SF,  from a tourists point if view.

A bit price but I feel a great value!

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at the Argonaut Hotel and had a very positive experience.  All of the staff were very helpful and friendly.  It was very convenient to have a restaurant in the hotel also.  The rooms were spacious and bright and the bathroom was very clean.  A big hit was the complimentary wine and beer from 5 - 6 pm. every night.  We did not attend many of these, but they were very popular.  The lobby was very inviting and had a lot of room to sit and visit if you wished.  We would definitely stay here again as the location was perfect.  A lot of the city tours had a starting point just down the block from the hotel.  We also were able to walk to a lot of the local attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: We really liked the location of the hotel.  We were within walking distance to a lot of attractions.  We also enjoyed the happy hour from 5 - 6 pm.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice to have an area where you could get some complimentary tea or coffee.  We really appreciated the large fresh water that was available
review.locationRemarks: The location was super and we found that the crowd wasn't as congested as we were at the end of the pier.  It was easy to catch local transport also.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with friendly staff
review.reviewText: Nice hotel - convenient location. Happy hour was a nice touch as it allowed guests who wanted to meet other travelers to do so.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient access to tourist attractions while not being in the center of it all
review.locationRemarks: When exiting the hotel turn left and walk along the waterfront which has a grassy area for kids to run around on as well as access to a "beach."

review.title: Perfect location on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This boutique hotel was lovely and fun nautical themed but not in a tacky way. The staff were all helpful and pleasant. The location of this hotel is the main drawcard as it is so close to all the activity in the wharf area (but not noisy!).
review.positiveRemarks: Nautical theme, close proximity to activity in wharf area.
review.negativeRemarks: Consistency in staff demeanour and service. Most staff were lovely - a couple were a bit stand offish in their willingness to help.

review.reviewText: Location location location. Perfect spot in the city. Staff was awesome and very accommodating. Will definitely return!

review.title: Great location for Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Disappointing view from my room on arrival and I was moved without fuss the next day. Near everything in Fisherman's Wharf including the cable cars (trams). Staff very friendly and efficient.

review.title: Lovely location and hotel
review.reviewText: My room was changed because I felt very claustrophobic in the first room. Wonderful change. Appreciate very much.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Room 421 , view of other rooms/air conditioning units. Room could have used a deeper clean, but overall would stay there again. Location is excellent, next to gharadelli, across from bay, Hyde and Powell around corner etc.. Did not rent a car, worked out great. Must do is get the free bike rental from hotel from blazing saddles and ride across Golden Gate Bridge to Saulsilito , one of our favorite parts. But beware , Blazing Saddle company puts a $400 dollar hold on whatever credit card you use to get the bikes for incidentals, and that money was taken out if my account for 2 days(not a true hold). Other than that awesome trip, good size room for 2 adults, 2kids. Quiet and convenient. Oh and there is a Starbucks behind hotel ;)
good location.  a bit expensive to have to add parking as well.
Perfect location and warm inviting rooms!!! Just wanted a one night getaway and this hotel was perfect!!!

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Excellent stay. Great location.  Walking easy to everything

review.title: Great hotel close to attractions
review.reviewText:
Great place to stay down by the peir!
Fantastic happy hour daily in the lobby!

review.title: Great hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Best hotel I have ever been to, and I have been to quite a few. The staff were extremely friendly,  helpful and knowledgeable. The atmosphere was also very comfortable. Very relaxed and homey feel to it. Best experience ever! The wine hour created a nice social experience to mingle and meet other guests which also created new friendships. Very nice idea.
review.positiveRemarks: Small gestures like the apples, water were a nice touch. As well as the variety of newspapers.The house coats and yoga mat.
review.negativeRemarks: Thought it was perfect in every way.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's wharf, Lots of restaurants and shopping. Close to cable car station, Ghiardelli square, Pier 39. Crooked Street.

review.title: Nice by Fishmans wharf
review.reviewText: Clean hotel. Room design not the most practical but for a day or two fine.

review.title: Fantastic location for exploring San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Great room, fantastic staff and superb location.  We had stayed here before and weren't disappointed.  Loads of walkable restaurants in the area and Pier 33 for Alcatraz was a 15 minute walk.
The only negative was the cost of parking.  For a small car it was $50 per night and a larger vehicle cost $61per night, both plus tax.

review.title: Hotel staff goes the extra mile
review.reviewText: Had a great four night stay. The staff are among the most hospitable and helpful at any hotel we have ever stayed. Nice wine, beer and sangria reception every evening.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff......thank you in particular to Stephen.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near all the activities of Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Beautiful and comfortable hotel. Location is perfect for exploring the city. Beds were very comfortable but not a lot of room to unpack clothes. Staff is very friendly and answered questions as needed. Glad we paid a little more for bay view even tho was off to side of building.

review.title: Right in the centre of Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
The Argonaut Hotel was a last minute booking due to a mishap at another place we were booked in and I must say: this was a very pleasant hotel with excellent staff.

Argonaut has many hidden surprises which make staying there a joy. Wine hour in the hotel lobby where complimentary beer, wine and sangria is served; all of the comforts you can imagine in room for a 4 star hotel including all of the things you may have forgotten to pack including international outlet adapters and the historical charm of the building itself.

The staff at the hotel were absolutely superb from checkin to the bellboy and everybody else.

Finally, the decorating of this hotel is unique. Rooms are charming with a loft feeling and comfortable furniture.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, sangria, room and the convenient location.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, historic streetcar line, tour bus stop, golden gate, etc.

review.reviewText: The hotel needs to be remodeled, the rugs seem very used.  The trays from room service can last up to 24 hrs outside a room.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with friendly staff
review.reviewText: Great location, incredibly accommodating staff, very clean rooms. If you forget anything including dental floss, they will bring it up to your room! The only qualm is that a lot of rooms (including mine) face a concrete courtyard that has other room windows very close across mine so we had to keep the shutters closed for privacy.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: My wife said it was the best hotel I ever booked. Great location, classic design with brick walls and original cannery beams. Inside room was very quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: Great touch with the cocktail hour for guests
review.locationRemarks: It's where the action is.  Walking distance to all Fisherman's Wharf attractions.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Great Location...Fast Service! 
Pricey, but worth it if you come to San Fran without a car.

Wine Reception daily 5-6pm
Clean Hotel...View from the rooms nice in some...rest of the rooms overlook a roof!

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Whatf
review.reviewText: Great place to stay . Overall highly rated . Wine time from 5-6 every afternoon a huge hit with everyone . Great fireplace in lobby
Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff, very clean and tasteful rooms

review.title: Good hotel near Fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Well located for tours and seeing sites. Room was on the small side but adequate.

review.title: no
review.reviewText: this is the second time at this hotel the first time was great the second time not so, first the shower we had to put a q-tip in the handle so it did not more ,and if you didn't the handle moved and you get burned. I had to call for coffee that they did not replace when they clean the room, the romote control did not work had to call to replace that, and that they did have signs about water use like wash your sheets and towels every other day that was a big surpise.

review.title: Very central for Fishermans wharf area
review.reviewText: Fast check in, room good, busy area of San Francisco, Hotel met all our needs
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing, walls very thin.
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do nearby, restaurants, etc

review.title: Free wine and beer!
review.reviewText: Every evening at 5pm wine  and beer in relaxed lounge. With wifi for the kids! Great atmosphere and couldn't recommend more highly.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Great location by the Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This was a short memorial weekend vacation for my family and we enjoyed staying at Argonaut Hotel.  The location of this hotel could not be better. All of the best of Fisherman's Wharf was right outside our hotel room.  Parking was additional $57.00 with tax.  A small bottle of water in the room cost $3.00 which considering we had already spent quite a bit was annoying.  Providing a couple of bottled water would have been a nice gesture and would not have cost the hotel much. It was clean and the room service was quick and excellent.  Overall, we were pleased with our stay and would recommend it to other travelers.

review.title: Did have to change our room to get a better view
review.reviewText: Change of room was no problem.  Great  location on the warf

review.title: Good hotel if you want to be on Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Our stay at The Argonaut was pleasant overall.  One thing I will say, however, is that the walls appear to be quite thin, as you can hear your neighbors quite easily.  Otherwise, the hotel is nice and the staff is very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Ventilation fan in bathroom is definitely one thing that should be added.  Nothing to do about the thin walls unless completely renovated.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is cool for a day, but very crowded on weekends.  The rest of the city is pretty amazing.

review.title: Excellent location, close to pier, good food
review.reviewText: Everything about this stay was excellent! The location, the food , rooms were awesome, Kimpton hotels are the best!

review.title: Great Hotel, great staff.
review.reviewText: Highly recommend this hotel.  The staff is wonderful.  A special thanks to Chloe, the concierge.  She was wonderful and very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, great staff and facilities.  Overall, very happy with the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: At Fisherman's Wharf so it is near many activities/restaurants in San Francisco.

review.title: Best Location
review.reviewText: Our second trip to San Francisco. We were able to see more of the city because the location of the hotel, enabled us to get on the hop on hop off buses. These buses, originated a block away from the hotel and when we wanted to go out to dinner, there were many restaurants nearby. We came to Fishermen's Wharf by cruise ship and left the same way. Yes the hotel cost more than we normally spend but, overall, it was a great experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: Great location and close to everything on the Wharf.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Easy access to fishermans wharf. Nice friendly staff.
Good hotel bit overpriced but maybe this is what San Fransisco is like

review.title: Lovely!
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Argonaut for 4 nights. The staff was warm and friendly, knowledgeable about the area and what to do and see. 
The room was lovely, although smallish and the view was of the courtyard. A very expensive court yard view! I would say, having travelled to many, many locations in and out of the US, that for the total experience, it was an over priced hotel. 
We LOVE San Fransisco and all of the quirkiness that goes with it!

review.title: We'll be back !!!
review.reviewText: What a lovely hotel. The location was perfect, right across the street from the bay, and 1/2 a block from the trolley car turn around.  We booked through Expedia, and were pleasantly surprised to see a lovely, handwritten note, a bottle of red wine, glasses and a souvenir bottle opener when we arrived in the room. I expect these perks when you book directly from the hotel.  The 5pm nightly, free, happy hour was a wonderful perk.  All you can drink red and white wines as well as an assortment of craft, artisan and local beers to choose from.  Our ONLY complaint is the $50.00 a night parking, considering the room prices, this fee could be lowered. This was excessive !!!  We will stay here again.  We won't stay anywhere else but the Argonaut... Katia & Lester.

review.title: Fantastic location at Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Boutique Hotel lived up to all its promises.  Best location; easy access to everything San Francisco offers.  Close enough to city but surprisingly quiet.  Staff were helpful and diligent -very welcoming.

review.title: Tremendous. Close to everything on the waterfront.
review.reviewText: We took three days at the last minute to go to San Francisco. We found a great flight/hotel package on Wednesday afternoon and were on the plane the next morning. Everything was great and we appreciate it.

beautiful hotel
excellent location
wonderful helpful staff

Beautiful character hotel!!!  Had a Great stay!
Ideal place to stay if visiting Fishermans wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: Soooo unique!!! The brick walls give it such character! Beautiful

review.title: Great hotel in an excellent location
review.reviewText: San Francisco is one of my favourite cities in the entire world. I love the weather, the people and the activities. It is a city that can be enjoyed by people from all walks of life.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of good restaurants, gift shops and tours of all kinds (including boat tours). The hotel is also walking distance from the famous Pier 39.

review.title: Great location , very nice staff
review.reviewText:
Great location
Staff where very helpfull anf trustworthy
Rooms where comfortable

review.title: Great Location, small rooms
review.reviewText: Overall good experience, all of the interior facing units have a terrible view of each other's windows and the roof of the ground floor, so make sure you request an exterior unit with a view of the street. My room was nice but very small.  Expensive Valet at $50 per night!!!

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText:
Located on main strip, near Trolley stop and Ghiradelli Square.  Also not very far from Lombard Street and Little Italy.

Wine tastings in the afternoon and friendly staff.

review.title: Center of Everything
review.reviewText: Great location, can see just about everything San Francisco has to offer in walking distance from this hotel. Decorated in an amazing oceanic/shipwreck rooms this hotel not only had great staff but there was much comfort felt in the bed alone, I swear those beds are by far the best I've ever experienced! Definitely recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a nice small getaway! Definitely great for couples!
review.negativeRemarks: More selection to the mini-bar.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, Ghirardelli Chocolate Factory, The San Francisco Dungeon, Boarding for Alcatraz, Aquarium at the Bay, Crab House on Pier 39, etc

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: A perfect spot to call home with fabulous customer service - loved it and would highly recommend!  The photos on the website don't do this treasure any justice.  It's got a fabulous vibe and the location couldn't be more perfect.  Well done to all the staff for excellent service.

review.title: Great hotel on Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Concierge was excellent. Staff always willing to assist. Excellent location to everything!!

review.title: San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText:
Great location by fisherman's wharf
Handy for cable cars/restaurants/shops etc
Helpful staff
Parking not so easy nearby unless you opt for valet parking
review.negativeRemarks:
Air con units bit noisey in rooms
Showers could be better
review.locationRemarks:
Cable cars
Pier 39 sea lions etc
Easy cycle to Golden gate bridge

review.title: Location location location
review.reviewText: Near everything!  Seafood, tourist sights and transportation

review.title: They love dogs
review.reviewText: This is one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had. The first bonus is that they are dog friendly and don't charge extra for it. They are close to the bay and parks so we could take our dog out for walks. The location is touristy but that's not a bad thing. The rooms were eclectic and large. The decorations and brick walls are great. We enjoyed the wine reception.
review.positiveRemarks: dog friendly, free wifi for Kimptom members, friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: it's perfect!
review.locationRemarks: It's near everything for sight seeing, eating and enjoying parks and the bay.

review.title: Right where the action is
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very close to the ocean and right where the action is.  The hotel is very comfortable and familiar.   I just wish the bathrooms were bigger.  

They do have EV charging which is a huge plus!

review.title: good location. Not convinced room was super clean.
review.reviewText: Just at the end of Fishermans wharf and a close walk to Presidio area. Overall I liked it. Well situated without being right in the thick of it. Plus I'm a huge Kimpton fan. When we checked in, sink was full of black stuff which staff did come and clean. Staff wasn't quite sure what it was, maybe a clogged sink that was fixed but not cleaned. Coffee mugs had lint in them too, which added to the sense of cleanliness unease.

review.title: Lovely hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: We have just returned from The Argonaut and cannot fault it (apart from a kettle in the room would have been nice , us Brits like our cups of tea ) .  Great location right on fisherman's wharf .  We were offered an upgrade to the fourth floor but had a double room on the second floor  for the first night, the room was lovely but had no view just looked out onto concrete and rooms opposite. The room on the fourth floor was larger with two beds and a view of the transamerica pyramid tower.   All the staff were friendly and helpful .  Glad we chose this hotel , would not hesitate to stay in a Kimpton again .
Friendly, comfortable, smaller property, pleasant change from the typical big brand hotels.

review.title: Can't Wait To Go Back!
review.reviewText: We weren't sure if we were going to stay in San Francisco until we arrived there.  We did some internet/phone searches while at a restaurant and were disappointed to find that we couldn't find a nice place close to the Wharf for less than $600 a night.  We pulled up to Argonaut Hotel and checked it out; it was a perfect location but I was sure it would be expensive.  It ended up being reasonable, especially going through Expedia.
review.positiveRemarks: Location!  We didn't have to break the bank to stay in the middle of the heart of San Francisco.  It was beautiful, and functional, and affordable.
review.negativeRemarks: A few of the less popular items in the mini bar were expired (ex.  Advil had been expired for a year), also the bed was very hard.
review.locationRemarks: Get dinner at McCormick and Schmidt's RIGHT at Sunset facing the water and get sundaes at Ghiradelli.

review.reviewText:
Friendly staff, awesome location.
Everything was as expected, few complimentary things were missing like toothpaste and toothbrush.
Even though, I would come back there!
Location very close to Fishermans Wharf and cable car, staff very helpful with arranging car hire, loved decor of hotel
Nice hotel in the Fisherman's Wharf area.  Check-In was very quick.

review.title: The ONLY place to stay in Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: This is the only historic and stylish hotel located in the heart of the craziness that is Fisherman's Wharf. We loved the wine reception and my kids loved the Wii in the lobby. We were concerned when we checked in that our room was located next to a courtyard filled with shops and restaurants at The Cannery, but it quieted right down at around 9 in the evening. The room was spacious and well appointed. The housekeeping was a bit hit and miss, but nothing serious. If you stay there, be sure to get ice cream at Normans -right around the corner and the nicest couple in San Francisco and get breakfast around the corner at the Waterfront Bakery - best price for a quick good breakfast in the area. Don't miss the visitor center in the front of the hotel. It is very well done and provides a lot of historical perspective on the area. We had a fantastic vacation and would highly recommend The Argonaut.
review.positiveRemarks: Great character, lovely staff - fantastic location.
review.negativeRemarks: We got stuck in the elevator for a bit and housekeeping overlooked an old red bull can in our room when we checked in.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf. There are a million things to do near by.

review.title: Return visit
review.reviewText: After 10 years the hotel looks the same - great location & staff was attentive. Rooms could have been fixed up a bit and the use of space was not smart - they needed more sitting areas - overall after all these years the hotel did not disappoint !

review.title: Quality hotel in central location
review.reviewText: We'll stay here again. We had quick access to Golden Gate Bridge, Alvatraz, Lombard St, Ghirardelli Sq, Cable cars, Piers, running and bike paths. Caught a bus up the street to China Town and a cable car to Union Square shopping. So glad we stayed at The Argonaut.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Our second stay at the Argonaut. Awesome nautical theme. Happy hour every day at 5 get there by 4:45 for a seat. Beds very comfortable. Some rooms, no view. Staff very friendly. Highly recommended.

review.title: Nice location on fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Great location for walking to all the great spots at Fishermans Wharf and other locations like Ghirardelli Square. It also was a great spot for tours to pick up and drop off. There was wine tasting in the hotel every day from 5:00 to 6:00.

review.title: Fire Alarm testing at 8:30AM, Give me a break.
review.reviewText: We checked in at 7pm. We reserved through Expedia. When we got there they told us Expedia should not have booked us since they no longer had 2 Queen beds. We waited as the receptionist tried to find something for us. She said we could get an upgrade to a King bed and sofa. Then something was available but wasn't showing available.  Someone went to check it physically.  Well, it wasn't ready but they gave it to us.The toiletries such as shampoo and conditioner were not full. I had to turn on heater since it was cold and we only had sheets with a thin duvet in between the sheets. It wasn't even buttoned up. The smoke alarm kept going off in the morning. My husband called the front desk and they said they were testing it. What hotel tests smoke alarms at 7 ish in the morning? Two pricey for that many hassles and no upgrade was given.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Hotel with character right at the end of Fishermans' Wharf.  Easy access to cable cars and street cars for a quick trip around to Market Street.
review.negativeRemarks: not a thing

review.reviewText: Room walls are thin. Could hear the crying baby  next door as if it were in our room.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the wharf
review.reviewText: very nice location, very clean, staff was very helpful
review.negativeRemarks: earlier breakfast at the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz was great; walking was perfect

review.reviewText: stayed for 2 days and had a great time, our first trip to San Francisco
review.positiveRemarks: Great hotel with good amenities and fabulous staff
review.negativeRemarks: an extra chair in the room

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Pros Hotel is in a great spot on fishermans warf.  Right behind it is a trolley station.  Lots to see and eat in that area. That is also the starting point from where you bike the bridge.  Ghirardelli square is a block away.  They have a wine tasting around 5 but that gets crowded fast.

Cons : parking is $50 dollars a day.  But that's how much it is in the whole city.  You are better off buying a city pass you can ride the buses and trolleys with it.  It's a very busy hotel.  Always crowded. Rooms are small nothing special about my stay.

review.title: Nice vacation
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean and service was great, only issue was pot smoke on neighbor next door. Air circulation was not great. Our room smelled of it and bathroom did not circulate as well. Very minor on a good hotel.

review.title: Average hotel
review.reviewText: Very disappointed with our stay here. Was looking for luxury but it just felt like any old busy, tacky, commercial hotel. Wish I had chosen a smaller boutique hotel as it was not worth the price.

review.title: San Francisco Jewel.
review.reviewText: This is how all hotels should be operated. Sure, being a boutique hotel lends a few quirks to the experience, but that's why you're staying in a place with character, not a bland, soulless chain.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. It's the only place we stay in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of room room service menu past 2200hrs, but no big deal. Plan accordingly. Probably shouldn't eat that late anyway!
review.locationRemarks: You're on the pier. Enough said! :-)

review.title: Nice clean hotel, allows access to everything
review.reviewText: We were able to ride cable cars, transfer to all other areas in a really easy way.
Great stay. We had 2 small dogs with us and they were warmly welcomed. The staff ensured that we were all well looked after.

review.title: Nice hotel close to beach and restaurants.
review.reviewText: The hotel employees are nice and helpful. The location is good for eating, sight seeing, bicycling. Everything except the comforter has some smell.
review.negativeRemarks: Add a sofa, clean the bedding stuff no smell.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, restaurants, beach walking, bicycling.

review.title: Good location for sight seeing
review.reviewText: Appreciated concierge help with transportation directions
Spent 4 nights at the Argonaut and even though the rooms are small (which is typical for the Wharf), it was an excellent experience. Friendly staff and a great location and facility.

review.title: Excellent location, Extremely friendly staff
review.reviewText: Everybody was super friendly!!  Location was amazing - walk to tons of shops, restaurants, bars, pier and more.  Fast and free Internet

review.title: Great location for sightseeing
review.reviewText: We stayed at the argonaut for 3 nights and could not have been happier. The building itself is beautiful, room was very spacious, and the lobby was a great area to relax in especially during the free cocktail hour with wine and local beer. The location is ideal for sightseeing. Walking distance of ferry building market, the Alcatraz ferry, ghirardelli square, Lombard street, coit tower, and the entrance of one of the famous cable cars. Fisherman's wharf area is very high volume/touristy but before noon each day it was actually quite peaceful. I highly recommend staying at the argonaut!

review.title: Staff helped surprise Husband & Sister
review.reviewText: I had mentioned to the staff that I had planned this trip to San Francisco to celebrate my husband's and sister's 50th birthday. They had a bottle of wine and a handwritten note in the hotel rooms, so nice. This hotel is close to the bay and numerous restaurants, and in walking distance to a load of activities. They offer a discount on most activities arranged through them and with their help..... we were so busy and had the best time.
review.positiveRemarks: Great service, yummy restaurant and free wine & beer happy hour! The rooms were a nice size and airy.
review.negativeRemarks: Hard to think of anything that could be improved, maybe an area to sunbath but there is sooo much else to do.
review.locationRemarks: Located so close to the Bay, loads of historical boats to see, near beach and Chocolate Factory. I love the location and recommend highly.,

review.reviewText:
Great location
Family friendly
Staff very accommodating

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: Great location, very friendly staff, nice fitness center, clean room, free wine at night, what's not to like?!

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, close to Fisherman's Wharf, excellent customer service.

review.title: Staff Does not Get more Welcoming than here
review.reviewText:
From the moment we stepped out of the cab, the staff could not have been friendlier or more welcoming (thank you Steve).  Everyone is incredibly friendly.

Rooms are great, roomy, and love the yoga mat in the closet.  The free wine and beer from 5-6:00 PM in the lobby is the perfect happy hour.  Location is completely fun.  Since my stay, whenever I mention that I was at a Kimpton Hotel, the reaction is yes, they are wonderful.  Really over the top.  I fully agree.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff first, then rooms, then yoga mat in room, then wine and beer in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: I personally don't like a sliding bathroom door.  I like to hang towels on the back of the door.  That's as big a complaint as I can come up with.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf - touristy but so what?  It is fun.  Excellent musicians play around the wharf.  Easy to get around.  Cable cars next door.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is situated in an interesting part of the City but the interior design is outdated and the amenities in the rooms can be nicer.
review.negativeRemarks: Interior design, Robes, more liquor variety

review.title: Great hotel by Fisherman's Wharf & Ghiradeli Squar
review.reviewText: I came to the hotel at 9:30 AM, expecting I'd have to check my back until check-in in the afternoon.  They told me that no room in the class I booked was available but gave me a free upgrade to a view room rather than making me wait!  What a nice touch, and representative of the service you expect from a hotel like this!
review.positiveRemarks: Attentive staff, clean decor, pet friendly
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradeli Square

review.title: One Time Experience
review.reviewText:
The only thing that was good about this hotel was the decorations/style (in my opinion, my mother hated it), and the view from the expensive room. Valet is 50 dollars!!! and you are pretty much obligated too unless you are taking a taxi. There is no pool or hot tub. 
If you like peace and quit then this is not the hotel for you, because people are out partying all night. At least on the Saturday night we stayed and according to other reviews I've read. But like I said the view of the bay made it almost worth it.

review.title: Best service I've ever had
review.reviewText: Great service, great rooms, very clean and the best location. Would definitely stay here again.
Outstanding, great location  will definitely be back

review.title: Really very nice
review.reviewText: The argonaut was vey pleasant. Staff v friendly and helpful. Location excellent. Buena vista cafe great for breakfast after walk along the water and amazing grounds of fort mason. Cable cars right up the hill. Piers and embarcadero right there. View was lovely. We did ask to be changed as first room's view was not as good.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe have comfy chairs by the view window. A bit awkward because only a view from one of the two queen beds. Traveling with friend, so...

review.title: For the extra price paid Hotel not worth it to me
review.reviewText: The rooms had no refrigerators ...No microwaves...I felt the rooms were out dated for the extra money spent the staff was ok not to helpful to tell you were things were in hotel and to tell about accommodations ....Since it was my first stay in this hotel ..It being a 4 star hotel... I excepted more since i travel a lot on business trips... I'd rather had stayed at a Hampton hotel or Marriott hotel wasn't wowed ....Parking and getting my vehicle was freezing out side while waiting for my vehicle even when i had texted 30 mins. prior .... rather stayed else where I won't stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be up dated ... Put in Refrig. for left overs and microwave to heat up left overs... put snacks in rooms
review.locationRemarks: Work in for business

review.title: OUR STAY FEB 20 TO 22ND
review.reviewText: THE BELL CAPTAIN STEVEN MADE OUR STAY EXCELLENT. HE IMMEDIATLY MADE US AND OUR THREE DOGS MAYA, ASH AND ZOE FEEL RIGHT AT HOME. AWESOME!
Amazing! Great staff...great room...wine reception feature is awesome! Will go back again for sure.

review.title: Good location. Comfy rooms. 2nd Floor = Ground lvl
review.reviewText:
Location of the hotel was right at the end of Fisherman's Wharf. Convenient if this is a place you plan to spend some time, but it does have a key drawback: nothing open after 9 or 10pm. 

Check in was efficient. Front desk and Bellmen were polite and friendly. 

Room was good. Comfy. Clean. Spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: More inviting bar/restaurant. Not only did it close early... but the lighting was way too bright!
review.locationRemarks: Right at the end of Fisherman's Wharf.

review.reviewText: We found all encounters with staff to be outstanding and they were very accommodating to seniors.

review.title: Staff
review.reviewText: The whole staff at the Hotel could not have been nicer and more accommodating to us.  At no expense to us, they stored our roof cargo unit. Room was very clean, comfortable and reasonably priced. Will definitely visit again.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, friendly, inviting and just an all around enjoyable stay.

review.title: Very nice hotel near the Embarcadero
review.reviewText: Hotel accommodations were good. Several gift cards ended up missing from my room
Very noisy , walls thin, all neighbors were noisy .  Other than that..stay was fine,staff great

review.title: Paying for the location, not the room
review.reviewText: The location is great and the staff friendly. My gripe is with the room being dated, one of the lamps broken, and one of the bathtowels stained.

review.title: Hotel very nice, great staff, extremely clean.
review.reviewText: Expedia has screwed up too much for me to work with them again.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit expensive
review.locationRemarks: Great location, can walk to everything we wanted to do.

review.title: Definitely not worth the price
review.reviewText: Ridiculously over priced room for what you get. The room was clean but it was really noisy, we were right next to a courtyard directly across from a Mexican restaurant that played music from 12PM to close. I would not recommend to anyone, can definitely find another hotel nearby for half of what we paid.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was not comfortable. I sat on it an it squeaked so loud so you can imagine how it was when laying down.
review.locationRemarks: You are near the piers and its a 35 minute walk along the boardwalk to the Ferry building.The boardwalk is a tourist trap though,wish I would've known

review.title: Really lovely Hotel with Great Staff
review.reviewText:
Spent 3 nights at this Fishermans Wharf hotel. Stayed in a room with separate bedroom and sitting room which was beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. Bathrooms are smallish but impeccable. Very nice touch to provide complimentary drinks every evening. All staff were very friendly and provided tremendous, professional service. 
Only minor negatives coffee maker is in the bathroom & no tea provided. Also, not fond of hotels that use those pump bottles for the soap & shampoo.

review.title: Lovely, central location
review.reviewText: Great time, great location. Only sad part was no laundry facilities.
wonderful location very pleasant staff - san Francisco is beautiful climate wonderful
review.positiveRemarks: cleanliness as well as great location
review.negativeRemarks: hot water supply
review.locationRemarks: many restaurants, shops and close to all tours busses and cable cars

review.title: Overall pretty good but...
review.reviewText: We took an extra room adjacent to the other and asked for a discount which we initially got but then at checkout they charged us full price pretexting that it was not mentioned in their record. The rest was good.

review.title: Awesome location
review.reviewText:
All the staff went above and beyond for us as soon as we arrived until we left.. 
Will definetly come back
Lovely hotel, great staff, not very many food options in hotel
Hotel staff was very accommodating, friendly and helpful. Great location

review.title: Excellent hotel in fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Great place to stay right in the heart of Fishermans wharf. They have free bike rentals so make sure you take advantage of that. Rode across the Golden Gate Bridge and took the ferry back from Sausalito. Lots of great shopping and restaurants near by.

review.title: PERFECT LOCATION
review.reviewText:
My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights. Our room was on the 4th floor with a bay view. We had an uninterrupted view of Alcatraz Island directly to our front as well as a side view of the Golden Gate Bridge off to our left. Room was excellent with a very comfortable mattress and feather pillows. All the basics are there in line with a hotel of this category. The staff were all extremely friendly and welcoming.
We found the location perfect. It is to one end of Fisherman's Wharf so away from all the intense touristy bits but still only a 10 minutes walk to Pier 39 (the official wharf) and a 15 minute walk to Pier 33 for Alcatraz. Lots and lots and lots of eating places within minutes of the hotel!!
Transport links were excellent with the Powell-Hyde Cable Car end-station a 2 minute walk away and the F Line trams about a 3 minute walk in the other direction. Several tour bus companies have their start points near the hotel.
This was our first trip to San Francisco and the hotel was absolutely perfect for our tourist needs. I would certainly stay there again and I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel unreservedly.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, welcoming atmosphere, great location, quality of the room.

review.title: "Deluxe" Room, My Foot.
review.reviewText:
I booked this hotel for a combination of location and luxury; the latter quality I assumed based on how the nightly rate for a deluxe king room compared to other hotels (e.g. the Ritz-Carlton) and a review of room pictures and descriptions on both Expedia and the hotel's own website. As it turned out, the location was the only part of that combination that was fulfilled. While .500 would be great in baseball, it's horrible for a hotel, particularly at the room rate they charged. 
To summarize, the hotel should be ashamed that any room on street level, with forgettable amenities and a window subject to the noise and prying eyes of passers-by at all hours of the night, would be labeled "deluxe". The location is ideal for the major tourist attractions of the SF waterfront...but based on the disparity between the room rate/description and what you actually get, it's worth looking into other hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: Truth in advertising (see above).
review.locationRemarks: Just East of: Ghiradelli Square, end of Powell-Hyde cable car line. Just West of: Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Right next to the pier!
review.reviewText: Loved the location of this hotel, walking distance to tons of restaurants and shops, across the street from the bay

review.title: not a great bathroom
review.reviewText: The hotel and the room were very nice. I loved the location too (close to the pier, loads of touristy stuff around). However, for an expensive hotel like this, you do expect a a decent shower. There was no tub nor any decent tile around the shower. The drain was also barely functional. I checked in late and was too tired to ask them to move me to another room so can't say if other bathrooms were like this.
review.negativeRemarks: BATHROOOM!

review.title: Simply terrific
review.reviewText:
My wife remarked to me on our airplane ride home that she already missed our hotel room at the Argonaut Hotel. 
We were in town to site see The Golden Gate Bridge, tour Alcatraz and run in a 5K race. The location for our stay was perfect for all we wanted to do.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to almost everything we did during our 4-day stay. Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate Bridge... simply wonderful!

review.reviewText: Beautiful, clean, comfortable hotel in a great location.

review.title: Great Hotel in the heart of Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: I recently stayed at the Argonaugt on a one night trip to San Fran. From my arrival at 5:45pm, the welcoming hotel staff made check in a breeze. While I arrived at the tail end of the Wine/Beer/Hot Toddy Reception, the staff recommended getting a quick drink to take up with us to the room and also provided vouchers for a free beverage in the beautiful restaurant in the hotel's property. The hotel also can provide any provision you may have left behind. Great hotel, great location, great staff!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything from the complementary reception to the service staff! Amazing hotel that provides the best service!
review.negativeRemarks: Only recommendation is to possibly look at having key card front door openers for after hours. Staff is on top of opening though.
review.locationRemarks: There is so much to do nearby you cannot list all here. This hotel is in a PRIME location. Near everything including Union Square!

review.title: Attention to Detail great hotel!
review.reviewText: Very attentive staff.  Hotel recently refurbished.  Great location - highly recommended.
It was by the wharf , so you could walk back. & forth .  The room was quiet couldn't hear noise from outside . Loved the history museum .

review.title: Always GREAT
review.reviewText: It is just the best location. The staff can makes thing VERY easy if you just ask....parking......extra drinks.....food comps.....upgrade your room.....plan your day trip.

review.title: Nice hotel with good location for Fisherman's Whar
review.reviewText:
We stayed over Christmas so an extremely busy period, the restaurant staff seemed to be under a lot of pressure and service was not as good as it could have been.  
We enjoyed our stay.  The restaurant across the road from the hotel which we only discovered on the last night, was excellent.

review.title: A great stay
