review.reviewText: Stayed at the Argonaut for two nights with my wife and two kids in a double queen bed room. Spacious rooms and well appointed, comfy beds. Enjoyed the Happy Hour as I always enjoy free stuff! Discussed hiring bikes to ride over the Golden Gate and were pleased to discover Argonaut has an arrangement with Blazing Saddles rentals; ended up with two solos and a tandem for the day absolutely free, can't beat that. The location is good with plenty to see, do and eat in close walking distance, but Fishermans Wharf is a very touristy area.
review.locationRemarks: Bike the Bridge - what a fantastic and fun way to see SF

review.title: Perfect location for San Fransisco
review.reviewText:
I had stayed at a Kimpton Hotel in Miami so I already knew this hotel would be great.  It did not disappoint.
I loved the nautical theme of the hotel as soon as you walk through the front doors.

Our room was a King room and although we did not have an Ocean view we were still very happy with the room.

The ammenities were great, the bed was very comfortable, although I did not like the pillows.. Too soft but that's not a deal breaker for this hotel.

The staff were great and very helpful.

Be mindful though that they take $400 bond, so just be aware that you have plenty of funds for this.  

The hotel is a little ways from Pier 39 but made for a really nice walk ... About 10 mins or longer if you stop and look at all the shops on the way.  It's a quiet area.. Next door is a great little bar for drinks and making new friends at the end of a long day.

The hotel is also pet friendly, but super clean.

I would definatley stay here again if I were in San Francisco ..
review.positiveRemarks: The nautical style, it was an character building furnished beautifully.
review.locationRemarks: About a 10 min walk to Pier 39, close to the hop on hop off bus.  Pier 33 where you go to Alcatraz is about a half hour brisk walk.

review.title: Fabulous Hotel
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel, great and helpful service, fabulous location - would highly recommend and the view of Alcatraz from our window every day was so special. Room very large, Blue Mermaid excellent for breakfast and dinner.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz, Bay cruises, street cars, Fishermans wharf

review.title: Nice place for fisherman wharf
review.reviewText: Easy to walk around along the beach, close to a lot of tour spots, such as fisherman wharf and Alcatraz prison. if you rent a car, remember only valet parking available and it is $50 bucks per day, you can find other parking garages 1 or 2 blocks away from hotel with $36 per day. overall, we will give 4 stars, because we think the staff there were not really helping if you have any questions/issues, for example, if you ask them how could we get on a tour for Alcatraz prison, they will answer why the tour was booked without providing solutions, what we want to hear is if it is still possible to catch another tour or there is no way but we have to wait another day, something like that. we don't need redundant explaining how many visitors visit this season hotel was clean and quiet, we like it.

review.title: Great hotel in a convenient location.
review.reviewText: This hotel is beautiful, with a knowledgeable and friendly staff. Right on Fisherman's Wharf, is a place my family fully intend to return to. It's quaint and beautiful yet sophisticated. I cannot recommend it enough

review.title: Fabulous location
review.reviewText: First stay in San Francisco and very happy with hotel, location etc and would recommend to anyone.
review.locationRemarks: Central Fishermans Wharf so fab location and easy to get to anywhere in San Francisco you wish to visit.

review.title: Good location and comfortable room
review.reviewText: A colourful location as a jumping off point for tours around the city and bay. More a daytime venue than a night one. We had trouble finding a place to get a drink and light meal when we checked in at 10:00. The hotel itself was quite comfortable, clean, and well equipped. There was one oddity: the custom-built bed frames creak loudly. Otherwise, a reasonable value for money.

review.title: Probably my new favorite hotel.....
review.reviewText: Great location. I've always wanted to stay here and now I'm glad I did. Was able to check in early which was awesome. I was upgraded for free which is very awesome. Great staff!  The rooms are really cool. Love the brick look. Would totally stay here again. Can't wait till next time.
Excellent hotel, service and location... perfetc for all
Boutique hotel in a convenient location. Just across the street from one of the trolley car rides to Union Square.
review.locationRemarks: Bridge walk, rent bikes and ride the Embarcadero, Exploratorium at night on first Thursday of the month adults only after 6:00 pm.

review.title: very nice location, calm atmosphere
review.reviewText: Very courteous staff, nice bar/restaurant, very convenient to everything, but quieter than the center of fisherman's wharf where it is very commercial.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants very close by.

review.title: we had a wonderful time, the staff were polite
review.reviewText: we enjoyed our trip would do it again  lots to see and do  must see the sea lions try china town hop on the bus to union square see all the shops.
review.positiveRemarks: clean friendly staff central to everything
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: bus stops cable car bikes shops restaurants good all round access to everything

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: It has a nice decor, the staff is pleasant and its location is great! If i were to go back to San Francisco, I would definitely stay there.

review.title: best hotel on fishermans wharf
review.reviewText:
We have stayed there numerous times and always recommend it.  Excellent staff and location - from the door man to the manager - everyone is friendly and professional.  Rooms are large and comfortable.  Bed is a bit hard - could use a foam topper - but pillows are soft.  Parking is very expensive but the staff are efficient. Great location to walk to restaurants, trolley, attractions or just sit and watch the Golden gate and bay.  Love the Argonaut!

Skip the restaurant - food is blah. Go to Buena Vista Cafe instead!

review.title: Great location at the begining of Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Very accomadating staff, general good feel ambience. Prime location but quiet enough to get away from the populus.

review.title: Right on wharf
review.reviewText:
Close to trolley, ghiardelli and the wharf. 
Wine hour is a good gathering place to meet people and some of their pets.
review.positiveRemarks: Love that it is a dog friendly hotel
review.negativeRemarks: The concierge was not there whenever we were looking to ask questions.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Great choice. Shops, restaurants, embarcadero, tram.

review.title: Friendly people, great location
review.reviewText: Had a great time.  Loved seeing the dogs staying there too - have it a little extra

review.title: Excellent hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We loved staying at The Argonaut!  It was so close to everything, especially Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and the cable cars.  There's so much to do nearby.  We borrowed the bikes and rode across Golden Gate Bridge, a definite highlight!  The wine hour was wonderful & we met so many other travellers.
review.positiveRemarks: Great view of Alcatraz from our room.  Very friendly & helpful staff.  Loved wine hour.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Centre of Fisherman's Wharf.  Close to Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square, Alcatraz ferry & Hyde Street cable car terminal.

review.title: fine
review.reviewText: it was fine, but i felt a little ignored by staff when i requested items or help, and hassled by them when i had asked for nothing/was in bed asleep.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We were in the area for a few dahs for a birthday and was very happy with location of the hotel. Everything was there. We didn't have to rent a car. Jump on cable cars and you are in the center of everything. The doorman were entertaining and full of info. Will visit again soon.

review.title: Excellent hotel in the heart of Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
Excellent experience, the staff were very helpful.
The hotel is situated in the heart of Fishermans Wharf which has lots of atmosphere and only a few stops on a cable car to Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Staying in this hotel was brilliant and not like a chain hotel, it had atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location to Fishermans Wharf, ferry to Alcatraz and other islands as well as bus tours to the golden gate.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Had an awesome night at the argonaut. Easy check in and valet service. The room was nice and clean plus I had a complimentary robe! Stylish

review.title: Historic hotel on the wharf !
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel on the wharf , steps away from all activities. Hotel is beautiful. Rooms are well appointed , newly remodeled and very clean. Staff is very friendly and knowledgable . Special thanks to Brooke, concierge . Brooke knows her city and was spot on with restaurants and sights to see. She set up all reservations for us , efficiently and with a smile every time !
Maritime restaurant had good service and very good food.. However the booths and tables could use a make over.
Room service was done very well for morning coffee.
The Happy hour from 5-6 is a must, the whiskey hot totty was delicious and was a perfect Holiday drink.
Front staff and Valets were all friendly.everyone on staff made sure we had a great time.
review.negativeRemarks: Only complaint, not enough light in hotel rooms. And can hear guests in adjoining rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Location perfect, the wharf, Lombard street, trolley ,Alcatraz ferry..all within walking distance. Cabs were easy to obtain and friendly if needed

review.title: Great Fisherman's Wharf Location
review.reviewText:
We stayed here over a weekend right before Christmas and were pleased with the hotel. The location is right on Fisherman's Wharf within easy walking distance to lots of shops and restaurants. The walk to Pier 33 for Alcatraz was a little farther than we expected, but still okay (took about 20 minutes). If you're not in great shape, consider getting a cab to Pier 33 because you will have enough walking at Alcatraz.

The room was nice, although I thought the bed would be softer for the hotel price-point. It was very hard and lumpy. Valet is expensive ($50 per night...but it is San Francisco, so that is to be expected). Staff were very nice and accomodating. The room was well-stocked with munchies, drinks, robes, umbrellas, etc. Overall, a very nice place to stay right on Fisherman's Wharf.

Be sure to buy your Alcatraz tickets FAR in advance! They really do sell out months in advance! Also, if you are going for a Christmas trip, the city really doesn't go all out for Christmas. Very few buildings were decorated. Union Square had an ice rink and tree, but the crowds were INSANE! It really wasn't what I expected from a Christmas trip.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the hotel staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 had a lot of cute shops (not so touristy as the rest of the Wharf) and restaurants. We also liked the food at the Pub BBQ at Ghiradelli Square

review.title: Argonaut hotel san francisco
review.reviewText: We bkd a bay view king room. We were on floor 2 we had a good view of alcatrz. Room was small but excellent. Hindsight we should have asked for the top floor for a higher view but a lovely stay. The blue mermaid bar and restaurant staff was excellent.

review.title: I will return
review.reviewText: Our stay was wonderful.  Perfect location, helpful and friendly staff, & comfortable room.
review.locationRemarks: From this location it's easy to explore fishermans wharf on down to pier 39.  Everything else is a short taxi ride away.  Great location.

review.title: Good location in Fishermens Wharf. Quiet but close
review.reviewText: Good location - a couple of blocks from cable car routes and Maritime Museum. Very friendly staff, let down a little by chaotic service at breakfast.

review.title: Character and 4 stars
review.reviewText: Nice comfortable room that doesn't look like every other hotel. Pleasant professional staff especially the doormen and the concierge (she was great). Clean room, nice amenities.  Warm and inviting.  Room service could be improved a notch.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the character of the room. And that it is 4 stars.  Nice wine reception. Gracious staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the warf. Walking distance to cable cars, crooked street, ferry to Alcatraz and more.

review.title: Unique Hotel
review.reviewText: This was my first stay at the Argonaut. I loved the decor- unique, nautical theme. Clean and comfortable rooms.  All the staff were accommodating and friendly. Our car battery died and the valet jumped it for us. Parking is expensive so we moved our car after the first night to a garage close by. We never were able to take advantage of the wine reception because of the time it is offered. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Wonder location, great people!!!! Will certainly stay here again.

review.title: San Francisco stopover.
review.reviewText: Great hotel at far end of Fisherman's Wharf. Close to everything but far enough away from Pier 39.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff service and friendliness. Comfortable bed and space in room.
review.negativeRemarks: Better grade toilet paper
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf', hop on hop off buses, street cars

review.title: Amazing Experience
review.reviewText: Our first time in San Francisco, the staff was very friendly from the door man to the conceirage.  They went the extra steps regarding our stay and truly made a memorable experience for us.
review.positiveRemarks: The Location, the ambiance and decor.  They had a free wine tasting each night and all staff very involved.
review.negativeRemarks: Hottub and free wi-fii for everyone not just kimptom card holders.
review.locationRemarks: On Fishermans wharf, next to the cable cars, Gharadelli square, across from the Golden Gate bridge, Alcatraz, The dungeon and wax museum.

review.title: Good position at the far end of Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Beds comfortable, room quiet and clean, location convenient. Wine reception in the evening was a novel idea.  Would have been more interesting to serve Californian wines instead of Italian.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning is a little reminiscent of an aircraft engine droning in the background
review.locationRemarks: Top end of Fishermans Wharf. Lots of restaurants nearby.

review.title: Thanksgiving family holiday worked out beautifully
review.reviewText: Location of the hotel is perfect--ambience and environs were ideal for first and second time visitors to San Francisco. We rented a car but used only twice, no need with great transportation options in the Fisherman's Wharf area. Tours to Napa/Sonoma wine area also terrific and pick up from Argonaut convenient. Hotel staff were all warm and friendly and responded to our needs quickly.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, size of room--very spacious, gym facility, dcor.
review.negativeRemarks: More variety of food items in restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Take the old cable car to Union Square; run to Golden Gate bridge form the shoreline; go to Ghirdarelli Square for chocolate. Walk and enjoy!

review.reviewText: Overall good experience. Had a room that was eye level with the sidewalk outside and requested to be moved higher since this didnt allow for privacy and Federico made it happen without any objection. Hotel was good and staff was better. I actually tried to stay another night, but they were completely booked.

review.title: Convenient location - Excellent staff
review.reviewText:
The Argonaut was the perfect location for our stay in San Francisco. The valet parking service made everything easier. The staff at the entrance, Doorman and Valet parking attendant, were helpful and friendly. I felt as though they were inviting me into their own home.
The atmosphere was welcoming and easy to navigate. The rooms were clean, the bathroom large and spacious.
Over all it was a great stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The desk personnel were helpful and friendly. The restaurant was convenient and their food was very good.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing that I would like to see would be a sign for directions to the elevator.
review.locationRemarks: There were so many things to do in the immediate are and many small locally owned businesses to shop from.

review.title: Great location and staff; spacious rooms
review.reviewText: Enjoy the facilities. Easy walk to Marina and Crissy Field. Wine at 5-6 each evening a lovely bonus.

review.title: Great experience. On a great place.
review.reviewText:
Can't say enough about the staff at this hotel. Made you feel
Really welcome and had great attitudes. Facilities were top notch and very comfortable. Within walking distance to great restaurants and sights. Would come back gladly.

review.title: As usual this hotel was amazing!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel and setting is amazing!! The proximity to everything is fantastic!! The concierge was less than impressive. She booked a trip for us on a day we never discussed and we waited for a bus that never showed on the day we scheduled to go!! Our bad I guess we needed to double check the paid for in advance schedule we signed (didn't think I needed to)!! Other than that it was an amazing stay! I will always stay at kimpton Hotels!!!

review.title: Pet-friendly hotel
review.reviewText: I got to pat some doggies in the lobby and elevator which is pretty cool.

review.title: Great Location, friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Great  location, friendly and helpful staff, nice wine social each evening which is a treat. Nice Boutique Hotel and although expensive the location and staff quality make it within the range of other hotels we have stayed at in this category.Rooms are clean and nicely appointed but there is not a lot of storage space, particularly in the bathroom. As we booked through expedia we were not able to collect any Kimpton points which we were unaware of. Overall I would recommend this Hotel and would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Storage space: More than one luggage stand and perhaps a shelf/drawer in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Everything you would want to see in San Francisco you can walk, cable car or taxi too easily.

review.title: Second time to stay here!
review.reviewText: My husband and I brought our two sons ages 11 and 18 to San Francisco. We had stayed at the Argonaut four years ago and loved it. We had a king deluxe room with a king size bed, a couch that folds out into a bed and we got a rollaway bed for our 11-year-old and we still had a very spacious room even with the couch folded out and the rollaway!

review.title: Return visit...3rd time! Excellent location.
review.reviewText: For our 3nd visit we went for a special deal price by Expedia. We were allocated an internal room which was very comfortable and equalled the standards of our previous visits.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were excellent, friendly and helpful. Room and bed very comfortable. Well stocked bar fridge and snack bar, reasonably priced items.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee and tea-making facilities. Lack of instructions for the coffee/water jug.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location Fisherman's Wharf. Less touristy, close to cable-car, historic wharf. Pier 39 only a short walk. Try Joanie's Diner for breakfast!

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText: Great service. Great location. Great staff. Very clean.

review.title: Centrally located to everything
review.reviewText: My family and I had an amazing experience.  We are definitely  coming back again..

review.title: great location but make sure you get outside room
review.reviewText: expedia put us in inside room with view of walls.  Argonaut was nice enough to change our room because it was our anniversary.  Insist on outside view or you will be looking at walls.
review.positiveRemarks: location and just a little different.
review.negativeRemarks: more insulation from noise outside and other rooms
review.locationRemarks: you are right on Fisherman's Wharf and the beautiful bay.  Location is the best I saw

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf at your doorstep
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel is ideally situated in San Francisco for a tourist - close to the water and the cable car lines and the beginning of many of the tour bus routes. There are many attractions and good restaurants within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel has a daily wine reception in the lobby, featuring local wine and beer - a nice way to meet other guests from around the world.

review.reviewText: Most of the staff we encountered was very unfriendly and rude.

review.title: Fantastic location!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a warm and welcoming hotel at the end of Fisherman's Wharf, and next to the end of the Powell Hyde cable car line. We booked a room with a view of the Golden Gate bridge which you can glimpse depending on the fog. The bridge was further away than I thought it would be so it wasn't the view I was expecting. The location is fantastic though... a short walk to Pier 33 where the Alcatraz ferries depart (book online in advance to avoid disappointment), and there's a good variety of restaurants in the area. We stayed in mid November and I'm surprised how quiet everything was after around 8.30pm though. Compared to the rates of the other hotels nearby, and the big name hotels in the downtown area, the Argonaut was really good value. Would stay again no doubt.

review.title: Lovely location and fair price in a great city.
review.reviewText: Great location for a fair price near all the sights you have to see in San Francisco. All the staff are accomodating and make you feel at home. Stephen (or Stephan) who works the door/bell desk is very kind, always willing to have some banter and share a laugh with you. He made the stay very worthwhile and memorable.
Great location and great service. Hotel staff was very helpful. Overall A+ experience !

review.title: Fantastic hotel.
review.reviewText:
Handy for all tourist sites - Right next to the cable car terminus.
Not sure whether it is worth choosing the $25 breakfast as the Buena vista cafe is 5 minutes walk away and they server great breakfasts.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf - What more is there to say.

review.reviewText: Clean & nice size room. Bathroom sink area a little small.Good location. Concierge not very helpful but other staff fairly friendly.

review.title: Great location, atmosphere and  friendliness
review.reviewText: Loved our stay. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. Blue Mermaid served great food. Wine social in the evening. Walking distance to lots of attractions...what more could you want?
review.positiveRemarks: I love having a little couch in the room so you don't have to always sit on the bed to be comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: OK,  the rooms are a bit small but hey when they're this cute who cares?
review.locationRemarks: Walk easily up and down the Piers and to Ghiradelli square

review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a area conducive to a tourist.

review.title: A little gem, right at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
What a great little hotel! Highly recommended. The place is clean, comfortable and quiet, in an interesting building that was once a warehouse. The location is superb, being right on Fisherman's Wharf and at the end of a cable car line. 

There's lots to see & do within walking distance along the Wharf. And the nearby cable car takes you downtown, past the windy section of Lombard Street and with great views across the city and out to Alcatraz along the way.

review.title: Nice Hotel right in Fishermans Whartf
review.reviewText: Kimpton Hotels always seem to be great stayed at many and they are consistently excellent.

review.title: Great hotel, right at the Cable Car terminus
review.reviewText: Perfect location in a beautiful historic building. Friendly staff, large comfortable rooms. They go the distance!

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Very good hotel with great location and great staff, would love to go back again for sure!

review.title: Excellent location on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The Argonaut's staff were wonderful, helpful and pleasant.  The location could not be surpassed.  The facility was clean and kept in good repair, however, the overall facility is not a four star hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: More realistic room description.
review.locationRemarks: Great location directly on Fisherman's Wharf.  Near cable car turnaround and MANY sights to see (wear comfortable shoes!).

review.title: Top notch locale, reasonable price, and cool style
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at the Argonaut for one night at the end of a Sonoma getaway.  We paid less for a non-view room, and benefited from the quiet courtyard location.  Trust me, there is no view from these rooms, but we didn't choose a hotel in this location with the intent of hanging out in our room.  Right on Fisherman's wharf, around the corner from Ghirardelli Square and the can't-miss Buena Vista Cafe.  Chloe at the concierge desk and Lavon at the Front Desk and Ben from the belldesk all provided exceptional service.
review.positiveRemarks: Best location in SF, great vibe, and the staff inside the hotel were terrific.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet attendants were somewhat abrupt, and the statement that they would "let" me park in front of the hotel for free while I registered annoyed me.
review.locationRemarks: See above comments.  Perfect location for a tourist to visit Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, etc.  Cab fair to/from Union Sq is $9 +/-.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
I spent 5 days with my wife at the Argonaut and everything was nice. We were most of the time out leaving very early in the morning but the time we spent there was great. Excellent location just next to the railway station and 5 min walk from pier 39. 
We also had our last dinner at the blue mermaid and the food was delicious. Would definitely stay again. The room was spacious, my only complain would be the bed that make too much noise when I or my wife rolled over at night. Besides that, it was very quiet and clean,
review.positiveRemarks: The room, the theme, the personnel
review.negativeRemarks: Open Internet access
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39' city tours,

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The Doormen and front desk staff were so friendly and helpful. We came in very late for a reservation because of the world series parade. They grabbed our bags out of the taxi and we were off in a flash thanks to those guys. We made our reservation at the Ferry building in time because of them.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly Staff. Clean rooms. View from the room.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was just a bit too firm for my liking.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything that a tourist might want to see. But just far enough away to be quiet.

review.reviewText: Great stay - friendly and helpful staff.  Great location!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, friendly and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Only thing that needs improving - please buy new towels!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, embarcadero, Columbus ave., fort mason and the marina.

review.reviewText: Nice and clean hotel, friendly staff, close to cable car turnaround and easy walk down the wharf

review.title: 2 days in San Fran
review.reviewText: Great Location. Rooms a bit small but the  quality of food was fine and is more important. Not really surprising as you should get this quality at the considerable price for room and board.
review.positiveRemarks: proximity to waterfront and friendly, knowledgeable staff, from the doorman, front desk and concierge.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Great location for walking around Fisherman's Wharf. The room was beautiful and we enjoyed the daily 5pm cocktail party and the opportunity to borrow bikes and explore the area. All the major tour buses were close by and we enjoyed being right by the water.
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: All the tour guides say not to stay in Fisherman's Wharf as it is too touristy. Well, we are tourists and we loved it.

review.title: Uninspiring
review.reviewText: This hotel was just average.  I stayed just one night. The wine was a nice touch.  The bed was comfortable.  The view was poor considering the location.  The room and the sheets had a funky odor.  It's in an old building so maybe it's to be expected to a degree.  Add $50 plus for overnight parking.

review.title: Great Location but Overpriced
review.reviewText:
The Staff - amazing.
The Room.....standard hotel room with a view of the room across the yard. Seriously, this was the most expensive room I paid for on my 10 day road trip, and it was nothing to write home about. It was just a hotel room.
It's clean, but, the walls are a little thin, as in, I could clearly hear what my neighbour was up to. 
The Location - come on, it doesn't get better than being on Fisherman's Wharf. Walking distance to a lot of great things, take transit for the rest.
review.negativeRemarks: The price - come on, do the hotel rooms in San Francisco NEED to be so freaking expensive ????
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf - food, The Embarcadero, walking distance to  a ton of things.

review.title: Welcome back to the argonaut
review.reviewText: On my recent stay to the argonaut, as a returning guest, I was pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of wine for myself and 2 guests in our room upon arrival. Check in was extremely quick and friendly enough. The room had very hard pillows and a very loud air conditioner making sleeping difficult. The one thing I noticed this time about my visit was the general feeling regarding the staff. Not once were we greeted either leaving or coming back into the hotel, by valet/door staff, concierge, or front desk, which I thought was a little lacking. Overall cleanliness of the room was good. I wouldn't let the above stop me from staying there again though. Location is fantastic.
review.positiveRemarks: Bottle of wine on arrival, quick check in, hotel location.
review.negativeRemarks: Better selection of pillows, less noisy air conditioner.
review.locationRemarks: A few steps from cable car turnaround and a 5 min walk to pier 39/ alcatraz cruises etc.

review.title: Nice but poor value
review.reviewText:
Great location - I have stayed in the area many times.
Pleasant staff upon check in.  We checked in early and were advised room was not ready. Fine - we checked luggage and went for walk. At 3:00 pm we checked in again- A room was ready, not our room. Waited longer. Once we checked in room was nice. Waited for luggage ..finally went down to see where it was. ????
I had to walk into storage room because they could not find it.

On two later occasions we received attitude from staff like we were interrupting them!
To top it off - the morning I left I was yelled at by maintenance guy when I used restroom with a " caution" sign outside .
 Nice facility- concierge was great and very helpful!!!
restaurant very good.
I will look for other facility close by

review.title: Hotel Staff Rude And Horrible... Booked Wrong Room
review.reviewText: Worst Staff At Reception Desk .... Staff Needs Manners And Communication training

review.title: Weekend in SF
review.reviewText: I did not think the room measured up to the price I paid for it.  The bed needed to be replaced.  The bathroom needs more shelves to put your personal items on.  At $500+ per night I expected a little more luxury than this room provided.  The staff were very friendly.  Don't think I'll pay that price again for the room I got.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds need to be replaced.  Put some shelves in the bathroom for guests to put their personal items.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for our 16th wedding anniversary. We loved the accommodations but especially the location. Wine hour is nice and great restaurants all around. The concierge was very helpful.

review.title: Highly Recommended!!!
review.reviewText: I always stay here when I'm in San Fran!!!  Complimentary adult and children refreshments at 5:00.  Very family friendly!!!

review.title: Return visit to a great hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Argonaut last year. Happy with the return visit. Suite we stayed in this time not as nice as last time but still comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproofing. First room allocated on 4th was noisy from ventilation. Moved to suite on second floor which was noisy from upstairs and outside.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to different piers and cable car spot. Also close to Ghirardellis for chocs and ice cream!

review.title: Great Location!  Great Hotel! Great Staff!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was absolutely awesome.  The location is perfect to walk to all of the tourist spots on Fisherman's Wharf, next to cable car boarding and Ghiradelli Square is close.  The staff is very friendly, eager to serve and give great ideas on places to eat.  The hotel is clean, with spacious and very comfortable rooms.  We have already suggested to other travelers we met that they should stay here the next time they are in town.  If we get back to San Francisco we will definitely stay there.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and how friendly and helpful they were.  They are very accommodating and eager to offer suggestions on restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: There is so much to do within walking distance.  Shopping, restaurants, booking tours.  To travel to downtown public transportation is a short walk.

review.title: Extortionate price PLUS no free wifi
review.reviewText: I paid 5* prices for this hotel but even for a 4* it was disappointing.  Very expensive, no free wifi, room smelled musty. No free water in room.  Plus front of house staff tried to charge $350 for going 1 minute over a 1hr late checkout.  Best bit is the location but wouldnt go back.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide free wifi. Improvice standard of in-room food, front of house staff abrasive,  bell boys and concierge helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Right in heart of Fishermans Wharf, beside Cable-car terminal so very convenient. Easy walk to beach, Hyde St Pier museum and Golden Gate.

review.title: Experience at Argonaut
review.reviewText: It was our 45 anniversary and it couldn't have been a better experience. From the minute we stepped out of the cab until we left for home was one wonderful and pleasant experience. The staff was pleasant and most helpful. The doormen were fun and inviting. The Mermaid Restaurant was always a welcome sight after hours of sight seeing and exhaustion. Food and staff were both god so didn't feel we had to go elsewhere to look for dinner.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: Location was excellent. Restaurants, bars, Fisherman Wharf were all near by. Cable car turn around is right across from the street.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: We arrived early morning and were mentally prepared to have to leave our bags with the front desk until our room was available. The lady at the desk advised us that she did have a room available and checked us in. The hotel was in an excellent location, everyone was always friendly and pleasant. Unfortnately our room was facing the back side of the building so the view was not as great as we were told it would be. As first time visitors to San Francisco, we were hoping to wake up to a view of the bay.
review.negativeRemarks: With the amount of money we paid for our stay we would have loved for the hotel to have a shuttle service for our airport commute.
review.locationRemarks: Location was excellent, the ease of having our scheduled tours within walking distance was a great help.

review.title: Great hotel on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel is lovely - quirky and unusual in dcor, but the staff are fantastic. The hotel offers a complimentary wine tasting every evening from 5-6pm which is great. On arrival, we were allocated an internal facing room whose only view was across to another room on the other side. I asked for a room with a view and we were moved with no problem to a room with a view of the park and cable car stop, it was lovely. There was, however, an additional fee of $25 per night. Given that we were spending 5 nights at the Argonaut, we felt a view was important.
review.positiveRemarks: The complimentary wine tasting, the friendly and helpful staff and the cleanliness of the hotel. We also liked its location, handy for tourists.
review.negativeRemarks: It would have been helpful to know in advance whether the room had a view or not as we would have considered this further.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf and handy for lots of tourist attractions - ferry to Alcatraz, Coit Tower and the cable cars.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Would stay again when in area, locatn was great, staff was very helpful
review.positiveRemarks: Historic decor along with great location
review.negativeRemarks: Parking very expensive
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf need i say more

review.title: Great Hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: Had a great time at the Argonaut Hotel, very clean, friendly staff and fantastic location at Fisherman's Wharf. The Happy Hour drinks were appreciated!!

review.title: Pleasant hotel in ideal location.
review.reviewText: This was our first stop on a tour of San Francisco, Los Angeles and Las Vegas.  The Argonaut Hotel is located at Fishermans wharf, just two blocks from the Big Bus tour (recommended to get your bearings). The hotel staff were welcoming and the guest rooms spacious and comfortable. An added bonus was the happy hour from 5 - 6pm where free!!! beer and wine was served. The Argonaut set the standard for our future booked hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable and spacious rooms.  Coffee maker in room.  Free wine and beer.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really.
review.locationRemarks: Close to cable car which is very convenient for taking a trip into the city.  Short walk to Pier 33 attractions, little further to Pier 39 (Alcatraz).

review.title: Good location, average staff
review.reviewText: We stayed of 5 days and when we checked in we asked for an upgrade, when they said no we accepted it but after getting to the room rang down and asked if we could get and upgrade for only a few nights in our stay which they said was possible (why did they not tell us this at checkin).  When we had to move rooms the reception staff were very rude when telling us a bought how to change rooms.  Additionally they charged us for additional services that we either did not use or not acceptable for the level of star hotel we used (e.g we asked the concierge to book us tickets to the baseball they told us no..go book it yourselves online..when we did that they tried to charge us $15 to print the tickets! I complained and despite them telling us they would reverse the charge, it was still on the bill when we checked out, although they took it off it was annoying to ask.  In saying this location was great, bar staff at the Mermaid were great

review.title: Perfect location for walking.
review.reviewText: Good experience overall.  Though my friend and I booked the room in advance, we did not get the bay view we had requested.

review.title: Argonaut stays
review.reviewText: Good location, not far from end of F Line Street Car in one direction and the end of the Powell-Hyde Cable Car in the other direction. Short walk to Fisherman's Wharf frenzy and easy walk to all Piers including Alcatraz tours leaving from Pier 33.

review.title: San Francisco First Time
review.reviewText: I would definitely reccommend this hotel. Great staff and the doorman Donavan was awesome. From your first impression to your checkout, everything was first class. Loved the wine and beer tasting at nights too. It is right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. Easy to everything. first class accomendations.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything but especially the location, staff, design and historical significance.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: You are in the heart of the wharf so the historical tour, Alcatraz nite tour is a must do, take the ferry to Sausalito.

review.title: Well placed on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: With just a long weekend to show my partner something of San Francisco we found this an excellent location. The immediate vicinity is lively, the Bay adjacant, and the cable cars, trolley lines and buses took us just about everywhere else we could pack into the available time.  The place is convenient, welcoming and would be our choice again.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with an Excellent location.  Great service.
review.locationRemarks: You can't get a better location

review.reviewText: Loved the hotel, clean, safe, free wine hour and bikes to ride. Excellent location and our daily housekeepers went above and beyond.

review.title: Nice clean hotel in the nicest part of the bay
review.reviewText: Nice room good spot and friendly staff. My only criticism would be the 'wine welcome' had the same wines and beer every night we stayed.

review.title: Great spot on the wharf
review.reviewText: Great location right on the wharf.  Restaurant was good. Try the chowder sampler! Clean room. Wine hour was very busy but very tasty.  Would stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the action
review.reviewText: Clean place! Very accommodating staff. Loved the wine hour! Argonaunt is next to Ghirardelli Square and cable car line. Lots of restraunts with in walking distance. The non tourists places are just a cable car ride or a train ride away. The ferry building is a must do for breakfast or lunch.  Would stay at the Argonaut again!

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText:
Great view, near the pier. Very good staff.

Nice room number.

review.title: Great hotel on Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: Great boutique hotel on Fisherman's Warf but out of the mainstream of tourists and traffic.  Easy walk to all warf attractions and restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Love this hotel; great staff, rooms, decor and wine hour in the lobby.  Good restaurant attached
review.locationRemarks: Close to all warf restaurants and attractions, next to Cable Car line

review.title: The Bruce's holiday in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: I have just spent a week in San Francisco with my wife and son at the Argonaught hotel where we had probably our  best holiday. Fisherman,s Wharf is got to be the best location to stay as there is so much to do within walking distance and getting into the downtown area is very easy by public transport.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the friendly and helpful staff, the size of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: I found the hotel had everything we needed.
review.locationRemarks: You can pick up the open top bus tours, a bay cruise, the Alcatraz tour and the Big Red Fire Engine tour, Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf all within 10 min

review.title: room change
review.reviewText: Changed room 3 times.  When checking in we were assigned the rooms that nobody wants. First room right on street level. After saying we didn't want room they assigned a room smaller than the first.  The bellhop had to show us 3 other rooms before they gave us a decent room. Considering the room was $400 a night I would have preferred better service.  Want to charge me for WiFi.  Had to go to front desk and ask for WiFi password. They finally gave it to me and told me to keep it a secret.  Meantime free WiFi was part of the password.  Same with coffee.  They had to give us vouchers to get a coffee in the morning.  Hotel recommended a Chinese restaurant very popular. We  waited 50 minutes was still not seated because we had no reservation. He should have called to make one for us or tell us to make reservation
review.positiveRemarks: Location. It was at the end of fisherman wharf so it was away from the craziness but close enough to all the action
review.negativeRemarks: It seemed like the hotel did not give any conveniences except if you asked and then they acted like they were doing something special just for you.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to all restaurants

review.title: Best location by the Wharf
review.reviewText: Our stay was fantastic. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly!

review.title: Lovely hotel, good location
review.reviewText:
Stayed for one week in September. Location is good right on Fishermans Wharf with the cable car turn around next door and all the piers around a 10 minute walk.
The hotel is very stylish and cosy. Room was a good size and very comfortable. Noise was a slight issue but would not put me off staying here.
Food at the hotel's restaurant (Blue Mermaid) was really tasty and cost wise in line with the other restaurants.
Staff were all very friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Very stylish and comfortable. Good Wharf location
review.negativeRemarks: Issue with noise
review.locationRemarks: Cable car turn around right next door. Gardens and small beach to the right. Piers and shops to the left, all in walking distance

review.title: Argonaut hotel
review.reviewText:
We stayed in a King Suite during our recent trip which was more than big enough for our needs. The staff were very friendly and the free wine tasting every evening was a great addition! The decor fits in very nicely with the hotels location

 Based in Fishermans Wharf, and within walking distance of a Powell/Hyde Cable Car stop (going past Lombard Street, and to Union Square), and a F Streetcar stop(going past Pier 39, Pier 33 and the Ferry Building), the hotel was perfectly placed for transport around the city to all the major tourist spots.
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly placed for travel all around the city

review.title: Best hotel on trip
review.reviewText: The room was great. Clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. Great location close everything, trolley station, Lombard St and pier 39.

review.title: Great location in Fisherman's Wharf. Quiet too.
review.reviewText: Chose this hotel due to it's excellent location in Fisherman's Wharf as well as it's comfortable and nicely decorated rooms.  Great boutique hotel.  Rooms views not the best but the only time spent there was to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Have some coffee available in the lobby every morning
review.locationRemarks: Close to loads of restaurants, Hyde & Powell street car, biking & walking trails, shops, Pier 39

review.title: Awesome hotel on The Wharf
review.reviewText: Amazing place, location with lots of history, run into people from around the globe, complimentary wine glass every afternoon, The Blue Mermaid restaurant, which is awesome and has the best clam chowder ever.  Complimentary bikes which you will want to move around.  It is near to a hop on-hop off bus tour, near all of the piers and not too far off the Golden gate.  Huge rooms brilliantly decorated, amazing service, very friendly, willing, just a lovely place.  would go back anytime.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking. USD50 per night is quite expensive, yet you get valet with in-out privileges.  Room service,  awful parfait I had, they did remove the charge
review.locationRemarks: Tours, shopping, eating, alcatraz, golden gate, Ghirardelli chocolate factory, sea shore, bars, sea food,  The Blue Mermaid restaurant, Bike riding

review.title: Great hotel, perfect location.
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Staff was amazing. Will defiantly visit again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Awesome location. Walking distance to food, the wharf, and entertainment. Great clean hotel with very helpful staff.

review.title: Bed is super uncomfortable
review.reviewText: The room was quiet and clean. The bed was squeaky and super uncomfortable. Surprising for a Kimpton hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: New beds!

review.title: middle of the action at fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Maritime  museum was very interesting, great restaurants, Ghiradellie hot fudge sunday are the best and have a nightcap at the cafe Buena Vista.

review.title: great hotel right on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: excellent rooms with modern amenities, in a great place for exploring
review.positiveRemarks: Nautical theme throughout and loved the wine tasting each night. Blue Mermaid Chowder restaurant was excellent
review.negativeRemarks: do not charge for in room water
review.locationRemarks: right on Fisherman's wharf with easy access to Alcatraz, Hop on Hop off buses and restaurants.park area to the side, walks towards Golden Gate Bridge

review.reviewText: This is a wonderful hotel with wonderful staff. Highly recommended!

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience at the Argonaut.  We arrived late on a weeknight and unfortunately the king bed room we had requested was not available.  Instead we received a room with 2 queen beds - not a deal breaker since we were so tired we would have slept anywhere at that point.  They promised to move us to another room the next day.  We were pleasantly surprised to find out that not only did they provide us with a king bed the next day but they upgraded us to a suite - and as an apology gave us a bottle of wine.  That was a lovely gesture and much appreciated.  What class!

review.title: An excellent stay at a wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: What can you say it was just brilliant stay  ideal location marvellous room excellent staff right from the door staff to the maids you don't see we loved it
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz, Bike ride over Golden Gate Bridge, Fishermans Warf, Hippy Area, Big bus tours,visit the mrs Doubtfire House, planetarium, golden gate park

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel as a belated anniversary celebration. The hotel staff were very helpful during the stay with valet parking (although the text-message way to pick-up our car after check-out did not work as they told us it would), check in, and attending to our small needs such as shaving cream we had forgotten to bring. We missed the wine reception and were given coupons to get a free glass of wine at their restaurant, which was a very nice gesture. The room and bathroom were clean, very pretty, and comfortable. We did not get a good view as we had requested in our reservations, although this may have been because we got a lower rate on Expedia. The hotel was a quiet place, although in our room as we were going to bed, we could hear the tv next door as well as a person coughing. This was the most disappointing part, as most reviews had said this would be a quiet place and it broke the mood of a romantic night in a nice hotel. The beds were comfortable. Overall, there was nothing that stood out to us as making it worth the stay, other than the cleanliness and comfort of the room along with it's close location to the Fisherman's Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: IF there was a way to sound proof the rooms a little more so that you can't hear your neighbor's tv or someone coughing.
review.locationRemarks: There is Ghirardelli's Square with little shops, cupcake shop, and of course the chocolate and ice cream store. Many small shops with souvenirs nearby

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Excellent location between Ghiradelli Square and Fishermans Wharf. Gorgeous views, great decor and friendly staff. Highly recommend!

review.title: Excellent location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great experience in general, particularly the location. Service was great. We had a small incident with noisy guests near us and the hotel took immediate action and were nice enough to apologize even though not their fault. Staff was cordial, room quite clean and nice and spacious. We got our room very early which was a welcome surprise as usually you don't gets. Room ready after 3PM elsewhere. Highly recommended for a stay in San Francisco (for vacation purposes especially)

review.title: should we move to San Francisco?
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was recommended by a friend and did not disappoint!   lovely nautical rooms, close to the wharf, pier 39, Ball stadium, ghiardelli chocolate factory, cable car starting point, Crissy Field, Marina district.  We loved it all!
review.positiveRemarks: great rooms, wine hour, friendly staff

managementResponses.response:
Hi, Louise,
Normally, our front desk friendliness matches that of our famous quirky doormen. I see that we dropped the ball in this case -- yikes! We will review this inconsistency with the team.

review.title: The Argonaut Hotel, San Francisco
review.reviewText: For the amount of money I spent on this hotel extremely disappointed.  Small room, bathroom very ordinary (show curtain and bath matt), no view.  Service was mediocre - when I checked in the lady on reception didn't even look up to greet me.  Doorman must say were very nice, helpful and engaging.  Wine hour - didn't release this was for anyone off the street; to sell this as part of your accommodation is false.  But I guess you are paying for location at Fishermans Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper rates.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good for tours (Pier 39/33)

review.title: Nothing special here..
review.reviewText: Room was small and AC unit very loud. We would not return here!

review.title: Don't take a car
review.reviewText: Hotel was reasonably placed at the end of Fisherman's wharf but next to the tram stop which was handy.  Some staff were great, others below average.  Avoid the valet parking as way over priced at fifty dollars per night.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking charges.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
Fantastic hotel situated right in the heart of the pier area of SF and next door to the main tram stop.
I visited SF some ten years ago and was amazed at the transformation of the old cannery into the hotel.
they have done a great job keeping the character of the old building while having all mod cons.
would recommend to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: slow service at breakfast

review.title: GREAT location
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and comfortable.  Wine/beer hour was fantastic - great way to meet with others that are visiting the area.  Restaurant was average at best.

review.title: Summer 2014 San Francisco Vacation
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is awesome!  The hotel is in a great location, the staff was attentive and friendly, the room was very comfortable and serviced in a timely fashion.  Overall, nothing but great things to say about this hotel.  Keep up the great work Argonaut!
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the staff, the room... everything was excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: We ate at the restaurant in the hotel, The Blue Mermaid, and it wasn't nearly on par with the hotel.  Food - so,so; wait staff - not attentive.
review.locationRemarks: Being at Fisherman's Wharf provides access to the all the restaurants and shops in the area, access to tours, and easy access to the cable cars.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText:
Wonderful location on Fishermans Wharf.  Lots of close restaurants nearby.
They made our 20th wedding anniversary very special.  Thank you so much. 
We would definitely come back again.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the wine welcome hour and that it was pet friendly.
review.locationRemarks:
There were several stops nearby for all types of transportation.   Whether it was a bus tour,
street car and even the cable cars.

review.title: The Argonaut Hotel
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a quiet and comfortable place to stay.  Staff were friendly but the overall impression was that they were a bit distracted and disorganised - we arrived laden with suitcases after a 12 hour transatlantic flight and none of the doormen offered to help us.  In fact, one of them opened the door for me and pointed out where reception was as I staggered through the door carrying two cases and my handbag!  At breakfast too, they got my order wrong and tried to persuade me it was my misunderstanding - I am vegetarian and the food arrived with bacon when I expressly asked for it without.  All of that aside, the hotel is close to to bay, ideal for families, the rooms are spacious and the beds are really comfortable!
review.positiveRemarks: The beds - and breakfast - once they got my order right.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff could be a bit more alert to helping out.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is a bit of a tourist trap but there's lots to do and great shops a short walk away.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText:
All the staff are courteous and helpful. The hotel is located a little far from pier 39, and the Alcatraz Island boarding area. 
Overall beautiful, clean and spacious rooms.

review.title: Comfortable hotel, close to everything!
review.reviewText: Had a great stay at the Argonaut, I highly reccommend it. The staff were helpful and friendly, I received a free upgrade at the front desk (a little charm goes a long way!) my room was super spacious and comfortable, nice beds/bedding, plush robes and booties for your feet. The lobby is great, they do a free wine/beer/sangria tasting every night from 5-6ish...definitely take advantage, very generous pour and a great way to meet and chat with other guests. Also, the Powell/Hyde cable car is right on the corner so its a fun way to jump on one of the vintage trolleys and head up to Chinatown, Union Sq etc. Great stay, I would go back.
review.positiveRemarks: The wine tasting by far was such a great way to socialize (and the free drinks are wonderful!)
review.negativeRemarks: If anything, I would have liked blackout curtains on the windows, the plantation shutters dont totally block out all the light but its a minor point.
review.locationRemarks: The wharf, Pier 39, Ghirardelli Sq are all right there, close to everything.

review.title: Great Location....OK facilities.
review.reviewText: The location cannot be beat right at the Wharf.   The $50 to park is an irritant, and the amount it seems to be the norm for the area hotels.   The room was OK, I do not see the attraction.  Probably not stay again.

managementResponses.response:
Hi, Traveler,
I know things can be a little pricier over some summer dates, though , for future trips, please know that we have three tiers of rooms: the standard, deluxe (exterior view) and view (facing the Golden Gate Bridge or Alcatraz). Those can be fun, especially if you plan to relax in your room in the afternoons!

review.title: Nice w/ view of other rooms.
review.reviewText: The price doesn't reflect the room but it's location is one the best in SF.

managementResponses.response: Thanks, traveler! So glad that everything was convenient for you here :).

review.title: Couldn't be better located next to the Wharf.
review.reviewText: Great rooms, friendly staff. Walking distance to all was very easy.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to everything, cable cars, shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Very thoughtful hotel.
review.reviewText: The small details they provide that made our trip so much nicer
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to the nice touristy parts of town

managementResponses.response: Thanks, Mich! And I'll be delighted to tell the housekeeping ladies about your thumbs up, too. But why did you have to make me think about ice cream :)? Between Norman's (serving Mitchell's local ice cream), Ben & Jerry's, and Coldstones, I am outnumbered :).

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of the Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: This is a fantastic location for a visit to San Francisco.  Close to loads of restaurants and shops, not to mention Ben & Jerry's ice cream next door.  The hotel staff was very welcoming.  The complementary wine happy hour in the lounge was a nice surprise.  Concierge help with booking trips to Muir Woods.  The hotel room was very comfortable - especially the beds.  The room was very clean which is something I always look for when staying in any hotel.  I would definitely stay here again!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy beds and very clean room
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was fantastic!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is a great place for sightseeing - close to all boat tours to Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge, Sausalito.  Lots of restaurants & shops

review.title: Really nice hotel overall and dogs allowed
review.reviewText: I have not been in such a nice hotel that allows pets.  Everyone was so friendly.  The location was terrific in that we could walk everywhere.  We enjoyed North Beach, the piers, embarcadero and surrounding neighborhood including Cannery Row and Ghirardelli Square.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was nice, the staff were all friendly.  We really enjoyed ourselves.

review.title: Great location if you don't mind the tourist drove
review.reviewText: Rooms were surprisingly quiet for being right on the wharf.

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText:
Everyone from the bell hop to the housekeeping to the concierge was absolutely wonderful!! The hotel room was beautiful and everything was perfectly stocked and clean! This room was worth every penny we spent!
It's also super close to anything and everything in the fisherman's wharf and Pier 39 area.

review.title: Fisherman's  Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel so located in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf,  it is a great location.  Transport is nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Being able to book late check out prior to the day of less ing
review.locationRemarks: The water, the ferries, the shops, the people, the tour companies.

review.title: Great Location for Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the stay and loved the wine reception from 5p-6p!

review.title: Great hotel in the Wharf area.
review.reviewText: When I arrived, I discovered that my reservation through Expedia was not processed. The Service staff quickly looked at all options and found me the last room available. I contacted Expedia and worked it out. The supervisor that I spoke to on the phone was great. She offered a credit on the booked room and excellent credit to my account for future bookings.  Very happy with experience.
review.positiveRemarks:
Excellent Service staff, great rooms with and without views, suprisingly quiet for being on the Wharf.
Food was great as well. I will be back.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is on the west corner of the Wharf so it is quieter.

review.title: Great location for short visit
review.reviewText: Great location for the SF things to do and see but quiter end of the wharf - which is good  excellent room.   Pricy

review.title: Great location for bay, wharf, food and transport
review.reviewText: Great hotel, nice spec, lovely relaxed atmosphere, tasteful decor and rooms immaculate
review.positiveRemarks: Relaxed style and low key staff
review.negativeRemarks: Bar prices steep but happy hour 3 til 6 (limited choice) and free drinks reception every night 5 til 6 with wine and beer available.
review.locationRemarks: It's in the historic marine park so loads to see and do. Plus Fishermans wharf has everything from ferries, food, the tacky, museums  and shops

review.title: Ahhhhh The Argonaut
review.reviewText: Staye at The Argonaut sadly for only two nights......should have made it atleast 4 or 5! Fantastic location right by fisherman's wharf and just round the corner from the hop on/off city sightseeing bus, tram stop the other side of hotel making it very easy to get into the city. Lovely spacious room with nice big bathroom, very clean. Will definitely go back for more exploration of San Francisco!

managementResponses.response: Aw, great to hear - we'll have to pass this to along to the team!

review.reviewText: Great Location, one of the best. People in the hotel were very nice.

review.title: Awesome place to stay
review.reviewText: Loved it A great place to stay very quaint great good and all the staff were awesome

managementResponses.response: Some of our rooms overlook the cable car, so guests will look out and decide if the line is short enough to go down to board. Pretty funny!

review.title: Great location great hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotel is perfectly located right across from Fishermans Wharf and near the first stop of the cable car.  Staff was very friendly and helpful and room was beautiful.

review.title: Great Kimpton hotel with all that entails
review.reviewText: A typical Kimpton experience - boutique hotel, friendly staff, unique decoration, free wine receptions!  Even though this is in Fisherman's Wharf it's not a tourist trap, and it made is a great location for exploring San Francisco.  Excellence as usual from Kimpton.

managementResponses.response: Thanks, Kathy! I know just what you mean, and I'm glad the designers gave the hotel a "sense of place" here at the waterfront. Hopefully you got to check out the neat onsite Maritime History museum run by the National Park Service? The price is right at $0 and the exhibits are fun for all ages.

review.title: Great hotel on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Excellent location, close to all the Wharf has to offer!  The wine reception each evening was great.   The restaurant and bar are good, but the staff were not always the most friendly, unlike other staff we encountered. Location, location, location!  Room decor was neat if you remember that you are on the wharf!  We found everything to be clean and well taken care of in this historic hotel.  Overall, we very much enjoyed our stay atThe Argonaut Hotel and would definitely return!  And by the way, location, location, location!

review.title: Very convenient; at the wharf.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay, as always, Kimpton! Lots of families, you could use a bit more social areas and an indoor pool for all the very young travelers.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience. Wine tasting and happy hour.
review.negativeRemarks: More coffee amenities.
review.locationRemarks: At the wharf. Nice park to watch people and swimers. Walk to shops, eateries and the Buena Vista. Easy to get a cab, trolley or double decker bus..

managementResponses.response: Thanks, traveler! I'm glad you loved the mix of old and new here. We try to have all the modern conveniences with the charms of the brick and beam left behind from the Cannery days. If any neighbors get too raucus, know that we can always have security pay those kids a visit :). Thanks!

review.reviewText: Modern room in a historic building with a great location. Some noise from kids in the next room.

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Michelle! Our staff love to read these reviews. Hopefully you can visit us in September or October when it is usually "summer" here :)

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of many attractions.
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. Couldn't complain about anything other than the cold foggy weather. All staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. Would stay again.

review.title: Excellent location!  Great staff
review.reviewText: Unique hotel!  Worth checking out!  The location can't be beat

review.title: Great hotel and great location
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very nice and extra helpful. Stayed for three nights and had no complaints.

review.title: very nice hotel near the beach
review.reviewText: What a wonderful experience, staff was excellent - what a wonderful way to celebrate a belated father's day and birthday....we will never forget the time spent
review.positiveRemarks: it's location and how clean the hotel was
review.negativeRemarks: none to report
review.locationRemarks: everything is near by, from a classic burger to wine tasting and ice cream....nothing better

review.title: Super convenient locale and charming
review.reviewText: Room,staff and locale awesome. Rooms are very noisy...can hear adjacent rooms and hallway traffic super loud. Super loud.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Stayed here in June of this year. Loved the location. Right on Jefferson St. with direct access to Hyde St. Pier and cable cars. Minutes from Fisherman's Warf by foot. The hotel was very clean, check in was very easy and our room was very clean. I recommend a room with views of the bay for anyone staying here.

review.title: Nice Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great hotel and location and staff were very friendly. Limited hotel facilities and breakfast was expensive. Although there was a really interesting museum in the foyer, which was worth a trip.
review.positiveRemarks: The room, bit expensive but worth the view of Alcatraz (had to pay extra for this on arrival)
review.negativeRemarks: There was no pool - not sure what they could do about this though. Bring the price of breakfast down.
review.locationRemarks: Loads! Stayed for 5 nights. Had a trip up to Napa valley and Muir Woods, also Alcatraz. Pier 39 is a fun place to eat.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay. Felt secure and loved the location. Excellent helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: No squirt bottles in the shower.
review.locationRemarks: Close to tours, restaurants and sight seeing.

review.title: Nice hotel near to triathlon race start at Marina
review.reviewText: Great experience, nice bar bedroom and restaurant, which what I would have expected at this price point.

review.title: Excellent location for being on the wharf
review.reviewText: Air conditioning was set to auto to which when it reaches the coolest temperature it will shut off therefore the room being too cold or too hot.

Excellent, helpful staff! Nice hotel, great location, and well-maintained. But it's the wonderful staff, from the curbside help with car & baggage, to the front desk, to the maid service - all friendly, helpful, and glad to be of service - who really made this a special visit.
review.locationRemarks: On Fisherman's Wharf, around the corner from Ghirardelli Square - You couldn't ask for a better location.

review.reviewText: Staffs were very friendly and good location to stay.

review.title: On The Bay
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel in walking distance to the Piers. Very active area, but fun. Kids would love it! Family oriented, but excellent for romance too!
review.positiveRemarks: The decor was nice, the staff nicer, and the rooms were spotless!
review.negativeRemarks: Give guests a break on parking rates!
review.locationRemarks: Right on the Bay, next to a park, a walk to Pier 39, a block from the chocolates.....what more?

review.title: Great hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: Perfect hotel for those wanting to be close to all tourist attractions. Close to beach, trolleys, wharf, Ghidelli, etc. Friendly and accomodating staff. Lovely nautical decor. Would stay again!

review.title: Great hotel close to many of San Francisco attrac
review.reviewText: Would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to be right in the middle of many of the great things San Francisco has to offer. Room was clean. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Would stay here again if I am lucky enough to come back to San Francisco.

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Rodrigo! I hope you got to enjoy the wine party on the second day? We host it from 5-6pm nightly and now is a great time at the hotel since we are serving up the summer sangria. The housekeeping and engineering teams will be delighted to hear that you were so happy with the room. Thank you for writing, and we'll look forward to your return visit :)

review.title: Top Location and very good amenities
review.reviewText: We arrived late for the wine tasting but the location of the hotel is excellent. The room was very clean and in excellent condition. I will definitely return.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very good hotel in great location for all attractions and the beach. Plenty great places to eat ,to suit all tastes and budgets.
review.negativeRemarks: Relocate sofa in bedroom from under air conditioning vent.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf and pier 39 Alcatraz trips Riding the cable car Going over Golden gate

review.title: Excellent location in Fisherman's wharf.
review.reviewText: We stayed as a home base to see local sites and tour colleges. It was pricey for the hotel itself, but an excellent location.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Happy hour, though seating options were limited. Fitness room was average.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge service. Most were very helpful, but there were a couple with attitude and incorrect information that put a damper on the hotel experience.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you both for coming aboard the Argonaut. "awesome " is just what we want to read, and I'll let everyone know how you loved the service as well as the pillowtop mattress.
In addition to the free nightly wine party that we host, we offer a (first come, first serve) bike rental program, wifi, and a "Forgot It? We've Got It!" toiletry program. The hope is that all those little things make you feel more at home and provide fun/convenience.

review.title: Awesome hotel, in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: My sister and I stayed at the Argonaut Hotel during the week of June 8, 2014 for 5 nights. The hotel is awesome, the beds are comfortable, the staff is super nice, there is a great happy hour every night that we partook in twice. There is a restaurant in the hotel that's quite good but it was our most expensive breakfast during our whole stay. But all in all, I would highly recommend staying here.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that there were doorbells that eliminated hearing other people knock on their doors. I liked the location. I liked the ambiance.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, the cable car line is right up the street, Ghiradelli Chocolate Factory, close to all wharf attractions, easy to walk.

managementResponses.response: Thanks, Liz! We'll share this with the team, especially the concierge. I am glad that their help and of course the location here made everything so fun and easy for you. Cheers!

review.title: Charming hotel with great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was immaculate with most helpful staff. The concierge service was the best ever and the location right across the street from the wharf made the trip.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, cleanliness, location and happy hour!
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were a but small but that cannot be improved- There were only 2 in the room and any more than that would have made it very tight.
review.locationRemarks: Best location with access to everything you could want to see or sign up to see.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Friendly hotel in a good location in fishermans wharf. We changed from an inward facing room to an outward as it was so dark!

review.title: Great location, fun hotel!
review.reviewText:
Great service- staff efficient and prepared
Fun themed hotel in excellent tourist location
Complimentary happy hour was a bonus- fun and social!

managementResponses.response: Hi, David, and thanks to you and the wife for making us your home base! I'm delighted that the four days left you wanting more. GIve us a holler as you're planning your return trip and we'll be happy to get going on sightseeing and dinner reservations for you!

review.title: A Well Earned Vacation
review.reviewText: Both my wife and I haven't had a vacation in some years and having visited San Francisco by myself, I thought it would be a nice change to go back and explore it together. The Argonaut Hotel was excellent and that made the stay that much more enjoyable. Saw all the sites we could and tried to get in as many touristy things as possible so when we return we'll have a good base to stay in and a long time to visit. Too many things to do for a four day stay but it left us wanting more.
review.positiveRemarks: No complaints about anything. Restaurant has an awesome chef!!
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was a bit hard. Fitted bottom sheets would be nice so I don't wrap up like a big burrito when I roll over...
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location to Fisherman's Warf. The Trolley and public transit were steps away.

managementResponses.response: Hi, Traveler! I hope that we will have the chance to see you again in the future -- maybe in one of our Deluxe or View category rooms? We do take pride in being pet friendly (no fees!) , and also havng a pet-free floor for guests who request that alternative as well. I will let the team know that you and your four-legged buddy felt well taken care of here. Thank you !

review.title: Great stay. Could be better
review.reviewText: Overall it's good... The room could be better. A view would have been nice rather than staring at the other hotel rooms across. The staff are awesome and helpful. Very pet friendly. Walking distance everywhere.

managementResponses.response: Thanks, traveler. Our thanks to you and your good nose! Please feel free to let us know if there is ever a fragrance issue in your room. We are definitely non-smoking and need to ensure that that policy is enforced. Any neighbors who are smoking (a rare event, luckilly), will need to receive a warning call since we take this very seriously, both for guest service and because we occupy an historic building :). We are lucky to have those modern, ultra-deep tubs in the suites, though, right? The view from the soaking r&r of the tub is priceless!

review.reviewText: Great Jacuzzi ... Great view. Bit of a smoky smell in a non-smoking room otherwise very clean. Nice dcor ... would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel restaurant could use a bit of improving. Food not as good as touted.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shops and restaurants to choose from....tourist mecca.

review.title: Very good hotel in a very good location
review.reviewText:
Great hotel - comfort, service, food (Blue Mermaid) and location. It's all here. Plus there is some history with this hotel - the structure/brick work stems from the early 1900s as a warehouse and cannery for vegetables and fruit.
Convenient to Ghiradelli Square or Fisherman's Wharf, the hotel is a block away from the final cable car stop on the Mason-Hyde Line. Just make your experience that much better by requesting a higher floor with a view.
review.positiveRemarks: Nautical theme, history, staff, and restaurant in addition to a comfortable room and bed!
