review.negativeRemarks: half the rooms face toward one another in a rectangular fashion so there is no view.
review.locationRemarks: Location is fantastic: Ghiradelli Square, Fisherman's Wharf, restaurants and shops all within a few blocks.

managementResponses.response: Hi, Traveller, and thanks for coming to the Argonaut! I am glad that you loved the location and views around the neighborhood, though I can see whe should review a Deluxe or View room for you next time. I hope that you will be back - the crew will be waiting!

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a great location. The staff were really nice, helpful and polite. The only downside was the view from the room, a wall!!

photos.caption: Hotel from the cable car turnaroun
Early morning view from cable car

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: No problems at all during our two week stay. The staff are wonderfully friendly and the doormen are a delight in their quirky uniforms. We are not usually in need of much help from the concierge (having researched thoroughly before we arrive), but the one or two enquiries we made were answered very helpfully with real knowledge of the subject.
review.positiveRemarks: The personal service and genuine desire to provide a good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: The one improvement I would like to see is the provision of a kettle in the room for tea drinkers, although I probably would have got one if I'd asked
review.locationRemarks: Book well in advance for Alcatraz and don't miss the evening tour. It sells out weeks ahead. Also book a day tour to Yosemite National Park. Stunning!

review.title: Deluxe room promotion deal!
review.reviewText: We booked the Deluxe rooms as they were on promo for no extra cost. Rooms were very spacious & it was like sleeping on a cloud on the beds!
review.positiveRemarks: Room was better than standard! Hotel was fresh! It did not feel dingy or tired.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have been nice to have an alternate exit other than the elevators.
review.locationRemarks: We spent 1 full day on exploring Fisherman's Wharf and all the Piers. Close to Cable Cars, Street Cars, Navey musueum, lots of shops & EXCELLENT dinin

review.title: Bingo! We found a winner...!
review.reviewText:
We stayed for two nights with our 3 year old daughter. From the moment we arrived with the warm and professional welcome as we exited our taxi to the friendly reception hosts who welcomed us and offered our daughter some fun treasure treats - we felt this place was different!.. The room we had was a twin deluxe queen. It was spacious, clean and just as beautiful as the pictures on the website make out.

The wine reception is a brilliant idea and a great chance to socialise in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere with other guests and the friendly & professional service staff. It was almost like a youth hostel social room / bar area for adults and professional business people and includes non alcoholic drink options for children and non drinkers too.
review.positiveRemarks: The laid back friendly atmosphere and friendly and professional staff as well as the great decor.
review.negativeRemarks: The rating of this hotel could easily be improved to 5 star (as it was a defiant upgrade from the 5 star we stayed in the three nights prior up town)
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of the tourist friendly Fisherman's wharf you can easily walk to see the Sea Loins, take a cruise tour on the bay or enjoy the many

review.reviewText: Rooms were done up in a cheesy nautical theme that needed updating. The most disappointing was the whole place, including the streets outside, were like a ghost town at night. Day tourist lure, but nothing happening in the PM.

review.title: Argonaut Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel located adjacent to all the sights and activities of Fisherman's Wharf. The staff are courteous and accommodating. I'd stay here again next time I'm in San Francisco.

review.title: Great location in the heart of Napa
review.reviewText: The overnight road construction with jackhammers disrupted sleep unfortunately.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to everything and very clean. The staff was so friendly and helpful with everything you needed or asked about. They make you feel like you are at home

review.title: Amazing Value.
review.reviewText: I'm typically too preoccupied to write reviews, but I had to make an exception with this one. Staff friendliness, knowledge, helpfulness and overall commitment added to the inherent beauty of the Argonaught Hotel. Gorgeous rooms with character abound from the old wood beams and natural brick walls. And right on the waterfront. We never got to enjoy the chowder from the Blue Mermaid restaurant attached to the restaurant but next time I think we will. Complimentary bikes were a nice unexpected touch but never got to use those either, we just walked everywhere. Great Job staff from the boys outside, to the cleaning staff, front desk and concierge. One last thing, the complimentary drinks from 5 - 6 were always served with a smile and had a few full pours of wine.

review.title: Superb location, superb hotel, professional staff
review.reviewText: On arrival we were greeted by uniformed, professional and friendly staff, the front desk were helpful and efficient. The hotel itself is probably the best in the Wharf area, I have stayed at many of them. The rooms are very clean, very well furnished with ultra comfortable beds and pillows. We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Argonaut and would certainly return.
review.positiveRemarks: I did not find anything not to like.
review.locationRemarks: Obviously the Wharf is the main attraction but the hotel is adjacent to the cable-car terminal for the picturesque ride up to town.

managementResponses.response: Hi, SuzieQ! I hope that we will have the chance to "wow" you more in the future. Now that we know a bit more about your preferences, we could provide a shower cap in your room and let housekeeping know that you do not wish to have the minibar restocked daily. (Or, if you don't want it to happen till later in the day, you can illuminate the Privacy sign for your door.) We do feel our minibar prices are competitive for San Francisco, though the real deal is to join our free loyalty club, which will entitle you to a $10 "Raid the Bar" credit on each eligible stay. Feel free to visit our website or call the front desk for details. Last but not least, I'll pass along the feedback that the calamari was chewy, though I'm happy the other dishes were tasty!

review.title: Well located hotel but with little WOW factor
review.reviewText: My husband and I recently spent 4 nights at this hotel. Unfortunately my expectations were not really met but this may be due to the very high ratings I read prior to booking. The hotel is located in an excellent position and the staff were friendly and efficient. However, the rooms although very clean were not large, the bathrooms fairly small and the toiletries provided minimal eg. there was no shower cap. Someone knocks on the door every morning to check the mini bar. There is no complimentary water provided with a small bottle costing $3. The WIFI was good. The happy hour is a nice touch but was very crowded possibly due to the fact it is not restricted to hotel guests but allows locals to drop in. It was virtually impossible to get a seat. The restaurant was satisfactory. The crab chowder was excellent, other dishes satisfactory but a dish of calamari was tough and overcooked. There was very little response when this was mentioned to the waiter. Overall the hotel is comfortable but I would not rate it as highly as some others of comparable pricing.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was perfect. Staff were friendly and well trained.
review.negativeRemarks: Vaule for money needs to be improved. Complimentary water would be nice. More seats provided in lobby to cater for the crowd at the wine hour.
review.locationRemarks: Location is excellent with all of the Fisherman's Wharf activities and the cable car nearby.

review.title: Great location and lots of Old World Character!
review.reviewText:
Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf
Great staff with one goal --- to make your stay enjoyable and memorable
Especially Donavan -- meeting you at the door when you get out of the taxi with a great smile and an explosive personality -- what an asset for the Argonaut Hotel!
Clean room and comfortable with a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge. All rooms do not have this view as some looks onto a concrete courtyard, but if you are out all day then this is probably not a big deal.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks, Leigh! I know just what you mean...........BACON!! The Chef's thick-cut bacon is out of this world. I think that's why I so adore the Ahi Tuna BLT, which is practically a meal for two!
Anyhow, back to the subject at hand: happy anniversary to you both, and thank you for choosing us! I'm glad we will see you again, and perhaps with your pet buddy on one of our pet floors next time :).

review.title: Great location near Hyde Street Pier
review.reviewText: We stayed for a week to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Loved the location; it was close to the beach, Fishermans Wharf and transportation. Staff was friendly and helpful. The food offered at the Blue Mermaid was excellent, especially the crab chowder and the bacon! Our only criticism would be that the beds could have been more comfortable and less sqeaky. The hotel is dog friendly and though we didn't have a dog with us, it was fun to see them around the hotel. We wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Argonaut again upon our next visit to SF.

review.title: Great hotel near Fisherman's Wharf and Cable Car
review.reviewText: Great location and service. Room was nice except bed was a bit firm. Staff was outstanding; best service I have ever received. The restaurant (Mermaid Chowder House) was excellent -- try the crab and corn chowder!
review.negativeRemarks: switch to temperpedic mattresses

review.title: Fab stay!!!!!
review.reviewText: My daughter and I visited San Francisco for the first time mid May and chose the Argonaut for our stay from the reviews - so glad we did. Had an amazing time - loved the wine hour - really felt like a bit of a house party - if only for an hour! Concierges were amazingly helpful - Steve was just hysterical, but in a v good way. Will definitely stay again if we manage to return to SF.
review.locationRemarks: Right by cable car turn round. Amazing view across the bay to Alcatraz from entrance.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Room was huge, close to everything. Bay cruise a must and the seafood restaurants along the piers are fantastic. Buy the MUNI pass gives you unlimited rides on the cable cars and trams. Its cheaper that way.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car at the back of the hotel, restaurants opposite the hotel entrance as well as the pier. fantastic location for sight seeing and bay cruising.

review.title: Great location- close to everything
review.reviewText: our first time to SF. we used the BART and trolley to get there, easy and cheaper than cab. close to everything. Rent bikes- was a wonderful way to see most of the sights of the city-and GREAT views of everything. Weather was wonderful too, but cold at night (take at least a jacket or coat and maybe a warm hat). Visited Sonoma- great time, however traffic coming back on the weekend was terrible. Eat closer to fisherman's grotto for cheaper seafood (versus the wharf restaurants). Go up Columbus street to north beach for great italian food.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms, excellent staff, nice happy hour.
review.negativeRemarks: We requested an earlier check-in time; We came back twice before 3 and never got it. Also,we requested a room with a view & got 2nd floor(no view)

review.reviewText: We reserved the hotel a couple hours before showing up, got to the hotel late and had no problems checking in. They have valet parking and a nice friendly staff. We will be coming back when we have more time to enjoy all the small things this hotel has to offer. We felt like we were on a ship in our room, very nautical.
The ceilings do transmit those above you walking around. Would have preferred to stay on top floor.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel and staff in a wonderful location on the Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: The sheets in a non smoking room reeked of smoke

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Spent 4 nights, 5 days sightseeing San Francisco wharf area, Chinatown, Union Square area. Rented car and drove to Muir Woods and Pointe Reyes.
review.positiveRemarks: Location location, location! Safe for 2 women traveling/sightseeing. Staff helpful, friendly, happy, efficient.
review.locationRemarks: Near-Peir 39, Cable car, Ferry Building, boat excursions, Scoma's Resturant, small beach area, Ghirardelli Square, Buena Vista Cafe, etc, etc!

review.reviewText: Wonderful service in a great location in San Francisco.

review.title: Great location for tourist
review.reviewText: We enjoyed a weekend stay with our adult sons here, and were pleased to be close to restaurants and transportation. We were a little disappointed at the Argonaut's owning dining facility - rather chaotic atmosphere, and the waiter who served us at the one meal we had there was a bit dozy. (The young female bartender was great, though.)

review.title: Perfect fit!
review.reviewText: Terrific hotel find right by the water. Two thumbs up!

managementResponses.response: Nice! Thanks, John! I'm delighted that you appreciated the character and history of this cannery building, and of course those views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz don't hurt :).

review.title: Hotel full of Character
review.reviewText:
Although it is not very imposing on arrival as it is in an old canning factory it does have loads of atmosphere. We bothed liked the exposed brickwork and large timber beams and columns which gave it great character. Staff very attentive and there were free drinks for guests from 5pm to 6pm every day.
Large bedroom and ours had views directly ahead of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate to the left.
Would not have wanted to go for an inner room as they had views over the courtyard with only a flat roof to look at.
review.locationRemarks: Great location on Fishermans Wharf with plenty of shops and restaurants on the doorstep

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Room was perfect with a gorgeous view of Alcatraz.

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Family from Ohio! I like to make sure to mention the free bike rentals (first come, first serve, but great for early risers) since that little perk can really save you money and give you that extra incentive to brave that little slope up to the spectacular bridge!

review.title: Excellent choice for vacation visit
review.reviewText: Great place to stay for a vacation in San Francisco! Plenty of options at Fisherman's wharf for dining, biking, sightseeing and a short cable car or trolley ride to downtown or other destinations. Hotel is clean and comfortable, staff is accommodating and helpful.

review.title: Fantastic location.
review.reviewText: Probably the best location for tourists in SF. The hotel is up to all what is promised.

review.title: Nice hotel on the wharf but quiet rooms
review.reviewText: Enjoyable two day stay. Very clean spacious attractive room. Helpful staff. Highly recommend.

It is wonderful to be right on the Wharf. You are right across the street from the Bay and in the heart of Fisherman's wharf. If you don't need/want a pool or care about the view from your room you will love this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: the restaurant is excellent - we had breakfast and dinners and everything was wonderful including the service.
review.negativeRemarks: No pool. Most of the rooms don't have much of a view. No gift shop. We had a car and the daily parking rate was outrageous

review.title: Nice hotel by the wharf
review.reviewText: We loved being down at fisherman's wharf. Lots to do, lots of restaurants. The hotel was great, nice and clean, comfy bed. The conceiges were so helpful with tour tickets and baseball tickets. Restaurant was delicious!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Helpful staff, great location. Many rooms only have a view of a boring internal courtyard. Fortunately we were upgraded and so at least had a street view, albeit a back street.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms starting to get a bit tired
review.locationRemarks: Fishermens wharf - cable car - ferries across harbor

review.title: Quick Weekend in San Fran
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the quick weekend stay at the Argonaut. Too bad we didn't have more time.
review.negativeRemarks: Amazed at how big a tourist trap Fisherman's Wharf has become over the last 25 yrs since I last visited. Still. I'd recommend this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to North Beach, Coit Tower, Ghiradelli, etc. Strap on your sneakers at hit the hills...walking is the best way to see the city!

review.title: A few nights at the Argonaught
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in an excellent position, however I have to ask is it worth the money??? I was shocked to see that you had to pay for bottled water. Other hotels provide 2 bottles a day.. Also no tea only coffee and that was sparse.. One normal and one decaf. As there were two of us we had to toss a coin!

The decor was lovely and they had people running around making sure everything was done However it is the little things that were missing. Like the above and the bath towels had seen better days.

The toiletries were bulk on the wall and basic. for this price I expected a little better..

Overall the hotel is nice but I dont consider it worth the price.
review.negativeRemarks: facilities in the room as mentioned above... Also it was extremely noisy
review.locationRemarks: It is right on the water and a great location. Close to restaurants and all the activity on Fishermans Wharf .

review.title: Great hotel and close to everything.
review.reviewText: It was wonderful. The staff was excellent and very helpful.

managementResponses.response:
It's wonderful to read "wonderful!"
And a happy bday again to your girlfriend. I look forward to sharing this with the team, and with the thoughtful concierge in particular. But now you have me craving CAKE!!! :)

review.title: Argonaut - a great place
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the Argonaut. The hotel is well situated but more importantly we were made to feel very welcome - from the free beer and wine each day and the little note and cake left in the room on my girlfriend's birthday to the concierge confirming our dinner reservations without us even asking her to, the staff made the stay as effortless as possible. Would definitely return.

review.title: great location all the comforts at you finger tips
review.reviewText:
right from the door man greeting us, to the bell boy to the housekeeping making you feel welcome and at home. The rooms suited our taste from comfort to decor to the extras in the room.
The bed with the pillow top and the feather blanket, not to mention the pillow..ah the pillow, which i will be ordering! More comfortable than my own bed at home! The decor was nautical, which suited the view out our window of the ocean and pier. The cute fuzzy robes and soft, not to mention, lavender smelling towels!!!
The wine reception in lobby with free wine, we never did catch, but we would have, if we'd been around the hotel at that time! I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!!! It added to our experience of San Franciso, without a doubt
review.negativeRemarks: front desk people did things to help, but weren't as smiley and friendly as door man, bellboys or cleaners/could hear through wall of room way to easy
review.locationRemarks: i felt like you were right at the end of the touristy, busy area, which was nice. i didn't want to be in the centre of all that.

review.title: Perfect hotel for a family stay
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was such a great find for our family trip to San Francisco. The hotel is gorgeous, stylish and well appointed with nice places to sit and enjoy a glass of wine or take a break at the end of the day. The staff were so friendly, and especially attentive to our kids who both looked forward to returning to the hotel each day with updates for their 'friends' at the bell stand. High-fives and visits to the treasure chest always followed. The room was comfortable, spacious and had everything we needed to be comfortable during our stay. The kids even got to 'take care' of a goldfish for the duration! Just part of the kids' welcome - which also included kid-sized animal print robes (to match our own) and a scavenger hunt through the lobby. All around just a fantastic place to stay, and while the Wharf area is very heavily touristed, we felt that the hotel was perfectly situated for all of our exploring and we could truly escape the crowds into our own oasis. The Blue Mermaid restaurant was also one of the highlights with equally friendly staff, great food and excellent value. Highly recommend it - and we'll be back on our next visit to the City!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything - top to bottom, a perfect stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!

review.title: Central to everything we wanted to do.
review.reviewText: Nice room. Cleaned every day. Quiet hallways. Would have liked it if the room faced the wharf. Staff very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to sites of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Facing the bay. The hotel can't do anything about this but there are too many homeless beggers on the street.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. Walk to "Hop on Hop Off" sightseeing bus stop. Walk to cable cars. Good food within walking distance.

review.title: Excellent Service, Excellent Location,Dog Friendly
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel twice now. Both times the experience has been terrific. It is located at the west end of the Fisherman's Wharf venues, close to the Galleries and Port of SF Museum. Lots of variety in the restaurants. Close to the Cable Cars and with easy access to other transportation. Wine social at 5 PM every day. The friendly atmosphere that is created by the staff of the hotel effects the guest with an openness that feels like "family."
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: First time visit to San Francisco & after touring all over the area, this hotel was the best - so much history; the old cannery building. The location is the best with very friendly staff, clean, great views, walking distance to the piers & restaurants all around. No need to rent a car. The wine tasting was a very pleasant surprise, nice touch!!
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything in the Wharf.

review.title: Close to tourist area
review.reviewText:
Very friendly comfortable right at the piers
Wine night is a good idea unfortunately could not use out as too busy sightseeing

review.title: view was impressive
review.reviewText: It was our 30th wedding anniversary and we were there for just that reason, our standards were set high. The staff of the Argonaut made it special by making us feel comfortable, being respectful and sharing a smile. The view from our room set the stage. We were central to so many activities enabling to walk everywhere and we did.
review.negativeRemarks: Sitting area in the room by the window

review.title: Nice hotel in Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText:
Hotel was across the Pier in Fisherman's Wharf. Great place to stay if you are in San Francisco for a short stay. It's very busy on weekends.
Many great restaurants walking distance to hotel.
Nautical theme of hotel was very cute. Our room was clean and they had very nice hair and soap products in the rooms for guests.
Loved the free wine tasting in the lobby at 5:30 pm.

review.title: Great location on the water
review.reviewText: It is the perfect location on the water near great restaurants and shops/ and pier 39
review.positiveRemarks: The room is very comfortable. The bathroom and shower were great. The staff was friendly and helpful. The restaurant food was wonderful and casual.
review.negativeRemarks: There needed to be more space in the bathroom to lay out stuff by the sink.
review.locationRemarks: Try the Blue Mermaid, Go up to Russian Hill - Green's Sports Bar, Tradition for drinks, Ozumo for sushi

review.title: Great choice
review.reviewText: Girls weekend trip.....Went with my 2 daughters and 2 of my nieces....it was great
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, great service, and near everything
review.negativeRemarks: Paid for bay view / very small window could not see anything so I would not do that again

review.title: Nice hotel right near the wharf
review.reviewText: Went for a girls weekend-loved the wine reception and the blue mermaid restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the wharf

review.title: Nice hotel, amazing staff, great location...
review.reviewText: We initially saw this hotel during our first San Francisco trip two years ago. We walked into the lobby and noticed it's beautiful decor and knew we had to stay there on our next trip. I was a bit disappointed with our room as it had a strange smell. The staff was great and the location is ideal, but the smell will probably keep me from staying there again!

review.title: Fantastic Staff!!!
review.reviewText: Lavon at the front desk is so wonderful and went above and beyond! The doormen, Stephen, Donovan and John are so welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable! Fantastic experience!!!

review.title: Great Location And Quiet
review.reviewText: The room was very, very clean which is an important issue for me. The beds were fine. No problem sleeping. One thing I do want to mention is Brooke at the concierge desk. She is the go-to girl for anything you want. She was fabulous! The restaurant, The Blue Mermaid, has fantastic food. The crab chowder is to die for!
review.locationRemarks: The location is great. Within walking distance of just about everything, but far enough from the Embarcadero to be quiet for sleeping.

review.title: Anniversary Surprise
review.reviewText: I surprised my wife with a trip to San Francisco, her favorite city for our anniversary. We loved the hotel and spent three days in total relaxation and bliss. We will return!
review.positiveRemarks: The atmosphere and the friendly staff. The location was perfect!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was too expensive so we chose not to bring a car. Came close to picking a different hotel just because of that!
review.locationRemarks: Right on the Warf near the Cannery and Buena Vista two of our favorite places. Good restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: The actual hotel is a converted warehouse that has very spacious rooms and a unique historic ambiance. The location is optimal and the overall experience of staying there is very pleasant so I definitely recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the ambiance because it'a a converted warehouse so the rooms are very spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: no suggestions
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is right on the fisherman's wharf so there are many things to do.

review.title: Close to most activities
review.reviewText: Nice place although the thermostat would not allow continuous airflow and seemed to shut off at midnight.  Since no windows could be opened, made the room a little stuffy in the middle of the night.  Other than that, very nice, clean, friendly staff.

review.title: On Fisherman's Warf w/ great access
review.reviewText: Comfortable clean rooms with helpful staff. Easy access to Warf, trolley and busses.

review.title: Spring is here
review.reviewText: My wife and I have stayed at the Argonaut several times before but will look for another hotel for the next visit. I had a mishap with a tree while skiing and was nursing some sore ribs and the beds were far from comfortable. I thought it was just us but talked to another couple from England and they voiced the same concern. I do not recall the beds being this uncomfortable during prior visits. The location is by far one of the best if you want to be close to the water and like the access to easy walking. When I returned home I talked to my company accountant (Who I had directed to the Argonaut last month) and she advised that they had not been happy with the beds. If location is the thing you are after, then the Argonaut is the place. If it is a good nights sleep then you should look elsewhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Throw out the beds and get new mattresses that are in keeping with what the Hotel costs.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of easy walks and close to the transit stations and Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: In the heart of the action
review.reviewText: We're a family of 4 who stayed in a twin double bedded room. The room was big enough for all of us. The staff were hospitable and eager to help. For the location and size of room the price was ok, but the restaurant and minibar were expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: Very helpful staff - the doorman handed me a towel and a cold bottle of water when I came back from my run.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant v expensive for what you got. Smoke alarm had annoying red flashing light.
review.locationRemarks: Couldn't be better positioned for Fishermans Wharf area. 50m to the cable car, 200ish to the F-line trolley. Lovely walk to the Golden Gate

review.title: Lovely themed hotel in Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Great location, we had twin Queen Beds, with bay view.
review.positiveRemarks: Themed and child friendly. Close to attactions.
review.negativeRemarks: Room and window small, not worth the  for the small view of the bay. Noisy room with fan, plumbing and one of the beds which creaked & groaned.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, aquarium, sea lions on Pier 39, Golden Gate and Alcatraz.

review.title: Wonderful as usual!
review.reviewText: Great location...we stay here each time we visit. Good walking distance to most wharf attractions and transit.

review.title: Overall very nice hotel
review.reviewText: This is the best hotel in the Fisherman's Wharf area, competent friendly staff, very clean, reasonable prices, convienent location.
review.negativeRemarks: Add a microwave to the room
review.locationRemarks: Everything on Fisherman's Wharf!

review.title: Great location for families.
review.reviewText: Great hotel and location! We rented bikes and road in the nearby parks and made our way across the Golden Gate Bridge. Concierge was outstanding and made great dinner recommendations. We enjoyed our stay by the wharf. Parking is around 50 per day so be warned!

review.title: Cool hotel close to everything!
review.reviewText: Stayed w my husband and teenage boys. Had a wonderful. So many places are in walking distance. The staff is very helpful and the daily wine tasting was an added plus!!

review.title: Great hotel, great location, and wonderful staff
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of our honeymoon! We had a suite on the 4th floor. The view was amazing and the room was much larger and nicer than we expected. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. When the bellman found out it was our honeymoon he had a bottle of wine at our choosing brought up to us. The wine hour downstairs was a great way to meet and talk to people also staying at the hotel. It gets busy though so get there early. The hotel was in a great location and within walking distance to a couple of great restaurants, a trolley stop, and a Walgreens. Cabs were very cheap and the hotel staff was willing to do whatever we asked of them. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family, and plan to stay here again if we come back to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the service, and the clean fresh appearance of the hotel. There was so much more included in the hotel than normal!
review.negativeRemarks: More chairs downstairs for wine hour :)
review.locationRemarks: The location is right near Fisherman's Warf and Pier 39. There was no lack of restaurants around either! We loved the Mexican place around the corner!

review.title: A good base
review.reviewText: For the price we expected more. The location is very good. The room was clean and comfortable, just a pity that it was beside the lift with its noise of rushing air every time it moved!. The staff were pleasant and helpful. But we had that wherever we travelled in the US and the Argonaut really offered nothing more. The only common space was a busy and quite dark lobby. Some sort of bar area would have been helpful but the adjunct to the hotel only offered wine tasting and the neighbouring restaurant offered nothing special So all in all I would look for the the same facilities elsewhere for less.
review.negativeRemarks: Common areas
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the cable car and a beach.

review.title: Amazing hotel! We will go there again for sure.
review.reviewText: One of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed at. Great location.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText:
If you don't know San Francisco, you might find everything is so expensive there but in reality, SF is not a cheap city to vacation in. The nightly parking I thought is VERY EXPENSIVE, so best to avoid rental car and use taxi or bicycle. My other complaint was quality of sleeping and the matress was very soft for someone who is not used to it. The staff are very friendly and helpful

I recommend this hotel, only if its location.

review.title: Right in the heart of the tourist area.
review.reviewText:
Spent 7 nights at the Argonaut Hotel. Initially I was not too pleased with the hotel's location - it felt a bit too close to all the noise and congestion associated with the wharf - but after a couple days I started to really appreciate having so many bars and restaurants close by - plus the crowds thinned out considerably after the weekend.

The room was clean  and the staff was very pleasant. Really enjoyed the daily happy hour - very good.

Horrible view from the room - interior room - all we saw from our window was the other rooms without any view and the lobby roof.

The wine tasting room was a joke - expensive and not worth the time or energy.
review.positiveRemarks: The afternoon happy hour was good and the Blue Mermaid Chowder House & Bar connected to the hotel was good for a quick breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was noisey - 4th floor - sounded like an HVAC unit was on the roof directly on top of our room.
review.locationRemarks: Location is right near the Buena Vista Cafe and the Powell Street Hyde cable car - plus you're right next to the bike trail - so location is very good

review.title: Stylish hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: We just spent five nights at the Argonaut. The hotel was decorated beautifully and the rooms were a great size for us and our two kids. We enjoyed having Queen beds! We especially enjoyed the complimentary wine/ beer reception each night in the hotel lobby. They even gave the kids sparkling apple cider so we could all enjoy it! The hotels location was perfect for us with many restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Awesome location, could stand some updating
review.reviewText:
Checked in on Thur left on Monday morning. Great location. Walk west toward Golden Gate bridge, for 4 miles.
Room was clean and well serviced. We got wine at happy hour which was nice. Staff was very friendly. Overall hotel needs some updating, e.g. carpet looks tired, etc. No way to get white noise, repeated efforts to keep the fan going were not successful so made it tough to sleep. Well stock fridge. Business office was a complete ripoff. $7.95 per 15 minutes and 79 cents to print 1 page, are we in the hotel business, or the ripoff your business customers business. I'd still recommend it.

review.title: Great location and friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Would definitely stay there again. Its right on the wharf and a cable car stop is just around the corner.

review.title: Fantastic in every way!
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Quiet but so close to everything. Had the King Suite with view of Alcatraz - such an amazing room. Wine tasting a great touch! No problems ever. Housekeeping does a thorough job. Loved it.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe the elevators could be faster - but no biggie!
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to all the piers, restaurants, and shops on Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Lovely, spotless and great location
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel, amazing beds and great wine hour. Staff were lovely.

review.title: Great location and experience!
review.reviewText: Very charming hotel, with great bell staff, comfy rooms, great location and service. Awesome wine and beer hour. Great concierge.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff could have been more welcoming and ask if there was anything else they could do Restaurant slow with many staff socializing.
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful location. Close to everything and cable cars just out the front door.

review.title: Awesome experience!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut has a fantastic location, close to so many of the tourist attractions we wanted to see. Loved the wine reception! Only problem we had through the whole stay was getting a taxi on check-out morning. We asked to book a cab the night before but were told it was not necessary, then waited over half an hour (before dawn!) for one to come.

review.title: Great location for visitors to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel is located just a short walk from Pier 39 and is perfect for visitors who want to spend a few days enjoying San Francisco. Rooms are spacious and clean - our one had a great view of the golden gate bridge across the water. Just outside the hotel you can jump on a cable car and ride up to china town which is a bustling hive of activity, if you do enjoy a drink at some great dive bars like LiPo or Budda bar - excellent way to meet some local characters.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel is slighly pricey for what it offers - but that said it is in a prime location so that maybe explains the premium.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, cable car ride, views of the golden gate bridge, shopping and great bars and resturants

review.title: Walking distance to MANY sights!
review.reviewText: We were so impressed with the nautical theme throughout the building. We LOVED the room decor. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff went over and above to ensure our stay was pleasant. Friendly door men greeting you and made sure you were heading in the right direction. We enjoyed the wine tasting and relaxed in the lobby's meeting area many times! The Mermaid restaurant in the building had consistenly excellent service and food. I'd definitly return to the Argonaut the next time I'm travelling to SanFrancisco!
review.negativeRemarks: More bikes available for loan.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car, Fisherman's Wharf, restaurants, park, Ghiradelli Square all within 5 minute walk!

review.title: Great for families and close to lots of fun stuff
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful, close to the beach, pier 39 and many foods of your choice. It was perfect for myself, husband and 2 young daughters. The rooms were clean, comfortable and quite at night. I recommend the resturant in lobby, best chowder.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great location to beach, pier 39, food, Starbucks ( my fav) , Ghirardelli square and much more

review.title: My Alcatraz dream visit/honeymoon!
review.reviewText: The hotel for us was great , all the amenities close to hand, plus all the sites. we did not have a car so where hotel was for us was great , just a sort walk for all you wont to do & see.
review.positiveRemarks: Where the hotel was situated plus staff so helpful. The beds to dye for, rooms great size.
review.negativeRemarks: We arrived late flight so missed the tour of the hotel, would have been nice to be shown round. Suppose if we asked they would have arranged it.
review.locationRemarks: You can see Alcatraz from hotel plus piers , you are at the start of the strip.

review.title: Keep looking there is better out there
review.reviewText: We stayed in a double queen Only three pillows per bed which were all feather so they are like having nothing and the beds were very hard no give at all. The worst experience was when we checked out. We had valet park our car $46 a night. We didn't need it for the last two days. It took over a half hour to get our car because they claimed the night before they had I to move it to a lot 4 blocks down. If we didn't use out car for the past two days why the night before check out did they move ours. Park the new ones coming in 4 blocks over. Needless to say we were 40 minutes behind schedule getting to a very busy airport. I will NOT recommend this hotel. There are way nicer more convient ones to stay when visiting San Francisco

managementResponses.response:
Hi, Tiff,
Thanks for the feedback about the hotel and restaurant. I'm sorry that the hostess did not provide a more warm and timely welcome to you. We'll definitely take a look at that! The bed issue is an odd one because the mattresses are Sealy pillowtops. I occasionally hear they are too soft, so something must be broken for the bed to feel hard. If you have a moment to drop me a line with the room number, I'd be happy to remove the linen and mattress pad and give the bed a full inspection to get to the bottom of this! Thank you.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: The beds were so hard that both my husband and I awoke with back pain. The headboard had not been cleaned and seemed to have some stains. The some of the staff members were nice and tried to be helpful. We tried to eat at the Blue Mermaid, but we found ourselves waiting for 5 minutes before we even got a rushed acknowledgement that someone would attend to us momentarily, and another 5 minutes passed before we decided to leave and walk across the street to another restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds and service at the restaurant. The hallways smelled a little strange as well.
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz, restaurants, etc.

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Traveler! I'm sorry about the maintenance issues, though I am happy everything was fixed so quickly. We aim to please!

review.title: Great Hotel on Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: Our experience was excellent. There were a few minor maintenance problems that were corrected immediately.
review.positiveRemarks: The location made it easy to get to the sites we wanted to see.
review.negativeRemarks: The room could have two chairs for sitting, instead of just one.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for telling everyone to stay at the Argonaut, Liz! We're happy that you loved the charms of our historic building and of course the prime location. But why did you have to get me thinking about chowder and ice cream sundaes?! Yum... that sea salt caramel sundae sounds amazing!!

review.title: Close to everything!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a wonderful boutique hotel that is next to everything you need to see and do in San Francisco. It sits at the end of the Wharf on Hyde and Jefferson. Because it was an old Cannery warehouse before it became a hotel it has a distinct charm with the red brick building and railroad ties that are found in the room. Starbucks is on the corner, Ben and Jerrys and The Blue Mermaid eatery has awarding winning clam chowder. You can visit Hyde Pier for a boat exhibit , go to Ghirardellis for a sea salt carmel sundae or catch a cable car ride to Union Station and China Town this is all next door to the hotel. The front desk and valet people were nice, friendly and accommodating. The hotel has two bikes and if you get down to the lobby early enough you can take them complimentary of the hotel. They have a wine reception in the evening for guests in the lobby. The downside is the parking, there is none. They have a valet to park your vehicle and an overnight fee within/out privileges. Next time I would decline the car rental and use public transportation for San Francisco. Its cheaper and more cost effective. Stay at the Argonaut!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Biking to the Golden Gate Bridge, Hyde Pier, Fishermans Wharf, Starbucks, In and Out Burger, Ghirardellis, Alcatraz is a 20 min walk.

review.title: Nice Hotel - close for walking around
review.reviewText: Location was great for walking to Fisherman's Wharf, Trolly, and Lombard Street. Restaurant has best Chowder in town. Did not like the toiletry set up. They should leave more room in fridge for personal items - instead is was packed full of mini bar charge items. Our only other dislike was we had a middle room and courtyard had a less attractive view than courtyard at Alcatraz - they should plant something or put something of interest out there?
review.negativeRemarks: Courtyard, Room in Fridge, Toiltries
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Trolly, Fisherman's Wharf, Peir 39, Lombard Street

review.title: Overall, Very nice hotel!
review.reviewText: Love the nautical theme, the decor, accommodating staff and the restaurant. What was especially disappointing were structural problems, like plumbing issues. For a boutique hotel at this price point, I expected more. Despite those issues, I would still recommend this hotel. It was in the center of numerous restaurants and activity, and the staff was sooo accommodating. Overall it was a pleasure staying there.
review.negativeRemarks: Structural problems like plumbing.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants, bike rentals, tours to Alcatraz and the aquarium are all in walking distance.

managementResponses.response: Thanks, Crystal. We appreciate your understanding about the tight parking situation in SF. Hotels average $45-50/night for valet, so, if possible, it can be a good savings to take cabs and public transit around the city. And there's nothing like a ferry boat or cable car!

review.title: Very nice!
review.reviewText: Very nice location, very friendly staff. Hated having to pay for parking and no breakfast, but such is San Francisco. Clean, nice hotel. Very pet-friendly. Free wine reception for an hour each night was very nice!

review.title: Great hotel with amazing bay view
review.reviewText: Amazing hotel with beautiful bay view, great location, wonderful staff

managementResponses.response:
Hi, Nana,
I see that you are a "room with a view" gal and would definitely enjoy our Deluxe or Bay View rooms. In the meantime, I'm happy you got to enjoy the waterfront vistas from your free bike rental! We offer that every day (weather permitting) on a first-come, first-serve basis. We also have a free nightly wine party where many guests like to trade their tourist tips, favorite restaurants, etc.

review.title: Do NOT book their standard room.
review.reviewText: I booked here for the bay view. But, my room had no view! It faced to a wall! That made me so depressed. However, I really liked the Fisherman's Wharf. I rent a bicycle just located at the hotel. Riding a bike along the bay would make you forget everything and get a real relax.:)

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: This hotel was beautiful and comfortable. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful and they had a free wine happy hour each evening :)
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, beautiful architecture, friendly staff!
review.locationRemarks: near the fisherman's wharf activities, but also convenient to public transit via cable cars and trolleys

managementResponses.response: Hooray! Thanks for letting us know we made the hubby's big 4-0 special :).

review.title: 40th Birthday
review.reviewText: This was our third time staying at the Argonaut and as always the staff were great. My husband told them it was my birthday weekend and they made the stay extra special. The location of the hotel is perfect for Fisherman's Wharf and easy to catch public transportation to other parts of the city.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to everything
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay. Have two children 9-12 and two Q room was comfortable for us.

review.title: Great location, so close to everything
review.reviewText: The beds were amazing! Had a bay view room, very nice.

review.title: Charming Hotel Near Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: As a gift for our 30th Anniversary my husband booked a surprise trip for us during March break to one of the cities I have been dreaming about seeing since my early 20's, San Francisco. He found a great deal through Expedia.ca. The trip included airfare and hotel accommodation down by the wharf in this beautiful city! The hotel is known as the Argonaut, it is a Kimpton Hotel. It is also situated in the heart of the bay area surrounded by the water to one side and the wharf to the other. Alcatraz is within view from the hotel. We arrived on a Saturday night to a warm welcome and a bottle of Champagne with 2 glasses and a lovely hand written card from the staff of the hotel welcoming us and wishing us a Happy Anniversary and a great stay! We were just thrilled by that gesture and by the smiles and warm hello's once we arrived at the hotel. The hotel also made arrangements for a driver to pick us up at the airport which was such a bonus. Although we paid for this service it was worth every penny to have someone meet us at the gate of the airport, and help us with our bags and get us safely to our hotel. I felt like a movie star! The hotel staff helped us with all our day trips and were always friendly and willing to assist us if we had any questions regarding sight seeing or other issues. Also in the evenings the hotel has a wine tasting hour which is fantastic for anyone who would like to meet other people staying in the hotel. I felt very much at home in this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was in the perfect location for everything you would like to do. It's near the ocean, it's walking distance to pretty much everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Personally I didn't find anything wrong with the hotel at all, it was lovely! If I could have anything else it would have been a pool!
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in a fantastic location, near the ocean and a beach. And near the Powell and Market cable cars. Also close to the sightseeing tours.

review.title: Great Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We arrived late on our check in day but they had the room at the ready. Everything was great from the room ammenities, the view of Alcatraz, to breakfast in the Blue Mermaid.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location. Close to everything at the Wharf, but still private when you needed it to be private.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking to everything, the Golden Gate Bridge, Ghiradelli Square, The Piers, Trolley Cars

managementResponses.response: Thanks, traveler. I know just what you mean! When on business, it can be great to stay at a boutique hotel out of the "seriousness' of downtown or the financial district. Better to be surrounded by flips flops and bike rentals than by badges and briefcases any day ;)!

review.title: Great spot to mix business with pleasure.
review.reviewText: Great hotel and location. Very helpful and friendly staff.

review.title: Most enjoyable week I have ever spent in a hotel.
review.reviewText:
We loved staying with you. Beautiful historic building, exceptional staff, wonderful location. You really made us
feel welcome.
review.negativeRemarks: hard to come up with anything. maybe a few more seats at happy hour.
review.locationRemarks: could not have picked a better location.so much to do close to hotel. And public transportation for everything else nearby . very safe neighborhood.

review.title: Perfect location at the wharf
review.reviewText: Very impressed with the Argonaut Hotel. Our room was very nice and the wharf location was perfect for our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The nautical decor was nice; location to wharf area excellent
review.locationRemarks: Walkable to all wharf sites and Ghirardelli Square

review.title: Gorgeous Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel did not disappoint. It has beautiful decor with a nautical theme. Our room was delightful and immaculately clean. Our first reaction walking in was wow! We have stayed in many hotels, some with larger rooms but without the charm of this one. We were right on Fisherman's Wharf beside the cable car turn a round and the marine museum. It doesn't get any better than that. There was complimentary wine in the lobby for guests between 5 and 6. Dinner at the Blue Mermaid was quite good, the crab and corn chowder was delicious. Our only small complaint was the steep cost of calling long distance from our room...lesson learned. Other than that, I don't thing we could stay anywhere else downtown SF after being spoiled here. We definitely would recommend this gorgeous hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Fisherman's Wharf...cable cars, submarine and liberty ship tours, Alcatraz Island etc.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Location, location, location!!! Perfect location for all tourist activities. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.
review.locationRemarks: Warf, cable cars, plenty of restaurant to choose from.

review.title: Enjoyed the stay
review.reviewText:
Location was wonderful. We wanted to stay at a hotel that was close to Alcatraz, pier 39, trolly cars and the fisherman a wharf.
The hotel was very clean, well kept and the nautical theme was slightly cheesy but at the same time fitting. Didn't eat at the restaurant. So many great places to eat along the wharf.

review.title: Excellent hotel in a superb location
review.reviewText: Rooms on the back side are quiet but you do not have the sea and Golden Gate view
review.negativeRemarks: Ask for GGate view

review.title: Excellent stay, close to everything
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Argonaut to be close to our 3:30 Alcatraz tour. Due to some travel constraints, we arrived at the hotel with only minutes to spare. The head valet grabbed our bags, popped us in a cab, and told the driver to book it to Pier 33. We arrived on time for our tour, and when we returned, we found our bags safely placed in our room and a free wine reception waiting downstairs. Overall great experience.

review.title: Location!
review.reviewText: Hotel is located within walking distance to everything, cable cars, restaurants, etc. Special thank you to Brook, at the concierge desk, for all her helpful information. We enjoyed the wine reception every evening at 5 pm.

review.title: A few days in SF
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is in a great location for wandering around the city. The hotel itself is wonderful and we would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great location, great staff...definitely recommend
review.reviewText:
Great spot
Highly recommend
Bayview not worth the money
Staff great
Wine reception is not worth any time or effort wine is barely drinkeable

review.title: Perfect Hotel on FIshermans Warf
review.reviewText: This is a lovely hotel, clean and cute! The staff is fantastic-hats off to concierge team, they did a great job. Highly recommend to anyone visiting San Francisco!!
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was a bit soft-but it certainlly didn't ruin the trip.

review.title: Best hotel on Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel is not like any other. Polite and pleasant staff, unique with a nautical-themed atmosphere, and we felt like we were part of a family during our stay. We were provided with the best directions, and help with organizing our sight-seeing adventures during our stay. The hotel restaurant had the finest chowder and house wine we ever tasted. Plus free wine hour in the lobby was awesome! Located right on Fisherman's Wharf was a bonus. We never wanted for anything! The staff was most impressive. We felt like we said good-bye to friends when we left. What an experience for a hotel stay that we thought was just going to be there to sleep!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was the best and the beds were the most comfortable sleep ever. Free wine from 5-6 pm didn't hurt either :) Loved the nautical theme.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: The location on Fisherman's Wharf in the heart of San Francisco is the best along with shops and restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Nice for a weekend away
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a fantastic location, the wine reception and hot chocolate bars were very nice surprises. the staff are great, just beware most of the rooms have windows that look onto an internal void.
review.locationRemarks: There are great things to do nearby, Fishermans Wharf, great restaurants and art galleries.

photos.caption: from our room thats Alcatraz in the fog

review.title: almost perfect
review.reviewText:
Just got back, Feb 13 - 18. 2014.
The first impression was good and it continued. The staff was friendly and helpful.. The rooms are modern and clean. Not the biggest rooms, but ok. A few noises here and there. Not major. Beds are comfortable. Not too much bad to say really. The WiFi is bad - slow if it worked at all. The 5:00 wine tasting every night is a great idea. Grab a glass of wine and get ready for dinner. Its a nice, comfortable hotel. No bad issues.
But the Argonaut could have, it doesn't, but it could have some major faults and still be forgiven because of its perfect location. Out your front door is the wharf and all its entertainment. Its at the end and out of "some" of the crowd. Not all for sure. Cable cars just up the next block. Pier 39 a short walk the other way. And in between the Alcatraz cruise pier. Vendors for tours everywhere. My advice, go, take all the tours you can afford and fit into your schedule. We did. Napa - Sanoma, Muir woods - Sausalito, Alcatraz, Bay cruise, Cable cars, Pier 39, Ghiordelli Sq, etc etc...All the reasons you would stay on the wharf are close to the Argonaut.
Yes, if I go back to San Fran I would stay at the Argonaut.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi

review.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel in the heart of San Fran
review.reviewText: From the moment we drove up to the door to the send off, we were amazed by this unique hotel and wonderful staff!
review.positiveRemarks: We loved: casual but elegant atmosphere, location, staff, restaurant, cleanliness, happy hours.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, cable car station, Ghiradelli Square, tours to Muir Woods, Saucalito, wine country

review.title: Expensive catches, inexperienced guides
review.reviewText:
Great place but we were just beside Barking dogs. You don't expect to pay such a price and be wake up at nights by such animals.

Expensive catches, staff friendly but not so helpful.

Nice stay overall. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't use the phone in the room, you'll be charged 18$ for a 30 seconds call. Local calls are free but no warning if your call is long distance.
review.locationRemarks: For orientation guidance and transports in San Francisco, use your own resources. The lady near the front desk doesn't know much.

review.title: Excellent Hotel by the Fisherman Wharf
review.reviewText: At the heart of the historical fisherman wharf is this gem of a hotel. This naval themed hotel was a bit hit for my two young kids, who thoroughly enjoy the little things like the treasure chest filled with toys in the front desk to the compass headboard in their room The room was spacious and clean, and it comfortably fit two cribs with room to spare. To have the building adjoined with the San Francisco Maritime National Historic Park was a pleasant bonus. Furthermore, it was well situated where walgreens, restaurants and attractions such as the sea lions at pier 39 where all within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in the best location!!!
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel experience! Stayed with my boyfriend 2/14-2/16 and had the best time. Hotel staff was super friendly, very helpful and the room was very comfortable and clean! Location was the best overall, great walking distance to a variety of activities. We didn't have to drive anywhere this weekend, we just walked! Surprised by the great museums, art galleries and the maritime history the Wharf had to offer. Really interesting history and culture. And we got a free upgrade on top of it!!
review.positiveRemarks: The happy hour in the lounge was an excellent surprise! Especially after a long flight and traffic trying to get to the hotel, a nice drink was great!
review.locationRemarks: Beware of the restaurants in the surrounding area. Super expensive and the food was mediocre at best. Try and get out of the area to eat if you can.

review.title: A clean comfy character hotel in a superb location
review.reviewText: The only reason I haven't rated this as excellent was room service finished at 10:30pm on Sunday night and I'd only just arrived because of a flight delay of six hours.

review.title: Nice hotel by the bay
review.reviewText: Customer service was excellent. Rooms were clean. I did think I was going to have a room with a ocean view, I did not, however there is so much to do around the area it really did not matter.
review.negativeRemarks: People above us were very noisy. Could hear them 2 of the nights we were there.

review.title: What a great place
review.reviewText:
I would recommend the bayview rooms. Waking up and looking out a window across the bay was amazing.
The whole place was wonderful

review.title: Trendy hotel with added extras
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location for all SF attractions. It has a great atmosphere and some nice extra touches like the complementary wine hour. Staff all very responsive to any request.
review.negativeRemarks: An on site gym would have been nice. Breakfast included in rate.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Peer 39 and ferry to Alcatraz. Also two steps away from the Cable car. A must!

review.title: Beautiful hotel with friendliness of family
review.reviewText: Great location for cable car; ghirardelli square; fishermans wharf;pier 39 etc. also on flat!

review.negativeRemarks: Having your staff keep a birthday party secret. This was for a surprise for my wif's Bithday and he let the cat out of the bag... waa!
review.locationRemarks: We have stayed weith you several times before

review.title: Great friendly hotel, great San Fran City base
review.reviewText: We stayed in jan 2014 with our three children and had a wonderful stay at the Argonaut. It's location in fishermans wharf means you're not only close to all the sights you also have a ringside view of the city. The concierge and doorman went out of their way to help make our stay so great, and they helped us plan great day trips around the city. Happy hour at the bar each afternoon is also a great way to start the evening.

review.title: Located right on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
This little beauty was well located right near where the trolley cars turnaround at the wharf. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. The lobby reception area was very beautiful and very comfortable to sip a glass of wine or cider which is offered every afternoon.

The rooms too were beautifully decorated and made our stay in San Francisco all the more enjoyable!
review.locationRemarks: Well as stated previously, the hotel sits at one end of Fisherman's Wharf near where the trolley cars turn around.

review.title: Great place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived through collecting our bags after a trip to wine country, the staff were fantastic. The rooms are very spacious, well appointed and the nautical theme a "hoot" making the stay even more special. Great for families.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything and the fact that the cable car stop was across the road.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great location at Fisherman's wharf, in the heart of the action and only an interesting cable car ride away from downtown.

review.title: Short stay made worthwhile
review.reviewText: There's nothing I can say about the hotel except how wonderful it was. I was only there for 3 days but the staff were so friendly and helpful. The hotel was in the perfect location for what we needed. Definitely try the hotel's restaurant, The Blue Mermaid. They have great chowder.
review.locationRemarks: A short walk to Pier 39.Across the street from Hyde Street Pier. A block up is The Buena Vista caf and Ghirardelli Square and the cable car stop.

review.title: Enjoyed the location of the hotel
review.reviewText: We felt the room was too small with a huge king bed in there. There was a lack of sitting area in room. We enjoyed the cocktail hour, nice to get bottled beer instead of a cheap tap beer. The lobby decor was nice but the clam chowder in the restaurant was lacking. We were a little surprised that the cleaning crew did not get to our room until 3:30 pm. Overall for the money I'm not sure I would stay there again.

review.title: Very good location
review.reviewText:
Close to cable car turn around../F- line streetcar...
Expensive valet parking daily rate..
Asked to have a wake up call on the day we had to check out... Never had one...

review.title: Great hotel in a perfect location.
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel, it had everything! It was close to trams and buses, close to some tourist areas but not too close. Also, there was free wifi and free wine and beer every night for happy hour. The room was really nice, very clean and comfortable and the staff were always helpful. This was the best hotel we stayed in on our trip across the US.

review.title: Central to wharf, tourist sites and transport
review.reviewText:
All staff were extremely friendly and helpful.
Was recommended this hotel by a friend and am so glad we stayed here. Highly recommend
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel has great ambiance, facilities and little extras, such as wine reception each afternoon, hot chocolate during the day.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, keep up the little extras like the wine reception. They add the sparkle
review.locationRemarks: The hotel location was great, next to tram into Union square, near to bike path and short walk to attractions of Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Raiders Game
review.reviewText: We came to San Francisco to go to the Raiders/Broncos game on Sunday. A friend had recommended the Argonaut. GREAT location. We loved that. We are planning on staying at the Harbor Court hotel in September. I love the Embarcadero area. The staff at the Argonaut was wonderful from the bell caption to the desk clerk.
review.positiveRemarks: It's location, decor, and the restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: The price of wine in the wine tasting room.
review.locationRemarks: The Wharf and walking over to Ghiradelli. That was so nice.

review.title: No view from the 2nd floor
review.reviewText:
I booked this room as part of our family Christmas vacation. I was told we'd have a view of the bay etc.
There was only a view of the restaurant across the street. I immediately got grief from my wife.
I asked to change rooms but all they could offer was a $25 credit.

review.title: Right on the wharf, great location
review.reviewText: Easy check in, helpful staff, right on the wharf, great view of the Golden Gate Bridge.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the Historic Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, Lombard Street. Pet friendly.

review.title: Comfort and wise accomodtions
review.reviewText: Warm and pleasant. Nice decor and close to all things on the wharf

review.title: Wonderful weekend with my teenagers!
review.reviewText: I selected the Argonaut Hotel primarily for its location. I was having a Christmas weekend with my teenage daughters and two neices and wanted someplace they could venture out from and not be faced with homeless vagrants on every corner. The area was perfect for walking to the wharf, little italy and other nearby sites. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. But I cannot say enough about the hotel's staff! They were friendly, helpful and gave us execellent directions, dinner suggestions, and other little tips to make our stay terrific. The Valet guys were very gracious and even a little entertaining while we drove them crazy zipping in and out with two cars! I would highly recommend this hotel for families or for just a couple wanting a romantic weekend away!
review.positiveRemarks: The decor, the friendly service, the security, and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds were a little too firm.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf, the Piers, Ghiradelli Square, Columbus street with it plethora of Italian restaurants, Lombard street, cable cars, etc.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We loved the location of this hotel right on the main street in Fisherman's Wharf, close to everything. Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Pet friendly hotel so be prepared to encounter A LOT of pets in this building. View was a little disappointing as we were on the second floor which was actually partly below street level, we had to keep the room closed and dark so people on the street couldnt look in. But we were very happy with the hotel and would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Would be cool if there was an entrance to Starbucks from inside the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Everything!!

review.title: Great wharf location
review.reviewText: Overall experience was very nice. The location is excellent in the heart of the wharf. Centrally located to cable cars, tour buses and F line which make it easy to see the entire city.
review.locationRemarks: So much to do in the wharf area. Easy walk to north beach for great dining.

review.title: Very nice hotel, modern and well located.
review.reviewText: Very pleased overall

review.title: Nice Hotel In the Cannery
review.reviewText: Great staff. Small but very nice room. Very quiet. Comfortable bed. Very nice staff. Close to Pier 39 &Ghirardelli Square. In the Cannery.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to many sights. Very quiet, great for a good night's sleep after a fun day seeing the sights in San Francisco.

review.title: Situation Perfect
review.reviewText:
Having no idea where to stay in San Francisco and going through stacks of hotel reviews, comparing the rates etc we eventually decided on the Argonaut.

Our criteria was that it had to be central, close to transport, not too touristy and most of all quiet. The Argonaut ticked all the boxes. The rooms were quite large and the room could be darkened down quite well. This was great as we had flown from Australia (20+ hours).

I don't think we could have picked any better as it's at the far end of Fisherman's Wharf and close to the Girehldi (sic) Chocolate place. Because of the dead end street the hotel doesn't have a lot of traffic, although this could be busier in summer.

There is a cable car close by and good restaurants.

It was also nice to chat to other guests at the 'happy hour' in the afternoon with wine tasting. A nice way to end a hard day sight-seeing.
review.positiveRemarks: It was quiet and well appointed. I also liked the provision of lots of power-points to recharge mobiles, cameras and lap tops.
review.locationRemarks: Location is at the end of Fisherman's Wharf well away from the heavy touristy area. It has a cable car station nearby and there's great walks also.

review.title: Great Hotel/Great Location
review.reviewText:
We stayed a week at the hotel and it was one of the best trips our family has ever had. A large part of this was the hotel's location and the staff's willingness to help us with whatever we needed. (The Concierge and front desk were awesome) This hotel is walking distance to the wharf, At&T park, Ghirardelli Square, Lombard street, trolley cars, Candlestick transportation, etc.
The only negatives were the parking fee for our rental and the exuberant prices for the snack prices placed in our room.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the story behind the hotel and it's eclectic decor. I also really enjoyed the restaurant at the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: I'd really like to see parking included with the booking price and the cash bar prices lowered to "at cost" to the customer.
review.locationRemarks: If I had to do it over again I would not rent a car and use public transportation for my stay. This hotel is in the main HUB of all SF activities.

review.title: Great location. Lovely old renovated building.
cutest hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.positiveRemarks: The room was very clean, quiet and beautifully decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The room amenities are of a high quality.
review.negativeRemarks: It was a little more expensive than the average room but it was worth spending the extra money.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything you could want in Fisherman's Wharf and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

review.positiveRemarks: Its closeness to everything. Across the street you can ride a street car. Six blocks is Lombard street. Nine blocks is Chinatown and Pier 39
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger, wider bathtubs.
review.locationRemarks: You must check out Alcatraz. It was the best part of our trip and well worth the money.

review.title: Cool boutique hotel right on Embarcadero
review.reviewText: Stayed here with my wife for the Fri-Sat-Sun weekend. Would definitely stay again. Be sure and ask for a goldfish for your room! :)
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and helpful staff, clean hotel, enjoyed the nautical motif and the exposed warehouse architecture (just the right mix). Excellent location.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the touristy area of the wharf, next to Hyde trolley, by Ghiradelli Square, walking dist to Wharf, Pier 39, Seals, Ferry, Bay, Shops.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: It convenient and a neat place to stay.

review.title: Location, Location, Location. Can not be beat.
review.reviewText:
Location, Location. Location. Couldn't be better. The best location in The City for a "touristy" kind of visit to the most beautiful city in the world. Loved the authentic and original beams and bricks in our room.

The staff -- especially the Doormen -- were the best part of the experience. Funny, knowledgable, outgoing... My kids loved 'em.

The "wine hour" was wonderful.

Only gripe: the heating/cooling system, which kept us up the first night. Blankets kept going on/off, on/off... as the room was alternately too hot/too cold... But that was, overall, a minor gripe. Understandable when engineering a modern boutique hotel into a century+ old brick building. It's part of the experience, I guess... Second and third nights were better. Maybe we just had better control of the thermostat.

Bottom Line: Argonaut Rocks. Tumbling out of bed, having good in-room coffee, and then stumbling out the front door to the incredible San Francisco Bay (at its best angle) right in your face... a memory for a lifetime.

We will be back.
review.negativeRemarks: In-room AC/heating. Well, it could be cheaper. But then, there's that""Location, Location, Location" thing... You get what you pay for.
review.locationRemarks: Location: Perfect. Things to do: For the tourist, "everything."

review.title: Great location in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean and comfortable. Easy check-in and in great location. Nice views of Bay and even a glimpse of Alcatraz.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and nautical theme throughout the hotel and surrounding area.
review.negativeRemarks: Did not encounter any issues that need improvement
review.locationRemarks: Right in Fisherman's Wharf. Everything is nearby.

review.title: Awesome location!
review.reviewText: I live near SF and like to spend a few nights there every few months with my kids. I stay at different hotels and this one is definitely one that we will go back to. It is a small hotel but has a hosted wine hour with cider fir the kids. The area that it's located in has been updated and you are in walking distance to fisherman's wharf, great restaurants and the cable car is right next door to take you to Union Square for shopping. Also walk over to Buena Vista for iris coffees.. yum

Fantastic hotel. Excellent location in Fisherman's Wharf, right next to the cable car stop. We really enjoyed the nightly happy hour and the chowder from the restaurant was delicious. Would definately recommend and stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Enjoyed the nautical theme and extra touches such as birthday wine and chocolates for my mother.
review.negativeRemarks: Better tea and coffee making facilities in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Located in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, a short walk to Pier 39, Alcatraz Landing, cable car depot and the City Sightseeing buses.

review.title: Great hotel in a perfect location!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was the perfect location right across the street from the water in Fisherman's Wharf. There is a free wine and beer happy hour every evening. The nautical theme of the hotel was perfect for the location. All staff at the hotel were very accommodating and friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, great view of Alcatraz

review.title: Always a great stay
review.reviewText: This is the second Kimpton Hotel I've stayed in. Both were great experiences. The argonaut changed my bedding on check in because I'm allergic to down. They were great. Room was perfect. Had a view of Alcatraz.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Tea facilities
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to cable car, chocolate factory and Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Best Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: This is by far the best hotel experience we have had! The hotel was 5 star all the way from the bell hops, the super clean rooms, to the free wine power hour! We would definitely stay here again!

review.title: A great stay for the value!
review.reviewText: A great stay! Awesome staff! The wine reception was fun-apple cider for my 4 year old and a treasure chest with goodies-choose a rubber ducky. Lost the rubber ducky at dinner and the front desk sent another one up just in time for bath. Clean room, soft beds, quiet hallways, prompt room service, great location... The only downside was it took about 20 minutes to get our car out of valet.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel & Location
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, friendly & professional staff. Across the street from the waterfront & easy walking distance to sight seeing, restaurants & shopping.
review.positiveRemarks: First class, but not stuffy or pretentious.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast restaurant did not open until 7:00
review.locationRemarks: Sight see, walk, shop, dine, visit the waterfront, aquarium, curios, everything

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great staff
