Amazing staff and good location if you want to be right in the middle of all the touristy fishermans wharf stuff. Kind of far from the other neighbourhoods and downtown.

review.title: Close to all waterfront activities.
review.reviewText:
Quaint, nautical, boutique hotel in the ultra-touristy Fisherman's Wharf. Close to all the SF activities that you can fit in. We walked to Alcatraz Cruises, strolled the Wharf at all different times right out the front door. We hit up The Buena Vista Cafe (1 blk) and Ghiradelli Square (blks).

We took advantage of the free bikes from the concierge (be there at least 5-10 mins early as they open at 8am sharp and they only have 6 bikes) to ride over to Chesnut Street for breakfast, across the Golden Gate bridge to Sausalito then ferried back and was just down the Wharf from hotel.

Front desk staff awesome for any advice and questions. Concierge services great info. Brenda was a bevy of info. Ernie at the bell station great info. Both secret foodies with good recommendations. Hit them both up. Cannot beat FREE 5-6pm wine and Anchor Steam beer in lobby every night.

Blue Mermaid good happy hour, but did not sample further to give honest opinion. Rooms perfect for a visit to SF. All the comforts, with nautical charm. Only had interior view, however not bothered. Within 10 minutes taxi ride to all popular restaurant areas of SF. Would revisit this property for its location, charm and professional feeling without being stuffy.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf. Chestnut Street. Golden Gate Bridge. All restaurant districts.

review.title: Nice hotel in the Cannery
review.reviewText: We have stayed twice now at The Argonaut Hotel and the accommodations are very nice. The only complaint I had was the second time we stayed in a room adjacent to the main street and it was quite loud until 1-2 AM. Just something I would stay aware of for the next time. Aside from that the accommodations are truly nice and very convenient to Cannery Row and Ghiradelli Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide for open windows for fresh air if the city code would allow.
review.locationRemarks: Numerous restaurants and San Francisco highlights in the wharf area. Very scenic location in the Giradelli Square area.

review.negativeRemarks: I never had the thought "that could be improved." Very satisfied with everything.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square, Cable car. All easy walking distance.

review.title: perfect experience
review.reviewText: perfect location,lots of character, ambience,wonderful
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: fisherman's wharf, presidio,great restaurants,at the heart of everything

review.title: Great location, great hotel!
review.reviewText: We live two hours south of San Francisco and have been to the city many times. We were pleased to find that the Argonaut Hotel is right next to The Buena Vista, a "must go" SF experience known for their Irish coffee. This hotel is within walking distance to all the action down on Pier 39. We had amazing seafood down on the wharf & even took a fairy boat over to Sausalito. The Argonaut Hotel's employees had unique uniforms on and they were friendly and helpful. The decor is nautical and every fixture and wall hanging is beautiful and tied into the ocean theme. You can enjoy free wine at the "mandatory" social hour too! I would highly recommend this hotel! We had a blast!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper
review.locationRemarks: Everything! Shopping, restaurants, pier, boat rides, Ghiardelli Square......etc

review.title: Back home
review.reviewText: Loved the location and boutique hotel. In two minutes I could sit in Aquatic park and take in the view of the bay.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in time was delayed
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman wharf Pier 39

review.title: This hotel was amazing
review.reviewText:
The location was perfect
The staff were wonderful very helpful.
The rooms we spacious I love all the exposed brick and wood beams.

review.title: the staff
review.reviewText: the front desk staff was not very friendly, in fact she was quite rude. the doorman was very nice.

review.title: Excellent hotel right near fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Great family friendly hotel. The doormen was freak with the kids. When we first arrived we had an obstructed bay view. There were no rooms available 1st night but changed us the next day. Only advice request room on top floor at front has great views of the bay and Alcatraz

review.title: Excelent hotel
review.reviewText: Excelent hotel,beautiful building, and very professional staff in one of the most beautiful cities in the world!!!

review.title: Character and Quality
review.reviewText: This was my first time in San Francisco. I chose the Argonaut for its location, decor, and reviews. I have never been happier with a hotel. The location can't be beat and the staff was always friendly and helpful. The concierge helped us rent a car for the day and gave us lots of advice on planning our day trip to the wine country. I joined Intouch before my arrival and was able to upgrade to a room with a better view plus got $10 off in the bar! The free wine tasting every day was nice, too. Our room was cute, super clean, and comfortable. I love it's uniqueness. After staying at the Argonaut, other hotels just won't do-only Argonaut in San Francisco! My husband and I are hoping to return next fall. The weather was beautiful every day! Can't wait to experience Argonaut and San Francisco again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location on Fisherman's Wharf is perfect for everything we wanted to see. Nautical decor and cannery building enhance the San Francisco experience.
review.locationRemarks: Trolleys, pier 39 seals, Hop on-hop off tours, Alcatraz tours, Ghirardelli Square, Lombard Street- everything nearby!

review.title: Fabulous stay!
review.reviewText: This is our favorite place to stay while in San Francisco. This visit was very special in that my fiance and I planned to get married during our time in the area. Terry, the concierge, helped to plan every step of the way for our time at the Argonaut. Reservations were made, car service was arranged, and a nice bottle of wine and truffles awaited us in our room thanks to the hotel staff at the front desk.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, excellent accommodations, pretty view, and quiet end of the Fisherman's Wharf area near historic area and park.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: In National Historic district on the Bay; great park across the street as well as the cable car station. Buena Vista Cafe is just across the street.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Couldn't ask for a better location in the Wharf. Rooms are comfortable, clean and spacious. Don't bother upgrading to a bay view. Not worth the extra cost as windows are small.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of upgrade to bay view!
review.locationRemarks: All amenities are close at hand and plenty to see just by walking out the door. Good restaurants are a short walk away.

review.title: Great hotel amenities, location!
review.positiveRemarks: Location near fisherman's wharf and waterfront.
review.negativeRemarks: Better lighting, a little dark in rooms. Everything else great!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, cable cars, lombard street, bike across bridge....

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Hotel is located right on Fisherman's Wharf next to cable car stop and Buena Vista restaurant. Room was long and narrow. It was OK nothing special.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is an old warehouse building. Improvements would be difficult.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Lovely Hotel in an excellent location.
review.reviewText:
This was a great find. The Hotel is beautiful. The staff are fabulous, particularly Donovan the Porter/Doorman.
The rooms are very clean and comfortable.
My only 2 gripes are that we had no view at all and there were 4 of us in the room, but everything was set up for 2 which bothered me as we paid for 4 people, even after complaining we still only had 2 dressing gowns and coffee for 2 every day, but don't let me put you off, it is a lovely Hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The location. Cleanliness. Donovan. The beds were really comforatable.
review.negativeRemarks: Supplying a room booked for 4 with everything 4 people will require. A view.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf is lively during the day, but in Oct closes at 10. Pier 39 is buzzy and great. The open top buses run from the next street.

review.title: Perfectlocation!
review.reviewText: Everyone there was ssssooo fkn awesome next time i stay n frisco i am only staying there!

review.title: Make Your Holiday Special
review.reviewText: The hotel is a superbly renovated historic building and located along Fisherman's Wharf. This location is IDEAL for tourists, with many attractions (including 1 cable car line) within easy walking distance. The room was spacious, clean, comfortable and had everything that you possibly need. Staff were helpful with booking tours etc and made great recommendations. The 'Wine Hour' is extremely popular. Everything works exactly as it should - making life easy. The Blue Mermaid (restaurant) attached to the lobby is also very good.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the quirky nautical theme - something a little different from the 'average' upmarket hotel. The location is sensational (and safe) for tourists
review.locationRemarks: So much to see and do! Cable car, Alcatraz, Pier 39 all at your finger tips. Hotel staff recommended Napa Valley Wine Country Tours - sensational!

review.title: Awesome hotel and location
review.reviewText: We checked in late afternoon and it was the middle of happy hour...free wine every night from 5-6. Very casual and fun atmosphere. Didn't expect a doorman but it was a great touch. First night our room was on backside of hotel and it was very loud outside..we heard all the conversations of ppl walking by, the cable cars rotate on this side and street sweeper goes by at 3:45 am. I think maybe the windows need to be more insulated. Moved to a king room next 2 nights and it was a HUGE diff. No outside noises unless we opened the window. Staff is AMAZING!!! They are friendly, helpful and HAPPY. Hotel is next to ghiardelli sq, cable car stop, very short walk to fishermans wharf and pier to Alcatraz. Would HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

review.title: Fantastic Holiday
review.reviewText: The staff couldn't have been more helpful, especially the Concierge and desk staff. The rooms were large and we upgraded to a fantastic suite. Easy to get around the City and beyond - trams, buses, trains all easy. Numerous and varied eateries.
review.positiveRemarks: Smart, clean, friendly, relaxed - happy hour! They even allow dogs - brilliant
review.negativeRemarks: Only issue was noise from the restaurants speakers, below our room, hung on the ceiling - but not open too late!
review.locationRemarks: You can access everything!

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Clean, good location, great vibe, large room. Really a perfect stay.

review.title: Our 10th Anniversary spent in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We had booked a 2-night stay at the Argonaut Hotel via the internet; arriving on Friday and leaving on Sunday. We arrived at the hotel around 1:30 pm on Friday. Check in time was at 3:00 pm. The staff allowed us to check in early and because they had asked what had brought us to their establishment, we told them we were celebrating our anniversary. We were surprised with a very thoughtful gift of two bottles of water and a plate of cookies in honor of our anniversary from the hotel. We were able to extend our visit another day without having to change rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Everyone was courteous and seemed to go out of their way to accommodate our needs.
review.negativeRemarks: A second chair would have been nice if you did not want to lie down to watch television.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to view the submarine and the Liberty ship and board the boat to Alcatraz. Got bus tickets to tour the city and a guide narrated the tour.

review.title: Liked close proximity to attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: The Consigneir was greatest.. Very helpful, friendly, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Food, I found the breakfasts at Hotel very disappointing. Both my husband's and my food was cold. The bacon & toast had been preped earlier and drie

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay here for two nights!
Can't say enough about our wonderful experience with the Argonaut. Facility,location and staff were all top notch!
review.negativeRemarks: I found it a little odd to see so many dogs in house

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
We arrived at the Argonaut on October 9. The first thing that we noticed was it was kitty corner to the cable car stop and near the end of the street. It is also very close to the Hyde Street pier. (Unfortunately we couldn't visit due to the government shutdown)
Upon entering the staff was very friendly and courteous.
The concierge desk girls were great!! They helped us set up a helicopter tour and a dinner at a "fancier" location.
The rooms are nicely decorated and kept very clean. The bed was a little soft for our liking but they seemed to be able to adjusted upon request.
We would definitely stay here again! Only wish there were more options to get to and from the airport....

review.title: Loved it. Everything was perfect
review.reviewText: We had a huge room that was spotless , comfortable and we loved it

review.title: Great Location for San Francisco visit!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location for experiencing San Francisco.It is in Fisherman's Wharf but just far enough away from the many crowds that come over to the Wharf on a daily basis to congregate on Pier 39. It also has a lot of great ambience with the nautical decor and fireplace to relax after a day of sightseeing! It is a "boutique hotel"! They offer a complimentary wine tasting in the early evening in the lobby area. It has a convenient restaurant with good food esp chowders! However, there are a lot of good restaurants all around the Wharf within walking distance for a change and variety. All the staff we met were so nice and helpful. A special thanks to our Concierge "Terry" who helped us plan the many places we wished to visit! I went with 3 of my good friends and we had a great time!
review.negativeRemarks: It already has everything you need to enjoy your stay in San Francisco!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf,Trolley Stop,Hop On/Hop Off Bus,Ghiaridelli SQ.,Alcatraz Is.,Fishing,Buena Vista(Irish Coffee}.

review.title: Great location on San Francisco wharf
review.reviewText:
The hotel exceeded our expectations. The room was huge and very comfortable. Staff were very helpful particularly the concierge and the front door staff.
The location was perfect for a first visit to San Francisco and after a 5 night stay we left feeling relaxed and ready to move on.
Our second stay in a Kimpton and it won't be our last.
review.positiveRemarks: The room! A king suite with separate living area exceeded expectations. Worth every penny.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything!
review.locationRemarks: At the end of the wharf with access to public transport, beach / sea front, locations for tour bus pick ups and good places to eat.

review.title: Great location, great facilities
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in the middle of everything, right near Fisherman's Wharf. Few blocks from great restaurants and near launches for tours. Complimentary wine hour from 5-6 is a great touch. Excellent gym as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a little plain

review.title: Short stay in San Fran
review.reviewText:
Outstanding hotel, so impressed with the level or service, standard of rooms and overall facilities. Highly recommend you staying here. They upgraded us purely because they could and also let us keep our bags there in between days staying over (one night we stayed with family). Very friendly and helpful staff and the rooms are a very good size. Love that they have mp3 players in them!

Very well decorated with a comfortable and homely feel to the reception area. I'll certainly be telling friends and family to stay here!!

review.title: I left my heart in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: This was a fantastic hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend staying at this hotel!!

review.title: Argonaut hotel
review.reviewText: Great, love the daily wine reception, location is great, also our room was comfy and clean. The adjoining restaurant is ver good as well and convenient

review.title: Can't wait to come back!
review.reviewText: This was our first time in San Francisco...definitely will be coming back. Soon. The hotel was perfectly located, the staff was some of the best we've experienced, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We were greeted by the valet and the doorman, and in a matter of minutes our luggage was in our room. Great service!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location location location!! The lobby was cozy and friendly and our room (while not huge) was very sumptuous and very quiet.
review.locationRemarks: The location was ideal...we walked to Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square, and saw all the sights in between.

review.title: Wonderful character hotel, wharf front.
review.reviewText: Starting with the doorman, John, and with really good suggestions for restaurants from Ethan, our stay here was enjoyable and comfortable. Close to everything on the wharf. We loved the nautical decor, well done and maintained. The 5 o'clock wine tasting in the nautical lounge was a huge hit! Although we booked on expedia and could not request a view room, it was still a little disappointing to learn we would be in a room with looking into the interior roof, no view at all. The room was tastefully decorated and clean, however it was quite small for the price. Very little storage space, in the room or bathroom and the bathroom was tiny! The beds were really good and with all the walking we did in San Fran, it was very welcoming each evening. We would recommend it if you can afford a bay view room, and we would stay again.

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: Excellent location for Fisherman's Wharf and convenience to numerous attractions. Nice room size, friendly and helpful staff, but somewhat loud at night....street noise.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, restaurant access, Chinatown, Little Italy, Lombard Street, bay views, great location.

review.title: Great area
review.reviewText: Staff very friendly and helpful. This will be our hotel of choice every time we visit San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: hard pressed but perhaps offer hotel shuttle to the airport
review.locationRemarks: Many restaurants, Powell-Hyde cable car start right by the hotel, Hyde pier, maritime museum, wine tastings every evening in the hotel lobby

review.title: Quiet, comfortable, great location!
review.reviewText: This is a quiet hotel, near all of the Pier 39 action yet very removed. Dynamite staff, solid restaurant, and loved the wine reception that's help each night!

review.title: Love the Argonaut!
review.reviewText: This is our second time at the Argonaut. Nicely decorated, excellent rooms, friendly staff and a great location!

review.title: Great hotel and location.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, new and had everything we needed. I also enjoyed the nightly free wine tasting. Very well located at the end of a long jogging/biking trail, near the cable cars and plenty of good restaurants. An excellent stay.

review.title: Close to all attractions
review.reviewText: We enjoyed stay. Staff friendly and knowledgeable. Lots of unexpected perks such as wine, beer tasting, free bikes, apples and earphones at desk, ec.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location. Walking distance to everything in Fisherman's Wharf. Also, could catch buses, taxis to all of city attractions.

review.title: Vibrant hotel at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: A fresh and sparky establishment in the heart of San Francisco's tourist centre - Fisherman's Wharf. Attentive staff, quiet, comfortable rooms, quality bar and restaurant all add up to a completely satisfying experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfort, welcoming and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Free WiFi, free to air TV.
review.locationRemarks: On the doorstep of bustling Fisherman's Wharf where you can shop, sail, eat and drink to your heart's content. Starting point for land and water tours

review.title: Overall 9/10
review.reviewText: Fantastic quality hotel with really well trained staff. Rooms had all amenities as well as artistic decor. Wine sampling 5-6pm is a real treat. Blue Mermaid bar had great bar service with the hatdest working barmaid i have ever seen although the foodquality I can only rate at 5 out of 10.. sorry chef. Great location in Fisherman Wharf , really in the heart of the tourist district.

review.title: Fine hotel, perfectly located
review.reviewText: I must share the best part of staying at the Argonaut...their concierge. Her name was Brooke and she was a marvel. If you wanted tickets for a cruise...done. Tickets for a bus trip...done. You get the idea. She also had great tips for restaurants, places to go and how to get there. Never steered us wrong and always had a smile. Just the best.
review.positiveRemarks: It is in a terrific location, has great amenities, comfortable rooms and a caring staff.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate Bridge, Ghirardelli Chocolate Company and more restaurants and shops than you can count.

review.title: Great hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in very good condition and in a great position. Everything went very well and all the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were a good size and clean. It was an relaxing stay as everything was so easy and accessible. Willl stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was lovely - nice areas to relax in - nice restaurant - good rooms with space - clean - great loation
review.negativeRemarks: All good.
review.locationRemarks: Positioned well but is still relaxing and not too busy. Great location for all that is on and for public transport. Close to bus tours too.

review.title: It Was Great!
review.reviewText: Way over exceeded our expectations. Tremendous location right at the end of Fisherman's Wharf. Our room overlooked the cable car turnaround. Very spacious room. Extremely helpful staff. Free bicycle checkout in the lobby. Good food at adjacent Blue Mermaid restaurant. Free 'happy hour" wine or beer nightly from 5-6 p.m. Adjacent to National Maritime Museum (which was unfortunately closed because of our stupid government). Walk to Ghirardelli Square. We liked it so much we sought out the hotel general manager to compliment the staff and the overall experience.
review.locationRemarks: You are right on Fisherman's Wharf! You can walk to everything: Cable cars, bay shore, bike rental, restaurants, National Maritime Museum, Ghirardelli

review.title: Great Location, AMAZING staff
review.reviewText: What a friendly city and even friendlier hotel! From the time we checked in to when we checked out, we were taken care of by all of the Argonaut Staff. I couldn't mention every member of the staff who said, "Hello," "Have a good day," "What did you do today?,"Can I help you?" because it would take too long. I do have to mention Lavon, from the front desk and John, the doorman. Lavon recommended an amazing restaurant and even took time out of her day to make the call to reserve, ask for a special table and tell the restaurant that it was a special occasion. She remembered us and even asked how the meal was and how we were taken care of. Great job Lavon!! John was so helpful when it came down to helping us locate our tour pick up locations. I wanted to give him a special mention because even our tour bus driver commented how great John is and that you can tell so much about a hotel by the doorman. It is apparent that the Argonaut Hotel truly cares about their guests and have included staff who care just as much! We will definitely be staying with you again as we need to come back to experience Alcatraz! (Due to the gov't shutdown) Thank you Argonaut!
review.locationRemarks: Located on Fisherman's Wharf, across the street from cable cars, a couple blocks from Ghirardelli Square and walking distance from restaurants

review.title: What a wonderful hotel.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Great location. Helpful, friendly staff. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Best location
review.reviewText: Wasn't certain about staying in touristy Fisherman's Wharf but the convenience of the F-Line, Muni-transit and cable cars were BIG pluses. The hotel is located across the street from Powell/Mason line making it a quick jump-on in the early/late hours, the F-line is 2 blocks away for frequent streetcar rides down to Embarcadero (muni only $2 plus 1.5hr transfers) and the Muni Bus was also 2 blocks away for a ride to DT/Bart, etc. It was simple to figure out the transport system and definitely did not need a rental car. The hotel staff was outstanding and very willing to share their personal love stories with San Francisco. Heed their welcome advice because it led us to wonderful dinners out - The Palace and Foreign Cinema. Disappointed to leave after 4 days/3 nights but experienced way more than thought possible because The Argonaut was a good home base. We left our hearts in SF and will be definitely return to The Argonaut!
review.negativeRemarks: Linens were okay but the bed mattresses could be improved; felt too much movement. Yummy Bigelow soap/shampoo/body wash.
review.locationRemarks: In-n-Out one block away for late night burger/fries. B&J Ice Cream within block for a quick lick. Walgreens 1-1/2 block away.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, clean, comfortable and quiet. Staff were friendly and efficient. I would stay here again if i went back to SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee and nibbles for european travellers who are likely to up at 3am!
review.locationRemarks: 24 hour diner nearby, staff will tell you where! Perfect location for Trams and Fishermans Wharf area.

review.title: English Tourist
review.reviewText: Excellent great weather in October plenty to do at Fishermans Wharf
review.positiveRemarks: Location wasvexceptional far enough away from the city and close enough to all other sightseeing
review.negativeRemarks: Dies not cater for the English tee drinkers
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect with Alcatraz unfortunately closed due to the government. Golden Gate Bridge, various parks and of course the cable cars

review.title: Great staff, great location, great stay!!
review.reviewText: Easy to access on public transportation, and the staff was exceptional. They maid our brief stay memorable and enjoyable and I will seek out other Kimpton hotels next time we travel!!

review.title: Very nice hotle!
review.reviewText: I love the culture in this hotel. Everything is very agronomic and super detail oriented. We got a free upgrade to a ocean view room which was great. And the room was clean and comfortable. The girl at the reception is very talkative and friendly. So is the door man. Anyhow, both my bf and I love it!
review.locationRemarks: golden gate bridge

review.title: Good location. Close to many tourist sites.
review.reviewText: Bikes were available for guests use. Biked over the Golden Gate Bridge. Many restaurants close by. Bus transportation was nearby and allowed accessibility to downtown.

review.title: Comfortable and good location
review.reviewText: Can't fault the hotel at all. Very good location (Fisherman's wharf), great rooms which were clean, well-presented and modern.

review.title: A very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and the hotel has an excellent atmosphere. It was quiet, no extra noises .
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are spacious and clean, and there is a good historic maritime feel about the place. It has a restaurant on the premises ( very convenient).
review.locationRemarks: Nice location right on the Wharf. Easy to get anywhere by walking, taxi, cable car. Restaurants, shopping, sightseeing

review.title: Great location by water & attractions.
review.reviewText: Great room and staff. Near cable car so fun way to get to city center. Great places to run and bike just outside the door. Would definitely go back!

review.title: Unique, awesome boutique hotel - amazing location!
review.reviewText:
The moment we arrive at the Argonaut we were greeted by the most enthusiastic, fun, humorour, & warm bellman - Steve. He honestly made this hotel, & even our trip, absolutely memorable & amazing. He knew we were tired before he opened our cab door & promised the worst part was over & we were in good hands. He had us each a glass of wine (red or white) within minutes & had us laughing right away. He recommended where to go out that night (Fiddlers Green is a fun little hoppin pub "stumbling distance away"), where to visit, etc. He had champagne & a nice note in our room on ice the next day. Every time we saw him he was so happy to see us (& the feeling was mutual). Can't say enough about him!!

All of the other staff was absolutely amazing as well. The bellmen were so helpful we didn't use the concierge once. Our rooms were immaculate & so cool - the nautical theme was so different & fun, the beds were comfortable, & so many included amenities (especially if you are Kimpton loyalty members - join for free!). My husband's neck was sore after the first night as he isn't used to down pillows, when we asked the front desk about it they had three really nice firm pillows in our room immediately.

Honestly this trip has made us Kimpton loyalists! We will look up Kimpton hotesl next time we travel anywhere if they are anything like this. The Argonaut does not disappoint!
review.positiveRemarks: Steve the bellman. All the staff. The amenities. The smaller, boutique feel.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to really everything on Fisherman's warf - main cable car line, trolleys, Ghiardelli chocolate factory, Pier 39...

review.title: America's cup
review.reviewText: Great location. Excellent staff and accommodations!

review.title: Great location for our needs
review.reviewText: A very enjoyable stay at this hotel. Excellent staff, hotel meet more than our needs. Would stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Located at bottom of cable car close to Fishermans Wharf. Walk up to Lombard Street, close to many tour buses, hour walk to Union Square.

review.title: Excellent location, right of Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great time. Celebrated 25th anniversary. Staff was great; they upgraded our room and provided a welcome gift upon arrival. Atmosphere second to none.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, excellent location, lots of things to do, easy to arrange any sight seeing activities right outside the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Take the 48 hour hop on hop off city tour. You could see all the top notch attractions at your own pace. Alcatraz, Lombard St. & restaurants.

review.title: Amazing place to stay
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel for our second stay in San Francisco as our first hotel was out of our price range due to the America's cup. Ive got to say, the Argonaut Hotel was the most amazing place to stay, and l'm so happy we got to stay here. Location can't be beat, right on fisherman's wharf, staff were so friendly, and the room was just so cool. The restaurant downstairs has great food and can accommodate a vegetarian which is a plus. The fitness centre is 24 hours which is convenient. All in all a great stay. We will be back.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was so cool. Theme was neat. Staff friendly and helpful. Good fitness centre. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning machine could be quieter.
review.locationRemarks: Tis about a 20 minute walk to a laundromat on chestnut street. Opens at 8am.

review.title: Perfect America's Cup Location!
review.reviewText: We stayed here while in town for a weekend of viewing the America's Cup races. This hotel is exactly centered between Marina Green (the AC Village) and Piers 27/29 (the finish line), and it's an easy bike ride/walk to both. It's also very close to the free Pier 39 viewing. Many America's Cup fans stay at the hotel during the races, so the evening wine reception is filled with stories and "did you see that?!" conversations about the day's events. It felt like our own little America's Cup Hotel, as we met people from 4 other countries who were there just to enjoy the racing. Fun!
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the staff (Stephen is fantastic!), and especially enjoyed the wine/beer/cider reception for hotel guests.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish we would have known that we could have rented bikes from the hotel, rather than the company next door. It would have been easier.
review.locationRemarks: Watch the America's Cup racing, rent a bike and ride over the bridge, visit the Exploratorium.

review.title: Perfect location to enjoy the City by the Bay!
review.reviewText: Vacationed in San Francisco and stayed at the Argonaut after doing much research on where to stay. Reviews on hotel were great for the most part. Some people are difficult to please no matter what the circumstances. Rooms were clean, quiet, and comfortable beds. Had a room on the 4th floor with a window view of the bay and Golden Gate Bridge. Request room #444 for a nice view! Workout facilities were adequate. Staff was friendly and accomodating. Great location, walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, Ghirardelli Square, and many places to eat. Would definitely stay there again if ever in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean. Wine happy hour was a nice feature.
review.negativeRemarks: Have semi-sweet or sweet choices for wines. Merlot or Chardonney were only 2 available.
review.locationRemarks: Cable Car turnaround was right up Hyde street to hop on. Ghirardelli Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Embarcadero, Beach, were all within walking distance

review.title: Pleasing friendly hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and Cable Car. A short walk to F tram. Plenty of diverse eating opportunities in walking proximity (5-10 min). Staff were eager to please and obliging. The presentation was well done and appropriate to the area with the ship theme.

review.title: very nice hotel close to golden gate bridge
review.reviewText: we were greeted by the excellent smiling staff who by the way were very helpful in answering all our questions, the happy hour the hotel provides is just an excellent touch,we met so many people from near and far. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: The History of the building,the location and the cleanliness of the hotel and all staff were extremely friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Location was excellent and you are walking distance to most of all amenities.

review.title: Excellent Hotel, Close to Pier 39
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were fantastic! This is my second time staying here and I would definitely stay again. The Blue Mermaid Chowder House & Bar is a must also. The food is excellent and the waiter we had was the best service we had at any of the restaurants we went to in all of San Francisco. The argonaut is within walking distance (10 or 15 minute walk) to Pier 39 and not much further to Pier 33 (Alcatraz tickets and loading dock). The cable car pick up spot is right beside the hotel also. (recomend getting there early, between 8:00am - 10:00am) as the line up will get long and can wait up to a hour. Lombard street is only a few blocks from the hotel as well. The roads are very steep from the hotel to Lomabard Street so we took the cable car and got off there. The other time we took the cable car right to Union Square. Such a unique experience. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful in many ways. They will flag you a cab if needed and will help get wherever you need to be. The rooms were cleaned promptly and the cleanliness was great! Both times staying here have made our experience to San Francisco that much better. It is worth every penny to stay here!!!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel in an excellent location. In Fishermans Wharf, next to:- bay, small beach, cable cars, piers, bike rental (unless you're up early enough to get complimentary bikes from the hotel). Bay view room gives you view of the Golden Gate Bridge. Got cable car to Union square and great place but glad we stayed at the Wharf. Cycling over the Golden Gate Bridge and down into the beautiful Sausalito is an absolute must then get the ferry back with the bike from Sausalito back to the Piers. Wouldn't really recommend the bike journey from Sausalito to the old mill park. Too long and a lot of cycling on main roads albeit on bike lanes. Free wine from 5pm-6pm each evening in the hotel which is a bonus. Take plenty of money San Fran isn't cheap for food and drink! Parking expensive, (most places); we didn't use the car at all the four nights we were there but needed it for our road trip. Would go back to hotel.

review.title: Decor was refreshingly nice and original
review.reviewText: Great place to stay price was reasonable, clean room above average with mini bar etc.in my opinion. Great decor blending the warehouse feel into the rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor was fantastic loved the drink hour in the afternoons.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge was always busy while 2 people on the main desk they should be able to swap when needed.
review.locationRemarks: Great location loads to do.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: My brother and I decided to take a trip to San Francisco. After looking at all the choices we decided on this hotel! A+ all the way.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!!
review.locationRemarks: This was a perfect location on Fisherman's Wharf. Views were spectacular and walking distance to everything!!

review.title: Perfect in every way
review.reviewText:
Love this hotel in so many ways.... From the nightly wine reception, to the kids treasure hunt, location, original exposed beams, staff, etc, etc.
One of the best stays I have had in San Francisco!
review.negativeRemarks: All was great

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel with its Nautical theme, friendliness and convenient location. This fantastic building which has been converted to a hotelhas a real holiday feel too it... Do yourself a favour... don't miss happy hour every afternoon! Go Kimpton!! P
review.negativeRemarks: Staff could be more helpful about what to see in San Fran!
review.locationRemarks: Piers everywhere with lots of tourist stuff going on.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at the Argonaut...THanks for everything!!

review.title: The Heart of Town!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with above and beyond staff support. This hotel is located in the heart of all the action, great first time visit hotel location.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very helpful in directing us where to go, see and do.
review.locationRemarks: Electric bikes! This was the best recommendation, San Francisco hills can be challenging.

review.title: Perfect.
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel at ideal location - edge of the hustle-bustle of the waterfront so just about enough of it but not overkill. Adjacent to Ghirardhelli square and cable car, with views of the GG bridge. We traveled with 3 yr old twins who LOVED the experience. The room itself was comfortable, excellent beds. Amazing staff and service.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, cleanliness, felt like a "special treat" and it really was.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet response time... kid snacks at 5:30 with the wine (like cookies). Free coffee in the lounge in the a.m. would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car, Ghirardhelli Square, ferries, North Beach area, Exploratorium and Aquarium.

review.title: Very noisy hotel
review.reviewText: From the kids running up and down the hallway, to the barking dogs to the loud party going on next door to our room, this was the noisiest hotel we've ever stayed in...probably won't come back.

review.title: Great location, staff & Kimpton style but pricey
review.reviewText: Super staff, love Kimpton style, especially free happy hour.

review.title: Excellent hotel; great service and great location.
review.reviewText: Overall great hotel; location perfect near Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Perfect spot for a quick trip
review.reviewText: Didn't get to experience a lot of the hotel as we only stayed for one night, but the front line staff are all super friendly and the location is great. Lots of restaurants, very close to Pier 39 and literally right beside a cable car turn-around. If you need to pack a lot in during a quick trip. Stay here!!

review.title: Great Hotel, great locale!
review.reviewText: exceptional accommodations and staff. Love that it is pet friendly yet immaculate. Great food and room service. Complimentary wine tasting each evening.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of a single thing.
review.locationRemarks: On the beach, great eats and too much to do, so little time.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Right on wharf. Walking distance to everything. Comfy and really nice

review.title: Worth every Penny ;)
review.reviewText: it's the best hotel stay with really friendly staff, Wine Reception, enjoy the location and the location and the location.
review.locationRemarks: Scoma's great seafood, Bike ride over the Golden gate Bridge once in a lifetime experience, Ghirardelli Chocolate, Cable Car.

review.title: Great hotel next to Fisherman's Wharf:)
review.reviewText:
Smiles all around. Staff were helpful and wonderful. The free wine and beer from 5-6 really hit the spot at the end of a fun day.
The rooms were comfortable, clean and cute. The location was perfect. We had a great stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The free wine and beer from 5-6 really hit the spot at the end of a fun day.
review.negativeRemarks: I would have put in a heated pool/ park on the second floor area instead of the view of the roof.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is right on Fisherman's Wharf. It is a short walk to pier 39.You can catch the # 7 trolley close by. It is a perfect location.

review.title: One Night!
review.reviewText: Wish we could've stayed longer. One of the best hotel experiences we've ever had. The hotel is beautiful and in a prime location on Fisherman's Wharf. But what really sets this hotel apart is the staff. Absolutely over the top!!! 5 Star all the way. We will never stay at another hotel in SF, this is our spot!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, SF Giants baseball, Alcatraz Island.

review.title: Great hotel.... Excellent Restaurant!
review.reviewText: Stayed here in aug '13 for Louis Vuitton Cup. Service was excellent. Free WIFI if you sign up with kimpton hotels. Walking distance to public transit or the wharf.... Only issue is that price is a little high and parking is offsite.... Valet ended up getting wrong car which challenged our timely arrival to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet ticket should be aligned with rooms so that request to get car can't be screwed up. A little pricey.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to wharf...

review.title: Good location for Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
Clean and comfortable room in a busy hotel. Standard king room was internal facing so I think this meant street noise was quieter for us. Rooms could do with improving sound-proofing as we were next to housekeeping areas which were noisy.
Limited surface space in room with coffee machine housed in bathroom! Complimentary wine reception was good and seemed to be lots of things to keep kids occupied in lobby. Didn't use restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: Fishermans Wharf area can be very tourist orientated and hotel managed to escape some of that. Complimentary wifi good.
review.negativeRemarks: Airconditioning noisy and rooms need better soundproofing. Complimentary water in rooms would have been appreciated.
review.locationRemarks: Good for Fishermans Wharf. Close to cable car terminal. Loads of restaurants nearby but venture further afield to get better experience of the city.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We have been to this hotel 3 times and each time I remind myself what a great location and comfortable hotel this one is. I would stay here once again if I return to San Francisco. It feels like home.
review.negativeRemarks: The Parking fees. This is the only thing I did not like about the hotel. I hear though, this is the norm in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything "Heart of the City"

review.title: Excellent hotel. Great Location
review.reviewText:
My wife and I chose this hotel because it was not a corporate hotel and it has a great location close to FIsherman's Wharf. An added unexpected bonus was that it is also kitty corner from the Buena VIsta (great breakfast and renowned for its Irish Coffee).

We arrived just after 0900 in the morning but the room was already available. The staff was courteous and friendly in a way that seemed genuine and warm. The hotel appointments were charming with the nautical theme. The Blue Mermaid cafe and restaurant was most acceptable, especially their shaded outdoor patio for afternoon cocktails.

I not only recommend this hotel highly, I have no hesitation at all in reporting that my next trip back to SF will be less charming if I were to stay anywhere else.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, helpful staff. Charming appointments and atmosphere. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: A kiosk in the lobby for out of town newspapers might be nice.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is three minute walk from Fisherman's Wharf with all that entails. It is also literally right across the street from the Cable Car station

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location for cable car, fisherman's wharf and dining. We upgraded to a deluxe King and we should have just stayed with the standard |King. If you like brick walls, and small windows (glad they opened for fresh air) and an older vintage hotel, then this is it. We could hear the children in the next room very easily. Some of the furniture in the rooms needs a good steam clean and when we were checking under the beds for anything that we didn't want to leave behind, I found a dirty old pair of underwear under the night stand. Thank Goodness this was the morning we were checking out or I would have moved hotels. (Note to cleaning staff to check the rooms thoroughly, not just the routine cleaning) The bell hops and valet staff are fantastic! I would recommend this hotel for the location, but next time we will try something different.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms to be updated and cleaned

review.title: I cannot wait to go back!!
review.reviewText:
My daughter and I came to visit for a long weekend. It was our first trip to S.F. We had a medical scare our first morning, my daughter had a severe allergic reaction to something she had eaten for breakfast. The front desk staff, specifically Annette, was outstanding in the reaction and help with our situation. My daughter had to be transported to the hospital and we spent the better part of our first day there. Annette called to check on my daughter the next morning, with genuine unprompted concern. The entire staff became very familiar with our unfortunate event and was equally concerned and helpful at every possible opportunity. I cannot say enough good things to repay or thank them for all they did for us! We will return soon for another visit and will not dream of staying anywhere else!!
I have had some aweful hotel experiences in my lifetime, but the Argonaut is First Class all the way. Instant hot water, great water pressure, clean,clean rooms, comfy pillows and soft sheets, and fast room service, what more could a person ask for?
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the location the most, the rooms were awesome, the food was great, service was impecable!
review.negativeRemarks: I honestly could not recommend any needed changes.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location. Right across the street from Fisherman's wharf, and just a short walk to Pier 39 and lots to see and do in between!

review.title: The hotel was awesome. a wonderful nautical theme
review.reviewText: Front desk staff, concierge, bell staff and housekeeping especially friendly and did an excellent job. Loved the location and the dcor! Will definitely visit again, with my tiny dog next time!
review.negativeRemarks: Bar staff not too friendly the time I had a drink @ bar & $14 for Grey Goose?
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly located next to Ghirardelli Square, Fishermans Wharf, North Beach, tons of destinations within walking distance. Also cable car stop close

review.title: Definitely Would Like to Stay at this Hotel Again
review.reviewText: Had a great experience at this hotel. The staff were extremely helpful (in particular Emily and Blase). Hotel is in a great location, close to the Wharf but far enough away that you don't feel like your in a tourist spot. Hotel itself was clean and well kept. Enjoyed the daily wine tasting. Overall, a really good experience and we would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf (easy walking distance) but far enough away that we felt that we could escape back to our hotel.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is beautiful and the staff is amazing and helpful. Even with the amazing staff and accommodation this hotel is over priced for what you get. We have stayed with many other chains that give you better bang for your buck. $200 would be a reasonable price for this hotel not 500. Once again the staff is amazing!!!

review.title: Recommended for fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Very good quirky hotel. Great location for fishermans wharf. Would definitely stay here if visiting San Francisco again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, wine reception, complimentary bike hire for first 4 people at concierge desk!
review.negativeRemarks: Only bar was in restaurant and it closed early. We wanted hot chocolate drink at 9.30and Reception staff advised room service could not provide.
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant location, best on fishermans wharf, but still not noisy!
review.userLocation: Whitley Bay, Tyne and Wear, UK

review.title: Travel to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location at Fisherman's Wharf. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and hope to return. Fantastic service and the restaurant ( Blue Mermaid ) is highly recommended.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Beautifully maintained and great service. Great restaurant ( Blue Mermaid )
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Great location at Fishermans Wharf. Trolley stop only one block away.

review.title: Tourist Getaway
review.reviewText: Great staff - very helpful. Super location if you are interested in doing the typical touristy activities.
review.locationRemarks: Location was excellent - right across the street from the wharf and all it's interesting sights and activities

review.title: Great hotel to explore Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We stayed for four nights at the Argonaut at the start of a family holiday in California. It was a perfect location to explore San Francisco. Right next to Fisherman's Wharf and a cable car turntable - lot's to explore within walking distance. We would thoroughly recommend the hotel and would stay again if in San Francisco. If we had one complaint it would be that the sound separation between the rooms is not good - if you get someone with the TV turned up in the room next door, you can hear it more than would be normal in a hotel. That said, this bothered us only twice for short periods duringour stay and the general upkeep of the hotel, the friendliness of the staff and the location more than made up for this. We had a great stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from other rooms
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for exploring the bay area

review.title: Decent but overpriced. You pay for the location.
review.reviewText: Overrated. Too pricey for the quality and overall experience. Terrible noise insulation (especially in connecting rooms but also from rooms above and beside). Great location and nice staff. Very ordinary restaurant: average and expedited (not prompt; rushed) service, average dinner but terrible breakfast (non drinkable coffee). You won't hate the place. It's clean and somewhat cool, but you will definitely not feel you got your money's worth. Concierge also sent us to a bad touristy restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant. Price. Noise.
review.locationRemarks: Very touristy but central.

review.title: Anniversary Dream
review.reviewText: There's no better place to stay then the Argonaut. This hotel is located at the end of "Fishermans Wharf" directly across from Alcatraz. Unless you want to be in downtown San Francisco, which we didn't, we seen no other hotels that came close to the Argonaut for location. The service and rooms were exceptional. We really enjoyed walking into the hotel after a cold August day and warming up next to the fireplace with a glass of wine.

review.title: Location was perfect for the wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel is very nice,unique and comfortable. The rooms were spacious. The staff was helpful in finding us the information on local tourist items.
review.negativeRemarks: Bring out more seating during the wine social hour. We always had to stand.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for wharf activities and resturants.

review.title: Happy hour
review.reviewText: The cocktail happy hour between 5-6 was great, it was free drink but accepting donations for charity.

review.title: The perfect five night break.
review.reviewText:
The argonaut is a lovely relaxing place to stay. We booked in for five nights to enjoy a holiday based at fisherman's wharf. The location was ideal and the standard of service excellent. Happy hour is positive feature as it enables you to
Mingle with others in a relaxed atmosphere. It was recommended to us by our son and daughter who stayed as part of their honeymoons. We will likewise recommend the Argonaut to friends back in England. Thank you for making us feel so welcome.

review.title: Not value for money
review.reviewText: This hotel is probably fine if you're a wealthy family and can afford several rooms, but for a couple the room was quite small and narrow, the valet parking is a complete rip off and the so called 'wine welcome' consists of a room crammed with people, (families) only a few seats and a queue. It's right in the tourist area, so it's really busy and the sidewalk's a nightmare to navigate. It's okay, but it's not value for money.

review.title: Nice hotel in fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but too crowded in it's location. Staff is friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds were very uncomfortable.
review.locationRemarks: A location on fisherman wharf was convenient but at some points hard to get in the door with the crowds of people on the street in front of door.

review.title: San Franciso Mini Vacation
review.reviewText: Overall, it was good...spent more time outside of the hotel than inside. Our room was a little small and we felt a little scrunched...not much space to maneuver around. Clean. Bed was ok, comfort-wise. Staff helpful with directions on sight-seeings.
review.positiveRemarks: The ambiance. Refurshied decor was nice. Staff helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Blue Mermaid Restaurant and room service costs were high (for a mid-westerner); a continental breakfast on the menu would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz, Bay boat tour, Pier 39 all within walking distance.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great experience couldn't fault it at all. Staff were very helpful
review.locationRemarks: Great location , near the waterfront , trolley pick up right around the corner, few blocks from the tour bus

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great location! Staff was very friendly and helpful!!! Rooms are beautiful and comfortable! Would definately stay there again!!!

review.title: Wonderful hotel in great location
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel with a different feel to the big chains. Really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location on Fisherman's Wharf and really near to loads going on.

review.title: Best on the Wharf
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to San Francisco so I feel really fortunate that we selected the Argonaut. I have stayed in a number of nice hotels but this one was just about perfect. The room was spacious and well appointed. They had the cozy fire in the lobby. It was wonderful to sit by the fireplace and enjoy the wine hour after being out in the cool air. The concierge was very helpful with our Alcatraz and bus tours. The desk staff and the bellman were so helpful and considerate the entire stay. We met some lovely people during the hosted wine hour and we appreciated the changes in the wine, sangria some nights, etc. we also appreciated the sparkling cider rather than just pop for the young adults in our group. There are a lot of tourists on Jefferson St but the Argonaut is at the quieter end conveniently located by the cable car turnaround.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything! Because we split up and did different things a few days we were in and out of the room. Our maids nevev failed to get our room cleaned in
review.negativeRemarks: If the wine hour could be extended another half hour that would be nice, but it is perfectly done. Because it was so good, I regretted the two nights
review.locationRemarks: Although very touristy we enjoyed walking down to Pier 39, and we saw the sea lions on the pier and visited the aquarium . The Ghiradelli ice cream pa

review.title: Wonderful Stay!
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel in a great location! The staff are very helpful and friendly. Don't miss the social hour between 5-6. I would definitely stay again!

review.title: Tourist Trap
review.reviewText:
The hotel was ok. Their dining offering was very limited. Also they did not have a seperate bar, it was in coonjuction with their tourist trap restuarang.
They had free wine tasting every night and it appeared a lot of people nor living in the hotel (at least 2 I spoke to) enjoyed the free drinks (that I kind of payed for)
So my $350/night and $46 parking was not worth it for me.

review.title: Nice stay in San Fran
review.reviewText: Great location in the Wharf. Comfortable rooms and friendly front desk and front door staff. Concierge desk seemed to be consistently grumpy - got better information from the front desk - and with a smile! Rooms are very nice and clean with plenty of space and the "happy hour" in the lounge is a very nice touch. Once again, great location and walking distance from pretty much anything you want to do in San Fran. A great place and hotel that I would go back to again.

review.title: good location and nice them, parking expensive
review.reviewText: Hotel location is excellent and beautiful hotel. Only down side is that parking is expensive (vale) and getting the car back takes a long time (so need to think a head).

review.title: Great, peaceful hotel in busy location
review.reviewText: Fantastic location for touring the city or just enjoying the bay, helpful staff, lovely hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: It was all good!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent as trolleys, trams and buses went from just outside. Lovely view of the bay, Alcatraz and Golden Gate bridge

review.title: Amazing characterful Hotel with brilliant Suites
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel right on the wharf. Amazing suite booked lots of room for two teens and their parents! Wine reception great treat. Views of Alcatraz and Golden Gate from our room. Transport so easy and cable cars run from behind the hotel. Will definitely return. Only one problem, if you like your tea take a travel kettle, the coffee machine is great but can't get hot water!

review.title: The location is good, but the service is bad
review.reviewText:
hard to find public parking area. you have to pay more than 50 bucks for valet parking...
When I told the front desk manager I got a ticket because I was unsure where to park my car when I checked in, she was indifferent, her words were "Sorry, we cannot help you" ...
review.negativeRemarks: service attitute
review.locationRemarks: Fog Harbor is nice resturant~~

review.title: Fabulous location and fabulous hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was absolutely amazing. The staff was very friendly, room was very clean and if we return to San fransisco this is the hotel we will come back to.
review.locationRemarks: The location was right on the warf and close to many restaraunts

review.title: LOVED this place!
review.reviewText:
Will definitely stay here again! Great location! Great food! Great rooms! In room spa services! Bike rentals at your door! Have nothing bad to say really.

We were disappointed we didn't get a room with a bay view but, when I called down to the Front Desk to express that to them, was immediately offered a complimentary upgrade to make up for no view rooms being available. No questions asked. Also had a bottle of red wine, glasses and yummy chocolate truffles waiting for us with a "Welcome" card signed by the manager.

If you get to the concierge when it first opens at 8am you can get free bike rentals!

Stay here - you won't be disappointed :-)
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of one single thing.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the Wharf but down at the end so not bombarded by noise or crowds. Rooms VERY soundproof, especially with the window closed.

review.title: Great hotel! Would stay here again!
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at The Argonaut. The hotel staff was great. The proximity to the Wharf was awesome. The thing that stuck out to me most was how clean the rooms were. The cleaning staff stays on top of things and does a superb job! I would certainly recommend The Argonaut!

review.title: Great hotel on Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: Celebratring our 20 year wedding anniversary and couldn't have picked a better hotel. Close or easy access to all San Francisco has to offer. Staff courteous and friendly. I was concerned about street noise being right on Jefferson but by bedtime all was quiet.The concierge was able to answer all our questions and make all travel and tour arrangements.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location on Fisherman's Warf and 1 block from cable car terminal. Staff extremely courteous and friendly. Concierge was extremelyhelpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The only place for clothes storage was the closet, no drawers. So we could not unpack our suitcases completely. Inconvenient for a 7 day stay.
review.locationRemarks: Right on fisherman's Warf. Close to

review.title: Just Perfect
review.reviewText: First Time to San Francisco so why not stay near the wharf. Across the street from the Pier, the cable car turnaround and infamous Buena Vista cafe. Down the street from Pier 39 and Ghiradelli Square. Good starting point to get to anywhere else. All of the staff were extremely helpful. National Museum at location was worth walking thru.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Nice nautical theme, but not campy. Location was great. Quiet. Excellent restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Had to look to find the fitness center.

review.title: Great Choice in SF
review.reviewText: We made the right selection. Great location. Friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: Take the Hop On Hop Off bus tours.

review.title: Very nice but parking is too expensive
review.reviewText:
Very pleasant But the Crab Chowder at the Mermaid restaurant lacks Crabs.
Also had the Crabs and I paid $40 for one crab.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Loved the hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful and easy to get to other transportation, the cable stop is right across the street and the sightseeing bus line was on the other side of the hotel which we used every day we were there. It was clean and the staff was friendly and inviting. I loved there wine social at 5:00 every day! The consigner Brooke, was so helpful and nice, she got us Alcatraz tickets when I couldn't find any. Michael was also very accommodating. Everyone on the staff treated you very friendly and nice I would definitely go here again if I go back to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were clean and you could open your window and hear the activity outside but as soon as you closed the window, it was total quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing, I wished for were little snacks with the free wine!
review.locationRemarks: It was on the wharf which is fun for a few days, but then it was close to bus lines to easily get downtown.

review.title: Definitely worth it!
review.reviewText: Great location. Very friendly, helpful staff. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Great Hotel for access to all transportation.
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a class operation! Any question is met with an immediate desire to please. The facility is first class and the staff bend over backwards to meet every need. There was a small problem with the plumbing, but I feel this is more about the age of the building and the proximity to sea level. Regardless, the staff responded immediately. I would recommend this hotel over any in the shopping or business area of the city. Can't beat their restaurant or many in the immediate area. We were very pleased with our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor, the location, the ambiance of being a part of the Bay.
review.negativeRemarks: Plumbing, but that is a minor issue, and they are aware of it, and work to make everything pleasant.
review.locationRemarks: Across from the cable car stop, just down from the streetcars, and easy access to the bus system. What else? Fisherman's Wharf!

review.title: make time for you stay.
review.reviewText: I was lucky to have been with someone that had lived in the bay area before and prepared me. Pointing out all the very interesting landmarks. Make sure you have warm clothing, (layer up at night, it can get rather chilly) especially if your from the south. Take as many tours as you can fit in, there is so much to see and do. Plan a day just walking around the city, get a day pass and use the cable cars, trollies and buses (hop on and hop off saves a lot of energy). Also so much to eat and so many places with good food. I rented a car one day and drove to areas outside the city, like San Jose to see the Winchester Mystery house and then drive along the Pacific Coast Highway. I plan on going back.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything and located on Fisherman's Warf. Employees were all very helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Some hooks in the bathrooms to hang towels

review.title: City by the Bay
review.reviewText: The service from th moment you pull up lets you know it's all about you! The staff will take care of all your needs.
review.negativeRemarks: For us it was perfect,even as we wanted our room moved because we wanted to be closer to the elevator so my husband didn't have to walk to far.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans warf, Fort Mason shows, dinners and shopping, all great,

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: This was a wonderful hotel in a great section of town. There is alot to do right in the general area.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! It is by the cable cars, Fisherman's Wharf and The Buena Vista.

review.title: Nice close to all attractions
review.reviewText:
We had a great time, everything was real handy
Staff was real helpful & friendly
Met some wonderful people while enjoying the free wine in the evening
review.positiveRemarks: The free wine & beer in the evening, relaxing after a long day of walking
review.negativeRemarks: A small refrigerator in room would be very convenient.
review.locationRemarks: Resturants, transportation, scenery & site seeing was wonderful in that area

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Our first visit to San Fransisco and this hotel lived up to the great reviews it had already. We had a beautiful room overlooking the courtyard, staff were very helpful and friendly and the wine reception in the evening was a very relaxed and nice way to start the evening and seemed to be enjoyed by everyone there.

review.title: Great location, great hotel!
review.reviewText: We loved everything about this hotel...the location, decor, staff, happy hour...everything! I would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay near Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The nautical theme drew me to the hotel. Everything else was a bonus. Really enjoyed the nightly happy hours, got to connect with other guests.
review.negativeRemarks: Overnight parking was a bit pricey.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to access Fisherman's wharf and other nearby attractions like boat tours, the Buena Vista, Lombard Street, etc.

review.title: Right in the middle of it all, but fantastic hotel
review.reviewText: Yes, it is in the middle of the tourist area, but it is a great hotel. The bed was super comfortable, room was clean and the staff very friendly. You are only a few blocks from fantastic restaurants on Polk St, Hyde St and the transit runs near by.

review.title: Amazing themed hotel for a weekend getaway
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Hotel is close to many activities and sites. Social hour in the lobby was a blast.

review.title: Excellent hotel, wonderful stay.
review.reviewText: Had a romantic get-away for a week and loved the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is comfortable, staff is friendly, and is perfectly located in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is extremely expensive since they don't have a parking lot, and the inside room view outside isn't much to write home about.
review.locationRemarks: Again, it's perfectly located in the city and a joy to be at if your stay is focused on activities within the Inner Harbor.

review.title: Lovely Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful, and really made our stay special. In particular, the doormen Steven and Donovan hit it off with our 6-year old son, and always had a friendly word for him. The location and amenities nearby makes this a wonderful place for families with younger children to stay. We will stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: We really enjoyed the Maritime Museum in the building, and visited there a few times.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were a bit small and quite dark, but it wasn't a big issue, as we spent most of our time out seeing the sights.
review.locationRemarks: The location was superb. Walking distance to everything at Fisherman's Wharf, right beside the cable car stop and Ghirardelli Square.

review.title: Argonaut hotel fabulous
review.reviewText: Fantastic location. Great staff everything was fabulous

review.title: Awesome.
review.reviewText: Great spot, close to all the action, great big room, really clean. Nice staff, 5pm welcome drink hour was fab. Didn't have a car, so no idea about parking but a fantastic place to stay. Walk to whatever you need.

review.title: Just wonderful
review.reviewText:
This place wouldn't seem amazing from the outside, but inside it is very nice. Start with parking right out front, or cabs dropping you off, then you walk through the main doors and notice te maritime museum attached with entrance in the main hallway on the right and a wine tasting shop on the left. Continue few steps and you enter the lobby, though not very large it does have very comfortable couches and seating near a fireplace. (Here is where the daily wine reception happens from 5-6pm, though we made it only once in 5 days bc we were always out and about... Wine, beer and sangria free each day).
Rooms are larger than expected with a couch seating area in front of a flat screen tv, then a desk, and the king bed just past that. Beds are nice and comfy, as are the medium-sized bathrooms (though no door lock or fan for the bathroom). Sign in the bathroom says if you forgot anything that they have it, or they will go get it (including cell phone and computer chargers, hair straightener/curlers, even a carryon bag for your plane--- unique offerings).
Best of all is the excellent location with tons of attractions just few minutes away. Cable car entrance around the corner. Pier 39 is only a 8-10 minute walk, Lombard st attraction a short (but challenging) walk away, and Ghirardelli Square just next door behind the hotel.
Only down side is the cost for parking. Parking lot right behind the hotel is ten - fifteen dollars cheaper but not sure if it allows in/out access.
review.positiveRemarks: Perfect location, wonderful staff, comparable rates to nearby locations
review.locationRemarks: Ghirardelli Square, Fishermans Wharf, Hyde St Pier, views of Alcatraz and Golden Gate Bridge

review.title: Great for tourist families
review.reviewText: Hotel is ideal for tourists; very busy and noise, right in the middle of the tourist hotspot of San Francisco. Hotel is nicely designed, just found it needed refreshing (meaning common areas and rooms smelt a little stale for some reason).
review.positiveRemarks: Stylish and quirky interior design, everything you need in a tourist hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Very busy, heavy traffic, noisy area.
review.locationRemarks: Tourist hotspot.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. Very nice hotel and friendly staff. The location in Fisherman's Wharf can't be beat. Short walk to many restaurants and shops.i highly recommend this place.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean,helpful staff, close to many attractions, good restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Lou's restaurant is very good. Live music Friday through Sunday. Take a boat to Alkatraz and under the GG Bridge.

review.title: Canadian favourite
review.reviewText: Great location, walking distance to everything. Cozy hotel, we didn't stay in the room except to change and sleep. Didn't take advantage of the happy hour the hotel offered so all in all if you're looking for a place to sleep, this hotel is great for that.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: We didn't make many plans for our trip to San Francisco. We picked the Argonaut because of the location, but we were impressed by the staff, especially the concierges. We had a wonderful time at every activity they suggested. When they learned it was our anniversary we came back to find a bottle of wine and some really yummy chocolates. The room was a bit small, but the bed was comfortable and everythjng was clean and well maintained. We will certainly go back.

review.title: Hotel Room felt like nearby Alcatraz
review.reviewText:
Given a room looking onto a blank courtyard felt like we were staying at the nearby Alcatraz.

Walls between rooms are very thin, could hear people next door putting ice into their glasses.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf hotel.
review.reviewText: It was very pleasant experience overall. The staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel is nicely located in the central of everything. The hotel was very nice looking. The ambiance of the hotel is very nicely decorated.
review.negativeRemarks: Not that I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of all the fun and action. The hotel is right by the wharf.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: We stayed for one night in a standard room, it was very comfortable but a bit on the small side. Enjoyed the wine hour very much. Unusual design, nautical theme, looks very appealing. Very good location right on the end of the wharf area, yet room was still quiet despite the noise outside. Excellent concierge and other staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room
review.locationRemarks: Great, couldn't be any better, right on the wharf area

review.title: Argonaut review
review.reviewText: I found the inner rooms to be small and the view was of the other side of the hotel directly in front of you. If you want to go to this hotel, make sure you are not situated in the inside corridors. For location, you can't beat it. All else was wonderful
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the main street and activities
review.negativeRemarks: the room was small and the view from the room was awful
review.locationRemarks: excellent and central to everything

review.title: You can not get any closer to the action.
review.reviewText: Hotel was pricey for the size of the room. Bathroom shower was not cleaned well, the beganing of mold on tiles. No, coffee bar available in the morning, , like Chicago , coffee provided in morning is nice perk, and I prefer to not make mine in the bathroom. Snack frig, was not filled or refilled regularly during our 4 day stay. Staff was great!!
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the bathroom shower better
review.locationRemarks: Sight seeing Alcatraz

review.title: Great hotel at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: I've been to SFa few times. Always before I've stayed with friends, skipped the tourist stuff and went to the restaurants and hotspots frequented by people who live in the city. This time I went with my girlfriend, who had never been before and we went specifically to do the touristy stuff. You can't be close to everything, but this was a great hotel to explore many of San Francisco's tourist attractions. It is located in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf and is walking distance to many of the things you'll want to do there - shopping, dining, tours, etc. The F-line is close by, which makes it easy to get anywhere along the Embarcadero, and Market St. I really liked the design of the hotel, the rooms were nice, there was a good workout facility and the staf was really excellent. Not only were they responsive to needs and questions, but actually seemed to be truly glad to offer their knowledge of the area and be helpful. There is so much to see that we didn't get to do everything we wanted to do this trip, and when we go back the Argonaut will be my first choice for where to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was fantastic, the hotel as a whole was very comfortable and welcoming. The workout facilities were sufficient and in good repair.
review.negativeRemarks: My only complaint is that the bathroom fan didn't work causing it to get so steamy that it was difficult for two people to get ready at the same time.
review.locationRemarks: Tours or historic ships, bay cruises, Alacatraz, bike tours, Pier 39, many dining options, many touring companies starting tours from this district

review.title: Book This Nw!!!
