review.reviewText: Absolutley wonderful !! Very knowledgeable & helpful staff - extremely clean hotel & great food !!!
review.locationRemarks: Great location - the Hop On Hop Off Tours were great - easy walking acces to restaurants, stores, & entertainment!!

review.title: Nice location, overpriced
review.reviewText: Nice location, very good hospitality, though not worth the price unless You have room with the good view.

review.title: Nice Hotel good location
review.reviewText: The only real issue with this hotel is the valet parking,over $40 dollars per night plus tax .Very expensive fof a 5 night stay.Apart from that would stay again.Hotel right in the heart of Fishermans Wharf ,within easy walking to attractions

review.title: Great location near Ghirardelli Square & cable car
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay. The hotel staff and especially the doormen were quite helpful and accomodating. Access to all types of transportation was fantastic. We took day trips to Union Square on the cable cars adjacent to the hotel as well as riding the F trolley along the Embarcadero to Market St

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Great location towards the end of the wharf. Not as busy as the ones closer to pier 39. Very nice hotel and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping tended to slack off towards the end of our stay (6 nights). I find this happens in other hotels, the longer you stay...
review.locationRemarks: All wharf activities and shopping.

review.title: Superb Hotel
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel. Friendly staff and well located for access to Fishermens Wharf. Highly recommended

review.title: Great Place.
review.reviewText: Wonderful, attentive staff; incredible location!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Great place; really in keeping with the nautical museum on-site.
review.locationRemarks: Right at the end of the wharf, just steps away from the beach, Ghiradelli Square & the Trolley cars.

review.title: Great location, lovely building
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a beautiful building in an excellent location with very nice staff. The room was comfortable enough - not amazing but not terrible - it was nice. Make sure you get a room with a view though, otherwise you're better off just keeping the blinds closed.
review.positiveRemarks: It couldn't be in a better location if you're visiting Fisherman's Warf.
review.negativeRemarks: The hallways and elevators were uncomfortably stuffy. Maybe their AC was on the fritz.
review.locationRemarks: You're within walking distance of all the Fisherman's Warf sights.

review.title: hotel full of character
review.reviewText: This hotel was amazing. Perfec location, the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in, beside my own, and mostly it was full of character. It wasn't your typical hotel. Beautiful old building, but the rooms were up to date. Loved it.
review.negativeRemarks: Add some hooks on the walls for hanging clothes up.

review.title: Wonderful West Coast Stay
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience. Outstanding in every way. It was a recommendation from a friend and she was right.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was away helpful and nice. The best clam chowder I have ever hah' California style.
review.locationRemarks: Bodego Bay was so close and such a Wonder surprise.

review.title: location on Wharf
review.reviewText: Busy and impersonal hotel but was efficient and good location
review.negativeRemarks: room layout a bit odd
review.locationRemarks: Busy location but not very stylish would suit families

review.title: Close but no
review.reviewText: Aside from them overcharging for everything under the sun, (wifi, parking..) the beds weren't at all comfortable, the room layout is odd and there is a lot of wasted space. The windows are single pane and you can hear everything from drunks arguing at midnight to road work at 6am. The staff was a friendly and nice, but that is about the only compliment I can say about this hotel. I would not recommend it.

review.title: Great hotel by the pier.
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel is one of the best hotels to stay at in San Francisco. It's across the street from all the sightseeing things to do in San Francisco .you can walk a short distance or take a cable car to where ever you need to go. It's a great location. The staff is friendly and attentive. There is a happy hour with free wine and beer everyday at five p.m. for an hour.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds are very comfortable . There is also a nice fitness center to work out in and it's open 24/7.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was great.
review.locationRemarks: This is a prime location . Everything is literally a short walking distance from the hotel.

review.title: Excellent Experience
review.reviewText: Our stay was excellent! Right from the beginning the staff was friendly and always available to help. The room was clean and the view was superb! The location was excellent as well as we wanted to be close to the Wharf. Thank you!

review.title: Prime location, great staff
review.reviewText:
Had a short one-night stay. The front-desk saw that and upgraded us to a king for free, and we chatted pleasantly for a bit.

Room was a bit tight in terms of space, but was clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The little arm that holds the shower gel/shampoo/conditioner was loose and kept falling forward.
review.locationRemarks: The location is pretty much prime for anything on or near the wharf.

review.title: Perfect for sightseeing
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Comfortable rooms. Nice happy hour with Wii games available for the kids. Good restaurant. Very convenient to cable cars, Fisherman's Wharf, and Ghiradelli Square. Concierge made reservations for us using Open Table (we could have done this and gotten the points), however, wasn't able to get reservations at premier restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge ability to book premier restaurants.

review.title: Loved the Argonaut!!
review.reviewText: Had a great experience staying at this hotel. It is in a fantastic location down on the historical waterfront and in walking distance to some great areas - North Beach restaurants, marina area etc. The hotel is clean, modern, and swish. Love the evening drinks for those staying there too. Also have to mention the helpful door staff with bags/taxis etc. I had checked out but left my luggage with them for an extra day to get in some extra sightseeing....they didn't have to help but it made all the difference being able to come back and get bags later that night.
review.locationRemarks: Sensational location on the waterfront and close to the historical waterfront, marina and North Beach areas.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and wished we could of stayed longer. This hotel has a great staff and is a very child friendly hotel. We were allowed to check in at 11am for no extra charge which blew my mind! The rooms are very clean (I was worried because it is also a pet friendly hotel) and tidy. It was a plus that they will also give you two bike vouchers to rent bikes from Blazing Saddles next store. The key is to be at the concierege by 8am becuase they only have 4 vouchers they can give out a day. It saved me $60 with the vouchers for our family of 4.
review.negativeRemarks: I would of loved a larger bathroom but realize it is SF and everything is smaller there.
review.locationRemarks: The location is awesome! It is right next to the cable cars, Ghiradelli and a quick walking distance to Pier 39.

review.title: A super Fisherman's Wharf hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely service oriented and, except for a staffmember at reception who charged us 66 cents for 2 postage stamps, we found the location ideal if you want to stay in the Fisherman's Wharf district.
review.negativeRemarks: Uncomfortable lounge seating in room
review.locationRemarks: Good location to Wharf but the road was under construction and disruptive

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Great Location. A bit pricey, but, what isn't at the wharf?

review.title: Great visit of the bay area
review.reviewText: Great spot for 1st timers to the Bay Area, right at Fisherman's Wharf and can walk to many of the attractions from hotel.

review.title: Great hotel at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location close to all transportation - buses, ferries, cable car. Plus you're right at Fisherman's Wharf which is a great place in San Fran to start off.

review.title: Fantastic location
review.reviewText:
A good hotel in a great location, nice & quiet, very helpful staff

Appreciated early check in availability
review.negativeRemarks: Restuarant , would like more choice
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: A piece of history.
review.reviewText: Very accommodating staff and great location. Perfect location to visit all of the attractions in San Fransico.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: A fantastic hotel for first time tourists
review.reviewText: it's the little things-- when I needed to use a printer after hours, the lovely woman (Cailin I believe her name was) went above and beyond to help me out. Perfect location, great views, fantastic service-- what more can you ask for!!

review.title: wonderful experience
review.reviewText: What a great location - down by the wharf. Daily happy hour was fabulous. And what a great dog friendly place.

review.title: Argonaut Rocks!
review.reviewText: The staff at the Argonaut, which is a lovely hotel, is perhaps the best asset of the property. They truly aim to make your experience delightful and unique in any way they can. Although I did not have my dogs or my child on my last trip, the fact that they are pet and family friendly says it all. I will always continue to look for other Kimpton properties in the future and if ever back in SFO, will definitely look my friends up at the Argonaut!

review.title: Nicest Hotel on Jefferson Street
review.reviewText:
What a fabulous spot! We just loved it. The service was second to none, food and drink were outstanding--the location is great. Close to Fisherman's Wharf, cable car right across the street. Rooms are nicely appointed, clean and comfortable. Staff were very helpful in ALL regards. Just the two of us, but, this is a family friendly Hotel.
When San Francisco calls again, the Argonaut is where we will be.

review.title: Great hotel! It seems to be suited for everyone!
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed the location of the hotel. The staff was wonderful, courteous and so helpful. Loved the happy hour too as we got to relax in your beautiful livingroom and meet some very nice people. Great amenity!
review.positiveRemarks: The ambience...it permeated RELAXATION!! Love the nautical theme too. The restaurant was in a perfect location and the food was terrific.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom counter area was a little too small since it was also used for the coffee bar. Need to place the coffee pot elsewhere.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, but difficult to drive to on a weekend when there's too many people walking and riding their bikes in the streets in total chaos.

review.title: Great hotel for family and four legged friends!
review.reviewText: Great hotel for family and four legged friends! It was a fun atmosphere with great staff! The lobby was a great gathering place, it was very clean and a great location! I would definitely go back!
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby was a gathering place for all guests! Really neat!
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous location!!!!

review.title: Room with a view
review.reviewText: We loved the location on Fisherman's Wharf, especially with a view of the Golden Gate Bridge from the room window. It was close to the city but not quite in the middle of all the bustle. Also the hotel is right next to the Trolley terminus and it was very easy to get a ride on them, especially before about 10am when it started to get busy. Also only a very short walk to the #30 bus which took you right into the Centre of San Francisco. Many restaurants on Fisherman's Wharf and in central San Francisco.

review.title: A long weekend
review.reviewText: A pleasent stay. Very nice hotel. But not for the budget minded. Rooms are nice but somewhat expensive. The wine hour in the lobby is fun.

review.title: Great staff, location, and architecture.
review.reviewText: Most helpful, upbeat, and kind staff you could ask for. Kudos!
review.locationRemarks: location is ideal. Walking distance to many sites and minutes to public transportation for the rest.

review.title: Best getaway
review.reviewText: All was good would go back in a heartbeat. Stay was very relaxing and enjoyable.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Location was great right across the street from the bay.

review.title: Treat yourself!
review.reviewText: This is a fabulous hotel, upscale comfort , wonderful staff and excellent location. This our second visit and look forward to going back again!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location, very classy hotel definitely recommend for anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, service and the beds were very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: We had a poor experience with the concierge, no fault of the Argonaut, I would not recommend the hop on hop off buses, use the trollies and cable cars
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Warf, close to all piers and great restaurants and bike rentals.

review.title: Great for couples get away!
review.reviewText: This hotel has a special charm. We were fortunate to have our bellman explain the history.. How the building was a renovated warehouse, ravaged by fire, redone and maintained beautifully! Is very convenient- within walking distance of many attractions. We thought it was perfect! Happy hour was fun too!
review.positiveRemarks: The history! Interesting decor and left over remnants of early "warehouse" days
review.negativeRemarks: Road work outside
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to restaurants, shopping, sea lions, tour busses, trolleys Everything!!

review.title: Perfect in every way!
review.reviewText: Perfect location and view. Very clean. Great staff. Helpful in every way. Terrific restuarant for breakfast. Would go back in a flash.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, view and restaurant for breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Couldn't fault a thing.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect.

review.title: Excellent in every way.
review.reviewText: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed at in SF. Why are Kimpton hotels always so great and yet other companies can't match them?
review.positiveRemarks: The location, staff, and design of the rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Great location in the heart of Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Great hotel on Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: Great anniversary trip, excellent location, very romantic.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants within 1-4 blocks of the hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel for Everybody
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this hotel three nights after a very tiring LA trip.
Nicely decined rooms. Combination of old and new are perfectly matching.
Tremendous breakfast at the resaturant. Very delicious (Attention: not included in the price)
At the heart of Fisherman's Wharf.
Highly recomended.

review.title: Charming unique hotel
review.reviewText:
A unique style Hotel offering all amenities in a charming decor. Gorgions breakfast,a bit expensive but wonderful staff
Very well located near Fisherman's Wharf and close to main touristic sites .

review.title: Beautiful and Historic Fisherman's Wharf Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a lovely one night star. The room was larg, clean and sunny.
review.negativeRemarks: I was suprised that the wi-fi access is $11.99 per day. For SF to the tech hub, I expected it would be free.
review.locationRemarks: Walk t Hyde Street Pier ( 2 minutes) Pier 39 (15 minutes). Great food and drinks in the area.

review.title: Hotel by Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Our room had a view of other rooms and a small courtyard (roof). We couldn't really open our shutters as the other hotel guests would have been able to see right in.
review.locationRemarks: Great location next to Fisherman's Wharf. Also quite close to China Town which was the main reason we visited San Francisco.

review.title: Beautiful hotel great location
review.reviewText: Had the pleasure of staying at the Argonaut for one night on a 10 day trip though California. Happy to say, it was the best place we stayed at for the entire trip. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Everyone was willing to answer questions or offer suggestions. The location is great and the room was beautiful and clean. It's a little pricey, hence why we only stayed one night. But if you're in the mood to splurge, go for this hotel. You'll be happy you did.

review.title: Great hotel in a fantastic location
review.reviewText:
Right next to the cable car turning station at the end of the Powell-Hyde line and a easy walk to fishermans wharf, pier 39 (shops) and pier 33 (Alcatraz). We were originally planning to stay in Union Square, but are so glad that we chose the Argonaut.

Rooms are a little small by US standards, but are clean, well furnished and comfortable. The staff were all very friendly and helpful with making arrangements for dinner and transport.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for seeing cable car and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Had a great time. Hotel was better than expected. Comfortable room with up to date furnishings. Plenty of space and gorgeous views. Staff was very helpful and room service was perfect. Would definitely stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness of all aspects. Shower was the best.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds were okay and sheets need to be a little better and be better fitter.

review.title: Pleasant Shock
review.reviewText: I lived in San Francisco for several years, and thought I knew all the hotels worth knowing. I was wrong. The Argonaut was a wonderful surprise, or pleasant shock, as I like to call it. The location is perfect and the hotel charming. The staff were great; the restaurant, The Blue Mermaid, was so much fun for us. Can't wait to go back! I look forward to trying other Kimpton hotels in my travels.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything, but esp. the chef at the Blue Mermaid, Adrian. That guy is amazing in the kitchen.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking in San Francisco is a constant problem; this applies to the Argonaut too.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is right across from the Hyde St. pier. That should say it all there is to say for things near by.

review.title: Stay at the Argonaut.......
review.reviewText:
Great experience in the Argonaut
right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf
Rooms aren't huge but definately worth it and updated and modern

Can take a quick cable car ride to all of the sights and end up downtown
you can walk down the Embarcadero as well which is simple and easy to figure out and again you are at the end of the 1 street and you are back to your hotel.

Talk to Brooke the concierge when you get there she will take care of you..

Try the Argonaut it's worth it
review.positiveRemarks:
Staff was really friendly
You are close to everything in Fisherman's wharf and easy to go further into San Fran and Hertz if you are renting a car
review.negativeRemarks: there was lots of construction during our time, which will change in the coming months.
review.locationRemarks: Really nice and convenient. Good to stay here as you are close to the tourist stuff

review.title: Nice location.
review.reviewText: It was an awesome stay. I really have nothing negative to say. The staff was always very helpful. The room was clean and spacious. I loved the location.
review.negativeRemarks: I was happy with everything.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf, and Hyde Pier. Easy walk to all the piers. Close to nice restaurants and seafood!

review.title: Nice place on Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: We arrived late and had leave the hotel for food and drinks because they were already closing at 9pm. Hoped to have a few drinks there to unwind after my flight. Staff was friendly, no complaints. Room was very nice, good ammenities. Breakfast was wonderful at the hotel. I would probably stay there again. Good location between Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirradelli Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar/Restaurant closed too early. I got in late and had to leave the hotel for food and drinks.
review.locationRemarks: Great spot on the wharf.

review.title: "Great Romantic Room"
review.reviewText: The room was beautiful and clean and the staff was very friendly. The only hiccup in the trip was when I reserved the room my reservation stated I would receive a bottle of champagne in the room when we arrived, but it was not there. Overall, excellent experience.

review.title: Great romantic getaway!
review.reviewText: Elegant, comfortable hotel in a prime location. It was a wonderful romantic get away for my wife and me.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect.

review.title: Great location on the wharf
review.reviewText: Great hotel on the wharf next to Gihardelli! The setting was perfect for the first leg of our getaway. We had wonderful food (although the Blue Mermaid and Collective adjacent to the hotel were lacking) on the wharf. Parking is a bit of a struggle with the construction, but the staff are super friendly and helpful!

review.title: Great location but better places to stay in SF.
review.reviewText:
The rooms were small and stuffy. Air conditioner was hit and miss.

5pm complimentary wine and beer was nice, but appy's would have been appreciated. The restaurant was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Room
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText:
We chose the hotel for our son who loved the nautical theme. It was cute in reality too.
Front desk were efficient.
The room was spacious, the bathrooms small but clean and the bathroom amenities smelled nice.
Dinner at the Blue Mermaid was enjoyable and they made the kids feel special.
We had a view out the front looking towards Alcatraz, which was great.
LOts of people enjoyed the lobby which was warm (with open fire) and had different areas for people to socialise easily.
It had a fridge and coffee - which ranks highly.
review.negativeRemarks: Presently, irritating road works out the front creates access and noise issues.
review.locationRemarks: Great. Near Alcatraz ferry, cable cars and a view of Golden Gate Bridge but near Fisherman's Wharf so surrounded by souvenir.touristy stuff.

review.title: Excellent location, Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Excellent location, right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. Cable car picks up one block away. Nice walk to Pier 39 (less than one mile) and only a bit further to the Alcatrez ferry dock. Tons of restaurants surrounding it. Free wine/beer happy hour is a nice touch. Breakfast at onsite restaurant was also very good.

review.title: Great place in the end of Fishermen's Warf
review.reviewText: Argonaut is perfect and very modern hotel. We only stayed there for two nights - and enjoyed it. Size, comfort and general upkeep of the rooms and facilities are very good - but also come at a price. It's quite expensive, both on a room charge and food/drink at the hotel quarter.This far side of The Fishermen's Warf is perfect for sightseeing and less for business purposes, but delightful and atmospheric. If You're with a car, consider using other garages than the one the valets's use - You can find much cheaper deals just a block away.
review.positiveRemarks: Location (when they finish repairs on the entrance side)

review.title: What a Treat!
review.reviewText:
e hotel staff were excellent. Housekeeping staff were friendly and smiled when we met them in the hallway. Both concierge staff were helpful. The wine receptioned gave us an opportunity to meet interesting travellers from around the world. The hotel restaurant was excellent The hotel location allows guests to enjoy the waterfront.
We'd return.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect.

review.title: beware
review.reviewText: be aware there are roadworks currently ongoing which we weren't made aware of. Each morning at 7:30 we were woke to the pleasant sound of a jack hammer and other heavy machinery

review.title: Somewhat disappointing. Three star at best.
review.reviewText: According to their website their Two Queen Room with a Bay View lists a room rate of $305.00 per night. We got this hotel through a package deal, but if I had paid that $305 for this room, I would have been furious. Livid.This is a 3 star hotel, plain and simple. The staff is helpful and friendly, The rooms are clean. But the accommodations themselves offer few extra luxuries or special touches that one would expect with a 4 star hotel. It was our 10 year wedding anniversary and the Argonaut gave us nothing special. The Omni is a 4 star hotel; The W is a 4 star hotel. Any number of hotels in SF are worthy of a 4 star ranking (the Galleria Park to name just one) but The Argonaut is not. It's location is in "Tourist Central"; perfect for those looking for clam chowder in bread bowls and Golden Gate fridge magnets. If I could get this room again for under $150 night and wanted a room where my 4 and 5 year olds could run wild, I'd consider it. For a 10 year romantic wedding anniversary, I was significantly let down. I have traveled to SF many times. For the money, there are better deals to be had that offer a genuine SF feel rather than tourist trap hype.
review.negativeRemarks: Tourist trap feel and lack of attention to details.
review.locationRemarks: Great for tourists who want all the SF cliches at their door.

review.title: Wonderful experience
review.reviewText: It had comfortable character. Very friendly staff. We would definitely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Construction starting outside window at 6:15 am
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking to great attractions

review.title: An excellent hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel as part of a 3 stop break in the USA. Although a little on the pricey side, the location is worth the extra. Its at one end of Fisherman's Wharf which meant the room was quiet, but the main activities in FW are only a short walk away. It has a very strong nautical theme to it, which is traditional for the area. The staff are very courteous and helpful and nothing is too much trouble - we were even able to check in mid-morning which was an unexpected bonus. The room was compact but very clean and freshly decorated. The restaurant was excellent and we had breakfast, lunch and dinner there. Would definitely book again.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Argonaut tries to hussle you for every penny.
review.reviewText: They charged us for every little thing. If we wanted I've, there was a fee. If you want to print one sheet of paper it's automatically $7.99 to get online. They also charged us $46 parking over night fee not to mention that we got taxed $6 per night. It's a good location but honestly if you can stay somewhere else, do it. It's not worth at all what we paid per night. I was disappointed for sure. Never going back again.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else. But mainly fees fees fees for everything.

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: Great location on westernmost part of Fisherman's Wharf, next to cable car stop and attached to a maritime museum. Also next door is an outdoor artisan market where you can get a caricature artist to paint your face for $2.99 plus tip! Starbucks is on back of building (no direct entrance from inside hotel) and restaurant and wine bar attached to hotel. Next to bike rental & attractions ticket seller. In-n-Out and Thai food a block down. Boudin Restaurant 5 min walking distance. Have the best breakfast around at the Hollywood Caf a few blocks away. Hotel's name is the name they gave Gold Rush seekers who came by ship and dcor is nautical theme. Kids get to pick a toy every day from the treasure box so guess what's the first thing they ask for when they wake up? You can request to have a goldfish in your room! We were able to check in at 2pm! Check-out is not until noon. Oh, they delivered a couple of dolphin shaped chocolate-dipped cookies while we were gone-made the kids very happy!
review.locationRemarks: Close to good food!

review.title: We are going back!!
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 5 nights and it was a wonderful experience. Great staff, service, and comfortable room. We've stayed in the fisherman's wharf area before, I have to say the Argonaut far surpassed the other major chain hotels in all areas. Also, the size of our room was quite large consider being in a major city like SF. PS...we booked a queen size room and were upgraded to a king.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location near fisherman's wharf, cable car turnaround/station, and Ghiradelli Square

review.title: Nice hotel close to all the SF sites to see.
review.reviewText: The free 5 to 6 happy hour in the lobby was a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from other rooms and outside
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Maritime themed hotel with great character
review.reviewText:
I did a lot of research for a San Francisco hotel before selecting this one and was not disappointed. The hotel and room were presented superbly and the staff were professional, helpful and friendly. We absolutely loved the room and our view of the Golden Gate Bridge. This is a pet friendly hotel and we did share the lift with some very large dogs at times but didn't hear a single noise from any pets during our stay and no evidence of animal fur in or room so don't let that put you off staying there.
The location is ideal right on the wharfs and plenty of restaurants and tours to chose from right at the doorstep.
Valet parking is expensive but I think this is the case right across SF.
If you are after a unique hotel with a theme that epitomises San Francisco and close proximity to everything then this is for you.
review.locationRemarks: Close to waterfront restaurants and tours and great views of the bay

review.title: Will stay there again!!
review.reviewText:
Fantastic!
Easy walk up and down the warf.
Minute walk to trolley cars.
Right beside a nice park and beachfront to sit and enjoy the view of the bridge and the bay.
The staff at the hotel was VERY friendly and kept the place clean.

review.title: Four day stay
review.reviewText: Room fairly clean. Initially smelled the room has not been entered to for sometime but afterwards was okay. Room kinda small compared to most hotels for the ame price.
review.negativeRemarks: Some road noise.

review.title: Great for everyone!
review.reviewText: Very roomy. Had a bay view room on the street with a marathon going on and construction and could hear no outside noise. Had a great stay with a great room in a perfect location.
review.positiveRemarks: The size of the room was large, the bed very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows were a little too soft for my liking.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect, walking distance to Fisherman's Warf , Pier 39 and Ghiradelli Square. Right next to cable cars to get to anywhere else.

review.title: San Francisco 's First Rock n Roll 1/2 Marathoner
review.reviewText: Everything was fine about the hotel except for the bed was not up the standards that my wife and I normallyenjoy.
review.negativeRemarks: The Bed didn't sleep well for my wife or myself.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location for us and our plans.

review.title: A lovely hotel in a great location
review.reviewText:
This is a lovely hotel in a great location. The room was nicely appointed and comfortable but there was periodic noise from what I think was the staff elevator. However, this didn't disturb us at night and the soundproofing was reasonably good from other rooms and the corridor etc.
The fitness room was very good- a good range of cardio and weights equipment. I used it both days and found the equipment well maintained and the room clean. The only minor criticism is that the towels and water were depleted by the time I got there ( which was after 9.30am).
All staff were very pleasant and helpful when required.
review.negativeRemarks: Some noise from what Ithink was a service elevator
review.locationRemarks: Great- shame about the road works but that is not the fault of the hotel.

review.title: Great holiday choice!
review.reviewText:
We picked the hotel basically sight unseen on Expedia.
It's location is superb although the map that comes up had it at the other end of the street.
Everything about the hotel would have to described as excellent. The road outside was dug up in preparation for the Americas Cup but the staff compensated admirably.
There were a lot of famililies there as it was spring break but this did not interfere with our, older persons, activities.
We will definitely go back there as its location to most things is perfect.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Great hotel! We ran the San Francisco 1/2 marathon and they were very helpful, friendly and we had superb service with car, housekeeping and front desk. Highly recommend!
review.positiveRemarks: Decor, staff, cleanliness, location, location, location!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant service in house was less that desirable but room service was great!
review.locationRemarks: Awesome. Directly across from the wharf and great seafood restaurants. Also next to Ghiradelli square and close to little Italy

review.title: Tourist
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location for those interested in touring the wharf area. Within walking distance of all wharf activities and close to transportation to other areas.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was perfect for tourists interested in the wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Slight musty odor in the room.

review.title: Great location,a little to pricy
review.reviewText: You cannot get a better location.Although the street out front was being rebuilt, the hotel was taken care of very well. The valets were very slow and very inconvient
review.positiveRemarks: The wine bar semi attached to hotel (WINE COOPERATIVE) Was very informative,and tasty.
review.negativeRemarks: Road construction

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This is a superconvenient location. It's perfect for a family.
review.positiveRemarks: location, cleanness of the room, staff
review.negativeRemarks: Fisherman's Warf is a little noisy.
review.locationRemarks: very convenient.

review.title: Great location - clean - worthy of the price.
review.reviewText: Probably not the cheapest choice around, but the hotel is in a great location across the street from Fisherman's Wharf. Hotel is very clean and well kept, but does allow pets so watch out for that if this bothers you. If you are bringing or renting a car, be prepared for very high parking rates (we paid $46 per day). The restaurant in the hotel was very good (go for their famous bread bowl crab and corn chowder). Lots of other good restaurants and eateries nearby. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Price of Parking.
review.locationRemarks: Across from fisherman's wharf. Handy access to streetcar trolleys.

review.title: Good Location, Very Helpful Staff
review.reviewText: Very Comfortable Hotel - Staff very helpful and friendly. We had an executive room - long and narrow, but very comfortable bed, and very clean. Hotel Lobby has lovely comfortable sofas, and a nice burning fire - very inviting if the weather outside is still a bit chilly, as it was in March. If you have a car you will have to use their valet parking - it is very efficient, but a bit pricy. May be better using some of the undercover car parks only a few blocks away. Overall would recommend this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to Cable Car Terminus and easy walking distance to all of Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience from start to finish! Front desk gave us a beautiful room and a late check out. Enjoyed spending time and meeting other guests at the happy hour in in the lobby. Great location.

review.title: Blech.
review.reviewText: This hotel simply doesn't live up to its promise. The standards are not what I expected from a four star hotel. The lobby is extremely small and leaves little room for gathering before day of excursions, and it is nearly impossible to find a spot where there is any quiet. Music is piped everywhere for some unknown reason. The room was fine, but three channels of Kimpton garbage on television, and no HBO? What good hotel has no premium channels? I was looking forward to Game of Thrones only to find no premium channels offered. The concierge was helpful. The location is nice if you want to hang out at Fisherman's Wharf, but if not, stay somewhere in town.

review.title: Good place to stay!
review.reviewText: Check into parking before coming. If you use the hotel valet, it is $53 per night (46+tax). Check into mass transit and plan accordingly. Between the trolley car pickup next door and BART, you can get to just about anywhere. The cable cars also run frequently and come close to the hotel. Old timey feel; it used to be a warehouse. Easy walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and the boat excursion pickups including Alcatraz. Way too close to Ghirardelli square! Bars close by; be prepared for drunken foot traffic on a Friday or Saturday night. Front of hotel isn't readily obvious; non-descript, but just remember that it faces the wharf/bay. Nice park/open space by trolley pick up that is next door.
review.positiveRemarks: Classic feel and the staff were awesome.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking; lack thereof.
review.locationRemarks: Some construction right now out front, but it has awesome proximity to key attractions.

review.title: very close to all attractions of my interest
review.reviewText: After cocktail hour area was not cleaned up thouroughly, glasses & napkins all over tables. Otherwise excellent experience. Also not a fan of multi person use toiletries in shower.
review.negativeRemarks: glasses left about after the cocltail area for quite awhile
review.locationRemarks: excellent.

review.title: Perfect hotel for family trip to SF
review.reviewText: Hotel was beautiful with fun nautical theme. Restaurant in the hotel was fabulous too! Location was IDEAL - next to cable car stop, Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, etc.

review.title: great hotel for a family
review.reviewText: good hotel if you travel with kids. great location.
review.negativeRemarks: they are fixing the street in front of the hotel at the moment.
review.locationRemarks: next to the bay.

review.title: Spring break at the Argonaut
review.reviewText:
Staff was especially friendly to our young kids but not too many amenities for kids otherwise, no pool, etc.
Staff found it very hard to remember to clean our room each day. We had to call in the afternoon to get service.
review.positiveRemarks: Great convenient location, staff at desk, doorman, bellman, concierge were all excellent
review.negativeRemarks: difficulty getting the room cleaned each day
review.locationRemarks: great location,

review.title: Great location shame about the noise
review.reviewText: Great hotel great location, rooms and service are a good standard, on our stay there was rods works out the front of hotel, our last night was very noise due to a function below our room they did give us 100 dollars off our room but could have done with good night sleep,as we were traveling next day, overall good spot put you right in fisherman's walf.
review.negativeRemarks: Road works/ noise from function

review.title: Great place to stay by the bay
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location,close to everything on fisherman's wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is very helpful and willing to do whatever to make your stay enjoyable.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is expensive, but its SF

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Everything is good.Everything is good.Everything is good.Everything is good.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, could not fault the service we received
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, so near to the waterfront

review.title: Awesome hotel in the best part of San Francisco!!!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel is an exceptional place both in terms of location and service/quality. The staff was warm and professional from the moment we pulled up to the valet to the moment we pulled away at the end of our stay. The location is amazing - view of the Golden Gate Bridge, walking access to Ghirardeli Square, Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39. The rooms were well outfitted in a quaint nautical theme - and larger than the typical San Francisco hotel room. The parking was steep at $46 per night but in line with other hotels in San Francisco. I can't wait to go back!
review.positiveRemarks: I loved everything about this hotel - staff, rooms, location!!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking per night ($46) and in room coffee service (not good coffee!)
review.locationRemarks: RIght on the water in view of the Golden Gate Bridge - walking distance to all the major waterfront attractions in SF. AMAZING!!!

review.title: Excellent service!
review.reviewText: Excellent service! Great location, would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great for a Fisherman's Wharf short stay
review.reviewText:
Great hotel and location. Staff is on top of everything and very helpful and responsive.
Only one comment, you better like a very firm mattress!
review.negativeRemarks: Bed
review.locationRemarks: Right on Jefferson Av. Main Street for Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Must stay here when in San Fran!
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely helpful and friendly- they made our stay!

review.title: Perfect SF location
review.reviewText: Great location on the wharf, and the cablecar base station. Extremely friendly helpful staff. Valet parked (50 dollars), then walked all around. Quiet, extremely comfortable beds with premium down and linens, refrigerator in room, Very nice place, did not get to try the happy hour/free wine tasting but heard it was wonderful too.
review.negativeRemarks: decor
review.locationRemarks: perfect, at cablecar boarding corner, on the wharf.

review.title: Great Couples Getaway!
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the old brick look in the room and knowing it was once a cannery was interesting. Very quiet building and room was very comfortable. Great staff. Made a weeks stay for our 25th anniversary one to remember with a smile :)
review.negativeRemarks: Some city contruction was on the main street but hardley effected us.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Walk one block to cable cars and 3 blocks to Chocolate Factory.

review.title: Probably the quiestest room I have stayed in.
review.reviewText:
Interesting conversion of a warehouse. Room was superb the way they worked around the original beams. One room had a brick wall that looked original. Probably the quietest room I have ever stayed in. The loudest noise was the mini-bar cooler and that was only because the ret of the room was so quiet.

Excellent staff. Unbelievable location.

We enjoyed the free wine and beer mixer hour. We met people from other countries during the mixer - Australia, England, Ireland.

The restaurant is reasonably priced and well served.

review.title: Good choice for visiting SFO
review.reviewText: This is a very good hotel for exploring SFO starting from the wharf. It has good, large rooms, great service, a great location and a very good restaurant for breakfast and more. Price is a bit high, but not too much more than inferior competition around. The charge for parking is not really that bad considering that parking yourself without reentry possibility will cost you $35 overnight in the public parking around the corner. Cable car station crossing the street, trolley 2 blocks away. A bunch of good options for dining around (Gary Danko is very good!). All the staff is friendly and helpful, most really outstanding.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast in the Blue Maramid and overall service
review.negativeRemarks: Construction in front of the hotel during stay. Not depending on the hotel though.
review.locationRemarks: At the end of the wharf, close to Ghirardelly square, close to Gary Danko.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Situated in the middle of everything. Close to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, and the Hyde-Powell Streetcar. The rooms are high-tech and sleek, with a nautical theme. Free wine reception.
review.negativeRemarks: Construction
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Can't wait to Go back. Great experience. Professional and accommodating staff. Superb location.

review.title: Couldn't Ask For More
review.reviewText:
Hotel decor is funky and interesting. The suite we had was extremely roomy and everything worked as it should. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Location was ideal for getting to everywhere.

Late at night, there was some form of machinery noise 'clunking' - not loud but intrusive enough to be noticed.

All in all, couldn't ask for more!
review.positiveRemarks: Decor and roominess of Suite - location close to all the action of Fisherman's Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: A little bit noisy late at night - some form of machinery noise.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal to wherever you want to go.

review.title: Very Welcoming.
review.reviewText: Hotel and staff were wonderful, and the evening wine reception in front of a roaring fire was especially welcoming after the breezy sea air outside. The Deluxe Room was very nice. The only disappointment was that the bathroom was a little small. It was too small for two females, so would be even more cramped for a family.
review.positiveRemarks: The Wine Reception and the location
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Excellent fore the waterfront and the cable car, it was not in the noisiest, part of Fishermens wharf.

review.title: A Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Great hotel all around. Very convienient location, was able to walk to most area attractions. Staff was absolutely wonderful from check in to bellhops. The doormen alone are worth the price. Views from Bayside room was spectacular. Room was very clean and very up to date. Plenty of space given its a "boutique" hotel. Wine tastings at night gave us a chance to visit other travelers. Highly reccomend.
review.negativeRemarks: Construction on street but suppose to be gone by April 2013
review.locationRemarks: Very convienent to all bay area attractions

review.title: Wonderful views and service!
review.reviewText: Although there was no swimming pool or hot tub area, The Argonaut had wonderful amenities - a free wine service from 5 to 6, great curbside drop off/pick up/parking for guests, wonderful staff and a amazing views of the Golden Gate Bridge and San Fran Bay area. They also offered spa services right in your room - massages, manicures and pedicures, etc. I would recommend this hotel to everyone! :)
review.positiveRemarks: Close proximity to many stores and The Fisherman's Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: No swimming pool/hot tub/spa area.
review.locationRemarks: Great location - close to many San Fran "must sees!"

review.title: Great hotel close to everything inc transportation
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and the staff is pleasant. It's located in the perfect place for a vacationing family or couples that just want to get away. A lot of construction on Jefferson street while we were there but that's not the hotels fault and they did a good job of managing to guide the guests around it.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved walking to Gherredilli for dark hot chocolate at night after dinner.
review.negativeRemarks: Cable cars tended to have long lines in the middle of the day...take the street cars to get downtown, just 2 blocks away.
review.locationRemarks: Everything you could want right there or a street car away. Don't bother with a rental car.

review.title: Best deal for the little things that count most!
review.reviewText:
I just wanted to follow up and say my stay at the Argonaut was pretty good! They had a surprise which I really appreciated -- free bike rentals first come first serve. Usually I think bike rentals are like $32 for a full day pricing. Comes with locks helmut bag key too. I would stake out at the concierge before 8am when they open up just to be safe. There are only 4 vouchers they give out for free each day and you simply walk next door to biking saddles to redeem it for a full day. 24 hour return system too so no worries about giving it back too late in the night.

Oh and if you miss the wine hour from 5-6pm (with amazing hot toddies included!) you can just go up to front desk to ask for a make up voucher for a drink at the bar. Also there are free 10:30am tours of nearby areas. And i read somewhere online if you join their intouch program (free) you get $10 or $15 credit to use up in the mini fridge in ur room but i didn't redeem that.

all in all it was such a good deal to stay at this hotel. the decor inside was great, the bedding was the softest thing ever, felt like i was sleeping on a cloud.
review.positiveRemarks: wine HH w hot toddies and games, helpful staff, decor, bike rentals and tours
review.negativeRemarks: Just the location
review.locationRemarks: This is personal preference but I would probably not stay near Fisherman's Wharf again, it was far from the heart of the city.

review.title: Romantic getaway
review.reviewText: What can I say it's a kimpton hotel I would not expect anything less than amazing. Decor, cleanliness, and staff all up to par. Recent reviews stated construction in front... yes it's still there but didn't affect any of part of my visit
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: Argo SF
review.reviewText: Location is great, and the staff are nice and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: It is right on Fisherman's Wharf and one of the nicest areas. You can see part of the Golden Gate Bridge as you exit the hotel

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel, great location and very helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant location

review.title: The experience fell well short of our expectations
review.reviewText:
Allocated room (486) very noisy. Constant drone of extractor fans preventing a good nights sleep. Offered upgrade at additional cost. (Declined).

Booked open top bus sightseeing tour with GreyLine through hotel on recommendation of concierge, which in fact turned out to be conducted in ordinary single deck bus. Advised by the bus driver that open topped bus broke down earlier that morning, only to be contradicted subsequently by a Grayline Bus Company representative who admitted that the open top bus had been scheduled to another tour that same morning! This apparently due to the relatively few passengers who, like ourselves had pre-booked the so called "Luxury Tour".

Major roadworks being undertaken immediately outside the hotel restricting access and occasioning high noise pollution throughout the working day.

Concierge again found great difficulty in using the internet to access our airline's website to print the homeward flight e-boarding passes.
review.positiveRemarks: Complimentary glass of wine to residents in the lobby each afternoon provided opportunity to meet informally with other hotel guests.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Prime location. Hotel adjacent to Fisherman's Wharf within close proximity to restaurants , tramways, piers and other popular sightseeing venues.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: This was a very friendly, safe hotel. Staff are very eager to help out and make you feel welcome.
review.positiveRemarks: Great atmosphere, beautiful brick building, wonderful staff
review.negativeRemarks: We ate breakfast in the restaurant and didn't think it had the flavour for the price
review.locationRemarks: Great location beautiful scenery

photos.caption: Very thoughtful surprise from the hotel for our anniversary

review.title: beyond my expectations
review.reviewText:
The hotel is beautiful and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are gorgeous and clean and the location is perfect! Not to mention the ben&jerrys being RIGHT NEXT DOOR!
As we walked around Fishersman Wharf and passed by other hotels I automatically knew That we made the right choice by staying at the Argonaut Hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: the location and how clean the hotel was
review.negativeRemarks: cant think of anything
review.locationRemarks: the hotel is in walking distance to almost everything. Even with the construction going on in front of the building , it was still very comfortable

review.title: 2 Australians
review.reviewText: Our accommodation made our time in San Francisco one to remember. Based at Fisherman's Wharf it was central to everything. We enjoyed the restaurant in the hotel and many close by.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort, central location, friendly, helpful staff, well appointed room which made it very easy to relaxed and enjoy the evening.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is the best place to stay in San Francisco. It is walking distance to many of the attractions and restaurants.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Another Kimpton hotel that does not disappoint! The rooms are spacious, the staff helpful and the location perfect. I will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Awesome, except for Concierge...
review.reviewText: Except for the terrible concierge, everything was fantastic. I asked for her help with dinner reservations and she was not helpful at all. She was rude, and condescending and provided zero benefit. I ended up finding a nice restaurant via Open Table.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: The Good vs. the Baaaaaaaaaad
review.reviewText:
When we arrived we were happily greeted by Stephen at the valet. He's the bright spot in an otherwise lackluster hotel.

Check-in was quick and simple, also added our Kimpton InTouch Member number to the reservation, although we later found out that we didn't receive any InTouch benefits because we booked through expedia. Not cool and pretty cheap Kimpton.

When we arrived at the room, we quickly dumped our things and ran out to explore the city for a few hours before returning to ready for dinner reservations. When we got back, we discovered that we had a shower that didn't work, a broken iron that leaked all over a shirt when trying to use it, and a TV and bluray player that didn't power on. Reported the numerous issues to the front desk on the way to dinner and the woman apparently "forgot" to mention them to maintenance while we were out. Had to wait for maintenance to replace shower head, fix TV and find replacement iron at 10:30 at night upon our return.

They attempted to send up a bottle of champagne as service recovery, but there was already one there from Stephen at the valet who had one sent when he learned it was our anniversary.

Had drinks in the bar one night and the glass smelled like fish because it had been washed improperly. Also came for the hot cocoa reception one afternoon to find no cocoa, just an empty container. Waited for a while but it was never refreshed.

Stephen at the valet was friendly, remembered everyone's name and greeted all with a smile
review.positiveRemarks: Stephen at the valet was the bright spot of sunshine in an otherwise dreary San Francisco hotel stay.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff was generally unknowledgable and unhelpful. Have stayed in other Kimpton hotels and they're either really good or bad. This one is bad.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great right in Fisherman's Wharf. Caution though, they're doing a major construction project on the roads directly in front of the hotel.

review.title: Exceptional Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is exceptional. Located right near Fisherman's Wharf it's easy access to all the eateries, tours and nightlife. The rooms are spacious and for us Aussies there is a fridge for all our cold goodies. The concierge is great and all staff are very helpful, as are the people at the door. 7eleven is about 2 blocks walk and they have good choice for a simple breakfast. Subway is close by and In and Out burgers are better than Maccas. The laundry is expensive and the nearest coin laundromat is about 8 blocks away. This was the only negative I could find. I would recommend this hotel to anyone even families with young or teenage kids. It is also pet friendly. Well worth the stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Laundry facilities
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything

review.title: Great hotel for everyone.
review.reviewText:
Stayed there for 3 nights location is just great, in the heart of fisherman's wharf.
Rooms are very well kept and the staff are all first rate.
Thank You for a Great Visit
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: First rate

review.title: Great Hotel for a family, ideal location.
review.reviewText: The hotel sent a bowl with two gold fish to our room and our children loved it. They kept us company while we were there. In the same building we rented bikes and two blocks up the street we rented Go Cars. One block up were the cable cars and Buena Vista restaurant for Irish Coffee's. Great location. Complementary Wine reception from 5:00pm- 6:00pm in the lobby. Blue Mermaid restaurant served great clam chowder and Norman's ice-cream in the court yard served the best ice-cream. Coconut was our favorite. We will return to this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: You can rent bikes, have a nice dinner, walk to the wharf and one block to cable cars
review.negativeRemarks: I really loved everything, boutique hotel, 4 floors, quiet and clean
review.locationRemarks: We were walking distance to the wharf, cable cars, it was one block to the cable cars

review.title: The fisherman's wharf experience
review.reviewText: Great location, great experience. Loved the free wine tasting and the on-site restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Driving there.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the wharf.

review.title: San Fran weekend
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Excellent staff very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Wonderful hotel..perfect warf location
review.reviewText: It's in a perfect location..close to the action, but on the edge of Fishermans Warf so not in the middle of the crowds.. It's quiet and yet fun ...wine hour is awesome ...great for meeting new people. We'd recommend it and we will be back
review.positiveRemarks: Wine hour! The location is awesome
review.negativeRemarks: Actually I can't think of anything I didn't like
review.locationRemarks: It's perfect location

review.title: Happy
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay there again ! It was in the middle of everywhere you want to go the food is awesome the location is awesome would love to be there again
review.positiveRemarks: It had everything you need. Better than the Hilton !
review.locationRemarks: Awesome !

review.title: Matt & Joanne
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is amazing, close to everything we wanted to do. Trolley car turn around is literally right next door to get you to the heart of downtown. Bike rentals available right in the hotel if you want to bike golden gate. All the tourist spots are in walking distance. Make sure to try the crab and corn chowder in the in house restaurant, The Blue Mermaid, it's amazing. Overall a great experience, would go back for sure!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, atmosphere & staff are all amazing.
review.negativeRemarks: I know it's weird but my wife and I hated the supplied pillows on the bed. So much so, we were on the verge of buying some just for our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Seriously amazing, I don't know if it could be any better. Nice and quiet with great views and within walking distance to most things.

review.title: Argonaut yes
review.reviewText:
Very clean and well kept
Staff mostly helpful - some concierges need to understand they are in a service industry and not packing boxes
Awesome location and great premise
Rooms good and I'd stay there again no problem
review.negativeRemarks: 2 concierges that were not helpful
review.locationRemarks: San Fran fisherman a wharf - say no more

review.title: Outstanding Hotel!
review.reviewText:
One of the cleanest hotels we've ever visited! We spent three nights there.

The location is excellent, with Ghiradelli Square, the Hyde Street Cable Car Terminal, and the Hyde Street Pier within a couple of blocks.

There's no pool and no free breakfast, so if you're looking for those things, you'll be disappointed. But there is free hot chocolate and free wine in the afternoons, which was excellent.

The staff was great, and everyone we met was very friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was tops, and the cleanliness outstanding!
review.negativeRemarks: Our room had no view, since it faced the inner atrium. But, we had not requested a room with a view, so it was hardly an issue.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of everything, yet quiet and comfortable.

review.title: Little Ripper
review.reviewText: Staff were fantastic. It felt more like you were staying at a 5 star resort than a hotel. Bikes to have all day to ride around San Fran and over the golden gate bridge - free. Wine happy hour every day from 5 - 6 free. Hot chocolate happy hour also free. Every request was answered immediately and we even got help picking the best Sushi Place in town. A 9 out of 10 overall

review.title: A great hotel for the family or romantic getaway
review.reviewText:
The staff was super friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed the food at The Blue Meraid. We ate breakfast lunch and had dessert one evening there and it was all really good.
I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The location is convenient to the wharf and many other fun attractions. We are hoping to return with the our children someday soon.
review.positiveRemarks:
I loved the feel of being on a cruise ship. All the
Amentenities and great service
review.locationRemarks: I loved the location. Near a few attractions yet not too crowded. The streets were quite, and the views are lovelly

review.title: Very Happy Customer
review.reviewText:
This is a very clean and well kept hotel. The staff are very nice and eager to assist .
The hotel is in a great position to access Fishermans which is a very short walk . Getting into the city s easy with the cable car across the street or there are also numerous buses and taxi options.
I highly recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning a little noisy
review.locationRemarks: Great location on the water front ,views to the Golden Gate bridge and Alkatraz

review.title: Boutique Hotel with Big Brand Luxe
review.reviewText: The hotel was fantastic. The staff, the rooms, the comfort, everything was as described, maybe even better. My husband and I stayed for 5 nights and would most definitely stay there again. It did not disappoint!
review.positiveRemarks: The decor was upscale but comfortable and inviting.
review.negativeRemarks: I would have liked for them to have offered a room service option for in room dining.
review.locationRemarks: It's close enough to everything without being in the thick of the throngs of tourists. We are able to walk everywhere.

review.title: Good location. Good location.
review.reviewText: Good location in Fisherman's Wharf. Staff was a hit and miss - a request was made to the front desk on Day 1 regarding locating my hotel rewards program number but was never followed up, when a second employee was asked about the status, she was able to find the information in less than 5 mins and take care of the outstanding reques. Food in the Blue Mermaid was great - crab and corn chower was superb, however, considering the restaurant is on the main floor room service selection is low. I believe you can get take out from the restaurant, but it is not widely publized in the hotel. Proximity to trolley car was good - however, price to go anywhere is expensive at $6 per one way trip - more expensive than one way transit in most major cities - and the trolley takes a long time to get where it needs to go.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity and food at Blue Mermaid
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff with exception of Sheila. However, door staff was also great.
review.locationRemarks: Good proximity to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and other locations nearby, but Union Square is probably more suitable to those looking for more.

review.title: A great stay
review.reviewText: Great location and a really comfortable and well presented hotel. Excellent service from everyone we encountered and nothing was too much trouble. The room was really clean and well appointed. Overall they couldn't have done anything else to make us happier.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor, foyer lounges with occasional hot chocolate
review.negativeRemarks: no tea making facilities in room or foyer
review.locationRemarks: Execellent location for Fisherman's Wharf and all transport

review.title: Best location for exploring the Wharf area!
review.reviewText: Room had a beautiful view of Ghirradelli Square and the Golden Gate Bridge and bay. The room had one queen-size bed and a desk and chair squeezed into a tiny space. Since we were out and about most of the day, it did not matter too much, but was really, really small. Great bathroom; great lobby; free wine and hot chocolate in the evening and the hotel was situated in the middle of the action of the wharf. Overall we loved the hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and quality of amenities were top notch.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room was tiny: no place to sit except on the bed and one desk chair.
review.locationRemarks: Absolutely the best location for sight-seeing and enjoying all the wharf has to offer. Loved it!

review.title: Great hotel for the Fishermans' Wharf area
review.reviewText:
staff were great, food was excellent, wine bar from 5-6 enjoyable.
Parking fees were high, due to valet parking only
review.negativeRemarks: parking fees
review.locationRemarks: very good, next to Fishermans' Wharf

review.title: Fantastic hotel!!!
review.reviewText:
The Argonaut Hotel is in a fantastic location near Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square. The rooms have a nautical decor and are sufficient. There is public transportation easily available and cheap ($2/adult for the whole day!# so we never even bothered to use our own vehicle. You can park your vehicle for $10 cheaper across the street at the Pro Park lot #the hotel charges $47/day, I believe...#

When we arrived we were upgraded to a room with a view which gave us a window view of the water. Staff were great and helpful.

Blue Mermaid is a good restaurant connected to the hotel and has fantastic clam chowder for decent prices #$6/bowl).

We rented bicycles from Blazing Saddles and received a 10% discount on the day rate because we were staying at the hotel. Bikes were in good shape, maps & information were available and we had a great ride to Sausalito & took the ferry back. The bike shop even gave us tickets for the ferry at cost & we were able to return the tickets if we didn't use them.

All in all, it was a great visit to SF and I would stay at the Argonaut Hotel again anytime!

review.title: Location, location!
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Argonaut. The hotel is ideally situated at one end of the waterfront district. The Maritime Museum (free) is in the same building and accessible off the lobby and worth a look. The staff are helpful, giving good advice and producing maps and highlighting where to go and how to get there. The hotels' restaurant is closer to a cafe style atmosphere but was good for us and we did eat out in the evening in order to see more of the city. Very comfortable room and bed! A little mean on wifi access as restricted to doing on line check-in/print boarding pass unless you are a Kimpton member - free. Last but not least, it is 3 minutes from the end of the Hyde-Market trolley line with a kiosk which sells 1, 2 & 3 days Muni passes giving access to everything except the BART subway and the Blazing Saddles bike hire outlet is next door. If you do nothing else you have bike the bridge!
review.positiveRemarks: As the title suggests, a nice location, nice helpful staff and a comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: It's not a cheap hotel and so free wifi should be a given
review.locationRemarks: Great for access to the trolley network, Fisherman's Wharf & cycle shop outlets

review.title: not good enough for the price.
review.reviewText: The room is so tiny, there is no place to stash your luggage; I had to leave mine on the floor by the bathroom....and the beds, which were supposed to be queen size, were doubles. If the cost of staying at this hotel was $75.00 less, it would have been fine. But for the price they charge, the room and bed should be more comfortable. Also, consider the price of parking your car when choosing a SF hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: uncomfortable beds and small room

review.title: Great quality, child friendly hotel
review.reviewText: Very clean and well kept. Very comfy beds. Very child friendly and well located to Fishermans Wharf attractions, Ghirradelli Square and the cable car. Blue Mermaid Cafe also serves a nice breakfast at reasonable prices. Would highly recommend this hotel, especially if travelling with children.
review.positiveRemarks: Service, cleanliness, quality and how it caters well to children
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location - close to Fishermans Wharf, Ghirradelli Square and cable car

review.title: Perfect for those without a car
review.reviewText: Fantastic position....great atmosphere, wine nights were a blast!
review.positiveRemarks: Right in the middle of everything
review.locationRemarks: Between the Warf and Ghiradhelli

review.title: Love Kimpton hotels.
review.reviewText: Love, love, love this hotel! My third stay here. Room is quiet and comfortable - with great amenities, and details. Hot chocolate in the afternoons, wine in the evenings. Location is great - walking distance to Fishermans Wharf - and Ghiradelli Square - but enough off the path to relax a little bit.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of any!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect walking distance from fishermans wharf, ghiradelli square.

review.title: I will stay at the Argonaut again!
review.reviewText: I admit that I'm pretty easy to please. As long as I have a clean bed and the water/shower temperature isn't difficult to acclimate I'm happy, that said, the consistency of the Argonaut housekeeping and staff really made our stay a treat. We didn't have a view and our room was all the way at the back, but the beds were made everyday when we returned from our excursions. The front desk staff and concierge were quick with information from everything to where to eat (Scoma's and Mama's!) to how to get from point A to point B via trolly, bus, train or car. They have an evening social hour that's nice to meet new people. Good food at The Blue Mermaid.
review.positiveRemarks: Their hot toddy at the evening social hour is scrumptious!
review.negativeRemarks: The daily rate for valet parking. $46 dollars a night! And not to do with the hotel, but related, current construction on Jefferson Street.
review.locationRemarks: I found it easy to get to. Within walking distance of a lot of shops and eateries.

review.title: Ideal fisherman's wharf stay
review.reviewText: Fantastic location. Great history. Comfortable bed. Not your average stay but a hotel with some good character.
review.locationRemarks: Superb location

review.title: SF Wharf get away weekend
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay! Our car was well taken care of, and many major touristy things within walking distance made it easy to get around. Appreciated the wine hour and hot Tottie on a cold SF day.

review.title: Awesome hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay in the Argonaut. The location is great, on Fisherman's Wharf. Excellent, helpful staff from top to bottom. Good restaurant, good room, good gym. Was visiting San Francisco with relatives who were originally staying in another hotel, but moved to the Argonaut after visiting us there - that says it all.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, rooms, happy hour, restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Great location on Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Just average - a litle disappointed for a boutique
review.reviewText: Just okay. Had to ask for everything. Housekeeping late each date (late afternoon). Free wine was abused by outside hotel guests - I believe the guests should have to show their room keys or something. Wasn't offered the free $10 mini bar card (for Kimpton members) - had to ask, Kids weren't offered kids club stuff - had to ask. One doorman was a little in appropriate with my young children (teaching them inappropriate things),
review.negativeRemarks: didn't offer things had to ask, restaurant closed d/t construction - noisy d/t construction and running kids in hallway at all hours

review.title: Stay again
review.reviewText: Great location, within walking distance to Cable Cars & Alcatraz Island Ferry. Friendly staff.

review.title: Great location- friendly people
review.reviewText:
Argonaut is a fun hotel right on Fisherman's Wharf- within walking distance of many of the wharf's attractions and restaurants. It is also right across the street from the cable car turn-around which takes you to many other parts of the city.

The rooms are a bit small, but nicely appointed. The restaurant on property has a very nice breakfast and is quite reasonable.

Every afternoon, there is a wine hour. We were there at Christmas, so they not only had wines, but also "hot toddy" made with their house infused bourbon and apple cider.

Overall, a very nice experience~
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff and right on the Wharf!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: While not the hotel's fault, there is major road construction taking place on the street in front of the hotel. This affected the hotel's gas line so that the restaurant was not available. It was also quite noisy.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is ideal especially if you're going to make use of the double decker city tour busses
review.locationRemarks: Location is very convenient to activities near Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great staff, good location
review.reviewText:
There was a small mix up with our room on arrival which was dealt with brilliantly. All the staff at the hotel were excellent and very helpful.
The hotel is in an ideal location for the tourist being close to Fisherman's Wharf and also near to transport such as the cable car and bus.
Cannot comment on parking charges as returned hire car after dropping bags off at hotel.
This was the most expensive hotel that we stayed in on our trip but we thought it was good value for the location, quality and service that we received.

review.title: Nice hotel...great location.
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and great location. Staff was pleasant and informative. restaurant was closed...a bit inconvenient. Rooms small but ample and loved the unique decor. Wine happy hour a nice touch. Overall great experience.

review.title: Argonaut hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was excellent. It ticked all the boxes for us. Clean. Good position, helpful staff and was in our price range.
review.positiveRemarks: The free wine tasting and helpful consierge
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location.

review.title: Sweet Escape
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was perfect for my family. My 7 and 9 year children enjoyed the scavenger hunt and the treasures they received. All of the staff were accommodating and friendly. We also enjoyed the wine/ apple cider reception. The location was perfect - close to Ghiradelli Square, Cable Car and of course - Fisherman's Wharf!

review.title: Great location and excellent staff
review.reviewText: Great hotel overall. The reason I gave "comfort of your room" a three is that the sound proofing between rooms is such that you hear noises from the room next door that you shouldn't have to hear. Pity they didn't sound proof the walls a bit better. Otherwise it's a great hotel in a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: sound proofing of walls poor
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Restored our Christmas spirit
review.reviewText: We arrived tired and discouraged after our car had been broken into and our Christmas presents stolen. They made every effort to improve our mood- up grading our standard room to a huge corner suite, replacing our lost toiletries, and showering us with gifts of wine, umbrellas and even a robe. It bolstered our faith in the Christmas spirit.
review.negativeRemarks: valet pricey
review.locationRemarks: great, accross street from fisherman's wharf, views of goldern gate, alcatraz

review.title: Great stay with family; a wonderful find
review.reviewText: Outstanding customer service from start to finish. Good location.
review.negativeRemarks: High parking fees
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: The Argonaut Hotel is great
review.reviewText: Fantastic experience. The location is great and the staff are the best I have seen. The best hotel I have stayed at in my trips to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The extremely friendly and helpful staff and the comfort of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Excellent.

review.title: Looking for fun
review.reviewText:
This hotel was perfect for the kind of trip we were taking. The location is fantastic, where you'll find plenty of tourist hotspots, restaurants, and shopping.
The only thing we did not absolutely love was the noise. Since the hotel is where everything takes place, the pub accross the street had loud music and we could hear pedestrians walking by.
But, we would do it all over again since everything was there! The staff was by far ThE BEST!
review.negativeRemarks: Noise

review.title: Worth staying....
review.reviewText:
Great location, friendly and helpful staff. The views of the bridge were well worth paying for. Our rooms were very clean and well presented but had no provision for making tea that was not coffeee flavoured! Paper cups did nothing to enhance the flavour of the tea or coffee. We had a laugh at the disposable "eco-friendly" cups which seemed to be less environmentally friendly than multi-use ceremic.
Guest laundry facilities would have been appreciated and used as in-house laundry services were too expensive for a family of 4.
review.positiveRemarks: location and view of bridge and cable-car
review.negativeRemarks: no guest laundry
review.locationRemarks: right on the water front,close to all the tourist/souvenier shops and Fisherman's Wharf area

review.title: Perfect location for a hotel in San Francisco.
