review.reviewText: I really liked this hotel. It's right on the wharf, perfect location to walk to some of the most likely tourist things to do. The staff was incredibly friendly and enthusiastic. And we loved the food at the Blue Mermaid, where the staff was equally friendly. The room was very large and the bed very comfortable. There are families with children there, but we did not find the place to be noisy.

review.title: A San Fran Must!
review.reviewText: I have stayed in many hotels throughout the world - this was truly wonderful.
review.positiveRemarks: Wine hour, cute nautical theme, location and mini bar

review.title: Great hotel close to cable car
review.reviewText: Our favorite hotel in San Francisco. It never dissappoints. From the warm welcome by Doorman Stephen to the free wine reception each night, the hotel makes you feel welcome like one of the family. We received a free upgrade, lucky dips for our children and even had the opportunity to look after the hotel fish. It always impresses.
review.positiveRemarks: In Fishermans Wharf area, close to cable car. Great staff, lovely rooms and real service.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet car parking is expensive

review.title: Great for all
review.reviewText: Great location only negative was high valet costs. The staff was friendly and hotel clean the evening wine tasting was grey however they need to change the wines each night

review.title: Very comfortable accommodation, good location
review.reviewText: The hotel had booked us into an inward facing room but willingly upgraded us to a room with a view at no extra cost. Their wine hour is well worth it - good selection of wines. Good location within easy walking distance of Fishermans Wharf and any number of good restaurants.

review.title: FREINDLY SERVICE
review.reviewText:
THE SERVICE WAS OUTSTANDING THE MINUTE WE PULL UP TO THE DOOR. THE HOTEL CLERK WAS GREAT. SAYING HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO HER LIKE I ASKED WAS GREAT AND THE BOTTLE OF CHAMPAYNE AND CARD WAS ALSO GREAT.

THANK YOU ARGONAUT

review.title: Comfortable and clean
review.reviewText:
Comfortable clean and located in fisher mans wharf. Close to the streetcars and cable cars that will take you to union square. Foodies may be interested in visiting boudin bakery and the markets at the ferry building which is not far by streetcar. Also within walking distance to the Alcatraz ferry.
Service overall was good but the front desk staff we found were slightly inflexible as we had requested an extended checkout time due to late flight out of SF. Understand its hotel policy that they could not confirm this until the morning of our last day but they probably could have done this with a smile! Special mention however to the other staff at the door and bell hop who provided us with excellent tips and guidance on how to get to places - it was good to know who the knowledgeable and friendly staff were!

review.title: Great SF Experience
review.reviewText: Great location for access if you want to hire a bike and cycle across the Golden Gate Bridge - a not to be missed experience for us. Plus only a cable car ride away from all the shopping at Union Square. The hotel's restaurant/bar sells award winning chowder which is absolutely delicious. Valet car parking is quite expensive - but you can park your own car in same place for less money - plus there is meter parking around the streets nearby - and we found free street parking close by over the weekend.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Absolutely loved the hotel; just a real shame our room was next to quite a noisy service lift. Apart from that - superb!
review.positiveRemarks: View of the Golden Gate Bridge from the room; decor; wine hour each evening
review.negativeRemarks: Internal location of room - next to service lift
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous location

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: pleasant experience. see further comments via likes and dislikes
review.positiveRemarks: the hotel room had character and a warm presence. the staff were polite friendly. the free wine tasting, hot chocolate and in room wifi was great too.
review.negativeRemarks: the walls in thr hotel were thin. we could hear what the guests next door were doing. we could also hear people walking above us upstairs
review.locationRemarks: great location on the wharf. short walk to beautiful pier 39.

review.title: Great hotel for anyone!!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights for our 25th wedding anniversary. It was wonderful, charming, and very comfortable. The beds were extremely comfortable, and the staff even gave us a bottle of wine and some Ghiradelli chocolate for our special day. It was right on Fishermans Wharf, and a pretty easy walk to everywhere. The staff was extremely helpful with restaurant suggestions, and also travel information. We loved it here, and wished we could've stayed longer!!
review.positiveRemarks: The uniqueness of it, the location, and the decor and cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fees

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: Fantastic location. Close to everything and quiet. Lovely ambience and free wine and hot toddies by the fire between 5-6 a real bonus! Comfortable to the max!
review.locationRemarks: Top location

review.title: Comfortable stay
review.reviewText: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Good location on the edge of Fisherman's Wharf and next to start of cable cars. Comfortable beds, clean and spacious room with lovely view of Alcatraz. Loved the Xmas decorations & fire in the lobby. Staff were attentative and helpful. Family of four stayed for three nights but wished we had stayed longer!
review.locationRemarks: Not too noisy

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Good staff very helpful, rooms were well kept up and roomy, located in a great part of town, would definately stay again

review.title: Great base for a visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel and location for my stay in San Francisco. Staying in Fisherman's Wharf turned out to be a far better location for a base compared to the centre of town where I had been initially considering. This would be my first choice again if I'm in San Francisco again...

review.title: amazing hotel
review.reviewText: great hotel, great service, great location! Would definitely stay here again and reccomend it to anyone looking to have a great time in san francisco.

review.title: First time visitor to San Fran
review.reviewText: Very well kept campus and room. Normally have some hint of odor from rooms with frequent visitors, but not this time. Only surprise was parking in the area. Plan ahead as valet over $50 per night. Found a couple garages writhing a block or 2 at $32/nt.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Great location as just in front of classic ships pier

review.title: 5 star hotel at resonabile price
review.reviewText: The door men were really nice, especially with our 4 year old and entertaining. Front desk staff friendly and accomodating, room with view was amazing and entire hotel was superb. The tiny issue we had was despite advertising the rental of strollers, the hotel no longer offers this service, so if required I reccomend bringing your own.

review.title: Everyone treated as dishonest
review.reviewText:
The hotel is right on the waterfront, just a short walk from the edge of the Bay. Good tourist links into town, by bus, tram and cable car.
However the staff attitude to customers is dreadful, cascading down from the GM. Everyone is teated as a potentially dishonest individual who cannot be trusted to pay or extra services at the end of their stay. Even though the hotel stay was fuly paid up by Expedia, the hotel still required to take $100 per day as a charge on your credit card, in case you used extra facilities; eg bar, mini bar or dining. This was explained to us by the GM, as the fact that "prostitutes used the hotel and may then abuse the facilities; so to be seen to be fair, everyone needed to be treated equally" i.e. to the lowest common denominator.
Do not go and use this hotel. Stay away.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff attitude
review.locationRemarks: See review

review.title: Great getaway hotel
review.reviewText: good location Great little restaurant in hotel. Close to every thing if you are on vacation or business. Hotel decor is casual but tasteful.
review.locationRemarks: close to every thing in fishermans wharf and next to trolley turnaround

review.title: Fantastic hotel with great staff and location!
review.reviewText: LOVED this hotel! Friendly staff, fantastic location, and the evening wine bar was a bonus!!
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Great location, a short walk to Pier 39 and Ghiradelli Square

review.title: Wedding Weekend
review.reviewText:
This is our second time staying at the Argonaut and we plan to stay at the hotel in the future.
We love it!
review.positiveRemarks: the rooms are cozy and the hotel has character. The nightly wine reception is also a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: for sure ill go back
review.reviewText: love everything about this hotel ,so friendly and organize
review.negativeRemarks: noise of street
review.locationRemarks: so good

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. Great location and comfortable rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very friendly and helpful
review.locationRemarks: very nice location and easy to walk to many attractions at Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Quick Getaway
review.reviewText: We always stay at the Argonaut everytime we are in San Francisco. This time we stayed in the King view suite. We were very happy with this room and would recommend the upgrade, but only when it is on sale.

review.title: Great stay - and a trolley to wake you up.
review.reviewText:
Room was on the SF Trolley side of the hotel and was somewhat noisy especially early in the morning. Not the hotels fault, however, for someone not used to the unique rumbling of the cable cars, it is quite disconcerting at 6:00am. You do need to set your alarm - they will wake you up every morning.
Staff was very nice and accommodating especially the chatty doorman and check-in staff.
Power went out in the hotel (whole area) while I was there and the staff handled it well.
Overall a very nice stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Cable cars (trolley)

review.title: Another San Francisco Treat.
review.reviewText: We stayed here for a week. The rooms are very large but the walls are a bit thin and you can hear everything going on in the next room. If you get someone who likes to watch TV at a high volume as we did it can be annoying. They had put us originally in a room next to the elevator so every time it was in use we heard it. They did move us to another room. The wine reception in the lobby was very nice. This was our first time staying in a Kimpton hotel. It may be a bit more expensive but well worth it for the service and cleanliness.
review.positiveRemarks: The service and the size of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise factor.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is very touristy and far from many other SF locations but we learned the public transportation and that helped getting around town.

review.title: Great Hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Great resturant attached with superb food at a reasonable price. Looking for a hotel in San Fran, I can recommend this one
review.positiveRemarks: The staff - just went out of their way to assist in all aspects
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Spot on - right on Fisherman's Wharf with a short walk up the road to the Powell & Hyde Sts Cable Cars which takes you all the way into Union Square

review.title: Warm welcome
review.reviewText: Well situated on the waterfront. Large comfortable rooms with beds one needs a step ladder to climb onto. Friendly and welcoming staff. Oh, and this hotel is pet friendly. I think it was good value for money & I'll look for other Kimpton hotels when I next visit USA
review.negativeRemarks: One of our entry cards malfunctioned
review.locationRemarks: Right on the waterfront

review.title: Great choice for vacation
review.reviewText: The highlight of the Argonaut was the staff, everyone was great. The concierges did a wonderful job planning and packing our week full of activities. Not that excited about the decor, but the furnishings were very comfortable. The king size beds are actually California king size.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor
review.locationRemarks: Great location for vacation and transportation around the city.

review.title: Great hotel. Great location. Great service.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Great location. Great service. Wonderful restaurant. Green all the way.
review.positiveRemarks: Blue mermaid restaurant and clam chowder.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Probably the best location to stay in frisco.

review.title: Argonaut hotel
review.reviewText: Great staff great hotel nothing was a problem. Room was well layout
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to walk and see everything at fisherman's wharf, great room.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great location for fisherman's wharf

review.title: Good location, great room, impeccable service.
review.reviewText: Good location, great room, impeccable service. Price on the high side.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant was below average for area/expectations.
review.locationRemarks: Optimal near the bay, several restaurants and tourist attractions in the area. All of SF reachable with public transportation.

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: very impressed by the service provided by the front desk, door and bellhops, and the concierge.
review.locationRemarks: the location with easy access to the water front is a top feature.

review.title: Argonaut
review.reviewText: Great spacious room and very helpful staff. However noise of condensation dripping from air con/heating unit onto metal roof below window woke us several times each morning very early.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise of dripping condensation from air con/heating unit onto metal roof below window .which woke us up several times every morning very very early

review.title: Great trip!
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice and we got a great deal on the room. Location is great for those touring San Francisco. Very friendly staff.

review.title: San francisco
review.reviewText: Fantastic location, friendly staff and very good room

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel. The staff were excellent and could not have been more friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again. The free wine was a good way of meeting other guests and a pleasant start to the evening. Rooms are modern and very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleaning was not great. Surfaces clean on arrival but not cleaned subsequently
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to restaurants etc and an easy ride to the centre

review.title: Great Place by the Bay!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, great staff but bathrooms are a little small.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
Overall had an excellent stay, a couple of drinks machines would have been nice.
Very freindly Staff and excellent location.
review.negativeRemarks: a couple of drink dispensers would have been nice
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We loved it and great location!! Close to restaurants and entertainment.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the wharf

review.title: Great hotel...excellent location!
review.reviewText: This is a fantastic hotel, situated in the best location! Going out the front door, you can see Alcatraz off in the distance and the Golden Gate can be seen a few steps to the left of the front door! It's walking distance to Fisherman's wharf and transportation is easily accessible. We found the staff friendly and helpful. The rooms, while not huge, were very clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms not huge...but very clean and nicely furnished.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location!

review.title: Great location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: Fantastic location in terms of Fishermans Wharf, only stayed one night however if I am in San Fran again I will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel - location, location, location
review.reviewText: Excellent location, near everything. The only thing i would regret is that if you room is facing the street near the trolleys, then you would feel it noisy. But everything else is ok. Another thing, the parking, you can park your car yourself but the parking lot that they have is small, so in a Sunday afternoon you may not find a place and you should leave the car to the valet parking for $46USD....
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy if your room face the street and the parking

review.title: Family vacation
review.reviewText: The hotel and room were a pleasant surprise, with its carefully maintained heritage character. The staff were adequate, but no acknowledgement was given to my kids (despite their ad of a Kids' Club - a minor complaint, but also easy to fulfill). I especially enjoyed the daily wine tasting event (even if it was the same wine all week!).

review.title: Great for tourists.
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was very conveniently located and the staff was very friendly. Don't think I could have picked a better hotel for our 4 night stay. The hotel and rooms are clean, but the rooms are basic, small and nothing fancy, but comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the room, small but comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Very conveniently located for a tourist, i.e., Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, Cable Cars, and Little Italy and Chinatown are not far.

photos.caption: Great place to return after a long day
Room is beautiful, and some goldfish to keep you company!

review.title: Beautiful Stay - Superb Hotel
review.reviewText:
Fabulous! My husband and I stayed 3 nights with a bay view room -- worth the extra for a view! Rooms are spotless, many extras at no charge..umbrella, robes, sundries ect. Great, great hotel. Is very close to the action, but less noise (still noise but not ridiculous) Walking distance to much, cab at doorstep all the time for quick trips.
Beautiful stay -- Thanks
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of any
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: A definite 'yes'
review.reviewText: Friendly helpful staff. The food in the restaurant, and the service, was superb. Would stay again definitely
review.locationRemarks: Handy, though the wharf area is very touristy and a tad tacky

review.title: Fantastic...
review.reviewText:
Upon arrival, the staff were fantastic. The atmosphere in the hotel was second to none. Each evening we would relax in plush chairs in front of a fireplace with a glass of wine. Wine was complementary between 5pm and 6pm each day. Location was spectacular. Across the street from the Argonaut Hotel was San Francisco Bay with views of Alcatraz Island and Golden Gate Bridge. Also, it was walking distance to wonderful restaurants, cable cars rides and Ghirardelli.

Will definitely be staying there when I return to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: If I had to name a least favourite thing, the only thing I could think of would be the view from our window. Brick building next door.
review.locationRemarks: I can't imagine there is a better location for a hotel in Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at the hotel! It's in a great location! We upgraded to a suite the second two nights we were there and it is definitely worth the money! They have a complimentary wine reception everyday at 5pm, which is very neat! Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others!
review.positiveRemarks: Favorite things: great location, nautical decor, great staff, loved the bathroom And jacuzzi tub in the suite!
review.negativeRemarks: Depending on the room, you might get a view of the inside courtyard area that just faces other rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic!

review.title: Great hotel all around
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel is wonderful- it is very clean, the staff is friendly, it is in a superb location and the decor is awesome! I would highly recommend this hotel to all.
review.positiveRemarks: The natuical theme is awesome! Loved the location, cleanliness and staff!
review.negativeRemarks: The wine bar and restaurant closed too early on the weekend.
review.locationRemarks: Amazing location! So central in Fisherman's wharf and Ghiradelli square. Close to many great restaurants in walking distance.

review.title: Great location and hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, great staff and great time with friends. I would definitely stay here again
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were very friendly and accommodating
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was a little small but not worked out fine for us
review.locationRemarks: Loved the location and view from our room

review.title: Convenient location and beautiful hotel!
review.reviewText: Fabulous decor. Clean, comfortable and spacious room. Free happy hour every day - would stay here again!

review.title: Nice hotel for all occassions
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location and the staff is very friendly. No complaints.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Great hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText: Argonaut was a great place to stay - perfect location, lovely room, comfortable bed and great service! Not to mention the free wine hour every night.

review.title: First time to San Fancisco
review.reviewText: Had the suite and it exceeded my expectations. Close to the Fisherman's Wharf and other shopping areas. I would stay there again, no hesitation. All the staff were warm and friendly, made you feel welcome!!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect!

review.title: Great location for tourists
review.reviewText: This was the fourth and fifth night of our honeymoon and it was a comfortable and convenient hotel. The view from our room was unpleasing as we looked into other rooms across the way and the price does not support the services provided. No complimentary breakfast or water and inability to use the refrigerator due to the room service products. No vending machines. Parking fee is expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: location, courtesy of staff and cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: price of hotel room and parking
review.locationRemarks: Located on the tourist strip - close to many attractions. Easy to locate.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText:
the hotel was very clean and staff were very attentive.
We did not care for our first room and the staff were able to change our room and
actually up graded it.
Resturant was good, staff again were very attentive.
We were pleased with our stay and would recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks:
the hotel was located in the Warf area, very commercialized. Would rather be in the
Union Square location

review.title: Very disappointed
review.reviewText: First, the concierge was unbelievably unhelpful. She wouldn't give us a straight answer as to where we could park without paying $46 a night for valet parking (turned out the side street was available for parking for free from 4pm-10am). She gave us complicated directions to see the Golden Gate bridge when really you could just walk out a block or so and stand on the municipal pier and have a great view of the bridge and alcatraz. The hotel and especially the room decor was tacky with its nautical theme. The walls were paper thin and we could clearly hear our neighbors entire conversation at 5am. The maid surprised us and came into the room at 9am. To top it off, I currently have an extra $100 pending from my bank account for this hotel when I prepaid for the night and touched nothing in the room. Would not go back or recommend to anyone I know

review.title: Great experience starting at the front entrance!
review.reviewText: Bell and door staff were exceptional! Comfy bed. Great location.

review.title: Great hotel for everyone.
review.reviewText: The best place I have ever stayed at, loved that it was pet friendly. It also had everything I needed. Cleanliness was wonderful, staff especially kind and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous location!

review.title: Will be returning!!
review.reviewText: 3 night stay, 10 year anniversary.. Staff was very friendly. Room was very clean. Definitely coming back on our next visit to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: Best Place To Stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
This hotel was more than I could have hoped for not knowing anyone who had stayed there. The hospitality of the staff could not have been better. The location is outstanding, and if I ever return to San Franciso, that will be the only place I will stay.

I will tell everyone that The Argonaut is outstanding in every way. Thank you Expedia.
review.negativeRemarks: Not one thing to complain about!
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf; direct views of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge; beautiful park right beside the hotel; great for walking

review.title: Great hotel...for everyone!
review.reviewText: This is my new favorite hotel in SFR . Dog friendly..great location...great room. The guest service was on point. My dog Charlie got the royal treatment. Will definitely be back!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect..easy to find...great spot in the wharf area

review.title: Nice place, cool Mueseum next door
review.reviewText:
As a single traveler with a couple of backpacks I didn't get
The help or attention that couples seemed to get.
No one offered to help me with my bags.

review.title: Outstanding Argonaut
review.reviewText: Beautiful luxurious hotel with well appointed rooms. Great ambiance and located right on Fishermans Wharf. great restaurants and shopping within short walking distance. Good quality in-room amenities. Easy access to Alcatraz ferry pier. Be warned... rug up as its COLD !!!
review.positiveRemarks: Its location, great comfortable rooms and walking distance to great restaurants, piers and shopping.
review.locationRemarks: right on Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Walking distance to many things
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, spacious room, helpful staff

Hotel has amazing exposed timber beams inside - beautifully set up
review.positiveRemarks: The exposed timber beams in the rooms, etc - awesome

review.title: Great hotel, restaurant needs work.
review.reviewText: Hotel was great on all fronts except one...we were turned away from the hotel restaurant for not having a reservation, despite there being plenty of open tables. When we came back 30 minutes later, the same tables sat empty. When we came back 30 minutes after that, guess what? Yes, the same tables were empty. Be advised, if you want to eat in the hotel restaurant, make a reservation. Don't assume an empty restaurant means you will get a seat. Odd and unfriendly, but that is what we encountered. All other aspects of the hotel were top notch.

review.title: Great for family!
review.reviewText: Concierge was awesome. Hotel perfectly located in more quiet end of the Wharf with close accessibility to transit. Great environment for families and excellent views of Alcatraz and Golden Gate. Highly recommend! Cioppino's is excellent choice for dinner.

review.title: excellent service
review.reviewText: lovely hotel very comfrotable and free wine tasting of a evening
review.negativeRemarks: only one eating area
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Great location on wharf with great service, pricey
review.reviewText: A little overpriced for the weekend but if you want to be near the Wharf, great location.

review.title: good times at the Arganaut
review.reviewText: we have stayed in this hotel three times now and thoroughly enjoy the experience. The location is great and the staff always very welcoming.
review.positiveRemarks: this hotel's point of difference is the interior decor and the very friendly staff and great mix and mingle drinks hour each evening
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Good restaurants and handy to access tours on harbour etc

review.title: Great hotel for everyone
review.reviewText: My husband and I were very happy with our hotel stay, the location was great! The cannery style building, attached to a courtyard with shops, restaurants, entertainment, as well as being right on the wharf was awsome;) Still on the Wharf but far enough from all the tourisum and foot traffic. The Nautical theme and cleanliness of our room was great, the hotel offered a great wine and appetizers in the evening with a cozy fire place and cozy seating. The hotels location right next to Hyde Park where you can catch the cable cars, and enjoy a hot fudge sundae at Ghirardelli Square;P The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Loved it!

review.title: Great location but to much street noise
review.reviewText: Great location but noisey. There was a fair bit of pedestrian noise from the adjacent Irish pub on our room till 2am. It was a long weekend thou.

review.title: A four day stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel and great location. The beds are wonderful but the parking is very expensive, over $50.00 with city tax. Parking nearby $33.00 at Gheradilli Square

photos.caption: Double room with view over bay

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel right on the bay. Lovely rooms. Highly recommend The Blue Mermaid for lunch.

review.title: The nicest place to stay on the wharf
review.reviewText: The lobby was cozy and comfortable for relaxing after walking the city. Wine tasting hour was a nice social experience.
review.negativeRemarks: the young child that ran screaming through the hallway at 6 am on Sunday morning
review.locationRemarks: excellent location for touring San Francisco

review.title: Fun weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Concierge and front desk staff were very helpful. Great location. Access to restaurants, Fisherma's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, and more was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Amazing access to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: You Can Do A Whole Lot Better
review.reviewText: Having completed a lengthy visit to the S.F. Bay area the Napa Valley, our last night before returning home was spent at the Argonaut. While the staff was courteous, they seemed somewhat less than genuine at the front desk. The doorman service and valet were the most helpful. The size of our room made it difficult to control the room temperature evenly throughout the large space. Additionally, a large shelf located in the shower stall broke away from the walll. When I reported this to the front desk, the clerk seemed mildly amused and notified the "Executive Housekeeper" who neither acknowledged me nor apologized for any inconvenience. The shower was very difficult to regulate and difficult to find a comfortable temperature range. Finally, we utilized the concierge to recommend a restaurant in S.F.'s famous North Beach section known for its fine Italian food. The concierge made her suggestion saying "This is the best." We were sent to an establishment that not only had markedly bad service, the food was mediocre at best. To top it off, on leaving the restaurant, we hailed a taxi and when we asked to be taken to the Buena Vista, one of the city's more well known pubs, the driver said, "I'm new and I don't know where that is." We had to provide the directions! All in all, our last night in San Francisco was a somewhat of a disappointment from an accommodations perspective but, we love the city and will return in the near future. However, we would not recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Service, accommodations, concierge
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to Pier 39 and wharf area

review.title: Over all a non plus hotel
review.reviewText: I visited with my wife late August 2012. About a ten minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Upon our arrival our cases were dealt with efficiently and straight away the touting started (for wine tasting). We have just had a ten hour flight plus the trip from the airport so wine tasting was at the bottom of our list!!! If you want a taxi the same person will jump out into the middle of the road and wave one down for you. The welcome inside was polite if not a little ingratiating. We found our room with our luggage not far behind. The room was not big but had a good size and comfortable bed. The bathroom well equipped. The hotel served it's purpose, it was clean, had helpful staff, comfy bed and was well maintained but the atmosphere was a little formal with no real character to the place. we returned from the Wharf about half nine one evening hopping for a drink in the bar after our meal in the Wharf to find it was closed. Bit odd for a hotel bar. Still saved us a bit of money. Over all more non plus than value for money.
review.negativeRemarks: not genuinely welcoming. All smiles and white teeth but no real substance
review.locationRemarks: Neither here nor there. About 15 min walk to Fisherman's Wharf, running the gauntlet of shop owners trying to get you into their shops.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, a little pricey but worth the stay. The staff was helpful and courteous. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable. Our location was perfect, everything in walking distance to all piers, shops & restaurants. We especially liked the wine reception each evening. The staff printed our boarding passes, locked up our luggage so we could take a cable car run after check out and then they called us a cab. It was a great and memorable stay. They even take pets.
review.negativeRemarks: Absolutely nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect, we walked everywhere. Close ferry ride to Sausilito, a must see.

review.title: Great Location with Excellent Employees
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was excellent in every way. The most important way was the excellence of it's customer service. It didn't matter which employee we talked to, they were all friendly and very helpful at all times.

review.title: Anniversary visit
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, pleasant. We found it quite noisy though due to proximity to the public transit. Would recommend visitors ask for a room on the east side, or an inside room.
review.negativeRemarks: too noisy
review.locationRemarks: close to tourist attraction of Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Kimpton san Fran
review.reviewText:
Brilliant all round. Staff, facilities, rooms, service. I have never stayed at a Kimpton hotel before, but it will be the first I look for when traveling in the US.
Reception staff were brilliant, answered all of my questions and gave me excellent advise every time.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, next to cable car lines, car rental, tourist district, tour operators, waterfront, boat cruises and fishermans wharf.

review.title: Just Nice
review.reviewText:
At the price they are charging they should include breakfast to be truly considered 1st class.
The hotel is nice, beds were 1st class and the area is ok, and convenient. However in comparison to hotels worldwide this is hotel is pricy for what you get. So, Good hotel? Yes. Value for money? No.

review.title: Awesome hotel with great people.
review.reviewText:
I moved to the Argonaut from another hotel in Union Square, and the experience was night and day.

The view from the room was fantastic and the room was great. The umbrella in the closet was a nice touch. :)
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic!

review.title: Comfort
review.reviewText: Pleased with stay and was very comfortable. Would have appreciated a morning coffee courtesy of hotel (fresh coffee in lobby)

review.title: A great experience in an Francisco
review.reviewText: We had a great time. The staff are friendly and happy to help. It was a fantasic location on Fisherman's Wharf and near the Cable Car. breakfast a little pricey but there are other places close by. A guest laundry would be good for tracellng families.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location
Staff
Happy hour drinks
Cleaniness of the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Vanity in bathroom too small
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic, close to cable car and right at the start of the fisherman's wharf

review.title: Toronto Ladies Vacation in San Fran / environs.
review.reviewText: Hotel is very well located on Fisherman's Wharf near all attractions, cable cars, ferries, and great restaurants. Super Happy Hour consists of red and white wines and sometimes a sparkling beverage btwn 5 - 6 pm. Staff is very attentive, pleasant and courteous. Beds are comfortable and rooms are spacious. Pet friendly on specific floors if that is important information for you. Nautical theme is evident throughout the building. Would suggest they provide a couple of chairs or a sofa in the room for seating. Overall would recommend this hotel for everyone.
review.positiveRemarks: cleanliness, helpful staff, great happy hour
review.negativeRemarks: lack of enough seating in rooms
review.locationRemarks: well situated on Fisherman's Wharf close to buses, cable cars, hop on hop off trolleys etc

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel located very well to activities and restaurants. This is the ONLY hotel located right on fishermans wharf. Even though other hotels state they are on fishermans wharf, they are not. The food at the Blue Mermaid was only average. There are many other restaurants near by to choose from that offer better quality. My stay was in the King suite and was terrific. I strongly recommend the extra $ for this hotel. If I return to SanFrancisco I would stay here again

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was great. Rooms were a little small. Bed was comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms

review.title: Nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with a nautical theme & a bit of character which we enjoyed. Pleasant & helpful staff & located conveniently to Fishermans wharf. We expected a nice view of the water but the view was obscured by trees so some room views would be better than others (obviously not the Hotels fault).Overall a nice place to hang your hat for a few days.

review.title: Not family friendly. great for couples
review.reviewText: The Hotel was very nice. We were disappointed to not have a view. Our looked out over the roof of the hotel. The other complaint was the walls were very thin, You could easily hear people in next room and doors in hallway closing very loudly. The bed and bedding however was wonderful.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, walking distance to everything at Fisherman's Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: The noisy halls and thin walls
review.locationRemarks: We were on the second floor at the Argonaut with no view. Bummer

review.title: Perfect place to explore from
review.reviewText:
Great Location to be, with all you need from the warf right on your doorstep. Had a look at the other hotels in the area while we were there, and quite happy we choose this one.
All the usual good stuff. Clean modern room. Friendly helpfull staff. Free Wifi.
Parking was a bit pricey at $46 a day plus tax, but after driving all day on the pacific coast highway, it was nice just to walk away and let the valet parking take the car away. Kudos to to those guys too, after leaving some items in the car, they promptly returned the car, to allow us to remove the items. Cheaper full day parking could be found around the block, for $36. Just too easy to let these guys have it after a long days travel.
I always check places out on trip advisor, and this lived up to those reviews. If we return to SF next year, will stay here again.So happy to recommend it.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking prices
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great hotel for sightseeing in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed the stay at the hotel. The location was absolutely perfect for sightseeing in San Francisco. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The decor was tasteful, but yet very relaxing. Loved the 5 - 6 wine gathering daily in the lounge area and enjoyed talking to the other guests from a variety of locations. Had lots of interesting conversations! The restaurant food was very good. Would definitely stay here again on another trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Argonaut Hotel stay in early September 2012
review.reviewText: I thought the hotel was a nice upscale boutique hotel perfectly situated in Fishermen's Wharf. Our hotel room smelled new everytime we walked into it. The mini-bar was more than adequately stocked. There were not enough television channels to choose from. Every room could use a visitors' map to show where you were situated and where every pier was located from the hotel for those of us who have never visited San Francisco before. We loved the hotel's wine get together from 5 to 6 every afternoon. Most of the hotel staff was very friendly and professional. The king-sized bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet at night. It was nice that you could access the Blue Mermaid cafe from both the hotel lobby and the street. The food was very good at the cafe albeit a bit pricey, especially for breakfast. We would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor and freshness as well as the daily wine parties
review.negativeRemarks: Other than one snotty doorman who was peeved that we asked the location of a pier, the staff was friendly and professional
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for those visitors wanting to stay in the Fishermen's Wharf area and close to the Bay

review.title: Best hotel we stayed in!
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 3 nights during August 2012 as part of our honeymoon trip. From the very start we were impressed with not only the location in Fisherman's Wharf but the decor and the staff too. We received an upgrade to our room plus a bottle of champagne AND a whole food hamper and tote bag. There was also a free wine reception every day between 5-6pm which was great and because I had signed up to be a Kimpton member (this is free to do on their website and I highly recommend it) we received free in-room wi-fi plus free mini bar! The concierge also gave us free vouchers to use with the rent-a-bike company next door so we had a whole day of riding over the Golden Gate bridge courtesy of the Argonaut. We spent 3 weeks travelling through NYC and California and our stay at the Argonaut was our favourite by a mile. The cafes, bars and restaurants are all very near and the location to Pier 39 is great too. We also had a view of the Golden Gate Bridge from our room. Can't recommend enough :)
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for sightseeing, families and couples alike.

review.title: Lovely Experience
review.reviewText: Really Lovely hotel! Would highly reccommend. Located right near the cable car terminal, and on Fishermans Wharf. Easy to get to all the sights. Staff really friendly, hotel really clean and modern. Well worth the stay
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Next to cable car terminus, views of Golden Gate Bridge, Pleasant walk along Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: Excellent location and staff were fantastic. We were on honeymoon and had a complimentary bottle of bubbles in our room. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Hotel, Nice Location
review.reviewText: Great hotel, well located to water area, good business facilities, a bit crowded with tourists nearby.

review.title: Fabulous San Francisco trip
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful hotel. Clean, comfortable and great location. The staff was helpful, courteous and friendly. The concierge was great in assisting guests with meal recommendations, transportation, etc. The location is fantastic, close to everything on the waterfront. There is a wonderful maritime museum attached to the hotel. The wine happy hour is a nice extra for guests. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

review.title: Beds
review.reviewText: The overall hotel experience was good, but the beds were not very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is excellent, the staff was helpfull. The resturant was very good especially the soups.
review.negativeRemarks: hard mattress

review.title: We'll be back
review.reviewText: The hotel is right on the Wharf. The staff were really friendly. Can't wait to go back!

review.title: position.
review.reviewText: Well located for fisherman's whalf. Easy to get access to uptown transport. Very helpful staff. Nice food in the Restaurant.

review.title: Great hotel location
review.reviewText: The location is fantastic and hotel lovely. Very nice accommodations. Within walking distance of Wharf attractions and restaurants. Bell captain was SUPERB! and most helpful. But, why serve cheap complementary wine not from Napa or Sonoma in a fine San Francisco hotel? Front desk staff needs more knowledge about checkin, business office and general hotel information. Also, clothes hooks would be most helpful in bed and bath rooms.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The staff is wonderful and very helpful. Very clean and comfortable rooms. Room service and food wonderful as well.

review.title: Location, location,location
review.reviewText: The location is very good, close to everything on the wharf.

review.title: Great hotel in centre of it all.
review.reviewText: Great location, easy to travel by Muni card or bikes all over the town. We hired a car before arriving in SF and took it back the 1st day we were there having driven over the bridge and to a couple of other places. Hotel really helpful. Great room. Comfortable bed and enough space. Nice touches with the jogging map and staff really helpful. Would top it off if there was a roof top bar! Imagine the views.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf experience
review.reviewText: Beautiful room with plenty of space. Very comfortable bed and nice bathroom. Nice robes in closet. We were very happy with the room and condition of this hotel. It's located right on fishermans wharf, at the end by the park. Nice to walk toward the busy wharf activities or head the other direction by a park and swimming area all the way to the Golden Gate Bridge if you want. Nice views of Alcatraz. A bit noisy on Saturday night as you are at the Wharf but not too bad. If you want a touristy experience in a nice hotel, this is a good choice.

review.title: Very Overrated for the Price
review.reviewText:
The hotel promoted happy hour in the lobby with free wine. The wine they served was two steps below two buck chuck! We tried to get a decent drink in the very small bar in the restaurant, but couldn't reach the bartender. The lobby was crowded with very limited seating.
Valet parking was advertised, but found out that it was $46 per day. Ouch! Please don't do me any favors.

Bottom line....the room was just fine, the location good, but forget the rest of the experience awkward, crowded, expensive.

This hotel is very overrated.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby, bar, restaurant, parking
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Pricey, but very good Fisherman's Wharf hotel
review.reviewText: Right on Fisherman's Wharf near Ghirardelli Square, the Argonaut is a fine -- if expensive -- tourist hotel. The relentless nautical theme is a bit annoying, but the appointments all are first class. My only complaints are that the Deluxe King room was rather small for the hefty price tag, and the bed was a bit firm for my taste.

review.title: STAY HERE!!!
review.reviewText:
Absolutly perfect location and easy to access! Fifteen minute walk to Pier 33 (Alcatraz tours - but get you tickets from the National Park Service well in advance). The cable cars stop is just outside your door. The "crookedest street" Lombard is only five blocks away. The National Park Service is literally next door. Bicycle rental and taxi service - front door. Valet parking takes care of your car (Additional fee of $46/day but well worth the fee.)

The Hotel staff are extremely courteous! Free wine each evening from 5 to 6. Very nice rooms. We love the transformation from "The Cannery" to the hotel. Sure beats the chain hotels by far!

Looking forward to returning for a much longer stay at the Argonaut and exploring more of San Fran.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location on Fisherman's Wharf but away from all the noise. Our room overlooked the Hyde Street turn around and was rated as a Golden Bridge view. Even allowing for the fog and mist the view would have been very partial at best. It was very comfortable and provided a great base for our first visit to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the complimentary bikes which we were able to use all day to ride the Bridge

review.title: Pricey water
review.reviewText: Excellent location, lovely room, bright and clean, but alittle OTT on pricing, thought the cost of bottled water was extreme, would have expected it to be complimentary! Not 3 and 6 dollars

review.title: Family Fun in San Fran
review.reviewText: This hotel is very comfortable and in a perfect location for exploring the city. It is very close to cable car stops for exploring Union Square, Chinatown and North Beach as well as the waterfront. Just step outside and you are just a couple of minutes from the waterfront. The Blue Mermaid had a great breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was laid out perfectly. We did not feel cramped.
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Instant touristy fun but also easy to get to other parts of the city.

review.title: Not long enough....
review.reviewText: We had a great stay, loved the hotel. Particular impressed with bellman Ethan who gave us a great introduction to our room on arrival and suggestions for great coffee and eating places near by. Excellent location for Fishermans Wharf, public transport, the ocean and local attractions. Wished we could have stayed longer....
review.positiveRemarks: Marine theme, friendly staff, comfortable well equipped room including hilarious animal print robes!
review.negativeRemarks: Very busy lobby/living room. Shower tiling not as clean as it could be, grout discoloured...
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for accessing Fishermans Wharf and local attractions whether by foot or public transport

review.title: Nice location, but fairly noisy
review.reviewText:
Overall, it was a good hotel in an excellent location (right on the main drag of the Wharf). However, the rooms do not have good soundproofing so we heard a lot of what was taking place outside (outside our window was a happening Mexican restaurant) and in the rooms adjacent to us (we woke up at 8am to a family arguing in German next door).

Staff is extremely friendly and helpful and the decor is very nice.

review.title: Excellent service, clean room, dream location
review.reviewText: Great location. Excellent Staff. Very very clean and comfortable. Best nights sleep I have had in awhile. Getting taxis are easy and due to location you can pretty get anywhere cheaply
review.positiveRemarks: Happy Hour which is free (donations accepted) and location!!
review.negativeRemarks: The Duck Tour which passes by the hotel every AM
review.locationRemarks: Excellent. Right next to Ghirardelli Square but easy to get a cab to all parts of San Francisco

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: Everyone was pleasant for our whole stay of 5 days. There was nothing lacking for us. We had read a few reviews about the smaller size of the rooms, but this was not the case for us! We can't say anything negative about our time spent at the Argonaut. Would highly recommend it to anyone. We were a family of 5 (2 rooms) Mom, Dad and 3 kids in their early 20's.
review.positiveRemarks: great rooms. comfortable beds. nice bathrooms. friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: concierge was not very helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location. Convenient to so many things to do. Nice that it is on the very end of the very commercial Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Good hotel but some drawbacks
review.reviewText:
Just spent 5 nights staying at the Argonaut as a family with teenage kids. While nothing was particularly horrendous I left feeling slightly underwhelmed. The hotel is pleasant, clean, well located and fairly spacious although the public areas are less than adequate. Probably the main source of dissatisfaction was Fishermans Wharf itself - it's now grossly commercialised with gaudy and cheap seafront shops. It's not a reason not to stay there per se, just know what you are heading to. Head left out of the hotel in the direction of Sissey Fields and Golden Gate bridge and things are much more pleasant, especially when the sun shines.
Back to the hotel - rooms are a good size, ours was clean and well maintained but bathroom was small and more dated. We only used the restaurant for breakfast and found it to be on the expensive side with charges for all refills (niggle). The food however was good. No free wifi (niggle niggle) in the hotel but you can pay a daily rate - surely a hotel of this standard and expense doesn't need to skim you for what is now a travelling necessity. Staff were pleasant at all times but tended to be slightly aloof.
Dining tips if you do choose to go - avoid the Wharf and head up to North Beach (10mins walk max). There are numerous great restaurants dotted around Washington Square. Particularly commend Original Joe's (Stockton/Union st) for brunch or dinner, Cafe Divine (directly opposite) for excellent breakfasts and Cafe Sport on Green St for seafood.
review.negativeRemarks: Wharf tat
review.locationRemarks: Probably the best that you will get on the Wharf but still VERY busy

review.title: Great for families or couples
review.reviewText: Cute boutique hotel in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. Nice amenities, including afternoon wine tasting! Parking was expensive and inconvenient, but overall great experience. Would highly recommend.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: We arrived very early (11:30AM?) and we're able to check in right away which was great since my daughter was not feeling well. Our four night stay was enjoyable. We didn't need much in the way of service but whenever we had a request it was always greeted with a smile. The location is great for the wharf, seafront and dining. Our room was at the back of the building which kept hall noise to a minimum but on Saturday night there was quite a bit of noise as the bars closed. A number of mornings we could hear what sounded likes weights be dropped at around 6:00AM.
review.negativeRemarks: Standard bathroom with limited counter space, noise level on a Saturday night from bar and drunks, only one entrance/exit door.
review.locationRemarks: Walk out the front door and you feel like you're in the middle of the action.

review.title: Family's Ultimate San Francisco Base Station
review.reviewText: Great decor, fabulous staff--personable, not pushy. Great restaurant dining--wonderful seafood. Knew how to cook well-done fish without drying it out. Car came promptly when called.
review.positiveRemarks: Glass of wine when ending day before going to dinner, VERY comfortable beds, comfortable bath for soaking... ahhh... and free wifi for the teenager!
review.negativeRemarks: Husband freaked over star-shaped pillows... sometimes restaurant/lobby music too loud
review.locationRemarks: Perfect family base to see San Francisco--Fisherman's Wharf area was loud on the street--VERY quiet in hotel.

review.title: LOCATION...LOCATION...LOCATION!
review.reviewText: Location...Location...Location! Drive up and park your car...never a need for it until you're headed home. Walk to the Wharf, great restaurants, shops...and steps to the trolly cars for Union Square and Theatres. Cool weather for a brisk morning walk, accompanied by a cup of STARBUCKS from the store located in the hotel building. Friendly staff and accomodating for reservations at shows, restaurants, taxis, etc. I'd come back again...and often!
review.positiveRemarks: Small and friendly...and so convenient to the Fishermans Wharf activities.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy at night...near the Trolly turn-around and tourist buses.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to everywhere!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great service. Blase at the counter was great help in recommending places to see and best times to go to avoid the big rush. Would highly recommend staying at the hotel.

review.title: Very good hotel, need better service
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a great location with a beautiful lounge which has great seating. They have complimentary drinks from 2-5pm in the lounge which was a very nice touch after a busy day of sightseeing. We asked for a quiet room and recieved it. the room was very comfortable.
John, the valet was very helpful.
The conceirge was too busy and not very helpful. Perhaps they need to add a second one during busy hours.
We were told there was someone at the front desk 24 hours a day for our early checkout. However I called 3 times with no answer. We had to carry all our stuff down ourselves and call for our car. Someone did show up after we got to the desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Poor service
review.locationRemarks: Maritime museum located in the building, on Fisherman's Wharf, next to beach and park and carble car turntable, and bus.

review.title: from Adelaide, Australia
review.reviewText: The king size best was really comfortable, but too big for the room size - could barely get past between the wall and the bed. The best location, close to everything. Did not get to try the wine happy hour - could be better timed between 6 -7pm instead of 5 -7pm. Would like it better if they had milk instead of powder for the in room coffe. We are a mature couple and absolutely loved the whole experience

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Loved the wine reception and the staff. Room quiet no view. Small room. A bit pricey but great location!

review.title: Recommend
review.reviewText: A very good hotel. The small handbasin with little shelf space was a bit annoying. As was the outward opening door to the room. Busy location and busy with all kinds of guests but overall would recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom shelf space
review.locationRemarks: Busy but perfect for the sightseer

review.title: Hotel with character !!
review.reviewText: We loved the location! Staff were very friendly and were only too happy to help with anything we needed.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
This is a great place to stay along the bay. Staff was friendly and helpful. The beds are comfortable. The room was very clean and the cleaning staff always had a smile on their face and willing to help with any needs you might have. The wine reception in lobby during the late afternoon is great. The hotel restaurant has award winning crab and corn chowder. Very lovely.
The location is great to many of the bay area attractions. It's a charming hotel!
You won't be disappointed.

review.title: A Week in Luxury
review.reviewText: The staff in all areas were very friendly. They always spoke to you and told you to have a great day. This included housekeeping, concierge, front desk, entry door personnel and restaurant. We had an issue with a clogged commode. The repairman was there within 10 min and fixed it on the spot. He was very cordial as well.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness and friendliness and location. You can see Alcatraz when you walk out the front door of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: I cannot think of anything.
review.locationRemarks:
Near Fisherman's Wharf and waterfront. Trolley at corner. city tour
on corner.

review.title: Relaxing!
review.reviewText: Very quiet and relaxing atmosphere. Highly reccomend this hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: The decor was very soothing and relaxing
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, we had a fantastic time!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location! Close to Fisherman's warf and pier 39 yet far enough away not to have the insane crowds.

review.title: Clean rooms, friendly service, free wine.
review.reviewText: Great hotel but Fisherman's Wharf is all about tourists. The rooms are spotless, the service is great, ans there is free wine an hour each day.

review.title: Great hotel for a family
review.reviewText: Friendly hotel - great themed rooms. In the heart of Fisherman's Wharf action but surprisingly quiet. Resteraunt fairly ordinairy at this price point. Good starting point for cycling across the bridge.
review.negativeRemarks: Food (but plently of other options locally)
review.locationRemarks: Centre of Fisherman's Wharf action. Great for cycling across the bridge. Acess to downtown good but not outstanding.

review.title: A really pleasant stay
review.reviewText:
I got in late on a Monday night, so I couldn't see much. I decided to go look around the next morning and find some coffee and was blown away. Walked out the front of the hotel and the bay is right across the street. There was an old clipper ship docked, a modern cruise ship coming in to port, the Golden Gate off to the left, across the bay hillsides covered with houses that reminded me of photos of the mediteranean.

There's a park to one side of the hotel that extends up a hill on one side with the bay on the other. There were folks out for their morning swim close to shore, lots of healthy people jogging and riding bikes (it was maybe 7am). On the other side of the hotel was pretty much every touristy thing you could want -- plenty of places to eat, get snacks, shop, book tourist activities. There were three Starbucks within just a couple of blocks.

I was on a really fast trip in and out of the city for business and pretty stressed out. There wasn't anything at the hotel that added to my stress. I had one of the extra large rooms, so there was plenty of room for me to spread out and work, run an iron over my clothes, etc.

It's not the kind of place where taxis are sitting outside and when I was going to checkout, I realized I might have to wait -- which caused me a little angst, but before I even got to the front desk someone approached me and asked if I needed one and they had one for me within a couple of minutes.
review.negativeRemarks: There really wasn't anything unlikeable about it.
review.locationRemarks: Very touristy area of town, so in the middle of anything a vistor could want. Right on the bay, a park on one side and food/shops, etc. on the other.

review.title: Super friendly and impeccably clean
review.reviewText: The room was spacious and clean and quiet. They provided a long list of items in case you forgot them (toothpaste, razors and much more). Free wine tasting at 5PM in the lobby. Hotel manager was pouring and was incredibly helpful in providing dinner suggestions. They even printed out a document for us at the front desk and no annoying $1/page fee! I would definitely go back.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was just OK-better options neary
review.locationRemarks: Perfect if you are doing the Fisherman's Wharf tourist thing but want to avoid the "motels"

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: My wife and I loved our stay at the Argonaut. The only negative I can think of was that the room was small (the view out the window was of the windows of the other rooms in the hotel), but since most of our time was spent out in the city that did not impact our enjoyment. The location is phenomenal, easy walking to tours (like the cable cars, Alcatraz island, etc.), wonderful restaurants, and other locales (like the Embarcadero). The service was great. We enjoyed the small gym on our floor. Overall, in our opinion, this is a great hotel.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf - Great starting point
review.reviewText: Great location, courteous and helpful staff and well appointed rooms with a lot of character. We would certainly go again!

review.title: Lovely hotel; area too touristy
review.reviewText: Great hotel for people wanting to experience Fisherman's Wharf, but it's a really crowded, touristy area. The hotel provides a nice, sane respite from the overstimulating surroundings, but I don't think I'd stay in that neighborhood again.
review.positiveRemarks: Room very well appointed and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Location.
review.locationRemarks: Really touristy.

review.title: Aussie traveller
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, staff were very helpful. Room was very clean and modern. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was clean
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was amazing. Staff were very helpful when organizing day trips
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fishermans wharf, lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Great Hotel for family trips
review.reviewText: Great services and amazing location in tourist area. Just steps from cable cars, the beach and bike rentals. A little expensive based on the size of the rooms, but youre paying for location and the experience. My kids had the most fun, including a scavenger hunt inside the hotel where they get toys when theyre finished. Great experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for turists. Steps away from cable cars and bike rentals. Walk a couple of blocks to the Wharf.

review.title: vacation at the Argonaut
review.reviewText: Great hotel, nice staff. Very friendly and willing to go out of their way to make visit good. Good location for access to Wharf area. Good for family vacation. Safe and quiet at night with no worries in the later evening walking about.

review.title: Loved the Argonaut
review.reviewText: it was great, loved the dogs and the wine reception

review.title: Fabulous Wharf Hotel!
review.reviewText:
Everything was fantastic, except that the room smelled like Chlorox or chlorine (!). I guess that's better than other hotel smells!

Thank you. We will definitely stay there again!
Pam
review.negativeRemarks: smell in the hotel room
review.locationRemarks: spot on

review.title: The Place to be in SF
review.reviewText: Pleasant room w/ bright nautical decor. Excellent location.
review.locationRemarks: convenient to Fisherman's wharf, a cablecar line and Ghirardelli Square

review.title: The location is the best thing about the Argonaut
review.reviewText: If you want a quiet place to stay, don't stay here. The walls are absolutely paper thin. I could hear every room door open and close and every foot fall in the hallway. Could also hear the water running and toilet flushing in next door rooms. This Hotel claims to be a 4 star, but it's a 3 star at best.
review.positiveRemarks: Being able to walk out the front door of the hotel and be within steps of Aquatic Park.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect.

review.title: Don't think twice - book it!
review.reviewText: Many people are put off staying at Fishermans Wharf because it is deemed to be "too touristy". I would say you need not worry at all. The hotel is beautifully located at the western end of the main drag, close to good transport links and restaurants and away from the most popular venues. The staff couldn't be more helpful. I fear that the number of visits I made to the Concierge might have caused her to lose the will to live, but she was ever anything other than delightful and incredibly helpful. The bed was the most comfortable I've slept in for years. I meant to find out what make it was, but forgot unfortunately. The free glass of wine each day is a novel and most welcome idea - the lively atmosphere in the lobby as guests gathered was uplifting after a long day of sightseeing. I will definitely be looking for Kimpton hotels on future holidays.
review.positiveRemarks: The option to receive a 5$ voucher any day you decide against having your room serviced is a brilliant idea.

review.title: Interesting concept, but not for everybody
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located very near the main tourist attractions. A plus for visitors.

Water pressure in the shower was so weak it was barely a trickle.

Parking is awfully complicated, so you are better off paying the $46 daily valet parking fee.

Internet access is very sporadic inside the hotel, going in and out frequently.

The attached restaurant is overpriced for breakfast and run-of-the-mill in terms of quality. Not a plus, if not a minus.
review.negativeRemarks: A functioning shower would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: At the center of the action

review.title: Fantastic, roomy and quiet hotel. Worth the extra.
review.reviewText: Great hotel, good location for fishermans wharf, comfy bed and quiet rooms, nice decor, friendly staff with useful suggestions, cute minibar selection and a few good free perks for guests. Very close to two famous relatively cheap places to eat Scomas (seafood) and Buena Vista (American and pub, first America Irish coffee place).

photos.caption: The Argonaut Great Hotel Great Location!

review.title: Great Hotel Stay!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was a wonderful hotel it was clean, friendly, comfortable, quiet and close to everything. The entire staff was a delight. This would definitely be my choice again!
review.negativeRemarks: No view from our room.
review.locationRemarks: It was a great location close to everything!

review.title: Wonderful weekend!
review.reviewText: Everything was wonderful! Very quiet rooms, perfect location and comfy beds. Couldn't have been better!

review.title: Staying at the Argonaut
review.reviewText: Ideal location for Fishermans wharf, pier 39 and for all tours from the bay area, The evening wine reception gave an opportunity to socialise with other hotel residence and was a good start to the evening, staff freindly and helpful and very knowledgeable of the area
review.negativeRemarks: Door to the room opening outwards, took a bit of getting used to
review.locationRemarks: Superbly located for all main attractions around the pier area and the cable car with plently of places to eat

review.title: Enjoyed every minute
review.reviewText:
Fantastic location for seeing the sites of SF. Blue Mermaid is very good and wine tasting is fun. Room clean, comfortable and quieter than expected.
Already recommended it to a co-worker who is planning to visit SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Bell boy very keen to take a tip
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for cable cars, boats and site seeing tours

review.title: Lovely and charming hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was exactly what we were looking for. It was traditional but luxurious at the same time. Super comfy beds, free wine tasting and a great lounge. Room service, movie rentals and spa treatments all quite pricy though. Location is great, tons of stuff with in walkibg distance. Would recomend for sure, had a wonderful romantic weekend away here.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
The Location of the Argonaut Hotel has you right amongst the busy wharf activities and within walking distance to all the sites.
The staff were friendly and extremely helpful.
The room was very comfortable and clean with all the facilities needed.
Highly recommend.

review.title: US Open weekend at the Wharf!
review.reviewText:
Great Hotel and right in the heart of the Wharf. Near Fisherman's Wharf, cable car, Ghirardelli, Hop On & Hop Off buses. Super restaurants in the area. Very helpful bellmen and concierge. Hotel has very comfortable lounge area near front desk. Rooms were very large and comfortable. TV cable carrier was very poor. Service kept flicking on and off during the programs, annoying to say the least.
Overall, a wonderful choice.
review.negativeRemarks: Televisioon viewing
review.locationRemarks: Couldn't be better !

photos.caption: The stunning view from our room!! Does it get any better? I don't think so!

review.title: The complete maritime experience.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed every moment of staying at this hotel. Loved the history of it for one thing, in the early 1900's it was part of the Del Monte cannery and you can tell it was restored with tender loving care to reflect this era but with all the modern convienences. Along with the nautical theme which fit so well with the area, our room had the most beautiful, fabulous, and amazing view of the San Francisco Bay and Alcatraz. I felt like I was looking at a beautiful picture when I looked out our window. We stayed for 2 nights and did not want to leave. I will definitely stay here if I ever go back to San Fran and will highly recommend this hotel to my friends. The charm of this place just touched my heart. Absolutely LOVED IT.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was extremely nice. Afternoon tea and wine tasting ;)
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything I didn't like, seriously!
review.locationRemarks: For us, this was the perfect location. Right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf we loved every minute of it.

review.title: Cute
review.reviewText: This is a quirky hotel that we really liked. It has the whole nautical theme and is quite charming in an unconventional way. The location is great and the staff superb. John the door man was more help and more attentive than the concierge. He really helped us many times. Our air conditioner was a little noisy and the condensation dripped into the room on to the carpet. We really didn't notice that till the last day, so in fairness, they never had a chance to address it. But we did have a faulty safe the first day and it was fixed very quickly.
review.negativeRemarks: the white wine at the evening reception
review.locationRemarks: Great location near the cable cars and great bus routes and the insanity of Fishermens Wharf

review.title: Argonaut - June 2012
review.reviewText: The staff was exceptionally friendly and acccomodating. The room was spacious and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great if you want to be near Fisherman's Wharf. The streetcar (F line) is two blocks away; cable car access is just one block away.

review.title: The friendliest people in the friendly town of SF.
review.reviewText: We were welcome with "Yes we are pet friendly, yes we can put a cot in your room (at no extra cost) and yes, we have a free daily wine reception". This, along with superb location, very pleasing clean rooms and funny, witty staff from the doorman to the reception, along with "good morning from all the staff", deserve this place a 5.

review.title: Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location - close to public transportation. The free wine each day is great!

review.title: Argonaut
review.reviewText: This was our 2nd trip to this hotel. We're fans of the Kimpton chain.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls (noise level), lack of proper bathroom door.
review.locationRemarks: Adjacent to Hyde St. cable car, also 1 block from major bus line and 2-3 blocks from F-trolley -- easy access to public transportation all over SF.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is truly fabulous from the receptionist Blaise telling us a joke when we were checking in to the nightly wine reception(none of your rubbish wine either) but Shiraz and Sauvignon blanc also sangria.The staff were lovely and very helpful. The restaurant was Very nice also serving great seafood.

review.title: Highly recommended for tourists
review.reviewText: Great pet friendly hotel and amazing staff. Bed was too soft for my liking, but everything else was superb.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was too soft
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: BTdTh
review.reviewText: $49/night to park the car. Great location for a lot of area activities. Our view was a bay view, but no a view of the golden gate bridge (window was small). Though this is typical of a converted warehouse.

review.title: Customer Service Awesome
review.reviewText: The staff was fantastic when I needed something great customer service!

review.title: Awesome!!
review.reviewText:
Very very good locatuon. very friendly staff...STEVE the doorman makes that place!! From the time we got there til we left, he was soo friendly and helpful! give him a 5 and watch him dance :)
Room was very nice and very clean. everything was working as it should. The evening wine tasting was a great way to get the night started. Go to nicks lighthouse a few blocks away-fabulous!!! Hole in the wall but great food and service!! I would definitely stay here again!!
review.negativeRemarks: Notta
review.locationRemarks: Are you kidding...it's perfect!!

review.title: Right on the wharf...
review.reviewText: Nicely appointed hotel with sailing theme in an historic building. Rooms were comfortable but not overdone, with exposed brick walls with windows that actually opened. It is a small hotel (only 4 floors). Stop by hotel restaurant, the Blue Mermaid, for a cup of their award winning chowder ortrythe chowder sampler... It really was good. Great location: Browse the Maritime Museum... Walk down Hyde Pier... Catch a cable car (or rent a GoCar)... Have an Irish coffee at the famous Buena Vista Cafe or go one more block to Ghiradelli Square for some shopping. The crew at the door were fun and knowledgeable about the city. You can bring your pets (treats in the hallway). Nightly wine reception encouraged guests to mingle and share stories about where they'd been and where they were going.
review.positiveRemarks: The nightly wine reception. Tips went to charity, and we met some lovely people. Lots of international guests.
review.negativeRemarks: To have a room with a view of the Bay, you have to request/pay for an upgrade. Not a lot of frills for the price, but a nice property.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the wharf, cable cars, muni station. Right across from Hyde Pier. The hotel is co-located with the Maritime Museum, which is well-done.

review.title: location, location, location
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, great location. The decor is unique and appropriate to the area, very nautical. comfortable bed. 5:00p.m. complimentary wine was a nice touch too.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Family friendly hotel near at great location
review.reviewText: Stayed 4 nights at the Argonaut hotel. Great location in the Fisherman Wharf area in San Fransisco. Easy access to the Cable car route to the Market street area. Good starting point for bike rides to the Golden gate bridge and parks. Hotel staff really friendly and service minded, you felt really welcome. Good breakfast restaurant in the hotel, but also good selection of breakfast restaurants in the neighborhood.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, really
review.locationRemarks: Great! In the Wharf area, great selection of restaurants, close to transportation, biking etc.

review.title: I do recommend this venue!
