review.reviewText: A very nice hotel in a great location. The staff were very good indeed. The rooms are "smallish" but very well appointed and decorated. The hotel ran a free wine tasting on the night we arrived and that brought a lot of guests together. A good idea. Happy to recommend this venue.
review.negativeRemarks: price was a little high for the room size.
review.locationRemarks: excellent.

review.title: Fantastic 3 Day Get Away
review.reviewText: From the moment we checked until we checked out eveyrthing was perfect. Our room had a beautiful view of the Golden Gate Bridge and we looked onto the Cable Cars at teh end of Hyde The room was made up daily and was perfectly clean. The location was fantastic, easy to get to restaurants, cable car, Pier 39, Union Square and much much more The Blue Mermaid, which by the way has fantastic food is located right in the hotel...the corn crab chowder is out of this world. The front desk and concierge was very helpful from giving us directions to getting us a bandaid. The wine get together from 5 to 6 in the evening was very relaxing and a great friendly atmosphere. We were able to use the computer in the Business centre to check in for our flight and print our boarding passes at no charge. I would highly recommend this hotel for a get away or even a business stay. We will stay here the next time we visit San Francisco
review.positiveRemarks: The people, cleanliness, atmosphere, restaurant and location
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Location was fantastic, close to Pier 39, Restaurants, Cable Car, Union Square..which we walked to from hotel.

review.title: Great location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: We loved staying at the Argonaut, both in terms of the location and the staff, who were very, very helpful and friendly as we navigated an unfamiliar city. The location is fabulous-- very near Fisherman's Wharf, walking distance to the Alcatrez tour pier, Ghiradelli, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the lovely brick wall and shutters in our room, the very helpful bellstaff and front desk staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The food was good in the onsite restaurant, Blue Mermaid, but for late evening, dimmer lighting would have been nice for ambience.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location in the heart of the waterfront.

review.title: Fantastic - would highly recommend.
review.reviewText: Great hotel - great spot, close to everything, transport shops and good restaurants. Very clean, spacious room - lovely comfy bed! Good hotel restaurant with fantastic breakfast. Wine tasting at 5pm - by the fire - and free!! Would highly recommend - as it was to us.
review.positiveRemarks: The view, Alcatraz - the atmosphere. Old world charm - lots going on. Close proximity to transport Downtown and Sausolito. V clean and v comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar closed at 10! Could be a little noisy through the night but it is a working Port after all!
review.locationRemarks: Great - close to everything and views of a bit of history. Alcatraz

review.title: Nice first class hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel was outstanding! The location was great, just far away but not too far away. The staff was first class all the way.

We had a great time. One thing I would do different is to move around and stay in other parts of the state. San Francisco is beautiful but If you want to see other parts of California and you only have a week to do it than don't stay here the whole time. A few days is plenty!

Parking is expensive. Don't have a rent a car for a week here! 48.00 a day at the hotel !
review.negativeRemarks: One way in and out. No back door. Elevators were too slow and it took forever to run up to the room to drop off packages or to get a jacket.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Most Friendly Hotel Ever
review.reviewText:
My family and I stayed at this hotel for four nights and we couldn't have been happier! We have two boys (ages 1.5 and the other almost 4) and the hotel was EXTREMELY accommodating and friendly to them during our stay. They have a treasure chest at the front desk full of toys that they let our oldest son pick out of when we first arrived. During the daily complimentary wine tasting (from 5 - 6), they also had sparkling apple cider for the kids to drink.

The doormen were amazing. Not only were they friendly and always giving high-fives to our kids, but they also gave them rides on the baggage carts and helped us find a taxi when our airport shuttle failed to show up.

The concierge was also phenomenal. She helped us find restaurants to visit during our stay, and also helped us re-book our Alcatraz tour when we found out we wouldn't be able to make it.

Finally, the location was perfect. It was one block from one of the main trolley stops and within two blocks of bus stops that took us everywhere we wanted to go during our visit.
review.positiveRemarks: Free wine tasting daily from 5 - 6! Did I mention it was free? Free wine? Daily?! Yes.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Within one block of a park, beach, a trolley stop and many restaurants. Two blocks from a beach, bus stops, and even more restaurants.

review.title: Great staff and location, very clean, views 50/50
review.reviewText:
Staff is GREAT. Very friendly, professional, on top of everything. Complimentary wine served in the lobby at evening time? Yes, please! Very clean, upkeep is excellent.

The rooms have quite a bit of floor space, but they're long and narrow (at least our 1 bed room was). There wasn't much room to walk around to the far side of the bed. Also, if you get an inner-wall room like ours, your "view" will be the concrete inner walls of the hotel's "courtyard" (in quotes b/c it's just empty space), along with the windows from the other inner-wall rooms. But if you get an outer-wall room, I imagine the view is superb--the hotel is right across the street from the bay!

If you're a tourist/visiting/vacationing, the location is superb. Lots of restaurants, walking distance to so many attractions and sights... can't beat it. Highly recommend this place.
review.negativeRemarks: Views are non-existent if you get an inner-wall room.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is fanastically located in Fishermans Wharf and across the road from the Hyde St cable car turnaround. The hotel doorman were excellent, in fact outstanding and could not do enough to help. The counter staff overall were very good although my wife was disappointed with the attitude of one staff member when she dropped down to advise our 7 year old had misused the remote 10 minutes earlier to start a movie. He advised our son it would seem had also clicked on something else earlier that day & my wife felt generally uncomfortable with the lack of trust & saracarric nature of the person who reversed the item. Overall the hotel is great. The Blue Mermaid...dreadful. Food was good but the demaenor of the waitress on the second day we dined for breakfast was terrible. Maybe she was having a bad day. I wouldn't call her rude or even unpleasant though others would, she just did not hide the fact she did not want to be there. This hotel is clearly committed to impressing their guests and I really wanted to give fives across the board but it only takes one or two staff members to screw up all the great work being done by the overwhelming majority at this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Waitress at Blue Mermaid who served us breakfast the second time
review.locationRemarks: Unbeatable

review.title: The Beautiful Argonaut
review.reviewText: We had a problem with our booking when we arrived (plumbing) so were not able to have the suite we had booked but the staff bent over backwards to satisfy us. The hotel was beautiful and the staff amazing. I would stay here again without a doubt.
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of a single negative aspect of this hotel, we loved it!
review.locationRemarks: Superb location, step outside and you are right in the action of Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Great Hotel but one bad apple
review.reviewText: Steve the bellhop was awesome. Hotel was nice and just right for our stay. Our only complaint was we had booked in Feb and they somehow overbooked our upgraded room for our stay in April. The Argonaught made it right for us but this was our honeymoon and we were a little frustrated by this. Not neccessarily a complaint but a employee at the front desk just didnt seem like he wanted to help us several times with any information about the city. Any question we asked he kinda gave a smirk and kept commenting let me google that for you. We were not asking highly graded questions but questions any traveler would probably like to know and a hotel should have available for its guests. Noise is loud on the streets and enters the rooms until about 11pm (didnt bother us) Bottom line: Argonaught is a nice hotel and in a good location off of fisherman wharf. I would recommend hotel and stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Wine Tasting 5pm-6pm, great wines and they fill your glass.
review.negativeRemarks: 1 front desk employee had a bad attitude, several situations, rest of employees were great. Unfortunately he was not wearing a name badge. Go Figure.
review.locationRemarks: Location was in a prime spot to see several attractions by walking. Also very close to Cable and Bus lines.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a perfect location - near Fisherman's wharf. We can walk to area attractions and lots of restaurants. Everyday at 5:00, there is free wine tasting at the hotel. The only downside to this hotel is you have to pay for wi-fi. And the silly thing is that wi-fi is free at the Starbuck's at the back of the hotel. The Argonaut should get with the times. Nobody pays for wi-fi anymore. Even taxis have free wi-fi. Other than that, we would highly recommend this hotel and would return ourselves.
review.positiveRemarks: Close proximity to all attractions and restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: Having to pay everyday for wi-fi.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to restaurants, to cable car, to Fisherman's Wharf, especially Pier 39.

review.title: Frisco2012
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Great location. Cable car is just a block away. Very convenient. Staff are friendly, hospitable & helpful. Definitely will come back to stay in this hotel again in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness of the hallway as well as the room.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient.

review.title: I don't think I would stay anywhere else!!
review.reviewText: We LOVED the Argonaut! I don't think the pictures on the internet do the hotel justice. It was very spacious, VERY comfortable, nice and quiet in the rooms, very nicely decorated, the restaurant was MUCH nicer than I thought it would be according to the photos, the entrance and wine reception room was very inviting, hotel staff VERY friendly and helpful, EXCELLENT location in Fisherman's Wharf......LOVED it so much we can't wait to go back!!
review.negativeRemarks: There truly wasn't anything we didn't like :)
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location - we walked to pier 39, pier 33 (alcatraz landing), we even walked to the Golden Gate Bridge from our hotel :) Super location!

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: Our stay at The Argonaut was fantastic. The location was perfect at Fisherman's Wharf with a short cable car, bus or cab ride to Union Sq. The rooms were clean and spacious and the free evening wine tasting was an added bonus. All the staff were so friendly and helpful we'd definitely stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable lobby area to relax after a day's sightseeing, large clean rooms, location and great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant and bar closing at 9pm.
review.locationRemarks: Nice area in Fisherman's Wharf, a short walk to North Beach.

review.title: Great hotel and location!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, lots of character. Right in the middle of all the fun!

review.title: Great hotel, limited parking.
review.reviewText:
The only thing that I didn't like about this hotel is that they only had valet parking. I don't mind parking at a garage down the street, but it would have been nice if you could get a discount on parking or validation for a day or two.

We parked on the street the first night, did all of our sightseeing by car the first day and only had to pay for 24 hours of parking. It worked for us in the end.

We loved the hotel itself.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clearly a very nice hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Could not be better for a short sightseeing visit to SF.

review.title: Easygoing
review.reviewText: Expensive but with good service, Air conditioner was pretty noisy
review.negativeRemarks: air conditioner

review.title: Amazing hotel
review.reviewText: Best place to stay in the area. We absolutely recommend this wonderful hotel!

review.title: Great for families!
review.reviewText: Loved that the hotel was pet-friendly, we'll definitely bring our dog next time! Our room was clean and smelled great. The two queen-sized beds fit the four of us perfectly. The staff was friendly and very helpful; the wine hour was wonderful. We will definitely recommend the Argonaut Hotel to our friends and family.
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly situated for playing on the beach, close to restaurants, shops, etc.

review.title: The Argonaut!!! A Great place to stay!!
review.reviewText: The hotel location was great, and the staff at the hotel was friendly, and very willing to assist with our requests. The room was very clean.
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed the atmosphere, and the opportunity to meet new people during the complementary wine hour.
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of one, I truly enjoyed my stay.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great, close to everything, cable car connection, the wharf with all its shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Great Hotel on Wisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel has the friendliest staff you can imagine. The location is great for lots of things to do. If I ever visit San Francisco again, I will stay at the Argonaut.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed did not leave a lot of room to move about the room.
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect for a tourist.

review.title: no parking
review.reviewText: There is no parking. There is no store to purchase water so we have to pay $3 per one bottle of water(16oz). I would not going back that hotel again.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: The Palomar Westwood is in a very convient location for visiting UCLA, Rodeo Drive area, and any other LA location accessible from the highways. The valet parking is expensive ($30), but makes getting your car in and out very easy. The restaurant and bar has some very tasty and handcrafted libations and some great small bites to choose from.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: Fantastic form the moment we arrived till the moment we left.

review.title: A great visit
review.reviewText: The Hotel is stunning, the people are great, the location, the cleanness, the kindness. No words
review.negativeRemarks: The absence of a free breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Boutique Hotel in the heart of the action!
review.reviewText: 5 star Quality hotel with great staff that remember you once they met you even once. Nothing is too difficult. Well located, close to all the touristy action but still quiet enough to enjoy some restful sleep. Fantastic bed and one of the most comfortable ones I have ever laid on! Just wish the walls were slightly thicker as I could still hear noise from people around when talking in the corridor.
review.positiveRemarks: The extra lush and comfortable bed. The great professional staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Better noise insulation in rooms would be perfect
review.locationRemarks: Perfect and depending on the room you may get a nice clear view of San Francisco bridge which is rare for a hotel in town.

review.title: Best place to stay on the wharf
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and two teens. It was extremely family-friendly, clean and central to many activities. The hotel restaurant was delicious and there were many other dining options nearby. The rooms were beautifully done, very visually pleasing and comfortable. They had several nice touches like free wine tasting in the afternoon which included cider for the kids. The best was Ernie at the front desk who gave invaluable information. The worst were the concierges who knew very little about the area and had little to offer. Great place to stay. I would go there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms, the bed, the location and help from Ernie.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierges

review.title: For the price, shouldn't be any mistakes.
review.reviewText: The room was to small, it was like a shoe box, long and narrow (second floor.) We asked for an upgrade and were told we could change. We brought everything down stairs but then we were told there wasn't a room available until the next night so we had to take everything back up. The next day all our things were moved into the new room while we were out enjoying the day. We never did receive a paper in the morning. The concier desk made a mistake in the number of tickets we needed and I'm still waiting for the $214 bank charge to be reversed. No one told us the kids could have had sparkling cider while we enjoyed our wine at the mangers reception; the last night I saw a kid in line, saw the cider. For dinner in the Blue Mermaid, kids and I waited 15 minutes after we were sat at a table. We never received menus or water glasses. We walked out and had a very nice dinner across the street. Gentlemen out front, especially Kevin, were great, nice and attentive.
review.positiveRemarks: Once we moved, I loved the view. Friendly door men
review.negativeRemarks: Beds to soft and high. Needs more chairs or small couch. Would be nice to have hooks along wall or shelves to place our stuff onto.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect, why we choose this place. Easy to walk or catch a bus, cable car, or taxi,

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Great location, lovely hotel, LOVED the nightly free wine tastings for adults and hot chocolate bar for kids!
review.locationRemarks: in the middle of everything the Warf has to offer!

review.title: SFCA Argonaut
review.reviewText: I didn't expect the hotel to be so nice. It was clean. The staff were helpful. The gym was small, but well equipped. It was convenient.

review.title: Great hotel and location!
review.reviewText: We loved the Argonaut! My 2nd time staying at this hotel. Love the Kimpton chain! Great staff and well run organization! The restaurant was delicious, too!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Quiet corner near Ghiradelli Square.

review.title: Great hotel, would stay again
review.reviewText: Overall I found the hotel very good. It was ideally located to everything in Fisherman's Wharf. The room was quiet and comfortable. The free wireless was a good connection. The room rates were very reasonable. The lighting was a little dim but as long as you turned on all the lamps it was ok. There was only complimentary coffee provided in the room. As a tea drinker I would have liked a couple of tea bags! Other than that I couldn't fault it. I would definitely choose to stay there again on future trips to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, friendly staff, very comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: No tea bags were provided, only coffee; room a little dark
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for the tourist

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect from the time that we met the Doorman to the time we said goodbye.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: We had a fabulous stay at the Argonaut. From the moment we arrived we were treated so well- nothing was too much bother for the staff. Everyone from the doorman, the concierge, the reception team and the cleaning staff was so kind and helpful. Great location- so close to the tram, to buses, and Fishermans Wharf. We had a fabulous view of the Golden Gate Bridge from our window!
review.positiveRemarks: The hot chocolate from 2-4pm, and the very helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything!
review.locationRemarks: Superb location. Easy to walk to so many attractions. Close to tram. Relatively quiet being at the end of the street. AA++ location.

review.title: A jewel at Fisherman's wharf- Ghirardellia Square
review.reviewText:
Booked in here on a biz trip when all the downtown joints were booked. Really like this little hidden jewel hext to Ghirardelli square and Fisherman's wharf. Like many Kimpton hotels, the renovation is very innovative. this one follows the nautical theme so if that's not your cup of tea then avoid it. But the amenities are all good. Staff was really courteous and I see a lot of hotel desks in an average year, so that's not puffery. Room service at 6:30 for breakfast was a bit slow to answer but once they called me back it was really responsive and the healthy egg choice was nicely done.

I would defnitely return, and feel comfortable with family or signifcant other.

review.title: Great hotel that puts the guest first
review.reviewText:
Really nice hotel and super friendly hotel staff. I actually was a little worried the hotel would be too nautical themed, but I was pleasantly surprised by the understated & consistent decor.

I was there for a friends wedding (that was hold in the hotel) - the staff was very accommodating to wedding & non-wedding attendees alike, answering questions & going the extra mile to fulfill every guest request, then took the time to followup with me when they saw me days later (even about the littlest thing - it was great!). Definitely a nice experience after many ho-hum hotel stays.

The room (a standard, 2 queen bed room) seemed a little narrow when I walked in, but that really didn't effect my stay nor the comfort. The bed was very comfortable and bathroom a good size (with nice shampoo/soap to boot!). My friends (bride & groom) were in one of the suites - it was huge, nice refined finishes without being stuffy.

Location-wise it's literally across the street from the Fisherman's Wharf. While some of my friends that live in SF said the area was too touristy, I sort of thought it was a fun experience. There are a few areas that are very packed on the weekend, but overall there is a lot to do in a walkable area. For many, this area is probably an ideal location, with easy access to the local trolleys/muni system to get around to other areas of the city (I walked most places though to see the city).
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, location, and extra care to make my stay comfortable & fun
review.negativeRemarks: Interior rooms didn't have a view, but didn't effect the stay or experience at all

review.title: Great guest experience.
review.reviewText: The room was decorated very nicely and was very quiet. Bed was incredibly comfortable. Staff was extremely courteous and prompt. Location was top notch. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

review.title: A friendly, welcoming hotel with a great staff.
review.reviewText: Great location on fisherman's wharf; close to everything. Very attentive and friendly staff throughout the hotel. Extremely helpful with information and suggestions for restaurants, entertainment etc. Gym is small but adequate. Loved the 5-6pm wine reception in the lobby. A very nice way to relax after a long day of sight seeing. Also, being a dog owner, the fact that all of the Kimpton Hotels are dog friendly (truly dog friendly ie. no extra charges, dog bowls and a dog bed in the room) makes this an ideal choice when traveling with my four-legged companion. Stayed at the Kimpton in Boston last year (with my dog) and it was also a great experience! Highly recommended.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly helpful staff, afternoon wine reception
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, San Francisco - near lots of restaurants, the pier, cable car, close to Golden Gate Bridge, etc.

review.title: Nautical Awesomeness
review.reviewText:
All I can say is this hotel ROCKS. I am a 20 something solo male traveler - took a weekend trip February 2012 and I would stay at the Argonaut again in a heartbeat.

Awesome decor, friendly staff/very attentive - they make you feel so welcome as you walk through the halls, and it was not a once off - EVERY time I went from my room on 4th floor to the lobby, any staff member (housekeeping, managers etc.) that were nearby went out of their way to be friendly and say hello! FREE WiFi if you join Kimpton's loyalty intouch program.

Bonus points that I got in at 10 am on a Saturday (took an early Delta flight) and came expecting just to check my bags and head out until check-in but to my pleasant surprise my room was ready!

The only super small ding I have to give is for the front desk attendant - she was unable to recall the names of any nearby restaurants/bars worth going to for a fun brunch - but that is what YELP is for right!? And besides that she was awesome.

Room interior is super clean, comfortable bed and all the right amenities you expect at this price point.

Stay here - you will not be disappointed. Oh........and make use of the transportation right out the front door to get anywhere in the city you want to go on the cheap!
review.positiveRemarks:
Decor-Nautical awesomeness.
Location-Middle of the Action/Super Walkable & Accessible.
Staff-Friend/Attentive.
Room-Super clean/Awesome Decor
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing - it ROCKED.
review.locationRemarks: Superb - right on the Wharf/Park in the middle of the action. Public transport is right out the front door - can get anywhere you need to go!

review.title: Argonaut Hotel Review
review.reviewText: Hotel was really nice and clean. The staff was very professional and did an excellent job of taking care of us. My only issue was how thin the walls were. We heard everything in the hallway and in the next room. I'm not sure if it was people being rude and not thinking of others or the walls were not insulated enough.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from every direction while we was trying to sleep.

review.title: Worth it
review.reviewText: Excellent location especially for tourists. Friendly staff. Worth the price.

review.title: Great Location, Great Hotel, Great City!!
review.reviewText:
Absolutely loved the Argonaut and would definitely return!!

Whilst located towards one end of town, the setting is nontheless fantastic, especially for those who want to explore the various piers and Marina area, and the hotel is also well connected to the rest of the city via a great network of buses or the historic (and fun!!) cable car line, which starts right around the corner from the hotel entrance. It is also possible to walk around the various districts if you are prepared to negotiate San Fransisco's steep hills :)

Hotel staff are polite, friendly and helpful, and the rooms were of a reasonable size, clean and perfectly maintained. They serve free hot chocolate every day between 2pm - 4pm in addition to the free wine tasting between 5pm - 6pm too which is great for meeting other people staying in the hotel.

Food at the hotel restaurant was also good (try the clam chowder!!) although it is also worth exploring the nearby Marina / Union Street areas for a wider selection of restaurants - and livelier nightlife - than in the hotel's immediate vicinity.

review.title: Don'[t have a pleasant memory
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located in the Fisherman Wharf so in the heart of the one of the main tourist attraction in SF.
Disadvantages: the neighborhood is way too crowded especially on weekends.
Parking outside of the hotel for the ones traveling by car is really expensive. Moreover, like what happened to us, the staff working at the reception doesnt give you the alternative parking option. Thus you end up paying $39/night for a regular size car. dont want people to go through what I went through: spending first 2 hours at the hotel room searching a cheaper parking on the Internet, and walking around the neighborhood the find a more reasonable parking option. So heres the tip: you can park your car in nearby Anchorage Square Parking Lot and get a special overnight parking rate when you give the name of your hotel, but you have to do that before you get into the parking lot.
Even though your hotel rate includes free wireless in the room, once you want to get connected to the Internet, the hotel asks you to register your personal email address to Kimpton Hotels website. Once you call the front desk confirm whether this is the only option to get wireless in your room, they insist that you are obligated your to register your email to the website (and receive junk mail from a company that you have no interest in hearing from) to be able benefit from a service that they call free.
review.negativeRemarks:
Crowded lobby,
Expensive parking,
Not helpful staff
Obligation to give away your email address to be able to benefit from "free" wireless Internet.
review.locationRemarks: Way too crowded on the weekends

review.title: Great base for visting SF!
review.reviewText: A great hotel to make your base for a sightseeing holiday to SF. All staff are super friendly and make you very welcome. The rooms are a little on the small side but are very cosy and clean. The hotel is also dog friendly which is a bonus if you wish to take your fluffy pal with you. The only negative thing i could say is the walls are thin, so it can be a little noisy but nothing major. Overall we had a really nice stay at the Argonaut Hotel.

review.title: Ideal Wharf location
review.reviewText: The restaurant has great food. The location is perfect for anyone that would want to spend their vacation in the Warf. They wouldn't need a rental car. The parking is expensive at the hotel and outside the hotel. Using the tour packages, there is more than enough to do. All five of us had an excellent experience. The rooms were a bit small, but, we spent most of the time in the Warf.
review.negativeRemarks: The cost for parking at the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The location is ideal for vacationers.

review.title: Location x3
review.reviewText: The location is the best in San Francisco,i dont have any complaints about the hotel ,but the main reason we stay in the hotel was the location, it is a perfect location. The wine tasting was also very good.
review.locationRemarks: the best location

review.title: a nice Saturday in the city
review.reviewText: It was a lovely night. We were just there for one night, but had a great time. thanks!

review.title: comfort plus
review.reviewText: Great location on Fisherman's Wharf and all the hustle of the harbour. Really accommodating service people on the front counter. Nice quiet room which was a sanctuary after being amongst crowds in the city all day. Definitely would recommend for its ambience.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to cable car and harbour. Loved the new decor.
review.locationRemarks: Just out of the way from the mania of Pier 39 so you're amongst it without being smothered!

review.title: The stars are the staff
review.reviewText: This is a really nice hotel in a great location. Rooms and other areas all have good decor but the real stars are the staff. From arrival to departure they were alwasy smiling and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Nautical theme is great as are the old original timbers
review.locationRemarks: Could not be closer to Fishermans Wharf

review.title: best in san francisco
review.reviewText: My favorite hotel in san francisco by far! wonderful staff . Boutique hotel. Love the doorbells.Everythjing I could want from a hotel.

review.title: Great hotel for 1st time trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is in a great location on the fisherman's wharf. The PH trolley is across the street if you want to head downtown or just ride the trolley and within a couple blocks was the F stop where we were able to ride down the wharf and catch other trains into the city. We were able to walk to the Alcatraz tour, rented bikes and rode across the Golden Gate Bridge. There are plenty of bars and restaurants within walking so a car is not really needed. Our hotel room was a corner room and a little on the small side. We didn't have any problems with other room noise. The complementary wine tasting was great and the restaurant had wonderful crab and corn chowder.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room we had.

review.title: #1 San Francisco Bay Hotel
review.reviewText: Ideal location for the first time visitor to SF. I would suggest larger windows on bay side, at least on the top floor. (need less to say, a substantial financial expense), but just saying. Access to Lomard Ave, Chinatown, Northbeach, and business district easily accessible via the historic trolly located outside the back door. Restaurant could use a make-up to reflect the overall class of the hotel. I'll would not hesitate to stay there again. Hospitality outstanding, as was all of SF, and the rooms are very nice and up to date.
review.negativeRemarks: Windows could have been bigger on the bayside.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to visit the bay area and access the rest of the city.

review.title: Not quite enough for the money.
review.reviewText: The windows are too small for much of a view so I'm not sure they should advertise room with a view. The wine reception is just that, no food. The t.v. selection is not good. For me the beds were very comfortable but too high to climb up onto. My room did not have a chair, except for a very hard wooden chair. I would like to be able to sit on something other than the bed. The room was very clean, and I appreciated that, plus the pillows were great, and the comforters were nice instead of the regular bedspread which everyone now worries about in cleanliness. I wrote a note to management about my disappointments so it is not new to them.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, pillows, location, sound-proof rooms, heating/cooling system, a window that opens, plenty of big fluffy towels
review.negativeRemarks: T.V. selection, view, restaurant was not very good, fee for parking, shower not forceful enough.
review.locationRemarks: Very good location, right at Fisherman's Wharf, easy access to public transit and cable cars, close to Ghiradelli square as well.

review.title: Missed wine reception!
review.reviewText: Location was perfect, next to Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars right next to hotel, and lots of dining and shopping nearby. Wine reception ONLY from 5-6pm, missed it upon arrival, and next day too late getting back from the football game to catch it. Room long and narrow, but very charming...ladies bring a shower cap because none supplied! Extremely friendly staff, would stay again, paid extra for a "bay view" room, worth it, but view was not directly out window, you had to look to the far right...

review.title: First time In San Francisco, Perfect location
review.reviewText:
My husband and I traveled to San Francisco in November for a 49rs football game. This was our fist time in San Francisco. We stayed at the Argonaut for 7 days. LOVED IT We had a King Size room, top floor. No view! as it was an inside room. THe room was large, and service was great.
The front desk staff, Concierge, door man, all very helpful.
Everything was within walking distance. Ghiradelli Square right around the corner. The cable Car stops right around the corner. You can see Alcatraz and Golden Gate bridge from the front of the building. Lots to see and do on Fisherman's wharf. Seafood everywhere.
Alcatraz is a must, as well as the golden gate bridge, Napa Valley wine tour. And we loved the 49rs game, and I am not even a football fan, but got caught up in it right away.
If I was to return to san francisco I would definelty stay at the argonaut again. So convienent for everything.
review.locationRemarks:
I would recommend a trip to alcatraz, we went in the morning, but the night tour would be very interesting.
We also did a city bus tour to get an overall feel for the city to see where we wanted to go, worth it.

review.title: totally satisfied
review.reviewText: We had great time , the Hotel front desk was helpful way beyond expectations Sarah check us in gave the rooms we requested and since one of our Ladies (5) celebrated her 60 Birthday had a bottle of wine send to our room. It wa struely a great experience to stay and play at the Hotel Argonaut.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: great , for sight seeing

review.title: Fantastic stay the the Argonaut
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Argonaut in Jan 2012. Wonderful stay. The hotel was clean and comfortable, the staff were friendly and very helpful. It's in a fantastic location right at Fishermen's Wharf and just opposite the cable car turn-around. Would definitely recommend to others without hesitation.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great time at the Argonaut Hotel. We were lucky enough to get tickets to the 49ers game. One of the helpful staff arranged these for us and this was the highlight of our trip for our 3 sons.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf

review.title: wharf wonderland
review.negativeRemarks: parking

review.title: Argunaut - a Great Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a boutique hotel located quite near Fisherman's Wharf. My room was charming, with exposed brick on one wall, and wooden louvered blinds over the window facing the street. Room service is available through the Blue Mermaid Chowder House, which was great for me. The staff is courteous and prompt and efficient. The room was immaculate and the bed linens were the highest quality. The food was great. I did not spend any time in the lobby, but they kept the fireplace burning the entire time, so that's a great place to hang out. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in a moderately-priced hotel that gives superb service.
review.negativeRemarks: Having $300 reserved on my credit card for incidentals, - $100.00 for each night I stayed. I wasn't expecting that.
review.locationRemarks: Very near Fisherman's Wharf, so you can stroll down there and enjoy the Bay.

review.title: Argonaut hotel
review.reviewText: It would be good if it had laundry facilities, otherwise this is a quality hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were clean and comfortable. It has a good vibe and is close to everything. Steve (the doorman) was fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: No laundry facility
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to all facilities

review.title: The best!
review.reviewText: The absolutely best location and best hotel for a San Francisco visit. You can walk to everything. The food and bars where excellent. Could not have asked for a better time.

review.title: Loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed just one night at the Argonaut as we live in Sacramento and just wanted to do a few things in San Francisco. It was my husband, me, our 7 year old and 4 year old. We were very pleased with the size, decor and quality of the room. Everything seemed very clean and new and the carpet even smelled new. The staff at the hotel was very nice including a great doorman. And a special perk for the kids was a toy out of the treasure chest AND a goldfish for the night. They loved Max the goldfish! Our only complaint was that they told us the parking would be $70 and online it said $46. I picked this hotel because of the $46 parking but they said because we had a large vehicle it would be $70. We were told this when we checked out - not when we got there. They did finally agree to lower it to $46 this time. I would love to stay there again but the high cost of parking may deter us.
review.negativeRemarks: The high cost of parking for our SUV
review.locationRemarks: Perfect spot! Easy to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square and Pier 39.

review.title: beware of the parking fees
review.reviewText: great hotel but beware of the parking. only valet and $46(!!!) a night, which is just outrages given the prices of the hotel rooms...

review.title: Dog Friendly and Great Location
review.reviewText: The location is awesome. The only issue was that the hotel does not offer parking. With that said, I will be staying here anytime i'm in san Francisco.

review.title: A+
review.reviewText: warm and comfortable and staff was very attentive. room was huge and spacious and super clean and tidyed up after each morning!

review.title: good but pricey hotel
review.reviewText: only one of the staff was not very good. one of the front desk staff was not very helpful or interested. otherwise everyone were helpful and attentive. the room smelled a little bit like a dog; should have asked for a non-pet room.
review.positiveRemarks: good location for tourists and nice decor inside the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: had to valet park

review.title: San Fran Fan
review.reviewText: The hotel had a delightful "hot chocolate hour" and a "wine tasting hour". There were many people from the hotel who attended these events yet during other times the hotel was quiet. The hotel was easy to get to and easy to get to other places in the city. I loved that it was dog friendly (even though I didn't bring one). For those that bring their pets this is so important, and no one could tell there were pets there.
review.locationRemarks: Far end of Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Nice, clean, location is great. Cable car stop is one one side, Cioppino's restaurant is on another side, Jack's bar with about 100 beers on tap is on the other side.. Safe location with no crazies around.
review.locationRemarks: Great. Cable Car stop on one side, Cioppino's on another side, Jack's on the other side... Perfect location.

review.title: Romantic, stylish and friendly
review.reviewText:
We had a very good time at this charming hotel.
I dont want to add more to my review
review.locationRemarks: historical interesting location

review.title: Three's a crowd
review.reviewText: Was extremely disappointed that a roll away bed was not provided. I paid for a room for 3 people, one being a 15 year old teenage boy. Made for cramped quarters. Next time I just won't mention there is a third person and save myself some money!

review.title: Great place on the wharf
review.reviewText: Pleasant experience overall. Good location and great service.

review.title: S.F. X'mas
review.reviewText: Everyone working in the hotel are extremely friendly. We are able to get our room fast and the bell man Steve was very entertaining.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is perfect, it's walking distance from Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Great Hotel, would stay there again
review.reviewText:
The Argonaut is a great hotel. Staff helpful and friendly. Good location, near Powell st cable car terminal although it's a bit of a walk back as the cable car doesn't return there. Happy hour wine tasting was lovely each afternoon, however for us it's a bit disconcerting to share the lobby of such a fine hotel with people's dogs. Some extremely large dogs who were very well behaved but really should not be allowed at happy hour. Don't get the dog thing in the USA, dogs stay at home in Australia!
The king sized bed was fantastic and very comfortable....
review.negativeRemarks: dogs everywhere
review.locationRemarks: very central

review.title: Recent Visit
review.reviewText: We arrived and were placed in a hanicap room, which was not told to us at check in. Due to my own personal OCD with water on the floor, we asked if we would be able to change rooms and without any hesitation they placed us on the 4th floor, which has been newly remodeled. The staff was amazing! Super helpful and friendly. Even with the third floor being under construction, the noise was not bad at all. I would most def. go back and recommend it to everyone I know. The location is perfect!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: construction but not bad
review.locationRemarks: PERFECT!!!!!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendy and helpful. The location was fanastic.

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed at this boutique hotel for five days and found it to be fabulous. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times. The beds and rooms were very comfortable, and hot chocolate and wine tasting in the Lobby daily made for an inviting atmosphere.The location, being near Fisherman 's Wharf, was very convenient to the tourist sights and shops of the Bay and Alcatraz .The hotel is just near the Cable Car tournaround so the trip to downtown is enjoyable,convenient and fun. Buying a 3 Day muni passport meant it was also cheap to hop on and off cable cars, buses and trams all day.We travelled with 3 teenagers and felt happy to let them wander off to explore the area on their own during the day. All in all a great stay in a great city.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is the tourist area but for a holidaying family it is perfect. The choice of restaurants and cafes is endless. From take-away places to five star service restaurants, all within walking distance. Chowder is the order of the day although there is plenty to eat as an alternative. You can enjoy the Bay on boats to Alcatraz, or sail around the island. You can also hire a bike to ride the Golden Gate Bridge or join a tour bus to do it if you are a little less active. Souvenir shops and clothing shops along with cute boutiques selling all sorts of interesting foods and nik-naks are stretched all along the bayfront. Ghiradelli chocolates had its factory in the area and still sells yummy chocolates and icecream at the old factory museum site. Cable cars epitomise San Francisco and start and finish in the area.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: First time in San Francisco....great location, very friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: Can't wait to go back...
review.reviewText: We had decided to get away just for a day, do some sightseeing and shopping. This was the first time staying at this hotel, and we fell in love with the nautical theme in the lobby and in the rooms. The room was on the small side, but what it lacked in space it made up for in the comfortable bed and cleanliness. I think the best part of our stay was the complimentary wine tasting in the evening where we had a chance to mingle with other guests. We had a chance to try their special hot apple cider with whiskey...so good! We will definately be returning, and bringing ourt dog since we did not realize they were pet friendly.

review.title: Want to go back, couldn't have asked for anything more.
review.reviewText: We had a great experience staying at the Argonaut. We only wished we'd stayed longer. Our two young kids loved it!

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Argonaut is a great hotel! It's conveniently located in Fisherman's Wharf, very close to Ghirardelli Square. The hotel staff is very friendly and the rooms are so comfortable. I love the sailor theme!
review.locationRemarks: Biking the Golden Gate Bridge is a must! There's two bike rental locations just outside the hotel. The path up to the bridge is filled with fellow runners and bikers and has breathtaking views of the bridge and even Alcatraz.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Overall, a very good experience. Very attentive. Wine hour a plus!

review.title: comfort in SF
review.reviewText:
Touristy location.
Near transport and attractions
review.locationRemarks: near public transport and downtown

review.title: Friendly staff, comfortable room
review.reviewText: Room was awesome, a king suite with plenty of space and very comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. Will stay here again, kimpton in my experience are the best hotels. One small thing...not really hotels fault but there must have been a small child in room above running back and forth which was a little annoying.
review.locationRemarks: The whole place... San Francisco is one of my favourite cities in the world.

review.title: Best hotel on Fishermans Wharf!
review.reviewText: Hands down, the best place to stay in Fishermans Wharf. Close to cable car station, Ghirardelli Square and many great places to eat!

review.title: Second time there. Will go back for sure!
review.reviewText: My daughter and I enjoyed our stay. We wish we could have enjoyed a room with a view like last time but the room was very clean and conveniently located. The hotel personnel is friendly to families.

review.title: Great Atmosphere
review.reviewText: Spent five days - loved the hotel and environment! Wonderful nautical decor! Their restaurant, the Blue Mermaid was very good - their chowder was the best we had in San Francisco! The free wine in the lobby every day at 5pm made for a festive air. Reasonable price. Would recommend this hotel to friends and family.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco is a great central location with beautiful views.

review.title: Home away from home.
review.reviewText: From the time you pull up to the time you leave, you feel welcome. Location is excellent for all of the SanFrancisco sites.

review.title: Perfect spot along Fishermans Wharf!
review.reviewText: We truly enjoyed our stay at the Argonaut Hotel. We were fortunate to get an early check in, the room was very cozy, the cleanliness of the entire hotel was impeccable, and the service was top notch. The hotel location is fantastic! It's right on the edge of Fishermans Wharf and within easy access of all of San Francisco's hot spots. I would definitely stay there again and highly recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: A beautiful hotel in Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: First time to San Francisco and what a perfect hotel to make our stay amazing. We flew in from Australia and were excited to see the sights of SF with ease. Location is excellent to sight see the wharf and Pier 39 and catch the F line into Union Square etc is so easy as the stop is at the end of the hotel street. I loved the nautical theme and overall ambience and interior styling of the hotel. Hotel staff were friendly, accommodating and nothing was too much trouble. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. I didn't want to leave!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square (shopping. Restaurants etc)

review.title: Loved this hotel
review.reviewText: Great Location, very clean, staff very helpful, close to everything on the Wharf, close to cable cars, would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Great location and fabulous staff
review.reviewText: We have stayed here four times and its always first class! he happy hour gives you a chance to meet lots of very nice people too!
review.locationRemarks: Marina/Embarcadarogreat to be by the water and enjoy all there is to do and see there! Watch the swimmers, tour the boats, go to Pier 39 to shop and eat. Take a boat tour, go to the Aquarium, on and on.~~~~~~~

review.title: Had a short fun stay
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location in Fisherman's Wharf area. Rooms are clean and well appointed. Free wine tasting in the evening was a nice perk. Service was very good and helpful. Room was quiet but the only downside was no view (faced back of building).
review.locationRemarks:
Fisherman's Wharf
Alcatraz
China Town
Golden Gate/Sausalito

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: We had an excellent stay at the Argonaut with a quiet inside 4th floor room and a waiting gift. The wine reception every night was fun and a great touch.

review.title: Great Hotel Experience
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a beautiful boutique hotel right on the water in San Francisco. We found all the staff we interacted with to be most helpful and cordial. We will definitely use The Argonaut when we're next in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: The Fisherman's Wharf area is great for wonderful seafood, unique sights, strolling, people watching, etc. If you only have a short time in San Francisco, the Wharf area is a great place to spend it.

review.title: One of the best!
review.reviewText:
This is one of the best Hotels I have stayed at. It is not the most modern (it tries to create living on a boat environment) or the most comfortable but has a lot of charm, really good quality service (front desk, bellman, housekeeping, etc.), excellent location (very, very short walking distance to famous tram, 5-10min to Pier 39). It includes free wireless internet, always a plus.
on the negative side nothing much, maybe a shuttle service to airport would not hurt for a more on a budget travelers (only taxi or supershuttle now) and some breakfast package options if not included in the room rate. For breakfast I however recommend Joanie's Happy Days Diner just 5min from Hotel (good quality, reasonable price).
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman Wharf

review.title: The only place I'd stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. It was conveniently located with tons of shops and restaurants to choose from close by, though my very favorite was right within the hotel. The Blue Mermaid was simply awesome. You've got to try the Huevos Rancheros...they're to DIE FOR!!! The lobby is warm and inviting with lots of comfortable seating and a beautiful fireplace, which we enjoyed every evening with the complimentary wine reception. The staff was friendly and cheerfully helped us plan all of our activities. The only thing I might do differently next time is upgrade to a room with an ocean view, as that would have made the already great room perfect. We would recommend this hotel to everyone and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Wanted to stay near Fishermans Wharf this time and wasn't dissapointed. Great location 2 minutes from the wharf and next to the famous tram. Valet parking that tends to be expensive but so are the other hotels, its hard to avoid. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Very happy with our stay.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice room and lots of space. It was a good retreat to get away from SF. The afternoon wine tasting was a nice touch and the hospitality was great. The doorman is a nice touch and very knowledgeable. If it wasnt for San Francisco, I would stay here again for sure.

review.title: Nearly perfect
review.reviewText: I stayed on the 04th floor of the hotel and it was quiet. This was surprising as the hotel was full due to fleet week. The only niggle I had the room was never cleaned until arounf 3.30 in the afternoon except for my final day when housekeeping knovked before I was out of bed.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was located in a perfect location. My wife and I celebrated our anniversary here and we walked to several attractions which made it easy to enjoy the town. We specially liked the live music (sunday night) next door and we took advantage of the proximity to our hotel by staying up enjoying adult cocktails. We plan on visiting this hotel in the near future.

review.title: Argonaut experience
review.reviewText: Great location near Fisherman's Wharf. A bit crowded with tourists just around hotel, but perfect location to walk to most interesting areas of San Francisco. Not overwhelmed by hotel itself, but very nice and clean with friendly staff.

review.title: Amazing - Very Impressed
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to S.F. We were extremely impressed by the city and especially by the hotel and it's location. The courtesy starting with the door men to the front desk was more than friendly. We especially loved that the hotel is pet friendly. We will definately recommend your hotel to everyone we talk to about our trip and hope to be back soon.

review.title: It's ok!!!
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was well kept and in a great location. The bed was comfortable but the linens we not up to par. They short sheet the bed. The bottom sheet will not tuck in at the top or the bottom which leaves you in a wadded mess by morning. Bedding is very important to me, especially for the rates. Otherwise, the hotel is very nic.

review.title: Recomended for leisure trip.
review.reviewText: Very well located for tourism with all kind of restaurants around and nearby public transportation. Easy to arrive by car. Comfort of a very good 4 star hotel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Could use some additional space/shelves for personal effects. Coffee maker took up available counter space in bathroom. otherwise nice and staff very friendly and curtious.

review.title: staff very friendly and helpful
review.reviewText: great location very close to pier 39 but not right on top of it. very nice place. staff was great and extremely helpful and friendly. great view of the bay and alcatraz from are room

review.title: Cute hotel, great location... SOME Staff could be a little more subtle...
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice, great service, friendly staff, lovely rooms. We had a great experience. It's located right by Fisherman's Wharf and all the attractions and restaurants. For the most part the staff were friendly and extremely helpful. However, there was a particular staff member who could not have been more obvious when hoping for... or expecting might be a better word... a tip for bringing our luggage to the room. We thought that was a little rude, and even comical. But can't knock the hotel for one indiviudal's lack of tact.

review.title: Cleaning of room
review.reviewText:
It's a nice place to use as a base to visit the city. For a cheap breakfast $5 turn right out of the hotel and 500m up the road is Jacks bar.
Only complaint I have is the lack of having your room cleaned. Mine was NOT cleaned for two days and I had to complain to front desk who was NOT helpful. I expect more from a so called 4 star hotel

review.title: Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Staff was very accommodating and willing to assist where needed. The room was a little small, but it did have the two queen beds we needed. Bathroom was also small, but clean.

review.title: Met what I was looking for
review.reviewText: room was clean & comfortable, although a bit cramped. Parking cost is exorbitant!

review.title: Excellent service, great location. Individual rooms differ, though!
review.reviewText: I love Kimpton hotels and this one did not disappoint. Fisherman's Wharf, while the heart of touristy SF, is a great jumping-off point for exploring the rest of the city. The service at this hotel was excellent. Be aware, though: this hotel only has four floors, and the second floor is essentially at street level. We got a back-facing street level room that was TINY and awkwardly narrow -- I stuck my head in to a few other rooms nearby as I passed housekeeping and they were twice the size of ours! Be sure to ask for an upper floor and a room facing the Wharf, not the back street.

review.title: Very enjoyable
review.reviewText: Great location. 5-6 wine reception a fun way to meet other guests.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
the only thing missing was turn down service
everything else was great

no pool
has a good bar and decent restaurant

review.title: A very nice hotel near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: I liked the style of the room and the whole building. Service was good. Location is great! Seafood restaurants, ferries to the islands, cable car station - all are very close. In the next door office you can rent a bicycle and ride to the Golden Gate Bridge. I will definitely choose it for my next trip.

review.title: Great hotel in Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is well situated. The rooms are spacious and clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. The concierge is also a great help but will charge you $5 to make an internet based reservation. This is the first time I had seen this in any hotel. If I had known I would have done it myself. Internet access is free at the hotel. I never used the concierge after this.

review.title: We will definatley be return customers!
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived, until the moment we left, we were completely taken care of. This hotel is not only beautiful, well maintained, and wonderfully staffed it is a convenient location for all San Fran adventures. We also loved how accommodating they were with children. An all around joy at the Argonaut!

review.title: Argonaut - Make sure your room faces out.
review.reviewText:
If you're looking for convenience to Fisherman's Wharf, and transportation to other locations, you can't beat the Argonaut.
The only thing is you need a room facing the street; preferably facing the bay. If your room doesn't face outside, you'll want to switch, and they'll charge extra for the upgrade.
Service is excellent. Free wine every night at 5.

review.title: Not the hotel you want for your honeymoon!!
review.reviewText: Let me first say the hotel is beautiful, and the location is perfect, but it is not a good choice for a honeymoon, nothing was prepared as I had preplanned with the hotel, and there was never really a special feeling there, I think they cater more towards families, which is fine, and when me and my wife have children then we will prob stay here, but for your honeymoon, pick someplace else.

review.title: Great location for first time visitors to San Francisco
review.reviewText: My daughter (age 11) and I just spent five nights at the Argonaut on an end-of-summer mother/daughter getaway. We were very pleased with the hotel. The location is close to many of the popular touristy attractions which was convenient for first timers to SF. Our room was clean and quiet, albeit rather small. The staff was friendly, professional and helpful--especially the concierge. We ate at the Blue Mermaid Chowder House and Bar several times for breakfast and dinner. It was convenient to have a restaurant with good food and service at the hotel. Better than a typical hotel restaurant.

review.title: First choice hotel for vacation in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Great place. Very friendly personnel. Wondeful location- close to everything. Very honest local restaurant. Would go back anytime and will refer others to this place.
But without a car as parking overpriced

review.title: awesome - Dad and 13 year old son
review.reviewText:
perfect location. steps to the cable car end-of-line. Buy a 3-day pass for $21 per day per person. Rode numerous time on 3 different cable lines. About an hour wait most days after 2:00 p.m. until mid-evening. Went downtown to Bush street - walked a few blocks over to Chinatown. Aa few blocks from Pier 39. Walking distance from Pier 33 (for Alcatraz tour). Walked to the "Italian" area of town (taxi one way - uphill $5 - walking ... about 10 minutes downhill). Endless activities. Take the rocket boat (dress warm - a lot of fun (although I didn't do it - you can get 1/2 price tickets on goldstar.com for this (boat was about 1/2 full (bought tickets less than 30 minutes before the scheduled tour). Go to Club Fugazi to see Beach Blanket Babylon (on Sundays if you have young children). Hotel is very clean. Great staff available to answer any questions at any time. No lines to check-in or check-out. get an "outside room" (our was a 'bay view' per the web site - but, not really. the hotel isn't "on the bay" - it's across the street blocked mostly by other businesses - but the 'oustide rooms' (at least ours) faced the street (actually the cable car line) vs. facing inwards (which, from the elevator view was facing an ugly lowered rooftop). Windows actually open (we were on the 3rd floor - there are 4 floors). Never heard any noise from above or adjoining rooms. Rooms are very large.
Wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else in the wharf area when we return next.

review.title: Exceeded expectations!
review.reviewText:
I have stayed at a few different hotels in San
Francisco in the past but the Argonaut by far was the nicest surprise. The Fairmont has more history but this location was perfect for our needs. I love the location for a short, compact sightseeing experience without the need for a car. Close to all the tourist attractions, fine dining and great views! The hotel staff was friendly, professional and helpful in all aspects of our visit. The restuarant and bar manager was a great help for planning our day and the food was delicious. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: I mentions that it was my anniversary, and they surprisingly upgraded our hotel room for no charge, gave us a surprise bottle of wine and chocolate. Awesome, Awesome! I've never had that kind of service. Seriously.

review.title: wonderful hotel and location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay here the view was great.The only thing was we were in room 312 great view of cable car and marina but this room is very small. were the desk is should be a combo desk and dresser. The cabinet where the tv is should have a wall mount tv and remove this cabinet as it makes it hard to get around the bed. Move the honor bar to hall way and this will give the room an illusion of being a little bit bigger.Our doorman Dovovan was just terrific,helpful friendly and made us feel like we had know him forever.He should be commended for the great job he does to make everyone feel welcome.We recommend this hotel highly.

review.title: Comfortable room with lots of space
review.reviewText: Very good service, plenty of space in our standard room and well located for attractions and transportation.I

review.title: Argonaut- wow!
review.reviewText: From the time we arrived to check out...this hotel surpassed any expectations I had. If we needed something, we simply had to ask. Everyone was so polite, the decor is truly unique and the service is outstanding. We asked for a view of Alcatraz and they didn't disappoint.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel is wonderful. The staff is professional and very helpful and the location of the hotel is excellent. My daughter and I loved the Mermaid Bar and we cannot wait to stay at the Argonaut again. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Perfect hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: Would highly rate this hotel for families with kids. The staff is engaging and friendly from the moment you arrive. The location could not be beat!

review.title: Argonaut
review.reviewText: Great place for family with children

review.title: Fantastic Wine Reception
review.reviewText: The location was great, in proximity to many of the must-see tourist attractions. The on-site, free maritime museum had neat exhibits. The most amazing part was the free (or rather included) mid-day drinks and popsicles, and the incredible wine reception. We each had several glasses of wine or the sangria, which would easily have cost $5-10 each. We met lovely people in the lobby from all over the globe. The on property restaurant had very good food, and large portions. We will definitely stay there again, if we have the opportunity. Parking fees were unfortunately very high.

review.title: Wonderful stay at a stylish accomodation and great personell
review.reviewText: We were delighted to stay at this hotel. Everything was just wonderful. Very tastful style of the hotel and very cosy room. Everything worked perfectly, personell were very helpful and kind. We felt very welcome and would absolutely recommend this hotel to others. The minor draw back was teh absence of the pool but we would have no time for this any way... with regards, Elena

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was in a convenient location. It was in walking distance to Pier 39 and Ghiradelli Square. The hotel's staff were friendly and helpful with any questions that arose. The hotel room was nice and quiet. I enjoyed the San Francisco area very much and will return in the future to the area and the Argonaut.

review.title: Terrific Hotel
review.reviewText: The Staff were great. The location was the best. Cablle car around the corner. The beach down one block. The warf was in walking distant. We are looking forward in coming back to the friendly staff. Would recommend this hotel to everybody.

review.title: Could not possibly ask for more
review.reviewText: Getaway weekend was exceptional. From the central location, concierge service to desk courtesy and eagerness to serve. We had an amazing stay and would be hard pressed not to stay there on our next visit.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Right on the main strip of Fisherman's Wharf-just walk out the door to sights and restaurants! Famous cable cars right around the corner. Would stay there again!!

review.title: Great Hotel, but Car Headaches
review.reviewText:
A very clean and central hotel in the Fisherman's Wharf area of San Francisco. The location was ideal for sightseeing and for kids. In addition, the hotel was very dog friendly and many guests bring their dogs.

The parking was the biggest headache for us though. We had to wait over 40 minutes outside in the harsh wind for the valet to bring out our car. The valet system needs some severe process improvement!

review.title: Arganaut
review.reviewText:
Great front desk service! We missed the 'happy hour' and they gave us a coupon for a glass of wine anyway. Printing of boarding passes, arranging tours and shuttles all done well.

Only one disapointment. THe food quality and service level at the restaurant was not up to par. We ate there once, and were totally disapointed. We expected a better menu and service.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: Character hotel and a perfect location on the Wharf. Ask for a room with a view because it is worth it.

review.title: Very friendly staff, convenient location
review.reviewText: From stepping out of the cab at our arrival to hopping back into a cab on the last day, the staff couldn't have been friendlier or more cheerful. The hotel was very clean and the location, although in the heart of the over-the-top touristy area of he city (Fisherman's wharf) was close to all forms of public transportation (including the very cool cable cars) and made it very easy to get around. The one thing was the bed. It was very soft to begin with and I think due to be changed (it was sagging in the middle with no one on it). I have back trouble and this soft mattress was not ideal. But otherwise, great hotel.

review.title: Great service and good location, would stay here again
review.reviewText: Service at this hotel was good. The rooms were clean and the hotel decor had an interesting theme. Would definately stay here again if I return to San Francisco.

review.title: Good location, poor room service and no real bar area
review.reviewText: I would not stay here again. I have stayed in quite few Kimpton hotels and this is the worst so far. Not upto the standard of Kimpton Monaco's

review.title: Ana
review.reviewText: Great service, excellent location, reasonable price.

review.title: would definitely use this Hotel again
review.reviewText:
I was impressed with where the Hotel was at Fisherman's Wharf. Very convenient to many attractions. I rode the trolley's the first day but after that decided to walk everywhere...up and down those hills. You see alot more and great exercise. Took only 40 mins. to get into downtown to do some shopping in Union Square by foot. Poke St. is a fun street to walk and get a Thai Massage, Pedi & Mani's and lots of ethnic eateries. The Hotel has a Wine Reception every night @ 5-6p.m. That was a nice touch! Would definitely return to this Hotel when in San Francisco again.

a gal from Canada

review.title: argonauts
review.reviewText: the hotel fully satisfied our expectations: wonderful the attention to all teh details and the courtesy of all the staff people. more, the location was better than expected, just at teh turnaround of the cable car and in the middle of fishernan's wharf. fantastic the nautical theme, especially in the room.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel

review.title: Fantastic Place to Stay in SF!
review.reviewText: I frequent SF & usually stay in Chinatown. This trip I brought my sisters up for a girls weekend and thought being on the wharf would be a nice birthday treat! I had previously been concerned about the traffic and the noise of the location but once inside it was very quiet. Lots of tourist traffic but if you are playing tourist yourself, it can't be beat. You are steps away from the water, cable car turnaround, Ghiradelli Square (ice cream!!!), and great food in every direction. The hotel service was fantastic! Everyone was very attentive and helpful. The room was a good size, very cute; the bed was very comfortable, lots of hot water, good maid service. The restaurant was really good, great service, nice selection on the menu. Remember that you are on the water & it will get cold & windy. Buy a fleece sweater and go for a boat tour under the Golden Gate bridge! Love the location, love the hotel, I will be returning!

review.title: A very good choice
review.reviewText: This hotel is situated at the quieter end of Fisherman's Wharf which suited us well. The rooms are very nice, and we found the concierge, front desk staff, porters and doormen extremely helpful.

review.title: Perfect Hotel
review.reviewText:
The Argonaut Hotel more than met out needs and expectations during our April 2011 stay in San Francisco. It was conveniently located to the Fisherman's Wharf area and public transportation. Our room was comfortable, very clean and we heard very little street or neighbor noise. The adjoining restaurant was well staffed and the food was tasty-especially their chowders. We highly recommend it as lodging for a San Francisco stay.
We also recommend a fairly new tour: San Francisco Movies! It was great fun!

review.title: loved hotel not parkinh fee's
review.reviewText: the hotel was wonderful but they charged us $45.oo a day to park our rent a car

review.title: Ideal city break base
review.reviewText:
Just completed 6 day stay with 12 year old son as a new US 'city' break and loved San Francisco; ideal location for public transport, attractions, cable cars, biking the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, etc, great staff.
Would not stay anywhere else if on a hotel break in San Francisco.

review.title: Review-SF TRIP
review.reviewText: Great location!!

review.title: Excellent Hotel in Great Area!
review.reviewText: This hotel was excellent. The staff was really nice and extremely helpful. We enjoyed the wine social each evening! The location is a winner too. Walking distance to everything in Fisherman's Warf. We highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great location for families
review.reviewText: I took my 8 year old son for spring break and the hotel was great for our needs. The location was convenient for kid-friendly activities with a cable car stop one block away, the Aquarium of the Bay and Fisherman's Wharf activities walkable distance, bike rentals just next door, and the Exploratorium and Golden Gate Bridge in easy biking distance. It was easy to get downtown and to the Ferry Terminal; the only place that took a little longer was Golden Gate Park. The bell staff was particularly great and made my son feel really welcome; he didn't get a welcome package, but most days got a visit to the treasure chest and a friendly chat. We had a basic inside room with no view, but there was also no noise from outside and it was spacious by San Francisco standards. However, the walls are thin - it was easy to hear other guests next door (but we only heard them one night). The hotel doesn't seem to cater to a lot of late-night partiers, so this wasn't a huge issue for us. All in all, I would go back, particularly with children.

review.title: The best place to stay!
review.reviewText: Loved the Argonaut. Great hotel and caring helpful staff. Location is perfect for the Fishermans Wharf area as everything is within walking distance. Don't forget to go to Boudins Bread Bakery for at least one meal including their wonderful sourdough bread! And do include Scoma's Restaurant on Al Scoma Way for an extra special dinner. Hotel has a nice Wine Tasting Reception between 5 and 6 pm which is fun. The Cable Car turnaround is just around the corner in Victorian Park and you can get anywhere around the city via the cable car, bus or streetcar connections using the Pass you buy there. Oh yes, the Hotel is Pet Friendly too.

review.title: Charming hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Charming hotel with more personality than I had anticipated. GREAT location adjacent to Fisherman's Wharf, restaurants, wonderful seawall walking/cycling path that extends from Fisherman's Wharf over the Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito. Bike rentals are located right next door. Staff upgraded us from a standard room to one with a view of the Golden Gate. All staff were friendly and welcoming to my children (aged 9 and 7). Although exterior facade of hotel is brick, the structure has been seismically upgraded to modern standards. Overall, my family LOVED our stay. This hotel will be my top pick the next time I visit San Francisco.

review.title: Best Location for SF Vacation
review.reviewText: This was my first visit to SanFran and I loved it. The Argonaut was great. I couldn't think of a better location to stay. But that isn't all. The employees were extremely helpful. Though the wine at the daily wine tasting wasn't the best, it was a great time to mingle with the other guests. Our daughter had a good time with the other kids staying there as well. The Blue Mermaid restaurant was very nice as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

review.title: Loved the Argonaut
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful. All of the staff was really friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location close to many attractions, and great restaurants. The bed and pillows were SO .....comfy. Cute decor and the room was very nice. I had a wonderful time and have already recommended the Argonaut to some friends. Hope I get back to San Francisco again and if I do I will definitely stay at the Argonaut. Oh, You have to go to the hotel restaurant, The Blue Mermaid, and get the crab and corn chowder! Wow...it was great. Also, I loved that the hotel was dog friendly. I could not take my dogs on the trip, but I got to play with other visitors dogs.

review.title: Hotel and location couldn't have been better
review.reviewText:
The Argonaut Hotel was faultless; friendly staff and excellent location. There is so much to do and see just on the doorstep and the best seafood I have ever tasted is in every restaurant. The seafood market just along the street is great for outdoors lunch while watching the street entertainers.
I will definitely be back!!

review.title: The Staff was great
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived the entire staff seemed to enjoy their positions and were eager to help. The hotel location is great at the end of the wharf and a short walk to several key attractions like the cable cars, Ghirardelli Square, and fishermans wharf.
