I would have thought the street noise would have been worse but the room was very quiet. I would reccomend it highly and will definately return.

review.title: Great Spring Break Hotel With Kids...
review.reviewText:
So it's pretty hard to visit San Fran with kids - we have 2 boys (6 & 8). The Argonaut was great for the kids... The door men were extremely nice and were great "welcome" wagons for them. There is a WII in the hotel lobby which was nice on the day it rained like crazy.

I liked that it was near the 'tourist' stuff but honestly you didn't feel like you were right in it. The lobby restaurant was just ok - we ate there for breakfast once then went other places. there's a bagel place right around the corner that is fantastic.

I had to use the business center while there - not really much there - 2 computers and a printer - but what can you ask for. there isn't a pool or really a spa with the hotel - but you can walk across the street to the boats, a beach, rent bikes, and it's just a block or two to the main tourist stuff.

The cable car trolley is right around the corner from the hotel so an easy walk.

Don't rent a car - i think parking is $50/day - we never spent more than $20/day on Taxi fare...and we went everywhere. It's just a pain.

review.title: Wonderful Experience!!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed four nights at the Argonaut and enjoyed every moment. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We loved the location, the room, the lobby, the restaurant.....the whole package. I would definitely recommend it !!! And we plan to stay here again any time we are visiting San Francisco!!

review.title: great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Very good experience while spending a week in San Francisco! On the wharf, but quiet rooms, 1 block from cable cars, great dining and knowledgeable staff. Certainly would stay again.

review.title: We loved it and will be back!
review.reviewText: Our family of four spent three nights in a King Suite with a view. It was amazing. The suite was as big as an apartment and looked right out over Alcatraz. The kids, 8 and 12, had their own space and the hotel even gave them two goldfish to take care of for our stay. The bathroom was huge and well laid out and there was a slider between the bedroom and the kids space. The staff was wonderful! Nightly wine tastings in the lobby, with sparkling apple juice too, were a nice touch. The location could not be beat, step to the cable car stop, shopping, museums, restaurants. All around great, and we are picky.

review.title: The best hotel experience ever!.
review.reviewText:
I decided to write a review for the first time because it was really the best experience ever. I received more than i expected and the money spent was all worth it. It is a nice, not too big, not too small hotel.The hotel is well maintained, everything is clean and i honestly doubt you can find a better location to stay in San Francisco. The ultimate experience was with the personnel. When checking out, they called a cab to take me to the airport. Ii forgot an envelope in the back seat, called the hotel and even when i was no longer a guest there, the doorman remembered me, remembered the cab driver, contact the agency, put me in the phone with them and 15 min after, the cab driver met me at a the right terminal to give me my documents. They really fulfilled all my expectations in every sense, because the hotel is nice and cozy, the location is amazing, they are all very helpful and willing to answer questions or fulfill a request at any time.
Also, complimentary wine from 5 to 6 is great too, provided by (also) friendly people. On my last day, i dad the opportunity to go to the gym, and it was clean and pretty well-equipped. The next time i go to San Fco, again, i would definitely stay There.

review.title: 100% Fantastic
review.reviewText: I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. All of the great reviews I read before booking this hotel were 100% right. From the moment we got there Blaise made us feel welcome and my daughter was so excited about her pink bracelet she got from the treasure chest. The stay started off perfectly with the doormen being helpful and friendly, the room was beyond what I expected and the location is the perfect jumping off point for so many things in San Francisco. We have been to San Francisco a number of times before and normally stay near Union Square. This time I decided to do something different and stay near the warf and I have to say I will do it again in a heartbeat. The wine reception was delightful and even though we had our daughter with us she was not only welcome but they had non alcholic cider to drink so she could feel like one of the grown ups. The staff is so friendly and helpful I cannot stress this enough. Yeah Argonaut!!!

review.title: LIked everything about this hotel.
review.reviewText: We really liked everything about this hotel. It was important for us to find a hotel with 2 queen beds. (Not easy to find in San. Fran.) Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The front desk called the night before check out to ask if they could assist us in anyway and offered to print our airline boarding passes for us. It was surprisingly quiet there too. Great location and an easy walk to all the fun sights in San Francisco. Will recommend it to our friends.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: I love everything about this hotel. Staff is so nice it's crazy. Room was very clean. Did not hear a peep from any neighbors. Absolutely the best location in San Francisco - right on Fisherman's Wharf, and right next to a cable car depot. You also have a great bar with 84 beers on tap right next door, and one of the best restaurants in San Francisco right across the street (Cioppinos). I would not change one thing.. I am in love with this place..

review.title: Argonaut Hotel San Fran is very nice indeed.
review.reviewText:
While the Hotels nautical theme is a bit overdone, the hotel is very clean, great beds, very good service and great location. Not at the cheaper end of the price scale but you get what you pay for. The attached restaurant has nice food but is a bit pricey, especially once you add in tips and taxes.
However, with this hotel, you can't get much closer to Fisherman's wharf. Well recommended.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This hotel was fantastic. The staff were attentive and charming, the free wine reception in the evening was an added bonus - good wine and a chance to meet other people. The hotel food from room service was very good quality and price was similar to the local high end restaurants. The location is the west part of Fisherman's Wharf so its quiet and the beach is close while the piers are all within walking distance. The only thing I would change about the hotel is the star spangled carpets although they really did go with the rest of the decor.

review.title: New fans of the Argonaut!
review.reviewText: From curbside to room service, everyone was very friendly and helpful. We were thrilled with the location and our room was spacious. We will definitely go back to the Argonaut and would recommend it to anyone staying in SF for the weekend.

review.title: Steve Best Bartender
review.reviewText: Parking was very expensive, self park for much less right behind hotel careful thou if you have an early flight garage doesnt open till 7:00 am. Internet service Wi-Fi super slow and very frustrating! NOT a good hotel for biz travlers at all. They even charge for copies at the front desk. They also charge to use the biz center. Ridiculous. Front desk help- some very helpful, some very snooty. Food was good. The bartender Steve at the Blue Mermaid was the best.. Outer rooms with exterior window are the better rooms. The inner rooms have no view at all (roof). Good for a short stay vacation. Great location.

review.title: Fishermans Wharf finest!
review.reviewText: Such a great themed hotel, great location, great staff.. Great experience!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: We've stayed at this hotel before and would again. We don't spend much time at Fisherman's Wharf, but it is convenient to the other parts of town that ineterest us. The hotel is a good quality and the price is inline with other options in SF.

review.title: San Francisco Treat
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this property and always have been pleased. Rooms are tastefully decorated in a nautical decor and are oversized and comfortable. Great location on the waterfront but not in the middle of all the crowds. Convenient to the trolleys, Ghiardelli Square, Crooked Street and of course, the Wharf. Great breakfast at the Mermaid - loved the hot chocolate and sourdough french toast with blueberry butter.

review.title: No 1 in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Ideal location, amazing service, attentive to all details. EVERY member of staff makes and effort, smiles and makes you feel like you are the only person staying there. Rooms are very good, comfy beds and great decor - although make sure you get a room with a view. The Blue Mermaid did lovely breakfasts but I would recommend The Eagle Cafe on Pier 39 - amazing brekkie. Cleanliness was absolutely spot on, the bed was made immaculately every day.

Could not fault this place one iota :-) Right next to the Marine Park and one of the cable car stopping points, next to the Cannery and in the heart of Fishermans Wharf. I'd like to know how they get all their staff so passionate about customer care - then I'd be on to a winner with my team!

review.title: A very pleasant hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location - Great service - Would definitely recommend this hotel ! The only little quirk was they double charged me for a soft drink from our room bar fridge. For $3.00, I didn't dispute the charge.

review.title: argonaut fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: this is a great hotel for visitors to san francisco. it is in the heart of all the action without the noise. great rooms with comfy beds.

review.title: Would Not stay Anywhere Else in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Loved, loved, loved everything about this hotel! From check-in to check-out. Being a hotel General Manager for 10 years in the past, this hotel really impressed me. The Front Desk staff was very friendly and welcolming. The wine reception was a very nice added touch. Hotel was very clean. The rooms were spacious and the decor was beautiful. The entire property was very well maintained. The location could not of been better! I plan on visiting San Francisco in the near future and would not think of staying anywhere else!

review.title: great san francisco hotel
review.reviewText: this is a great place to stay in SF - good size room, warm and well kept, comfy bed, and good bathroom. Staff were unfailingly helpful, concierges excellent value with travel tips or eating preferences. Only downside is the tacky tourist strip along Fishermans Wharf to the hotels' right: solution - turn left out the door to the park and aquatic area, cable cars and useful buses.

review.title: Charming Hotel Wonderful Location.
review.reviewText: Everyone is helpful and competent. The staff could not be more willing to make your stay stress free.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, clean, updated. Lovely linens, Aveda products. Only complaint, wall are a bit thin so I could hear everything in the adjoining rooms and also in the room above me which was a bit embarrassing. I had to be moved to another room because there was a very loud ac/heating unit outside my window on the second floor. It came on at 12:30 and I was finally asleep in another room at 2 am which was not good, I was very tired during the day and it was a long day.

review.title: A great choice in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The front desk staff was very friendly and prepared for our check-in. It was probably the fastest check-in I have ever experienced. We arrived fairly early in the morning but the hotel had a room ready for us. The cab company had even alerted the hotel to our impending arrival and the doorman greeted us by name. He took our child to the "treasure chest" in the lobby to pick out a toy. The bellman whisked away our bags and brought them up promptly. Everyone was pleasant and attentive. The conceriege took care of all reservations and made recommendations upon request. She even called a favorite pizza place to make sure they delivered to the hotel. The nightly wine tastings were a nice treat. We rate this trip as one of the best we have taken and it is in no small part to the wonderful service we received.

review.title: Even better than the rave reviews we heard before we stayed there.
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a true pleasure to stay in. Decor is absolutely charming, staff are friendly and helpful and the wine reception every evening is great fun. Location is fabulous at Fisherman's Wharf. Loved every minute of our stay. One comment- book at least a Deluxe or Bayview Room- worth the small extra cost.

review.title: Great choice
review.reviewText: 5th visit to San Francisco but first time at the Argonaut. Great hotel, great staff and great location.

review.title: Regular Business Travel to the Bay Area
review.reviewText:
I was unable to get a room at my normal hotel, or any other one for that matter, in the Financial District, this last January. So, I was forced to stay a couple of miless outside of the Financial District at the Argonaut Hotel. I was pleasantly surprise. It was very clean and quiet. The staff was very pleasant. It seemed to cater more to business people than to tourists. I would imagine it might be the reverse during better weather because it's located just a couple of blocks from Fishermans Wharf's.

The only downside to this hotel for me was the location. I had to take a cab everywhere because my clients are located in the Financial District, and I can usually walk from client to client. Oh, I almost forgot, there are not individual thermostats in each room so I was unable to adjust the temperature. It got a little chilly, but not bad.

I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Excellent Value
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel could not have been more convenient - right next to the end of the cable car line, a block or two to the main Fisherman's Wharf restaurants, three blocks to Ghiradelli Square, and a reasonable walk to the events at Fort Mason. Breakfast at the restaurant was very good and incredibly quick. Rooms were clean and comfortable, although the temperature was a little difficult to regulate. The staff were ALL friendly, efficient and helpful. All this and the most reasonable price for this category hotel in this area. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: A Perfect Stay
review.reviewText: A superb stay at a wonderful hotel! We couldn't have asked for anything more! The staff went out of their way to welcome and service us throughout our three day stay. The rooms were well-appointed and the beds so comfortable! The complimentary evening wine receptions were an added bonus! The location was perfect for walking to all the sights and to transportation stops on the trolley system. Many nice restaurants from fancy to casual, within walking distance and many, many more a short cab ride away. The Blue Mermaid was a great starting point - the crab chowder is "to-die-for!" We can't wait to return to The Argonaut Hotel again!

review.title: watch out for the parking charge they don't tell you about till you pay your bill $60.00
review.reviewText: watch out for the parking charge they don't tell you about till checkout $60.00

review.title: Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: San Francisco is the most beautiful city in the U.S. the view from my window of the Golden Gate was excellent. The people in the city were very friendly and I would definite going back again and very soon.

review.title: Wonderful near the Wharf!
review.reviewText: From check in to check out if was wonderful. My 11 year old had stayed before with his Mom. This was my first time. I've travelled all around the US and this was just a great hotel. Polite, Clean, and Friendly. Couldn't have been better.

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: Will go back there

review.title: My First Ever Review!
review.reviewText:
As the title suggests, this is my first review (I think!) that I have ever written because I wanted to take the time to recommend The Argonaut. On this last trip I stayed in 5 hotels in 8 days and this was by far the best.

Staff were friendly, welcoming and accommodating (I don't mean they gave me a room, obviously!). When I checked out, I asked if I could come back in a day's time and leave my bags whilst I went for dinner and before heading off for the airport, although I wouldn't be a guest. Their response was "Of course! just because you have checked out doesn't mean you stop being our guest" and this was the attitude of everyone. Door staff were efficient and unimposing, the room service was on time and better than expected. As with other Kimpton Hotels, some form of complimentary afternoon drink is provided and this produces a lively and friendly atmosphere for guests: business travellers or holiday makers alike.

Thoroughly recommend.

review.title: Fun with just a few flaws
review.reviewText:
Great location right near Pier 39. The hotel has a great feel and a sense of history. The staff were extremely helpful and the room was not small.

However, there is no immediate parking, it is San Francisco. There are parking garages within a short walking distance and the daily rate seems to be in the $30 range.

The hotel offered wine/ hot alcoholic drinks / hot chocolate tasting, in their lobby which was a fun addition.

The biggest disappointment was the cleanliness of the room. The sheet had a large stain. It was evident that the sheets had been cleaned, but I honestly expect a hotel like the argonaut to absorb the cost of a dirty sheet and replace it.

review.title: We had a nice stay
review.reviewText: The only complaint that I would have is that there was no parking at the hotel and they do not validate parking. I feel that if there is no parking designated for the hotel they should validate for a near by parking garage or offer free valet parking.

review.title: SF New Year Break 201o
review.reviewText: Great hotel, fantastic location for short trips to SF. The cable stop stop is a 3 minute walk, the F line is a 5 minute walk, Fisherman's Grotto is a 5 minute amble, Pier 39 a 10 minute stroll and superb access to any boat trip around the bay or Alcatraz you were planning to take. The hotel staff, as well as most of SF's local population, were extremely friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make our stay more enjoyable. The hotel room was nice - pretty standard for most US hotels but great facilities. Our plan included free wine from 6-7pm and hot chocolate from 2-4.30pm - both of which were welcome to warm you up in the Winter weather. Would definately recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

review.title: Loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: Loved the location of the hotel, the staff, and all that it had to offer. Read it was kid friendly which worried my husband and I a little but was not over run with kids. Great wine happy hour every evening. When we return to San Fran we will be staying here again.

review.title: Impressive Staff
review.reviewText: Staying in this hotel, made me feel "at home" away from home.

review.title: Perfect San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: This was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. My wife and I took this trip to celebrate our anniversary and it was everything we expected and more. When we returned to our room the night of our anniversary, one of the hotel staff had left a bottle of wine, chocolates, and a nice handwritten card wishing us a happy anniversary. From the front desk staff to the concierge, valet, and doormen, the staff couldn't have been any more friendly or helpful. I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Argonaut in Fisherman's Wharf-great place to stay !
review.reviewText: Argonaut is a great hotel! Hotel staff were very helpful and very friendly! Rooms were clean and spacious well maintained. Beds and bedding are luxuriously comfortable... I would recommend to anyone and would definitely stay there again...

review.title: Can't wait to go back!!!!!
review.reviewText: We were doing a small getaway vacation in San Francisco. We got in early, way before checkin thinking we would leave our bags. They checked and said they had another room if we wanted it and of course we did. The staff was fantastic. The concierge was always helpful. We had meals with their help. They helped us with finding the easiest way to get to the Art Museum on mass transit. We took advantage of the wine tasting and met very interesting people there. The beds were wonderful.....and luxorious. The soap was luxorious with a hot shower, beuatiful scent.....felt like silk with the soft water. The idea to provide things forgotten was terrific. I got a toothbrush. Staff went over board being helpful. We will go back again......and look for other Kimptons too. WOW.

review.title: Staying in San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: I selected the Argonaut hotel because of its location on the west end of Fisherman's Wharf and its proximity to the cable car and street car lines. The Argonaut proved to be an excellent choice for these reasons. The hotel is mid sized with the standard amenities. I found the bed to be very comfortable and enjoyed the hot chocolate bar in the lobby area each afternoon. The decor is a rustic nautical theme where brick walls and wooden beams from the buildings days as a cannery remain. The concierge was helpful in providing maps and local tour information. My only possible complaint would be that the restaurant and bar close at 9 p.m. on weeknights and 10 p.m. on weekends. Fortunately there are several alternative watering holes with in walking distance.

review.title: This is going to be a regular stop
review.reviewText:
After a seven and a half hour delay at Heathrow, we finally got to the Argronaut at Midnight. We were made very welcome at the front desk, and I had emailed earlier stating the reason for our trip to San Francisco was my girlfriends birthday. They upgraded our room to one with amazing views of the harbour, which was totally unexpected.
The hotel is amazing, we have stayed at a Kimpton hotel in Boston, but that was no where as good as this. It was total luxury and the friendly staff spoilt us rotten. Nothing was too much trouble.
San Francisco is a great city to visit. We went at the end of December and it still warm. There are lots of really good restuarants and bars in walking distance. Cable car rides and a trip to Alcatraz are a must do. Going in to the main part of town is easy and there are plenty of shops (a bit like a smaller version of New York), as my girlfriend dragged me into most of them.
Overall, it was a fantastic break in a city we've never visited, but will return to soon, and the Argonaut will be our hotel of choice.

review.title: A San Francisco Treat
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was excellent. It was witnin walking distance of all wharf activities and North Beach eateries. The hop on hop off buses were a block away and the doormen would call for a cab if needed. The decor was nautical and there is a museum housed in this historical building. Right outside the door is Hyde Street Pier with its tall ship exhibitions and wonderful views of the Bay. This was my second stay at the Kimpton and would definitely stay there everytime I visit San Francisco.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The room was a nice size with 2 queen beds. Nice bed and linens. Aveedo products in bath. The location is convenient to Fisherman's Wharf. Unfortunately, there was a large group of conventioners who were partying hard. One guest obviously got sick in the hallway of the 4th floor - yuck! The hotel cleaned the rug but was unable to remove the smell from the corridor even when using a commercial air cleaner. The smell lingered for days!! This spoiled our experience at this hotel. A good hotel MUST be prepared to handle this type of problem promptly.

review.title: I love this hotel!!
review.reviewText: This is an amazing hotel in an amazing city. The hotel is right in the middle of so many attractions. You can walk to Fisherman's Warf, Pier 39, Union Square, The Maritime Museum and Dock, Ghirardelli Square, and so much more. It's a convenient way to stay and play in our most beautiful city. The Cable cars run only a half a block away from this place! The staff was so wonderful. I have never in my life been treated so well. They will do anything for you and you don't even have to ask. They have the nicest bell hops and the door man was always smiling and happy to see you. I highly reccomend that whenever you go to San Fransisco always stay with the Argonaut Hotel a Kimpton Establishment!!

review.title: Argonaut San Fran
review.reviewText: Would stay there again anytime I am in San Francisco. My husband, daughter and I all loved it. Wasn't noisy at all and we were right on the street. Great food in restaurant. Miss the chowder.

review.title: Enjoyed the trip :)
review.reviewText: Great Location, clean, and friendly. Although, it's a bit of a jaunt to pier 33, if your taking an Alcatraz tour, just give yourself enough walking time. If your a coffee lover like me, and cannot start your day without, there is a Starbucks right behind the hotel. Very close to the Powell and Hyde Cable car turnaround. Excellent Italian restaurant a block away.

review.title: San Fransisco holiday
review.reviewText: We had a great time in San Fransisco on our short holiday. Travelling with our children we found the Argonaut well situated and it gave us great access to everything on the waterfront. The room was a little cramped but the service and cleanliness was excellent. Rooms with only one bed are more spacious of course. I would go back to this hotel without hesitation, we were definately impressed by the service level right from when we arrived and were directed by the bellboy, to when we checked out in the wee hours of the morning. I rented a car which I would not do again if I was staying at the Argonaut, the Cable car stops right outside the door and heads right down to Union square so it really was a wasted expense. We did go for a drive across the Golden Gate but that was all we used it for. You can walk everywhere on the Waterfront or catch the Cable Car and the F Line at any point which adds their own element of tourism to the trip. Also Parking is difficult, and adds even more expense.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Loved the location.

review.title: Excellent Spot with Excellent Service
review.reviewText: This was my second time staying here this year. This time I traveled with family, including my 6 year old son who was treated like a king by the staff (kudos to Kevin the bellhop and especially Steve the doorman). The hotel added to the travel experience. Wine hour (cider for the kids) is a nice treat and you can't beat the location. I didn't have a car this time so I didn't have to deal with the crazy parking fee. I also heeded the advice of other reviews and stayed in a deluxe room (for noise purposes). I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

review.title: Best Hotel on Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: Great staff, unique building, and Aveda products in the hotel rooms.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText:
The location is perfect for walking to lots of attractions and restaurants and
close to a cable car stop. Everyone in the staff were very friendly and helpful.
Would stay there again without hesitation.

review.title: Loved everything!
review.reviewText:
This was my first visit to San Francisco for my weekend birthday celebration. I chose this hotel based on its location at Fisherman's Wharf. The location was perfect! Close to walk to many sites and restaurants, and close to the cable car and trolley line to get anywhere in SF. We easily found our way via public transportation to Golden Gate Park.

The hotel exceeded my expectations. Everyone was friendly and efficient. I loved the nautical decor in the lovely lobby, rooms and throughout the hotel. Enjoyed the National Park Museum just off the lobby. I would recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: Wharfs finest
review.reviewText: Best place to stay- great location and staff was wonderful.

review.title: An Excellent Experience at the Argonaut
review.reviewText: Please use what I wrote in the above box ...

review.title: Argonut
review.reviewText: The fridge in the room was very noisy thought out the night...other than that everything else was good. The location of the hotel is great close to everyhting.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Location of the hotel was great. Room was small with no view. Decor was dated. Hotel needs a makeover

review.title: We'll visit again and again!!
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and gracious. The hotel was beautiful yet comfortable. The Blue Mermaid is the adjacent restaraunt (sp?) and our experience there was equally fabulous. The service and food was exceptional. The entire experience was everything I was looking for in a upscale boutique hotel in the City.

review.title: "Perfect Location"
review.reviewText: Mellow atmosphere, helpful staff, & good location. My first trip to San Francisco & we had a great time! I will definitely stay at the Argonaut the next time we go out!

review.title: Great hotel but our view was not impressive.
review.reviewText:
The Argonaut was a wonderful place to stay. Free wine tasting every night was
very enjoyable. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The area was just what we wanted. I was hoping for a better view of the waterfront but our room faced another set of rooms across from us. The view was rather depressing.
Other than that we loved the hotel, location, and the helpful staff. I would definitely stay there again. It is a great place for children!

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Argonaut Hotel was everything I expected and more. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Room was clean, although somewhat small. Location was excellent. Can't wait to return!

review.title: best in the CITY
review.reviewText: already did in the first chance. one of the best so far.

review.title: Great S.F. location
review.reviewText: My wife and I first stay in a Kimpton hotel was a very enjoyable experience, large room, courteous and helful staff. great location by the warf, close to cable car hub.

review.title: Overpriced tourist trap
review.reviewText: Location was very good, with an excellent view from our room, but the price was very high for the quality of this hotel. The concierge never called back with promised information; in compensation, they gave us $25 off the bill. The taxi we tried to hail refused to stop at the hotel; when we caught up to him around the corner he said that the hotel gives all its business to certain firms.

review.title: San Fran with Some Gliches
review.reviewText: We should of made our concerns earlier about the bed, it had a huge hump in the middle of it, making it uncomfortable to sleep, made the recommendations upon leaving the hotel, had some difficulties with the billing on our room, extra room charges, that were immediately rectified, great bell staff and good reception staff, concierge ok

review.title: Will definitely stay here again!
review.reviewText: Great hotel and great location. All staff were kind and helpful. Only complaint is that there is no bathroom fan; after 4 people taking showers, the room is too steamy. Thanks for making our trip to San Francisco a great family memory!

review.title: lovely but noisy
review.reviewText: lovely hotel, but lots of noise from street outside, also poss walls very thin as we got a lot ofdisturbance in the early hours from people above us. I think they were only walking around but we could hear every step! The hotel is also used for weddings, so be prepared for drunken singing in the corridors . This was probably only an issue for us as we had to get up early the next day for our flight. The attached restaurant, The Blue Mermaid, served great chowder, but that was all. Generally the service not great or the food that special. However, hotel staff very friendly & knowledgeable & great location to explore San Francisco. We were glad we didnt book outside of Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Argonaut is a wonderful hotel. The staff was amazing, rooms clean, large and nice decor. Large bathroom - mini bar with fridge. We planned on staying 3 nights and ended up staying 5 nights.

review.title: Fun place
review.reviewText:
Great atmosphere in this hotel which is in the perfect spot.
Welcoming people looking to help. Good bar and restaurant.

review.title: SF Waterfront
review.reviewText: The hotel is lovely, well appointed and located. The location being right on the waterfront is convenient, but crowded. We arrived into a crowd that our taxi could not penetrate and had to walk a block (thankfully downhill) with our luggage. We checked in and were assigned a ground level handicapped accessible room. We asked to be moved, as we did not require the accessibility and did not like the window in the room looking directly out on the crowded sidewalk, this was accommodated quickly. The staff aims to please. There was a nightly wine reception in the lobby which was very heavily attended and it took until our last day for us to actually manage to get a seat for the reception, but you could stand and imbibe. I was disappointed on the last day to hear another guest being asked if the stay involved a special occasion and being treated to extra perks, when we were never asked. The restaurant in the hotel "The Blue Mermaid" served tasty seafood.

review.title: Awesome location
review.reviewText: We went to this hotel for my son's wedding. It was awesome, great lobby for family and friends to meet up, nice restaurant in the hotel so my disabled parents could easily get a meal, and the staff was very helpful in every way.

review.title: Great first visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel set the pace for our entire visit. No trouble getting around the entire city without a car from here. We felt very relaxed and welcomed at the Argonaut. Excellent bed! Great food at the adjacent Blue Mermaid. The most pleasant, knowledgeable front desk staff we've ever encountered.

review.title: Great Hotel...Great Location
review.reviewText: Hospitality was excellent! Clean and updated hotel. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Will Return
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a lovely hotel. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Great attention to detail. Wine reception every evening was wonderful! Location is excellent, either to neighborhoods or to public transportation.

review.title: A lovely place to stay while in SFO
review.reviewText: Great room. Wonderful location. Attentive service. Not much more that you can ask from a hotel.

review.title: SF Argonaut
review.reviewText:
Hotel conditions, location, service, cleanliness, check-in
were all very good. The valet parking cost was just EXORBITANT!!
I would hope that Expedia could negotiate a better deal with
the hotel.

review.title: Great location, child and teenager friendly
review.reviewText: We found this location excellent for access to Fishermans Wharf area, cable cars, walks along the waterfront, other public transit. Aftenoon reception with wine and cider for kids was lovely to come back to after a day of touristy activities. Only wish from us is a fridge in room for milk, juice etc..

review.title: Best Sleep I Ever Had At A Hotel
review.reviewText: I can't say enough about this hotel and the staff. It was fantastic. From the moment we arrived I knew it was going to be a great stay. The bell man was happy and excited to get our bags. The hotel restaurant really does have the BEST crab and corn chowder. The bed was SO comfortable I only wish I could have taken it home with me. I would recommed this hotel to everyone and I will absolutly go back.. The location is fantastic.

review.title: Good value fun hotel best for kids
review.reviewText: Nice, clean nautical-themed hotel that seemed more suited to couples with kids than those wothout

review.title: I would stay there again.
review.reviewText: I was very happy with Expedia. The Flights went well. The hotel - Argonaunt was very nice. The place is clean, the folks that work there are friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in a good area as far as access to things to see and transportation.

review.title: Great location, atmosphere and staff!
review.reviewText: Usually it is myself and my husband travelling alone for leisure. This time however, we were travelling with our niece (21 years old) and my mother-in-law. We all had a fantastic time at this hotel due to its great location and ambiance. The staff was extremely friendly and always accommodating. Steve, the bellman, is captured in our family photos, because he made our stay memorable. His restaurant recommendations were spot-on and was always smiling and making sure he took care of all our needs. Hotel rooms were clean and staff always greeting you.

review.title: You don't get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
The pros: Clean rooms, comfortable beds, free wine, convenient location and friendly staff.

The cons: Expensive, low water pressure in shower, below street level rooms, other guests easily heard in hallways/other rooms, old TV, no free internet, no continental breakfast, lots of street noise, no free shuttle to airport.

review.title: Great attention to detail
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a beautiful hotel with a lot of style. All the staff are exceptionally friendly and the products used (eg soap) are of very nice quality. Being a renovated building this place still holds the charm of old stone walls and steel beams but with all the modern comforts which have been introduced with care and attention. Having said this, the view from some of the rooms is not so good. There was little privacy from our window as it looked straight onto a busy side walk, and other rooms have only a view of a brick wall (admittedly there is a lot of space between the window and the wall, but no greenery). But the interior of the rooms make up for this as they are very beautiful, comfortable and stylish.

review.title: Arrrrrrrgonaut - Ship Enthusiasts Hotel
review.reviewText: We went to San Francisco for 7 days. Great Hotel.

review.title: Fun in San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
We had a very relaxing and fun time. The hotel was in really good location towards the end of Fisherman's Wharf so it wasn't nosy and next to the water. The hotel also offered wine tasting in the evening and lemonade in the afternoon for free! The food was very good.
San Francisco was great but the weather was changeable and cold in the mornings before the fog cleared. The city is quite spreadout and expensive, but if you are prepared to walk, there is loads to see. The cable cars are fun, but the buses are a lot cheaper. The views from every road are different and always stunning. Cycling across the Golden Gate bridge is a must followed by cycling up the bay on other side to look back onto the City. The beaches aren't really for swimming, but good for a visit and chill out. Coit Tower and Twin Peaks display fantastic views of the city and not to be missed. Golden Gate park is also fantastic and Lumbard Street is very interesting! Union Street has a lovely feel to it and wasn't in any of our guide books. It is a really nice mix of independent shops and food places. We also hired a car and went down the coast to Santa Cruz which was a pretty town with the 6th oldest rollacosta in the US. A good day out.

review.title: Absolutely Amazing
review.reviewText: Perfect hotel in the perfect location!!

review.title: Hope its always available
review.reviewText: Well we know we will go back to San Francisco and we both hope this hotel will always be available. The only thing is I will remember to ask for street view otherwise you get a concrete wall. But afterall it was a cannery at one time. Museum downstairs was fun to visit, and we took advantage of lemonaide time every evening. You will have to go to know what that is.

review.title: Loved the hotel and staff. If ever back in San Fran, will be sure to stay again!
review.reviewText: I loved the hotel, the nautical theme fit in with the area and the wine tasting nightly was great as well. Rooms were very clean and beds very comfortable. Thanks for making our first trip away without our child so relaxing!

review.title: Very nice, comfortable hotel in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: My wife, son, and I spent 3 nights at the Argonaut. Very nice hotel if you want to be at Fisherman's Wharf. Close enough to walk to Chinatown and little Italy, Coit tower, etc. Very close to the dock for Alcatraz. Hotel was clean, comfortable. Only negative issue is that my bags were delayed. I kept calling the front desk to ask if they had arrived and was told over and over they were not. I called American Airlines and they assured me the bags had been delivered. I kept pestering the front desk and, voila! The bags appeared! When I checked out they asked me if my bags had ever been found! I was annoyed by the poor communication around that issue, but the hotel was otherwise above par, given the cost. All in all, a definite recommendation.

review.title: Argonaut Hotel
review.reviewText: It was an excellent hotel, they helped us with anything we needed. They made staying in San Francisco easier.

review.title: San Francisco-a good place to visit; Argaunot-an escape from being there.
review.reviewText: A bell captain greeted our cab. We were greeted with a degree of familiarity even though we had not been there before. The hotel is quaint and comfortable. The staff could not have been more accomodating. Convenience to Fisherman's Wharf and the cable car could not have been better. A car is not necessary but an inconvenience as well as expensive. A full grocery store and pharmacy is well within walking distance.

review.title: Great experience from beginning to end!
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel made you feel welcome, from the greeters at the front door saying welcome back after a day of sightseeing to the housekeeping staff you encountered during the day. The front desk personnel were extremely helpful and acommodating whenever we had questions or needed anything. The restaurant had excellent food and the waiters were very friendly. We loved the nautical decor - it gave you a very relaxed feeling. The only thing that perhaps could be improved upon was the wine that was offered each night in the lobby. Overall, if we were to stay at Fisherman's Wharf again, the Argonaut would be our choice!

review.title: Great Hotel with Kids
review.reviewText: This is the perfect hotel for families. We were traveling with two teenagers and they loved it. Location is outstanding to enjoy all of San Francisco's attractions. Only negative is parking-be prepared for $43 per night valet charge. My understanding is that is typical of San Francisco. Could not have asked for a better hotel in the perfect location! Would definitely stay there again!!

review.title: Was the best hotel ever
review.reviewText: The accomodations were the best I ever had for the money and will go back again when we return to san fran

review.title: A Place to Call Home in San Francisco
review.reviewText: If you want somehwere to stay in San Francisco that is convenient, welcoming and comfortable, then the Argonaut Hotel on Fisherman's Whaf is just the place. We loved our 6 night stay. From there we were able to visit all the sights, including a day trip to Yosemite, another to Carmel and Monterey. We even fitted in a day trip to Vacaville - outlet shopping heaven and another day just at Maceys at Union Square. Our room - 2 double beds on the 3rd Floor with a view of Alcatraz was magical, I think we took so many photos of the same view but it seemed to continually change. From our travels, we've learnt that where you stay can make all the difference to how you view the success of your holiday - the Argonaut definitely ended our holiday to the West Coast on a high.

review.title: We will stay there again
review.reviewText: Great location. We really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with this hotel in general. The only criticism I have is the information the concierge gave us. We inquired about sushi restaurants and was basically told the only one was a few miles away, but we found several in union square. Also, when we asked how far the golden gate bridge was, we were told 2 miles to the bridge, 2 miles across and back and 2 miles back to the hotel. It is about 4 miles just to get to the bridge, 2 miles across, 2 miles back to the other side and then 4 miles back to the hotel. (A HUGE difference when you are walking!)

review.title: Fantastic time at the Argonaut!!!
review.reviewText: We completely enjoyed our stay at the Argonaut Hotel. The themed lobby and hotel rooms were amazing and very well done. The happy hour wine bar was a nice touch too. First class all the way! The Blue Mermaid Lounge was great, and the service was excellent. The location of the Argonaut Hotel was perfect. We were just steps away from shops, dining, museums, and trolley cars or cable cars for transportation. This was our first trip to San Francisco. We will definately be going back and hope to stay at the Argonaut each time!!!

review.title: Argonaut was a great experience
review.reviewText: Great location, away from the crowds and noise of Fishermans Wharf but within two blocks, so easy walking distance. Rooms are funky but fun and comfortable, if a bit small. Great beds. The cannery building is neat. All staff we encountered were very pleasant and helpful. The concierge service was not that strong for a hotel catering to tourists-we got better info from our guidebooks. Overall a great hotel, we would stay there again and recommend to others.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a beautiful hotel with a great location to Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street, the trolly line, and Ghiradelli Square just to name a few. The room was kept extremely clean and well put together. We would definitely return!

review.title: Unique Boutique Hotel in the Wharf District
review.reviewText: This was our 2nd trip to the Bay Area, and our first time staying at the Argonaut - but probably not our last. The hotel exceeded our expectations and the location is fantastic if you're looking to do the "touristy" things (walk/shop along the Wharf, ride the cablecars, visit the marina, biking the Golden Gate bridge, etc.). Our room was very clean, spacious with a great view of Alcatraz (which the kids thought was really cool). The restaurant and wine store in the hotel were great, and even the fitness room was decent/better than average. Staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly the bellmen/valets and the girls at the front desk. The reason I only gave "Service" a rating of 4 out of 5 stars was because the housekeeping seemed to come at odd times (either at 8:00 a.m. - while we were still getting up - or late in the afternoon when we were coming back from a day of walking around/sightseeing, etc.) and when we first arrived the room had a strong perfumey smell - like bad hand lotion - that took a bit to either get rid of or get used to (not sure which). At the end of the day, we will definitely be back the next time we're in San Francisco and I would HIGHLY recommend the Argonaut to anyone looking for an upscale hotel that caters to tourists looking to enjoy the sights and experiences the Wharf area has to offer.

review.title: San Francisco Argonaut
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is in a great location. The room was spacious, with a view of the Golden Gate bridge and Alcatraz Island. Not that the 1 window in the room was small, since the hotel was a factory in its former life. The concierge was knowlegeable and helpful. The staff, especially the doormen, were incredibly nice to our children. There was a 1 hour wine tasting daily which coincided with our return to the hotel after touring, and before going to dinner. It was a nice way to relax, and there was a Wii and checkers to occupy the children.

review.title: Best 1st Stop on west coast.
review.reviewText: I would stay here again. The location is great. Most of the stops on our road-trip were 1 night only so we did not want to spend any time waiting on shuttles, buses and cabs or looking for parking spaces. The Argonaut is in a great location for anyone wanting see the best of SF in 1 or 2 days. The walk to Alcatraz launch is about 15min-20min (it is at the eastern end of the wharf area). But the walk is all along the bayside and enjoyable. We ran of time and did not see Sausalito... oh well have to come back again some day. We left for Mariposa mid afternoon on the 2nd day.

review.title: We'd definitely go back!
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel. The decor was intriguing, the staff was fantastic and the location was quiet, out of the way at one end of the Warf. The draw backs... the only choice for parking was valet, which was very expensive. The beds were hard.

review.title: Absolutely fantastic! Can't wait to try another Klimptons.
review.reviewText:
My wife and I had a wonderful week in San Francisco mostly due to The Argonaut. The location is so convient words cannot express it. Right on Fishermans's Wharf, you cannot get any closer to the action then this place. We did the "tourist" thing, Alcatraz, ride bikes across the Golden Gate Bridge, Union Square, Chinatown, Sausolito, the second most crooked street (Lombard Street), Coit Tower, Muir Woods, shopping, eating, tolley's cable cars, Hop on Hop off busses, if it was touristy we did it!
Getting around San Francisco is quite easy when staying at the Argonaut. You are right next door to a cable car (busy) turnaround, a block and a half from the bus stop to go downtown (always a seat available) or just walk. Get a map, figure out the shortest most direct route and walk the streets of San Francisco. From the Argonaut to Union Square/Chinatown is a relatively easy walk of 50 minutes and if you get lost you will see other parts of San Francisco that most tourists miss.
The hotel was very clean, staff were exception! Steve the Doorman (a super guy) is a crazy baggage cart driver, if you have kids with you make sure they get a ride upon arrival. The 5-6 wine reception is a great way to meet fellow travellers and share some stories. Our room was on the inside so no view but it was exceedingly quite at night considering how busy Fisherman's Wharf can get.
All in all, we would be back in a minute if the opportunity arose. Now we want to try some of the other Klimton Hotels.

review.title: Argonaut
review.reviewText: If you are not aware that in San Francisco trembles almost all the time from zero to1, you better go somewhere else, The Hotel is nice but it seems to be built out of wood and I constantly perceived movement of the construction which I believe is uncomfortable.

review.title: Great hotel for family trip
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this hotel after reading multiple reviews and got a decent rate on a hotel with 2 Queen beds. Our visit to San Fran was a whirlwind tourist trip with no down time before heading to Yosemite so we needed a place that was clean, convenient, reasonably priced and comfortable and this hotel fit that bill perfectly.

Since we weren't going to be in our room but to sleep and shower, we chose the standard room with a courtyard view. The view was really of other rooms overlooking a concrete pad so courtyard is a bit of a misnomer.

The hotel is in the renovated Cannery building right on Fisherman's Wharf next to the Hyde Street cable car turnaround-great location. The architecture of the building is really cool and it was decorated with a nautical theme. The beds were comfortable (although the pillows weren't) and the room size was adequate for the amount of time we spent there. The rooms are a little dark though (especially since you really can't open the shutters unless you want to wave at the folks across the way as you get dressed!) and the bathroom fixtures are all in one space. We like having the sink separate from the tub/toilet area so more than one person can be getting ready without the shower steam problem and there is only one sink in the bathroom.

We took advantage of their free wine reception one evening and the wait staff from the restaurant also brought out some drink samples and appetizers. Very nice touch. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Argonaut
review.reviewText: This was a wonderful place to stay. Quiet hotel and close to many exciting things.

review.title: Ideal Location and Great Service
review.reviewText: The location was great. We enjoyed being able to walk out the front door and be right on the wharf. It was convenient to restaurants, trolleys, and buses. The general service was outstanding. The concierge was hit-and-miss. We had a great experience with one concierge, the other one was not as helpful.

review.title: The best hotel in S F.
review.reviewText:
This is a Nice hotel to stay for your Vacation in SF :
1 Nice and clean room, hundred dollars pillow ( if you noticed) , gives you good night rest.
2 parking services are the best, if you need directions, they are the best, helping customers go anywhere quick and right on the target, " one of them I have to thank again is " steve " thanks a lot , Steve simply is the best when you need direction in a hurry.
3 To those who bringing kids alone, don't forget when using the public internet, there is a treasure chest on left side , please go through it, you never know what you will find.
4 free wine tasting is a must do , you will love it.
5 This Hotel is 5 star , yes it is really a five star hotel, we really enjoyed every minute of it, Qualiuty speaks itself,Thanks for everything.

review.title: Exceeded Our Expectations
review.reviewText: Our visit to San Francisco, and stay at the Argonaut, was everything we had expected - and more. From the moment our Shuttle pulled up in front of the hotel, we received the best of service. Our check in experience was extremely efficient, the employees were all very attentive, and our decision to upgrade our room to a King Suite was one of the best decisions we made on our trip. The room was very spacious, nicely decorated, comfortable, etc. The free wine tasting indeed lived up to the hipe - we met some amazing people which only added to our overall experience. We had a wonderful vacation and will definitely stay at a Kimpton hotel on our next trip - I highly recommend the Argonaut, specifically.

review.title: The place to be, on July 4th or any other time of the year!
review.reviewText: The hotel was warm and friendly, the concierge (whomever was there when you needed to ask) were amazingly helpful (and as it consistently turned out, correct everytime!). I really liked the ambiance of the lobby, with the lemonade and the wine etc. My son and I came by outselves but didn't feel as though we were alone. The hotel and its staff made every occupant feel comfortable and welcome!

review.title: Best Hotel on the Wharf
review.reviewText: Best location on the Fisherman's Wharf and close to the many attractions in San Francisco. With smaller kids, the walking distance was easy for them. We didn't need to rent a car since the 'hop-on/hop-off' bus location was right behind the hotel. In addition, a small beach was only one block away where the kids got to have some fun. The decor of the hotel was also fun as well as kid and pet friendly. Lots of fun for grown ups and kids alike!

review.title: Great Location on fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: We wre given rooms with a great view of the bay and Golden Gate Bridge. Check in was efficient and friendly and the concierge service took care of our things until our rooms were ready.The Argonaut is a great hotel if the wharf is where you want to be in San Francisco. Access to all highways is convenient and all activities are adjacent to the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Though the room was a little smaller than we would have liked and our view was just another side of the hotel, we did enjoy our stay here. The concierge was very knowledgable about how to get around town. The hotel is within walking distance of so many things on the Wharf. The buses and trolleys were a block away and we got around the city on public transportation the whole time. Probably wouldn't have even rented a car if we had known about the good public transportation system. Hotel parking was $28 a night: valet even higher.

review.title: Everyone Should Experience the Argonaut
review.reviewText: Our hotel stay was wonderful. The rooms were clean, the bathrooms immaculate (extremely important!!!) and the service was excellent. The only thing I would change is that we had a room to the street and since it was the 4th of July weekend, we could hear excitement all night long...would have been great but we really were exhausted and needed some rest. Otherwise I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone considering a trip to San Francisco. It is right on the Wharf, close to public transportation, shopping, dining, and the staff is very helpful!

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Loved it! Great location, friendly staff. Would go back....

review.title: pretty good but needs some improvement
review.reviewText:
Overall...clean and helpful staff. Weekend got a little noisy due to the
nearby restaurants' loud music, but otherwise lovely. Hotel needs to address 2 major uncomfortable areas: 1. Lighting - inadequate in the room; the only chair lacked a light for reading. 2. Any kind of space to leave items: no counter in the large bathroom for toilet items or even a comb; no table in the bedroom area for any table for morning coffee. The one desk top was crowded with coffee pot, phone, etc. They should consider adding a small microwave to the room, which has been pretty much standard in all hotels. Other than this, the room was large and very clean and comfortable. It's location near the waterfront, buses, trolleys, Powell and Hyde cable car turnaround and premium coffee shops make it ideal for touring the city.

review.title: Perfect hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Between the very friendly staff, the very comfortable room, and the always nice free wine and cheese (including beer and sangria too) reception, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Argonaut! I would choose this hotel again in a heartbeat if I stayed in the SF Fisherman's Wharf area again!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms were small and bathroom small and my window looked right into the other side of the hotel windows; however, the room was very nice, bed comfortable, and all the amenitites of a 5star hotel. I will highly recommend this hotel. If you are a wine drinker, the wine social looked to be fun.

review.title: Great Wharf hotel
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend the Argonaut hotel. We stayed there for our 20th wedding anniversary trip to San Fran and the staff and service were outstanding. We have travelled a fair bit and found the staff friendly, the services exceptional and the room comfortable and unique. No bland biege walls and bedding here; the hotel is in an old heritage building and the recent renovation maintained the original brickwork and huge wooden beams. The hotel is bright and done in a great navy, red and white theme- refreshing! Bed was very comfortable and the room was always exceptionally clean. Staff seemed to pride themselves on offering services beyond the norm; offerred to order pizza for us one night when many of the neighbourhood restaurants were closed ( they do have room service but the menu is a bit limiting), offerred to arrange for a shuttle to the airport for us and also offerred to print our boarding passes for us. We took them up on all of it and they seemed delighted to be of help. Oh - and I neglected to mention that upon arriving in our room, a few minutes later we had a knock on the door and it was a cheery staff member with a bottle of chilling champagne and glasses for us along with a personalized card wishing us a happy anniversary! Very nice experience and for the price - amazing service.

review.title: Fabulous in San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
Our 7 night stay in San Francisco at the Argonaut Hotel was absolutely fabulous. All the staff are courteous, genuinely friendly and helpful. We stayed in the spacious King Deluxe room that was immaculately cleaned every day. The bed was very comfortable (the selection of pillows hard and soft pillows as awesome) and having the small couch to sit on to watch TV at the end of a long day of walking was great. We had a west facing view of the park in front of Ghirardelli Square and in the distance the Golden Gate Bridge. The room was very quiet -- no noise transer from any of the rooms around us.

The hotel location just at the end of the Powell-Hyde Street cable car turnaround was perfect. It was a few blocks walk to Fishermans Wharf, to the F Market Street Car, to the Powell-Mason cable car and Pier 39 as well. Good access to the bus routes too. We were able to get around the City very easily from here. It is also close to a wide variety of excellent restaurants and the Blue Mermaid in the Argonaut serves amazing chowders.

The ocean breeze can be quite cool in June, but the free glass of wine and the toasty fireplace in the lobby warmed you up quickly in the late afternoon.

It was perfect place to call home for a whole week -- we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay along the waterfront.

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: great trip, apart from airline. late both ways. city, hotel great.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was a great place to stay. Will definitely return. Least favorite part was the lack of parking. Loved the wine tasting events at the hotel. The convenience to attractions was excellent. Would highly recommend Argonaut to anyone staying in San Francisco.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is the perfect place to stay on Fishermans Warf! No need for a car since the trolley and F line both are near by. Ideal location next to all attractions on Fishermans Warf.. No regrets were had about this stay, it was a great vaction with my family. Rooms were nicely decorated! I do not recommend the Bar/Restaurant called "Jacks" located a few doors down from the hotel. The $9.99 steak dinner was the worst we ever had, your better off eating from a stret vendor for that price! The steak was paper thin..Service was very poor as well. Take your time and find a better restaurant on the warf. I recommend the boudin bakery, they have an awesome menu and dont forget to try a crepe down on pier 39!!

review.title: The Argonaut is a adventure in itsself. Part of the reason I love San Francisco.Love it.
review.reviewText: The best of everything is waiting for everyone at the Argonaut. The best staff and hotel accomdations in San Francisco, great location and a place to meet other travelers at there wine reception. Bravo Argonaut.

review.title: Wonderfulness at the Wharf with smiles!
review.reviewText: The hotel was absolutely beautiful and pleasant. Centrally located to everything and everyone.The door men greeted us graciously and joyously. Like we were old friends or rich tycoons, (John and Kevin) especially. We were given a room with a fantasic view of Alcatraz Island and it was wonderful. Made us appreciate freedom. The daily social hour was a big success as we met some good friends there. Great atmosphere and attitudes. This was an exemplary hotel and I would highly recommend to anyone on a trip to San Francisco! Make sure you get the bay view rooms though. We are looking for another good reason to return to San Francisco and the Argonaut Hotel at Fisherman's Wharf - a Kimpton Hotel. You have got the place there.

review.title: San Francisco "Rocks"
review.reviewText: What a wonderful place to stay. The location site was perfect and made many of the tour sites accessible to the waterfront, Ghiradelli Square and trolley cars. What really made our trip memorable at the hotel was happy hour and rushing back to visit Steve, the bellman. He and all the employees at the hotel genuinely wanted all the guests to "feel" at home. Cannot say enough about the employees, restaurant, room etc. Highly recommend the hotel to everyone and be sure to tell Steve "hi" from the Texas clan.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText:
Went to San Francisco for a conference at the nearby Sheraton Hotel. Spent a week at the Argonaut hotel. Great location right on Jefferson Street, which seemed to on the main thoroughfare through the wharf and continues on through a park to the Golden Gate Bridge.
The rooms were very clean, and the nautical motif was nice, without being too cheesey. Wine reception everynight at 5pm to 6pm. Concierge was very helpful, and everything is within walking distance (to include the culinary delights of Little Italy - just down COlumbus Ave).
One demerit of the hotel, would be the very thin walls and floors. There were amorous couples both above my room and next door, and their exertions were very audible! (as was the toddler next door, who would awake screaming every morning at 0400.)
Overall, good location and reasonable price. I would stay there again.

review.title: Nice upscale hotel in a wonderful location on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We booked about 3 months in advance through Expedia and got a rate that was nearly half the full price rate. The property is beautifully decorated in a maritime theme. For our discounted rate, our room did not have a view, but we spent most of our time out on the town anyway. The location is scenic and ideally located near several public transportation options, including the famous Cable Car... The complimentary "Arnold Palmers" (iced tea mixed with lemonade with a hint of mint) offered during the summer months is a nice touch. WiFi access was free once you join the Kimpton In Touch program (which is free to join.) The mini bar was very expensive so we bought snacks at a nearby Walgreens and saved alot of $$. I made 3 local calls from my room and was billed $1 for each call which I thought was ridiculous... However, overall, we had a very nice experience and would definitely return again.

review.title: We will go back to San Francisco and stay again at the Argonaut Hotel --
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel at Fisherman's Wharf was easy access - right at the Pier -- no needs of cabs you could walk everywhere on the Wharf- and only next door was the Terminal for the San Francisco famous Cable Cars -

review.title: Can't Wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel in a great location, with friendly and accomodating staff. The rooms were very comfortable, generously sized. Was given 2 double beds at check-in, was hoping for a King but not available. Lobby area is gorgeous and comfortable, complimentary refreshments were appreciated, and concierge was helpful. Really enjoyed my stay - only recommendation is to be sure to have staff informed of promotions - I missed out on some fun "extras" I would have really enjoyed if the staff knew what the "code word" for the month was. It's better to not have a promotion at all than to "tease" with it and then not acknowledge it. Overall, it was a great stay in an amazing city, and I would absolutely recommend The Argonaut!

review.title: A Great Place To Vacation
review.reviewText:
What a wonderful place to visit. San Francisco is a mega of things to do. Make sure to take the double decker tour bus tours. It helps you get acquainted with the city. Go over the Golden Gate bridge and visit Souliato. Great shops and cafe's. Make sure to bring a jacket and pants, as the weather changes depending on where you go. And of course the time of year you are visiting too. We went in June and the weather was in the 70-80's during the day and 50's at night and windy all the time.
There is so much to do in SF you could easily spend 2 weeks there. One spot we went to which was not on the radar of the guide books was Japan town. If you love Japanese culture, it's a great place and easy to get to using the city bus service. You will find authentic Japense noodle resturants and such. It was great!
For me, my favorite shop just a 1/2 block from the hotel was a native American jewerly store, that had beautiful items in. Not cheap, but the real deal.
One thing is for sure, there is something for everyone in San Francisco.
We will be back.

review.title: Good location and Great In-house Restaurant
review.reviewText: I was very happy with my stay at the Argonaut. The staff was very pleasant and the hotel was conveniently situated almost right on the pier. It was only a block or so from Ghirardelli Square and about 6 blocks from Pier 39. The Blue Mermaid (restaurant in the hotel) was fantastic. I highly recommend the crab cakes!

review.title: We lucked out with this pick.
review.reviewText:
Location is what attracted us to the Argonaut and we were not disapointed. It was within walking distance of Pier 39 to the east, Ghiardelli Square to the west and everything in between. Therefore, we didn't have to rent a car and pay for overnight parking or worry about finding a place to park during the day. Cable car turnaround and sightseeing bus terminals were within two blocks.
The staff was courteous, knowledgeable and helpful; volunteering information and making phone calls to enhance our stay. We ate at the hotel restaurant, the Blue Mermaid, twice, and it was very good.
We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in the Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel - would stay there again.

review.title: Will be back
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was GREAT!! Friendly staff, you are greeted at the front door every time you come back from outings. When we asked a question on the best way to get the the AT&T ball field the girl at the front desk got out a map and told ut the best route to take. We've stayed at hotels were their own people didn't have answers to our questions. The bed and pillows are comfy. The hotel is in a perfect location at the end of the Wharf so there is less traffic. But still close enough to everything there is to do.The best part is the wine tasting from 5-6 every evening. Even if you don't drink go down and visit with other travelers. We met two very nice couples from the UK. We will go back to San Fransisco and we will stay at the Argonaut. Don't mess with taking a tour of the bay with the Blue and Gold boats. Take one of the small boats they cost $15 per person.(the other place charges 25 per person) Dress warm and be sure to sit at the front of the boat for the best views. (you will get a bit wet but they provide blankets) Great time! Great town!

review.title: Very Impressed, would recommend to all our friends
review.reviewText: great experience

review.title: Center of The Wharf
review.reviewText:
The Argonaut Hotel at Fisherman's Wharf is everything it was advertised to be; with one exception that was addressed immediately by staff. Do not take a car whether it is rental or not without appreciating the cost of parking. At the hotel valet was $43.00 per night and the garage parking one block away was $28.00 per night. This was something we were not aware of and would not have rented a car for the first three days and nights of our trip if we would have known parking would cost more than the rental.

The rest of the stay was wonderful and made for an incredible experience for our friends who had not been to the area before.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Over all we enjoyed the Argonaut, I'd recommend that you don't stay in the back of the hotel - they pickup the garbage every morning at 5:30am and our rooms (406 & 407) were right above the trash bin. One morning about 1am it seemed liked it took an hour for them to throw every empty glass bottle in to the trash. I'm a very light sleeper, so the noise bothered me, the rest of the family didn't notice all the after hour noises.

In my opinion, pay the extra money for bay-view rooms or get a room that's not along the back (south) part of the hotel. In the hotel's defense, I should say that I didn't not complain to the hotel staff since it only bothered me.

The staff was wonderful and the location was excellent, adjacent to the cable car turn-a-round. I would stay here again, just in different rooms.

review.title: Nice boutique hotel near Peir 39
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay very much and because we were in town for just a short period, we appreciated that it was close to the "tourist" area of Peir 39. The concierge was very helpful. The hotel is pet friendly and there were a lot of people with their dogs, which is always nice to see. The lobby is very comfortable and nice, and the rooms are decorated nicely. They aren't huge but unless you want to spend hours in your room, as long as they are clean and well appointed it shouldn't matter. The only negative comment I have is the daily rate for parking is high~particularly given the cost of the room. However, I would still recommend this hotel to friends.

review.title: Kimpton Hotels rule!
review.reviewText:
Same fine accommodations we've experienced at another Kimpton
Hotel. These are becoming our preferred hotels in all cities. Among other more obvious things (such as location, condition, decor, and service), the air is sweet and clean in these hotels, and I'm very sensitive about this. My only warning about the Argonaut is that valet parking is expensive, while overnight street parking is plentiful, and over the weekend, you can leave a car parked in the same spot outside for days.

review.title: Had a great time, wish I could recommend it, but the cockroach in the room was just too gross!
review.reviewText:
The room was gorgeous, spacious and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and the location is convenient. We stayed there for 5 nights. On the last night, we found a bug... a cockroach... it was crawling on the unit that held the TV. We tried to get it but it went behind the TV and climbed up the wall.

We told the hotel staff right away, and they did send someone to check the room eventually. Unfortunately they couldn't find anything. We didn't have a very restful sleep that night.

The next morning when we checked out, we told the front desk again. They didn't charge us for one night of parking that we had incurred.

Other than the bug incident, our stay at the hotel was wonderful. And I suppose the fact that the hotel is close to the water leads to humidity and dampness which leads to bugs. But we just can't go back - it grossed us out a bit too much. I mean, this is a 4.5 star hotel.

review.title: in comparisson from all the state we visited, we loved san francisco most.
review.reviewText:
the view of our room was not so nice. upon request they transferred us to a bay view without any add on charge. we could see alcatraz & golden gate from a distance on our new room. the bed was very comfortable. no problems with water heater & aircon. all the hotel staff were courteous. everything in our room was clean & neat. the service was also good.the hotel location was also convenient. the hotel doesn't have a car service however they were able to provide us taxi as early as 5AM when we check out. i would strongly recommend Argonaut hotel & Expedia.com to my
colleges, thanks to both.

review.title: Great choice
review.reviewText:
Excellent staff - helpful and friendly. The room was quiet and very comfortable. Easy walking distance to all the amenities that Fisherman's Wharf has to offer.

Transit convenient as well. Nice touch with the wine reception at 5:00.

review.title: Great first time trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Rates were very reasonable, wine reception every afternoon, friendly staff, excellent location, would go back in a heart beat!

review.title: Not for older
review.reviewText: The hotel located in Fisherman's Wharf a very nice but crowdy area. If it's ibn your plans to go early to bed this hotel is not for you. The location is just in the main street with all bars and restaurants and you 'll able to rest/sleep after 11pm.

review.title: San Francisco Trip
review.reviewText: Great Hotel. Very well located. Nice rooms, Free internet wireless access. We enjoyed very much.

review.title: Loved Happy Hour
review.reviewText: I need to say two things--one the hotel was great and the happy hour was a great way to meet people and share vacation stories; ironically I don't even rink but it doesn't matter (2) the room walls are very thin and I had to call about noise--all was taken care of quickly and pain-free. I highly recommend this hotel and it is perfectly situated fro the wharf, tours, beach, cable cars and all the crazy street vendors. Loved it.

review.title: Argonaut
review.reviewText: Pleasant unique atmosphere. Excellent service. Nice location. Only negative is cost of parking. Extremely high but due to location and lack of onsite parking.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great location, But OUCH!! on the parking!
review.reviewText:
I took my 87 year old Mother on a great trip to San Francisco. I decided on the Argonaut because of its handy location and the reputation of The Kimpton Hotels.
Everthing was great. The staff was very cheerful from valet to the front desk to the bellman. We arrived just at the wine happy hour, which was just what we needed after finding our way through the busy city.
We ate downstairs in the chowder house, the food was very good ( don't miss the crab/corn chowder ) The service from the waiter was just OK, however the
buser was very friendly and even took our photo, so that made our night.
Since I booked with Expedia, all the room charges had been taken care of prior to our arrival. So it was just a matter of the over night parking charge.
I was rather surprised to find it was $50.00 per night and it must have been outside parking since it rained during the night and our car was covered in dirty raindrops. You would think for this price, they might of at least washed the windows for us.
So all and all we had a great time, The Argonaut is a beautiful property and you can be sure you will get top notch service but just be ready to pay a hefty over night parking fee if you valet park at the front door.

review.title: Great Hotel & location
review.reviewText: This hotel is right accross the street from the Hyde Street Pier and a block from Ghiradelli Square. Highly recommend for a number of reasons. I'm sure to be staying there again on my return visit to Fisherman;s Wharf.

review.title: Wonderful get-a-way!
