review.reviewText: Great hotel! Rooms were clean and neat. Hotel staff was super friendly. Very close to everything at fishermans wharf. Transportation to other parts of the city were just a few steps outside. Great hotel! We will come back next time and bring the kids too!

review.title: Best location on the wharf
review.reviewText: More or less as expected - over the top decor, friendly staff, superb location, no parking, bike shop next door. One minor gripe, when I checked in for my 2xQueen size room and the front office realized I was travelling alone they said 'would I like to swap to a single Queen room' which I thought was an upgrade of some sort, but it turned out to be a downgrade. The single queen room was tiny and I couldn't leave my suitcase open, whereas the double queen rooms had enough space for that extra bed that my case would have been happy on. They gave me my minibar bill for free when I complained. I guess most hotels pull that sort of stunt, I'd still recommend it.

review.title: Great Family Spot
review.reviewText:
This was our first vacation with our 18 month old. This hotel was a perfect fit. You could not ask for a better location. It centrally located to everything. The staff at the hotel was so friendly. They made my little one feel so special by remember her name and greeting her everytime they saw her. This was front the front desk staff to the maids. I hope they pay thier door staff well because they were great.

Thank you to the staff at the Argonaut Hotel for making our first family vacation a memorable and fun one.

review.title: My Mom said this was the nicest hotel she's ever been to!
review.reviewText: The service was unbelievable. When we first pulled up there was someone waiting to help us with our bags and bring us to the check in counter. We arrived before noon and to our surprise the room was ready! The hotel decor was beautiful, the rooms were beautiful and had exposed brick and olf wood beams to give it that rustic/ship feeling. The hotel was clean and comfy. The hotel restaurant yummy. The hotel was walking distance from everything in Fishermans warf. I think we walked the Warf a few times that weekend. I can't comment enough on how nice the staff was. They were so accomodating and friendly. I have stayed at upscale hotels before so this place was nothing new, but this was the first time I have ever been blown away by the service. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. I am now interested in booking all of my hotels with Kimpton.

review.title: Good but not perfect
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is in an excellent location and has interesting architecture because of its reuse of an old building. The room was comfortable and clean but service was uneven. Service overall was uneven. They made a mess of the breakfast room service order and a request for something advertised in their hotel guide, but some service was excellent such as the doorman managing the crazy car access. Overall a good experience, but room to improve.

review.title: Will certainly book this hotel again
review.reviewText: Great hotel, fantastic location - comfortable room, reasonable rates.

review.title: Best hotel in the Wharf...and maybe ALL of San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I cannot rave enough about the quality of this hotel. It was the perfect balance between "kid friendly " and "adult luxury". The nautical theme was well-loved by my child and the staff was very kid-friendly. The doormen went out of their way to high-five my child, talked directly to him, asked him about his toys, etc. They were amazing.

The complimentary wine hour was held daily from 5pm to 6pm - GREAT for the adults in the group as was the Starbucks coffee in the rooms each morning. Free WIFI, too, if you sign up for the free Kimpton club. Lovely atmosphere in the lobby as well.

The rooms were amazing - rustic with exposed, original beams and original brick in many places. Beds and pillows were VERY comfortable. Lots of natural light in the rooms from big windows.

Hotel offered FREE stroller rental (umbrella strollers), which turned out to be a god-send with all the hills and walking we did all over the city.

Hotel location was GREAT - east Wharf area is relatively quiet, very pretty. Hotel was right next to the Powell-Hyde Cable Car station (turnaround) and 2 blocks from a local bus stop that took you just about anywhere you wanted to go. 2 blocks from Ghirardelli Square and walking distance to Pier 39. Right next to Norman's Ice Cream (serves best Ice Cream in San Fran). Also, an enterprise rent-a-car 2 blocks away which we used to rent car for a day to go to Muir Woods - very convenient. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Amazing, amazing experience.

review.title: Location is the Best!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is in an excellent location within walking distance of many attractions and restaurants. The cable car that takes you to China Town and the Financial District turns around across the street from the hotel. The staff was very friendly and accomodating, and they serve an afternoon wine tasting each day. We enjoyed our stay here and wouldn't hesitate staying again!

review.title: Trendy hotel, nice rooms
review.reviewText: We loved the decor in the lobby and in our room. The hotel has a lively atmosphere, especially during free wine service in the lobby. Adjacent restaurant was delicious. Only thing we didn't love was that we paid extra for a room with a view. While the view was technically there (Golden Gate Bridge and Bay), you had to stand at just the correct spot and angle to see it.

review.title: I love this hotel
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Argonaut several times and each time the level of service is consistently outstanding. It is my favorite hotel in San Francisco

review.title: Would definitely stay again...
review.reviewText: Stayed with some family for one night but would not miss the chance to stay there again. It was absolutely beautiful. I loved the nautical theme and enjoyed the wine hour.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Next time I go to San Francisco I will stay here. We walked in and know we had picked the right hotel. It was a nice way to end a long vacation in CA. It was close to everything we wanted to do. Wonderful, helpful staff that made the stay that much better.

review.title: Dark and no view at all.
review.reviewText: The room looked out to the street at ground level,we had perdetrians walking by constantly and couldnt even open up the shade, was terrible.

review.title: Wonderful stay at Hotel Argonaut
review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel, freindly and efficient staff and an excellent location. Could not really ask for more.... food, wine, rooms, staff, cleaniness, location.... everything was great

review.title: We enjoyed it so much we extended our stay
review.reviewText: The hotel & area surpassed our expectations, it was right on Fisherman's Wharf, but was also easy to access other areas. The staff were extremely helpful with any queries we had.

review.title: Met and exceded expectations!
review.reviewText: What a great hotel! Location was PERFECT and the nightly FREE wine hour was great! We will be staying here again on our next visit! Pet friendly is neat too, even though one in our group was allergic to cats there was no problem the whole trip!

review.title: Beast hotel at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This was our first stay at a Kimpton property. The hotel was spotless. Food was good with reasonable prices. The location is great- at the quiet end of Fisherman's Wharf with an easy , flat walk to the tourist spots at the Wharf. We do a lot of traveling and we were imprerssed with this hotel.

review.title: great locations
review.reviewText: great locations, everything just within reach, very friendly staff and very helpful once you need. Went the restaurant called "Pier 23", which highly recommend by Guy Fieri from food network and tried couple dishes that appeared on his show, wasn't as good as it sounds or looks like, nothing bad, but really nothing shockingly amazing. but there is one called "Scoma's", where just few steps away from Argonaut Hotel is so good, it is recommend by the locals and says the best restaurant at Fisherman's Wharf, which sure is. they have website you can go and check their exact locations, cause you cannot find them on the regular Travler's guide or some advertisement stuff, but it is packed all days and nights, which means a lot.

review.title: Loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: Absolutely perfect location. Staff was exceptional! Great place.

review.title: DIFFERENT
review.reviewText: THE HOTEL WAS ARRANGED DIFFERENT

review.title: Conviniently located but noisy rooms!
review.reviewText:
Great location if you plan to explore Fisherman's Warf and Pier 39.
THE CITY is very walkable and much can be explored by either walking, renting a bike or using public transport. No real need for a rental car unless you plan on going elsewhere. We can recommend "bike across the bridge" and get back using the ferry from Sausalito.... nice! Oh, and pack a windbreaker or a scarf.... you won't regret it! Quick trip to Muir Woods.. spectacular. Alcatraz was okay...ish... really run down and much of it has deterioated quite a bit... If you have time, check out Sonoma and Napa Valley.

review.title: Argonaut Hotel at Fisherman's Wharf - FANTASTIC!
review.reviewText: I found the hotel to be excellent in every way. The location was very good and the hotel itself was beautiful. Very nicely decorated in a sailboat theme it had a very comfortable feel. It was warm and inviting and it was very relaxing to simply sit in the lobby area. The daily wine tasting was an added bonus that made my experience even better. The staff was very friendly and courteous. I used the concierge and was happy with their assistance. All together I would rank this hotel very highly. I would also recommend it for a family trip. The Blue Mermaid restaraunt was very good and the area lends itself to a great family experience.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: I've never written a review for anything, and have never been so impressed with a hotel (or other place) that I've taken the time to do this. Free wireless in room, free convenient printing, reception desk super helpful, great atmosphere filled with nice people, great location, great deal. So much better than other hotels, and no labor disputes, etc. - I'll seek out Kimpton wherever I go.

review.title: Very Relaxing
review.reviewText: During our stay in the USA we visitied LA for 4 nights then 5 nights in Las Vegas then 4 nights in San Francisco. San Fran was the best place to finish our honey moon and the Argonaught was fantastic all round. Our stay at the Argonaunt was extremely satisfying and relaxing, Good sized clean rooms in a great location. The staff were friendly and accomodating and th eoverall price was very competitive.

review.title: Location, location, location!!!!
review.reviewText: Hotel is very clean and has an extremely comfortable bed. We never made it to the nightly complimentary "happy hour", so can't comment. Even though it is advertised as a "pet friendly" hotel, we never heard, saw or smelled any animals. Great location on Fishermans Wharf, slightly away from noisy crowds but within walking distance or short cable ride to everything. Concierge was very helpful but told us it was a 1/2 hour walk to Golden Gate bridge. We're in good shape but couldn't have made it in 1/2 hour unless we were shot out of cannon......more like 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Don't ask bellman for recommendation of a restaurant, he's going to suggest the hotels' restaurant next door. Would stay there again in a heartbeat, and I'm VERY fussy. There's a great little breakfast place behind and to the left of hotel called Pergaminos. On the other hand stay away from Irish pub two doors down, Fiddlers Green.................worst fish and chips ever......still have nightmares. Tiernans' around the corner has a great performer, David Weeks................he is definetely worth a few hours with a glass of wine.

review.title: The best hotel located in Fishermans Wharf!!!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a very beautiful hotel. It is in the perfect tourist location! Its feet away from shops, restaurants, tours.The service was excellent. They have an excellent staff. They even offered complimentary wine from 5pm to 6pm the three days I was there. My only complaint is the insane fee to park your car overnight. I think they should offer free parking for their hotel guest or at least reduced prices then nearby parking garages. The parking fee is my only thumbs down. Everything else was terrific!

review.title: very satisfied
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful, location was great & hotel was very child friendly.

review.title: Warm and Inviting!
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was great and we were greeted by a very friendly staff. The only downfall was that the walls were thin and we could hear everything from the other rooms. Loved the wine reception every evening and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. Absolutely enjoyed a city tour that the concierge reccommended. The company was called Mr. Toad's. We toured for 3 hours in an old fashioned, open aired car with a fantastic tour guide!!!!

review.title: Only hotel for families vacationing in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: We have stayed at a wide array of hotels in San Francisco, from Marriotts to Holiday Inns, from downtown to Fisherman's Wharf. This was by far and away the best hotel experience if you are a family and seeing the sights of SF (not doing business). The theming is great, and fits the area perfectly. My son (11) really enjoyed that everything was nautical, right down to the Maritime National Park you could enter right off the lobby inside the hotel! The staff was incredible about providing excellent service and making a special effort to be friendly and make sure we enjoyed our stay. The location could not be beat. We walked to everything we wanted to see, or took the cable cars conveniently located across the street. In fact, our room had a particularly nice view of the cable car stop and turn around. I don't believe that all rooms had as good a view or large windows judging from the exterior, however. We stayed 3 nights, and kept expecting the charm to wear off, but it did not. If you are looking for the deluxe posh hotel experience, this may not be your hotel. It is definitely family friendly with a fun atmosphere, though. And the rooms were clean, well maintained, and comfortable. On a 2 week trip in California that included stays in 6 different hotels, this was by far and away our favorite hotel and truly increased our enjoyment of our time in SF. The Argonaut was part of the fun, not just a place to go sleep when we weren't touring. Will definitely be going back!

review.title: Very Family and Pet Friendly
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience. One of the finest hotels we have stayed in. Very dog friendly. We did not have to pay an extra pet fee.(Unlike some of the other cheaper hotels.) Our dog got a treat every morning. The location was great. We were able to walk everywhere or take a cable car. The next time we travel to the San Francisco, we will definitely stay at the Argonaut!

review.title: Good Experience
review.reviewText: As above

review.title: Best location for Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Best location there is on the Wharf. Convenient to transportation and attractions. Fine quality hotel accomodations.

review.title: will definitely be coming back!
review.reviewText: What a great location! We were able to walk to everything and if we needed directions the staff were eager to help!

review.title: 2nd visit for us, did not disappoint!! Fabulous hotel and helpful,friendly staff.
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Arganout Hotel before. It is centrally based for all kinds of activities. The cable car to union square is just yards away, as is all the fun of Fishermans Wharfe. Most of the Piers are within a short stroll, or ride by vintage tram. The Hotel itself looks out accross the bay with views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz Island. The local restaraunts offer a great variety of food at amazing value!!

review.title: Affordable Gem in Great Location
review.reviewText: Stayed March 2010 for a 4 day leisure trip to San Fran. Hotel has great location within walking distance to many great attractions. Walked to Fishermans' Wharf, Alcatraz cruise terminal, Ghirardelli square, all within 20 minutes walk. Impeccably maintained property. Very historic feel (used to be Del Monte peach cannery). Nautical theme is wonderful. Feels nautical without being tacky. Staff are very friendly and always willing to please. Would definitely stay again. Only complaint is that noise between rooms is easily transmitted between walls. Wasn't exactly a problem, but might be one if you end up with noisy neighbors.

review.title: would go back in a minute
review.reviewText:
If we ever go back to San francisco i would stay at the Argonaut again. It is in a perfect place to tour San Francsico, right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. The staff was pleasant, the room was clean and comfortable. They had a wine reception every night at 5 to 6pm. they had a nice Heath club and a WII set up in the Lobby.
We had a small problem with the plumbing in our room the first night and they relocated us right away, without us requesting it. I would stay there again.

review.title: The Wharf Special
review.reviewText: Everything exceeded my expectations at this hotel.

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText: We loved the historic setting of the cannery warehouse and the nautical look. Nice sheets, extremely clean bathroom. Located conveniently with loads of services nearby.

review.title: Lovers of San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: Our room, a standard with king, was totally amazing! The staff was friendly and helpful. The restaurant had quality food, the doormen and front desk people were extremely courteous and helpful. They even printed our flight check-in for us as we were gone for the day on a tour and unable to do it for ourselves. We'd recommend this hotel to anyone and when we return to San Francisco we'll be staying here again.

review.title: A Family Friendly Gem
review.reviewText: This hotel is located on the edge of the Fisherman's Wharf area, next to the cable care turnabout and within easy walking distance to all the area's attractions. Built in a refurbished old brick factory it is clean and quiet. Service is always quick, polite and helpful. The rooms are large and the beds are comfy. The nautical theme is very bold, but tolerable.They accept dogs. There is a free wine tasting in the afternoon. Family friendly.

review.title: A treat at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: A great hotel on Fisherman's Wharf, Very friendly accommodating staff. We were made to feel really welcome. Our room (2 queen beds) was spacious enough for all four of us and very comfortable. We had a partial view of the bay and Golden Gate bridge. The evening wine reception was also a nice treat. Overall a great experience and we would definitely come back to this hotel if visiting San Francisco again.

review.title: Not impressed!
review.reviewText: The Hotel was clean and the bell hops and door man were extremely helpful. However the hotel clerk we dealt with was not very helpful in accomodating us in securing an additional nights reservation. It is very near the Fisherman's warf which is very convenient for catching the cable cars, buying souviners, and eating a good meal. Don't think I would stay here again.

review.title: Home away from Home
review.reviewText: We love our stay at the Argonaut every time we go there.

review.title: Tad hurt being a first timer
review.reviewText: the hotel itself was very wonderful. The only thing I was hurt about was that, since the check-in girl was on the phone with someone, I asked if the conceirge lady can help me. In a cold and almost condescending tone, she told me that I was to speak to the check-in girl, meaning that I had to continue waiting to be checked in. I believe she called in another girl right after speaking to me, but I just wish she had been kinder about my ignorance.

review.title: Beautiful Nautical theme fit right in
review.reviewText: Very nice Hotel. Close to all the sites and especially the Fisherman's Wharf "strip". Beautiful Nautical theme fit in with the surroundungs. Very quiet and comfortable room. Also close to public transportation, and the staff knew very well the best way to get around without a car.

review.title: Overnight at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Argonaut. We caught the tail end of the wine tasting when we checked in. The room was comfortable the location was great.

review.title: Fun Trip - Great Location
review.reviewText: Location was great, right in the heart of Fishermans Wharf. This hotel is comfortable, clean, charming, friendly, with a wonderful staff. I cant wait to go back.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff and great location

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel!
review.reviewText: My husband and I travel often so we are use to good service however we have never received service like we received at the Argonaut Hotel. Everything was perfect from check in to check out. The staff was the best we have ever encountered. Everyone was incredibly pleasant from the bell boy to housekeeping! We highly recommend this hotel. We will definitely stay here the next time I'm in San Francisco!!

review.title: A MUST STAY - GET THE SUITE with a VIEW!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: This place was FABULOUS!!!!! We arrived late, but were greated very promptly and courteously. My only complaint is the VALET parking - HIGH cost for nightly charge.

review.title: Fourth year in a row
review.reviewText:
I go to SF every year for a conference, and even though the Argonaut is a 20-minute bus ride from the Moscone Center, I always think it's worth it. I get to see more than just the downtown area of a great city, Fisherman's Wharf has a wealth of decent restaurants, and the Argonaut itself is always lively without being overwhelming. Every night at 5pm is a wine tasting, and it's a great place to meet in preparation for the next day's activities before setting out for the night. The rooms are clean and quiet (and both dog and kid-friendly), but I don't spend much time in the room aside from sleeping.

I recommended it to a colleague, and he agrees with me. Every year he thanks me for finding this great hotel.

review.title: Very nice stay
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed staying at the Argonaut. Our hotel room was very spacious, and the bed was comfortable!!!

review.title: A must stay!!!!
review.reviewText: This Hotel is perfect. Great location, close to everything. The Hotel is gorgeous, all brick building, even has a museum attatched to Hotel. Rooms are absolutely enormous and very nice with brick walls. Did I mention free wine tasting everyday between 5 and 6pm? Staff were great, helped us with all our inquiries. Easily the best Hotel in S.F. and well priced. Easily a 4 or 5 Star, without being stuck up and snobbish. A must stay everytime.

review.title: Just Fun
review.reviewText: We always get MUNI passes for how ever long we are going to visit then you can enjoy all of the public transportation for one price. we found a couple of new resturants, if you like steaks Izzy's is great and the locals go there also. We rode the # 30 bus to staton (I think) but you can ask the front desk the street name. Also Joey & Eddie's for Italian food it's near Washington square You can take the cable car up. Just call ahead for the cross streets. Also visit the farmers market down at the Emarcadaro on Saturdays for fun time meeting the locals.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: I had a fantastic time and can't wait to go back. I will be staying at Argonaut Hotel Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Very Impressed!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is top notch with a very convenient location. The beds and pillows were so comfortable we wanted to take them home. We did actually check out the pillow maker and ordered some when we returned home.

We loved the architecture and the history of this building.

We were meeting out of state relatives and the hotel made sure our rooms were only a few doors apart.

review.title: Will definitely go back again!!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Argonaut to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. We were so happy we picked this hotel. Its centrally located to everything. We did rent a car this time but will not in the future. We will use public transportation and taxis as its a lot less expensive. The staff was very friendly and helpful during every interaction. We stayed in the king suite and the jacuzzi tub was wonderful. Much larger than in most hotels. My husband and I will definitely stay there again and are even thinking of making this an annual event.

review.title: Great hotel for family
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because we stayed at Union Square the previous time so wanted to try near Fisherman's Wharf on this trip. The location was wonderful since it is just minutes away from Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square and the cable car stop. The hotel was clean and nice and the staff were courteous to our needs. We really enjoyed free wi-fi and daily happy hours with free wine and hot chocolate. The only drawback was that our room, which was a standard king was very tight and had no view(we were facing toward the inner side of the building) Other than that, everything was great. We were especially impressed when the hotel sent us to our home the cheese (which we bought at Napa) we left at the fridge. It made a wonderful LAST impression.

review.title: Would love to return......GREAT hotel!
review.reviewText:
The hotel's decor was all nautical.....the hotel was one block to the S.F. wharf.

Very pleasant experience at the desk singing in and help to our room. They had

a wine tasting about 5 pm .....how wonderful! ! We would return there in a

heartbeat! ! The rooms and bath were exceptionally clean with the nautical

decor in the room and bath.

review.title: Not much for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and staff was friendly. We only stayed for one night but parking was outragously exspensive so make sure you add an extra $55.00 a night on to your stay. For the price we paid it wasn't as nice as I had thought it would be. But it is a boutique hotel so they are usually a little more pricey than the chains. You can't beat the location if you enjoy fishermans wharf. They would have to have a really good deal before i stayed there again. But all in all I can't complain.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText:
Loved the hotel and the location. The atmosphere of the hotel and staff were very friendly. The photo's on the website show the rooms as VERY BRIGHT - thankfully they are not as bright as pictured, but still unique and nice. The wine reception was great, and about 50 people actually attended it !! The staff we very accomodating to requests for add'l coffee, luggage assistance, shopping/dining location direction/suggestions. Beds were comfortable and we had a deluxe king room that was the size of some suites I've stayed in.
I agree with some of the other reviews, sometimes you could hear noise in the hallways/next door - but nothing that woke me up, or kept me awake.
Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: The View with NO view
review.reviewText:
If you are to reserve this hotel to view of GG, think twice. The window is too small and GG view is blocked by tress 3rd floor and below. Hotel is marketing it for the view as premium option. It is NOT worth it. Hotel management is still trying to sell you for hefty price.

The only good thing about this hotel is that it is stting on Pier 39.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our time in the City very much, the weather was lovely ( especially for February). The Argonaut is a very nice Hotel with a great friendly staff and a wonderful location. It was nice to be so close to the Bay.

review.title: nice but dark
review.reviewText: room was nice, but i paid extra for a golden gate bridge view which was almost entirely obscured by a tree. able to hear other guests on several occasions. room service food was good. street noise in the morning disturbing, especially the garbage removal.

review.title: Great hotel wish I had had more time
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel, from the outside seems like any other inner city hotel but the interior will blow your mind. Service in all areas outstanding. Resturant recommendations perfect. The staff went beyond any expectation.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: Rooms were clean, staff was polite and efficient. Free wine in the evening was a nice surprise. Parking in all of San Francisco is a problem. Unexpected fees: Parking and WiFi

review.title: A good place to stay for people persons
review.reviewText:
With maritime themes and decor adorning this old brick building and big bolts sticking out of the brick and timbers, this unlikely 4-star hotel is unique not only in its decor but in its personable, professional staff - some of the most genuine people I have met. The hotel seems to embrace the idea that travel is a social opportunity, and their warm, spacious reception area, evening wine gatherings and friendly, gracious staff make socializing easy. The desk clerk and doorman were as helpful offering dining and entertainment suggestions as the concierge.

The rooms: again, nautical themes but comfortable with obvious thought given to room arrangement and appointments. Ample floor space, iPod-ready clock radio, power strip on the desktop, huge bathroom counter-top with Aveda products, bathroom nightlight, good shower water-pressure, soft thick towels, keyless room safe, sofa with ottoman, lights where you need them, tv with dvd and lots of movie options, and animal-print bathrobes.

Hotel situated close to where the cable cars turn around near Fisherman's Wharf, and the doorman will bust a gut getting you a cab RIGHT NOW to go anywhere you want. All kinds of great dining options along the streets, bristling with tourists, couples and people walking small dogs, with postcard views of the bay.

Fun and relaxing. A more traditional hotel is easy to find, but I recommend giving this place on the off chance you might discover a part of the travel experience youve been missing.

review.title: Perfect all around EXCEPT
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was fantastic...very courteous and extremely helpful. The hotel was clean and in a great location. The only issue was that the Standard King room was long and narrow and the heater made an awful noise when it turned on...not very comfortable if you ask me. The walls were pretty thin too...we could hear our neighbors and EVERYTHING they were doing. However, after the 1st night I couldn't take the neighbors anymore and asked to be moved to another room. The front desk asked no questions and immediately moved us to another room down the hall which turned out to be a room with a view and the bigger King room.It was MUCH more comfortable and spacey...MUCH BETTER! I recommend going with the deluxe king room if you want any comfort...the standard king is just too small.

review.title: Excellent Value
review.reviewText: Excellent value and attentive staff. The room was large and comfortable. While the location is a bit removed from the business scene, the proximity to parks and wharf make it an excellent location for runners. The staff at the restaurant were outstanding.. friendly and prompt service.

review.title: Noisiest Hotel In the World
review.reviewText: You can hear guests in neighboring rooms BREATHING. In spite of big brick walls, every single sound in the next room came through. It was truly unbelievable. I heard other guests saying the same thing the next morning in the lobby. I will NEVER stay at the Argonaut again. I would rather take my chances sleeping in my car.

review.title: Best location at fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Very convinient location at Fsherman's Wharf. Friendly staff. Bell captain recommended the restaurant Scoma's,which had awesome seafood. Hotelroom was small and after taking a shower the bath was steamed like sometimes the Golden Gate Bridge. Valet parking was 50 bucks/night, but this is the same overall the place.

review.title: Will stay again!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay so much on the first leg of our driving trip that we ended up staying again on our way back home 10 days later. The hotel is beautiful, in a perfect location, hotel staff was wonderful, very kid friendly when you arrive which made it fun for my 9 and 7 year old, and one block from the Buena Vista. The room we had was very spacious and overlooked the outer courtyard(I think we got up graded at check in). We are already planning another trip to San Francisco and we will diffently stay at the Argonaut. FYI-the over night parking was a little high for my Escalade but we had left alot of things in the back and thought it would be safer with hotel parking

review.title: location awesome
review.reviewText: location awesome, staff was some of the best anywhere, rooms a little small

review.title: FUN LOCATION
review.reviewText: GREAT LOCATION TO A LOT OF FUN ACTIVITIES. NEAR THE PIERS, NEAR THE TROLLEY STOP, GREAT FOOD NEARBY AND WITHIN THE HOTEL, VIEWS OF ALCATRAZ, STEP OUTSIDE OF HOTEL AND HAVE VIEWS OF GOLDEN GATE BRIDGE, GHIRARDELLI SQUARE, WALKING DISTANCE TO ALL PIER ACTIVITIES.

review.title: Before Christmas
review.reviewText:
We went just a few days before Christmas and found that San Fran was bursting with people, even though the weather wasn't perfect.

This hotel has a nautical theme that almost reminds you of Disneyland. The location is PERFECT and hard to pass up. They have a wine hour, everyday, which was pleasant.

The room had a bed that was sort of hard, the blankets and such were not very plush, but were ok.

Service was amazing; the valet to even maintenance were very friendly and helpful; we have been to SF many, many times and didn't need help from the staff, but found a lot of people asking questions and seeming very happy with their results.

I think we will stay at the Fairmont hotel next time, but this hotel was nice. It is very family friendly, has great Aveda products and you can tell they really care about people staying there and having a great time.

The lobby was amazing!

review.title: Great hotel but check room allocation
review.reviewText: The hotel location is fantastic, the rooms clean & the staff friendly and helpful. However, we were a little disappointed with our room size and location. There was little room to move around the 2 QS beds and using the bathroom was a tight juggle. The inward facing location meant we could either look directly into the rooms opposite (& vice versa) or keep the shutters fully closed excluding all daylight

review.title: The best solution in the neighbourhood
review.reviewText: but the night parking it's too expensive ($ 43.00 + tax)

review.title: We love the Argonaut Hotel. You should try it!
review.reviewText: This is our second visit to the Argonaut Hotel. It is fantastic. The two other couples we have vacationed with agree. This hotel is comfortable, clean, charming, friendly, at a great location, with a wonderful staff, and a great happy hour. We have never had a problem at the Argonaut and their restaurant has the BEST crab chowder anywhere. The cable car stop is right across the street in a great little park. The wharf is also across the street. You can walk to Pier 39, great restaurants, shopping, local pubs, etc. I just can't say enough about it and I can't wait to go back.

review.title: Great Hotel! Location too touristy.
review.reviewText:
Overall we had a great stay at the hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful. Location was great, right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. A must do when here is get a bike from Blazing Saddle. Then bike it across the Golden gate bridge to Sausalito and ride the ferry back.

The only drawback with this location is it can feel like a tourist trap. It's good to try once, but the next time we definitely would stay in downtown's financial district.

review.title: Simply amazing!
review.reviewText: Amazing location. Gorgeous hotel. And if you have children, it's perfect!

review.title: Highly Recommend this Hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I extended a nearby business trip for a weekend in San Fran. The Argonaut was perfect! Great location and a beautiful room in this nautically-themed hotel. Bldg a former cannery that was completely remodeled. Beautiful old brick walls still present throughout hotel with occasional glimpses of old architectural features. Rooms very clean and well-appointed. Staff very helpful and polite. The extra pillows (housekeeping delivered quickly) were the only thing the very comfy bed needed. Overnight laundry service did a great job with our casual clothing and was reasonably priced. Great location across street from trolleys and just down a block from bus/streetcars. Walgreens is around corner too. WiFi consent and worked well in room. Staff shipped several boxes without any problems. Great place, great weekend!

review.title: What a way to go!
review.reviewText: We were celebrating my husbands 50th birthday with a trip to San Fransisco. The Argonaut Hotel was wonderful. The room was a little small, but the atmosphere was wonderful and the bed was very comfortable. The service from the front desk all the way to the door men was exceptional. We would love to stay here again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful! Bed was a little uncomfortable. The lighting in the room is hard to find, but good when we found it. Helpful concierge.

review.title: Awesome Stay!
review.reviewText: Extremely clean and well furnished hotel seconds away from the docks of Fisherman's Wharf and cable cars. Free wine from 5-6 was a bonus!

review.title: Syle, history, fun and accessibility - definately one to return to
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a delight. it is located in an historic building that has been extremely sympathetically renovated. The standard of the decor is of the highest order. The food in the adjoining restaurant/brt (all under the control of the hotel) is excellent and good value for money. The service is first class and they even have a free wine tasting hour every evening. It is most conveniently located for the historic end of Fisherman's Wharf and to Ghiradelli Square and the cable car terminus to the City.

The best hotel in the area if you want something a bit different but stylish. It is a bhit more expensive but sooo worth it!!

review.title: Night before Napa
review.reviewText: We chose the Argonaut for a brief stay before heading to Napa and were so happy with our choice! It's absolutely the nicest hotel on Fisherman's Wharf with direct access to all the tourist attractions but also close enough to walk or take a cable car to many different areas of the city. We were also upgraded to a larger room on the corner with beautiful views. The room itself was enormous with a master bedroom and sitting room and luxurious soaking tub in the bath! We definitely found a deal on Expedia and will look to stay here, again.

review.title: best place at the wharf
review.reviewText: very friendly staff,well maintained ,comfortable rooms and good location if you want to stay in wharf area.

review.title: Changed our opinion of San Francisco
review.reviewText:
When we arrived in San Francisco we had booked at another hotel - after one night we moved, it was awful.
My boss had recommended the Argonaut and luckily they still had availabilities. As soon as we arrived the staff were welcoming, helpful and friendly. Concierge was able to help us sort out everything we needed. Rooms were comfortable and spacious. In a great location just a short walk to Fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: Awesome location, hotel and super service. Everyone on the staff was very courteous and helpful. Our main requirement was a quiet room and for 6 days and night it was very quiet even though the hotel was sold out on at least two nights. Being right beside the cable car turnaround was a major plus for me. Thank you Argonaut.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
staff was very nice -valet parking is prompt - great location
The restaurant in the hotel was great esp for breakfast.

review.title: Fantastic Location!
review.reviewText: Kind of snooty front desk people the night we arrived. Other than that all was perfect. The valet and bell staff were extremely helpful in pointing out local emenities.

review.title: Great Place to stay, eat,and sleep
review.reviewText:
it was our first time to San Fran and we loved it. we loved the hotel it was in the best location. easy for local transport and easy access to all facilities. the tourism bureau is around the corner, a great ice cream shop across the foyer, excellent restaurant. great service and really gave a great atmosphere for San Fran especially as this hotel is on Fishermans wharf it had all the trimmings.
fabulous. stay and first hotel we have stayed at that was pet friendly. Made me miss my little dog.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: All was okay here but didn't care for the lack of ventilation in the bathroom. There was no fan just a vent opening in the ceiling. When we took showers everything fogged up including the room! Called it in to the desk and never heard anything further????

review.title: will return some day
review.reviewText:
Great location
Quiet, comfortable room (King)
friendly staff, especially doormen
houses maritime museum, very interesting
fun shops and wonderful restaurants close by including in the hotel itself
right next door to the Hyde St. cable car start location
overall a very good experience

review.title: Great Place -- Great Location
review.reviewText:
We chose to take a brief vacation to the west coast - a first for me. We primarily chose the Argonaut for its location at Fiserman's Wharf. The hotel itself was located right on the edge of the main drag - walking distance to shops, cable cars and importantly restaurants.

The staff were friendly and very helpful. The wine tasting every evening was a nice touch which we only participated once. We were there for only 4 days and had so much to do.

The rooms were clean and well equiped, though a tad small - I suppose some would describe it as cozy.

As our stay was short and was not able to do all the things we wanted to do. It was decided that another trip was definitely due and a return to this hotel is a must.

review.title: Class and comfort; would definitely return.
review.reviewText: The best hotel right across from Fisherman's Wharf is also one block from the cable car line. My husband and I arrived on a Saturday afternoon for a two night stay. Service was friendly and responsive to our needs. Front desk is cordial and competent and the concierge was very helpful with dinner suggestions and reservations. We had a 4th floor, inside room, yet there is still a large window that lets in much light. Rooms and bathroom are comfortable and big enough; NOT cramped. The evening wine hour in the lobby is very nice. One 'don't': DON'T park overnight at the hotel as it is very expensive. There is a parking garage at about half the price right around the corner from the hotel. Have fun!

review.title: Looking forward to going back
review.reviewText: We were very surprised and pleased with our stay. We had a great time and will recommend it to our friends.

review.title: great location friendly help
review.reviewText: great place to stay. courteous help. clean and nice rooms.

review.title: Location-Location-Location
review.reviewText: What a great location...you can walk to just about everything that makes San Francisco so unique...love the nautical theme of the hotel and their clam chowder is top on the list! Every evening a wine reception is held in the lobby, great place to mingle with guests and sample great wines! We will definitely stay there again!

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: Very clean and you walk across the street and your at Pier 39

review.title: First time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location on the wharf. Staff friendly and helpful.

review.title: No what we expected
review.reviewText: The hotel itself seemed nice, until we got to our room. I was expecting a four star hotel, when what we got was a small underground room. the hotel boasted views. all we saw were peoples feet and small children peering thru our window. the room barely fit the queen size bed in it. it was the last room in the hall next to the house keeping room.

review.title: Fisherman Wharf's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel twice this year and both times it's been awesome. Great service, helpful doormen, good restaurant, fabulous happy hour (free wine), charming nautical decor, excellent location (across the street from the cable car, across the street from wharf area). Only downside was price for valet parking: around $46 per night -- ouch!

review.title: So convenient
review.reviewText: It was just what we needed - by the waterfront, at the terminus of the tram and cable cars and next door to the Maritime Museum. The hotel had an interesting nautical theme reflected in all the decor, but was also scrupulously clean. At the end of every afternoon there was a free wine tasting in the lounge in a friendly, relaxing environment.

review.title: Very poor quality of room and service
review.reviewText: We booked rooms for 2 periods (3 nights then a further 4 nights) - paid top rates for rooms with Bay / Golden Gate view. The rooms were smelly, noisy, dirty windows, noisy internal room equipment. We asked to change and eventually got better rooms. We skipped breakfast one morning as there was a queue for over 30 mins! When we did take breakfast, inevitably the order we gave was not provided in full (staff forgot parts of the order). Very slow service for evening meal. Cost of long distance phone calls was a rip-off. Staff organising taxis at front door were very rude on one occasion which was upsetting. We have stayed at the Argonaut before and enjoyed the experience but this was awful. We could not recommend it on this experience.

review.title: definitely would go back
review.reviewText: we had a great time. great location. great room and overall service

review.title: Great spot - great service
review.reviewText: I recently stayed at the Argonaut on vacation in SF. The service was excellent - and the hotel in a perfect spot for what we wanted to do (biking across the bridge, visiting sausilito, riding the trolleys). The amenities are up to par with Kimpton standards - which I have become a loyal fan of. The only surprise was the layout of the lobby - which wasn't as inviting/comfy as others I've stayed in - especially for the happy hour wine reception. There were far too many people for the facilities. overall - great time.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION , VERY NICE HOTEL
review.reviewText: PLENTY OF THINGS TO DO AND GREAT FOOD CLOSE TO THE HOTEL

review.title: A Gem in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Among the many hotels to choose from in Fisherman's Wharf, the Argonaut stood out among the crowd due to its location and price points. Once checked in, it suprisingly offered a wonderfully themed atmosphere reminscint of a stay at a Disney Resort. The location is everything expected. It is in close proximity to the street car to go to Union Square, multiple bus stops, and--of course--Fisherman's Wharf. "The Blazing Saddle" bike shop is right next to the hotel entrance, making it easily accessible to rent a bike, go across the Golden Gate Bridge, and return it conveniently. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. During the time of this review, there was a wine reception during the evening hours. As a result, as come travelers were checking in, they were also greeted with a complimentary glass of wine. Wine aside, when asked for dining recommendations, the staff never missed a beat and responded quickly and effectively based on what mood you're in. Overall impressed with the hotel. When compared with other lodging, there are a few short comings. The room size is a bit smaller, but with the ornamental decorations, its very easily overlooked. Also for some reason there was no fan in the bathroom. In order to battle fog from a hot shower, the a/c had to be turned on.

review.title: Highest Recommendation
review.reviewText: Was very pleased with the Argonaut hotel.Friendly and helpful staff. Great location and well maintained hotel. Would most definitely go back.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Overall I was very impress with the hotel.

review.title: Nothing special
review.reviewText: We got to San Fran for a romantic weekend away, and ended up being put into a two queen room instead of the king that we paid for. There are no ocean views, as this hotel backs onto two roads. The rooms themselves are quite dark. We never saw the wine receptions. We asked for a goldfish three times, before we got one the second day of our trip. The staff gave us the wrong information when we asked for help. The Blue Mermaid does have wonderful chowder though. I would say if you get a deal, go here, but it's nothing amazing.

review.title: Nice location but not impressed
review.reviewText: I did enjoy staying at this hotel because it was so close to everything. I picked this hotel because we flew up. Parking anywhere in SF is expensive. The wine hour is also very enjoyable to just sit and relax with a few glasses of wine. However, I did not appreciate getting charged again for my room by the hotel when I had already prepaid for it. It was fixed a few day after I noticed, but it should not have happened in the first place. The room was nice but small and there was no view whatsoever.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: My mom and I took the kids to the Argonaut for a leisure trip to San Francisco. The location is excellent. Lots things to do within walking distance and close to many types of transportation. The hotel was stylish, clean and quite and the accomodations were very comfortable. My kids loved the Wii in the lobby, and the fish we received for our room. Rice A Roni hill and the trolley is right around the corner, and the Maritime Museum is directly across the street, great double deck bus tour is also around the corner, as is Giradelli Square. The only downside was that our double room was a little small. That is the only negative thing that I have to say. I would definitely recommend the Argonaut.

review.title: The hotel is a busy hotel with a lot of coming and going
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Argonaught the wine tasting between 5 and 6 was great and a good oportunity to meet other guests.I was a bit surprised that we were tasting Jacobs Creek (Australian) wine and not the Californian wine.This is a very busy area of town so dont go expecting a laid back atmoshere.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel right on Fisherman's Wharf. Super close to the cable cars, wharf attractions. The hotel staff were very friendly and easily accommodated our early check in. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Convenient ,friendly and very clean
review.reviewText: Great place to stay in the best city in the US.The only thing i didn't like was the price of the parking,although the attendants we're very nice and considerate,and we we're always treated with courtesey.Would recommend this hotel for either family or couples.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Perfect location on the wharf with easy access to attractions, restaurants and the trolley. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only meal we ate at the hotel was breakfast and it was delicious. I will definitely stay at the Argonaut on my next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Pet & Kid Friendly - and great for grownups too!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is in a terrific location, several blocks away from the Fisherman's Wharf crowds, but just a short block to the Hyde cable car turnaround and the Buena Vista cafe. The hotel is both pet-friendly (big dogs too!) and kid-friendly (Wii in lobby). Big park with beach across the street is great for both.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: The Hotel is located on fishermans wharf. The Trolley cars run right outside the hotel and were easy to get to. Just up the hill is Lombard street. The trolley actually pauses there for riders to jump on and off. Also near the property is Gheradeli (spelling) square. Which was no big deal. On a clear day you can see the Golden Gate bridge from the propety. We braved the public transportation system to get to the bridge which was awesome and exciting. You can drive to the bridge but we decided to be more daring. We did not eat at the hotel simply because we wanted to eat on the Wharf. The staff is very friendly and the property itself is beautiful. I would highly recommend this property but be advised you do pay extra for parking which is not included in the hotel rate.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I had a great time at this hotel. Close to everything, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Tours. We enjoyed taking a stroll and finding everything close by. Would stay here again, definitely.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was in walking distance from every place we wanted to see, but it was close enough we could come back and take a break too (with san Francisco's streets I needed to) the service was polite and the ambience was serene.

review.title: If you are looking for a place to stay in Fisherman's Wharf...this is it.
review.reviewText: We traveled as a family of four (kids 7 and 9)and had a fourth floor room with two twin queen size beds overlooking the bay and Alcatraz...fantastic views. The Argonaut has very tastefully converted from an old warehouse, and the room designs and accommodation are modern and luxurious without being too wacky. The in-house services are relatively basic but room service was efficient, and the Blue Mermaid restaurant (integral to hotel)had plenty on the menu to keep the kids happy. Free fast internet a big plus for people who cannot completely disappear whilst they are on holiday. No pool- but there is so much to do in San Francisco that this should not be a problem. Not sure that Fisherman's Wharf is ideally situated for traveling around the city as tourists, but if you love the trams and buses it is not a major issue. Overall a very good hotel, and reasonably good value for money.

review.title: We loved the Argonaut!
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfectly located on the Wharf, the service was outstanding and the staff friendly and efficient. Our room was lovely and very comfortable with excellent amenities. When we return to San Francisco, this is where we will stay!

review.title: Wonderful Experience - Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: I would highly recommed this hotel to anyone. The staff was awesome - they always remembered your name and were so friendly. Excellent location.

review.title: Great location, would stay again
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly. Great location and room. Wine reception was a good way to meet other travelers.

review.title: Would definetly stay again
review.reviewText: There is not one bad thing or even improvement we can think of for this hotel. Everyone was friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived to the time we left. Check-in was smooth and easy, we were able to check-in early without any problems. Our room was pleasant and clean at all times. The concierge and front desk staff were very friendly and offered to get restaurant reservations when we asked about specific types of food. Our room was on the inside-we didn't expect to have a window, so it was a nice surprise. Other than occasional footsteps from overhead, no noise problems either. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anybody and would stay there again when in San Francisco. Unless you are driving here, you do not need to have a car. We rented one for a day through the concierge without any hassle. The car was dropped of at the front door and we had to return it to a different parking lot only because we got back to the city after 6:00. We walked everywhere- maps of the city are easy to obtain and follow. We got a City Pass, initially for the attraction tickets, but it also includes unlimited riding on the cable cars,the MUNI buses and street cars for 7 days. The MUNI system is CLEAN and will get you wherever you want to go in the city. The cable turn around is next to the hotel- very busy from about 9:30 in the morning til late at night. If you follow the route, there are stops about every 2 blocks and you can get on and off faster that way.

review.title: Hotel Bliss
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel,wouldn't stay anywhere else. It is a great location and the service is outstanding. The complimentary wine reception and nautical theme is so awesome, definitely fun to do every night before you go out to dinner or out on the town. The Blue Mermaid restraunt connected to the hotel is so good. They have an award winning clam chowder (crab and corn i believe)its very good. It was my first time to San Francisco and the hotel was very helpful in accomidations. I can't wait to go back,or even try out other Kimpton Hotels while i travel. Bravo Argonaut Hotel!!

review.title: Great location and extras
review.reviewText: All the positives that were said about this hotel are true - we loved it! We went with our two teenage sons, but the hotel seems like a good fit for everyone.

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: Great Staff, very helpful, pro helpful, friendly eye contact with staff. Bed was very comfortable, shower was great! Would not hesitate to stay another week.

review.title: very impressed with hotel and staff..
review.reviewText: the hotel was very nice and clean and the staff was great...would stay there again! very convenient to fisherman's wharf...

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was a great place to stay. Our room was clean, comfortable and the location was perfect for our needs. Concierge service was very helpful. We were in walking distance to many activities and to public transportation. We visited downtown, the Coit Tower, Chinatown, Ghiradelli, went to a Giants game, took the metro to Berkley and of course walked the wharf. We did it all walking or on public transportation. Many great restaraunts nearby.

review.title: best bet on the warf
review.reviewText: very nice and clean hotel on warf but away from the madness of the crowds.soon as you walk out the front door you can see the golden gate bridge to the left and alcatraz right in front of you.very friendly and helpful staff.this is my new # 1 choice when i am in san francisco.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Husband and 2 teenagers stayed for 1 week. Perfect location for walking the Warf. Hotel was clean, requests were handled in a timely manner, Free wine reception available every afternoon and I think they also had ice cream bars earlier in the afternoon but always missed that!

review.title: WOW
review.reviewText: We had an amazing stay and the staff was great especially Ernie who was always there to answer our questions and direct us to the best spots.

review.title: Very impressed!
review.reviewText: From the moment we drove up we were completely taken care of....no worries. Everyone was super accomodating from the valet to check in. Happy Hour was just that.....seems everyone in the hotel makes it a point to attend & visit with each other. Nice! Cute Cute deco. Fantastic location. Couldn't be better. From the desk to the conceirge were very helpful! Loved every minute of it.

review.title: Great Location for San Fran weekend
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was the perfect place for our anniversary weekend. We didn't need any vehicle because of the proximity of this hotel to all attractions we went to. Our thanks to the management and staff.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice and the staff is very friendly. The Hotel is walking distance to most attractions in the Fishermans Warf area. Great Hotel and would recommend to anyone.

review.title: Best & Worst
review.reviewText: Best: Excellent location, beautiful hotel. Great doormen, especially Donovan - not only cordial, but entertaining and funny. Daily wine tasting pours all you want. Front desk personnel warm and helpful. Worst: Concierge - Scott treated us with disdain. We stopped utilizing this service due to his attitude. Disappointed: After booking 7days/4people, traveling 16 hours, not allowed to access room 30 minutes early. Wine was plentiful at tasting, but quality was poor.

review.title: Excellent Price / Excellent Locaion
review.reviewText: The hotel was in an awesome location. Right at the end of the cable car line, right on Fisherman's Wharf. Tons of shops and restaurants and an easy walk to Pier 39. We didn't rent a car while in town, but took the cable car to Union Square, then walked back through Chinatown and Little Italy to Pier 39. There are even Sonoma Valley wine tours that will pick up from the hotel as well. Extranomical tours was the one we used. The hotel was very clean and the staff was always willing to help. With the price that we got from Expedia we would definately stay here again and are going to look for Kimpton Family hotels when we go to other cities. Thanks for a great time!

review.title: Can't fault it
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable room with excellent location

review.title: Exceeded expectations
review.reviewText: I am one of those people who like nice hotels and clean ones. This hotel was extremely clean and very cute. It wasn't a huge room but we got a room with a bay view and it was spectacular. The layout made it easy to keep the room tidy. Location was great also. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Best Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. The service and staff were excellent. We did not want for anything. We could see the Golden Gate Bridge and SF Bay out our window - it doesn't get much better than that!

review.title: Great spot to stay....and get the SF experience!!
review.reviewText: My boys and I went for the 4th of July weekend. Never had to get in my car once we were there. Perfect place to stay if you have never been to SF. Near bike rentals (recommend the "Bike the Bridge". Rode across Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito/Tiburon it was AWESOME (take Ferry back to near hotel). Warf, Gharidelli, firework shows, Canery....great location...good restaurant, and pleasant staff. Definately recommend.

review.title: Argonaut's Exceptional Service, Prime Location & Cool Design
review.reviewText: I couldn't be more impressed with the staff and facility of the Argonaut! Everyone went out of their way to be helpful and pleasant to us. The modern twist on a nautical look gave the hotel a cool vibe and the location for us weekend tourists from the South Bay was ideal. We were steps away from the trolley end point that took us to Union Square, steps from a great dinner with a view at Ghiradelli Square, and an easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. All for a reasonable rate through Expedia. We can't wait to go again!

review.title: Argonaut Never Disappoints
review.reviewText: We have stay at the Argonaut every time we are in San Fran and we are never disappointed. The old world style and charm of this place can not be matched. Besides the beauty of this place the staff is always helpful, friendly and accommodating. My husband and I always bring our two furry children and here they are treated like family. That is so important to us. We will continue to stay here every time we come to San Fran.

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: Beautiful rooms and even better customer service at this hotel located on the "quieter" end of Fisherman's Wharf. Perfect place to stay for a family or if you are going to SF for the first time.

review.title: I would reccomend this hotel for anyone looking for the best
review.reviewText: This was one of the best experiences wwe have ever had in hotel stay. My wife & i were there on our honeymoon and we were treated like famely.The staf there made our stay just wonderful. We didnothave a question about the city that wasnot answered,We can't wait to go back for another visit.Hats off for the best.

review.title: This is why we went back
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived we felt so welcome by the staff (Steve, John, Hawa), the food at the Blue Mermaid was just the way we remembered, delicious! Omar (our waiter) knew just what we needed, the lobby is warm and cozy,the history behind this hotel is very interesting, the view from our room was open to the court yard, we enjoyed the busy afternoons right by the wharf, next to the trolley and the Ghirardelli square, we would absolutely keep going back.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great service, the best doormen ever!!!

review.title: Excellent-A !!!!
review.reviewText: Location, Location, Location. Right on the Wharf, front door of hotel is the Wharf. Cable Car turn-around is right around the corner. Strret Cars are two blocks away. No need to bring a car to SF when you stay here. The rooms are excellent with super comfy mattress and the entire hotel is decorated in a nautical theme. Free wine hour every evening. Forget about looking at any other hotels in SF near the Wharf, you may pay a little more for this place but it is well worth it. Sometimes better things cost a little more. You won't regret staying here.

review.title: Kimpton's are Fantastic!
review.reviewText: Everything was awesome. In future, I will look for other Kimpton hotels to stay in.

review.title: FIrst rate service
review.reviewText: Perfect location overlooking cable-car turnaround and SF Bay and GG Bridge. Easy access to Wharf and tours. Doormen and desk attendants could not have been more helpful. A totally enjoyable experience from start to finish. Blue Mermaid restaurant -- best chowder in San Fran! Was sorry to leave.

review.title: Good local
review.reviewText: Great place to stay right next to trolly and convinent to the warf.

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was excellent. In and Out Burger was just down the street along with so many other dining options. The bus, street cars, & the F-line were all right there outside the door. All the differnt tours were easy to get to (I recommend the Alcatraz evening tour and the Mr. Toad city tour). We spent 7 days at the Argonaut. Our King Room had a view of the Cannery and was the perfect size for the two of us. The bed was so comfortable and provided a great sleep each night! The staff were all very friendly and helped us many times with directions.

review.title: Great Hotel in the Heart of Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: I found this hotel to be perfect for my 3 day stay in San Francisco. I wanted to spend most of my time in the Fisherman's Wharf area, and it was right there in the middle of everything. It is accross the street from the Cable car turn around, accross the street from the bay, 2 blocks from the street car terminal, and surrounded by shops and restaurants. I felt safe all the time, and had no noise at all in my inside room. The hotel was very well kept up, and there were service people around any time they were needed. The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. I would highly reccomend this hotel for just about everyone. I even enjoyed riding the elevator with dogs(pets are allowed). I would definitely stay here again if going to San Francisco, and have already recommended it to friends.

review.title: San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Great hotel. The staff was very helpful and the location can not be beaten. The rooms are a bit small but for San Fransisco this is normal. Definately take the King room as the Queen doesn't have a great view and is to small for 2 adults.

review.title: Best accommodation on Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: Step right into the heart of Fishermen's Wharf the minute you walk out the door. Easy access to all of San Francisco via cable cars and F-line. Staff were friendly and very helpful, rooms extremely comfortable and quiet. The evening wine reception is a great interlude between a busy day and going out for the evening. Won't even consider staying anywhere else next time we visit.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Great service. Great location.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: Other than the rude girl at the front desk upon checking in this was a great place. Make sure to have your ID on you to check in as she told me it was a "matter of security issues". She was sort of like the Mustafa of Argonaut.

review.title: Nice location for sightseeing
review.reviewText: The condition of the hotel was very nice along with the service staff. The only discomfort was that there was only one chair in our room. If the chair was occupied the other person had to sit on the bed.

review.title: Highly recommend!
review.reviewText: Great location, great staff, and great hotel. A bit far from shopping but just a cable car ride away from most anything in the city.

review.title: great hotel feel safe & pampered
review.reviewText: great hotel I love to stay here when in san francisco,I feel very safe here

review.title: Loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: We were very surprised at the cleanliness, cuteness of decor, location of this hotel, etc. I have not stayed in San Fran for quite a few years, and would defintely recomment this hotel to others!

review.title: Good service
review.reviewText: A problem with sink. Everything else is good.

review.title: Great experience - will stay at a Kimpton again!
review.reviewText: This is a great little hotel. The room was a bit small for us, but we didn't spend much time there. The daily happy hour is a nice touch!

review.title: Great location, Nice ammenities!
review.reviewText: First time stay, will definately be back, well done!

review.title: Best location and cozy setting
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was always courteous, and the location of the hotel was my favorite thing. Everything was within walking distance, and it was right in the middle of all the action of Fisherman's Wharf. The wine reception in the evenings was great, and the restaurant was terrific, maybe a little pricey.

review.title: Loved It!
review.reviewText: This is such cute cozy hotel and luxurious at the same time. Can't wait to go back!

review.title: Great location and clean
review.reviewText: A warm and friendly greeting on our late arrival was a pleasant surprise. The wine in the evenings with snacks was a nice touch. We also ordered room service which was prompt (15mins).

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: The stay at the Argonaut was nice. The location is accessible to the cable cars (one block) lots of restaurants and right next door to a wine bar, ice cream shop and bike rental. The concierge and hotel front desk could use some more training though. We arrived early and left our bags at the hotel. When our room was ready and asked for our bags to be delivered it took them over 30 minutes to get to our room. I had spa appt.'s and needed my bathing suit. When I called front desk the answer was yeah, I know you want your bags, you'll get them A couple of times we walked over to the concierge desk to ask for suggestions on places to eat etc. and he was on the phone. Not once did he look up and acknowledge us. We stood there for 10 minutes. We also called front desk for a cab one night and it never happened. We hailed one ourselves. The bed looks comfortable but it's not nearly as plush as it's made out to be. We would more than likely stay again but never use the concierge service/front desk for help.

review.title: Great place!
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with the hotel. The rooms are large and comfortable. The bed was more comfortable than my own bed. Late afternoon, we could hear the musicians playing in the courtyard. It was nice to listen to and they finished playing by dinner time. Only complaint was the fact that you could hear everything through the walls and hear the people walking above you. Luckily out we only had neighbours 2 out of 4 nights.

review.title: Wonderful spot to relax
review.reviewText: Aside from not liking the bed, everything else was great. Room service was prompt, employees were very helpful and polite. The wine hour was entertaining; not to mention the Wii the hotel sets up for guests to play during that time. The hotel is basically right on the water and is well within walking distance of anything you need to do around the Wharf area. I would stay here again if I come to San Fransisco in the future.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Excellent Hotel. The location was very convenient (pier 43). Staff & concierge were both very helpful and kind. I was amazed with the decoration and the cleaniness of the hotel. One think I did not like is there was no buffet breakfast. Another one was that the internet connection was unstable

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We stayed 3 nights. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. They helped us pick restaurants and gave us helpful directions to attractions. No complaints. Our shuttle wasn't picking us up til 1:00 and they let us have a late checkout. We did not rent a car, but had no problem getting around walking or with the cable cars and the double decker tour bus.

review.title: Wonderful Place to Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful to stay at. The service was outstanding. The location was ideal. The room was lovely. I've traveled quite extensively over the past few years, and the Arognaut has to be one of my top stays. Thanks for a lovely time.

review.title: Will stay again
review.reviewText: Overall very nice place and location is great at Fisherman's Wharf. Our weekend plans was just for Fisherman's Wharf location was great. The only downside was some second floor rooms looked directly eye level to the sidewalk because of the steep street on the the west side. Asked to be moved and they did without hesitation.

review.title: The best in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at the Argonaut. Quite frankly, after my last stay, I couldn't wait to go back. The location is perfect. The hotel staff is extraordinary. You will never pass a staff member without getting a greeting. Love the complimentary wine tasting every afternoon. Good wine and conversation. I can't wait for my next visit.

review.title: Great Location and Great Staff
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel based on the expedia reviews and I can tell you that we were not disappointed. The hotel is a very pleasant place to stay and we were never more than a $5 cab ride from anywhere. Harbour and wine tours start right outside the front door. The cable cars out front were a real treat too. We had a view of Alcatraz right out our window, with the golden gate bridge just off to the south. The staff were very polite. Really enjoyed this hotel and would highly recommend it.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: No complaints at all!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. Walking distance to Trolley Cars, dining and shopping. Hotel staff extremely friendly and helpful. Hope to return to The Argonaut soon. Very comfortable and pleasant stay!!

review.title: Amazing Service
review.reviewText: Great service, great atmosphere. Loved how friendly the staff is and helpful with directions and things to do. Definately would stay here again.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Argonaut Hotel was very enjoyable. The hotel is very charmng with it's nautical theme, and the location is great for visiting Alcatraz and doing other tours. Most of the staff were very friendly, although the front desk staff were not very accommodating. The room was very clean, and well maintained, although the beds were not as comfortable as most other hotels.

review.title: Thoroughly recommended
review.reviewText: Although on Fisherman's Wharf the hotel was very quiet. Tram turnaround is a couple of hundred yards away. Restaurants and bars on the doorstep. All staff were extremely helpful and friendly. If I returned to San Francisco I would defintely stay here again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Great hotel right on Fisherman's Wharf. Close to everything including transportation. Don't miss the nightly wine and appetizers. Great hotel!

review.title: Best Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here a couple of weeks ago for a business/leisure trip. At first we were a little hesistant because of previous reviews of "noise" and "thin walls", but I'm glad that we didn't pay any attention to that. If you stay here you will not regret it. The location, staff, views, and rooms were perfect. We had no issues whatsoever. Plus, their wine reception is a nice treat too! My husband and I will definitely be back!

review.title: No regrets!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, with good service and one of the better locations for access to SF activities.

review.title: A fortunate choice of Hotel
review.reviewText: It was our first visit to San Francisco and we were looking at several hotels when we found The Argonaut. We liked the look of the hotel on their website and secured a good rate with Expedia. When we arrived, the staff were welcoming and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable with funky decor with a marine theme and a stunning view of Alcatraz. The room was well furnished and equipped and the bed linen luxurious. The location is great, right on the waterfront at Fishermans Wharf,next to the Cable Car turnaround and tour bus stop,with lots of restauants and attractions nearby and an easy journey to the downtown areas.We enjoyed our stay so much that we returned for our last night to a room overlooking the Golden Gate Bridge and arrived in time to see the sunset.

review.title: Unique decor, convenient location
review.reviewText: We only stayed one night, but we'd definitely stay at the Argonaut again, as it was a good find. The location is an easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Giradelli Square, and the Buena Vista restaurant which had decent breakfast and great irish coffee. The valet was very helpful and fun and even offered to repack our entire vanful of luggage to give us more room. There was no sign or mention of the wine reception that was promised when we made our reservation. We forgot to ask about it, so I don't know if we missed it, but we didn't see anything set up anywhere.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great price and great location.

review.title: Impressed with decore of the hotel. However, not as much with the comfort of my room.
