review.reviewText: This Kimpton Hotel is located in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, overlooking San Francisco Bay. Great location to visit most of the tourist attraction and walking distance from/to North Beach, Chinatown and Union Sq. Throughout our 8 days stay we found that hotel staff was very polite, friendly and they provided very good service every time we needed something. Our room include original exposed brick walls, large timbers and whitewashed furniture(nautical theam). We were extremely satisfied with cleanliness of the room, however not very impressed with comfort. This was mainly due to a noise that was coming from... preaty much everywhere. Wall were so thin, that we could hear guests on either side of our room including people above us. We could hear them talking, walking, washing, flushing and also enjoying each others company. Overall very nice hotel, however, shame about noise!

review.title: hotel good - overall
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and clean and had a nice warm feel to it. Did not love the location and found the wharf to be very un-quaint. Also, parking for the hotel if you are renting a car is pretty expensive so make sure you take that into account. overall though, the hotel itself was nice, i would just wish it were in a different location.

review.title: Excellent in Many Ways
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was great! The location was outstanding for Fisherman's Wharf and easy access to cable cars...no car necessary. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean, comfortable, quiet, and attractive. We met other interesting guests every evening during "happy hour" in the lobby. We would go again tomorrow!

review.title: Argonaut - Great location
review.reviewText: A newly refurbished hotel with pleasant, helpful staff. Great location for all the Fisherman's Wharf sites and major tourist activities. Easy access to Chinatown by cable car (located next to hotel) or taxi ($7-ish) and all city shopping areas. Sits on the edge of the "strip" and as such you can tumble into the full spectrum of eateries and restaurants on offer from classy to gaudy from cheap to lavish. A clean, tidy and well kept establishment. It did the job splendidly!

review.title: Excellent Hotel!!
review.reviewText: I stayed here for two nights and I cannot find one complain about this hotel. From the friendly doormen to the cleanliness of the room. This is a great place to stay with kids. The location is awesome and convinient, located right on the wharf. You can walk anywhere where all entertainemnt is at. The parking charge is high but I parked my car somwhere at no charge overnight. Will stay here again.

review.title: 2 weeks in Luxury after filming doco in DR Congo
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a fabulous place to stay. Great location at the less busy end of Fisherman's Wharf. Quiet rooms. Quirky nature. Very friendly and helpful staff. The doormen are a hoot. Afternoon wine tastings are a great social event and a way to meet other guests. Free internet makes other hotels more expensive. I have no hesitation in recommending this place to all. After 3 weeks filming in Sub Saharan Africa the Argonaut is incredible.

review.title: Lovely hotel with lots of character
review.reviewText: Overall a great experience. Hotel has a great location giving easy access to many attractions. Service is great and the afternoon wine tasting in the lobby area was fun and a nice touch.

review.title: The Best on the Warf !
review.reviewText: There is not one thing I can say that would be negative about this hotel, from the room, the helpful doormen, to the wine tasting hour; this hotel is top notch. Very easy to walk around the Warf to all the shops, park, etc. Safe environment....an all around wonderful experience

review.title: Argonaut Hotel Fisherman's Wharf A Gem!
review.reviewText: Forget ALL the other "hotels" at Fisherman's Wharf, San Francisco -- the ONLY one you need to stay at is The Argonaut! Built within the exterior of a pre-1906 brick warehouse you'd never suspect the INSIDE was a 5-star HOTEL, but it is! Our Expedia reservation cut our rate IN HALF of what The Argonaut Hotel website rate was AND, upon check-in, they "upgraded" us (no charge) to a two-room suite!! The staff are kind, courteous and meticulous. The overnight parking (on-site) was a bit steep BUT a one-block walk will provide a parking garage at 1/2 that price. This hotel is part of the Kimpton Group which has hotels throughout the San Francisco Bay Area which we have stayed at before -- so, we ALWAYS look for a "Kimpton" whereever we stay now!

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: This hotels location is perfect. At the end of the wharf but on the end near the golden gate. Perfect. And restaurant downstairs is great especially for chowder. The only thing is I think the difference between a deluxe and standard is wether you get a view or not. And you want a view.

review.title: Best bang for the buck
review.reviewText: When I initially booked my vacation to San Fran, I was going to stay at another hotel but due to a last minute change of dates, the other hotel could not accommodate my needs... THAT WAS THE BEST THING THAT COULD HAVE HAPPENED! I saved about 200 bucks AND stayed an extra night! The hotel was amazing all around. Great location near the cable car turn around, fisherman's wharf is right around the corner, Alcatraz is in plain sight and so is the golden gate bridge! Wine parties every night were fun (who wouldn't want free wine???) I have already recommended this hotel to everyone I have spoken to about my trip. Great experience!!!!!!

review.title: We received beyond our expectations. The Argonaut Hotel is exceptionally nice.
review.reviewText: Nice location, good price, nice accomodations. Well in excess of our expectaions. We love the fact that the Hotel accpets pets. We did not have ours but woult have loved to have traveled with our little French Poodle. Just a small gaffe. We were not properly advised of the meaninn of Valet Parking and were surprised at the charge. But it was our fault not to have noticed the board outside the Hotel, with the tariffs. Not a big thing either. The price through Expedia was very acceptable.

review.title: Very confortable Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel y recomended

review.title: Very Nice, Great Location
review.reviewText: Beautiful, clean, walking distance to many attractions.

review.title: Great Stay...Family Friendly
review.reviewText: The stay was excellent from start to finish. The valets and door attendants were friendly and helpful. Check in and out, easy. Good sized room adequate for a family with children. Front desk help was efficient. Discount on parking for hybrid cars! Hotel is very conveniently located. Hyde Street cable car was across the street. Giradelli Square was one block away. A wide variety of restaurants within easy walking distance. I would highly recommend the Argonaut to family and friends!

review.title: Unforgetable Experience
review.reviewText: This was our first time in SF and I am happy that we had this experience with Argonaut Hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to anybody with kids, very kid friendly hotel.

review.title: Great base location to explore San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is based a few minutes walk from pier 39, the hub of San Francisco. There are many places to eat and drink within a lazy walk of the hotel. Rooms, staff and facilities were all we required to ensure a happy holiday stay. Great value for money.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: It was a Wonderful Hotel with very friendly staff. We had a view of Alcatraz and it was a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: ARGONAUT SAN FRANCISCO
review.reviewText: THIS IS MY 5TH STAY AT THIS HOTEL, ALTHOUGH SOME OF THE ROOMS DON'T HAVE A VIEW, THE ROOMS ARE ALYS CLEAN ARE THE STAFF IS ALWAYS MORE THAN HELPFUL!!!! EVERYTHING IS WITHIN AN EASY WALK, AND THE LAST STAY WE HAD UNSEASONABLLY WARM WEATHER SO I COULDN'T HAVE ASKED FOR ANYTHING MORE. IT SEEMS I SEE THE SAME FRIENDLY FACES YEAR AFTER YEAR, AS THE HOTLE STAFF HAS A LOW TURNOVER, AND I HAVE MADE FRIENDS.

review.title: This hotel is Fantastic!
review.reviewText: I was upgraded to a wonderful suite with a fantastic view of the water and Fisherman's wharf. It also had a huge jacuzzi which I used on two occasions during my 5 day stay. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Plus they have a nightly happy hour that is complimentary for guests. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

review.title: Exceeded expectations
review.reviewText: This hotel was very well situated, next to the cable car turnaround, 2 blocks from Ghiradelli Square and within walking distance of Pier 39 and the rest of Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel was beautifully decorated and spotless. The service exceeded expectations. I wanted to get tickets to Alcatraz for the next day and it was too late to go buy them, and we did not bring a computer with us, so I called the concierge. They bought the tickets for me online immediately. Yes, the parking is expensive but actually it was worth it. After a long day driving to Monterey and back on a Saturday we found Fisherman's Wharf jam packed with people and cars. I was afraid of what awaited us when we arrived at the hotel. I pulled up and got "Welcome back, how was your day?" rather than, are you a hotel guest? It was just wonderful service. There is a Starbucks on the same block as the hotel and that made a simple bagel breakfast very easy. My only complaint would be the bed being too firm for me. Other than that, great experience, would highly recommend the Argonaut to anyone.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: met our needs

review.title: The perfect weekend getaway
review.reviewText: The room was spacious, the decor was fun (and funky). We ended up with a room looking on Hyde Street and loved being able to see the cable car turnaround and the view of the bay at dawn. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful when we needed some direction. I would recommend a stay here for anyone wanting to stay in the city at a place that has both wonderful design and great staff.

review.title: Dont' go here.
review.reviewText: Hotel well placed for fishermans wharf which is a tourist trap. And priced accordingly. Hotel charges $39 p/d for car parking! Room overly nautical and quite dirty (overhead beams thick dust). Bath water no more than tepid despite complaint. Staff - esp tipping personnel - very friendly and efficiient. Poor location to discover San Francisco from. If fly drive pick up car after San Francisco as much less hassle parking etc.

review.title: Great location! Will definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: Great location for exploring the Wharf area with easy access to public transit. I would avoid having a rental car unless your plans are to get away from the city.

review.title: Excellent experience
review.reviewText: We loved everything about this hotel! The room was spacious, the bed was exceptionally comfortable, the staff was friendly and it was close to so many great things. You can spend time walking down Jefferson avenue and around fisherman's wharf or walk around the corner to the trolley and take the trolley car wherever you need to go. First rate. Loved it!

review.title: Great Hotel!!
review.reviewText: We loved everything about the hotel and their staff, and would definitely go back again. The only complaint we had was the noise from the people above us, so next time we would try to get the top floor. The view of alcatraz was wonderful, the decor was fun, the staff was very, very good and we liked the restaurant inside the hotel. All this helped to make the trip wonderful!!!

review.title: A GREAT GETAWAY
review.reviewText: VERY CLEAN AND FRIENDLY HOTEL, NOT AN INEXPENSIVE PLACE TO EAT THOUGH, BUT THE FOOD WAS VERY GOOD. HOTEL LOCATION WAS PERFECT.

review.title: Great locatiion
review.reviewText: I had a "special birthday" in San Francisco and the Hotel Argonaut is in a great location close to the sea front. I loved the wine evenings where all the guests would gather in the lounge between 17.00 - 18.00 for free wine and the guests mixed with one another. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: The entire family loved the hotel and location.
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasant visit to San Francisco...the Hotel added a lot to our experience. The location was perfect, staff friendly and room very comfortable.

review.title: Very Nice Stay
review.reviewText: My husband & I take approx 3 vacations a year, and I pride myself on finding a good deal - yet I refuse to budge on quality to do so. The Argonaut did not force us to choose between the two. We were in San Francisco for 5 days and enjoyed our hotel stay. The rooms were very clean. The throw pillows (a star shaped one on the bed and a round one on the chaise lounge) could use a wash, but I just threw those to the side. Service was excellent - from the doorman to the front desk agent - all were warm and friendly at every interaction. The location is not the prime spot and leaves a little to be desired, but it is pretty convenient to many San Francisco attractions. You'll see from the pics and Expedia description that the Argonaut is unique. My heart tends to be fond of the more luxurious accommodations, but the Argonaut was a great choice for the price we paid.

review.title: Worth the commute to downtown
review.reviewText: I stay here every year for a conference at the Moscone Center. While it's a 20-minute bus ride to downtown, I don't mind because I get to stay within sight of the water and a bunch of great restaurants, my room is clean and quiet, and the hotel staff are great. I also like being within walking distance of everything at Fisherman's Wharf while still just a bit outside of it. Yes, it's a touristy area, but the reaction I get whenever someone drops me off is, "Wow, that's a really nice hotel. I had no idea it was up here."

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Will not recommend this hotel to others. Its very loud, their staff is unfriendly, parking alone is $35/day. Great location, but the hotel experience was disappointing.

review.title: Beautiful-very nice
review.reviewText: this was a very nice motel and we will use you on our next trip to san francisco

review.title: Great hotel but a surprise upon arrival didn't have me thrilled
review.reviewText: Almost everything was great. Beautiful hotel, clean, close to transportation and the Wharf, polite staff.. The one thing that really did make me angry was their requirement upon arrival of a $500 deposit at check-in to cover amenities. I didn't see any mention of this when making the reservations. I had a problem with Citibank with transferring money to my credit card account, and had I not had another valid credit card, I would have been stuck with my new bride at 12 midnight 2000 miles away from home with nowhere to go. This was extremely NOT COOL. After paying thousands of dollars for a wedding and honeymoon it's not cool to surprise guests with extra fees.

review.title: Room with a View
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a phenomenal hotel right on Fisherman's Wharf. Our room had the cable car turn around right across the street, the bay just beyond that, and the golden gate bridge in the background...picture perfect. The staff (with the exception of one unfriendly bellhop) where most helpful, and comical in many respects. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to experience San Francisco!

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: We are going back. I highly recommend this hotel. The staff was very friendly. The hotel is very nautical. The wine tasting each night just topped it off. It is a good way to talk to other vacationers and find out the best places to go. They made us feel like family.

review.title: Ideal location
review.reviewText: This hotel is an ideal location if you plan on seeing the cites within San Francisco. The Hyde Street cable car and 2 blocks from the historic street cars. The hotel staff were excellent. When we needed a cab to the airport for 5am, they not only arranged it, but told us the cab driver's name. He knew ours as well. So, when we walked out of the hotel, we were greeted by name at 4:45 am. Great thing, since there was more than one cab waiting. Would recommend to anyone in a heartbeat.

review.title: Great hotel Great location
review.reviewText: I stayed here for four nights with my daughter and we truly enjoyed everything. The service was excellent, everyone was nice and helpful. The beds were heavenly and rooms quiet. Location was wonderful. Blue Mermaid restaurant was excellent and located at hotel. Would stay again anytime. Thanks for the great service and hospitality.

review.title: Kimpton does it right!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is in a perfect location for exploring the Fisherman's Wharf area of San Francisco. We could walk to everything from the cable car turnaround to Ghiradelli Square to the many restaurants in the area. The building also houses the San Francisco Maritime Museum and is across to street from their collection of historic ships. The staff at the Argonaut is friendly and helpful and the housekeeping staff was great!

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Good location - walkable to many sights. Too many tourist restaurants on location but can easily walk to affordable places.

review.title: Great hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: Loved the wine hour. great oppurtunity to meet other guests.

review.title: Great San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: We just spent two weeks at the Argonaut and had a wonderful time. The hotel is in a great location right on Fisherman's Wharf with the cable car just around the corner. We had a room overlooking the Cannery, and were very happy with it. It was slightly noisy on weekends, not enough to bother, and mainly during the day when you're not in the room anyway. The staff were always friendly and helpful, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. My only complaint is that the hot water frequently wasn't - hot, that is. The only times we had a really hot shower was on the mornings we were up very early - before 7am - and there were several days when the water was barely lukewarm. However, overall, this was a terrific hotel to stay at, and I'd stay there again. And the free wine tasting every evening was a particularly good feature!

review.title: Excellent Location for Sight-seeing
review.reviewText: This was our third time in as many years to visit San Francisco and we decided to stay in the Fisherman's Warf Area for a change of pace. The location was exceptional. Our "room with a view" overlooked the turn-around for the Powell-Hyde" cable car line with the Golden gate Bridge in the distance. The staff was friendly and very effecient for any and all requests. Our room was clean and large. The only bump in our stay was having to listen to a couple who were having a verbal altercation that lasted for over an hour one night. The hotel had to send for the police before they would stop.

review.title: A great place to stay!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. The front desk people were extremely helpful. Everyone was very friendly. It's a perfect place if you want to be right on the waterfront. The cable car terminal (which was very busy)was right across the street. But the bus and street cars were very easy to access from nearby streets. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. We have no complaints about this hotel.

review.title: Fantastic, Friendly, Phenomenal!!!
review.reviewText: Superior service, incredible location. I would recomend a room with the bay view-it is worth the extra money. When we travel back to SF this is where we will stay!!

review.title: Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: The Argonaut hotel was in a convenient location on Fisherman's Wharf next to the trolley car line. Our hotel room was extremely comfortable and clean and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. I would highly recommend this hotel to others!

review.title: The Argonaut Hotel
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. It was a perfect location! The restaraunt that was in the hotel, Blue Mermaid, was fantastic!

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the hotel was clean and welcoming, the best we stayed in whilst away

review.title: Great Hotel, great ubication
review.reviewText: It is a wonderful place near Fisherman's Warf, Pier 39, Girardelli Square and close enough to Pier 33, the place where ships to Alcatraz depart. It also has a very good restaurant.

review.title: I left my heart in San Francisco.......
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel and fantastic location. I would highly recommend this hotel to all travel and lifestyle types. I could not have been happier with the accommodations--especially the hosted wine reception...a great place and time to unwind from a busy touring day. Will definitely stay at this hotel again when in San Fran! Unquestionably one of the very best.

review.title: Nice location and staff. Very clean.
review.reviewText: Within short walking distance of many restaurants and tourist spots. Very friendly and helpful staff. The room and hotel were extremely clean.

review.title: Hope there is an Argonaut at my next destination.
review.reviewText: Its close to everything, just hop on a cable car.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: we were in a room on the second floor across the street from the hyde street cable car turnaround, if we opened our window we could hear all of that activity + the neat sound of the cable car bells. when you closed the window you couldn't hear anything outside. when you looked out the window you could see the golden gate bridge in the distance . it was a great view.

review.title: I will return but without my dog.
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and the location is perfect. Walking distance to everything. The one big problem I had was that I brought my dog with me which shouldn't have been an issue since it is a pet friendly hotel. The problem was you can hear everything. People walking outside, the halls, sneezing next door, music playing outdoors and with a pet its very difficult to leave him in the room even for a couple of hours when there is so much noise. He was barking constantly and I felt it was best to check out early.

review.title: We'll definitely go back!
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for us. It was quiet, comfortable, and it had a great location and friendly staff.

review.title: Argonaut - Spring Break 2009
review.reviewText: My family loved the Argonaut. We had a double queen room w/view of Golden Gate Brigde. While the room was narrow, there was enough room for my husband and 2 kids (11 & 13). The location was perfect, right across the street from the cable cars and Ghiradelli Square. I'm very picky about cleaniness, especially in bathrooms and I was very pleased. Our bathroom was very clean - no mold or dirt anywhere. My only complaint would be that the queen beds were not the standard size queen. I was concerned because my enitre family is very tall. However it all worked out and we were comfortable. I would definitely stay at the Argonaut again. However, if I was planing on a spa visit, I'd choose one of the larger hotels in Union Square. THe Argonaut only offers in-room spa services.

review.title: Novelty style, fun for first time visiting San Francisco, but very expensive and overrated
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Argonaut Hotel during the last week of February 09 for a family vacation. My boys, ages 8 & 11, wanted to see the Golden Gate Bridge. We booked a queen/queen room with a view of the bridge. Unfortunately, it's quite some distance away, and we couldn't even see it sometimes because of the fog. The room was small-not enough tables or surfaces, & the 4 of us stumbled all over each other the whole time. The bathroom doesn't even lock--it just has a pocket door, & there's no exhaust fan in there, either. The shower was great, though, so that's a plus. Be prepared to leave the hotel if you want to get any food for even a halfway reasonable price. The staff is nice enough & willing to direct you elsewhere to get less expensive meals than what they offer there. The location wasn't as convenient to the amenities of Fisherman's Wharf as I had hoped, either. Everything we wanted to do was several blocks away, further down Jefferson Street and closer to Pier 39, for example. Getting to the pier for Alcatraz Cruises was an exceptionally long haul. If I had it to do all over again, I would spend my money on a better location & food rather than all this novelty & hype.

review.title: A Rare Jem in the City
review.reviewText: Amzaing service, excellent staff, and one of the best experiences at a hotel. I was traveling wth a pet and this hotel understands how to accomadate you and your pet.

review.title: AWESOME HOTEL!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was sooo cool! The decor was awesome and every evening at 5 o'clock there was wine tasting in the lobby.

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent location, very large comfortable room, great view but, above all, very friendly, helpful staff on reception and door. Appreciated the little extras (free wi-fi, cheap local calls etc) and general lack of rip-off

review.title: Nice historical spot to stay in San Fran
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel with decent friendly service. As a cannery-turned hotel, the Argonaut Hotel has a truly historic ambiance. The rooms are Kimpton-styled with a nautical theme and comfy linens atop good firm mattresses. The rooms are kept spotless daily. It was nice to come in after a long day of touring to enjoy a glass or two of local wines at 5pm daily in the lobby. The staff did not always follow up on telephone requests which I attributed to being busy with 2 weddings during our stay. I called 3 times for a stronger hair dryer and for a complimentary sewing kit- both of which were never delivered to our room. Luckily, I was able to find the sewing kit stashed in the mini-bar. If you're counting on reliable Wi-Fi access, beware: The hotel has thick brick walls which may affect your connection (this is what the desk staff told us when we reported that we literally had to stand with our hand out the window to get a decent Wi-Fi connection... As a result, they took care of our mini-bar tab... nice indeed!)

review.title: Loved It Best Location
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were teffific,right at your finger tips,and the daily wine tastings for happy hour was a nice treat.The rooms were immaculate,couln't ask for more!

review.title: San Francisco Argonaut - a great find
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Fort Mason, just a short walk away, and the excellent room rate. The Argonaut is in the middle of the crowds at Fisherman's Wharf, but once you enter the lobby it is calm and relaxing. The hotel building is a completely renovated warehouse. The rooms and service are excellent. The hotel's restaurant is quite good. The hotel also houses the Maritime National Historic Park visitor center, just off the entryway. Nice touch: Daily 5 pm wine tasting in the lobby.

review.title: Ideal, great value for money
review.reviewText: This hotel is top class, great value for money and superbly located. Can't wait to go back

review.title: Best place to stay
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel, staff was great, close to everything near Fisherman's Wharf, transit is right across the street. 5:00pm wine sampleing in the main lobby gives you a great chance to meet new people from all over the world. Hats off to the Argonaut and their staff.

review.title: Excellent Stay - highly recommended!
review.reviewText: Amazing service from the second we stepped out of our cab from the airport. We arrived in the rain and were offered umbrellas upon leaving the hotel to go walking, we were offered a glass of wine (arrived during the wine host hour in our lobby) before we were even checked in. Beautiful rooms, quiet, clean and great service! Great location - at the "edge" of the hub of the wharf, but walking distance to restaurants, shopping, Pier 39, Alcatraz tours, etc.

review.title: Fabulous Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic time in San Francisco. The Argonaut was a wonderful place to stay, being right in the middle of Fisherman's wharf we were able to walk to most venues we wished to go to. The staff went out of their way to help us with directions and suggestions. They made our stay a memorable one.

review.title: Great Place!
review.reviewText: My wife and I celebrated our wedding anniversary in San Francisco, we were completely impressed with the hotel. Great Location, great rooms, and the staff is friendly and helpful. They also offer complimentary wine tasting every evening from 5-6pm.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: For this level of hotel in a tourist area of a major city we feel that it was a very good value. Our family rented three rooms and all were very clean, wireless access was a plus, beds were comfortable. Only issue was space in the rooms so we met in the lobby to sit and talk.

review.title: Great for families!
review.reviewText: What a great location,family friendly and near everything on Fishermans Wharf. Very good restaurant attached to the hotel. Staff was very friendly,professional and accomodating.We will be back.

review.title: Exceeded Expectations
review.reviewText: Visited S.F with my 12 y/o daughter for her B-day. Compared to other hotels I've stayed in S.F the Argonaut is by far the most impressive. The staff were friendly and eager to help. The location is perfect and within walking distance to all. The decor is great. You will not regret choosing to stay here.

review.title: The best hotel on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: What a lovely hotel. Expedia had a great special for winter on this hotel and even so, they granted my cheeky request for a room with a view of the bay. The hotel itself is gorgeous - a great foyer with an open fire, fabulous clean, bright spacious rooms with quirky nautical fittings and a free wine reception every evening. We felt the envy of all the tourists passing by the hotel every day and looking in. If you want to stay on the Wharf do not look any further.

review.title: Argonaut Hotel Fishermans Wharf San francisco
review.reviewText: Stayed here Feb 09. As someone who spends most of my working week in Hotels, it is nice to be able to say that this Hotel was probably better and more comfortable than most I stay in on business and for at least 20% less in price. My only criticism was that the restaurant next door the hotel uses for breakfast is incredibly expensive, so would suggest using the diner 300 yards down on the right which is just as good and half the price. The wine tatsing each evening was a real hit with everyone, and was a good way of chatting with fellow Visitors.

review.title: Maritime Charm On The Wharf
review.reviewText: Every detail is exquisite in this historical S.F. hotel, from the comfy deck chairs in the lobby to lounge in while sipping delicious complimentary wines, (a different vineyard monthly!) to the colorful Naval themed rooms with sea glass ornaments in the hallway. You will feel pampered and delighted and wishing to book your next trip here as soon as you can!

review.title: Great Hotel by the Bay
review.reviewText: My husband and I celebrated our 10 year wedding anniversary in San Francisco and stayed at the Argonaut. Rooms were great, we were especially pleased with the view from our window. It was great waking up to a view of the Golden Gate bridge and the sound of the trolly car. The hotel staff was great and very helpful. We had a fabulous time!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Great location, very comfortable rooms, would certainly use them again

review.title: Exquisite!
review.reviewText: This was a great experience. Location was ideal, room was perfec, and the restaurant and bar met our needs. We will come back again.

review.title: Good Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice, up to all expectations!

review.title: Mixed feelings
review.reviewText: I love Kimpton hotels, usually. This one is in a cheesy tourist area but part of the historic cannery. Soundproof, amazingly, with the usual perfect room: wonderful beds, bathrooms, good paper in the morning, lovely shampoos, etc. Downsides: not a good restaurant attached to this hotel; staff is not super-friendly, from the busy front-desk area to the bellhops nickel-and-diming you to death. We waited 30 minutes to get a taxi the night we stayed (pouring rain), and next morning got up early to walk and asked to borrow one of the dozens of umbrellas people had left outside. I had to get permission from the head guy, who told us to go back to the front desk and give them my room number. Already in a hurry, we said skip it and ended up getting drenched.

review.title: Been there several times. Always excellent.
review.reviewText: Excellent.

review.title: Another Great Visit
review.reviewText: This was our second visit to this hotel and we will definetly be back. The staff is extremely freindly and helpful, always willing to give advice or directions for restaraunts or attractions. The rooms are extremely clean and comfortable,with the Blue Mermaid offering a great retreat.

review.title: very good
review.reviewText: I am very content with this hotel, great beds

review.title: Fantastic stay at the Argonaut
review.reviewText: Our family loved this hotel; everything from the service, the location, the rooms, everything was great. The service started with the doorman and continued through to the front desk. Everyone was very friendly, helpful and courteous. We were continually greeted in a friendly manner. The room itself was just like the pictures on the website; we had a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge and Ghirardelli Square. The hotel is beside the Market and Powell street cable car turnaround so, of course, you can jump on the cable cars right there. A short walk puts you in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf and further down is Pier 39. The restaurant food was very good - a little pricey but there are tons of restaurants within walking distance. The entire hotel was very clean and quite lovely!

review.title: Long Weekend in SF
review.reviewText: Great location. Easy access to public transportation. Very fine accomodations and service. Warn and cozy.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Argonaut. The rooms were comfortable, and the hotel is in a great location. There is a museum in the hotel, a Starbucks in the building (around the corner and up the hill from the entrance), and the Cable Car stop is across the street. You are very close to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Whar

review.title: great hotel, service , location
review.reviewText: great hotel in a great location. Staff were very helpful

review.title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY
review.reviewText: The hotel is wonderful. Service could not have been friendlier or more efficient. Free wine tasting everyday is a nice perk. Great location on Fisherman's Warf. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Location & Chowder!
review.reviewText: Although Fishermans Wharf is the tacky side of this great city the Hotel has a great location right at the end next to Hyde St Pier so not only is it quiet, but you get to head out of the busy centre and be surrounded by fresh air. The rooms are much bigger than most and extremely comfortable. The chowder house serves amazing crab and sweetcorn chowder and has a great Happy Hour. Only downside was the poor service from reception and concierge. If you want anything done or advice as the doorman- you will get more help. The concierge was the rudest man ever met in a hotel!

review.title: Good Stay But Service Levels Lacking
review.reviewText: I enjoyed our recently stay at the Argonaut, which is conveniently located beside Fisherman's Wharf and commands unbeatable views of the Bay and the Golden Gate Bridge. The hotel is well-maintained and its facilities user-friendly. The deluxe King room I got was very large - so large that they could have put a round table in the middle just to make it seem less empty. Despite the hotel's charm, I was disappointed at the level of service I received. When I checked-in at 2:30pm, I was told by a very rude and unhelpful receptionist, Artel, that our room was not ready and we could leave our bags with the hotel and come back half an hour later. When I enquired whether other rooms were available, his response was: "you just have to come back later." I find this level of service entirely unacceptable. I'm disappointed at the lack of professionalism exhibited by this front desk staff at this hotel. I had a great time talking to bellmen, and even the ever-so-helpful doorman. I hope the hotel management will take a serious look at these concerns as the great reputation of this hotel is at stake.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Can't wait to go back

review.title: Great Hotel to Stay At
review.reviewText: This hotel was very clean and polite. The restaurant attached had one of the best clam chowders I've ever had. Service was excellent in restaurant and hotel. The best thing about this hotel, other than general comfort, was the location. Just at the end of the tourist strip, easy walking to sites or transportation.

review.title: Always my favorite place to stay
review.reviewText: I love the Argonaut because of its convenient location and relative ease to get to. The staff is wonderful and helpful without being obnoxious.

review.title: Enjoyed the stay
review.reviewText: Good location. Superb view from room. Restaurant in hotel casual and relaxed with very good food both at breakfast and dinner.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Very clean and quiet with lots of choices for eating close by. Cable car to downtown 1 block away or 2 blocks to the tram which also takes you downtown where you can connect with the BART for the airport. Taxi to downtown varied between $10-15 with tip. $50 for a taxi from the airport to the hotel. Highly recommend the free walking tours offered by the museum next door - we did the historical one on our last day and wished that we had done it on arrival as we found things that we hadn't done:-( The park ranger was very knowledgeable about not only the Fisherman's Wharf area but lots of info on the city.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Nice quiet hotel at the end of Fishermans wharf,close to cable cars,ghiradelli square,you can rent bikes right out front and ride over the Golden Gate bridge and into Sausalito and then jump on the ferry back.Alkatraz tour is a must..Great audio tour!Clam chowder at the restaurant attached to the Arganaut.."Blue Mermaid" is excellant!! Overall..had a great time..lots to see and do!

review.title: Great place, Great Location
review.reviewText: Our family enjoyed ever aspect of our stay at the Argonaut. The location was superb; Waterfront on the Fisherman's Warf. A Cable Car stop was next to the hotel. Street cars about 2 blocks down the road. Its at the far end of the Fisherman's warf area, allowing you to easily escape from the commercial area to parks and waterfront walks. Easy access to any number of restaurants. There was a daily generous happy hour in the lobby. The room was spacious and very comfortable. No car was needed during our 5 day stay. I can't fault the place.

review.title: Highly recommended hotel in fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: I really love this hotel.staff are very friendly.hotel close to many shops and restaurants. doube room is big and we had good king size bed.bathroom is big and really well presented.I particularly like the starbucks coffee as well.So far this is my best hotel I've stayed of all my holidays.Money is worth.hotel is near the cable car as well and is easy to go to union square.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: We loved staying in this hotel. The weather was awful on the first two days of our trip but we didn't mind as it meant we spent time in our lovely room in this wonderful hotel. The staff were helpful and obliging but not condescending. The rooms are well appointed, comfortable and clean - we'd definately go back or use another Kimpton Hotel if staying in a different city.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is all about location. Can't say anything bad about it, but you won't spend time in the hotel room. If you do, why would pay to be at the wharf?

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient location, excellent service and free wine tasting session every day.

review.title: Loved this hotel.
review.reviewText: Can't wait to go back.

review.title: Unique construction
review.reviewText: Very attractive, convenient location, friendly helpful service. Old brick exterior, (a cannery) modern interior

review.title: Fabulous Hotel...... Great location
review.reviewText: Super comfy beds, nice linens and towels.Cute robes. Great location. Minibar offers organic drinks and organic snacks at a resonable price.Hotel offers free wine or sparkling cider from 5pm -6pm.

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: Arriving at this hotel after a horrendous flight from London was an absolute pleasure. The room was extremely comfortable and the staff were attentive and friendly. Highly recommend.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: What a fantastic hotel. Great location. Right round the corner from the cable car turn around on Hyde St. Staff were so friendly, especially the door staff. Rooms were so spacious and very clean. Complimentary paper each morning which is a nice touch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I think you would struggle to find anywhere better to stay.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION, GREAT HOTEL, GREAT VALUE
review.reviewText: We and our two adult children loved this hotel! It was super convenient to our dinner date at Pier 29, plus a short walk to all the SF sights. The staff were friendly, helpful and attentive; the rooms well appointed, the beds excellent. Even the lobby was great--a fire burning, classy furniture, lovely lighting--we stayed after checkout just to enjoy the lobby. The hotel, with a nautical motif and located in a former cannery, had lots of historic appeal too. The value was excellent--an incredible deal for any lodging in San Francisco, and for such a wonderful hotel in a great location--truly extraordinary. Good breakfast options--a Denny's was a short walk away, and the staff actually walked with us to assure we arrived!

review.title: Not impressed!
review.reviewText: We arrived around 10:30 am and found out that the room was already available. However, the "doorman", who was nice seemed to be in a hurry to get our luggages and check us in. We also found out that we need to pay for an overnight parking fee! The lady at the desk seemed to be a "robot" who started talking using her usual "spiel" and handed us our room keys; we did not understand a single word she said! The room was clean, cozy but not really impressive. There was also no internet cable hooked up in our room. In summary, the location was good but the services were not impressive for the price we paid. The only good thing was the "free alcohol" at 5 PM which they provided as a courtesy to their guests. But that's it.

review.title: Always pleasant
review.reviewText: This was our 2nd time stay at Argonaut. Simply pleasant. They upgraded us and put us into a larger room. The only complaint I might mention is that I could hear the guests above us walking around all the time... Perfect location to catch a cable car first thing in the morning (right next door) to avoid crowds. We will back very soon!

review.title: The Argonaut Hotel is where I'd stay every time. I recommend it Completely
review.reviewText: At the heart of everything! The staff was extremely helpful. The hotel was everything it should be for a comfortable stay plus everything you wouldn't expect. Wine tasting every evening. And the local pub in the same magnificant building was a great stop before bed. The water is directly across the street. The restaurants are on the same strip. The trolly is around the corner. Loved it, loved it, loved it!

review.title: Nice hotel at a nice location
review.reviewText: Hotel was very lovely, at a nice location. Public transformation is easily available. Can't wait to go back!!!

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a wonderful location close to everything we wanted to see. The hotel looked just like the pictures. The beds were soft and a dream to sleep on. One of the cleanest hotels I've been in. But, if you want good service you might need to go elsewhere. Example...upon arrival 3 doorman where outside standing and talking..we were not greeted or asked if we needed any help with luggage..room service would not answer phone...front desk helpful but with attitude.

review.title: I liked it !
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay, very nice staff, in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: A Plus
review.reviewText: Very attentive and personal service. Nice room. Good location.

review.title: affordable boutique hotel option
review.reviewText: If you want to stay in a nice place but can't afford those fancy upscale hotels, the Argonaut is a happy medium. It's affordable and well kept for the price plus there's that free wine reception. Awesome? I think so. It's extremely centrally located to the wharf and all the stuff "to-do" in san francisco. It's conveniently located next to major bus lines and rail car routes and it's near one of the trolley car turn-around spots. it's just an overall awesome spot. the only thing that sucked was the view of the interior of the building..oh well, can't win them all

review.title: We stayed at the Argonaut from 15 to 22 December 2008 and had a fabulous time.
review.reviewText: On arrival at the hotel our luggage had been delayed in Paris so the hotel very kindly upgraded our room. All of the staff were helpful and very friendly and made our holiday very special. We really enjoyed the wine reception each evening and as a result met some really interesting people. This was our fourth holiday in San Francsco but it was the first time that we had stayed at the Argonaut, we will definitely be staying here again in the future.

review.title: INTERESTING
review.reviewText: Interesting architecture, redesigned from one of the old cannery bldgs, and having elements such as original beams running through the rooms.

review.title: Loved the Argonaut
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with great location in Fishermans Wharf. The hotel used to be a Del Monte cannery and Kinston has done a nice job of making it into a cozy hotel with a nostalgic feel. Staff was very friendly and accomdating. The hotel accidently packed one piece of our luggage into another customers car but after the hotel realized the error they corrected the problem and we had our bag back before the next morning.

review.title: Perfect Location for First Time Visitor
review.reviewText: I hesitate to give this place a great review because the next time I go back to San Francisco, the price will be jacked way up. the Location is perfect, Fisherman's Wharf is on your right side and Ghiradelli Square is on your left. it is very convenient to trolleys and buses. There is a wells fargo 1 block away, and more importantly, it is within walking distance to In-N-Out Burger.

review.title: Amazing Hotel, Amazing Location
review.reviewText: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The rooms were of exceptional quality, and the staff was very friendly (from what I hear, this is a rarity in San Francisco). The hotel is right across the street from the waterfront, within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, The Cannery, Ghirardelli Square, Cable Cars, and plenty more. Stunning views of the Golden Gate Bridge, and Alcatraz. It is also an easy walk to the streetcars that take you right downtown. The walls were a bit thin, and we could hear our neighbors at times, but this didn't bother us one bit. Overall, if you are looking to do the tourist thing in San Francisco, you couldn't ask for a more ideal location, with a more fun atmosphere.

review.title: Charming maritime-themed hotel
review.reviewText: Good service and charming maritime-theme makes this a recommended hotel at Fisherman's Wharf. The daily treasure-box trinket toy pick, and free wine-tasting in the evenings are an added bonuses, catering to both kids and adults alike. Caution - not all room sizes are acceptable. Initially we were put in a claustrophobic less-than-queen bedded room by the fire exit. Fortunately, the hotel made it up to us by putting us up in a decent-sized twin-bedded room for the rest of our stay.

review.title: Our stay at Argonaut
review.reviewText: This recommended hotel for our stay in SF was the best stay in SF we've had. From the welcome to the departure everyone was warm and friendly. We can't wait to return.

review.title: Great option for affordable class and location!
review.reviewText: Excellent service at this hotel - it was our second stay there and we would go back again. There was only one person that was less than pleasant at check in, but everyone else was fabulous. The rooms are worth upgrading, the standard rooms are somewhat small. Everything was very clean. A good value and the restaurant has a wonderful breakfast menu. Walking distance to just about everything on the Wharf.

review.title: Great location for exploring San Francisco wharf area
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our one-night stay at the Argonaut Hotel. The room was small, but for one night, it was fine. Hotel location was very good for walking around the wharf. Valet parking was expensive, but this was expected. We would stay here again based on this experience.

review.title: Great non-chain atmosphere
review.reviewText: Incredible non-chain atmosphere with all of the amenities of a nice chain (i.e., Hyatt). It is right on the water and right next to the chaos of Fisherman's Wharf without a completely touristy feel. The best part was the service. The rooms are comfortable and clean, but not as nice as rooms at places like the Westin. I would stay there again.

review.title: Would return
review.reviewText: Hotel is very convenient to Fishermans wharf. Restaurants close by, Starbucks around the corner. Room very comfortable, we had a view of Alatraz from our window.

review.title: Enjoyable Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were very pleasant and helpful. The location was excellent. The decorating was creative and fun.

review.title: On the Wharf in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The location was wonderful. The Argonaut was right at the end of the wharf next to Ghiradelli square. The hotel was wonderfully decorated in a nautical theme that my three year old son loved. The wine hour in the lobby is a nice touch after a long day of sightseeing, it's too bad they do not have nearly enough space in the lobby to accomodate everyone looking for a free glass of vino. The rooms were spacious, comfortable, and clean. The staff, from the doormen and porters to housekeeping and the adjacent restaurant, Blue Mermaid, were friendly and helpful. The only issue we had was from the front desk area, where they seemed to have a bit of arrogance about themselves and their position. Otherwise, we had a wonderful trip.

review.title: Nautical-themed Hotel in the middle of everything!
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, nice rooms, great location...Blue Mermaid Restaurant on premises is convienent but average.....walk one block to get a great Irish Coffee at the Buena Vista

review.title: Excellent hotel at this price
review.reviewText: Thanks Expediate!!

review.title: What a gem
review.reviewText: What a great hotel in an excellent location. The rooms are bright and well appointed. We had the courtyard view and I think that was much quieter that anything with an ocean view i.e street side. It was so close to so many fantastic restaurants, and the kids loved getting treasure from the treasure chest. The complimentary wine in the evening was a treat too. The A/C was a little warm but we opened the window for some fresh bay air.

review.title: we will be pleased to return to the Hotel.
review.reviewText: the location is perfect for tourist. close to all kind of transportation. fishman wharf is very pleasant for walking around.

review.title: I always look forward to going back to San Francisco, and staying atht e Argonaut is like the icing
review.reviewText: The rooms are spacious, quiet and comfortable. The New York Times delivery every morning is a welcome change from other hotels and USA Today.

review.title: Short, but excellent stay
review.reviewText: I arrived at 9:00am from an early flight. Check in is 3pm. No problem! They put me immediately in a room. Staff is helpful, courteous, and extremely professional. Would definitely go back.

review.title: Big rooms with brick walls but parking is insane. $39/day for valet
review.reviewText: Nice hotel located in Fishermans wharff. Very nice soap and shampoo but too much for parking! Also the meter's are by the hour which is a hasstle and the parking officers give you multiple tickets frequently.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Our room was not overly large, but certainly adequate. The bathroom was great and the shower was wonderful. We loved the location and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely return to the Argonaut.

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was a great place to stay during our first visit in San Francisco. Its central location at Fishermans Wharf helps to explore the whole area.

review.title: Still First Class, but in danger of slipping
review.reviewText: Second time we stayed in Argonaut through Thanksgiving weekend. Same exceptionally clean hotel room (especially bathroom - completely spotless). Rest of hotel great, just like last time. Seemed like less staff on hand this time though, and while I can't exactly put my finger on what was different this time, the level of attentiveness shown was not as sharp as last time by those who were there. We spoke with other guests (first timers) who were very pleased with the Argonaut. Don't get me wrong, this is still a superb hotel, and combined with the location is really a fantastic bargain for those visiting San Fran. They just need to focus on maintaining their edge.

review.title: Excellent service
review.reviewText: We were well cared for by the excellent staff of this hotel. Location was just what we wanted for our extended stay. The nightly wine reception provided a unique social opportunity to meet a few interesting people from many places whom we'd never have met otherwise. We would be happy to return to this hotel again.

review.title: Great location for tourists
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is in a great location for tourists, on Fisherman's Wharf and close to the cable car and trolley lines. The hotel is updated in a nautical decor. However, the walls are paper thin, and the rooms narrow. We could hear the people in the next room. Plus, our bed was not anchored. When two of us sat on the end of the bed, it would fly up at the headboard. They placed us in a room next to the maid station, so the noise started early in the morning. We could even hear the elevator bell ringing. If I were to return to San Fran as a tourist, I would stay at the Argonaut again, but I would not pay a significant premium for it. Or I would insist on an exterior room that has a view and window that opens. Interior rooms have a view of a conrete roof, and you have to keep your windows blinds closed so that others cannot see you in your room. For people with children or swimmers, there is no pool.

review.title: We loved the hotel Beautiful atmosphere Restaurant was great for breakfast
review.reviewText: We would highly recommend this hotel. Also Dog friendly. Lovely Nautical theme and a great restaurant attached. Great area also at Fishmans away from the hustle bustle. We will go back

review.title: Great hotel, close to everything
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Argonaut for his 50th birthday. Wonderful hotel, great atmpsophere and location. Will recommend this hotel to everyone.

review.title: My Favorite Hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: We had such a wonderful time. The location was amazing. Easy walks to everywhere we wanted to go. The Maritime Museum was closed for renovations, but there is a little museum in the hotel lobby that was very impressive. Any one who loves history would love this hotel. Our room had a view of the cannery courtyard. It was great to be able to open the window and smell the fresh air. We can not wait to go back!

review.title: Great Hotel, in a great spot near Ghiradelli and Wharf
review.reviewText: Unique nautical themed hotel in a terrific spot. I would revist this hotel due to it's location, service and amenities mentioned already.

review.title: wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: it is a wonderful hotel in fishermen's wharf! the decoration is so fantastic, i like those rooms with stars and moon!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Appearance, service, location excellent. Staff great! Would highly recommend!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is located just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the warf. It is also located right next door to the Trolley cars. We did the double decker bus and their was a stop right behind our hotel. Lots to do within walking distance. Not only the location but the cleanliness of this hotel makes it a perfect stay for anyone.

review.title: Great Location - Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We were very fortunate to book the Argonaut Hotel at Fisherman's Wharf. Having traveled to Napa/St. Helena for a food conference my Father-in-law and myself returned to have a culinary tour of San Francisco. San Fran has great food (as does Chicago, where we are from) and the Argonaut was a great hotel to use as a Base. From thoughtful concierge service, great decor, and amazingly comfortable beds(I actually lifted the bedsheets to see who manufactures the bed!), our entire 3 day stay was a joy in every respect. The proximity to Fisherman's wharf lends itself to great walking tours, but you can also elect to take a boat or bike tour that starts a few blocks from the hotel.

review.title: will definitely be back
review.reviewText: usually stay in Union square, this time decided to try Fisherman's. This was a great hotel at a great location. loved it!!

review.title: A hidden Gem
review.reviewText: We spent our first 5 days ever in San Francisco and I am very happy to have found the Argonaut, right in the heart of the WHARF and very close to a trolley line as well as bus connections so it was very easy to get around the city. We had a great quiet room on the second floor overlooking the courtyard towards the Cannary. In the evening you had some music from a bar downstairs, but it didn't really matter too much. There are many options for B-fast and dinner all around, so I wouldn't recommend doing this at the hotel. The doormen were extremely friendly and helpful, while the reception staff was just average. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

review.title: Hidden Gem
review.reviewText: The hotel's appearance from the exterior is far too modest for its stunning interior. Beautifully decorated inside, fantastic wine service every evening and pleasant, helpful staff to assist at any time. Rooms were spacious and extremely comfortable and clean. Only hotel we could find that had 2 queen beds on Fisherman's wharf. Fantastic location! Would highly recommend it to anyone wanting a comfortable, convenient home -way-from-home.

review.title: Very happy with stay
review.reviewText: We had a very enjoyable stay in a very pleasant hotel. The staff were always curteous and helpfull. Lots of good quaity restaurants nearby with all the attractions of the wharf. The cable car terminus right next to the hotel made travel around the city very easy indeed.

review.title: Great Location and Service
review.reviewText: Best location on the Wharf Staff are all very friendly and helpful The Hotel has a wonderful atmosphere The wine tasting every night is a great opportunity to meet other travellers.

review.title: Best in the Wharf
review.reviewText: I have stayed at Argonaut Hotel on a previous trip and they never fail to impress. The hotel staff is very friendly, and if you're there on a longer stay, they tend to remember you. The maintenance staff was excellent, and prompt. We had a problem with the bedside lights and they sent a repair man immediately to fix it. They were very fast, efficient, and friendly. He carried on great and funny conversations with us while repairing the lights, while making suggestions for things to do on our trip. The hotel restaurant was less than desirable however. We had our dinner there on the first night and the seafood was overdone and greasy. Even though I'm sure room service comes out the same kitchen, the food that you order via room service was much better! Their concierges are miracle workers! We wanted to try out Garry Danko, a fine dining restaurant just up the block, but notorious for requiring reservations two months in advance to get in! If you don't want to sit at the bar that is. We asked the concierge around 9am and by the time we returned to our hotel at 5pm, he'd scored us reservations for later that same night! Don't miss the nightly wine and cheese reception! If you're not a wine drinker, they have other alternatives like beer and apple cider.

review.title: GOOD CLEAN AND BEST LOCATION
review.reviewText: This hotel was a really clean and would recommend it again.The location is excellent you can go round the corner to get on the trams(make sure you buy all day ticket),or walk down the front to pier 39,alcatraz or for food.

review.title: It was the perfect getaway.
review.reviewText: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly, the room unbelievably quiet and met some interesting travelers at the wine tasting. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Superb Hotel
review.reviewText: We found the staff very helpful when needed but in the background when not required. Room was very clean and although no view it did not matter as there is so much to look at in the room with the decor and ipod, DVD player etc. Location is perfect for most areas of the city. Evening wine tastind should not be missed.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is in a good location, convenient to attractions and good food. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The room was a tad small, but efficiently laid out. The mini bar was stocked well with interesting snacks and quality beverages, both soft and with alcohol. I thought the decor was somewhat garish, with an art deco/nautical theme that made me feel like singing "On the good ship lollipop." The on-site restaurant served good breakfasts, but I would look elsewhere for dinner. I would recommend and return to this hotel.

review.title: great location!
review.reviewText: We found many fun things to do, including exploring the scenic neighborhoods up the hill.

review.title: Super Stay and Wonderful Venue
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is located in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf district, a perfect location for all of the activity. The hotel is beautiful and well maintained. The staff is friendly and accomidating. We will return. Highly recommended.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Our anniversary trip at the Argonaut was one of our best trips. The staff and location of this Hotel was excellent. Lots of things to do in walking distance. When your feet need a little rest the trolly car is less than a block away.

review.title: A Hidden Gem
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful 3 night stay, and can't wait to go back.

review.title: Excelent
review.reviewText: Very good

review.title: I would highly recommend the Argonaut to anyone.
review.reviewText: Brilliant Hotel, especially staff who were exceptionally friendly and efficient. Excellent Location in a Stunning City, well worth the slightly higher price tag. Hotel Restaurant food was good, varied and reasionably priced. Everthing within walking distance, shops, restaurants by the hundred, beach, historic maritime museum, sightseeing tours, boat trips.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: My wife & I stayed at the Argonaut for our honeymoon. We loved it here! The staff were very helpful, giving us many suggestions for attractions to see and restaurants to try. The maid service did a superb job and kept our room in top notch shape! We felt very welcomed here and will stay here again our next time in San Francisco!

review.title: Excellence at the Argonaut
review.reviewText: Spent a quick weekend at the Argonaut in SF to see the new CA Academy of Sciences and the Afghanistan exhibit at the Asian Art Museum. We were upgraded to an enormous suite on the second floor. Quiet w/windows shut, well decorated, comfortable, mini bar plus a refrigerator, climate control, deep soaking tub. Staff was welcoming and professional. Cannot find a single negative about the Argonaut.

review.title: Great Hotel with wonderful service
review.reviewText: We enjoyed a wonderful stay in October 2008. The hotel is in the PERFECT location for Fisherman's Wharf and access to cable cars. The decor is very nice and the beds are so comfy!!!! The mermaid restaurant was overpriced and disappointing for breakfast, but overall, just a fabulous stay.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel,used to be Del Montes Cannery, a perfect spot for all major attractions. Staff very helpful, the free wine reception from 5-6pm is a great idea met lots of interesting people. Would definately stay there again. Would recommend buying 3 or 5 day travel pass to explore the city on trams,cable cars and buses, great fun!!

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: We loved this Hotel! The rooms were exactly as pictured,very attractive Nautical decor, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and the location was great. All of the attractions at Fishermans Wharf are within walking distance and the Cable Car line is just blocks away! We would definintely stay there again!

review.title: Everything about the place made you smile!
review.reviewText: The Argonaugt is a great hotel for everyone. Extremely well managed, it maintains that small well run hotel intimacy without being intrusive - in fact it is not particularly small, but just feels it! The nautical theme that runs through the hotel could have been cheesy but really was done with such quality and style, you couldn't help but enjoy it. The rooms are big and capatious, the sound-proofing from all directions was very good and the free wine during the "Happy Hour" we experienced each day was a real bonus! Strongly recommended for anyone who want the efficiency and quality of a 4* hotel but want to avoid the banal,"could be anywhere in the world" ambiance. At the Argonaut, you could only be in the US of A!

review.title: Exceptional
review.reviewText: Best kept secret in San Francisco!

review.title: Great Time in San Francisco--Argonaut Hotel
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Argonaut---got a great deal through Expedia.

review.title: Outstanding experience
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience at the Argonaut. It was within walking distance of almost everything. The service of the employees was outstanding and they were all very helpful and friendly. I will definitely be going back!!

review.title: Would go back again.
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful. Location of hotel very convenient.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel was great! The staff were extremely helpful - even upgraded us to a better room with view of Golden Gate Bridge. The staff were always cheerful and eager to help. Also the evening wine tasting sessions were such fun. The quality of the wine could have been better but it was so useful to be able to meet other guests and swap experiences re where to visit and what restaurants to try. It was also so useful to be over the road to the cable car terminus. Would definitely go back

review.title: We were very happy with our stay!!
review.reviewText: The employees were very helpful and friendly, the rooms clean and very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again the next time in SF.

review.title: A Fantastic Experience
review.reviewText: This has to be one of the best holiday hotels we have stayed in. From the ever courteous and helpful staff to the comfort and decor of the hotel and bedrooms. The free wine tasting every night from 5-6pm was a novel way of bringing everyone together. The hotel sits right next to the cable car stop and is handy for street cars and buses.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Right on the bay by Pier 47. The most comfortable bed I've ever slept in (includes other 5 star hotels). Staff was extraordinarily helpful. The only negative would be the small bathrooms (was sharing with a girlfriend). Immaculately clean rooms. Would definitely stay here again. Be sure to enjoy Happy Hour from 5-6 PM.

review.title: Great location - Comfortable rooms - Great hotel staff (very attentive) - Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: The time we spent in the hotel was very comfortable. The wine hour was very entertaining. The Blue Mermaid restaurant was a great place to eat and the service was tremendous. The staff couldn't do enough to help make our trip one we'll always fondly remember. My wife and I couldn't have asked for a better location.

review.title: excellent location, friendly staff
review.reviewText: This hotel is located central in the Wharf area..close to several shops and restaurants, beach, touring, etc. We were only there for 1 night and did not take advantage of the complimentary happy hour serving wine, as we spent most of our time walking. SEveral restaurants to choose from. Pricey, so do shop around. The hotel was very impressive and i would not hesitate to stay again. We were booked for 1 queen size and were upgraded to a room with 2 queen size bed...very comfy beds...would've been nice to have a room with an ocean view, but hey can't have everything...quiet too.

review.title: Smallest Room In Hotel
review.reviewText: We were undoubtedly placed in the smallest room in this facility, with a window that overlooked people's feet as they walked by on the sidewalk, but even this room was very comfortable and nice. The wine reception was very enjoyable, the staff were all super-friendly. If you're looking to stay on Fisherman's Wharf, this is definitely the place to be!

review.title: Best place on the waterfront!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel is wonderfully decorated, and the staff, all of them, is friendly and knowledgeable. I was given tips on places to go and how to get there. After a day doing business, my room was clean and comfortable, and a wine tasting was waiting in the lobby. The view was fantastic and it was conveniently located for public transportation, including the cable car, which picked up right outside the hotel. I'd go there again in a heartbeat!

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: You couldn't ask for a better SanFran/Warf location. Cool rooms, great service.

review.title: Best Hotel in Area
review.reviewText: The Argonaut, from what I saw, was the best hotel in the area by far. The hotel itself was clean and friendly and the staff were very helpful. From walking through the door to first walking into the room, everything felt right. For us it was an ideal location too, three miles from the Golden gate bridge (easily walkable) and twenty minutes walk to the Alcatraz ferry port. The Aquatic Park 2 minutes from the hotel offered views of the bridge and alcatraz, whilst watching swimmers in the bay and joggers and cyclist whizzing past, fantastic! The Cable car to Union square is right round the corner also and well worth the 20 or 30 minute queue as the walk is steep and challenging. At $5 a ride it isnt too expensive either.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and comfortable,all staff very friendly and helpful,especially when we encountered problems with our on-line flight check-in.The beds and bedding were of a high standard(high priority for us)the room comfortable and the location convenient for all attractions at Fisherman's Wharf and access to the city.No problems with street noise late at night,overall a good choice.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great location. Quirky nautical theme - very different. Concierge very helpful. Definitely stay again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Walking distance to restaurants and shops

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was better than i had hoped. Our room was an inside one so we had no view but we spent so little time in our room except to sleep and bathe. The staff was very helpful from recommending places to eat or things to do. We biked the Golden Gate. Blazzing Saddles is right next to the hotel and they give you a ferry pass incase you don't want to ride back. We took the ferry back and it was great. We also went on a catamaran that is near pier 39 for $30 per person. If you LOVE GARLIC then go to "The Stinking Rose" they have the best italian food but you must love garlic.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was perfectly located between Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, the Hyde & Powell cable car and the northern end of Columbus Street. The room was not overyly spacious, but it had the most comfortable bed we have ever slept on outside our own home. Service of every type--doorman, bellman, front desk, concierge, cleaning--was excellent. We will stay there again.

review.title: A 'Safe Bet' Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Argonaut for four nights in September 2008, during which period it seemed extremely busy. The rooms were clean, freshly decorated and well-equipped. Check-in was swift and courteous and the conceirge was knowledgeable and efficient. Whilst a lot was made in hotel's marketing information about its 'nautical' theme, in reality, this did not have an immediate impact - it appeared indirectly through nautical-inspired materials for the soft furnishings. On the down-side, we found that the cleaning staff attended at our room very late in the day, in fact, one day so late that we were back in the room and we went for a day without the room being tended to. Also, the hotel is on a busy tourist thoroughfare at Fisherman's Wharf and, during our stay, was very busy, although the hustle and bustle from outside could not be heard in the room. This hotel is a safe option - it is clean, comfortable and in a convenient location. It does not quite live up to its marketing hype: we never saw any complimentary tea/wine afternoons in the lounge, the nautical theme is none too apparent and the rooms, whilst very nicely decorated, were not outstanding. Having said that, we enjoyed our stay and I would reccommend the hotel to families and others seeking a clean, well-presented hotel in the Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel is a great place to stay. We had great service, the staff was friendly (especially the cleaning people) and the daily wine tasting was a nice touch. The location of the hotel was convenient for seeing the sites. You are close to the cable cars, Ghiradelli Square and the Maritime Museum.

review.title: One of the best hotel experiences I have had
review.reviewText: This place ROCKS! The staff is one of the most friendly and helpful I have ever met and the property itself is very well kept and located in a great spot for seeing many if San Fran's touristy bits. BTW, the complimentary wine tasting every afternoon is a nice perk and a good way to meet fellow travelers.

review.title: SanFran is the place to be
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were very nice. We especially enjoyed the evening wine reception each night.

review.title: Staff and hotel was excellant
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying at the wharf. The Staff and hotel service was more than excellant. Everyone was very helpful and professional

review.title: Best hotel experience of my life
review.reviewText: This hotel had the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in and my wife agreed. The valet service was perfect after the long drive. A pricey stay, but worth it for the convenience of the location and parking. The complimentary wine was a great addition, and the bellhops were outstanding and provided great directions for the drive after our stay.

review.title: Great Hotel, perfect location!
review.reviewText: This was a great Hotel, the location was ideal. If I can give any advice it would be to get up early and walk out the front entrance to the left ( away from the warf) walk up the hill a little and you will see a trolly stop. This is the best place to get on, the lines are shorter earlier! I was a little annoyed by a really noisy neighbor, but I think that can happen in any hotel. The Restaurant across the street called Cioppinno's had the best cioppinno soup!

review.title: Perfect for waterfront stays
review.reviewText: Fantastic location right by the bayside attractions. Rooms are nice with a well executed nautical theme.

review.title: Loved the hotel, would go back tomorrow if I could.
review.reviewText: This hotel was so nice. The room, with it's nautical theme, was roomy and very clean. The mattress was better than I have at home....loved it. The staff was accommadating and very friendly. I loved the location too. The Fisherman's Wharf area has so much to see and with the cable car right across the street, easy access to mass transit. The only thing I would change at the hotel is the restaurant. Their chowders were superb but otherwise, it wasn't up what would expect from such a great hotel.

review.title: Would stay there again without hesitation
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, staff friendly and helpful. Great location, would stay there again without hesitation. Really enjoyed the wine reception and the comfortable beds.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel in a great location. The staff was very nice and helpful. Would stay here again.

review.title: Very Good
review.reviewText: I took my family on a 4 day break and found this Hotel to be very good. In fact I have evn booked my parents into it for a vacation. The only negative I could mention was the Chowder bar restaurant. The menu was understandibly seafood orientated however there were very little non seafood options, which given it is in a Hotel and is not a stand alone place, I expect it to cater for all tastes. However with so many good places to eat in SF, it wasn't too big a deal.

review.title: Great Hotel in a perfect location
