review.reviewText: This hotel was very comfortable and in a perfect location. The staff were all pleasant and helpful. The neighborhood near by is very safe and we felt comfortable walking around in the evening and early morning.

review.title: Wonderful experience at the Argonaut!
review.reviewText: Couldn't ask for a better experience! Enthusiastic staff and extremely helpful. The Argonaut went out of their way to make sure we had a great experience. Planning on making a return stay our next time in San Francisco!

review.title: Lovely hotel in fab location - Blue Mermaid Bar/Restaurant has great chowder
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on arriving in San Francisco at the start of our holiday touring California. It is right next to the Cable car turnaround point and on the edge of Fisherman's Wharf which is great as the Wharf itself is busy and commercialised and Complimentary wine tasting each evening at 5 pm. hotel staff all very very helpful, great hotel

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: only complaint was that our Carpet was wett in front of the bathroom when we checked in. Did not notice this until we took our shoes off and then hoped the water had come from the shower.

review.title: The hotel, staff and room are great.
review.reviewText: The Hotel staff was great, greating me at the car and taking my luggage. They make a point to get to know you instead of treating you as just another guest. The hotel, with its nautical theme really ties into the surrounding Warf area. The room was clean, bright and fresh. Anothough I had an inside room and didnt have a view of the city or bay, it was still great. I recommend asking for either a city orbay view. Did not attend the wine reception but the lobby was always full at that time which indicates it wasnt bad at all. A must for all couples families for single travelers!

review.title: Absolutely a Fantastic & Unique Hotel !
review.reviewText: Do you want to get away from it all and meet some new friends ? The Argonaut is the place. My wife & I just spent 4 days there & had a wonderful time. At their evening wine tasting hour in the room off the lobby we met people from Scotland, England & Canada and ended up going out to dinner with them all & had a great time ! .... Or you can have a quiet time by yourselves if you like. You're across the street from the famous wharf & 1 block from the infamous Buena Vista Cafe. It is perfectly located. Have a GREAT time, we surely did and will again !

review.title: Wish we had stayed longer than 7 nights
review.reviewText: Just back from 7 nights at The Argonaut - totally totally amazed and impressed with the hotel and we were so pleased with our choice of hotel. From the bellboys upwards, all staff were gracious, helpful and above all amusing. We cannot fault the hotel at all. Free wine tasting is a great way to meet other guests who you would normally just politely nod to. We thoroughly enjoyed our whole stay and loved every bit of San Francisco and can't wait to go again and we will definitely be staying at The Argonaut which is so convenient for the whole of San Francisco.

review.title: Comfortable stay in a nice location
review.reviewText: Classy but fun hotel. We would go back for sure!

review.title: Excellent Place to Stay!
review.reviewText: This is by far the best hotel that I've stayed in while visiting San Francisco! From check-in to check-out the hotel staff provided superior service. The room was also very clean and had a very comfortable bed. However, next time I will spend a little more for a deluxe room as the standard room's window didn't open so it got a little stuffy. The Argonaut's location was also great -- at the quiet end of Fisherman's Wharf but also near excellent places for eating and drinking. I'm looking forward to staying here again!!

review.title: Great Hotel - Loved the rooms
review.reviewText: It was great. The staff was awesome! Will stay again.

review.title: Great Hotel in a great city!
review.reviewText: Very cool room with aquatic theme. Wine in the lobby was fantastic. A great hotel.

review.title: AWESOME (AND PET FRIENDLY)
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Very curtious. Great location right on the water. Also, being pet friendly was PERFECT (they even provided the food and water bowl).

review.title: Perfect location for Fisherman's Wharf & Trolley Car line
review.reviewText: We visited San Francisco for our 35th Anniversary and we wanted our hotel to be comfortable and near popular tourist sites. We were extremely pleased with The Argonaut, both because it was indeed comfortable, and because its location was perfect...across the street from Fisherman's Wharf and practically next door to the Trolley line. Also nearby is Giardelli Square, great if you like shopping or are a chocolate lover. All in all, a great hotel in a great city.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: If you need or want to stay down on Fisherman's Wharf, this is the place to be. Easy access to the area's multitude of activities. Funky theme, but it works in the common areas and the rooms. Just far enough away that the front sidewalk is NOT wall to wall people for most times of the day!

review.title: In the heart of the action
review.reviewText: Great location for seeing Fishermans Wharf. With that comes the lack of parking and crowded sidewalks. If you come expecting those things you will have a great visit. Hotel was enjoyable.

review.title: Great Wine and Beds
review.reviewText: The Argonaut hotel is located in the perfect spot to get to all of San Francisco's major tourist attractions. Additionally, they have free wine tasting every night and the most comfortable beds! I would highly recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION,BEAUTIFUL HOTEL
review.reviewText: 5 star hotel

review.title: Great Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf District of San Fransico
review.reviewText: My husband, two children (ages 7 and 9) and I really enjoyed our stay here. The stafff is friendly and informative. Whenever we needed somethng taken care of in the room it was done expediciously. Although the hotel is located in a very tourist laden section of town, the rooms are quiet and there are plenty of decent restaurants within walking distance that cater both to adults and children. Cabs were always available and the general ambiance very friendly. The hotle on premises is good.

review.title: Fantastic hotel and location
review.reviewText: My husband and I were thoroughly impressed with the Argonaut Hotel. The location was fantastic for a leisure trip because Fisherman's Wharf is only two blocks away and the piers are across the street. The cable car line is right next to the hotel and there were many restaurants within walking distance. The staff were very friendly and accommodating, and the evening wine tasting was a great way to end a day of sightseeing.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: Excellent in all ways, and a convenient location.

review.title: Impressive Hotel and Staff
review.reviewText: Staff in hotel were very courteous and helpful. Rooms were spacious and comfortably furnished. Wine reception every afternoon was a nice surprise. Hotel's position in Fisherman's Wharf was good ---- plenty of restaurants nearby.

review.title: Great Hotel. Great Location
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Rooms were perfect & Clean. Blue Mermaid Restaurant had amazing food & service.

review.title: Many great things about this hotel, but a few were really annoying
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and in a superb location. Our room was big but the bathroom was small and only had one sink. My biggest complaint was the desk staff. We had arranged, and re-confirmed, late arrival. We got there at 11pm with 2 exhausted kids. The only unoccupied room of the type we booked had been "flagged" by housekeeping in the computer and the desk person could not tell why. She was very confused and it took quite a while for her to figure out what to do. Eventually, she sent a bellman up to see if the room was made up, and thank goodness it was. When checking out, we requested an hour late check out, (it was a Monday) and the same desk person was on duty and just shook her head and said no. No explanation, no apology, just no. Also, during our stay, both of our key cards had to be re-activated to work. The concierge helped with tour information, but pushed only one tour company. We were told very snottily that it was too late for us to go to Alcatraz because every single Alcatraz tour was booked until the next week, but we walked down the street and were able to get a tour to Alcatraz that afternoon. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was pretty good but very expensive. The bellmen were very nice and helpful. It's truly a shame that the other personnel issues dampened our opinion of the hotel, because it really has a lot of positives to it.

review.title: Unique Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is sea themed from the rooms with star fish pillows to the lobby with big white sales in it. We were on our honeymoon and out of all 4 hotels we stayed at in California,this is the only hotel who acknowledge this. They put a nice bottle of wine and a little card in our room to congratulate us. The hotel is very close to cable car and bus stop. You are also in walking distance to some nice restaurants. If you go out of the hotel to the left you will find it is a nicer area than the rest of Fisherman's Warf which is very touristy with lots of junk stores. Overall, the hotel is the nicest one I saw in the area.

review.title: Parking charges spoil otherwise impeccable review
review.reviewText: Hotel is everything you'd require, location couldn't be better for Wharf,transport links. Rooms, service, personnel all top-notch but even by SF standards the cost per night to have your car parked takes the gloss off when you're presented with your bill at the end of the stay ! Look hard for alternatives (private car parks nearby?)! We wished we'd taken our car back to Dollar at airport and got a taxi back in (it was the last 5 days of our US holiday before flying home). Don't miss the free evening wine reception (5-6pm)!

review.title: Outstanding choice
review.reviewText: After reading the reviews of this hotel, we felt fortunate that a room was available for our stay. We were not disappointed! As others have mentioned (and we found to be as described) the staff was wonderful, the wine tasting was a nice touch, the location was perfect for anything on Fisherman's Wharf and the room was clean, neat and tidy. The nautical theme throughout the hotel was a pleasant reminder of San Francisco.

review.title: Top Notch Hotel at a Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel balances unique, rustic character with modern amenities as well as being VERY clean and well kept. The staff is helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean and charming. This is one of the best hotels in which we've stayed. It is also conveniently located in San Francisco along Fisherman's Wharf, and all forms of public transportation are within two blocks. You won't be disappointed with this great hotel located in a great city.

review.title: Definitely will stay here again...
review.reviewText: This was truly a great hotel! The room was very comfortable and clean. Service was ok. I requested an extra pillow and extra towels which never came. Oh well. Location was great! Hotel was within walking distance of Ghirardelli Square and right on the Wharf. Request a room with a street view or ocean view if you want your window to open.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience at the Argonaut; warm reception, hospitable staff and fantastic location! The wine reception in the evening was an added bonus! Would definately stay here if we ever visit SF again!

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: Highly recommended, in a great location and the interior is fantastic. Main trolley car stops just next door and the views are amazing of the bay and Golden gate bridge.

review.title: First class experience
review.reviewText: We celebrated our 25th anniversary in San Francisco and chose the Argonaut Hotel as our home base. From check in to check out the staff was more than helpful; from hailing cabs, to arranging tours, to printing boarding passes our every need was met. We requested and got a room with a view of the Golden Gate Bridge. On our fourth morning the fog cooperated and we were rewarded with a breathtaking view. Thanks to all for making our stay a most pleasant one.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We absolutely loved this hotel. The room was big and clean, the staff was very helpful, and there was even freeeee wine and beer for hotel guests every evening from 5-6pm. would definitely recommend.

review.title: Best Hotel I have stayed at
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was excellant and the location was great.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was perfect. It's location is right on the wharf, close to transportation and all the activities. Having read about the noise factor that was experienced by some guests, I requested a room that faced the Cannery and we enjoyed a very peaceful and quiet stay for an entire week. From the decor to the service to the exercise room and concierge, we were totally satisfied.

review.title: Great Hotel and location
review.reviewText: Hotel could not be better located to see all the sights of Fisherman's wharf. Initial room was very clean and decorated but a bit smaller than wanted, we were able to upgrade to a King Bed front view facing room which was lovelly, again nice decor and a very good size. Nice touches like the free wine tasting every evening. I do not think you could have a better sighted hotel if you want to be near Fisherman's Wharf area, although busy in the day very quiet at night. Easy walk to all attractions or for use of the cable cars or street trams. Would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Excellant Hotel
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel which was more expensive than we would normally choose but it was worth the extra for a little bit of luxury. The only downside for us was the lack of a view but that probably meant the room was a lot quieter, which is a good thing. The room was very clean and well appointed and the service was good in general. The only problem we had was with a receptionist who offered to check our flight booking for us and get back to us but never did. We ended up doing it ourselves, although it was difficult to find a telephone number as there were no directories available. Overall though, a great place to stay, close to all the action in a fabulous city.

review.title: We would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: The bed comfort is excellent. The room theme very nice. The restaurant staff friendly and made good recommendations. The wine and relax is a nice touch. We like the museum and the history of the hotel.

review.title: Overall good experience.
review.reviewText: Check-in was late due to a plumbing problem in our room, then they ended up switching our room again. Other than that, our trip went off without a hitch. We found the front desk people to be a bit snooty and unhelpful. It may have been because the oldest person in our party was 19. We got all of our info and great help from the bellboys. They were friendly and knowledgable.

review.title: Close to many attractions
review.reviewText: The hotel was very well maintained. We loved the wine reception held nightly. It was close to everything.

review.title: Best Place to Stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: One of the nicest and neatest hotels I have ever stayed at. It was unique, well located, friendly, and we really enjoyed staying there. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. We loved the decor, the room size and we had a perfect view of Alcatraz! Loved it!

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a fantastic hotel with wonderful and helpful personnel.

review.title: Excellent stay.
review.reviewText: Having read a few grumbles about the Argonaut, all I can say is if you look hard enough for something to moan about you will probably find something. We Didnt.

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: We had a great 3 night stay at the Argonaut. We were a family of 4, staying in one room with 2 queen beds. Very comfortable and suitably spacious. Our room was street-facing, looking onto the cable-car stop - yet the room was perfectly quiet. The staff were all helpful, cheerful and efficient. The hotel is perfectly located for Fisherman's Wharf and the cable car.

review.title: Good to visit Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: It locates very close to Fisherman's Wharf. This is the only thing I can see why it costs high.

review.title: Very close to attractions
review.reviewText: This hotel is very convenient and in walking distance to most attractions. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Room is slightly small and cramped, but clean. I would stay here again.

review.title: Good for families & tourists
review.reviewText: For there were many of them when I was there. Right on the Wharf, and much more interesting than some of the other choices in chain hotels. Pets OK, too! The Restaurant was not impressive, but service was overall very good.

review.title: We couldn't imagine staying anywhere else!
review.reviewText: My family loved this hotel! It was beautiful, clean, friendly and inviting. It was impecably decorated for style and comfort. The location could not have been more perfect, right where we wanted to be with a trolley turn-around right outside the door. I will plan to stay at Kimpton hotels for future vacations.

review.title: This hotel is in an excellent location. Very comfortable, and the staff there are fantastic!
review.reviewText: I only had 1 complaint. I was in a non-smoking room, and early in the morning I would have the smell of smoke eminate through my room. Probably from the person below. Overall though, I enjoyed the hotel and appreciated the great service, and positive attitude of the employees.

review.title: Fantastic location
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a 3-4 star hotel, and we got it at a great bargain through Expedia. Everything about it was first class including the free happy hour every night. The Concierge and front desk were very friendly and helpful and our room was very nice. The location was a plus, close to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Lombard Street, Ghiradelli Square, and the cable cars. A definite recommendation.

review.title: Loved the hotel !!!!!!!
review.reviewText: We absolutly love the Argonaut. The people were friendly the location was perfect the wine was great. The host of the wine hour even went out of his way to make the wine perfect for my wife. The only thing that we could think of that could be a good add-on would be some type of continental breakfast.

review.title: Best for the Price
review.reviewText: We compared quality and price of other hotels in San Francisco and this hotel was a find! Its right on Fisherman's Wharf and the hotel's colorful nautical motif is a fun touch. There are several good restaurants nearby (try the Franciscan!) Staff is very helpful. Rooms are a bit small and ours didn't have views, but they are clean, comfortable and well maintained.

review.title: Very good quality hotel , very happy with the standard........................................
review.reviewText: Impressed with the standard. Very comfortable hotel which was well decorated and maintained. The rooms were a good size and well thought out. The hotel restaurent was was very good too. The menu was a litle limited but tasted very good. The only issue that we had was in respect of the hotel was the parking charges which were approx $40 per night! We couldn't find any cheaper alternative around , which I guess mitigates it somewhat.

review.title: high standard; needs warmth
review.reviewText: Comfortable, clean and lots of luxury elements. What let it down somewhat for us was:our room was incredibly dark (luck of draw), noisy pipes as old building, efficient and undeniable informative high service but some staff )reception)lacked warmth/ friednliness and dismissive at times

review.title: Fun, Fun, Fun
review.reviewText: This is a great place to stay. We were here for a week. The food is tremendous. My favorite is the clam linguini. It was a very quiet room and well attended. Everyone at the hotel was extremely helpful and friendly. It's easy to get around San Francisco from the wharf, too.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is in an excellent location and the room's are very comfortable. Recommend rooms with a view over the bay.

review.title: great for the family
review.reviewText: Very good hotel for a family, near all the main attractions

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Argonaut Hotel. Our room faced the courtyard, and we were able to open the window and listen to the music from the concerts that were held there each afternoon. We had great service from hotel staff members, and the location was convenient to many activities and the cable car turnaround. We would stay there again!

review.title: Great place to stay!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great place to stay. Although the price was really high, the little ammenities like high quality shampoos and soaps in the room make it somewhat acceptable. The Starbucks coffee was an excellent morning treat. Our room was 309, the only room on the side of the building with a tree covering our room window which was nice for privacy, but not so great for gazing. The other issue with the room on that side of the building is the entire BLOCK walk to get to our room from the elevators. The side of the building we were on had a staircase labeled for staff use only, but we used it anyway for a quick escape to get outside since it was such a long walk otherwise. There are no vending machines on the property and the hotel restaurant is expensive and served us cold breakfast. Stock up before you go. We didn't take the mini bar key because of the outrageous prices that usually come with minibar access. Fisherman's Wharf is close, about 4 blocks away. With ample shopping between the hotel and Pier 39. Parking is outrageously priced and street parking isn't bad on the weekdays, but on the holiday weekend it was impossible so we had no choice.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: great location for seeing the sites. Hotel met or exceeded expectations.

review.title: Do NOT hesitate
review.reviewText: This was by far the best Hotel I have ever stayed at. Everything was top notch and the staff was helpful and friendly. They offer free wine in the lobby between 5-6pm and it is a great way to find out what to do the next day. You will NOT need to rent a car as everything is within walking distance. I plan on coming back ASAP.

review.title: Everything I could have hoped for
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is in a great location, at the end of the wharf and near transportation to everything! Our view (the park and the GG Bridge was breathtaking). Staff was over the top with respect and helpfulness and the wine at 5:00 was excellent!

review.title: Will stay here every time
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Argonaut in Fisherman's Wharf for 5 days/4 nights with our kids (almost 7 and 5). It is a lovely hotel with extremely friendly and helpful service. We got a bay view room and could see the Golden Gate Bridge and the Ghirardelli sign from our room. So cool! You can't beat the location, either. We usually spend our time in the wharf, so this was perfect. Plus the cable car turnaround is right across the street if you want to pick that up to head into town. And I should mention, even though it's by the cable cars, the windows are soundproof so we had no street noise. We also used the car service on the hotel's website, Pacific Heights Limousine, to get to and from the airport. It was cheaper than a shuttle and the service was outstanding. The restaurant in the hotel is excellent - best chowder I've ever had. We had a great trip and can't wait to go back!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was great. The location at The Cannery was perfect, right on the Fisherman's Wharf, but not in the middle of all the traffic. The staff and service was top notch, as was the nightly wine hour. We will definetly return.

review.title: Excellent Surprise
review.reviewText: I was very surprised with all aspects of the hotel. The location was more good, the staff was friendly, helpful and professional. Overall service was great, rooms comfortable and clean. Everything was better than expected.

review.title: One of the best we've stayed in while in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The staff was courteous and the hotel was in an ideal location. We would love to go back.

review.title: One of the best hotels I've stayed in!
review.reviewText: The rooms are very spacious and clean. The bed are comfortable and the staff at the hotel are very helpful and friendly. Wished we could have stayed longer! Everything was top notch...

review.title: Return visit just as good as the first
review.reviewText: Love this hotel. This was our 2nd visit here in 18 months and the quality is just as good as before. Near the waterfront/wharf, cablecar and easy walking distance of attractions and shops. Would definately stay there again when returning to San Francisco. Suitable for families but not many leisure facilities within hotel. Has beautiful lounge/lobby and internet facilities. Bar/cafe attached serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Excellent location, service was great, room was bit small but otherwise perfect!

review.title: Fancy Schmancy
review.reviewText: I choose this hotel because I thought it was well located to hit some of SFs great attractions and it was kinda close to the ferry to Alcatraz, but thats about all. Fisherman's Wharf is strictly commercial, tacky and crowded. Hotel was also too fancy and noisy for us and charged too much for parking.

review.title: Excellent choice
review.reviewText: Our family absolutely loved this hotel! We were there for the 4th of July long weekend and it was definitely the place to be. The location on Fisherman's Wharf is so convenient and for the 4th there were bands and other activities nearby. The food at the restaraunt was fair but the hotel and the rooms (we upgraded one room to a suite) were wonderful. We will make it a 4th of July tradition.

review.title: Great Place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. Everything is at a short walking distance. If you are looking to go to Chinatown, Yerba Buena Gardens or Union Sq, the Powell and Hyde Cars are right across the Street. The service in the Hotel is great. Very clean and organized. I love the idea that the Hotel is Eco-friendly. They replace the towels at change the sheets at your request. Big plus in my book.

review.title: Great Find
review.reviewText: Great hotel. This was our first stay here and we will stay here in the future.

review.title: Nautical & Nice!!
review.reviewText: We booked all our Hotels for our holiday with Expedia and did choose them from the reviews, so I am very happy to do mine. The Hotel was everything we expected and more. The nautical theme unique, the staff were extremely pleasant and friendly, and the position was just so convenient to everything, with restaurants nearby, and the cable tram next door. The Happy Hour also a great idea - a nice way to meet other guests.

review.title: Maid Service Unacceptable
review.reviewText: We stayed 6 nights and had our room cleaned only twice. 2 of the 4 days the room was not cleaned was due to sleeping in, 2 of the 4 days the room was not cleaned was due to the maid not cleaning the room even though we had our Clean Room sign out. The in room bar was never refilled, so we had to call and pay for room service when we only wanted bottled water, we complained, however, nothing was done to correct this.

review.title: Great Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel got mixed reviews so we were questioning our choice, but decided on it anyway. It was fabulous. We were on the 2nd floor and watched thousands of people go by on the 4th of July and there was not a problem with any street noise whatsoever. The service was great, the location was even better. If you are looking for a little luxury, fun and convenience when traveling with your kids then this place is it. It's within walking distance of everything near the Wharf. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to all of our friends.

review.title: fantastic boutique hotel in the heart of fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: this is a great hotel no matter what your purpose for traveling to san francisco's fisherman's wharf area. wonderful luxurious bedding and bath products with exemplary service and a daily wine hour make this a great place for adult travelers. even better is the attention to kids! a welcome pack for small travelers keeps them entertained while a pet goldfish in your room for your stay is a unique amenity. add a location that is in the heart of the fisherman's wharf area & this is a hot spot for a few days of enjoying san francisco without needing a car.

review.title: Excellent hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel is excellent in all respects. This was our second stay here. The location is perfect, the staff very friendly and helpful and the rooms beautiful and spotless. There is a free wine/beer tasting every day from 5-6pm. You will not be disappointed!

review.title: AWESOME boutique hotel with fantastic location
review.reviewText: Lobby and room absolutely gorgeous - just like the pictures! Service impeccable. Right on the wharf, and next to Ghirardelli. Has a Starbucks right on property, and right next to cable car station. We loved this hotel and want to go back again!

review.title: Best Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf Area
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel often, and have never had a bad experience. My only beef is that no longer have free Internet computers to use - but, a lot of hotels charge for this too. Great hotel!

review.title: A Strong Showing
review.reviewText: Great location. Clean, quiet,and nicely decorated rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. Restaurant and room service food was solid. Kid friendly. We were there on a busy weekend (4th of July)and everything was smoothe from check-in to check-out. We were very impressed with the entire experience and would definitely return!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: hotel is in a great location, close to Fishermans wharf, North Beach and numerous bus lines. Lots of foot traffic so lots of people watching available.

review.title: Above Expectations
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Friendly Staff. GREAT LOCATION!!! The rooms are large, but cozy. Larger than most other rooms in SF. We were very happy with the service. Great Wine reception in the evenings. Would definitely stay here again. Wouldn't want to stay anywhere else.

review.title: We loved it.
review.reviewText: We loved our recent stay at the Argonaut. This is our third stay there.....we will always stay there.

review.title: Definitely recommending to others!
review.reviewText: I thought the hotel's nautical theme was very cute. The restaurant provided tasty food, though, their fruit salad looked a bit dated. Rooms were nice, clean and spacious. Central to many things or easily accessible. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: fun atmosphere.
review.reviewText: A bit pricey! Fun atmosphere. Staff was extremely friendly!!

review.title: Great Experience!
review.reviewText: The reviews for this hotel were generally very good, and we found out just why. Awesome location (didn't need a rental car), bell and concierge staff are excellent, rooms are cozy, clean, and one of the most comfortable hotel beds we've ever slept in. The ambience of the entire hotel is very cool. No complaints. Book it. You'll be glad you did.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This is a first class hotel in an excellent location. The interior lives up to it's nautical theme and the rooms were both spacious and comfortable. If anyone is travelling to SF I would recommend a stay at The Argonaut

review.title: Satisfactory overall
review.reviewText: Being close to Fisherman's Wharf is perfect for us and convenient to tour agencies around the area.The service is excellent except front desk forgot to give the key to open the mini bar.Housekeeping kept closing it until finding out 2 days after that a key should have been provided upon check in.Being particular with bed and sheets,I am happy with the service.I slept good every night.Overall,this hotel meet my expectation.Nautical theme I thought is different from that "hotel" atmosphere.Great job on designing it!!!!Sharp colors!!!!

review.title: Hotel with a Difference
review.reviewText: Definitely a hotel I would recommend, - efficient, helpful and fun loving door staff and the concierge was really helpful. Complimentary wine tasting late afternoons is a great idea, providing opportunities to mingle - or not - whatever your preference. BE AWARE - car parking is not supplied by the hotel - we had to ditch our hire car upon arrival in San Fran or we would have been up for ridiculous car park fees. I would stay there again!

review.title: Argonaut Hotel in San Frans
review.reviewText: Love the fact that I get free wireless, really important as we do need to check email and also contact friends via MSN. Very nice way of letting travellers have free wine to warm up in the lobby. Very special and really makes one wanna go back there again. Room however has got very bad view. Would be really good if it has faced the sea.

review.title: LOCATION,LOCATION,LOCATION
review.reviewText: GREAT LOCATION. CLOSE TO THE WHARF AND CABLE CARS. PARKING IN NEAR BY GARAGE $28 A DAY, NOT BAD CONSIDERING WHERE YOU ARE. CABLE CAR TO CHINA TOWN GET OFF WASHINGTON ST AND GO TWO BLOCKS EAST ON LEFT SIDE OF STREET IS CHINESE FOOD PLACE CALLED KOM LOC??, DOWN STAIRS LITTLE HOLE IN WALL. EXCELLENT FOOD JUST DON'T PAY ATTENTION TO APPEARENCE AND ALWAYS A LOCAL FAVORITE.

review.title: Good, But.....
review.reviewText: The service was great. All of the employees were cheerful and helpful. The only thing I dont get about the Argonaut and most hotels is why they dont spend a little extra money to insulate the rooms. From beds sqeaking to hangers being hung we could hear it all

review.title: Quaint, romantic, exceptional facilites and service
review.reviewText: excellent hotel and location...we were very pleased with the service and facilities.

review.title: Will Definitely Go Back
review.reviewText: This Hotel is probably the best hotel for the value that we've ever stayed at. The beds were comfy, the room had everything we needed, the shower head was definitely at the right height for my 6'3" sons, the food was excellent, and the staff was very helpful and friendly, plus the location was excellent being right on Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: We got a great deal.
review.reviewText: We typically stay at more affordable hotels, but there was an Expedia sale for this one. The hotel staff was everything you'd expect from this type of hotel. Extremely helpful and attentive. The location was also incredible. We were ugraded to a Bay View room when we arrived. It was a 4th floor room with views of Aquatic Park, the street car turn table, Ghiradelli Square, and the Golden Gate Bridge. The room was quiet and well appointed. There was also a sleeper sofa, DVD player, and honor bar.

review.title: Great Location, Ambiance and Price
review.reviewText: This hotel was the most economically priced of any located in the Fisherman's Wharf/Ghirardelli Square area on Expedia, but was beautiful, quaint (with a fishing/naval theme), clean, well maintained (read as "new everything") and perfectly located for a visit to San Francisco's bayside. It will be the only place I stay if/when I go back!

review.title: Stylish 4 star hotel in San Franciso's Fisherman Wharf
review.reviewText: I only stayed there for 1 night, but its a nice looking hotel with great staff and doormen, very good service and a nice style. Definitely worht staying in!

review.title: Would definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: Loved the funky modern nautical theme of this hotel. The decor was amazing, loved the fireplace in the main lounge area which was very welcoming after returning from a chilly night on Alcatraz. Bar and restaurent very good and staff very friendly and helpful throughout the hotel. A plush hotel with a very relaxed feel to it. One minor hitch was our room was at the back of the hotel on 2nd floor looking onto Hyde St. and due to the Steepness of the street we were actually looking up from our window to the pavement,so for privacy kept shutters semi-closed and this meant room was quite dark. Next time will book room with a view. But this was a minor problem overall.

review.title: Excellent in every way
review.reviewText: The standard of the hotel was excellent and the staff were very helpful.Every night between 5 & 6 they put on free wine so the guests could get to know each other which was very good and interesting.

review.title: Excellent location and fabulous quality
review.reviewText: Extremely well presented hotel, great location on Fishermans Wharf adjacent to cable cars straight to Union Square. Friendly and helpful staff and feeling of luxury throughout hotel.

review.title: Loved It!
review.reviewText: What a great time we had staying at the Argonaut. Ideally situated for the restaurants and sights. Even though this hotel is in a central location, in bustling Fisherman's Wharf we didn't have hear noise or disturbance from our room. The staff were friendly and always willing to help. We loved our breakfasts in the adjoining Blue Mermaid restaurant. Would pick this hotel every time.

review.title: Great Location - Nice, Fun Hotel!!
review.reviewText: We loved the location - so close to Ghiradelli, the Wharf and the cable car station. Staff was friendly, room was clean and the hotel is decorated in fun motif. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Best Hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was a great place to stay. Everyone was very cheerful and, more importantly, helpful. Its location can't be beat. It's right on the Wharf across the street from the cable car turn around, so transportation is no problem. Very clean! Best hotel ever!

review.title: Fun place in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Good location by the wharf and Ghiradelli Square. A little busy because of all the tourist traffic, but fun. Ideal place to stay for families because of the whimsical theme of the hotel. Our room was surprisingly quiet considering all that was going on outside. Would stay here again.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: The hotel as much better than I expected for the price. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: next to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: very nice and clean. bathroom toiletries by L'Occitane!

review.title: Nice hotel, not so nice location
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and well presented. The rooms were large and had L'occitane goodies in the bathroom which always helps to impress. The hotel was a bit impersonal though compared to another Kimpton hotel that I have stayed at in SF (the Triton) and the location is not great. Fisherman's wharf is a bit like a cheap seaside resort, very touristy and there were several tramps and scary looking people around.

review.title: Best ever, will go back!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was not only clean and plesant, the staff was helpful and friendly. You are right on the pier and withing walking distance of Pier 39 and 33 the sailing point for Alcatraz. We had a great time, and I plan on going back next year.

review.title: Peaceful & relaxing
review.reviewText: Argonaut Hotel was comfortable an relaxing. Arrival at the hotel was slow because parking is by valet and they were backed up at the time. We didn't have problems picking up our car. Loved the location it was close to restaurants, bars & cable car.

review.title: Overall good stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, but room service not very good. Cold coffee, not enough staff.

review.title: Nice hotel on wharf
review.reviewText: We liked the Argonaut. Very kid friendly. Friendly staff. Expensive, but everything in wharf area is. Would recommend to others who want to stay in wharf area.

review.title: Wonderful location
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in the best part of San Francisco - Pier 39. Most everything is located within walking distance. If not, the cable cars run within blocks of the hotel...

review.title: Location is fabulous!
review.reviewText: What a beautiful hotel this is and close to everything. The staff were very helpful and kind. The location was perfect.

review.title: Great Hotel. Great Location
review.reviewText: Luxury and convenience in a wonderful city. The hotel, room, and service were outstanding. Highly recommended!

review.title: Great Hotel by the Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location at the edge of the Fisherman's Wharf area.We went for Memorial Day weekend with our two kids (12 & 9). Easy access to the city from the Hyde/Powell cablecar line which is right next door and a block from Ghiradelli square (a favorite with the kids!). Only downsides: no pool, could take a long time to get your car out of the valet (I wouldn't get a car next time).

review.title: Argonaut - great location
review.reviewText: We loved the Argonaut. The staff was very friendly and met all of our needs. The location was great. We had a great view of Aquatic Park and the cable car station. The room was well done and spacious.

review.title: awesome hotel
review.reviewText: room was very nice. nice wine cocktail hour available. it was awesome room, perfect location. you can walk anywhere on the wharf!! my mother is 70 y/o and we went anywhere walking and enjoyed great food and great entertainment. the restaurant was excellent in the hotel!

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Nice place with good service and clean room. The pillows were a bit too soft for my taste but that's nitpicking. The only substantial issue we had was a crying baby next door on our last night. The adjoining room door let sound pass pretty easily so we heard her until she cried herself to sleep at a late hour. The rest of our stay was outstanding. This is a great, central location with easy access to many sites, tours, and easy transport to the rest of the city.

review.title: Clean, friendly, comfortable
review.reviewText: This is a neat, tidy, friendly hotel with comfortable rooms. I would highly recommend to other travellers.

review.title: Definitely would recommend
review.reviewText: The staff of the Argonaut Hotel made our stay extremely enjoyable. From the bellhops to the housekeeping staff, everyone had a great attitude and went above and beyond to accomodate us. The wine reception in the evening had a great turnout. We didn't participate, but saw it in full swing on several occasions as were were entering/leaving the hotel. The location, at one end of Fisherman's Wharf was perfect. Lots of restaurants, attractions and shops were well within walking distance. I would recommend a room on the 3rd or 4th floor since the lower levels are sometimes at pedestrian level due to the hill on which the hotel is built.

review.title: One fatal deal breaker for this Hotel
review.reviewText: I usually liked Kimpton hotels, and I looked at Expedia's feedback and ratings before I booked at the Argonaut and stayed for 5 nights. Location: 5+ great location, makes going to all the tourist attractions and tour buses very easy, the start of the cable car is just a block away, so is Fisherman's Wharf. Service: 4 - very friendly staff and doorman Room decor/cleanliness: 4 - nice linens, clean, and good shower pressure. Sound insulation: 0 - This is the fatal flaw of the hotel - It could be a hit or miss as some of the walls are separated by 3 layers of bricks, however in my room, I could hear everything next door, including people JUST moving on their beds, and you know what else. Then upstairs kids crying and running around, every single conversation, footsteps - good thing I brought a pair of ear plugs, but this is just not what I expected out of a Kimpton / 4 star hotel. Unless you are into sound voyeurism, then don't stay here, unfortunately.

review.title: The Usual Klimpton Excellence
review.reviewText: The Argonaut near Fisherman's Wharf kept up the excellent reputation I associate with the Klimpton chain of Hotels. Sometimes they have a strong theme as this one does, or are more of a boutique establishment, or remind you of a good European treasure you want to return to again and again. The service was outstanding, the decor refreshing, the restaurant top notch, and the room very spacious, clean, and welcoming. I would highly recommend this to anyone traveling to San Francisco.

review.title: room with a view
review.reviewText: Great location. Go ahead and pop for the bayview room. It's definitely worth it!

review.title: A great catch hotel at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel is the best hotel in the area. It's got great decorating and even though you are steps away from the SF bay, it's always warm inside! Located in a "good and safe" part of the city. Highlights include nautical themed rooms and the uber-friendly door man who works mornings. Definitely worth it!

review.title: Great nights sleep
review.reviewText: Best comfortable mattress Should have 10 min. free internet access Peanuts/pretzels w/wine hour Coffee available early am and late pm

review.title: Right in the Heart of It
review.reviewText: San Francisco can be daunting when driving but this hotel is right in the heart of it on Fishermans Wharf. Valet parked us, we entered into a tasteful nautically designed lobby with a warm fire flickering, and were quickly escorted to our room. The room, also nautical, was on the street level but still was quiet. I-pod docking station with radio, internet connections, hairdryer... We walked to Scomas (out the front door, two blocks down on the left through an alley) for dinner- a recommendation from the valet. Food was great. All attractions nearby. A hugely positive stay and I've been traveling all my life!

review.title: San Francisco's Best
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a hotel in the middle of it all stay at the Argonaut! There are so many things within walking distance even close enough for my Mother who sometimes can not walk that far. There are tons and tons of resturants and shopping. You can even see many sights right from the hotel... Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz Fishermans Wharf! Awesome experience.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Very nice location, quiet and close to public transportation and other activities. The hotel is very comfortable and the staff pleasant as well.

review.title: Nice Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and the theme was adorable. Close to shopping, attractions, transportation. Just what we wanted.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: After so much research for our trip, The Argonaut hotel rated so well on Expedia. We were not disaapointed. Location was excellent and the rooms were great. Staff were very helpful. Kids loved the treasure chest. Also supplied a bottle of champagne for wedding aniversary that was a nice surprise. Would stay here again when travelling to USA.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay for 3 nights to discover San Francisco. We had a nice room with view on the Golden Gate. We enjoyed the cable car which was 100 meter next to the hotel. Service was pretty good. The staff was very helpfull.

review.title: Theme was obviously targetted to the family market, a little disney
review.reviewText: carpets dirty, bathroom amenities was a refreshing suprise, nice free wifi, room service was prompt and food quality was very good. front service was goofy, as they always are..extra effort to help with limo and taxi's seemed a bit more than necessary...c

review.title: Good location, but
review.reviewText: The location is great. and the service, etc, is strong. but the hotel, listed as Boutique, feels more like a cheesey Vegas theme hotel.....also, our bed was terribly soft (nearly fell out of it a few times....) and when we mentioned this to the front desk they informed us they had just replaced all beds, and so they would all be like that.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is right in Fisherman's Wharf with immediate access to the cable car line and all the activities on the Wharf. The hotel staff members were all professional and helpful. The room, while a bit small, was perfect for our family of four. There are plenty of wonderful places to eat within walking distance and the hotel restaurant is quite good though a bit on the expensive side. Take a drive to North Beach area to Mona Lisa's for excellent Italian food!

review.title: Great Place to Stay - Highly recommend it!
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Argonaut. You can't beat the location and staff were friendly, helpful and courteous. The wine reception every evening was a real treat! WE would absolutely stay there again if we were to visit San Francisco. We highly recommend it!

review.title: The Best of Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: What a fun place to stay. See the Golden Gate Bridge from your room.

review.title: I found my favorite hotel
review.reviewText: I love this hotel, I felt like I was at home, even better because I didn't have to do anything but enjoy!

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, very comfy beds and friendly staff

review.title: friendly hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel has a very good location the staff were very quick and friendly in doing there work and any request was handled very swiftly. We were on the 2nd floor which is on street level towards the rear of the Hotel so some street noise is heard , mostly in the mornings when the bins were cleared . The room numbering was a bit confusing and took us a bit of time to find our room but a member of staff was able to set us straight . Good Hotel.

review.title: Excellent Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf area
review.reviewText: An excellent choice for a smaller upscale hotel without the stuffiness of most 4 / 5 star hotels. Staff and concierge are very attentive and informative. Went there for 30 year anniversary and concierge made point to remeber and greet us each day. Wine party at 4pm each day was a hit. Sample California wines and meet the other guests. Hotel is close to Cable Car station and next to a park that has great views of the bay and Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: I wouldn't have stayed here if it weren't for the great deal on Expedia because we just needed a place to rest our heads for a few hours and the regular rate for this hotel is too expensive for that. But what a treat! We checked in really late and as described, the hotel has a tasteful nautical theme. The lobby and rooms are fun and cozy, and the staff are helpful and friendly. Early the next morning, I was able to walk just a few short steps to the small beach at the end of Fisherman's Wharf and drink my tea watching the gentle waves lapping on the shore by my feet. Later we rode the cable car from the end of the line which is by the hotel and had Irish coffee at the Buena Vista which is also by the hotel. We were really only there a few hours but it was idyllic. I'm so glad we stayed at this hotel.

review.title: great bay experience!!!
review.reviewText: your first experience was the great people that work there. we felt very welcomed and they helped us with our car and then stored our luggage because we were 2 hrs. early, since your are right on the warf, we walk and ate till our room was ready, in facted they directed us to a local favorite spot. It was great. My husband was on crutches and they offered to bring ice and what ever we needed, the room was wonderful especialy if you like restored buildings.there was all the old brick still showing and the theme of the room was very natical/whimscal. very clean, and liked the walk right in shower and bench. extra towels, lots of pillows, and goodies in the frige. I would recomend this place if you have a handicap, or just can't get around very well. You are right there in the midst of the whole bay experience, it was so wonderful, I would do it all again in a heartbeat. oh yea! the veiw from our room was awsome, the whole golden gate bridge and bay, beautiful!!!

review.title: Argonaut Hotel @ Fisherman's Wharf - a Kimpton Hotel.
review.reviewText: Great location, charming hotel with nautical theme and welcoming staff. Located in the cannery building on the far end of the Wharf area its near the trolley turnaround and across from the bay. Some rooms even have a view of the Golden Gate. Rooms were overly comfortable, great beds, original brick walls and beams . Room service available and the Blue Mermaid restaurant is attached and open the entire day. We loved our stay and the location and will make the Argonaut our hotel of choice in San Francisco.

review.title: highly recommend
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel and location

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was awesome and could not have been located better. Be prepared to pay them to park your car though. About $30 per day, I think. Try the Mojito's in the Hotel bar!!

review.title: Pleasantly Suprised
review.reviewText: City /Tourist Centre Hotels are what they are; generally impersonal, small rooms and often expensive. The Argonaut therefore came as a pleasant suprise. Friendly attentive staff, clean large size rooms and reasonable rates. If you can run to it, go for one of the upper floor rooms. Quieter and (if you use your imagination) a view of the bay or bridge. As a regular traveller, I was impressed and would willingly recommend.

review.title: Great Hotel and concierge
review.reviewText: Ok there are touristy shops nearby but hey we are tourists and reviewers have clearly not been to an English seaside town! We really liked the hotel - clean comfortable close to lots of great attractions good gym for a hotel etc etc. Concierge gets a special mention for saving us lots of money with his suggestions for car hire and other useful facts about the locality.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I was a bit nervous about staying in Fishermans Wharf as I had heard it was very touristy and quite naff. However, this hotel is right on the fringe of the really cheesy bit, so you can avoid it completely if you wish, but is perfectly placed at the end of the Powell/Hyde Cable Car and next to the green spaces leading to Fort Mason, so for getting around the city it is an ideal location. I was travelling with a 10 year old and a 6 month old, the older one loved the cheesiness, but also loved the other bits of the city that we saw. The 6 month old appreciated all the fuss the hotel staff made of him, and the little beach opposite the hotel. No hesitation in recommending this pretty, clean and well-placed hotel. King size room plenty big enough and lovely shower and bathroom.

review.title: Best possible location
review.reviewText: Ideal location for family travel. Although technically on Fisherman's Wharf, it would be more accurate to say that this hotel is on the water, adjacent to the Maritime Park and 1/2 block from a cable car turnaround. It was approximately 6-7 blocks or 20 minutes walk from Pier 39 and in a MUCH more upscale/safe neighborhood. We had debated staying in Union Square, and felt very lucky to have selected such a clean and convenient location that was right on the water. The concierge directed us to phenomenal restaurants every night, and we used a MUNI pass to get everywhere. Best restaurant: Hunan Home's in China Town. The only complaint is that, although our room was the "deluxe" one we were promised, the hotel claimed that it contained Queen sized beds. We feel certain that the beds were Double or Full sized (we have both at home, and the Double ones aren't big enough for us to sleep in comfortably side-by-side). I think the hotel should publish the dimensions of the beds, since they seem to have a sizing system that is different from the rest of the world.

review.title: absolutely nice and cosy hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent "Mermaid" Restaurant

review.title: Romantic Getaway
review.reviewText: This was a very relaxing trip. The people were friendly and very helpful.

review.title: Wanted to stay longer!
review.reviewText: We had such a great time at the Argonaut! Great old brick architecture amaxzingly transformed by superior design and appoitnments! Location was fantastic, too! tons going on all around and convenient to shops and restaurants. We didn't get a chance to take advantage of all the plusses, like the wine reception in the evening, but it was the best stay we have had in a very long time. Will definitely return!

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: I like the place but the problem is they don't have a gym.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Great location, GREAT staff, great servise

review.title: Great SF location
review.reviewText: The hotel was everything we were looking in our visit to SF. Great accommodations with friendly and helpful staff . Excellent location for many tourist attractions.

review.title: Will be back
review.reviewText: We had a great time here. The hotel was very nice and the employees were very helpful and nice too. We would stay there again for sure. It's walking distances to about anywhere you want to go. Quiet inside your room. Kids can't wait to go again.

review.title: Good hotel,great location
review.reviewText: A perfect location for seeing all the sites .The staff were very helpful.Beware of the valet parking,the cost can quickly mount up but it is very convenient.I would definitely stay again.

review.title: Excellent Choice for Families
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel - very convienient location. Very friendly hotel staff. Starbucks coffee in room was a plus! Rent a bike next door and bike over the Golden Gate Bridge. Rooms facing the interior courtyard are larger if you can request it.

review.title: Argonaut Hotel - S.F.
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and well maintained. Very close to Ghiradelli Square & Fishermans Wharf with park and beach located in same block. Bags were immediately taken to room and cab was waiting for us in morning on return trip to airport. Room was on second floor and window was on street level, so had to keep closed to avoid people looking in. That was only negative. Would recommend to those wanting room close to the Wharf and Square.

review.title: We'll be back
review.reviewText: Great location, convenient to touristy bits as well as a wide variety of excellent restaurants and diverse downtown shopping. Good to come home to the Cocktail Hour in the Lobby each evening. Friendly, helpful staff throughout all levels. Will certainly stay at Argonaut again.

review.title: Very nice new hotel
review.reviewText: Was a very nice hotel, I think almost brand new. Nautical theme if you are into that kind of thing. Avoid rooms 201 and 202 (I had 202) as it is right at street level at the back of the hotel. We were unable to open the shades without people able to look in from 1 foot away. Didn't try the restaurants as there are so many around. Right next door to Jacks pub (68 beers on tap) which worked for us.

review.title: Didn't live up to the hype....
review.reviewText: After reading the reviews on Expedia, we were looking forward to a great experience at the Argonaut. Given that we were on our honeymoon from Australia, we did not choose our hotels lightly and picked 4-5 stars for the full 3 weeks while in the US. While the location is great, unfortunately the Argonaut did not live up to its reputation. The check-in was less than civil, concierge unhelpful and the quality of room lacklustre. Add to this parking at an crazy additional fee of US$39 plus tax per night and you get a hotel that is simply just not value for money. While not expecting special treatment, upon informing check-in that it was our honeymoon, they just grunted and informed us that the only room they had available was facing an industial airconditioning unit....fantastic service!

review.title: Great Place with Kids
review.reviewText: Right on Fisherman's Wharf. We had 2 rooms. They had comfortable beds and nice bathrooms. They could have been a bit bigger but overall, just fine. The hotel sits across the street from the water and you can get rooms with views of the bay but we chose to have quiet rooms since we didn't expect to spend much time looking out the window. The rooms were quiet, easy to sleep in without too much light or excessive A/C noise. Lots to do right out the door. Within walking distance to North Beach for fine dining and many casual restaurants right outside the door. We have 3 teens who were never bored. We filled the days with site seeing outside of the immediate area then came back for dinner and a walk around the wharf area and all its cheesy, fun night life.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We came back for the 4th time. Great rooms, great service, great location. We were given a bad room near the elevator, and we asked for and received immediately a better room. Wine tasting at 5:00pm and a great restaurant on the premises.

review.title: One of the Best AAA+++
review.reviewText: This is definitely one of the best hotels my wife and I have ever stayed in. Location was great as well as the excellent decor. Everything was top shelf. Everyone who visits San Francisco needs to stay here. It was fantastic.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: l thought the Argonaut was great, with an unbeatable location for San Francisco tourist activities. Alcatraz and the Golden Gate were visible from the front of the hotel, and the cable car was around the corner. Despite all the activity on Fisherman's Wharf, the large rooms were very quiet. Bike rental is available in the same building. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: This hotel is awesome, location, ambiance, comfort.
review.reviewText: It's all around very good, except if you are driving be ready to pay dearly for parking... This hotel has a great personality, it's in a nut shell "the place to be in Fisherman's Wharf"

review.title: Highly Recommended!!!
review.reviewText: At the end of March 2008 we stayed at the Argonaut in a Club View room (2 queen beds) with a view of the Golden Gate Bridge. The room was very clean and more spacious than the pictures I had seen on the internet. The service was FANTASTIC!!! The bar/restaurant had excellent food and the staff was incredible. They are also pet friendly (watched a beautiful Blue-Nose Pitbull get checked in with his family)! It's across the street from a park, so if you have pets this place is in a great spot! The location couldn't have been any better - walking distance from everything on the wharf and the Hyde cable car is next to the hotel. I will be staying there again the next time I visit San Francisco!

review.title: Enjoyed the Argonaut!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a great place to stay. The location is perfect. Walking distance to Ghiradelli Square and Fisherman's Wharf. It is adjacent to the cable car turnaround for transporation to China Town and Union Square. The hotel is clean and updated with a fun theme. The wine reception each evening is great.

review.title: LOVED IT!!!
review.reviewText: Awesome location. Friendly, helpful staff!

review.title: A gem
review.reviewText: We are very fussy about hotels, and too often disappointed by some of the 4 and 5 star city hotels. On our latest trip to NYC & and the West Coast, the Argonaut was an exception. It is a wonderful boutique hotel but don't be put off by the boutieque tag, it has excellent service to match. Also, it is in a very touristy part of San Fran (Fisherman's Wharf) but there was absolutely nothing to suggest a touristy hotel. The room seemed to have been totally refurbished only a couple of months ago, and the quality of furnishings (especially the heavenly beds) was top notch. It is a bit pricey but I don't mind spending if I know I am getting real class. We would highly recommend this hotel and we will stay again! If you are in San Fran for a few days as a tourist, there is no better place. I was with my family but if I am in San Fran on business, I would probably choose this place too, rather than stay downtown which is relatively boring. A tip for those bringing a rental car. Try and get a hybrid car like a Toyota Prius - valet parking is normally $38/ day but free for hybrids (there is no self parking). The hotel is within walking distance of Pier 39 (where most tours start) and also Pier 33 (Alcatraz ferry) although that's a solid 12 mins walk. Many places to eat within 5 mins walk, and shops selling the usual touristy fare. Shop across the road sells Levi 501s at $50.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This place was great. I was a little leery at first, because the front desk was a little busy and I didn't want to rush them. The rest of the stay was awesome, I was able to open the window and get the fresh SF air, love that!

review.title: Great Location, Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed for two nights in a deluxe Queen room. Tons of space and very clean. Great location, especally if you want to walk around Fisherman's Wharfe. Had a great wine hour reception as well.

review.title: Terrific location and hospitality
review.reviewText: The location is terrific, just close enough to Fisherman's Wharf for access but far enough to avoid the noise/crowds. The boutique feel and whimsical marine room decorating with the bay view really made us feel pampered and on vacation. My only disappointment was the need to pay to use the 2 computers in lobby for internet -- especially at the rate you are paying to stay there. Petty. Should be included.

review.title: Fantastic position., clean and friendly hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great position to catch the trolley to Union Square for shopping and also to walk to Pier 39 and the shops and restaurants in Fisherman's Wharf. There are some nice places to eat close by depending on your tastes. We had an inner hotel room which was very quiet and was good after a busy shopping day in the city and after our 3 hour bus tour which was a great way to see all the sights. I would most definitely stay at the Argonaut again. And would give it 5 out of 5 for everything.

review.title: Very Good location however there is nothing especial and a very bad service
review.reviewText: Internet doesn t work very well and it took me a lot of time to wait. The window of my room was located just beside the sidewalk. Too much noise. You feel that people are walking besides your bed. The housekeeping didn t clean the room until 5 o clock.

review.title: If you are going to be a tourist do it right.
review.reviewText: This sweet little hotel puts you right in the middle of the Fisherman's Wharf experience. The cable car is steps away as are most of the fun things to do on the wharf. Being next to a park keeps the tourist clutter close but not in your face. You can easily walk to dine in North Beach or the Chinatown restaurants. Lets face it, sometimes it is fun to be a tourist and do all the tacking things that go along with that and still be able to step away to a little more upscale adventure at your whim. This hotel is set up to do it all for you. The people at the desk and door were fantastic, just ask and it is yours.

review.title: High quality hotel in tourist district
review.reviewText: This is a high quality hotel serving the tourist trade in San Francisco - it is therefore located bang in the centre of the Fisherman's Wharf area, with the bay literally outside the door and excellent views from many rooms that look out to the Golden Gate Bridge. If this is where you want to be, this is the hotel for you (especially given excellent discount rate at Expedia). But be aware that this area is a long way out from the downtown city centre, and from the BART system, though you can get into this by taking the nearby cable car. Hotel staff were polite, efficient and friendly and, most importantly, switched my room without fuss in a few minutes. The reason I changed is because my room was effectively at street level and I did not want the noise or intrusion that this would create. As this almost certainly applies to a lot of rooms, I suggest you ask for rooms on 3rd or 4th floor when booking. The rooms were large, well equipped including free internet connection, and well maintained and cleaned. Having a free glass of wine at 5:oopm is a great bonus if you are around then. I also used the gym facilities which were fine. Breakfast is not included and that's probably good news. There is a hotel restaurant which is open for all three meals, but it is relatively expensive and not particularly special.

review.title: great stay here
review.reviewText: We had a great visit first time around. hotel was clean and comfortable, I always missed the free wine hour. liked that the trolley bus was just around the corner and the trams were on the other side. Try and ask for an outside room view. top of the line hotel. we loved our stay for two nights.

review.title: Location is great!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a perfect location for a "tourist" trip to San Francisco; next to the trolly, Ghiradelli Square and on Fisherman's Warf. The room was very clean and the nautical decoration was fun. The only negative is the parking situation. It is valet only and it is pricy.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was excellant. Great service, nice space in rooms. Meeting room was comfortable, as well.

review.title: We'll be Back!
review.reviewText: The room decor was fun and the view (golden gate bridge) from our window was breathtaking.

review.title: AWESOME!
review.reviewText: This hotel was made for me & others who love the nautical motif! From the unique brick walls, to huge overhead beams, to nautical decor finished perfectly, to the amazing staff..... wish I could've moved in!

review.title: Loved our stay!
review.reviewText: The staff at our hotel was super friendly. Customer service is very obvious amongst the staff. Every employee made sure that our stay was fantastic. The hotel is close to the fishers warf and it is and ideal location. We were able to get around by foot. The rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable. We would stay there again!

review.title: Comfort living away from home
review.reviewText: Comfort living away from home

review.title: Our favorite in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very plesant friendly, efficient staff makes this Fisherman's Wharf hotel a really enjoyable stay. The evening wine reception is a nice touch. The restaurant is reasonably priced, preparing a pretty basic menu really well. Don't miss their clam chowder - they serve a number of delicious variations - and their garlic-parmesan french fries.

review.title: Very quiet
review.reviewText: Very quiet place to stay. Hotel staff very freindly and helpful.

review.title: Would go back again!!
review.reviewText: Great location, hotel really nice and free wine and beer between 5pm and 6pm in the lobby!

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: Staff is very friendly and helpful. Concierge provided very good information on location of different sites to see. Evening wine tasting is an enjoyable added bonus! Hotel is spotless.

review.title: Best in San Francisco and Affordable
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel was outstanding. Great location, great service and great room. Would recommend arranging your car service prior as it is in a quieter part of San Francisco to avoid any delays.

review.title: Excellent service and facilities
review.reviewText: From the time of arrival to leaving the service of the hotel staff was exemplary, the rooms were very spacious and clean. Access to restaurants and sightseeing was very convenient, and the view over the bay excellent. If I return to San Francisco I will definitely be staying in Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: We were thrilled with this property, and the fact it is in a museum is really cool. You can catch a cable car to anywhere from here!

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: My husband and I were traveling to San Francisco on business and wanted to stay at a nice place before we headed back home. We were very happy with this hotel. Everyone there made us feel special..The bed was not the best, but the room was great..Very cute..The parking there was terrible and you have to use the hotels valet parking (not cheap)..Over all we loved it and plain on staying there again..

review.title: Great place!! Will be back!
review.reviewText: This hotel is very clean and friendly enivornment!!

review.title: Would go back to this hotel.
review.reviewText: The only downside to this hotel was that they were having a party the day we arrived so the in room service menu was limited to just hamburgers which was a great disappointment. It was also farther to fisherman's wharf then I had expected. But overall we were very satisfied with this hotel and would go back again.

review.title: Very good value for money
review.reviewText: Very nice big rooms. Standard rate do give a dull view to a a court but it was not an issue for us as we were always out. The rates are higher for a nicer view. Service was good. We were very happy with the hotel and the food (hotel restaurant)

review.title: nice hotel but smoke smell in our room was awful
review.reviewText: Everything was really nice there but our room smelled like someone had been smoking pot in there before we checked in it was really bad. The came up and sprayed air freshner and put in an air purifier so it went away quickly before we came back from dinner. But still the maids had to smell it why it wasn't fixed before we checked in I can't say. Other than that wonderful rooms quiet nice big, had an overall nice stay.

review.title: Enjoyed every minute.
review.reviewText: Excellent service, comfort, and quality. Near the famous cable car line, historic street car line, and city bus stops. You really don't need a car, and if you do, there are car rental agencies close by!!

review.title: It is a wonderful hotel nearby the harbour.
review.reviewText: Direct connection with the cable car to go downtown. A perfect restaurant for breakfast and dining. Perfect service at the reception.

review.title: Would stay again, no question!
review.reviewText: Great location, staff and facility. Interior room was very quite, albeit on the small side with double/double configuration. The king room I looked at was perfect. Can't get a cup of coffee at 3:00 am, (6:00 am EST) brew in-room only, and wake the family, NOT. Thought the front desk would offer a cup. They didn't even know Denny's is open 24 hours, 5 blocks away. Truely, this was only complaint.

review.title: Great hotel....thin walls
review.reviewText: The staff was great! The hotel was beautiful. The walls were a bit thin though. You could hear full conversations through the walls. They could use some insulation between the walls for sure.

review.title: Excellent!!
review.reviewText: This was our 2nd time to stay at the Argonaut and yet again the Hotel on every aspect was excellent. Can't fault a thing and would highly recommend it.

review.title: Primo Location
review.reviewText: Location is perfect, service is top-notch, rooms are good size and upbeat, restaurant is right next door with great food. This was our 2nd visit and it met all our needs. We'll be back! P.S. Don't forget the Irish Coffee at Buena Vista just a block away.

review.title: A++ ambiance and service!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel in early January, 2008. Everything about this hotel is perfect - from the friendly welcome at the front door, to Leo's great service as the consierge and including the free cocktail hour in the comfortable lobby. Everywhere you look, you are reminded of the nautical theme - and this is done with class and creativity. Our room with 2 queen beds was super clean and exceedingly comfortable and maintained the nautical theme to a 'T'. The hotel location is perfect as well. Enjoy great / reasonably priced food at the Blue Mermaid attached to the hotel (also provides good room service). We can't wait to return to San Fran and to the Argonaut Hotel. A++

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel for two night before traveling to Hawaii. The hotel is clean and the staff is very helpful. Great location to many attractions.

review.title: Worth Every Penny
review.reviewText: We have passed by and visited in the past but never stayed. This was our first time and the hotel is outstanding. From the door man to the maids, all are friendly and more than helpful. The complimentary wine tasting each night is a great perk. 24 hr valet service with no in/out restriction is great. My wife was spoiled so we will be staying here again. "Worth Every Penny!"

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: We had an excellent stay for 2 nights in November. Service was first class and non intrusive. Would recommend to friends and definately stay again if in San Francisco. Location could not be better.

review.title: Great Christmas Trip
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Argonaunt. The rooms were spotless,and very comfortable, especially the bed. Best nights sleep I have ever had while traveling. The staff was always ready to help. When we needed directions or had questions about San Francisco they were always ready with the answers or knew where to get the answers. We would definitely stay at the Argonaunt again.

review.title: Would definitely stay again!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in an excellent location on the Wharf. As for the hotel itself, it was very comfortable, the rooms quite spacious and very clean, and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: The noisiest hotel I've ever stayed in
review.reviewText: The hotel is stylish and very clean. Our room, although not huge, nor with a particularly inspiring view, was spotless. However, the noise in the room was unbearable! The separating walls between rooms were apparently made of plasterboard, although the aesthetically-pleasing wooden support beams give the impression of sturdiness it must have been a cheap and quick solution to convert the hotel. We could hear EVERY word of our neighbours, but not only that we could hear the rustle of plastic bags and the tear of trainer velcro - surely this isn't normal?
