(I'm writing this with the sorest ears after having to wear ear plugs every night for a whole week, just to get a bit of shut-eye). The only other issue was with the food in the hotel restaurant. This was probably our fault for booking a hotel so near a waterfront reknowned for its seafood, but as much as I'd like to try out the local food,I have a severe allergy to shellfish and there were only two dishes on the main menu as an option. Although it sticks with the theme of Fisherman's Wharf it would be sensible to cater for all guests a little more. The service was good and the doormen, in particular, were pleasant and cheery.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Having been boggled by the amount of choices of hotels available, we were thrilled with what we got. The staff were massively friendly and helpful, and the rooms were interesting as well as comfortable with all the mod cons we could have wanted, with the exception of tea making facilities. It seems that a decent cup of tea does not exist in USA. Free drinks were fab and the reataurant brought out nibbles too. Restaurant was good if a bit pricey. Would definitely go back again.

review.title: Excellent Upscale place to stay in the heart of Fishermans' Warf.
review.reviewText: Upon entering the upscale, nautically decorated hotel, you forget the hustle of fisherman's warf right outside your door. The cable cars pick you up within feet of the hotel. Our room was fabulous (plush and quite) with a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge and the cable cars. I was worried about the noise level being off such a busy street but it was one of the quietest hotels we have ever stayed in.

review.title: I'd Return
review.reviewText: I recommend the hotel. The exercise facilities were great. The animal print robes have got to go. The television is too far away from the bed and my wife ahd to look over me to view it. A wall mounted TV at the foot of the bed would make the a ten. The food at the Blue Mermaid was just okay. The garlic cheese fries were real bad.

review.title: Great hotel - Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is perfectly located for Fisherman's Wharf attractions - close to bus stops, cable cars and F-line trams. Many restaurants within walking distance. Service is very good, staff friendly and helpful. Free glasses of wine/beer for an hour in the lobby every evening are a plus.

review.title: GREAT CHOICE!
review.reviewText: I cant wait to go back. Staff was very nice and helpful. Room was always clean and neat. Bed was actually tooooo comfortable (I could have stayed in all weekend). I cant wait for another SF trip. I will recommend to all my friends as well.

review.title: Cozy and fun! An attraction in its own right!
review.reviewText: Excellent location in Fisherman's Wharf - walking distance to many sights (directly across from Hyde St. Pier), including trolley transportation. Enjoyed the unique history of the building (including attached Maritime Museum) and the evening wine tastings by the fireplace. Surprisingly family-friendly for a sophisticated, boutique hotel! Excellent and amiable staff -- cheerful and attentive even during the busy holiday season.

review.title: Finest Hotel in San Fran..........
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The greatest stay ever. I hope to return to San Fran soon and will certainly be booking at this wonderful place.

review.title: Look for a deal on parking
review.reviewText: I was overall pleased with the hotel and location. I wish the bathrooms had an exhaust fan so the shower curtain wouldn't get " pulled in " while showering but that's my only concern with the hotel itself. I would suggest looking for a deal on parking, however. I wasn't prepared for the $54 bill for valet parking. Will I stay there again, absolutely.

review.title: A treasure of a hotel
review.reviewText: Open mouths of delight about sums up our satisfaction with the Argonaut. As you know, it's actually a converted cannery building. The rooms are well appointed, with little luxurious touches like Starbucks coffee and L'Occitane toiletries. And what we like was that the Kimpton Group bothered to have a recycle bin in the room along with the usual waste paperbasket! The location suited us, being at the Wharf, next to Ghirardelli and close to the F-line and the cable cars. We were on the early bird to Alcatraz and could just take a leisurely stroll down to their pier.

review.title: Fantastic hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was better than it looks on the website. We arrived early and our room was not ready so upgraded us to a better room with a view of Alcatraz. Our room was great. The American nautical theme works well. Everything in the hotel seems to be of a very high quality and good taste. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The fire and armchairs in reception were very inviting after a cold winters sightseeing. The location of the hotel is great to just wander out and explore the Wharf. It's also very close to the cable car stops. We will definately stay here next time we are in San Francisco and will recommend to friends.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The staff was very pleasant. The service was exemplary. A 5 star experience ,right on fishermans wharf. Again, the staff is sincerly dedicated to providing a personal experience. Donovan, the doorman, remembered my name and the conversations, small talk and jokes we shared for the long weekend. Many other quality employees made our stay , exceptional.

review.title: Best Hotel on the Waterfront
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Argonaut on two occasions now and will continue to come back. The room was superior and the staff excellent!

review.title: Must go back!
review.reviewText: We loved every aspect of this hotel. Near most of the major attractions, walking around was fun. The staff was excellent. We will definitely be returning.

review.title: Great hotel, but not green.
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were great, but sadly Kimpton Hotels all claim to be environmentally responsible and it was our experience that they were not. We placed the towels on the rack each day we stayed there but they were replaced anyway. And they even replaced the soap each day. We think their cleaning staff have not been trained properly, but regardless the reason, what a sad waste of water and energy.

review.title: Very nice 1st Class Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice 1st Class Hotel with nice nautical theme.

review.title: Best hotel of all of our California hotels
review.reviewText: Wonderful location, in the heart of the Fisherman's Wharf. Bright, clean, modern, with a whimsical feel of the sea. Free wine tasting, from 5pm -6pm everyday in the foyer. A nice way to chat with fellow travelers. Steps away from the trolley system, good restaurants and daily tours.

review.title: we would like to come back again
review.reviewText: The only thing what we missed, was that the breakfest is not includet for a hotel in this category

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This is the second time that we have stayed at this hotel. Everyone one was very helpful. We told them that it was our second visit and when we went back to our room there was a bottle of wine and a beautiful box of truffles. We stayed in a TALL room. This room had a full brick wall and beautiful exposed beams.

review.title: Wonderful Find / Great Location
review.reviewText: The Hotel was great. We loved it, and enjoyed our stay. We will be back! The Hotel saff was awesome! Our only complaint is, only "1" chocolate on the pillow at turn down.

review.title: One Of The Best Rated Hotels In Sanfrancisco: World Traveler Magazine
review.reviewText: I received a copy of the World Travelers magazine and that's where I got the idea to stay at this hotel. The Argonaut was rated as one of the best places to stay in Sanfrancisco. The rooms were adorable, nautical themed, clean, all the comforts of home. Complimentary New York times every morning except Sunday. Starbucks coffee in the room. Maritime museum adjacent to it. Plus they had wine tasting every night 5-6pm. All the employees were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is also in a great location. All the shops and great places to eat so close to the hotel. Ghiradelli Square, trolley cars, fisherman wharf were all within walking distance. It's the old Delmonte packing facility that was changed to one of the most adorable hotels I've stayed in. I told everyone there I'm coming back. You could also rent bicycles next door and ride to the Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Loved the Argonaut
review.reviewText: My son and I stayed at the Argonaut the week of Thanksgiving. He flew in from NYC and I came in from Canton, OH. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful. The only thing that was not OK was the driver that took us back to the airport.

review.title: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.
review.reviewText: The Argounaut was an amazing hotel. Everything was exceptional from the lobby all the way to the room. A very classy place. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. This is the one area where I usually have a problem. The clam chowder in the Blue Mermaid resturant was excellent. And the location for seeing San Francisco was perfect. Right on Fisherman's Wharf and a cable car stop right next door. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: We were very impressed from the moment we walked in the door. Comfortable inviting lobby where you could sit and relax. But once you got to your room - why leave? Lots of space for sitting, and the beds are so comfortable. The shower head eased the aches from full days of site seeing. The only disapoint was a noisy neighbour one evening and our welcome package was given to us as we checked out. Great location at the waterfront, cable car station and very close to the Beuna Vista the home of the Irish Coffee. Safe, Clean and comfortable. Look forward to future visits.

review.title: Great Frisco Stay!!!
review.reviewText: Argonaut Hotel has a great location on Fisherman's Wharf in that it is very convenient to all the great San Francisco sights and yet a few blocks from the most crowded tourist areas. We were celebrating our 30th anniversary and had a bayfront window. The view was stunning - Alcatraz directly out our window and the Golden Gate in plain view to our left!!! Would not hesitate to stay here again - didn't see a hotel we would have swapped ours for. Downside: Can hear adjacent room noise and it's a bit pricey.

review.title: staff
review.reviewText: from the car valet, to the bellman, to the front desk, they were all exemplary. friendly, helpful, courteous are just a few of the positive adjectives i can give. keep up the good training!

review.title: excellent place to stay
review.reviewText: this hotel was wonderful..right in the midst of Fisherman's Wharf..staff was always helpful..room was very comfortable with all amenities..wine hour was a treat..definitely recommended

review.title: Highly Recommend This Hotel!
review.reviewText: Charming king deluxe room with sofa and ottoman. Very comfortable bed. Everthing was perfect. Definitely go to the evening wine reception - always a great crowd and the staff is so friendly. The restaurant was great too. My room overlooked the courtyard where a local musician sang every afternoon (free entertainment!). I liked being within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, yet not in the middle of it. I felt as if I was in a really nice neighborhood rather than a tourist trap.

review.title: Worth the money.
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel in the best location. Good access to the waterfront, restaurants, tours etc. The room is brilliant. Parking is expensive. Was wrongly charged for minibar use, but refunded after I called to enquire why.

review.title: Great Place to stay!!!
review.reviewText: This was my second stay and just as enjoyable as the first! Rooms are impeccibly clean and very comfortable. The staff are great: front desk, housekeeping, and valet. Only downfall is the overpriced overnight parking ($40.00/day).

review.title: Fantastic hotel
review.reviewText: Don't waste your time considering other hotels in San Francisco, the Argonaut is just fantastic. All the staff we encountered from the moment we arrived were helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The room was really clean and beautifully decorated and the beds so comfortable. Some guests have stated that the walls were so thin that they could hear their neighbours conversations but we did not encounter this problem. The Argonaut is in a prime location close to many major attractions which saves a lot of time especially if you are only on a short trip. Don't bother with the Blue Mermaid restaurant, we only tried once for breakfast but the service was really poor. Try instead 'Joanie's Happy Days Diner' which is just around the corner on Columbus Avenue. They do great breakfast at a good price with excellent service. Get there early as its really popular and gets very busy. If you get the chance, hire bikes at Blazing Saddles next door to the Argonaut and cycle over the Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito. If you enjoy fresh fish seek out a restaurant called 'FISH' where you will have a great lunch. Last but not least if you are planning to visit Alcatraz (which is a must) book well in advance as tickets do sell out well in advance and many people were turned away on the day. Next time we visit San Francisco we will definately be staying at the Argonaut so don't delay book today. You won't be disappointed.

review.title: Great place to splurge
review.reviewText: -Pricey but worth it. In a wonderful area of town. -the lobby is awesome and the rooms are even better. Had a view of the street but could see the golden gate bridge. The place is quiet. For a thirty-something there were a alot of older people but we were looking for something low key for the night anyway. -parking is expensive but hey, it's San Francisco. -I wasn't impressed with the Blue Mermaid Restaurant. Had two bad experiences (dinner and breakfast). There are plenty of other places around so go elsewhere. -I really enjoyed it here and would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, loved the nautical theme. Great locations to all the main attractions, majority within easy walking distance and cable car just around the corner. Reasonable food at sports pub. Would recommend, espically to people wanting to stay within the Wharf area. Golden Gate Bridge visible from some rooms and right out front door. We would go back.

review.title: Awesome Hotel
review.reviewText: The cocktail hour in the lobby was a nice added "bonus. THe hotel was beautiful, staff and bell service were very personable!

review.title: Bad service
review.reviewText: I selected this 4-star hotel so that I could enjoy my short stay at SF to the fullest. Arrived Thursday evening and asked about the tickets to Alcatraz which was one of the main reasons for my visit to SF. Hotel staff convinced me that a lot of tickets are available and there is no need to book the ticket. Friday all was sold out until Monday and I needed to leave Sunday. Female concierge was not up to her duties either.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was charming and very clean. We would definitly stay here again. Great hotel in a fun location.

review.title: Great Hotel on the Waterfront
review.reviewText: My husband and I had a great stay at the Argonaut Hotel on Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco. It is just across the street from San Francisco Bay. With a short walk down the street you get a spectacular view of the Golden Gate Bridge. The rooms have a great nautical decor and are quite comfortable. Their staff was very accomodating. We were glad we chose the Argonaut!

review.title: Unforgettable Anniversary
review.reviewText: I checked the ratings of previous travelers but I have to say a few details were not mentioned. When we got to the Hotel, the Bellmen were a delight, extremely cheerful and very well dressed. Front Desk also was great and when we went to our room which was adorable, we had a bottle of champagne waiting for us. Which was a nice touch! We had leopard skin robes which were cute and an umbrella for just in case. The Hotel thinks of everything. Not all Hotels have turn down service everynight but this one does and reminds of the cruises. At night, the maids are sweet and always had ice in one hand and chocolate in another. Loved the Starbucks coffee in the room! Also, the wine reception every night. Everytime we needed to ask for directions or know which was a good restaraunt, we always knew who to ask the bellmen or concierge. I would definitely come again my husband and I loved it!!! :)

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel was ideally located, extremely stylish and had a convenient and delicious restaurant attached, although lunch and dinner were much better than the breakfast.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: We only stayed 1 night here because of the price, but it was definately worth it! Every employee we encountered was friendly and helpful!

review.title: Absolutley Charming
review.reviewText: Great Decor. Rooms were decorated very nice a funny shape but one of the most unique. The service was top notch would definitley stay at this charmer again. The location was superb for dining sight seeing and more.

review.title: So much character!
review.reviewText: It is so great to stay someplace where everything is NOT beige and white! The daily wine tasting in the lobby was very nice -- it turned into a cocktail hour where it was fun to meet and greet other guests!

review.title: Loved it!!!!
review.reviewText: I was extremely satisfied with our stay. Everyone was very curtious and helpful. While the rates were a little expensive. The location was well worth the money. It is walking distance to everything on Fisherman's Wharf. Unless you just want to rent a car and go somewhere else, there was no need for a car. All of the tours started within a block of the hotel. The cable car turn around is just outside your window. What else could you ask for?

review.title: Nice hotel. Superb location
review.reviewText: This is your stop for a vacation in San Francisco. Affordable, good service. Nice details, such as wine tasting every afternoon.

review.title: Great Hotel Slips a Bit
review.reviewText: Don't misunderstand the title of this review...the Argonaut is still a fantastic hotel. I give it a "5" in every rating catagory...great location, great staff, most comfortable bed in existance...but their rates have gone up a lot. Not the room rates, as Expedia got us a fantastic rate on the room, but everything else has really gone up since our last stay. Parking, internet access, honor bar and everything else has really jumped in price in the last two years. That said, we will go back again...regardless of the price. This hotel is worth it! I can't imagine staying any place else in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel and location at Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Great Hotel in a excelent location. But watch parking costs, especially for large vehicles. Consider using a cab.

review.title: SF Trip
review.reviewText: The hotel was convienently located I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms were clean and comfortable. We were on the inside portion of the hotel, only a view of other rooms. But it was quiet, no street noise. Room was narrow, not much space from foot of bed to the dresser. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Nightly wine/beer from 5pm-6pm in the "living room" near the fireplace in the lobby. Great location for cable car and wharf attractions. Hotel restaurant was very good.We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great location and great service
review.reviewText: Great location and great service

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: This is a great tourist hotel within walking distance of some great attractions, restaurants and easy transport links to the shopping district. The staff are very helpful and the free wine tasting hour every evening is a wonderful idea.

review.title: Great San Fran Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel, staff is freindly and helpfull and is close to just about everything.

review.title: Dissatified with parking charges and fees
review.reviewText: First of all it was a very enjoyable stay, the rooms were extremely clean, hotel personnel was very helpful and caring. Enjoyed the complementary beverages that were provided during the evenings. It is in a great location an easy to find as I was form out of town and had never been to San Francisco. The thing that I was most disappointed with was the PARKING. First of all that you have to pay for parking even though you are staying at the hotel and you are also charged an additional fee if you have an oversized vehicle.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel in great location
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was very nice and clean. Looks newly remodeled. However, on our third night we came back to our room to find the strong smell of cigarettes lingering in our room. This is a non-smoking hotel so we could not figure out where the smell was coming from. Our family does not smoke and we were all together all day long. I called down to ask for a manager to come up. He was nice - couldn't tell us where the smell was coming from but was very nice. All other rooms were all booked solid due to an event that weekend or he would have relocated us. He offered to go to Walgreens to get some room spray. Then about an hour later the smoke alarm went off and we had to evacuate. There was not a fire, we were informed the smoke alarm in the kitchen went off. Don't get a room above the restaurant/bar in the hotel - they had a party there and the bass sound from the speakers shook the room until 10:30 p.m. Other than those two experiences, the hotel is nice and clean and the staff was very courteous. Great location. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and the Alacatraz departure area.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel, located right next to the cable cars and the f-line. Hotel was clean, rooms were spacious, great views, restaurant was subpar in both food and service, eat somewhere else.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: Front desk a little snotty and $40 for valet a little pricy but overall a great hotel

review.title: Fabulous staff
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful time. The staff made this stay an enjoyable experience.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, beware of noise
review.reviewText: Love this hotel, clean, wonderful staff and large rooms. The only drawbacks are that there are very small exterior windows for the deluxe rooms (the interior room windows are larger but do not open and face another room) - also, on nice days, if you stay on the courtyard side there is music all day until as late as 11pm so loud you can't even hear your TV. Other than that, wonderful hotel in the BEST location in San Franciso Wharf.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: A great hotel in a great location. the staff were friendly and helpful. every day at 5 they have a happy hour for all hotel guests with free wine and soft drinks for kids - a nice idea as you meet lots of interesting people. They are very welcoming for kids. I would stay here again

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: We were celebrating our 10th anniversary in San Francisco (where we were married). Our stay at the Argonaut made our trip even more special. Everyone from the Valet to the Bartender at the Blue Mermaid was very attentive and pleasant. Our room was very nice with a great view of the bay and Alcatraz. We plan to make the Argonaut "our hotel" in San Francisco!

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel. The attached restaurant, The Blue Mermaid, was good but pricy. The rooms are very nice and very clean and decorated in nautical fashion. Great location. Convenient to cable cars and trolleys. Do not rent a car; they charge for valet parking. You can do everything you need to in San Fran by using public transportation. I would definitely go back to the Argonaut!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We were first time travelers to San Franciso attending the American Dental Association National Convention. We had 3 rooms for us and our staff. We requested rooms with views that they honored for extra cost. Two rooms had views of the Golden Gate Bridge and ours of Alcatraz. The staff was friendly and helpful. We loved being in the heart of the action close to the Piers and good restaurants. They say that September is the best time to be in San Fran and they were right. Our weather was wonderful. From what we could tell, the Argonaut was the only hotel in the pier area. No car needed. We did hear them say that to park a car at the Argonaut was $39.00 a night! We loved the free wine and beer from 5-6 each night.

review.title: A Wonderful Hotel to Stay in!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was a great place to stay in San Francisco...close to everything including the tour offices, restaurants, attractions and the bay! We found the rooms to be a delightful change from any hotel we had previously stayed in....the staff were courteous, prompt and effecient, and the food/service in the restaurant/bar was excellent! The only thing we can suggest that would be a nice addition to the rooms would be a table and chairs on which to eat your room service meals! We would not hesitate to recomend this hotel to anyone!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: A theme hotel done well. Lots of character. Close to everything.

review.title: exceeded my expectations
review.reviewText: the staff was friendly, helpful, professional and always available rooms were in excellent condition could not have asked for anything more in a hotel accomodation would return in a heartbeat

review.title: Wonderful hotel; wonderful stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was beautiful; the staff superb; view unbelievable. We will definitely come back.

review.title: Exellent location - Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: No car needed. Cable Car turn-around is less than a block. Get a MUNI 3 day pass and can ride cable cars and buses as much as needed. Be sure to rent a bike and bike across the Golden Gate Bridge. Alcatraz tour was worth the money and was very interesting. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone. Staff was friendly and service was excellent.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at the Argonaut. The room was clean and well equipped. The staff was wonderful. Everything I wanted to see and do were well within walking distance from the hotel. The hotel restaurant had great food, with prices comparable to other restaurants in the vicinity. I would recommend this hotel. It's not cheap, but I'd absolutely stay there again - and I'd bring my dog with me!

review.title: argonut hotel-FISHERMANS WHARF
review.reviewText: One of nicest hotels that i can remember staying in in a long time, the staff were very helpful, the room was kept spotless, the food was moderately priced ( for an upscale hotel). there is nothing bad to say about the place . a very enjoyable stay was had by all

review.title: Would recommend this hotel to travelers on pleasure trips
review.reviewText: I choose this hotel from the comments on Expedia and was very pleased. We saved a few bucks by not having a view but we were too busy to spend time in our room. It was clean, plush towels, friendly staff, and most of all, a great location. We took the cable cars to many places, could walk to the ferry, and enjoyed the tourist-like atmosphere. The cable cars took us to other areas where we enjoyed where the real people lived and worked. Would recommend this to others.

review.title: Look forward to staying there again, would recommend it
review.reviewText: Everything was very nice and well maintained, staff was very helpful at all times

review.title: scale of 1-10, gets a ten
review.reviewText: great staff, excellant location- close to all attractions. wine reception every nite. It was so good, extended out stay. will be going back soon.

review.title: Great Location & Service
review.reviewText: Although we were a little nervous on the first day of the stay because we had to wait for the room being ready for half a hour after 3pm check-in time, the hotel stuff including front desk, bell boys and valet parking guys were all excellent. We felt that all of them tried to do the best at their jobs and treated us very nice. The only thing I was disappointed was that I couldn't give one of the bell boy, Mr."J"(anonymous) a descent tip. Sorry! I was too buys to take care of our folks and the last day we were leaving, you weren't there!

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The room was maybe a little smaller than expected, but not too small, and it was very comfortable. The complimentary wine reception was a nice way to start the evening. They also booked us onto a very reasonably priced airport shuttle at short notice, and upgraded our room. Looking forward to going back!

review.title: Number One choice of Hotels in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel to stay at. It is on the wharf, but it is quiet. It is a short walking distance to Pier 39, and the cable cars are a half a block away. A nice touch is the complimentary Wine tasting hour every day from 5 pm until 6pm in the hotel lobby lounge. It is a great way to taste California wines and meet people. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Very Comfortable Hotel!!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Argonaut for our anniversary. Everyone was so helpful. The concierge helped us to get a tour to Muir Woods and Wine Country. The location is great. Just walk out the door and a short walk to great restaurants and shopping. The beds were so comfortable and we loved the nautical themes in the hotel and rooms. Loved the wine tasting also.

review.title: I would return in a heartbeat
review.reviewText: One word can describe our stay at the Argonaut - fabulous! The staff were wonderful, attentive and friendly, the room clean and very comfortable and the ambiance of the hotel, spectacular! The hotel is located in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, so most things were within walking distance, or if not, the cable cars were right next door. We couldn't have choosen a better place for our stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Our San Francisco Adventure
review.reviewText: My husband and I visited San Fracisco and chose the Argonaut Hotel from reviewing recommendations from AAA and Foders sources. We were very pleased with the location and the service we experienced there. The hotel is located very close to the cable car line, Ghiradelli Square, THe Buena Vista (great Irish Coffee) and, of course Fisherman"s Wharf, Pier 39 and the Ferry Building! A "top choice"in our book! "Thanks for the memories"!!!!

review.title: outstanding service and comfort
review.reviewText: I have always wanted to stay the Argonaut - the best location in Fishermans Wharf and also the best hotel - by far. The rooms are unique in a historic building and the staff is exceptional. We went on Labor Day Weekend and there was a band playing on the courtyard under our window...with one phone call we were immediately upgraded to a bayview room so that we could have a quieter room. I travel 6-8 weeks a year and know a good hotel when I experience one - this was outstanding.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Loved it, loved it, loved it! The staff was wonderful, the hotel was perfect. Loved the Nautical theme. The way the doorman always greeted you coming & going, you felt like you were coming home to a friend. Highly recommend to anyone wanting to stay at the Wharf area. Just around the corner from cable cars & the street cars. It was far enough from pier 39 to where you were away from the noise & more private. The most noise I heard was from the fog horns on ships.

review.title: Definitely worth the trip!!
review.reviewText: Great location! Cable car access 1 block away..lice music played in several nearby restaurants...Definitely will visit Argonaut again!!!

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Perfectly situated in SF; all the service from car valets, bellmen, to front desk personnel was first class!

review.title: Small Room, but good value.
review.reviewText: My room was very small, but otherwise a good value, and about as good as you'll find in Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We found this a very quaint but up to date hotel with atmosphere and accommodations. We found the restaraunt at the hotel, the Blue Mermaid, to have great food, and the convenience and prices were also pluses. The location of the hotel made it very convenient to walk to many attractions as well as to connect to any mode of transportation needed to get around. We heartily recommend!

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: best service, best location

review.title: We'll stay here on our next visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Loved the wide halls, fireplace with comfortable chairs in the reception area. Our room was large and comfortable and felt like we were on a cruise ship. The best part is the location which is next to the beach, near the cable cars and close to Ghiradelli Square. We could walk to all the sites on Fisherman's wharf. Starbucks coffee in the room both regular and decaf was great.

review.title: Clean, Comfortable and Convenient
review.reviewText: Ideally situated for exploring San Francisco within minutes of good restaurants, bars and public transportation. The room was spacious, clean and tastefully decorated. It was refreshing to find a hotel that uses feathered pillows and duvets and not the usual petro-chemical bi-products that appear to be the norm. If visiting the bay, this hotel and location will not disappoint. Don't forget your running shoes as the path is across the road.

review.title: Exceptional quality for the price.
review.reviewText: This hotel was super clean and extremely well maintained. The rooms had a homey feel, with the exposed brick and super comfortable beds. It didn't even seem like we stayed in a hotel. Perfect location for our two pre-teen sons - next to just about everything we wanted to do in San Fran!

review.title: I'm Sold But the Employee Is Not
review.reviewText: We had a fabulous stay. The hotel was in a great location, check-in was easy. We arrived 30 minutes before the wine tasting in the lobby. The wine tasting gave us a great opportunity to talk to other guests and get information. We were able to get to everything easily from the hotel.This all pleased us because upon check-in the bellman told us as he was escorting us to the room that this location was not a safe place to stay, that we shouldnt wander too far from the hotel, and that the wharf had become run-down and cliche. In his opinion nobody who comes to San Francisco stays at the Wharf anymore. I am pleased that he was wrong.

review.title: Excellent Value
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is clean, with large rooms, and an excellent location at the end of Fisherman's Wharf next to the main cable car turnaround. The open wine and beer reception every day from 5-6pm is a treat.

review.title: Already planning a return visit...
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel is a great hotel. The staffs were all superb, and the rooms were wonderful. We had had a stressful morning travelling the short journey from Las Vegas to San Francisco, and on arrival at the Argonaut all my worries disappeared. The doorman, reception staff and the bell boy were all so enthusiast, and not just about the hotel, but about San Francisco in general. They couldn't stop talking about where we should go, where we should avoid, and continually offered their services for any queries we may have. They really could not have been any more helpful if they had tried. The room in the Argonaut was stunning. The decor is of a nautical theme, but it is done in such a tasteful way. The rooms are large, with a really comfortable bed and a good sized bathrooms. The hotel also benefits from the usual facilities associated with a large business hotel, only this is not! The Argonaut has the feel of a small boutique hotel, and the attention to detail is a credit to all staff working there. A nice touch was the wine tasting held in the lobby each evening. Beers were also available, which was nice, as I had a real taste for the Anchor Steam Beer, brewed in San Francisco. We are thinking of heading towards Lake Tahoe for a bit of skiing in 2008, and will certainly make time to stay at the Argonaut again. A real gem!

review.title: nice digs at fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: a very pleasant, comfortable, fairly recent construction, well situated near Pier41, a trolley line, and a cable-car hub. two-minute walk to the wharfside "chowdah in sourdough" experience. nice rooms with free ethernet hook-up, well-appointed, nice queen bedding; we had a shuttered window with an appealing view. extraordinary staff effort at bat for you. complementary limo service in am to fiancial district; free wine hour pre-dinner. did not try house restaurant-- but a good rep. will return!!!

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: The nautical theme of the hotel, including the room decor, is charming. The location is great for easy access to tourist destinations, whether by walking or public transportation. The staff is the friendliest of any hotel I've experienced in any US city. Our room was a bit small, but with a nice view of the bay, Alcatraz and Hyde pier. A nice touch: the windows open for fresh air. The street is busy, though, and the closed window kept the noise out. The fitness room has very good equipment and plenty of room for floor work. I would stay at the Argonaut again.

review.title: Loved location and ambience
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfect for location and ambience. You are close enough to Fisherman's Wharf to enjoy it but far enough away to be out of the crowds. We had an inside room and, while it was a bit narrow, it was extremely quiet and cute. We loved that you could walk out of the hotel and be at the aquadic center for a long walk and have Ghiradelli Square right next door. We looked at other hotels that we thought about staying at but they were either in a loud location, looked too generic or weren't close to the water. This hotel has it all. They also have a free wine tasting hour at 5:00 daily. The lobby was really cool and the look of the hotel was different enough without being tacky. Will want to go back again.

review.title: Fishermans Wharf and the Argonaut.... WOW!
review.reviewText: What a nice hotel. Free wine every night, right downtown. This hotel is right next to the trolly cars, and is super clean. There is so much to do here, we had a blast!. Get tix to a Giants game, go a little early and have a drink a Momos. Also be sure to get your Alcatraz tix a few weeks ahead of time. Fishermans wharf is only a few blocks a way with tons of excellent places to eat. I willl be back for sure. Great place to stay!

review.title: Great Hotel-Great Location
review.reviewText: Staff was helpful, courteous and professional. Suggest upgrade to Deluxe King. Spacious and comfortable.

review.title: Perfect hotel in San Fran!
review.reviewText: Beautiful rooms, amazing service, and free wine in the evenings. Location couldn't be better!

review.title: Best service ever! Excellent location!
review.reviewText: The staff assisted us from the moment we pulled up to the curb. While we checked in, the bellhop brought us drinks from the Manager's reception in the lobby. Then he took our bags upstairs and answered any questions we had about Fisherman's Wharf and San Francisco. He suggested taking our daughter to the Exploritorium. We did and it was great! Only downside, no pool, but we were so busy it didn't matter.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Located in Fisherman's Wharf, this is a great location. We could get to a lot areas of San Francisco either by walking or taking the Trolley. Hotel was nice and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms are decorated with a nautical theme. We've stayed here before and plan to continue to stay here on future trips.

review.title: What a hotel...............................
review.reviewText: By far the best hotel in the Fishermans Wharf area of San Francisco! We visited in May 2007 for four nights after spending 6 nights in Las Vegas, we love spending time in America but San Francisco is by far the best place we have been. The hotel is lovely, from the Door Man (complete with white gloves and pith helmet) to the Bell Boys (very friendly, always said a genuine hello) to the reception staff and the staff in the adjoining restaurant everyone was very friendly and provided an excellent service. Our room was pristine with all the extras you would expect (toiletries, dressing gown, TV, Video games etc) And what a good idea the free wine (and beer) tasting is, every evening the chance to meet other guests and sample some great wine. The hotel is has an excellent location -2 minutes from a small beach area, a 10 minute walk along the shops to Pier 39 with it's shops, restaurants and the famous Sea Lions, 2 minutes to the cable car stop (get there early to avoid the queues) Not a bad word to say about the hotel, can't wait to go back!

review.title: Great location, Excellent Service!
review.reviewText: It's on a perfect spot, right on Fisherman's Wharf and the decor is great. The hotel staff was extremely helpful. We arrived a little after their wine and cheese reception and were given a complimentary bottle of wine. We were also not happy with the initial room we were given and they immediately changed it for us. I would definitely book it again.

review.title: Great location Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This was a surprise. Great hotel right on Fisherman's wharf near everything and well appointed. A great find. Thanks Expedia!

review.title: one of the best hotels that we have ever stayed at
review.reviewText: The experience was wonderful. It was very clean and comfortable. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this place to anyone. We loved it.

review.title: San Franciscos Best Hotel!!
review.reviewText: We were here for 5 Days as part of our Honeymoon and we both loved it!! The staff are really friendly and very helpful!! We really loved the Nautical Boutique rooms and they were of good size as well, I really loved the shower i put it on and it was so powerful it nearly put me through the wall, thats how like a shower in the morning!! The 5pm free Wine and Steam Beer tasting was excellent and it was always a treat when we got back to the hotel look at watch and realized we'd got back just in time. All in all this hotel is excellent and i would recommend it to everyone from the love sick couple to the businessman or a someone just wanting to explore!!

review.title: Excellent choice in Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my time at the Argonaut. The staff members were friendly and accommodating. My room and the hotel were extremely clean, nicely decorated, and well appointed. I highly recommend this hotel, and the attached restaurant (Blue Mermaid), for both single and family travelers. PS. During my stay, portions of Fisherman's Wharf lost power. The staff at the Argonaut, prepared with glowsticks and flashlights, were readily available to help guests around the dark hotel.

review.title: A True Delight!
review.reviewText: We have stayed in several hotels in San Fran Fisherman's Wharf area, but this is our favorite! We spent three nights here and loved every minute!Our 10 year old loved the "request-a-fish" (a gold fish they will bring to your room to keep you company) but my favorite part was the turn down service (upon request) each night.

review.title: satisfied despite some unpleasant surprise
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel with our 2 children. Both of our kids loved the hotel and the staff were really helpful, especially the staff working at the front desk. There were power outage 4 times during our first night which was a bit scary for the kids. Except these surprises, we were quite satisfied with overall service. The location is just great!!

review.title: Fantastic hotel!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed for five days and if we ever go back we wouldn't consider another hotel. The Argonaut Hotel is perfectly located. We could walk to everywhere we wanted to go. The staff of the hotel treated us as if we were the most important guests. The wine tasting every evening gave us the opportunity to meet people from all over the world. We highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel experience
review.reviewText: We loved the whole stay Argonaut. The service was great. The nightly wine tasting was wonderful and we met several very nice people from all over the country.

review.title: Great Vacation in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. The staff was wonderful and well informed. Every morning they where so upbeat and happy. They where so helpful with tours and renting a car. Will stay here again. Will recommend to everyone.

review.title: The Best Stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was a pleasant find in the busy San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf area. Located within walking distance of Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square and the Hyde Street Cable Car terminus, the hotel was attractive and comfortable. Service and staff were excellent and the concierge knowledgeable of the area and extremely helpful. We will surely book again!

review.title: Very Cool Hotel
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Argonaut Hotel was a great experience for our first time to San Francisco. Make sure you request a room with a bay or street view otherwise you'll get a nice view of another hotel room! Our only complaint was the housekeeping staff was too noisy and would knock once and quickly come in if you don't have your "do not disturb" sign on the door. We froze in July!

review.title: Worth the money!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I wanted something really close to the pier and near everything and the Argonaut was perfect! We were in town while the All Star games were playing and San Francisco was just crawling with people. By the time we checked in we didn't want to go back outside and we found our room so comfortable that we didn't leave the rest of the night! The conceirge was wonderful and helped us with many different questions and concerns we had about everything from transportation to dining choices. This might seem a little pricer when debating between this and perhaps a cheaper hotel but honestly the Argonaut was worth every penny. It's about a 7 minute walk from Pier 39 and everything you could want to do is within complete walking distance. Not to mention you can check your luggage before you're able to check in so that you can enjoy the sites without having to worry. I definitely recommend it to anyone planning on going to Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: My family and I stayed at the Argonaut Hotel in the middle of July. The service was outstanding and the rooms were beautifully decorated. Very comfortable bedding. We loved the complementary wine and cider reception in the late afternoon. We would love to stay there again.

review.title: A refined hotel for the more experienced traveler.
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is the best, directly across from San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf's attractions and within easy walking distance to all Wharf attractions. It is fascinating to see how Klimpton converted a 100 year old cannery into a four diamond hotel with today's technology and walking thorugh parts of it gives you a real sense of history. It is very inspiring. Ive stayed at all of the Wharf hotels but this is the best. It was quiet and tastefully recorated and the staff was great.

review.title: good deal
review.reviewText: good deal for a very nice hotel

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: Attentive staff from the moment we arrived. Valet and Bell captain the best. Very nice and quiet rooms with free internet connection. Food at the Chowder restaurant very good. Great cocktail hour with free wine and a good local beer. Not a complaint but the parking was $40+ daily but if you drive a hybrid it is free! Typical futile California behavior control. Overall a very nice stay and on my next visit my gas guzzler and I know where to stay.

review.title: Best Hotel on the Wharf
review.reviewText: Fantastic location, close proximity to most of the wharf attractions, restaurants & Cable Car. Leave your automobile at home & walk or use the convenient modes of transportation nearby. Very friendly staff, clean & comfortable place. Opt for a room facing outside as the inside rooms are small & view only other windows. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great for Tourists/New to San Francisco
review.reviewText: We came to San Francisco on the tail end of a difficult trip personally. We wanted a little fun and enjoyment, and this hotel and the surrounding area provided that in full. This hotel is "in the action" on the wharf, and is in easy walking distance of several of the city's best sights (Embarcadero, Ghiradelli Square, China Town, and of course, the Wharf). The hotel is in a converted brick warehouse, and has a rustic charm from the outside. Inside, however, it has a sleek, modern maritime decor that somehow feels warm, clean and fresh. The rooms are spacious, very clean, well prepared, and very welcoming. I would DEFINITELY recommend the bay view room. The bellhops, doormen and valets were all eager to please and very serviceable. The restaurant (Blue Mermaid) is very good, as well. In my opinion, the price is a great value and we had a great time. The ONLY problem, and this can be a big problem depending on where you want to go in SF, is that you have to pay for parking (as much as $50 a night if you have a big SUV) and you must valet. This is a big pain if you need to get stuff from your car or intend to drive anywhere. However, they do allow you to pull your car up anytime you want without further charge (aside from tips). Overall, this is a great hotel and very worthy of the Insider's Select rating. It's a special place that will leave you with positive memories.

review.title: THE place to stay!
review.reviewText: A superlative staff. From the front desk,bellman,doorman, and room staff, all the service was far above what I had expected. Courtesy and friendlyness are the keywords to describe the staff. The location of the Argonaut could not be better for a visit to Fisherman's Wharf. I highly recommend for your visit to San Francisco to stay at the Argonaut. This is our fourth leisure trip here and in the future, the Argonaut will bee the only place we will stay.

review.title: Good hotel and location
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and in a great location. Service can be spotty depending on how busy they are. I found that they try very hard and most personnel are friendly.

review.title: Children made to feel very welcome
review.reviewText: Location is superb. There was a treasure box for my three children (all under 10 yrs) to choose from in the reception. Beds very compfortable. Staff very polite and helpful. Great attitude and environment.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We loved the Argonaut hotel! The rooms were great! They were very nicely decorated and also very roomy and comfortable. We had a wonderful view of the cannery courtyard and enjoyed being so close to everything. The location was perfect! We were able to walk to major attractions including Ghiradelli square, Pier 39, the Alcatraz tour, shopping, dining, Hyde Street Pier, and Fisherman's wharf. We had a wonderful time!

review.title: Relax in comfort
review.reviewText: I highly recommend this hotel to those people that want a hotel where you can truly relax and enjoy your time. The location is great, the staff are great, and the room was great. Make sure that you are in the hotel for the daily wine tasting and the extra cost for a bay view room is worth every penny.

review.title: My favourite in San Fran!
review.reviewText: Great location!!!! Free wine from 5-6pm in the lobby!! (cider for the kids so they feel special too) Great for families, but adults don't fret, still a great couple get away. We did our 25th anniversary there this year (2007) Nautical theme is kind of cool and so different and the bedding is wonderful. Staff is great!!!!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: This was the most beautiful hotel I've ever stayed in. Friendly staff, nice linens, and great location. First class hotel!!

review.title: Very nice boutique hotel
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was unlike any hotel I have ever stayed at. It reminded me of what I used to see in the movies with very attentive service, friendl;y smiles and greetings from every employee we came across, and doors held for me when I entered and exited. The rooms were very crisp and clean, although a bit small. They serve complimentary wine, beer, and sparkling cider every afternoon , which was a nice break before we headed out for dinner. I would definitely recommend the Argonaut.

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent the first two nights of our honeymoon at the Argonaut. The hotel was very attractive, the rooms were clean, and the nautical theme was fun, but the best part was the staff. They were extremely friendly and accommodating. Upon arrival, they upgraded our room to one with a beautiful view of the harbor. The concierge and bell captain went out of their way to ensure that we enjoyed our time in San Francisco with fun activities and delicious food. I was a little nervous about staying on the very touristy Fishermans Wharf, but my fears turned out to be unfounded. The Argonaut is at one end of the wharf next to the Ghirardelli Chocolate, away from the worst of the souvenir shops and chain restaurants. I would highly recommend the Argonaut to anyone planning a trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Loved It
review.reviewText: We loved the character of the hotel. The service was great especially the conceirge. We had a great view of Alcatraz. The meals at the Blue Mermaid were very good also.

review.title: Great Warf Hotel
review.reviewText: Very impressed with the hotel. Great location on the warf. Very nicely decorated and clean! Beds were very comfortable. Staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Overnight parking was a bit pricy ($40 night + tax), but understandable in such a busy city.

review.title: Wonderful Experience!
review.reviewText: What a great place to stay. Not only is it close to everything- the staff have a way of making you fell like you were their only guests! Just wonderful! GO!

review.title: Love the Decor
review.reviewText: The room and service of the hotel staff was great. The restaurant however is lacking in service. We waited 15 minutes for someone to take our order or even acknowledge us and then one of the orders was incorrect. Other then that the hotel itself is great.

review.title: Would go back in a heartbeat!
review.reviewText: Wonderful ambiance for the area. The nautical theme was adorable and was perfect. The staff is friendly and professional and the wine sampling in the early evening was a treat.

review.title: great place would recommend anyone to stay
review.reviewText: the service was great, everyone very helpful to make stay in San Francisco one to remember. Beautiful, pictures don't do it justice.

review.title: Great service & location
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful time...clean, great location, friendly service...free happy hour from 5pm-6pm. Was surprised though about charges for parking...a whopping $39.00 per day for valet service and parking...if just staying in San Francisco you don't need a car you can walk or take trolley everywhere

review.title: We should have stayed longer!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel on Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco was a delightful place to stay. Unfortnuately, we were only there for one night. Next time, we will make the hotel a destination and not a way-station! Early evening wine tasting in the beautiful lobby was a great way to end the day and meet other guests. The staff of the hotel was professional and friendly. The hotel wins our vote for a wonderful place to stay while in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel for the Money
review.reviewText: My sister and I traveled to San Francisco to see my son compete in the Escape from Alcatraz triathalon and used this trip as an excuse for a sisters get away. Everything about the hotel was great. The location was perfect, the staff friendly and helpful and the accommodations very comfortable. I will definitely stay here again when I travel back to San Francisco.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: I visited San Fran for the first time with my daughter. On arriving at the hotel we were very impressed with everything from the doormans courtesy to the comfort of our room. Previous to booking online at this hotel my daughter was not impressed by the outside of the building. The inside is everything we were looking for. It was convenient for everything from ferries, Pier 39, Alcatraz to the cable car stop just around the corner to go further afield. We had a great time and would not hesitate in going back or recommending this hotel to a friend.

review.title: Great trip
review.reviewText: Excellent all the way around. Great service. In a perfect location.

review.title: Friendly and Helpful
review.reviewText: My husband and I have traveled to Paris and several all-inclusive resorts. This year we decided to stay state side and visit San Francisco. The Argonaut was delightful. The staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. I hurt my knee prior to our vacation and with all the walking found it necesssary to miss one of the wine receptions. A bellman heard my husband speaking of my "disability" and delivered my glass bedside. Now that's service! If we find ourselves in the San Francisco area again we will definitely stay at the Argonaut! The room was smaller than I expected and the view was of the roof, but who visits SF to stay in the room!

review.title: Awesome Hotel! Perfect Location!
review.reviewText: We had an incredible stay at the Argonaut Hotel at Fisherman's Wharf! The hotel service, quality and cleanliness of the room, and location were all awesome. We have done a lot of traveling over the past few months - and this hotel would have to be at the top of the list!

review.title: one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely accomodating right from our arrival. The hotel is neat, very clean, and has great decor. The free wine tasting each day is a great plus. Will definitely stay here the next time I'm in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Right on Fisherman's Wharf. Perfect location in a great old cannery building. Restaurant served wonderful food. Highly recommend.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is very nice, the lobby is nice and they offer free wine at happy hour time. I do think though that you can stay at an equally nice hotel in the area for less money. The hotel is expensive. The rooms a pretty small and you have to pay to use the internet to print boarding passes, etc.

review.title: The place to stay on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were extremely helpful and courteous. The hotel is in a fantastic location at one end of fisherman's wharf thus avoiding a lot of the crowd's. It is also next to the main cab;e car turnarounds (Hyde Street). The view out of our window was spectacular. The free high speed internet worked without a problem. The complimentary wine in the lobby before dinner is also very nice.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf /Argonaut Hotel a great place to stay!
review.reviewText: We have traveled quite a bit and have stayed in some great hotels. This hotel is excellent. If arriving by air, taking a cab to the hotel and renting a car near the hotel when needed saves $40 a day parking. There is very little parking available anyway, so staying in walking distance and cable car rides to most attractions is great!If this is your first time in S.F. a better location can not be found. Room great, service great.

review.title: Excellent boutique hotel
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was excellent and we would definitely stay again if we visit San Francisco. After a tough flight over from Melbourne we were greeted by very friendly staff. We told the porter we had a terrible flight over and he organised 2 glasses of wine and a cider for our 4 yo girl to take up to our rooms as we were checking in. Check in was quick and efficient. My little girl was very chuffed at having her own "wine" glass. The room was spacious and clean; overlooking the Cannery square next door. In the evenings there was live music playing in the courtyard. The location was good for the sights in Fisherman's Wharf and for using the ferry to other locations around the Marin area. It is also close to Ghiradelli Square and the start of the Powell-Hyde St cable car ride. Service was quick, efficient and friendly. When we needed a stroller for our child. They managed to track one down and it was in our room ready for us when we needed it. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely recommend it to our friends.

review.title: Nice hotel in the center of it all...
review.reviewText: We were very pleased. Our room did not have a view...it looked in on the central courtyard. But that was ok, because it was really quite. Rooms are tastefully decorated, beds are comfortable, hotel is clean throughout, free wine tasting nightly, right and the west end of fisherman's wharf. Parking is EXPENSIVE ($39/day). Easy walk to Lumbard St, Pier 39, etc.

review.title: Great hotel with a boatload of Nautical decor
review.reviewText: The hotel is a great location for exploring Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate Bridge, and is at the start of one of the main cable routes. Cocktail hour in the lobby is a great way to end the day and start the evening. The Concierge was amazing in booking cars, restuarants reservations, and tracking packages delivered to the hotel. The nautical theme can cause some sea sickness, but the free cocktail hour more than makes up for it.

review.title: Location,Location,Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great loction. Everything is in walking distance.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Argonaut in SanFranscio. The hotel staff was very helpful and the rooms very clean. The location was good, you gould walk to several nice restraunts, and the prices were fair. I enjoyed the wine tasting at five o'clock every day.

review.title: At the centre of it all
review.reviewText: It was a little gem , close to the trolleys, best Irish coffees,and an Irish pub all kitty corner from the trolley turn. well appointed rooms with seafaring motif. Free wine hour at 5pm. The Bellboys were fun and curtious every time we came by. I'd do it again!

review.title: Fun Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was fun. Clean, great location and great service. Can't ask for anything more. When/If we have a chance we will go back.

review.title: Excellent Hotel!
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to San Francisco and The Argonaut was a great place to stay. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The hotel and our room were comfortable and clean. The 5 pm "Happy Hour" was a nice touch - although we were so busy, we only made it there once! Best of all was the location - within walking distance of tons of great restaurants and attractions.

review.title: Awesome location, great vibes and Yoga TV!
review.reviewText: if this is in your price range, do it. Location is absolutely perfect.

review.title: Only Problem
review.reviewText: The Hotel was really great. Parking was another issue. They post valet parking at $40 per day. I was charged the $40 plus $15 for oversize (Ford f150 truck) and they added $8 tax for a total of $63 per day. This is a rip off...

review.title: Quality rarely seen
review.reviewText: Stayed 7 nights in May 2007 and would recommend this hotel to anyone. Very, very freindly and helpful staff. Rooms are beautiful and tastefully decorated without being overly done. Beds were very comfortable and not a sound was heard from other rooms or corridor during the night. We had a courtyard facing room with no view but found that that didn't bother us. Perfect location for Fisherman's Wharf and for public transport into the city, be it by cable car, bus or tram. Good restaurant within hotel as well as dozens of excellent places to eat right on your doorstep. Top class all round.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Great hotel and great location. Excellent staff. Really enjoyed the wine reception. Would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: It is just an OK hotel, nothing special.
review.reviewText: Room was Ok, nothing special, and not that big (you could only just walk past the bottom of the bed, where the mini bar is meaning that the door didn't open fully). Windows did not open meaning that aircon was necessary all the time, this was fairly noisy. We didn't have a sea view, looked on to other rooms, so meant we had to keep blinds shut for privacy. The worst thing was definately the paper thin walls, I could hear complete conversations word for word. As I had read in previous reviews, I can confim that the concierge is absolutely useless, it may as well be non existant. There were two different people on duty during our stay, and neither were helpful. They do not (or can not?) book anything for you, and can not acurately tell you costs/times of anything. If you want to know something your best bet is to ask the doormen who are helpful, polite and friendly. The other point to note should you decide to stay in the hotel is that on check out, or on check in if your room is not ready, they offer to store your bags for you. But be warned, they just put a label on them and leave them in the enterance hall, meaning anyone who wonders in can help themselves- it is certainly not a secure baggage store. The good point of the hotel is location.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great location in the Cannery at Fisherman's Wharf. Leave your car with valet parking and walk from the hotel to all wharf attractions and restaurants. The hotel itself was great, clean, well appointed with a helpful and curteous staff. I highly recommend staying there.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great location. Friendly helpful service from all staff. Short walk to Pier 39, round the corner from the cable cars. Lots of nice restaurants in the area. Nice perk of nightly one hour hospitality gathering in the lobby with wine, beer etc. Would definately return to this hotel or recommend it to others.

review.title: Excellent location; excellent service. This is the best place to stay in Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: This is an excellent place to stay in Fisherman's Wharf. Two queen beds are very hard to find down there. Excellent location. The staff is wonderfully friendly. Don't forget to ask for goldfish to keep you company - the kids loved it! Very reasonable prices.

review.title: Best Yet
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience from the curb to the nautical theme throughout.Staff were wonderful, room was beautiful down to the last detail including the Golden Gate Bridge view. Plan to return and have already recommended it to others.This was our splurge hotel and worth every penny!

review.title: Great service, good location for tourists
review.reviewText: I've done quite a bit of travel with my kids, and this is the most kid-friendly place I've found. The double decker on-off bus stop is a short walk, as are Fisherman's Wharf, the Alcatraz ferry and the cable car turnaround. The area may be a bit touristy, but its also full of shops, restaurants, and things for a family to do. I paid for a view room, but the window was tiny and it was pretty much a waste. Parking was expensive, so factor it in. Otherwise, I was very happy with this hotel.

review.title: Exemplary service
review.reviewText: Despite the fact that we booked through Expedia, the Argonaut treated us as if we were lavish spenders and worked hard to accomodate our room preference despite being nearly fully booked. Every employee, from front desk bellhops to maids to the concierge to the room service delivery folks and even the mini-bar stocker were fabulously freindly and helpful, and many even remembered our names. If you dislike the cold formality and homogeneousness of the standard 4/5 stars, but want the same amenities, this is the place for you.

review.title: Very nice at the Wharf
review.reviewText: One of the nicer hotels at Fisherman's Wharf. Boutique feel near some major tourist attratctions.

review.title: Wonderful hotel hidden inside an old cannery
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel with my wife and 2 daughters(ages 8 and 10). We were always on the go, so used the hotel as a base camp for each day's adventure. it is a very nice hotel, but keep in mind you are in an old cannery. The are big wooden beams and brick walls through out the hotel. My family liked this. The nautical theme was enough to make my daughters think it was neat. Great location if you are a tourist, as it provides a starting point for most of you outings.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was convenient to everything in SF. The Blue Mermaid restaurant adjacent to the hotel was very good and charming. The trolley next to the hotel was comvenient although we liked to avoid the lines by hiking the hill and jumping the trolley at the top of Lombard St. The wine tasting every evening was fun and gave us an opportunity to meet other travelers. ****

review.title: Nice location and comfortable but no parking
review.reviewText: Very good location for the price. Clean and comfortable inside. $39 plus tax vallet parking only makes this hotel more expensive than the others in the same area. Would try others in the same area next time.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel!. Loved the brick wall and the wood beams. Great room with nice colors and good taste. Had an excellent breakfast in the Bakery located in the same building. There is also the Starbucks and a great Japanese restaurant (located just up from the same intersection with Starbucks). I would recommend the city tour offered by the hotel. SF has indeed a great European flavor with lots of stuff to see and do.

review.title: Wonderful location
review.reviewText: The weather was alittle cool, but the hotel was excellent. The resturant was only average.

review.title: excelent location
review.reviewText: is not the best but the location is excelent

review.title: Stay in SF, right on Fisherman's Wharf...
review.reviewText: We've been considering staying at the Argonaut for quite some time, and finally decided to do so for our 1st wedding anniversary. What a wonderful hotel! The facility is beautiful, the room was very clean, and the staff was outstanding! We will definitely go back and stay there again.

review.title: Terriffic hotel, all the big-chain amenities with boutique service, the staff knows you by name..
review.reviewText: we were there with our two children and were very impressed with the hotel staff, family freindly hotel, great location, for cycling over the bridge, wonderful views and we were greeted by the doorman every time by name...you can expect the best, do not settle for less

review.title: Would definately stay here again
review.reviewText: Pleasant staff and great surroundings. Made our stay more enjoyable with complimentary wine for or wedding anniversary.

review.title: Great location for family
review.reviewText: We brought our three children to San Francisco for Spring Break and this hotel was a perfect location for sightseeing. It is close to the streetcars, cablecars, and bus stops, so we found it easy to tour the entire city from our little hub. The hotel was very cute, clean, and comfortable, and the staff was kind and helpful. I would stay there again.

review.title: great, but noisy
review.reviewText: perfectly located, this hotel was great for traveling with my niece, a first-time visitor to the area. however, the walls were very thin and we could hear EVERYTHING going on next door. bring earplugs.

review.title: Great Family Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great time at the Argonaut. The only complaints I have are that we had a very loud family somewhere adjacent to our room and the rooms weren't as sound-proof as I would have hoped. Also, it would have been nice to have a sink located out of the shower room. The mirror was always fogging when the rest of the family was taking showers. The work out room was great and not crowded.

review.title: Reviews Right about Noise
review.reviewText: Stayed for four nights for a combined business, leisure trip. Had requested a few weeks before arriving for an early check in, had a very long flight, and a quite room having read all the reviews about the noise problems. No early check in available, only arrived an hour early and I was given a room with a connecting door that I did not request together with the thin walls to let all the noise in. Had the baby crying all night first night, the lovers the next night, and the party guys the last night. Unless all the rooms in this hotel have connecting doors and thin walls would have thought having booked so far in advance that my request could have been accommodated for. And yes you could hear every word. Staff were friendly although one concierge would be better employed as a comedian as he was such a smart arse to say the least and the reception staff didnt greet in a friendly manner. Having said that the room was very clean, decor nice, room size adequate, the location and atmosphere ideal, restaurant excellent and really good staff. Would stay again if they could assure me of getting a quite room.

review.title: Perfect in every way!
review.reviewText: Absolutely beautiful building and rooms, excellent staff and service, most comfortable beds and pillow, all situated in the best and most convenient location in San Francisco! I will be hard pressed to stay anywhere else on my next visit. It will be the Argonaut or not!

review.title: Was quite enjoyable
review.reviewText: Would return upon next visit

review.title: Good Location, Tiny Rooms
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location and was decorated very cute, the staff was freindly and helpful, but thats about it. For the price, the rooms were very small, barely enough room to walk around the bed. The hotel has a yoga channel, but the rooms are way too small to use it. The hotel did have an excellent place to eat downstairs called the blue mermaid.

review.title: Will Probably Return
review.reviewText: Good location, very friendly staff. Clean rooms with good A/C. Did not have an ocean room view, but probably worth the extra cost.

review.title: Great bargain
review.reviewText: Located just above the wild section of San Fran, this was a perfect place. It was child, adult, and pet friendly.

review.title: Absolutely loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: We found this hotel to be excellent in every regard. We stayed on the fourth floor and had a beautiful veiw of the harbor and city streets. Our windows opened, allowing us the ability to let in the fresh air and city sounds if we wanted, but closed they provided an excellent sound barrier. I had read many complaints about air conditioning in hotels in this city but found the Argonauts to be in fine working condition. The setting of the hotel right on the water was a particular delight; each morning I went to Starbucks (a short block away), bought a donut and hot tea and sat on the sea wall and enjoyed watching the boats, Alcatraz, the G.G. Bridge, swimmers in the harbor, the beautiful Western Gulls and all the runners, walkers and bikers. My husband took advantage of the running/biking trail that begins about a block from the hotel, running along the water, winding up through the Presidio and even across the G.G.Bridge into Sausilito if you desired. We plan to return again and will definately only stay in the Argonaut.

review.title: Best Hotel on the Wharf
review.reviewText: The Argonaut has a lot of character. The way he Hotel wass built into the original cannery building is one of its best qualities. Service is top notch and the location is perfect.

review.title: Definitely a Do-Over
review.reviewText: Great location, great staff, great quality. Parking is pricey especially for oversized vechiles, but that is to be expected in SF.

review.title: A terrific choice
review.reviewText: This hotel was lovely. I like its nautical look, and the service was superb. I recommend it highly.

review.title: Beyond fantastic
review.reviewText: This is a marvelous place that makes you fall in love with San Francisco even more. From the design and decor of the hotel to the top notch quality of the customer service, this is what many boutique hotels apire to be but often times don't achieve. The staff in its entirety were super pleasant and genuinely cared to make our stay a memorable one. The rooms are beautiful, more spacious than we expected, and with all the necessary ammenities that a frequent traveler could ask for. The location could not be better! You can walk to many attractions, hop on a cab (or public transportation if that's your cup of tea) and reach all the great things that SF has to offer in a few minutes. Several of the restaurants in the area are simply great, but make sure to eat at least once at the hotel's own Blue Mermaid Chowder House, quite a nice place for seafood. The hotel has a daily reception with wine and drinks which allows you to mingle with other travelers and relax before you head on out to dinner or an evening walk by the wharf. The Argonaut is just one reason why we love Kimpton hotels; we certainly look forward to staying here again.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: Located next to the wharf, waterfront trail, and tram made easy access to the city. Great hotel and staff. Museums, restaurants, bicycle rental, and pubs nearby. The gym was okay, but no washroom. We were going to watch a movie one night, but the rates were excessive. We got dinged for each local call.

review.title: Impressed, but hotel neighbors were bad
review.reviewText: The best part of this hotel was its location. Right next to Ghiradelli Square and one block from Fisherman's Wharf - everything was within walking distance and the atmosphere was suberb.
