The hotel has live music in the courtyard every day, so great way to wind down the early afternoon. Very beautiful location (it helped that I had great weather). Unfortunately, our neighbors were noisy and kept us up all night, but I should have complained. Parking was also way expensive though (valet was $49 per night) and it took forever to get our car out (waited at least 20 minutes), so I suggest finding parking elsewhere. Otherwise, with these lessons learned, we would definitely return!!

review.title: Boutique Hotel Like
review.reviewText: Obviously a fairly large hotel, but a small feel. Rooms are well appointed and clean. Located right on Fishermans Wharf and several steps from the Trolley. A return visit is in order!

review.title: some good ,some bad
review.reviewText: great location. San Francisco mass transit makes getting around easy from anywhere. the Argonaut has great views and many things in walking distance. Very clean and tidy. Comfortable. BUT.... If you are a bit noisy or like to stay up late you might have a problem. I recieved a call from the front desk to turn our TV down at 10.30 pm. When the TV was off we could clearly hear the people in the next room. From that point on every time I was in the room I felt like I needed to be quiet. I did not like that.Our departing shuttle was screwed up and nobody at the hotel was willing to take responsibility for that. We had to take a very expensive taxi or miss our flight.

review.title: Clean, Comfortable, Friendly Hotel
review.reviewText: This was an anniversary trip. We found the hotel on Expedia - one of their picks - and we chose a deluxe king. The staff was really friendly and welcoming. Our room was great - comfortable, lots of room. Convenient to the Powell/Hyde cable car.

review.title: Rooms are too small - parking is inconvenient
review.reviewText: I was very disappointed in the actual size of the room. We had two queen beds with approx. 320 sf to manueuver in. The location is excellent but not much else.

review.title: fun funky hotel
review.reviewText: The location is great for dining or shopping the Wharf or North Beach areas. One block from Gary Danko ! Decorations fun, staff very attentive. Would go back anytime !

review.title: Room with a view!
review.reviewText: We loved our stay - the room had plenty of space and the view was great - the Golden Gate Bridge. Happy hour is always fun and the restaurant was very good. We would stay at this hotel again - be prepared for a very busy location but conveniently close to public transportation.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with Argonaut Hotel. Service was great, everyone friendly and willing to help us. Our room was large enough for 2 adults and a 16 & 15 year old teenagers. Awesome location. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was excellent. All Staff Members were courteous & helpful. The room was extremely clean.

review.title: Nautical Theme
review.reviewText: One of the best hotel we stayed in. I little bit pricey but its worth it. Hotel staff are very nice and friendly. The nautical theme of the hotel is very classy. Rooms are small typical of SF hotel. Close to everything. Book this hotel if you have extra cash you'll enjoy it.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location on Fisherman's Wharf, employees of the hotel very helpful. On the down side, walls too thin - could hear everything in rooms next door and above. A little overboard on the nautical theme in the rooms. Lobby very nice and comfortable.

review.title: Excellent Guest Service, Very Charming Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a very charming hotel in a great location. The decor is bright, cheery and unique. What really makes this hotel is the staff. From the moment we arrived, we were showered with attention. Everything was taken care of quickly and cheerfully. They were always asking if they could help with directions, dining choices and sightseeing trips. We will definitely make a return trip to this hotel! I consider it to be a great value, great location and they have the most awesome staff.

review.title: Fantastic hotel on the water
review.reviewText: Hotel was great and everyone was friendly. Great location on Fisherman's Wharf and loved the fact it was across the street from the Buena Vista and wonderful Irish Coffees.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We found this hotel through Expedia and after reading the reviews, booked it. The staff was exceptional and the room was clean and very comfortable. Everyone we came in contact with at the hotel was friendly and helpful from the front desk to housekeeping. The concierge gave us great tips and when we return, we'll stay there again...with out a doubt!

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Great location and could even rent bikes right next door to the hotel and bike the GG Bridge. Around the corner, one could catch the cable car to head to Union Square. Up the street to Beach St. one could catch a bus easily to tour Coit Tower etc. Loved the hospitality of the 5:00 to 6:00 wine and beer in the front foyer/atrium. Great idea and met other travelers.

review.title: A little slice of heaven on the wharf!
review.reviewText: In my opinion, THE place to stay when in San Francisco is on the wharf. Tons of shopping, food and fun right from that location. Anywhere else you want to go (Union Square, Chinatown, Little Italy) is a quick MUNI ride. And the Argonaut is the best place to return to. Beautiful decour, wonderful staff....from the doorman to the front desk! The rooms are just as beautiful in person as they are in the pics you see. The beds were comfortable and the room in perfect condition. The Argonaut is even an attraction in itself, it's one of the stops that the double decker bus tours stop at. I suggest buying tickets, they let you "hop-on, hop-off" for say, lunch in Chinatown or a day at the SFMOMA. Then they'll bring you right back to your wonderful hotel. I definitely look forward to another stay at The Argonaut.

review.title: Loved this hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is wonderful, and the service and people are sooooooooooo great. Would definitely go back. Next time would book a suite with a hot tub. The only thing missing is a public hot tub and pool, but I understand why they don't have one. Loved the stay and location. Would recommend this hotel to everyone. Thank you so much.

review.title: Overall great hotel...
review.reviewText: Loved the courteous staff and the overall hotel experience was great. My room was actually a little small and not extremely clean, but would recommend it to anyone wishing to stay in fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Awesome new years
review.reviewText: It was a very nice hotel for the price and the service was great. My boyfriend and I had a very fun new years watching the fireworks on the embarcadero and staying there.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our weekend stay at the Argonaut. It was a classy hotel and so close to everything! One of the nicer hotels on Fisherman's Wharf. The room was very clean and quiet. Would come back again.

review.title: Great experience-will definitely go back
review.reviewText: Very quiet, well-maintained hotel. Terrific staff who really go out of their way to make you feel at home. Close to the attractions at the Wharf, ferries, etc and the cable cars are a short block away. We will definitely return the next time we are in San Francisco.

review.title: Fantastic experience
review.reviewText: Everything was wonderful, ours rooms were upgraded and were beautiful. The best thing about the hotel is the staff, the are friendly and very helpful. You feel like they were all your friends.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. Service was excellent, room was nice, location was perfect.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: I'm a repeat customer, and have tried some other SF-area hotels. Especially if you're OK with being in Fisherman's Wharf, this place is just great. Still has new feel to it; great design, decor, and very conmfortable; always great service. Important to book well in advance because the news is out!

review.title: Excellent Hotel!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a superb hotel. Clean, comfy, with a super staff. Location is fabulous - beautiful place to take a morning run. Can attract a lot of tourists, but takes good care of its business guests as well.

review.title: Supeior hotel, Excellent Location
review.reviewText: We throughly enjoyed our stay at the Argonaut Hotel. The staff was friendly and efficient, the hotel was clean and well appointed. Items that we requested were supplied right away without problems. The hotel location on Fisherman's Wharf was conveniently located and relaxing. On my next visit to the Bay area I will most likely stay at this location.

review.title: Wonderful Stay!
review.reviewText: Rooms are a little small but overall a wonderful stay! If you are a clean freak it's a clean and tidy room. Aveda products are a plus! Thumbs up on the bed linen (they are a higher thread count). Ask for a room on the 4th floor so you won't be disturbed by people walking on the floor above you. Helpful and friendly staff!

review.title: Don't bring your car !!!
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is clean and well maintained. The rooms are a bit small but acceptable for the price and location. Interior rooms have no views and exterior rooms are more expensive. Don't bring your car as the valet parking rates are exorbitant and tax is not included in the amount quoted. It is far less expensive to park in one of the nearby garages.

review.title: Awesome location and nice rooms!!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the wine tasting they have every night in the lobby. The rooms were clean, even with pets around. We would definitely go back!

review.title: Would go back over and over again
review.reviewText: When you go to SF, you have to stay there. Just everything is great. Location for sightseeing is perfect. Right around the corner is Cable Car Station. Just a few blocks and you are right in the middle of Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: the place to stay
review.reviewText: Grat spot. The Hotel was located in a wonderful area with many of the great attractions within walking distances. The staff was very helpful and ;made the stay extremely pleasant.

review.title: High quality perfect location!!!
review.reviewText: Location was perfect walked to every planned event with ease. Saved a bundle avoiding paid parking at attractions. Service was excellent. Environment was extremely high class above rating listed. Beds were very warm and comfortable. Would return over and over again. Great Job Expedia!!!!

review.title: Where's my car
review.reviewText: Valet parking only and expensive. Very difficult to find off site parking, but the location is very convenient. Overall a nice place to stay and I would stay there again because of its location.

review.title: Very professional, classy joint
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed this hotel mainly because it felt like a 4 star hotel run by young, attractive people. Since the moment we got in both the concierge and the bellboys (dressed in adorable sailor outfits) gave us the royal treatment. The room was comfortable though the bathroom could be a bit bigger for the king size suite. One thing I would warn you though: the food is a tad too pricey and not that delicious. Located at Fisherman's Wharf, the location is picturesque and full of life. If you want to go downtown all you need is to take the F train which is available only a few blocks away. I love that they were playing Sonic Youth, the Ramones and the Cure while we were sipping wine in the main lobby on Sunday afternoon.

review.title: Must Book the Argonaut Hotel if Going to San Fran
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was wonderful. The staff is young, friendly, efficient and very accommodating. My husband and I travel quite often, and we both agree the Argonaut is one of the best hotels we have ever booked. We knew nothing about the hotel before our arrival. We just liked the location and the look of it. We were not disappointed.

review.title: Great Location at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We spent four wonderful nights at the Argonaut Hotel. From the moment we got out of the van we were greeted and made to feel comfortable. The doorman and bellhops were all friendly and extremely helpful during our entire stay. After being out all day it was nice to return to a friendly smiling face. The wine tasting during the evening was great!. The bed was comfortable and the rooms were big enough. The only complaint during the entire time was the barking dogs in one of the rooms down the hall. I wasn't aware that the hotel catered to dog owners. The view out of our room was of another wall. I'd try for an outside room next time for a view. The location was just down the street from the Wharf and just next door to the cable car turnaround. restaurants were very close by also. I will definitely return to this hotel when I come back to San Francisco.

review.title: Terrific place
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean with a beautiful nautical theme that is well done. The staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome and special. I just mentioned that it was my partner's birthday and a complimentary bottle of wine and glasses appeared to celebrate. Check in and out was a breeze...small bathroom but it didn't really matter...go and enjoy!

review.title: Just as Advertised
review.reviewText: The hotel was just as I expected, thanks to expedia's description and other guests' remarks. The only complaint, if you can call it that, is that I needed a rollaway bed in addition to the two queen beds - I stayed with my two daughters and one of my daughter's friends (male). Although the hotel had one available for use, it couldn't be put in the room because of space and safety issues (fire hazzard). Aside from that, location was great no only with regard to the piers, but also to transportation on trolley or bus.

review.title: One of the best!
review.reviewText: Hotel is one of the best. Understand the Wharf is a busy area so many people are around. If you're looking for an island for quiet, the street can be somewhat noisy - not the hotel's fault because the location is great! Very unique rooms that are above and beyond!!!!

review.title: Unique and comfortable experience
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great location on Fisherman's Wharf. The rooms are comfortable and uniquely designed (nautical theme). There is free wine-tasting every day from 5pm to 6pm. The New York Times is delivered every morning. Please note that room rates do not include parking. Overnight parking rates are in the low double-digits.

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: The staff was always friendly, willing to help and everyone said hello.

review.title: The beds are the best!!
review.reviewText: I must say that everything about this hotel was great, even though it was located in a busy street, so the location was great you couldn't hear any noise from outside. The bed, comforter,and pillows were the best.The only problem I had was the fact that the drinks in the refrigerator seemed a bit old. Other then that I would definately stay here again when I go to SF.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Helpful staff and great rooms! Can't wait to return!!

review.title: Best Location & Value
review.reviewText: Can't beat the location, walking dist. to Wharf, Pier 39, Ghiradelli, Cable Car and more. Service and style A+. We go to San Fran annually and we will be staying here from now on.

review.title: Outstanding
review.reviewText: Great place, the staff was excellent,the rooms were very, very clean,the location could not be better.A nice touch was the eveing wine tasting try and not to miss that met some very nice people.Only complaint the parking charges were a shock a suggestion might be roll the cost of the parking into the room cost then it might not be such a shock when checking out.Will go back again just wont take a vehicle.

review.title: wonderful place
review.reviewText: Awsome service, great people, attentive service, cozy rooms, everything at the tip of your fingers. highly recomend.

review.title: Great Location, can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The location was awesome. This hotel is right on Fishermans Wharf.The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are a nice size and are well decorated with the natical theme.

review.title: Perfect Hotel in a Perfect Location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed staying here very much. The staff were great and the hotel is beautiful. Loved the free wine tasting every night at 5 pm. Will definitely book here again next time we go to San Francisco.

review.title: so cool
review.reviewText: the hotel is nautical themed, loved it, which is just great for san fran. Its located right next to the courtyard with live music, jacks bar, and right next to the cable car entrance. several nice restaurants just outside the front door. Could not ask for a better location for all the things we wanted to see and do(Pier 39, rainforest cafe, china town, gheradelli's,) minor draw back is valet parking is mandatory unless you know where to park before you get there, and its very expensive per day.but the guys did a excellent job of taking care of the car. would definitely stay there again. great place, friendly staff

review.title: Excelent staff
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms were immaculate. Blue Mermaid was a great place to start the day. The "wine hour" was a nice touch. Excellent location.

review.title: A fun hotel with very friendly staff in a good location
review.reviewText: We realy enjoyed our time in San Fran and the Hotel certainly helped make the experience more enjoyable. The nautical decor of the hotel made a pleasant change from the more usual mundane hotels and was appropriate to the Fisherman's Wharf area, and continued the theme for us as we'd just been cruising. The staff were friendly and helpful. We only made it back for a glass of wine one evening but it was a nice touch and seemed very popular.

review.title: Very good hotel in an excellent location !
review.reviewText: San Fran was a great vacation spot and the Argonaut was in the perfect location for almost any attraction. Can't wait to go back !

review.title: Fabulous Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the Argonaut. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location can't be beat (walking distance from anything you could want to do on the Wharf). Restaurant, the Blue Mermaid, had great breakfasts and excellent chowder. Would highly recommend it to anyone visiting San Francisco. Couldn't have asked for anything better.

review.title: Great View ... Cool Theme
review.reviewText: We had a bay view room that looked at the Golden Gate Bridge and the cable car station. View was a must have for me, but if you wanted to save alot of money go without. The hotel has a nautical theme that fits in well with the wharf area that we were in. Location in the middle of everything.

review.title: Great Vacation
review.reviewText: What a trip! We stayed 5 nights at the Argonaut. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. There was a small mixup with the valet service but everyone went out of their way to correct the problem and apologize. They even deducted a night of parking and provided us with complimentary wine. I will definitely go back!

review.title: Great Experience!
review.reviewText: Stayed 3 nights with my grand daughter and friend, all here for my daughter's wedding at Alamo Square. It was great waking up to sounds of trolley cars outside our window and enjoying view of Golden Gate Bridge and Bay. Enjoyed all the sites, dining and shopping on wharf, all within short walking distance. Great views of Alcatraz and Hot fudge sundaes at Ghiradelli Square just steps away! mmmmmm! Beautiful nautical decor in all rooms and halls! Only downside, no pool. I plan to go back to same hotel!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent location at Fisherman's Wharf. The staff were very helpful, specially one of the bell personel that speaks portuguese. Our room has no view, but it's very clean, well decorated and comfortable. Definitively we will be back!

review.title: Extremely comfortable and private
review.reviewText: An excellent repite in a beautiful city for a couple on their first time away from the hectic life as parents of a toddler and a preschooler. Our room afforded us privacy as well as friendly and efficient staff while vacationing in San Francisco.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Great location, great hotel!!!

review.title: I'll stay here every time
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel based on it's 4 star rating and was a bit worried about the "nautical" theme when booking. Could have easily been decorated like a Red Lobster. Not too worry, the nautical theme is very high class, just like everything else about the hotel. Service was excellent door to door, the room was clean and well decorated. The beds were divine, from sheets to springs. Even the free stuff in the bathroom was high end. The location can't be beat for walking downtown San Francisco.

review.title: What a great location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful, clean, and had great service. Accross the street was the cable car station, the wharf, and Ghirradelli Square. Walking distance to Pier 39. I would definately stay here again.

review.title: Awesome Argonaut!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a great hotel! Its location is fabulous (at the end of Fisherman's Wharf next to the cable car stop), near lots of shopping and restaurants (touristy area, but its nice to have these conveniences nearby). We rented a car, and the car parking charge was pretty hefty ($40/night I think). I would recommend having a car - the city really isn't that hard to get around in, but you can really save time by driving yourself and not taking the public transportation everywhere. The room theme was a little over the top, but it was clean, and everyone at the hotel was extremely helpful and friendly. Would stay there again in a heartbeat and will recommend to all of my friends and family traveling to the San Fran area.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel staff is very nice. The room was very nice however a little small.

review.title: Small rooms but tastefully decorated and comfortable.
review.reviewText: A great location for everything, Hotel staff extremely helpful and courteous. The beds were very comfortable. The rooms were a bit crowded but overall a great choice.

review.title: Great San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel in San Francisco is a great location for vacation stay. It's one of the cleaniest hotels I've ever stayed in.

review.title: Great hotel but...
review.reviewText: Great hotel but think twice about rental car. Parking is very expensive.

review.title: Very convenient hotel
review.reviewText: Ideal for combination between business and leisure stay.

review.title: Elegant but sturdy in convenient location
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our stay at the Argonaut. We got a promo rate so it did not seem too expensive although it is not a "budget hotel" We thought it was worth it for our family. It is centrally located in the Fisherman's Wharf (very touristy) area of SF. I think it must be newly renovated -- everything is clean, shiny, and very well attended by a large staff including concierge and doormen. Fortunately, they seem to know their customers because it is very welcoming to families with children without dumbing down the services. Beds were very comfortable. Maid service prompt. Room Service within reasonable wait. Bathrooms clean. Towels not too thin. It was a real refuge after making our way through the crowds at the Wharf! Only comment --- wish the internet terminals were a bit cheaper, although my husband was able to print our boarding passes for free because airline sites have a courtesy five minute access.

review.title: A perfect spot on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for our family. The room was quite large and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly, greeting us as we entered and exited the hotel. The evening wine reception was just what we needed at the end of a busy day of sightseeing. The hotel is a great Fisherman's Wharf location. We would definitely stay at The Argonaut again!

review.title: Pretty good as San Francisco digs go
review.reviewText: The price was reasonable, the location good and service was above average. Wi-Fi overpriced as with many large city hotels. Local calls are a buck, which is not the worse. Overnight parking is expensive because you must use their valet service, and there are numerous surcharges so it is not attractive as a motel.

review.title: A bit over the ordinary, but not much.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. The amenities such as parking, receiving a fax, or even receiving a box from UPS were pricey. I think, for the price paid, I would have chosen a different hotel with more in-room amenities.

review.title: Great Place - Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: The staff is friendly - the wine tasting time is excellent and the restaurant is very good. We would definitely reccomend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Francisco. The hotel was quiet, clean and very comfotable. Everything is nearby so you don't need a car, you can take the mass transportation which is all very convenient.

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: Everything was very clean and comfortable. The people there were extremely pleasant. The location could not be better if you're planning a visit to the fisherman's warf area.

review.title: We truly enjoyed ourselves.
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is very convenient to Pier 39 with great shopping and restaurants. Everyone was very hospitable and the 5-6pm free wine tasting proved a great pre-dinner relaxer at day's end and a chance to meet many nice folks (we met couples from Germany and Australia and shared many stories).

review.title: The Best in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is beautiful. The rooms are the most comfortable I've ever stayed in and the staff is wonderful. I visit San Francisco frequently and this hotel is where I will be staying from now on.

review.title: Lovely, freindly hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel in a superb location...on the 'nicer' end of Fisherman's Wharf. The doormen were super-helpful, showing us how to get to places on little maps etc. We have 2 teenagers and they loved it here - they thougt the in-room movies were good. The wine tasting was great - lovely end to a day. One tiny complaint - we asked for a yoga basket and it never came to the room. But, overall it was a wonderful place to stay and I would recommend it to anyone.

review.title: An Oasis
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel is an Oasis in the overt carnival atmosphere of Fisherman's Wharf. Rooms are great, staff is friendly and the free wine tasting doesn't hurt.

review.title: The Best Experience I ever had at a hotel!!!
review.reviewText: We had the best time, everyone was very professional and extremely nice. Everyone was always smiling and happy.

review.title: Great hotel, awesome location
review.reviewText: The hotel has beautiful decor and super spacious rooms. A five star to me.

review.title: Impressed with the hotel.
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the hotel. The staff were courteous and helpful. The room was large and comfortable. We had a King Deluxe. The concierge was very helpful and on Saturday night with a one hour notice was able to get us a table at a waterfront restaurant right by the window overlooking the bay and even sent us a plate of appetizers at her expense. The hotel is located at the west end of Fisherman's Wharf, so the surrounding area is not as crowded as closer to pier 39. The cable car turn arround is across the street from the hotel. The wine tasting each afternoon was great. An excellent hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel in the Fisherman's Wharf Area
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely clean and comfortable, and the staff was very friendly and helpful, expecially with providing restaurant recommendations. We liked the the construction of the hotel with its exposed original beams and brick. The hotel restaurant, Blue Mermaid is in our opinion the best seafood restaurant in the immediate wharf area. The food is fresh and made from scratch; service was great; atmosphere was casual and comfortable; and they make excellent bloody marys. We highly recommend this hotel to those that want to stay in the Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: Very nice location and setting. Recommend.
review.reviewText: Staff and employees very nice and helpful. Room and bath small but just what we needed. Room cleaning staff failed to put sweetner with coffee on two mornings, but when called desk, there within 5 minutes. No one explained "Honor Bar" and when we found open we used, but ended up paying for items. Otherwise excellent service. Will stay again.

review.title: Great location, whimsical hotel
review.reviewText: Whimsically decorated lobby and rooms make for a fun stay right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. The leopard print robes and bright, modern decor are like no other hotel you've stayed in. Friendly, helpful staff and very clean, tidy hotel.

review.title: Great Stay on the Wharf
review.reviewText: Our family really enjoyed staying at the Argonaut. It is clean and comfortable, and the location is ideal for first-time visitors. Our room overlooked a small square with casual restaurants, shops and daily live music (nothing too loud or obnoxious). We did lots of walking and sightseeing, and felt happy to come back to the Argonaut to rest our feet. The restaurant downstairs served a great breakfast. We'd definitely recommend this hotel!

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Great hotel - very friendly staff, nice decor, modern and rooms were very very nice. Would definitely go back!! Also, had a cute "Treasure Chest" for kids to get little toys - my kids loved it.

review.title: Exceptional Value for the Luxury Stay
review.reviewText: This was a rare occasion where the hotel truly is memorable as a part of the enjoyable vacation experienced in SF.

review.title: Will definitely use when in San Francisco again
review.reviewText: We were impressed with the security of the hotel while all the time being able to be in the middle of all the tourist attractions. The restaurant also served good food in a well prepared fashion. Will definietly return on my next visit.

review.title: Outstanding service.
review.reviewText: Great proximity to family activities. The Maritime NHS Visitor Center is in the hotel and had fun activities for children.

review.title: Good value for the location
review.reviewText: Rooms were comfy and well-maintained, though the carpet could have been cleaner. Bathroom very good with Aveda products. Our room's window did not open, so we had to keep the AC on all the time. They provide Starbuck's coffee in the room. Great location for tourists - near the water, Ghiardelli Square, the trolley, and walking distance to wonderful coffee in North Beach.

review.title: Fantastic location, beautiful accomodations
review.reviewText: This was our first visit to San Francisco, and the location of the hotel was outstanding. When you walk out the front of the hotel, you have the Hyde Street Pier and a view of Alcatraz directly in front of you. Ghirardelli Square, the Maritime Museum / Aquatic Park to your left, you're connected to The Cannery, and Fisherman's Wharf is directly to your right. The hotel itself was beautiful - nautically themed throughout. The wine tasting offered each evening was a nice touch, and even the attached restaurant (The Blue Mermaid) had very good food. Overall a fantastic experience.

review.title: Toop quality and kid friendly too
review.reviewText: The warmest and friendliest hotel staff I've ever encountered. They were terriffic with the kids! I didn't have to sacrifice hotel quality for kid friendliness.

review.title: Close and Comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel was 1-3 blocks away from all the great sites along the Fisherman's Wharf. Across the street we could catch a cable car ride or see the historic ships. The hotel was in a great location and the rooms were very comfortable. We had a great stay and I would definitely stay there again if I ever go back to San Francisco.

review.title: Luxury boutique style - excellent value
review.reviewText: excellent service, complimentary wine tastings each night, warm and welcoming. boutique and quirky in character - nautical theme, bit of fun. super comfy beds and pillows. complimentary internet - excellent value. close to shops and tourist attractions. only downside, was a bit noisy at night until the pubs closed.

review.title: We loved this hotel
review.reviewText: I have a 3 year old and 1 year old and it was super easy to stay here. There were a ton of things to do right when you walked out the front door (e.g. beach, starting zone for the cable cars, local park, etc.) The service at the hotel was also superb. Staff were attentive and knowledgeable. We will stay here again and again.

review.title: Very good.
review.reviewText: Stayed one night and wished we could stay more. Very good value. Great location and staff.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very polite and professional. Even when faced with computer problems and a crashed network, the staff NEVER lost their composure. We arrived hours before check-in but were able to drop our bags and go play on the Pier. When we checked in, our bags were delivered to our room almost before we found the room. The beds were very comfortable and the wine tasting in the lobby was a relaxing break from the SF crowds. The maids added a personal touch to the room on the second night when we found a couple of teddy bears we purchased the first day waiting for us on our beds that evening. Check out was easy and painless (despite the computer problems) and the staff hailed a taxi for us with in minutes of the request! I highly recommend this hotel!

review.title: Loved this hotel
review.reviewText: Great location right on fisherman's wharf next to trolley stop and Ghirradelli square. The only improvement I would recommend is in the room service and hotel restaurant menus which are very limited. However, in San Francisco there is no shortage of good restaurants. This is a Kimpton hotel and I plan on staying at their other hotels in the future if available.

review.title: Best location
review.reviewText: Best location- you can walk right to the park, beach, catch the cable car- just really a nice location.

review.title: The Amazing Argonaut
review.reviewText: I was extremely impressed with The Argonaut. The staff was friendly, always ready to greet me with a smile. The service, the ammenities, the food-all top notch. I travel to San Franciso often, and will, without a doubt, be staying here again.

review.title: Very pleased! We'll go back!
review.reviewText: This hotel was better than expected. Our room was spacious and comfortable and decorated just as nice as the photos shown. Rooms with two beds did not have chair or couch additional seating, which was disappointing. It is within easy walking distance of Pier 39, and waterfront attractions and restaurants. It is only a block from the beach and trolley cars. Valet parking was a pleasant surprise. Every employee was great, with the exception of the Concierge, which was a bit snooty, and not always available. I recommend chating with several staff about local eateries and attractions, they are willing to share. Despite some other reviews that said there was a problem with noise, we noticed very little.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Impressive service, great location, nice decor- a thoroughly enjoyable place to stay.

review.title: Great Place to stay in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend the Argonaut in San Francisco for anyone, but especially for a family for a first time visit. It was my kids first time in San Francisco and we wanted to show them all the sights in just 2 full days. The Argonaut is in an ideal location to do just that. In the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, next door from the cable car turn around and 2 blocks to Ghiradelli Square. If you drive, they will charge you $36 a day to park your car but the doorman told me I could park the car around the corner at the Beach Steet garage for half the price. No continental breakfast though which was a bit of disappointment so you will have to go the Starbuck's around the corner.If you are coming to be in the center of it all this is the place to stay. I highly recommend it, we would definitely stay there on our next trip.

review.title: very happy
review.reviewText: This was our first time going to San Francisco.We picked this hotel,by reading the reviews that where posted. This hotel was better than we expected. Everybody was very nice and helpful. Our room was very clean and well maintained. I would highly recommend this hotel for it's service and location. We were able to walk to every thing we wanted to do or just catch the cable car or bus. If you are looking for a great place to stay, you need to stay here.

review.title: Best Location for San Francisco Touring
review.reviewText: Great hotel and location. Only two negative comments - the water pressure in the shower was abyssmal, not sure if it was the room location or like that everywhere. Maids forgot to replace coffee service in our room one day. Other than that, we had a great time, close to the ferries and cable cars!

review.title: Very nice hotel stay.
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Very good overall hotel experience. Would definitely stay here again

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Great location, very helpful staff,Nice rooms (although the inside rooms don't have much of a view). Blue Mermaid restaurant was good,you have got to try the crab and corn chowder its great. The 5:00PM wine tasting was a nice touch and free to guests. Would highly recommend.

review.title: Loved the View
review.reviewText: I could sit at my desk and look out the window at Alcatraz across the bay. The hotel was excellent.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: I have never stayed in a more hospitable hotel where service and attention to detail were the top priorities.

review.title: excellent hotel for tourists staying by wharf
review.reviewText: i stayed at the argonaut for a leisure weekend and business trip. convenient location for tourists who want to stay at an unconventional hotel near the san francisco wharf.

review.title: San Fransisco Elite
review.reviewText: Wow, what a great hotel..My wife and I do alot of traveling, and were very impressed with the Argonaut Hotel. We read the feed backs from other travelers about this hotel, and gave it a shot...Two thumbs up and then some. The wine tasting from 5 to 6 p.m. daily what a very nice touch, and very good wine. The hotel room was a bit small, but clean as a whistle. The beds were very comfortable, and the staff is there to insure your comfort, believe me it's true. Location, location, location a must for any visitor.. Thanks again....

review.title: Nice modern hotel
review.reviewText: A nice hotel in the midst of the Wharf. Good service and assistance.

review.title: Great Location and Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel service and location were the definite strengths of this hotel. The hotel staff were attentive and courteous. The hotel is centrally located to all the "to do" things of San Francisco.

review.title: We loved this hotel
review.reviewText: I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. The service was wonderful and the rooms are huge (not to mention the beds are extremely comfortable).

review.title: San Fracisco hotel of choice
review.reviewText: My husband and myself loved this hotel. The Argonaut is a new, lively hotel that is super close and convenient to many attractions at Fisherman's Wharf. The worst part of travelling for me is usually the hotel stay. I hate hotels. I normally bring my own sheets and I refuse to sit down on anything in the room, from the furniture to the comforter. The Argonaut was a totally different experience for me. I would have walked around barefoot in the room, had it not been out of habit that I do otherwise. The Argonaut is also pet friendly and stored our bikes for us until we were ready for them. We are planning our next trip and the Argonaut Hotel is the only place that we will consider staying.

review.title: Well pleased
review.reviewText: Hotel was as advertised (4 star) -- enjoyed a comfortable night, clean room, linens and amenities -- the associated restaurant had a good breakfast, but there was noticeable dust in the air (some construction in the area accompanied by a strong breeze worsened that). The only shortcoming, probably true of most hotels in San Francisco, is the overnight parking tab.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: The hotel property is right on Fishermans Wharf great restuarants are everywhere. The hotel is very clean and confortable with a very attentive staff. The afternoon wine tasting was first rate. I will use the hotel again.

review.title: Excellent hotel and location
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely clean, quiet, comfortable, and the staff was helpful. The location is extremely close to the wharf and other tourist attractions. It's also in an excellent location to run along the marina and down to the Golden Gate Bridge if you like long runs. I was extremely pleased with this hotel and I will certainly recommend it to others. We stayed at this hotel for two nights in May 2006, one night in Napa, and then two nights at the Hotel Drisco. All three of the hotels were a pleasure to stay at, but the location of the Argonaut Hotel cannot be beat for site seeing. The hotel Drisco is in a beautiful neighbor in the Pacific Heights area, but it is a little out of the way from most of the attractions.

review.title: What a view!
review.reviewText: The staff is wonderful. The location is perfect, right on Fisherman's Wharf, across from the Maritime Museum, walking distance to Chinatown, Union Street, Ferry to Alcatraz and the Bay. Wine tasing every evening Starbucks coffee in the room. Wonderful!

review.title: Loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. The staff was very friendly. The location was excellent. The romms were clean and comfortable and the decor was fun and tasteful. I would definately stay here again.

review.title: Definately recommended
review.reviewText: Superbly located for the wharf and for public transport. Loved the room and the free wine tasting was an added bonus.

review.title: Convenience with location
review.reviewText: Overall, we enjoyed our 6 night stay at the Argonaut. The room was small but clean and services were excellent. The bathrooms could use an exhaust fan. Desk and doormen very knowledgable of the area. Quiet rooms. Valet parking convenience a bit pricey but great when arriving without any idea of nearby parking facilities. If you want cable car convenience, the Hyde/Powell line is a half block away.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This is the best hotel by far I have ever stayed in all my life. I was seeing other reviews, I thought they were exaggerated. I think there was some kind of concert at night as we heard some bass until maybe 10-11pm, the rest was ok. Great service, room was amazing and this was the cheapest one. I will definitely go back to stay there again. Right at the Wharf area, in the center of every attraction. There is a DVD player, Sony TV free internet in the room. The restaurant is great. Very reasonably priced also.

review.title: Nice room discounted rooms have no view but are very quiet
review.reviewText: very good i would stay there again

review.title: Best Spot In Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Awesome location!!! This hotel is at the center of everything in Fisherman's Wharf! We had a perfect view of the cable car turn around from our room! You can walk to everything. The rooms were spotless and the beds were beyond comfortable. The only negative thing was the concierge service. It was not that helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel and we would stay there again!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Close to pier 39

review.title: SF Fisherman Warf Hotel
review.reviewText: Great locacation. Right next to the Cannery and Really close to the Beach. Great view of Golden Gate

review.title: Fantastic find
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was a fantastic find in San Francsico. We have never been to the city before and didn't have a clue where to stay. We decided our best bet was to stay near the Wharf since we have two children. We picked the hotel based on the theme. We were not disappointed. The hotel was very clean, the staff very friendly and helpful, and the beds were exceptionally comfortable. The location of the hotel was key. It was in walking distance to all the Wharf's attractions and there were many good restaurants to choose from close by. The cable cars and F Train were only a few blocks away making it very convenient to get to other parts of the city. Overall our stay at the hotel was a wonderful experience. Our expectations were exceeded. We would choose to stay at this hotel again in the future.

review.title: Good times.
review.reviewText: Great location, cool themed rooms, and a great wine tasting in the lobby/lounge.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: The hotel's location can not be beat!

review.title: Parking - Ouch
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with a fine location. Rooms somewhat small (narrow) but nicely appointed. Valet parking is both expensive ($50+ per night) and not very efficient. Expect to wait half an hour or more for your vehicle.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Outstanding in all regards. Wonderful location. Free overnight parking on street, but meters start at 7AM. Garages nearby and has valet. My new hotel of choice in SF.

review.title: excellent SF hotel
review.reviewText: Located far enough away from Fisherman's wharf to be out of the noise and crowds, but near enough to be convenient to shops, restaurants, and fun. The cable car terminus is only a block from the hotel, and the F line also nearby, makes getting around super easy. Nice decor, good coffee in the room, very pleasant stay.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is great proximtyto a lot of attractions. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. There is no pool or jacuzzi, the work out room is small- but has the necessary equipment. The lobby is well decorated and comfortable. I found the front desk to be somewhat unfriendly and unattentive. The rest of the staff was great.

review.title: Argonaut Hotel - San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Argonaut was a pleasant and very comfortable hotel located in prime Fisherman's Wharf real estate. Our room was small, but contained first-rate ammenities, including Aveeda tolietries. The bellman and concierge were helpful and I got to a brief workout in their modern health facility. Because of the shortage of space, there was no pool in the hotel, but this was the rule, rather than the exception in SF. We also took advantage of the San Fran City Pass, which allowed us preferrential admitance to some of the city's most popular tourist attractions. With it, we were able to take unlimited cable car rides, visit the Exploratorium, take a Bay cruise and many other fun activities. We would recommend the Argonaut, especially for a family.

review.title: Best hotel in the wharf area by faarr....
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel,beautifully restored right in the midle of wharf's mayor atractions.Will go back time and time again.Tip:get a room with ocean view,even if its partial is worth it every penny.

review.title: fabulous hotel, wonderful staff
review.reviewText: gem of a hotel, convenient to it all! wonderfully helpful staff (recommendation for good eats in china town from lane in concierge was perfect!) made it an overall fabulous experience. defo recommend!

review.title: Very Convenient
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is a very convenient hotel. Good location, easy to get to other places in the city and excellent for a nice walk or jogging in the morning.

review.title: Cozy and convenient
review.reviewText: This is a cozy and classy way to enjoy Fisherman's Wharf and the nearby amenities. While the rooms are modest in size, and our double-queen had only a desk/chair and a foot stool for extra seating, which was a bit annoying for relaxing or watching TV, the rooms are comfortable, well-appointed, and have great beds and pillows. Be sure to ask for an outside room so your only view isn't the another guest room across the enclosed interior space. Service is excellent from the friendly and helpful bellmen to the savvy concierge. Many of the guests join the wine hour, so the lobby becomes a high energy adult space from 5-6. Cheap convenient transportation is only a few blocks away via the trolley system, but if you're in a hurry and are with a group, taxis are an excellent alternative, and the outstanding bellmen/doormen will make sure you get one right away. Parking is extremely expensive - about the same daily cost as a day of economy car rental, so leave the car at home.

review.title: Wonderful experience
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience! It's not your cookie-cutter hotel. The rooms are good sized and nicely furnished, great location, the staff was wonderful. You should go!

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Very good quality hotel. Excellent location for transportation and restaurants.

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText: We loved it! Our room had views of the Golden Gate, the cable cars & Ghiradelli Square. It is near the action on the wharf and away from the noise. The decor is pleasing, service excellent. This hotel is child and animal friendly which concerned us. We never heard a peep...It is just a wonderful place to stay when you are in San Francisco.

review.title: Big fun at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is ideally located at the end of Jefferson street, close enough to Fisherman's Wharf (and Ghiradelli Square) to enjoy its tacky tourist attractions, far enough away to escape from the same. The nautial theme of the hotel is kinda fun and the chowders at the hotel restaurant are excellent--not your usual New England clam chowder at all. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.

review.title: Most Comfortable Hotel Ever!
review.reviewText: We couldn't believe how comfortable we felt in this hotel. The beds had down comforters and pillow top mattress covers. The lobby and welcome area was extremely inviting and cozy. All of the staff we encountered there were extremely helpful and enjoyable to interract with.

review.title: This Hotel is as advertised
review.reviewText: We found it a pleasure to stay here and were pleasantly surprised to find everything as good as the marketing. A refreshing find. Bed and Pillows were great too!

review.title: Best location and very friendly staff!
review.reviewText: Best location you could ask for! We didn't get our car out of valet even once! (if you can avoid taking a car at all, you may want to consider it. To park your car there is $36.00 per night!) All of the staff there was VERY friendly, but we did call down for a steamer once, we would told it would be right up, and it never came. Also, the service at their resturant was HORRIBLE! Don't bother to go there. The food is o.k., but with all of the great places to eat nearby, the lousy service just doesn't make it worth while. Overall, because of the comfort of the room and the WONDERFUL location we would stay there again in a heartbeat!

review.title: 4 stars isn't what it used to be
review.reviewText: Overall pretty good, rooms a little small but tastefully and artfully decorated. Bathrooms could use some updating. Comfortable, attractive, with a great location.

review.title: We'll pick a Kimpton hotel on our next trip!
review.reviewText: Friendly service, professional staff, and a beautiful property are only a few of the compliments we would give the Argonaut. San Francisco is a fantastic town and the staff at the Argonaut made it even better with their helpful advice and recommendations. The rooms are a bit small, but we didn't wind up spending much time in our room anyway. And the evening wine tastings were an added treat.

review.title: Great Location, Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We live in the North Bay and go to San Francisco fairly often on day trips or overnight. We stayed at the hotel January 29th and, so far, this is my favorite hotel. Good location near Fisherman's Wharf and close to the cable car turnaround that will take you to North Beach, Chinatown, Lombard Street, and Union Square shopping. The hotel is only a few years old and very clean and comfortable. The beds are wonderful and the hotel room was very quiet(unlike other SF hotels where you hear street noise until very late at night). Because of the location, we took the Larkspur ferry to San Francisco and the trolley to within a block or so of the hotel. Very nice not to have to drive in to the city and deal with parking.

review.title: Simply Superb
review.reviewText: Great service, very clean and comfortable rooms/beds and free wine tasting when we were there every night....fantastic location as well

review.title: Best hotel bed ever!
review.reviewText: This was a phenomenal find. Location ideal for Fisherman's Wharf / North Beach area. Exceptional comfort and quality. Normal amenities, but also amazingly well-thought-out touches, like lighted light switches, a surge protector for your laptop, slippers free upon request, etc. The entertainment system was well designed and easy to navigate. Service was fine. Local restaurants are great too. Highly recommended.

review.title: Best in Frisco!
review.reviewText: Close to Fisherman's Wharf, Garadelli Square, the cable car turnaround and all the other attractions.

review.title: The best location
review.reviewText: The best location,nice staff,great food,near all the tours, we loved this place!

review.title: Location,Location, Location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel for a family is perfect. The cable cars are steps away, Fisherman's Wharf (where the action is)is close and of course Guirdelli Chocolate (the chocolate sundaes are to die for). The hotel was very well appointed and clean. The beds were very comfortable with down featherbeds and comforters. The wine tasting daily from 5-6 P.M. was a nice touch.

review.title: You've got to stay here!
review.reviewText: Our family travels a lot, both for business/leisure. This hotel is excellent! The location is right on the wharf, with easy access to attractions and cable cars. The staff is attentive and professional. The rooms are spotless and beautifully decorated. There is an adjoining restaurant. This hotel is also "pet friendly" with a few rooms on the 3rd floor exclusively for your 4 legged friends. There is a "happy hour" daily in the lobby.

review.title: What a View
review.reviewText: Our room view of the Golden Gate Bridge was wonderful, and we over looked the turn around for the Cable Car too. Excellent - Hotel and EZ access to the Warf and all it's amenities.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: everything was wonderful. i do not like down pillows but that was fixed with in a few hours. loved it. Complementary wine hour is awesome. love that it is dog friendly, next time i will be bringing my four legged friend! thanks so much.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: We truly enjoyed our stay. Great location. Service was great. Room was extremely comfortable. Met nice people at the wine reception. I would recommend highly.

review.title: Best location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is an old Del Monte Cannery building that has been renovated to please anyone. The nautical style is not over decorated. The beds and linens were very comfortable. It is located between Fisherman's Warf and Ghiradelli Square. All of the staff were very helpful and nice. Whenever we go back to San Francisco, we will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent service at a very reasonable price. I would stay again without giving it a thought.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Staff at this hotel was very friendly, courteous, and professional. Decoration of rooms and lobby was very distinctive and pleasant. Attached restaurant, Blue Mermaid, was good as well. Highly recommend New England clam chowder and Chicken Club Sandwich. One note. Some rooms have central AC/Heater while others have wall mounted units. I stayed in a room with wall mounted unit, and it was noisy and did not work as well as central unit.

review.title: Great location. Will go back
review.reviewText: Very friendly atmosphere. Complementary wine every afternoon. Good room service.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely attentive & pleasant. Location of hotel was great. Will stay again.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: We were your typical tourists. This hotel was right there, within walking distance of everything we were interested in, Alcatraz, Pier 39, Cable cars, etc. Would go back.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights and certainly weren't dissapointed. The rooms are well appointed, with large comfortable beds. The rooms are spacious and have all neccessary facilities and the bathroom/shower is of a high standard. The Staff are friendly and attentive and the 'wine tasting' between 5 and 6 each evening is a nice touch and very welcoming if you have been out sightseeing all day. Get in early as the lobby can get quite busy and hence all of the chairs will be occupied. The hotel is located at the quieter end of Fisherman's Wharf away from the souvenir shops and general hustle and bustle. The rooms are fairly quiet most of the time although some noise breakthrough is apparent from adjacent rooms at times (Loud TV/Telephone conversations). Public transport links from here are good, and Union Square is accessible by cable car within 15-20 mins.

review.title: perfect location for vacationers
review.reviewText: beautiful hotel on the same street as fishermans wharf, where you have access to all the tours you could ever be seeking.cable car stop is right on the corner of the building.everyone single employee who i experienced on our honeymoon,was extremely friendly and helpful.(coming from jersey, its a REAL TREAT!)there is a restaurant inside the building called blue mermaid which was great as well.no complaints here, just complements.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is at a central locaton to the Wharf. The staff is friendly and always helpful. The hotel restuarant is great for casual dining and if you enjoy chowder many different choices are available.

review.title: Best of Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: A pleasant and courteous staff greeted me upon entrance to this historical landmark hotel building. The rooms are spacious, clean and offer a strong nautical influenced decor. The adjacent Mermaid's lounge provides an excellent place for traditional Marine cuisine, or a great place for drinks and socializing with friends.

review.title: Fabulous San Francisco Location!
review.reviewText: We had a fabulous experience at the Argonaut Hotel! The staff were extremely attentive and helpful and the hotel was spotless. The building appears to be an old wharehouse which made the rooms and hallways very quiet as the walls were made of brick and looked to be about a foot wide. The location was one of its best features, as the hotel is located right by the water, thus Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, etc... were just steps away. This hotel was first rate across the board - I highly recommend it!

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, relaxing environment. Easy walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and surrounding attractions. Hotel staff more than willing to help. Will go back.

review.title: Gem in the heart of Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: We were extremely impressed with the Argonaut Hotel. The rooms where extremely confortable--the bed was awesome! The location was great with access to everything. The staff was also extremely helpful and polite. We would go back in a heart beat!

review.title: s.f hotel
review.reviewText: very nice hotel.great location.cable car was 1 block away.only gripe was no parking.( valet parking only at $ 36.00 a day )pier was minutes away close to everything

review.title: Excellent location...
review.reviewText: Grat location, nice size rooms, comfortable bedding...would definitely stay again.

review.title: Great Vacation
review.reviewText: The Argonaut Hotel was a wonderful place to stay on our first trip to San Francisco. It is conveniently located on Fisherman's Wharf and we were able to walk to China Town, Ghiardelli Square, Pier 39 and even SBC Ballpark for a baseball game. Our room was clean and beautifully decorated and the ammenities were impressive - down comforter, flat screen TV, DVD/CD/video game player. We have stayed at several 4 and 5 star hotels and this was definitely one of the best. The staff was extremely helpful and we enjoyed the wine tasting every every afternoon.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Within walking distance to everything and the trolly.

review.title: Very Spacious Room
review.reviewText: Spacious room but the easy chair was too "erect" for my taste. Hotel restruant was not as good as I would have expected, but there are others in the area to choose from. The extra money for a bay view was NOT worth it.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Had a great stay at the hotel. We will be back. Great location!!!!!! Central to everything. Rented bikes from the bike shop in front of the hotel. They were super nice and very helpful. Showed us the way to bike to the GGB with out hitting any streets with cars. The Blue Mermaid was okay for breakfast. Nothing special. Went to the Comedy Club next door. Eat before you go and get drinks at the bar to bring into the club, the service was bad. The clubs was decent for the price. $15.00 per person. Everyone at the hotel was super nice and had no problem with our request for a late check-out on Saturday. The hotel is a little noisey. But nothing to worry yourself with. We heard people in the AM coming out of their rooms, closing doors and talking. But nothing like some had suggested in other reviews. Head up Columbus Street to North Beach and visit the great resturants and coffee shops, the walk is great and not too far.

review.title: When in S.F. again, we will return
review.reviewText: From the moment we stepped from the cab to the time we left the service was awesome. From finding us some pizza, to a ride to the airport, shipping packages, free wine, having the bellman check us out while we were at lunch, this place rocks. I kept trying to find something wrong, but it didn't happen. The rooms are a very nicely decorated, fun rather than the boring bed, desk and tacky picture. This room encluded a chaise, a flatscreen tv, a dvd player and several other immenities include terry cloth robe. Special thanks the the entire bell staff whom all had some input on us enjoying our trip. See ya next time.

review.title: What an incredible hotel!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was way better than even the reviews on this web site said it was. We were on our honeymoon and could not have asked for a better experience. Great location. We walked everywhere. It was real nice having the Hyde Cable car stop right next door. Great view of the bridge from outside. Every morning we would walk up to Giradelli and get a hot chocolate! The only complaint would be that next time I would try to get an outside view room. We had a view of the air condition system on the inner courtyard type opening in the middle of the building

review.title: I'd go back in a heartbeat!
review.reviewText: This hotel was everything I could have hoped for. The staff was personable and helpful. Location was great;within walking distance to everything on the wharf and because it was on the end of Fisherman's Wharf, it was quiet for sleeping at night. The room was pleasantly appointed and the bed was very comfortable. I would definately stay there again.

review.title: Great location - Great Service
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel - tons of style. Super friendly people! Highly recommend.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Concierges were great help. Wine receptions were cozy. Location of hotel was great. Close to everything.

review.title: would return there in a flash
review.reviewText: If fishermans wharf is the area in which you wish to stay this hotel is an ideal base. Great restaurants closeby, shopping and the ferries to all interesting sights

review.title: Four Stars? Almost
review.reviewText: Overall the service was excellent and the concierges outstanding. I did not find this hotel to possess anything above what you would find in a 3 star hotel. In fact, while the evening wine tasting might be nice for those who partake, the customer could benefit by the addition of amenities found in lesser-rated accommodations such as a continental breakfast.

review.title: Terrific place to stay
review.reviewText: Had a great time here. Staff were amazing, from the guy on the curb, to the desk staff and the concierge, everyone was helpful to a fault. Hotel itself is very nice. Rooms aren't huge, and the nautical theme is a little overdone, but I'd happily stay again. And a glass of wine offered free in the afternoon was a nice treat. The location can't be beat.

review.title: Awesome Hotel, Great Location!
review.reviewText: This is our second stay at the Argonaut. The hotel has a great atmosphere! We love the location as it is close to everything! The cable cars are right next door and the Muni public transportation is just two blocks away. The hotel staff is always friendly and helpful. Probably the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in at a hotel! I would definitely recommend this hotel whether this is your first trip to The City, or are a frequent traveler here.

review.title: Will definately go back
review.reviewText: This rates right up there with the finer hotels. Very convenient to everything. Very helpful and quiet.

review.title: It was like being on a cruise ship. The bed was a welcome comfort after a beautiful day in San Fran
review.reviewText: We were welcomed by a bellman that was very polite and helped us with our parking concerns. The lobby was fun and cheerful. The young man that took our bags to our room made our day with a sight seeing to do list that was exactly what we wanted. The room was clean, warm and comfortable. We especially liked the bathrobes.

review.title: Best location on the Wharf!
review.reviewText: Easy walking distance to all Wharf attractions and the cable cars. Beautiful full service hotel with very attentive staff and well appointed rooms.

review.title: different
review.reviewText: characterful hotel, excellent staff,blue mermaid restaurant only average

review.title: Our second time
review.reviewText: Great location, fabulous staff. SOme of the concierge's are still getting experienced. Wonderful rooms,large,comfortable withflat screeen tv and DVD player.

review.title: Very good hotel!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It was easy to reach sightseeing spots from the hotel. We would like to visit here again!

review.title: Nice hotel - expensive parking
review.reviewText: The Argonaut is nicely appointed, and the service was great. The location is great as well. My only complaint was the expense of parking my car - $36 a day plus $5.04 tax seemed high to me.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay on Fisherman's Wharf in great part due to this wonderful hotel! It is truly in the perfect spot at the end of the Wharf and right around the corner from the cable car boarding. The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. I requested a non-smoking room & though I got one it was on a smoking floor (3rd floor). I requested a room on a non smoking floor on the 2nd day (as I could smell smoke coming under the door in the morning) and they switched rooms without hesitation.

review.title: Great Location & Comfy Beds
review.reviewText: The next time we visit San Francisco we will be staying at the Argonaut Hotel again. The hotel was in a perfect location, right on Fisherman's Wharf, you could walk to almost everything. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: We thought the hotel was very nice and would go there again.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel. I would recommend it to anyone/

review.title: My sisters and I love the hotel.
review.reviewText: It was right by the bay and it was located on a corner where it was quiet. Just cross the street and there was the trolley and Ghiredelli Square. Next door was the Cannery and everything else was walking distance. The location was very convenient.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great decor, excellent service, great location. Definitely recommend!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Rooms were very nice, exceptional service overall

review.title: A Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful hotel.  It certainly is four star.

review.title: Would definitely return
review.reviewText: We had a great experience at the Argonaut.  From asking for directions to making suggestions for places to eat, the staff never steered us wrong.  The room was impeccable too.

review.title: I was really empressed with the quality of the hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel as a whole was fantastic. Me and my fiancee were treated great. The view was great and we especally liked the bath tub, it was like a smaller spa. We were really satisfied with this hotel and would recoment it to anyone.

review.title: Wonderful except Concierge Service
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful, very clean and convenient to many sights.  The staff in general was excellent; the one exception is the concierge personnel.  They were arrogant and not at all helpful.  If you stay here be prepared to figure it out on your own.

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: Checking in was fast and staff was willing to help with great restaurant recommendations. Complementary wine was an added plus as we were able to socialize with others and share sotories of our adentures to this great city!  Great location>

review.title: Good Location, Great Staff
review.reviewText: Good location on Fisherman's Wharf.  Staff is friendly, responsive.  Room was clean, but items in honor bar were sticky as if a soda had been spilled on them.  Room was also noisy; conversation and coughing from next door could be heard clearly.

review.title: Will stay there over and over again
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel the first weekend it opened.  We loved it then and loved it again this time.  We will definately stay there again.  The staff is wonderful and the beds are the best I have ever slept in.  The wine reception in the evening is not bad either.

review.title: Extremely Pleased
review.reviewText: Close to everything on the Wharf! Clean, friendly. This hotel is only a year or so old, so it is very clean & well kept. Will stay there again if we go back.

review.title: Noisy nights
review.reviewText: Problem with room 243. Slamming of utility room door kept us awake, constant use of room understandable but slamming of doors inexcusable. Staff, especially doormen, valet and restaurant superb! Check in/out very smooth. Only problem was being awakened at different hours in the night
